title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: What You Will Achieve   This position will apply advanced manufacturing, science, and technology to support business and process improvements for the manufacture of small and / or large volume parenteral products. You will be a member of the Transformation and Strategy team. As a Data Analyst you will be responsible for mining, retrieving, organizing, and analyzing data to support the operations of a large manufacturing facility. Using the data, you will help to develop key performance indicators to demonstrate the effectiveness of processes and systems against business strategies.   Your knowledge of manufacturing operations and computer systems/tools will make you a critical member of the team. Your strong business processes and workflow skills will help facilitate required gatherings for building and enhancing business process maps and strategies. Your innovative use of communication tools and techniques will facilitate in explaining difficult issues, establishing consensus between teams, and will create a collaborative teaming environment for your colleagues.    Main Responsibilities      Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports  Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality  Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems  Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets   Filter and “clean” data by reviewing reports, printouts, and performance indicators  Work with management to prioritize business and information needs   Identify and define new process improvement opportunities      Must-Haves      A Bachelor’s degree with at least three years of experience; OR a Master’s degree with more than one year of experience.  Prior pharmaceutical and/or manufacturing experience required  Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques   Knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc) and databases (SQL etc)  Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)  Knowledge of SAP (ERP materials planning systems).     You will be joining an organisation with determined to bring about considerable change to the global industry, in an environment that promotes self-development and personal success while driving for company growth.    Job Title:  Data Analyst    Location:  Basel, Switzerland    Job Type:  Contract   Aerotek, an Allegis Group company. Allegis Group AG, Aeschengraben 20, CH-4051 Basel, Switzerland. Registration No. CHE-101.865.121. Aerotek and Actalent Services are companies within the Allegis Group network of companies (collectively referred to as "Allegis Group"). Aerotek, Actalent Services, Aston Carter, EASi, TEKsystems, Stamford Consultants and The Stamford Group are Allegis Group brands. If you apply, your personal data will be processed as described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice available at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.   To access our Online Privacy Notice, which explains what information we may collect, use, share, and store about you, and describes your rights and choices about this, please go to https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.   We are part of a global network of companies and as a result, the personal data you provide will be shared within Allegis Group and transferred and processed outside the UK, Switzerland and European Economic Area subject to the protections described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice. We store personal data in the UK, EEA, Switzerland and the USA. If you would like to exercise your privacy rights, please visit the "Contacting Us" section of our Online Privacy Notice at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices for details on how to contact us. To protect your privacy and security, we may take steps to verify your identity, such as a password and user ID if there is an account associated with your request, or identifying information such as your address or date of birth, before proceeding with your request. title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: Kelly Group are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Business Intelligence Coordinator. As a Business Intelligence Coordinator, you will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and interpreting data to support strategic decision-making and drive business growth. Your role will involve collaborating with various departments and stakeholders to identify key performance indicators (KPIs), develop data-driven insights, and implement effective reporting systems. The ideal candidate will possess a strong understanding of data analysis, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.                 Gather and consolidate data from multiple sources to build comprehensive datasets for analysis.    Apply statistical methods and data mining techniques to identify patterns, trends, and insights.    Conduct in-depth analysis to understand business performance, customer behaviour, and market trends.    Develop and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to facilitate data-driven decision-making.    Create visually appealing and user-friendly reports and dashboards to present insights and KPIs.    Generate regular reports and performance metrics to track business performance and highlight areas of improvement.    Provide training and support to end-users in utilizing reporting tools and interpreting data effectively.    Work closely with cross-functional teams to identify key business questions and data needs.    Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis to support strategic decision-making.    Monitor industry trends and competitor activities to identify potential areas for growth or improvement.        You will have the following qualifications and be able to prove experience and competence:              For this role you will need administrative experience. It will require excellent attention to detail and an ability to prioritise a number of different tasks.    Microsoft Office essential (especially Excel)    Organisation-Well organised, plans ahead and highlights problems in advance should be methodical and meticulous to keep records An ability to work under pressure    Interpersonal-Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to deal with conflict    Teamwork-Able to collaborate with others and contribute as part of a high performance team in order to achieve a common goal, as opposed to working independently or competitively    Communication-Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal    Initiative-Able to see the ‘bigger picture’ and to realise the implications of one’s actions possessing a proactive approach and attitude to one’s duties; sees tasks through to completion        What’s on offer for successful candidates?              Competitive PAYE Salary    20 days’ holiday plus statutory bank holidays    Company Pension scheme    Cycle to work scheme    Excellent career progression opportunities    Full training will be given to the right candidate.    Employee discount scheme           Established in 1985 to support the emerging UK cable television market, Kelly Group has diversified to meet the needs of our clients. With over 35 years’ experience and customer service at the heart of our business, Kelly Group is renowned for building networks in collaboration with several major leading telecommunication service providers, delivering innovative multi-functional solutions - connecting people globally.     Working across several industries including telecommunications, rail, metro, highways and fleet, Kelly Group operate nationally with 40+ operational centres and deliver a full suite of services. From the initial planning, design, notification through to installation, final commissioning and maintenance of networks, Kelly Group deliver a ‘one-stop solution’ to meet the needs of our clients and delight their customers.     As a service provider, our workforce is our extended family, which is why we invest in their safety, training, careers, welfare, vehicles and tools they need to deliver excellence. With a workforce of circa 3500, 40+ national operational centres, 4 training hubs and a fleet of over 2500 vehicles, Kelly Group are committed to developing an excellent team, a fair culture and a safe working environment.     The Kelly Group is committed to equality of opportunity for all staff and applications from individuals are encouraged regardless of age, disability, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, marriage and civil partnerships.     If you feel you have the required experience and want to further your career with a long standing communications contractor, please apply.

job_description: Qui sont-ils ?    Cabinet de conseil en Transformation Digitale, eXalt est avant tout une formidable aventure humaine, et une communauté de plus de 700 collaborateurs, basés à Paris (siège social), mais également à Lyon, Lille, Nantes, Bordeaux, Aix-en-Provence, Bogota et bientôt New-York   Fondée en juillet 2018 autour des valeurs d’intrapreneuriat, de co-apprentissage et de co-construction, eXalt inscrit son développement dans un engagement fort auprès de ses clients et de ses équipes. Multi-spécialiste, le groupe décline son modèle dans différents domaines à travers ses filiales dédiées :      Le Product Management & la Gestion de Projet au sein d’eXalt P&P   La Finance de Marché au sein d’eXalt Fi,   La Tech au sein d’eXalt IT,   La Cybersécurité au sein d’eXalt Shield  La Data au sein d’eXalt Value      Découvrez eXalt   Culture d'entreprise   Équipes   Offres d'emplois   28   J’y vais !   Rencontrez Mathéa, Co-fondatrice d'eXalt Bordeaux   Rencontrez Abdeljawad, Consultant en Finance de Marché eXalt Fi   Rencontrez Jenith, Consultant Data Engineer eXalt IT    Descriptif du poste    eXalt Value, filiale du groupe spécialisée sur les métiers de la Data, et recherche son/ sa nouveau/elle  Data Analyst  pour aller à la conquête de nouveaux projets ! Vous évoluerez dans un contexte multi sociétés et challengeant.   Vous serez rattaché(e) à notre bureau parisien.   Vos principales missions seront de :      Comprendre les problématiques métiers et les traduire de manières analytiques   Extraire les données nécessaires à l’analyse.   Définir et réaliser le nettoyage de la base de données.   S’assurer la qualité des données tout au long de leur traitement   Analyser et exploiter les données   Créer des dashboards via des outils de visualisations   Effectuer une veille sur les nouvelles technologies et solutions logicielles d’analyse des données.       Profil recherché      Nous recherchons avant tout une personne animée par l’esprit et l’ADN d’eXalt ☀️ ayant l’envie de prendre part à un superbe challenge et à notre aventure !       Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’un Bac+5   Vous bénéficiez d’une expérience d’au moins 4 ans en tant que Data Analyst   Vous avez une expertise en base de données et gestion de base de données (SQL/ NoSQL)   Vous maitrisez des outils de data visualisation (Tableau, Qlikview, PowerBI) et/ou des outils de fouille et analyse de données (Dataiku)   Vous avez une aisance rédactionnelle & relationnelle   Vous avez une passion pour les chiffres et le goût pour l’innovation   Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre rigueur, votre organisation et votre adaptabilité.   L’anglais professionnel est requis

title: Commercial Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Панель управления, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: De functie    Welkom bij Royal Schiphol Group. Wij zijn een luchtvaartonderneming met een belangrijke maatschappelijke opdracht: met onze luchthavens en samenwerkingsverbanden creëren wij waarde voor de samenleving en de economie. Wij werken vanuit onze kernwaarden efficiënt, betrouwbaar, duurzaam, gastvrij en inspirerend. Jaarlijks maken miljoenen mensen gebruik van Schiphol. Dé plek waar ontmoetingen centraal staan en verbindingen mogelijk gemaakt worden. Schiphol als luchthaven, als mobiliteitshub of als plek om te werken en elkaar te ontmoeten.      Voor Schiphol Commercial zijn we op zoek naar een Commercial Data Analyst onderdeel van het Customer Insights team.      Over de rol    Als Commercial Data Analyst bij Schiphol Commercial speel jij een cruciale rol in het stimuleren van de passagierservaring en het verhogen van de omzet van de commerciële proposities van Schiphol. Van retail, food & beverage tot parkeren, Privium en VIP-services – waarbij jouw primaire aandachtsgebied Retail en Food & Beverage zal zijn. Jij analyseert de data en gebruikt je expertise om adviezen te geven die het verschil maken.     Jouw Belangrijkste Taken        Analyseren en adviseren: jij ondersteunt de commerciële ontwikkeling van Schiphol Commercial. Op basis van analyses en business kennis vertaal je data naar insights en advies op strategisch en tactisch niveau. Je maakt hierbij gebruik van een breed scala aan bronnen als commerciële data, onderzoeksdata, passagiers-, consumenten- en marktontwikkelingen.   Bevorderen van een data-driven manier van werken: jij stuurt de verdere ontwikkeling en het functionele beheer van het Retail Informatie Systeem en onze Retail en Food & Beverage dashboards aan, waarbij je de sparringpartner bent tussen de business, IT en de developers. Deze dashboards zijn essentieel voor de succesvolle commerciële aansturing van de business.   Innoveren: jij zorgt voor nieuwe, innovatieve manieren van analyse en voegt steeds nieuwe databronnen toe aan het palet.   Inspireren: op een inspirerende manier communiceer en presenteer je je analyses en adviezen als input voor productontwikkelingen, business cases en marketingplannen.      De afdeling    Schiphol Commercial opereert in het hart van de commerciële activiteiten van Schiphol. Gezamenlijk zorgen we voor waardecreatie voor de klant (passagiers en bedrijven) én voor Schiphol door het ontwikkelen van een unieke en dynamische ontmoetingsplek voor werk en reizen. Dit doen we vanuit de 3 Productmarktcombinatie teams Parking & Mobility, Commercial Terminal Services (Retail, Horeca, Services, Terminal verhuringen, Privium, VIP en Media) en Commercial Real Estate, waarbij we intensief samenwerken vanuit de verschillende disciplines Marketing & Customer Experience, Development, Commercial Platform, Finance en HR.   De verschillende teams dragen hiermee bij aan de realisatie van de business doelstellingen van Commercial, waarbij top performance indicatoren zoals ROE (Optimize sales process and revenue), NPS (customer experience), RS (reputation score) en EPS (improve collaboration and efficiency) bepalend zijn. Daarnaast dragen we ook bij aan het meer Sustainable worden van onze airport en de processen eromheen.   Het customer insights team maakt onderdeel uit van de afdeling Marketing & Customer Experience binnen Schiphol Commercial en richt zich op insights en data vraagstukken voor de gehele organisatie   Jij bent   Met jouw commerciële drive en oog voor het klantbelang verhoog jij de commerciële resultaten en passenger experience. Je wilt details goed voor elkaar hebben, bent doortastend en krijgt energie van het challengen en verbeteren van bestaande processen. Je realiseert je dat je alleen succesvol kunt zijn als je draagvlak creëert en een betrouwbare teamplayer bent.     Daarnaast Beschik Je Over       Afgeronde WO opleiding en minimaal 5 jaar relevante werkervaring als data-analist en -adviseur, binnen een retail-omgeving is een pre  Analytisch vermogen en ervaring met de ontwikkeling en het gebruik van Business Intelligence dashboards zoals Power BI  Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal   Kennis van statistiek en programmeertalen om goed te kunnen schakelen met BI specialisten en data scientists  Uitstekende sociale vaardigheden: in een dynamisch speelveld met een diverse groep professionals doorzie je de situatie en gebruik je je overtuigingskracht in combinatie met je know-how  Je werkt graag in een team al ben je in staat veel zelfstandig te realiseren.     Klinkt dit als jouw ideale baan? Solliciteer dan nu en wie weet ben jij binnenkort onze nieuwe Commercial Data Analyst.   Wij bieden      Een goed salaris van van € 4594,- tot € 6374,- o.b.v. 36 uur (schaal 12) afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring   6,75% vaste eindejaarsuitkering   Een variabele participatie uitkering van maximaal 7,5%   2% Duurzaam Inzetbaarheid Budget (DIB), in te zetten voor je sportschool, skipas, vrije dagen en nog veel meer   Veel doorgroeimogelijkheden   We faciliteren opleidingen in kennis en competenties   Wij stimuleren een inclusieve cultuur daarom heb je recht op twee diversiteitsdagen, te gebruiken op een willekeurige (feest)dag   Smartphone, keuze uit iPhone 13, Samsung Galaxy S21 of een vergoeding van EUR 30,- netto per maand   Flexibele werktijden voor een optimale balans tussen werk en privé met een thuiswerkvergoeding     Herken je jezelf in bovenstaande omschrijving? Dan zien we je sollicitatie graag tegemoet!                          Desired Skills and Experience             retail, roe, realisatie, opleiding, analyseren, details, statistiek, processen, schakelen, ontwikkeling, informatie systeem, is een, analytisch vermogen, business intelligence, programmeertalen, beheer, tactisch, dib, duurzaam, customer experience, omgeving, organisatie, commerciële activiteiten, marktontwikkelingen, omzet, nederlandse taal, dynamisch, resultaten, commerciële drive, doortastend, strategisch, combinatie, nps, marketing, customer insights, sociale vaardigheden, analyse, inspireren, werkervaring, inzetbaarheid, innoveren, hart, palet, energie, driven, commerciële ontwikkeling, parkeren, SQL Financial Analyst, Financial Data Analyst, Financial Analyst, Data Research Analyst, Business Intelligence & Reporting Analyst, Senior Financial Analyst, Business Intelligence & Senior Analyst, Business Intelligence Data Analytics Manager, Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Financial Business Analyst

title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Job Title:  Data Analyst  Location:  Bristol, UK - Working from home options available  Compensation:  £39,408 - £44,044 + Benefits Role Type:  Full time / Permanent Role ID:  SF 49620    Creating Change Together    At Babcock we're working to create a safe and secure world, together, and if you join us, you can play your part as a Junior Data Analyst at our Bristol site.As an international defence company, we support and enhance our customers' defence and security capabilities and critical assets, meeting their requirements of value for money, increased availability, modernisation and flexibility.    Babcock International and Devonport     The Junior Data Analyst role is based within our Devonport Royal Dockyard business area.   Comprising of 14 dry docks, four miles of waterfront and 25 tidal berths, Devonport is the base for numerous surface vessels as well as the base and refit centre for the Trafalgar-class nuclear-powered submarines. Devonport has also recently been selected as the base port for the Navy's new Type 26 frigates and will become the maintenance centre for the future submarine programme.   For more than a century, Babcock, the Aerospace and Defence Company, has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly-skilled engineering services. We help customers in the UK and around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the four market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training.    The role     The difference our new Junior Data Analyst will make: As a Junior Data Analyst, you'll have a role that's out of the ordinary. An opportunity for you to work in a newly established team delivering modelling and analytic services in support of Babcock's long-term submarine maintenance and disposal programme.   Day to day, you'll be operating in a small team responsible for delivering modelling and analysis outputs in support of the strategic long-term planning of Babcock's Devonport, Clyde, and Bristol operations.   At Babcock, we have a history of helping talent go far. With our track record of innovation, you'll continually develop your knowledge and expertise.   We offer flexible working to give people more options to better integrate their work and personal life, whilst ensuring that business needs are met. This role requires regular travel to Bristol, on a weekly basis alongside home working arrangements.     Essential Experience        Relevant degree or strong relevant academic or vocational background.* Strong numeracy, logic and problem-solving skills.* Excellent team working and willing to proactively engage the wider business to support outputs.* Ideally, basic programming skills; Python is highly desirable. * Microsoft Power BI experience is desirable but, not essential.       What We Offer     Generous benefits including:* Generous holiday allowance of 25 days plus bank holidays * Reservist in the armed forces receive 10 days special paid leave * Matched contribution pension scheme up to 8% of salary, with life assurance* Employee share scheme - save tax and national insurance on shares, with 1 free share per 10 purchased* Employee shopping savings portal* Employment development allowance - £125 per year* Payment of Professional Fees* Reward and Recognition Scheme linked to Health and Safety* Working from home and flexible work patterns * Employee assistance programme supporting physical, mental and financial wellbeing * Flexible benefits, including cycle to work scheme, discounts and our Share Ownership Scheme* Autonomy. Trusted and empowered to be at your best    Babcock International     For over 130 years, we have helped to defend nations, protect communities and build a better world. To continue, we must adapt, advance and be a sustainable business with a shared goal. Change begins with our people and our shared Principles: be curious; be courageous; own and deliver; think: outcomes; collaborate; and be kind. These values not only guide the way we work, but also our efforts to reach net-zero carbon. Yes, our ambitions are big, but together, we can achieve them.    Armed Forces Covenant    We are proud to support the Armed Forces community by honouring the Armed Forces Covenant. If you are a reservist in the armed forces, we provide up to ten days special paid leave in support of your training commitments. Application Guidance    All applications should be made online. If you have a disability or need any reasonable adjustments during the application and selection stages, please let us know. We're committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone's free to thrive. We are happy to talk about flexible working - please ask about alternative patterns of work at interview.

job_description: We are seeking a highly motivated  Data Analyst  to join the  Programme Controls Team.      The Data Analyst will be reporting to the Reporting Manager.     The successful candidate will be responsible to collect data from multiple data sources /systems using automated tools where possible, cleanse and prepare data, analyze and visually represent data in reports and dashboards using business intelligence (BI) reporting tools.         In detail, the Data Analyst   amongst others, will have the following responsibilities:        Collect data from multiple data sources & systems (i.e. Primavera P6, Aconex, excel files, etc.), using automated methods where possible (i.e. API), cleanse and prepare data & build the data model so this data can feed into digital reports and dashboards. Develop and maintain the data model/systems to help perform the data analysis and reporting actions, and identify new process improvements  Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using business intelligence reporting tools (i.e. PowerBI) to report status and progress of Ellinikon projects and programme. Work with the Reporting Manager to understand business requirements for performance reporting to support informed decision making, and define the key metrics, key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and visualizations to be used  Analyse data and produce ad-hoc reports as required to meet business needs. Identify, analyze, and interpret patterns and trends in data sets  Document the data analysis and reporting processes followed at the monthly reporting cycle in a clear and concise way so anyone that follows the process can produce the same outputs. Continuously review processes to ensure they meet their purpose and identify opportunities for improvements          You will be a successful candidate for our job opening, if you can identify yourself with the following criteria:          Academic Qualifications & Professional Experience:       Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar  Previous work experience of minimum 3-5 years as a data analyst or business data analyst; experience in the construction or real estate sectors is an advantage  Strong knowledge of, and experience with, BI reporting tool (i.e. PowerBI), data models, databases and programming languages (i.e. Python, R) is required  Knowledge of, and experience with statistics and statistical packages (i.e. Excel, SAS, etc.) to be used for data set analyzing  Excellent command of the English language          On a personal side, the ideal candidate:       Has strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze large amounts of data, with great attention to detail and accuracy  Has good communication and presentation skills  Is a team player, proactive and willing to contribute, taking accountability for their tasks          Our Company offers:      Our vision is to bring to life the largest urban regeneration project in Europe. So, we need to attract the most talented people in our industry and offer all the necessary means and procedures to support them, not only to fill their job description but also to rise above and beyond expectations.         Thus, we do provide:          A passionate working environment  A competitive compensation package according to professional experience, combined with additional benefits  An exceptional opportunity to work in and develop one of the most challenging Companies in Greece!      We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate in any employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, marital status, medical condition or disability, or any other legally protected status. Our premises have been especially designed to be accessible to people with disabilities.         Information about your personal data         Our Company is Data Controller, pursuant to the legislation currently in force, in the context of the processing of your personal data to assess your candidacy for the job vacancy, for which you submit your CV. We collect and process your personal data that is included in your CV and data that is collected during the interviews, such as your full name, your contact details, your working experience and your education. We process the said data, according to the legal basis of legitimate Interest and more specifically for the assessment and selection of the most suitable candidate for the job vacancy. We may transfer your data to recruitment consulting companies and other legal entities of our Group, in the context of the assessment of the candidates and the fulfilment of the special needs of LAMDA Group. Your personal data is retained for 6 months of the receipt of your CV, in order to assess your candidacy for the current or future job vacancy. For more information about our practices and your rights, please visit our Corporate Website, Careers Section, Privacy Statement.

title: Product Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Статистическое моделирование, Моделирование данных, +8 more
job_description: At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. We offer hundreds of thousands of audiobooks and ebooks to customers in more than 27+ markets, with several new markets launching in the coming year. Storytel is Northern Europe's largest audiobook streaming service and we’re now looking for a Product Data Analyst to join the team! Storytel’s vision is to make the world a more empathic and creative place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed anytime, anywhere by anyone.   About The Team   As a Product Data Analyst, you will belong to the Analytics team who is responsible for delivering insights to the entire Storytel organization. We combine technical and statistical skills with business acumen and tailored communication to drive change at Storytel, using data. Our stakeholders work in domains ranging from product development and content management to business strategy and marketing.  Our technology stack is built on top of Google Cloud Platform and includes but is not limited to BigQuery (SQL), Looker and Jupyter Notebooks/Python.   About The Role   As a Product Data Analyst at Storytel you will have the opportunity to provide the organization with actionable insights to facilitate decision-making and enable commercial opportunities. End-to-end responsibility ranges from problem articulation, preparing & structuring of underlying data assets, analysis & data visualization as well as communication of final recommendations to business stakeholders. You master the intersection of traits such as statistical understanding, programming, presentation and people skills. You will also have the opportunity to be an internal data ambassador and upskill business stakeholders in order to grow data literacy at Storytel.   Some Other Things You Will Do Is    Use data to enable Product Team decisions  Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for a given product team  Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas  Give concrete product recommendations in the relevant Product Team, based on insights from analyses and experiments  Manage working with different Product Teams, enabling their analyses while prioritising your work and effectively managing your time and their expectations   Ensure that the product team understands and have access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.  Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments     About You   To be successful in this role we believe that you have:   Experience working in SQL and Python (including pandas and data visualization packages)  Sound knowledge of conducting experiments (A/B testing) and implementing appropriate analyses (this includes an understanding of relevant statistics concepts)  Exposure to working with digital consumer-facing products, especially a streaming service is a plus  Experience with Looker is a plus  Analytical thinking and curiosity - we want you to feel comfortable exploring data and finding potential opportunities for improvement  Independent and self-driven - to be able to support multiple product teams we need you to be motivated and comfortable working independently     And for some bonus points if you have    Experience in the GCP tool stack (Looker, BigQuery, etc.)  Experience with data modelling and engineering procedures  Experience with statistical modelling  Experience in applying Machine Learning techniques to solve business problems  Experience with the modern data stack and ecosystem     What We Offer   At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy. We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities when possible and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in.  Storytel’s culture encourages self-leadership, innovation, collaboration – and our employees share a common passion for high-quality content and stories. There is a strong emphasis on continuous development, learning through experimentation and actively sharing feedback to constantly improve performance.  Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. We like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterized by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it. And of course - you get unlimited listening to audio and ebooks from our service!  Does this sound like you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, please submit your application in English and we will contact you as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Python, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Never  just  instantly trust your gut feeling? Great: then you are exactly who we are after. To support our mission in  making the biggest step in the lives of millions of people  easier, we’re looking for a Data Analyst that can help us improve the quality of our products. And those improvements are based on data – because at funda, data drives our decisions.     We need you, because you’re that typical, die-hard data enthusiast. You have a strong track record when it comes to building dashboards and you always think one step ahead. And of course you love to translate complex data from different departments into clear solutions. This is what allows funda to make better decisions.     The current multi-disciplinary data team consists of one Analytics Engineer (Esther), a Data Scientist (Edwin), three Data Analysts (Ruben, Eveline and Marie) and one Data Lead (Linda). You will also work in close alignment with the service owner of the team (Stephen) and Eduardo, the CTO.     Funda is a small organization with a lot of interesting data. According to your new colleague Ruben, ‘because we’re one of the largest Dutch websites in terms of visitors, you’ll work with huge data volumes and great tooling.’       On our Engineering blog: How we went from 85 to 5 core data dashboards;  https://blog.funda.nl/game-changer-how-we-went-from-85-to-5-core-data-dashboards/      Your job in a nutshell    Building dashboards and reports for other teams to use  Validating data insights derived by funda teams  Maintaining documentation on the delivered datasets  Centralizing, maintaining and documenting all relevant core metrics  Ensuring that all core metrics are tracked accurately  Guaranteeing the data quality of delivered datasets       Why being a Data Analyst at funda is awesome    You work with a huge dataset, of the housing market in the Netherlands  There are more than 1 billion interactions per month  funda is a knowledge-based organisation that never stops learning       This is you    Solid understanding of the basics (SQL, BigQuery, Google Data Studio)  Experience with DBT, Segment and Python are nice bonuses  Know how to convincingly convey the value of data to others  Understand the importance of performance as a feature  Strong track record in managing stakeholders  At your best when working in a collaborative environment in which you put goals ahead of procedures       On our Engineering blog: Machine learning: the model behind funda’s Waardecheck;   https://blog.funda.nl/the-model-behind-the-waardecheck-2/      Love being spoiled? Well, we love spoiling you!    Annual bonus of up to 1.5 times your monthly salary  Hybrid working with one fixed office day  25 paid days off a year and the possibility to buy more  Working hours (32/36/40 per week) are negotiable  60% pension coverage  A learning budget of up to €2000 per year, plus unlimited access to digital courses at our own fundacademy  A net monthly reimbursement of up to €85 for your phone and internet costs  A net work-from-home allowance of € 2,15 per day  Full coverage of your travel costs for office days (if you live over 5 km away)  Unlimited access to mental support via OpenUp, including phone consultations with psychologists so you can blow off steam, get practical tips or just have someone to listen to you  Work from abroad (EU/EEA) up to 14 days a year, and the opportunity to take a 3-month (unpaid) sabbatical every 3 years  Membership at selected gyms and regular massages at the office  Lunch at the office, freshly prepared by our in-house chefs  Regular parties, outings and a gift for your birthday – or just because, because why not?       Interested? Let's go!    Apply with your CV and motivation letter via the button below  Meet one of our recruiters in a short video call  If we are keen on you, you can expect a maximum of two interview rounds  Before the first interview we will ask you to do an assignment

Building your skill stack    You will begin on your bespoke learning journey with a data bootcamp, where you will join other graduates and work together to build your foundations in the data space. With accredited qualifications and training provided by our talented Grayce data coaches, you will have every opportunity to improve and develop your skills. title: Digital Data Analyst

job_description: Samsonite Europe aims to provide a great online experience! Join the digital team and become part of an industry-leading luggage brand.         This is a position within our E-Commerce & Digital Marketing department. If you love creating data-driven decisions to drive an excellent customer experience for several Samsonite brands (Samsonite, American Tourister, Lipault, Gregory), we want you on our team! The role requires someone who is self-motivated with a cutting-edge attitude and loves data.         As a digital data analyst you will help our organization to make data-driven decisions the norm. You will create a culture that encourages critical thinking and curiosity and ensures that our decisions, from the tactical to the strategic, are always supported by data. You will relieve all the pains in the user journeys, maximize conversion and engagement rates across all our digital channels.         Reporting to the Digital Marketing Manager, you will be part of a young and dynamic Digital team and have the possibility to interact with many other departments as country teams or the Brand marketing teams.            Key Responsibilities    HELP US MAKE DATA-DRIVEN DECISIONS       Work with business stakeholders and ensure that they can make data-driven decisions  Translate business objectives into measurable KPIs both in the context of projects and for daily activities  Make data transparent for your stakeholders to support their strategic decisions. Collect, analyze and visualize data within a digital omnichannel context  Create and automate digital reporting and manage the quality of the data and reports   Ensure continuous improvement of both the methodology and the dashboards and data themselves with a view to refining insights  Train, support and advise business stakeholders on the preparation of simple digital analytics reports, the formulation of business requirements and the interpretation of digital analytics reports  Always on the lookout for improvements and make recommendations in this respect  Work closely with various internal teams to provide a coherent picture of the digital 'end-to-end' customer experience and the digital path the customer follows  Proactively monitor data to identify pain points and suggest improvements  Enable business stakeholders to analyze digital customer behavior across all digital touchpoints  You aggregate and organize data from different sources (Google Analytics, search, advertising, big query, CRM, Salesforce, Content square etc.)          Applicants should ideally:    Have several years of experience in digital (customer) data analysis.  Have knowledge/experience of digital marketing, e-commerce and e-care, including web analytics, social media and conversion marketing.  Have experience with the use of analytical tools (Google analytics, Big Query, Datastudio, Similarweb, Salesforce, Content square...).  Knowledge of tag management is a strong asset.  Be fluent in PowerPoint and Excel and have a basic knowledge of web technologies.  Have good analytical skills. You are a critical thinker and a good problem solver.  Be a real team player who can work well with colleagues from different teams, both from a business and a more technical background.  Have strong communication and presentation skills. You love to make data transparent for business and enjoy taking on less experienced colleagues.  Be willing to further develop skills in a team-oriented, fast-changing environment.  Be fluent in English (Dutch or French is an asset).  Have the ability to multitask.  Be intensely passionate to helping us grow our digital footprint.  Embrace new, digital media technologies and capabilities          Our offer   Next to this challenging role, we also offer a very attractive compensation package, including an excellent pension scheme, a competitive group insurance, lunch vouchers and extra holidays.     We are committed to a diverse and vibrant culture, welcoming people from all walks of life. Our long-standing commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers each of us to bring our authentic selves and unique differences to work every day.         Interested?   Any applications, including CV and cover letter should be forwarded to recruitment@samsonite.com

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Google Data Studio, Looker (Software), +6 more
job_description: Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?      Truecaller transformed how we communicate when we launched in 2009 in Stockholm, Sweden.  Our mission is to build trust everywhere by making tomorrow’s communication smarter, safer and more efficient. We focus on bringing smart services with big social impacts, like protecting people from fraud, harassment, and scam calls or messages. We identify new numbers from anywhere in the world and build a space for trustworthy conversations, for those that matter. Truecaller is loved by over 350 million people around the world and is growing very rapidly across regions.      Who we are:    The world’s #1 caller ID and spam blocking service for Android and iOS.  A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities, spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, Tel Aviv and Nairobi.  Listed on Nasdaq       We at the Cloud Telephony team,  are on a mission to enable AI-powered communication solutions for consumers and businesses through the Truecaller platform. The team will focus on creating cutting-edge cloud telephony solutions for consumers. The features the team will develop will affect the experience of hundreds of millions of users around the world directly and will improve their daily interaction with their phones.      As a Data Analyst  in the Cloud telephony team, you will build the dashboards which the team uses to analyze how the users are utilizing the Assistant feature.      What do we expect from you:       4+ years of experience doing quantitative analysis (experience working for a Product oriented company is a plus)  Expertise in data visualization tools, such as  Google Data Studio,  Looker, QlikSens,Tableau, PowerBI, etc.  Experience using SQL to extract, transform and analyze data  Ability to communicate results of analyses in a clear and effective manner  Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc.  Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance  Good communication skills          What will you work on:       Identify different sources and types of information from the different app stores, internal analytics, Campaign management tools, AB test solutions.  Collect, clean, organize, analyze and interpret application data and usage, draw insightful conclusions to enable data-driven product enhancements  Create visual interpretations of data on Data Studio or Looker, produce graphs and charts with insightful notes and summaries  Analyze customer data and assist product development in finding new innovative ways to optimize conversion and retention  Support the management in identifying, measuring and following up on key metrics  Analyze campaigns and user journey results in order to improve conversion and retention tactics  Provide regular, accurate and comprehensive statistical reports  Provide objective insight and analysis to influence decision making  Keep up-to-date knowledge on the external market and data research to compare our metrics and create a value-added analysis       It would be great if you also have:       Worked with Campaign management tools and metrics  Good understanding of A/B experiments and hands-on experience is a plus.  Good scripting and programming skills  Experience with Python and R programming language       Life at Truecaller -  Behind the code:   https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/      Sounds like your dream job?       We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.       This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.        We only accept applications in English .      What we offer:         A smart, talented and agile team:  An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing and fun environment.   A great compensation package:  Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance and pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, gym membership.   Great tech tools:  Pick the computer and phone that you fancy the most within our budget ranges.   Do it your way:  For the days you're working from home, we provide you with an attractive budget for creating your cozy office at home.   Office life:  Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun at our playroom! As well, exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, Geek lunch!       Come as you are:   Truecaller is diverse, equal and inclusive. We need a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs and experiences in order to keep building our great products. Learn more                               Who we areLooping Group is a young, dynamic full service integrated agency rich in culture and brimming with ideas. Very good German and English skills !      Why us?      Very flexible working models    Mobile working    Team spirit and a great working atmosphere    Our learning culture    Beautiful offices in central city locations    LOOPING Mental Health Programme with our partner nilo.health    An actively lived corporate culture based on our values, the Looping ABC: be ambitious, be brave, be collaborative      About usTHE BUSINESS Founded in 2016 by journalists, creatives and producers, we have   established ourselves as a leader in data-driven storytelling, working with an   impressive roster of brands including BMW, Mercedes Benz, Allianz, the Human   Vaccines Project, and many more. Our team consists of over 250 multi-skilled   staff split between offices in Berlin, Hamburg, and Munich, and London. Here at Looping Group, we have a distinctive offering for brands we   work with. In this world, attention has become extremely scarce. To win   attention, brands must now combine the art and science of storytelling. We put   this at the heart of our product and service offering, uniquely combining the   two to create content that commands attention, engages customers, and drives   tangible business results. As an independent agency, we have ample opportunity   to explore various solutions for clients and truly think uniquely. We are a   tech-enabled comms agency built to think ahead of the modern world. OUR INCLUSION STATEMENT Every role at Looping Group is open to applications from all   sections of society. We believe that embracing difference is critical to the   success of Looping Group. We see potential in every individual regardless of:   race, ethnic origin or nationality; religion or belief; physical or neuro   ability; socio-economics or age; marital, domestic or civil partnership status;   sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic that makes   you, well, you. We are committed to conscious inclusion to create a sense of   belonging, connection and shared purpose within our teams. We know it’s the   right thing to do, and we know it will make us all happier, fulfilled, and   successful in our work. We know it’s the right thing to do, and we know it will   make us all happier, fulfilled, and successful in our work Don’t meet every single   requirement? At LOOPING GROUP, we are dedicated to creating a diverse, inclusive   and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past   experience doesn’t perfectly align with every qualification in the job   description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right   candidate for this or other roles.

job_description: About DS Smith      DS Smith are a leading provider of sustainable packaging solutions, paper products and recycling services in more than 30 different countries. It’s a very exciting time to join, as we have committed to investing in our future across our strategic growth enablers within Innovation (R&D), Sustainability and Digital & Data.     Be a game changer as we invent, reimagine and redefine packaging!      About the role      DS Smith Packaging is looking for a Data Analyst with a passion for digital transformation that will establish, consolidate and unify data to support the Sales, Marketing and Innovation leadership. The role will be tasked with the production of trusted, transparent and robust enterprise data that enables fact driven decision making including responsibility for data completeness and data integrity.     Key Responsibilities:      Reporting Development and Delivery:    Identify, clarify and document business requirements in order to deliver the most suitable reporting solution.  Find a way to transform and join data from multiple sources to a well defined and governed data environment (datamarts in Power BI).  Ensure data quality checks are in place to detect data incompleteness and guarantee data integrity.  Ensure a security model is in place to allow access to different users at the right level.  Develop, test and deploy reporting solutions and enable its automatic generation.  Create and maintain documentation of the reporting solutions in terms of calculations method and terminology definition.  Create training materials and train the different stakeholders and users of the reporting solutions to ensure they know how to use the reporting tool and understand how to analyse the data       Change Management    Engage with business owners and users to understand how data-driven changes and new process requests can improve efficiencies and add value.       About you         Minimum requirements:   A minimum of 3-5 years’ data analysis experience, preferably as a consultant in an international manufacturing company.  Affinity with (master)data and data governance.  Knowledge and proven experience with Cognos, PowerBI, MS Access or other reporting tools.  Understand how data can be transferred between systems with ETL’s or interfaces through SQL  Understand relational databases and how to connect tables to a complete and performant data set.  Proven ability to intelligently operate and navigate in a multinational environment with experience working in matrix roles.  Experience with stakeholder management, ability to deal with stakeholders on each level of the organisation  Fluent in English as this is the company operating language

job_description: We’re on a mission to help organisations contextualise the environment they operate in.     At Echo Analytics, we work with companies from all over the world. We create, combine, and convert thousands of public and private datasets into meaningful geospatial insights and provide the most accurate commercial Point of Interest (POI) product and mobility insights available in Europe.      What do we do?   We provide companies with fuel to power their products with high-quality geospatial-based datasets. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build the most comprehensive geospatial datasets and insights available in Europe and rapidly expanding.      Echo partners with companies from multiple industries such as retail, mobility, smart-cities, real-estate, advertising, market-research, and financial services.      Who are we looking for?   We are looking for a Data Analyst to be in charge of all the data deliveries (data extraction or data analysis) from our Data Lake to our customers.     To be successful as a Data Analyst, you should have prior data experience, be able to collaborate with team members, be a strategic problem-solver and an inspiring data visionary. You also need to have business or client experience.      The opportunity   Our stack runs on Google Cloud Platform. You will work in an environment made up of Data Lakes (BigQuery, etc.), data streaming platforms (Pub/Sub, Dataflow..), orchestration and scheduling platforms (Airflow), modern deployment (Terraform), and management platforms (GCP).      You will manage all the data extraction in coordination with the product and customer success team.      This is a unique opportunity to be part of a highly promising start-up in its early stage and play a vital role in establishing and expanding its market.      Your Role at Echo   We’re currently scaling the team and hiring talents to grow faster. You will be responsible to :      Understand the product / customers requirements and specify the strategy to extract the data  Provide the visibility on the deliveries to the business   Provide data analysis to obtain the requested data (raw visit, dwell time, cross visitation,...) using data sciences such as normalisation, extrapolation…  Write complex and efficient SQL queries to transform raw data points from our data lake into reliable business use cases.  Ensure data is clean, consistent and accurate.  Be a technical guide to various business entities and data marts. Train data users on SQL and analytics best practices.  Create clear and easy to understand technical documents that explain fully the datasets created.  Continue learning new skills thanks to the Echo Analytics knowledge plan  Resolve complex problems coming from the data.        What we’re looking for:    Fluency in English (French is a plus)  At least 2 years of experience in Big Data, Data warehousing in tier-1 software companies.  2+ years of experience in Data Analysis in Python/SQL/R.  An experience in Data Visualization in Python or other BI tools.  An experience in project management is a plus.  Strong organisational skills.  Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack.  Strong experience in Agile Methods (Lean is a plus).  Working knowledge in DevOps: GitHub CI/CD, Terraform, Notion, Jira or other Project Management tools.       What we offer:   The opportunity to join an early stage fast-growing start-up and to scale with us   Attractive remuneration package with stock incentives (employee equity plan - BSPCE)  A great international team based in Paris  A contemporary office space in the centre of Paris  Remote-friendly policy  Free coffee and snacks  Weekly team lunch  Healthcare: Alan   An amazing and supporting work environment focused on your professional growth and development       Hiring process:   1. Send us your CV and Cover Letter  Make sure to highlight:   a. Your previous achievements   b. Your motivation   c. Your added value to Echo  2. Video-call  3. In-person meeting in our Parisian office     We are looking forward to hearing from you!     Office location: Paris – Pont Cardinet - Batignolles

title: Data Analyst

job_description: Data Analyst - Intern       Our Vision   At Hubble_s, we are driven by impact. We want to help teams meet their business goals by better managing collective behaviors. It’s people that make things happen and if those people aren’t aligned - from a business and behavioral standpoint - ideas and projects fall flat. Through our suite of digital tools, we get to the heart of what behaviors are blocking or helping progress and we get comfortable with tackling uncomfortable topics. We put employees in the driver’s seat so that, at all levels, people feel empowered and celebrated. The impact we seek is not only for better results, but an opportunity to help unlock a positive change in people’s lives.      Our Team   We attract people who want to have an impact on people’s lives. They have a sense of purpose and clarity of what drives them outside of work and bring this energy into the company. They operate without ego, as part of a collective, to bring about change in the lives of others and in their own lives.       Our Company    We created Hubble_s to build a disruptive and scalable B2B SaaS platform. When surveyed, we found that most c-level executives say companies are, in essence, “Factories of Behaviors.” These managers agree that they do not have the tools they need to manage behaviors at scale. We fill this gap. With a successful track record of leveraging behavioral science, data, and our proprietary IP with large enterprise clients, we are now taking our platform to a wider audience to help managers at all levels align collective behaviors and make better decisions. We recognize that key to achieving our mission is to secure an ambitious Data Analyst Intern who can help us develop insights from our unique behavioral data we are collecting from our user-base.       The Role    Support our analytics efforts in developing insights from behavioral data   Manage the company’s data systems and analyze needs to collect and organize the right data  Develop recommendations around how best to deploy artificial intelligence and machine learning to evolve our platform in the future       What we are really looking for is:    Availability for 6 months full-time internship  Studying or just graduated from a bachelor or master degree in Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, or related discipline  Experience in data analytics, with proficiency in data collection, management, analysis, quality, and visualization   Enthusiast for translating behavioral data into actionable insights (relevant experience in behavioral sciences a plus, but not required)  Attention to detail, organization, and time management skills  Self-starter but also able to take direction; ability to work both independently and collaborate as a team-player  Able to propose ideas and solutions, and then collaborate to improve upon them in a group setting  Excited to try new things, and willing to scrap old plans and create new ones as the need arises       Be ready to jump in, with these foundational skills:    Advanced knowledge of SQL and Excel functions  Knowledge of Tableau or Power BI or other data intelligence tools   R or Python programming  Proven capacity to identify patterns and trends in data and communicate them clearly  Understanding of concepts in artificial intelligence that will help us build on our machine learning capabilities (variable selection, linguistic rule creation, model development, etc.)   Excellent communication skills (written & verbal)  Spanish language skills are a plus, but not required  Comfortable with adding structure to unstructured problems   Ability to act as a translator between the data world and business world        What we offer you:    Impact on a global level  A team of colleagues who are grounded, curious, and energized by what we’re building  An open, collaborative work environment built on mutual respect and the ability to define what makes you happy   Intellectual challenge to help us develop products in an emerging field   Competitive compensation based on experience. We would consider reviewing this for an exceptional candidate

Highly competent with Excel, PowerPoint and Word and Eviews, R or Sequel, (any programming skills would be advantageous.  Excellent attention to detail  Ability to multitask and coordinate multiple projects at once.  Be able to communicate in a very professional environment  A consultant would be becoming more self sufficient on part of projects and increasingly taking more ownership of smaller client projects       We are a global fast growing company which offers a variety of opportunities for you to develop your skill set and career. In exchange for your contribution, we can offer you:    A competitive salary and benefits  Hybrid working  L&D Opportunities  A company focus on wellbeing and work life balance including initiatives like flexible working, mental health support and regular health and wellbeing events       About Ebiquity:    Ebiquity is the world leader in media investment analysis. job_description: GEDI Gruppo Editoriale  è uno dei principali operatori italiani nel settore dei media.   GEDI è editore di La Repubblica, La Stampa, Huffington Post, Il Secolo XIX, 9 testate locali e altri periodici. Fanno parte del Gruppo anche 3 emittenti radiofoniche nazionali: Radio Deejay, Radio Capital, m2o.  La nuova scommessa del gruppo è tutta sul Digitale:  GEDI Digital  ha infatti la missione di garantire ai Brand del Gruppo visibilità e presenza nel digitale ed è autore di contenuti audiovisivi multimediali originali, innovativi e di alta qualità.      Job description:   Siamo alla ricerca di un  Data Analyst  che verrà inserito nel team  Data Strategy, Reporting e Analytics  al fine di supportare lo sviluppo di prodotto, il marketing e la strategia.     Il candidato ideale deve avere uno spiccato interesse verso le dinamiche di business e almeno 3 anni di esperienza in Data Analysis, Data Visualization e/o Web Analytics; deve aver seguito un percorso di Laurea in ambito quantitativo e possedere ottime doti di comunicazione.      Principali attività:   · Si occuperà di riunire e analizzare diversi set di dati per supportare le business unit con approfondimenti di alto valore e dal potenziale impatto sui risultati economici aziendali;  · Parteciperà attivamente a progetti con i vari business team del gruppo;  · Sarà coinvolto nello sviluppo di mercato e di business del gruppo;  · Utilizzerà linguaggio SQL, principalmente tramite BigQuery, per estrarre informazioni dai vari flussi di dati presenti sulla Google Cloud Platform aziendale;  · Utilizzerà piattaforme di Web Analytics (p.e. Google Analytics) per analizzare i comportamenti di navigazione dei nostri utenti;  · Progetterà report chiari e automatizzati tramite strumenti di Data Visualization (Looker, Power BI) per democratizzare l'accesso ai dati a tutta l'azienda.      Requisiti:   · Laurea in discipline scientifiche: statistica, matematica, ingegneria, informatica, economia, finanza o altra facoltà quantitativa;  · Capacità di leggere i dati e trarne evidenze e indicazioni di business con impatto sulle revenues;  · Capacità di coding e propensione al pensiero computazionale;  · Buona conoscenza di SQL;  · Conoscenza di strumenti di Data Visualization (Looker Studio e Power BI preferenziali);  · Ottime doti comunicative, scritte e orali;  · Curiosità e interesse per gli aspetti tecnologici e per l’evoluzione degli strumenti di raccolta ed elaborazione dei dati digitali;  · Atteggiamento imprenditoriale e proattivo, orientato ad individuare soluzioni;  · Forte orientamento all’apprendimento continuo e all’auto-formazione.      Sede di lavoro:  Milano o Torino, con possibilità di Smart Working         Visita il nostro sito per avere maggiori informazioni sulla nostra realtà: https://www.gedi.it/it           Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03, 216/03 e 198/2006.

job_description: View All Vacancies   Data Analyst   Projects (Estates)    Location:   Egham   Salary:   £38,467 to £45,289 per annum - including London Allowance   Post Type:   Full Time   Closing Date:   23.59 hours BST on Wednesday 21 June 2023   Reference:   0523-215  Full-Time, Permanent  The Estates department is in the process of developing the Colleges historic estate to provide a 21st century campus and user experience that meets the increasingly contemporary needs of the people studying, working, and visiting here. The Estates Department is in the final stages of a post pandemic restructure and the new Data Analyst role is a key enabling part of this new structure.  This newly created role, reporting through to the Estates Data Analysis Business Partner, is a key planning and operational position for both the University’s Estates Department and Strategic Planning Team. It will provide analysis and data management for both teams, focussing on ensuring efficient, secure, and sustainable use of data and information management approaches for systems and projects.  Working with both the Estates and Strategic Planning team, the successful individual will have excellent communication and prioritisation skills. Working as part of a wider future data management team, this role will facilitate timely and relevant information gathering, analysis and interpretation to enable operational delivery and effective strategic decision-making.  The post holder will require sound experience in data management and analysis and the ability to interpret and work with multiple datasets to deliver effective analyses and reports. It will also involve advanced skills in use of Microsoft tools (including Office 365 and Excel) along with demonstrable experience of using a variety of technical platforms.  In return we offer a highly competitive rewards and benefits package including:   Generous annual leave entitlement   Training and Development opportunities  Pension Scheme with generous employer contribution   Various schemes including Cycle to Work, Season Ticket Loans and help with the cost of Eyesight testing. Successful candidates will therefore need to be eligible to work in the UK or have limited leave to remain in the UK and associated right to work for the duration of their employment with the College, in accordance with the Immigration, Asylum and Nationality Act 2006. title: Product Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Статистическое моделирование, Моделирование данных, +8 more
job_description: At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. We offer hundreds of thousands of audiobooks and ebooks to customers in more than 27+ markets, with several new markets launching in the coming year. Storytel is Northern Europe's largest audiobook streaming service and we’re now looking for a Product Data Analyst to join the team! Storytel’s vision is to make the world a more empathic and creative place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed anytime, anywhere by anyone.   About The Team   As a Product Data Analyst, you will belong to the Analytics team who is responsible for delivering insights to the entire Storytel organization. We combine technical and statistical skills with business acumen and tailored communication to drive change at Storytel, using data. Our stakeholders work in domains ranging from product development and content management to business strategy and marketing.  Our technology stack is built on top of Google Cloud Platform and includes but is not limited to BigQuery (SQL), Looker and Jupyter Notebooks/Python.   About The Role   As a Product Data Analyst at Storytel you will have the opportunity to provide the organization with actionable insights to facilitate decision-making and enable commercial opportunities. End-to-end responsibility ranges from problem articulation, preparing & structuring of underlying data assets, analysis & data visualization as well as communication of final recommendations to business stakeholders. You master the intersection of traits such as statistical understanding, programming, presentation and people skills. You will also have the opportunity to be an internal data ambassador and upskill business stakeholders in order to grow data literacy at Storytel.   Some Other Things You Will Do Is    Use data to enable Product Team decisions  Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for a given product team  Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas  Give concrete product recommendations in the relevant Product Team, based on insights from analyses and experiments  Manage working with different Product Teams, enabling their analyses while prioritising your work and effectively managing your time and their expectations   Ensure that the product team understands and have access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.  Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments     About You   To be successful in this role we believe that you have:   Experience working in SQL and Python (including pandas and data visualization packages)  Sound knowledge of conducting experiments (A/B testing) and implementing appropriate analyses (this includes an understanding of relevant statistics concepts)  Exposure to working with digital consumer-facing products, especially a streaming service is a plus  Experience with Looker is a plus  Analytical thinking and curiosity - we want you to feel comfortable exploring data and finding potential opportunities for improvement  Independent and self-driven - to be able to support multiple product teams we need you to be motivated and comfortable working independently     And for some bonus points if you have    Experience in the GCP tool stack (Looker, BigQuery, etc.)  Experience with data modelling and engineering procedures  Experience with statistical modelling  Experience in applying Machine Learning techniques to solve business problems  Experience with the modern data stack and ecosystem     What We Offer   At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy. We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities when possible and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in.  Storytel’s culture encourages self-leadership, innovation, collaboration – and our employees share a common passion for high-quality content and stories. There is a strong emphasis on continuous development, learning through experimentation and actively sharing feedback to constantly improve performance.  Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. We like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterized by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it. And of course - you get unlimited listening to audio and ebooks from our service!  Does this sound like you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, please submit your application in English and we will contact you as soon as possible.

title: Consultor BI
skills: Skills: Консультирование, Анализ бизнес-данных, +3 more
job_description: Konozca crece  y por este motivo, estamos  ampliando nuestro equipo de Consultores  con capacidad de proporcionar las mejores soluciones a nuestros clientes, detectar sus necesidades e implementar las soluciones más óptimas.     Somos una consultora tecnológica estratégica partner de Salesforce desde hace más de 12 años siendo líderes en el sector.     Contamos con una trayectoria exitosa reflejada en los más de  1500 proyectos  implantados con éxito enfocados a clientes de todo el mundo, además hemos sido premiados como  Partners Awards de Salesforce  por nuestro trabajo basado en la fiabilidad, rapidez y seguridad.     En Konozca evolucionamos y crecemos basándonos en nuestros cuatro pilares fundamentales: la innovación, confianza, crecimiento e igualdad. Crecimiento basado en las personas de las que sabemos que es nuestro pilar fundamental y por ello realizamos un gran esfuerzo en fidelizar a nuestros profesionales para que en todo momento sientan que están en su Compañía.     Para nosotros la  confianza y feedback  con nuestros clientes es esencial para desarrollar un óptimo trabajo, por ello superamos el umbral del  4.75/5 de puntuación media  en la valoración de nuestros proyectos implementados, además de contar con más de un  95% de fidelidad de nuestros clientes.      En Konozca te ofrecemos formar parte de un equipo profesional, dinámico y eficaz.   Además de ofrecerte las mejores condiciones laborales como un salario competitivo, un contrato indefinido y una serie de ventajas, entre las que te  ofrecemos,       Gestionar proyectos ambiciosos, trabajando en una estrecha colaboración con nuestros clientes con el fin de comprender sus necesidades comerciales, identificar áreas de mejora y desarrollar estrategias.  Plan formativo personalizado enfocado a tu crecimiento profesional dentro del ámbito que tú elijas.  Formarte a través de cursos y contenidos continuamente actualizados con el fin de lograr tu crecimiento y así adquirir los conocimientos en los últimos avances de la tecnología más potente del mercado.  Crecer anualmente a través de nuestro Plan de Carrera y programas de Desarrollo personalizado enfocado a tu evolución y ambición personal.  Sentirte uno más de la compañía, trabajarás junto a un equipo joven y proactivo.  Desarrollar un plan de certificaciones de Salesforce adaptado a ti en todas las plataformas ofrecidas por el CRM #1 mundialmente.  Atmósfera multicultural, excelente ambiente laboral. Promovemos continuas actividades de Team Building para que puedas sentirte cómodo en tu entorno laboral.       Durante tu jornada laboral en Konozca,        Participarás y colaborarás en la toma de requerimientos de los clientes para valorar sus objetivos y necesidades, analizando los impactos y participando en el desarrollo de las fases del ciclo de vida del proyecto.  Analizarás el diseño funcional y técnico, además de la puesta en producción de los proyectos asignados.  Implementarás procesos, generarás informes y realizarás consultas query necesarias para la explotación de datos.  Trabajarás en un entorno con metodología Agile que te permitirá garantizar el éxito de los proyectos.  Generarás soluciones de análisis automatizadas dentro de Tableau Desktop, publicadas en Tableau Server o Tableau online para su visualización.   Manteniendo el contenido actualizado mediante la publicación, programación y mantenimiento de Tableau.  Formarás a usuarios y elaborarás documentación, pruebas y seguimiento a los distintos proyectos.  Marcarás tu propia trayectoria profesional dentro de la empresa.       Qué buscamos en ti :       Titulación técnica  (en ámbito de la ingeniería, telecomunicaciones, matemáticas, física) o  Ciclo de grado superior  (en desarrollo de aplicaciones multiplataforma, desarrollo de aplicaciones web, similar).  Elevado nivel de inglés requerido para poder ejecutar adecuadamente tus funciones.  Experiencia con Tableau Desktop y Tableau Prep tanto en Tableau Server como Tableau Online.  Experiencia en consultoría llevando a cabo proyectos en las diferentes fases.   Ser capaz de mantener una perspectiva crítica y orientada a la excelencia en nuestros proyectos.   Ser una persona acostumbrada a gestionar relaciones con clientes, ser comunicativo y contar con un espíritu de equipo para una mayor armonía y profesionalidad.  Mostrar ganas de aprender y afrontar nuevos retos dentro de la compañía.  Ser una persona apasionada por la tecnología con ganas de trabajar en una empresa líder en el sector.  Capacite a los clientes sobre cómo utilizar Salesforce de manera efectiva y eficiente.      Se valorará positivamente el conocimiento de la herramienta Salesforce, no obstante, no es un requisito indispensable, ya que buscamos consultores con ganas de crecer y aprender de dicho CRM y afianzarse así en una empresa líder del sector tecnológico.     Si crees que puedes encajar y te sientes identificado con el perfil que buscamos, no dudes en contactarnos y formar parte de Konozca. ¡Te esperamos!
