title: Product Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Решение задач, Коммуникабельность, +8 more
job_description: Job Title:    Product Data Analyst    Location/s:    Medellin COL - Poblado Carrera Ave   As a Product Data Analyst, you’ll be part of our Strategy & Portfolio Management (S&PM) team. This dynamic, analytical organization includes our Complexity Management, Productivity, and Warranty teams, all focused on helping drive margin enhancement for our Hand Tools Accessories Storage (HTAS) Division. Our high-performing analytical team is responsible for driving margin growth through best-in-class analytics, insights, and reporting. We are true entrepreneurs and relationship builders, fueled by a passion to excite our organization and exceed the expectations of our trusted retail partners. As both a strategic and tactical function, we contribute directly to Stanley Black & Decker’s success and remain steadfast in our pursuit of excellence in market.   You will support HTAS by data entry and SKU analytics. You will work in conjunction with the rest of the S&PM team to collect & enter data, deliver insights, optimize data, and quality check data.    Specific Responsibilities:       Data Entry for Product Attribution: A key component to this role will be gathering data from websites to collect, cleanse and standardize product attributes that impact end-consumer purchasing decisions.   Assortment Planning: Organizing and analyzing our product range and deciding which products should be eliminated from and/or added to the range.   Project Management: Effectively plan, execute, monitor, and control, and close projects using principles, methods, and standard techniques that are appropriate to the specific project. Create and manage an effective project schedule.   Collaboration, Communication, & Influence: Partner with SBU Product and Global Channel teams to execute SKU level product changes by providing a clear narrative of the value being driven through advanced data analytics.   Technology: Leverage existing BI tools including SAP/Business Warehouse, Hive, JDA, Tableau, Alteryx, and Qlikview to develop analysis based upon KPIs devised to reduce complexity.   Strong Attention to Detail: As the foundational source of our product data, many teams will depend on the product attribution data to be correct, standardized and robust. Attention to detail is a must.       Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:      Bachelor’s Degree in data entry, business, analytics or related field is required.   Strong attention to detail, analytical skills, problem-solving skills, interpersonal skills are required.   Effective communication, both written and oral in English.   1+ years’ experience turning data into insights.   Proficient in MS Excel and PowerPoint.   Knowledge of the following a plus but not required: Qlikview, SAP, Tableau, Alteryx, Caspian, SQL, ability to automate manual tasks.   Power Bi knowledge is a plus.   Must operate independently, but within the confines of a team.   Self-motivated and willingness to overcome challenges.   Strong multi-tasking ability as well as ability to manage deadlines in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.   Ability to recognize and adapt to change.   High level of enthusiasm and a passion for excellence.   Excellent organization, personnel management, and matrix management skills. Solid interpersonal skills with the ability to work well with people at all levels and different backgrounds.        We Don’t Just Build The World, We Build Innovative Technology Too.     Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means working in an innovative, tech-driven and highly collaborative team environment supported by over 58,000 professionals in 60 countries across the globe. Here, you’ll get the unique chance to impact some of the world’s most iconic brands including STANLEY TOOLS, DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, MAC TOOLS and Black + Decker. Your ideas and solutions have the potential to reach millions of customers as we work together to write the next chapter in our history. Come build with us and take your career to new heights.    Who We Are    We’re the World’s largest tool company. We’re industry visionaries. We’re solving problems and advancing the manufacturing trade through innovative technology and our Industry 4.0 Initiative. We are committed to ensuring our state-of-the-art “smart factory” products and services provide greater quality to our customers & greater environmental and social value to our planet. We are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company.    Benefits & Perks    You’ll get a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, life, vision, wellness program, disability, retirement benefits, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, including paid vacation, holidays & personal days, and tuition reimbursement. And, of course, discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and products and well as discount programs for many other vendors and partners.    What You’ll Also Get    Career Opportunity: Career paths aren’t linear here. Being part of our global company with 60+ brands gives you the chance to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.    Learning & Development:     Our lifelong learning philosophy means you’ll have access to a wealth of state-of-the-art learning resources, including our Lean Academy and online university (where you can get certificates and specializations from renowned colleges and universities).    Diverse & Inclusive Culture:    We pride ourselves on being an awesome place to work. We respect and embrace differences because that’s how the best work gets done. You’ll find we like to have fun here, too.    Purpose-Driven Company:    You’ll help us continue to make positive changes in the local communities where we work and live as well as in the broader world through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Модели данных, Рассмотрение заявок, +8 more
job_description: We’re the world's leading carsharing platform, with millions of users around the world, sharing thousands of cars in over 950 cities across 8 countries.   Our mission is simple: Make our cities better places to live through carsharing.   Carsharing empowers people to move in a smarter and more sustainable way: studies show that one shared car replaces between 4 and 10 privately owned cars, which frees up space in our cities while giving communities 24/7 access to cars when they need them.   With our connected car technology, users can quickly and easily book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app, without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys.   To reach our vision of a world where all cars are shared, we need a strong team to help us disrupt car ownership. We look for people who are curious, positive, and engaged; who can adapt and learn quickly; who have the skills and smarts to reach their goals autonomously, while having the generosity and mindset to work collaboratively. No matter your role, background, or level of experience, we believe that every member of the team can have an impact.   We’re extremely proud to be certified "Best Place to Work” 2023 !     The Opportunity       If you want to use data to ensure rental safety and successfully resolve claims, this is your opportunity to make a difference. Fine-tuned risk management is critical to the success of carsharing, and at Getaround, we have demonstrated that a data-centric approach is crucial for achieving this success. Join us in developing the tools and models to bring us to the next generation of risk-proof marketplaces.  You'll be an essential part of our Risk Management and User Assistance squads, working hand in hand with safety and claims management teams, as well as product managers, software engineers, and data scientists to maintain security on the platform by reducing driving risk, stopping fraud, and minimizing friction during claims resolution.  You'll belong to the data team of 15 experienced and caring data enthusiasts and will report to Benjamin , our Data Analytics Manager for Risk Management and Carsharing. Part of your time will be dedicated to developing a robust data environment, sharing knowledge with your peers, exploring new tools, and developing best practices.  For risk management, you'll analyze risk factors, develop strategies to mitigate threats and work on projects such as fraud prevention alerts, cost-benefit analysis, and fraud management tool integration. For user assistance, you'll identify areas for improving the claims process, monitor and explore new features, refine claims segmentation, and analyze its impact on user experience.     We invite you to listen to our head of data’s podcast with DataGen to better understand how our data organization works.     What You'll Do       You'll work on cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end to:  Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner.  Own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.  Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action them  Share your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.  Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.  Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.       Our Stack       Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python or R notebooks in Hex.       What You'll Bring       Experience: 2 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment. More senior profiles are welcome as well.   Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.  A strong interest in product: you think about possible product improvements in your day-to-day interactions with any app  Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment  Coding abilities: Experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources. Experience with R, Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus  Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.  Communication: you’re excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.  Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.  A prior experience in fraud or operations analytics is a plus.  Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.     👉 If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and we’ll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you     Why Join Us       🌎 Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with global headquarters in San Francisco and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.  🌱 The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.  🧠 A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360° feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, unlimited access to Udemy (learning platform), optional annual training, plus a team wiki that you’ll contribute to improve  🌐 An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, the UK, Spain, Belgium and Austria.  🏡 A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.  📝 A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home  🤝 Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders  🗓 A €200 annual credit and unlimited 20% vouchers for your Getaround bookings  💫 Health insurance  🍽 A Swile lunch card  💻 Apple equipment     Come join us!

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: SQL, Python, +7 more
job_description: Ti attira la possibilità di trasformare i dati raccolti all’interno di diversi sistemi in uno strumento innovativo che aiuti l’azienda a compiere delle scelte migliori, da quale prodotto mettere a scaffale al prezzo da assegnare ad un articolo?      L’opportunità      In Pam Panorama avrai l’opportunità di farlo. Siamo infatti alla ricerca di una figura di Data Analyst che contribuisca allo sviluppo di prodotti e servizi innovativi, consentendo all’azienda di affrontare le sfide di un business dinamico e complesso come quello della GDO. Il Data Analyst lavorerà in un team collaborativo e focalizzato sulla  value delivery .        Di cosa ti occuperai    Seguire la pianificazione, la supervisione e il controllo della gestione e dell'uso dei dati e delle relative risorse  Contribuire a definire e a portare avanti la data strategy  aziendale in collaborazione con il Controllo di Gestione e gli altri stakeholder  Tenere sotto controllo la qualità dei dati raccolti, monitorare i metodi utilizzati per raccoglierli, i trattamenti a cui sono sottoposti, assicurando che le informazioni siano nel formato corretto e organizzate in base alle esigenze dell'azienda; correggere eventuali errori e risolvere i problemi che li hanno determinati  Utilizzare strumenti statistici per identificare, analizzare e interpretare modelli e tendenze in set di dati complessi che potrebbero essere utili per diagnosi e previsioni, al fine di fornire supporto decisionale al management  Adottare le strategie più efficaci per la visualizzazione, la presentazione e la distribuzione dei dati (infographics, data story telling, ecc.)  Individuare gli indicatori e le metriche utili a migliorare i processi e, in generale, le performance aziendali; stabilire regole per la raccolta, l'archiviazione e la proprietà dei dati utili a supportare il mantenimento e il miglioramento di tali performance  “Non solo dashboard”: capire ciò che le persone vogliono fare con i dati, individuare le business questions  rilevanti, analizzare e gestire i requisiti nell’ambito di un processo Agile  Collaborare con i team applicativi per il disegno e la realizzazione di soluzioni e data   products  che implementino capability inerenti alla valutazione (es. i risultati di una promozione), la decisione (es. se inserire o meno un prodotto in assortimento, la quantità da ordinare per un articolo), il monitoraggio (es. l’efficienza del flusso merci), ecc.  Contribuire a coltivare in azienda una cultura nella quale scelte e decisioni siano guidate dai dati ( data-driven ) e siano basate sull’analisi delle evidenze prodotte dalla sperimentazione controllata di nuove idee commerciali, innovazioni di processo, ecc., secondo un approccio  test-and-learn .    Cosa dovrai portare con te   Il lavoro del Data Analyst richiede la comprensione di come le persone, i processi e la tecnologia si combinino con le diverse culture, dentro e fuori un’organizzazione, per produrre valore per l’organizzazione stessa.   In questo contesto, la sua attenzione deve essere rivolta alla trasformazione dei dati in informazioni utili a garantire e migliorare la creazione e la distribuzione del valore.     Questo approccio necessita di un mix di competenze tecniche e relazionali, un profilo  T-shaped .     Competenze “orizzontali”      Attitudine a lavorare in gruppo e spirito di servizio  Capacità di negoziazione e di gestire in modo efficiente le relazioni con clienti interni, fornitori e altri stakeholder  Abilità nel comunicare verbalmente, in forma scritta e in modo visuale  Curiosità, creatività e propensione all'innovazione  Capacità di lavorare contemporaneamente in più progetti diversi mantenendo attenzione anche ai dettagli   Competenze “verticali”      Pensiero analitico e di problem-solving  Capacità di definire modelli e concetti  Forti competenze matematiche e statistiche  Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione come SQL, R, Python, ecc.  Conoscenza di pacchetti per lo sviluppo di report/dashboard come Microstrategy, Qlik, PowerBI, ecc.  Conoscenza di framework ETL come Talend ecc.  Conoscenza di pacchetti statistici come Excel, SPSS, ecc.   Costituiscono titolo preferenziale:      Almenoquattro anni di esperienza nel ruolo  Conoscenza del mondo retail  Esperienza di applicazione delle metodologie Agile/Scrum  Conoscenza delle tecnologie/servizi Big Data: Hadoop, Hive, Impala, Kafka, Spark, Kudu

title: Data Analyst H/F
skills: Skills: Статистика, Python, +8 more
job_description: Diot-Siaci est un groupe multispécialiste de conseil et de courtage d’assurance et de réassurance leader en France et en Europe, présent notamment en Asie, au Moyen-Orient et en Afrique. Il conçoit et imagine des solutions innovantes sur mesure pour ses clients Grandes Entreprises, ETI, PME-PMI et professionnels aussi bien en assurances de personnes qu’en assurances de biens et de responsabilités. Diot-Siaci dispose d’un actionnariat stable et familial qui lui permet d’accompagner ses clients dans leur transformation en répondant à leurs besoins sur toute la chaîne de valeur en IARD, Transport, Responsabilité Civile Professionnelle, Protection Sociale et Conseil et Mobilité Internationale. Avec près de 5000 collaborateurs et un vaste réseau international, le Groupe exerce son activité dans le monde entier et totalise un chiffre d’affaires proche de 730 M€ en 2021.     Nous protégeons le progrès pour imaginer un avenir durable et serein.     Nous rejoindre, c'est :     - Participer à une aventure humaine enrichissante dans un Groupe en forte expansion, pour relever des challenges ambitieux  - Bénéficier d’un cadre favorable à la construction de votre carrière et au développement de votre potentiel  - Contribuer au développement et à la promotion des engagements RSE et des valeurs fortes du Groupe     Le département Data Intelligence a pour rôle la conception et diffusion d’outils permettant le pilotage des directions commerciales et opérationnelles de Diot-Siaci. Elle intervient aussi auprès des clients (essentiellement Grands Comptes) pour mettre en œuvre des solutions de dataviz adaptées aux problématiques client. L’élargissement et la diversification des activités de Diot-Siaci ouvre de nombreuses perspectives de missions liées à la valorisation des données de l’entreprise, portée par le département Data Intelligence.        Les principales missions du poste sont :     • Structuration des bases de données : en collaboration avec l’équipe data et l’informatique, mise en place et amélioration des bases de données existantes. Fiabilisation des données avec la construction d’outils de détection des outliers, par règles métier et par modélisation.     • Recueillir, analyser et challenger les besoins métiers afin d’assurer la réalisation de reportings pertinents et nécessaires aux différents départements pour le pilotage de leur activité.     • Data Visualisation (Power Bi notamment) : proposer des solutions de restitution adaptées selon la cible d’utilisateurs visés. Automatisation des suivis déjà en place, dans un souci de productivité.     • Construction d’outils permettant de piloter l’activité des opérationnels. Par exemple, avec des algorithmes définissant ce qu’il faut traiter automatiquement vs par un gestionnaire et selon quelle priorité.     • Veille technique soutenue autour de la data et des nouvelles technologies afin d’être toujours pertinent et différenciant            Formation initiale et expérience   • Ecole d’ingénieur, Bac + 5 Statistiques / Informatique décisionnelle, Data science     • Première expérience significative dans la statistique décisionnelle, de préférence en courtage et/ou assurance (2/3 ans minimum)         Vos compétences techniques :   • Traitement de données, automatisation, data visualisation, modélisation statistique, bonne communication.     • Environnement technique : R, Python, SQL, Power Bi (+ les différents modes de licences proposés (Embedded, Premium, etc.) et idéalement Power APPS + Automate), Pack Office, connaissance des problématiques Cloud, connaissances de DJANGO seraient un réel plus.         Vos compétences personnelles :   • Vous avez une curiosité naturelle qui vous rend créatif et passionné par les sujets autour de la donnée et de la BI. Vous aimez partager les connaissances et bonnes pratiques acquises à chaque projet dans une démarche d’amélioration continue et de recherche d’innovation.     • Vous aimez interagir avec tous les métiers de l’entreprise pour avancer vos projets et êtes persuadé qu’une statistique a plus de puissance et de crédibilité lorsqu’elle est construite avec les sachants métiers et les opérationnels.     • Rigoureux et méthodique, vous êtes capable d’appréhender votre projet dans son ensemble, d’en modéliser les étapes et de le mener jusqu’à son terme avec un souci constant de fiabilité et de qualité.           Au sein de notre Groupe, vous bénéficiez de  2 à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine  et d’avantages sociaux.  Venez construire votre avenir avec nous.           Nous nous engageons en faveur de la diversité, de l'inclusion et de la lutte contre toute discrimination. Tous nos postes à pourvoir sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.  Le Groupe DIOT-SIACI est signataire de la Charte de la Diversité.  Pour en savoir plus, consultez notre page LinkedIn et notre site carrière.

job_description: Hotelbeds is the world’s leading technology partner, connecting and empowering the world of travel. We’re game-changers, disruptors, the people who bring together local and global brands in accommodation, transport, activities and payments through our network of 300,000 hotels worldwide, 60,000 hard to reach high value clients such as tour operators, travel agents and loyalty schemes across 140 source markets. We are tech-driven, with a customer-first philosophy, and commercial teams whose knowledge and relationships on the ground are second to none. And of course we have an amazing team! Our people, Team Hotelbeds, are the beating heart of the company who we encourage to ‘move fast, dream big and make the difference’ every day. In fact, we believe that it is tech + data + people that truly sets us apart in the market, alongside our ‘global approach, local touch’ mentality. We’re headquartered in Palma, Mallorca and employ around 3,500 people worldwide. As well as an attractive benefits package you will be able to work:    Within an innovative, engaging and multicultural environment.  Have the opportunity to build strong and lasting business relationships and friendships from around the world. title: Data Analyst - Operations
skills: Skills: SQL, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: bloomon is turning the flower industry on its head – for the better. How? By disrupting the traditional supply chain, where most florists operate offline and have done for decades. bloomon creates seasonal collections using unusual stems to deliver unique flower arrangements on repeat or as a unique gift. We always use field-fresh high-quality flowers straight from the grower and deliver them to our customers through a high-tech and highly creative platform.   We launched in Amsterdam in 2014 and went from start-up to scale-up at hypersonic speed. In 2021 we joined forces with Bloom & Wild, the UK's fastest-growing e-commerce company (according to the Financial Times). Driven by our vision of creating the destination for making life a little more thoughtful and beautiful, we're now part of Europe's leading online flower company.   Our group is backed by top-tier investors including General Catalyst (backers of Airbnb and Deliveroo), who led our £75 million Series D funding round in January 2021, alongside Index Ventures (investors in Wise and Glossier). We are home to a family of 3 strong brands, Bloom & Wild, bloomon, and Bergamotte. Together, we are active in 8 countries.   We really care about creating a diverse and inclusive team and we welcome people from all backgrounds, with different perspectives, ideas and experiences to work with us. In our team, everyone has the freedom to give their opinion, grow in their career and be part of a genuinely caring and inclusive team.    The team    We’re on a mission to make data at the heart of what we do as at Bloom & Wild. You’ll work closely with the Operations team to drive data driven decision making within all areas of Operations. You’ll be joining the Analytics & BI team and there will also be the opportunity to work with and learn from the rest of the team.    The role    We’re looking for an Operations Analyst to join our team. Reporting to the area lead of the BI Operations team as they optimise getting our products from farm to recipient in the most efficient way possible. This newly created role has lots of potential for future growth.    Please note that only applicants with intermediate- advanced hands-on SQL experience will be considered. This will be tested during the application process.       You'll have ownership of Operations Squad’s analytical roadmap (with support as needed) and be responsible for sizing and prioritising work to deliver the most impactful and timely insights.   You will work with several key parts of the Operations team these include:   Fulfillment & Delivery - working closely with the team to ensure that we effectively track fulfillment and carrier partner performance that optimises customer satisfaction and profitability.   Trading team - working closely with this team to ensure the optimal amount of stock to sell and avoid any wastage.   Sustainability - we are actively working to be a net 0 emissions company. You’ll be working with our sustainability team in order to understand the data needs, and challenges as well as focus on the key areas of impact.   Own fulfilment team - we have different warehouses in different countries. You will help provide this team with reporting to help optimise customer satisfaction.   Supply Chain and Quality - You will help this team to measure the quality of products including non floral gifts. You will create reporting to ensure that we achieve a high customer NPS and provide recommendations if you identify any areas for improvement.   Customer delight- You will support the customer delight team to understand the performance of our help centre, providing recommendations on areas we could look to improve.   This role will be a combination of building reporting and investigative analysis. You will be able to navigate the opportunities/challenges of both.   You are focused on the most valuable and high impact work and are not afraid to push back on requests if they do not have a clear impact/use.   This role is fast paced, so it will be important that you'll be able to identify quick wins and make trade-offs while maintaining analytical best practice.   You'll provide robust and easy to understand recommendations from your analysis that can be explained to technical and non-technical colleagues.   You have strong communication skills and you're a team player. You'll use these skills to develop strong relationships throughout the business.   You will be action-oriented and ensure that recommendations feed the long-term roadmap.      You       Have at least 3 years of hands-on day to day SQL experience- intermediate/advanced level required. This will be used every day and is a mandatory requirement of the role.   Proven track record (and examples) of creating actionable insight and recommendations which have driven business impact   Track record of working independently to shape analytical problems and define testing methodologies   Experience working with Tableau (or other reporting tools)   Previous experience of automating reporting and simple tasks   A strong attention to detail coupled with an ability to identify big-picture opportunities to add value     Why bloomon?   Bloom & Wild Group teams are distributed across office locations in Amsterdam and London, and multiple warehouse locations. We’re working hard to create a culture of inclusion for our teams, whether they’re working from the office or home. And so whether you need to be at home for focus time or for school pickup, or you want to spend time together with your co-workers, we’ll do our best to make your experience a good one!     Bloomon Perks & Benefits        24 vacation days, with an option to buy an extra 5 vacation days.   1 celebration day per year (extra day off to celebrate a holiday that is important to you)   Happiness days (4 extra days off per year for your personal “me-time”)   We’ll support your commute to our office and site locations. Depending on your journey to work, this may include a - VanMoof bike, an NS business card or expense reimbursement   Access to the GoodHabitz platform for personal development   Access to OpenUp online therapy for your mental health   We love having lunch together! We offer daily fresh and healthy lunch options at our locations in Amsterdam and Amstelveen,   A BBQ-worthy rooftop terrace (Amsterdam HQ)   Friday drinks and socials   Weekly online yoga classes   We’ll provide you with a laptop and other necessary equipment   Phone allowance   Discounts on our beautiful products!     We all love what we do – so if you like challenges, developing new skills, growing creatively and taking initiative, you’ll feel right at home at bloomon!

title: BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST
skills: None
job_description: QIBIT , divisione  ICT  di Gi Group S.p.A., Agenzia per il Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/04 Prot. n. 1101-SG), è specializzata nella selezione, formazione, inserimento e sviluppo professionale dei profili IT per il mercato italiano.   Per multinazionale leader nello sviluppo di servizi per il mercato del lavoro, all’interno  dell’area R&D Digital Innovation , cerchiamo un/a:      BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST       Inserita nel team di  Business Intelligence,  la risorsa avrà la responsabilità dell' implementazione del data model per l’analisi di mercato. In particolare, in coordinamento con le Operations e le altre funzioni aziendali, si occuperà di:   Definizione, individuazione e qualificazione fonti dati  Disegno ed implementazione data model  Monitoraggio dati strategici di mercato  Analisi dati concorrenza e benchmarck con dati interni  Raccolta, valutazione e rappresentazione di dati sul mercato target e sui clienti al fine di facilitare lo sviluppo strategico e gli studi di fattibilità. Identificare le tendenze del mercato.  Analizzare la composizione dei mercati, segmentarli in gruppi ed evidenziare le opportunità che ciascuna di queste nicchie rappresenta in termini di nuovi prodotti.  Conoscere le innovazioni e le tendenze in diversi settori industriali e commerciali per l'applicazione nello sviluppo del business.  Applicare schemi e modelli di progettazione di database, definire le dipendenze dei dati, utilizzare SQL per sviluppare e gestire database     Requisiti:    Laurea in ambito statistico/ matematico  Esperienza pregressa nella mansione di 3 - 5 anni  Inglese fluente (sarà testato in fase di colloquio)  Ottima conoscenza del linguaggio SQL  Conoscenza della logica e del funzionamento dei processi ETL (in particolare MS Integration Services) e capacità di creare e gestire processi ETL in autonomia   Esperienza con strumenti di visualizzazione dei dati (in particolare Power BI)  Conoscenza della progettazione tabulare finalizzata alla visualizzazione dei dati con Power BI (Dax Syntax)  Curiosità intellettuale e propensione all’aggiornamento  Buone doti comunicative e relazionali    Si offre:   Contratto diretto con l'azienda a tempo indeterminato       Luogo di lavoro:   Milano (3 giorni di lavoro in Smart working)   Facciamo parte di Gi Group Holding (www.gigroupholding.it ) la prima multinazionale italiana del lavoro, nonché una delle principali realtà a livello mondiale nei servizi dedicati allo sviluppo del mercato del lavoro. Il nostro Gruppo è attivo nei seguenti campi: lavoro temporaneo, Permanent e Professional Staffing, Ricerca e Selezione, Consulenza HR, Formazione, Outsourcing, supporto alla ricollocazione e attività complementari. Siamo presenti in più di 30 Paesi in Europa, Asia e America con un team di oltre 6000 persone. I valori che ci contraddistinguono: attenzione, passione, apprendimento continuo e innovazione, collaborazione, sostenibilità, responsabilità. Consulta tutti i nostri annunci su www.qibit.it   Gi Group S.p.A. è autorizzata ad operare dal Ministero del Lavoro (Aut. Min. 26/11/2004 PROT. 1101 - SG). L’offerta si intende rivolta a candidati ambosessi, nel rispetto del D.Lgs. n. 198/2006 e ss.mm.ii. e dei Decreti Legislativi n. 215 e n. 216 del 2003 sulle parità di trattamento. title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: ETL, QlikView, +8 more
job_description: Unser Stellenangebot   Die Volkswagen Group Services GmbH ist der Dienstleistungsanbieter innerhalb des Volkswagen Konzerns. Wir bieten abwechslungsreiche Projekterfahrungen beim größten Automobilhersteller der Welt, internationale und strategische Business Intelligence Projekte, innovative Arbeitsmethoden und umfassende Fortbildungsmöglichkeiten.Unser Aufgabenbereich ist die Analyse der Systeme im gesamten Einkauf des Volkswagen Konzerns. Zudem unterstützen wir weitere Bereiche bei ihren Business Intelligence Analysen. In all unseren Projekten nutzen wir dabei Data Analytics Tools wie SQL, Python etc.Unser Team im Bereich Business Intelligence sucht Unterstützung durch einen BI Spezialisten (m/w/d) wie Dich. Nutz Deine Chance und bewirb dich jetzt!   Ihre Aufgaben im Detail   Als Business Intelligence Specialist (m/w/d) bist Du für die fachliche Konzeption für BI-Anforderungen und Beratung bei der Weiterentwicklung der internen BI-Lösungen zuständig.   Die Erstellung von Analysen und Auswertungen aus dem Einkauf Data Warehouse und weiteren Quellen gehören zu Deinem Aufgabenbereich.   Kundenspezifischen Analysen und Auswertungen baust Du auf und setzt sie um.   Du veröffentlichst und dokumentierst Berichte im Volkswagen Portal.  Eigenständig pflegst Du die Metadaten, prüfst die Datenqualität und betreust allgemein das Berichtswesen.  Die Anwendung von SQL, Tableau und PowerBI als Power-User im Frontend-Reporting führst Du ebenfalls durch.   Ihr Profil    Du verfügst über ein Studium im Bereich Informatik, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.  Hast Du bereits einschlägige Erfahrung im BI-Umfeld sowie in der Projektarbeit und im Projektmanagement sammeln können? Cool!   Du bringst Erfahrung in der Arbeit mit SQL-basierten Datenbanken mit.   Im Rahmen deiner Laufbahn hast du Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von PowerBI, Tableau, QlikView, oder alternativ auch anderen BI-Lösungen gesammelt.  Hast Du Kenntnisse in der Durchführung von Datenanalysen und mit ETL - das wäre top, ist aber kein Muss!  Deine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit, strukturierte Arbeitsweise sowie Deine sehr guten analytischen Fähigkeiten zeichnen Dich aus.

job_description: Localisation :  Nantes   Métier :  Data   Contrat :  CDI      TRAVAILLER CHEZ ALTECA       Chez Alteca le management de proximité, le bien-être et l'évolution de nos collaborateurs sont des priorités qui nous permettent, chaque jour, de proposer la meilleure expertise possible à nos clients.    Et c'est grâce à ces convictions, que nous sommes aujourd'hui référencés auprès de partenaires grands comptes dans les secteurs de la Banque, de l'Assurance ou encore de la Distribution.      ________________________________        >  En tant que  Data Analyst (H/F),  tu seras rattaché(e) au  Pôle Data  de notre Agence nantaise .  Ton Manager sera Olivier, Directeur de l'Agence de Nantes, où l'un(e) de ses référent(e)s techniques.  Interlocuteur(trice) privilégié(e) , il/elle assurera ton  intégration  durant tes trois premiers mois dans l'entreprise, ta montée en compétences, tes  points de suivi  tout au long de tes missions et tes  Entretiens Annuels .      >  Tu auras également accès à une  communauté technique d'experts  grâce aux nombreux  Webinar  organisés tout au long de l'année, tu pourras aussi participer aux  projets de notre Centre de R&D  ou encore assister aux  MID'INNO  (présentations de nos collaborateurs sur des thématiques données comme la Green Tech, l'IA...).      >  Rejoindre ALTECA c'est aussi rejoindre une entreprise engagée sur la RSE (labellisée  Ecovadis Silver 2022 ), pour le bien-être de ses salariés (labellisée  HappyAtWork  pour la 5ème année consécutive), et dans la formation de ses stagiaires et alternants (labellisée  HappyTrainees  pour la 3ème année consécutive).      TES MISSIONS      En coordination avec les équipes d'un de nos clients grands comptes, tes missions seront les suivantes   :       Comprendre les enjeux du client.    Challenger les demandes des équipes métiers.    Recueillir et valoriser la donnée  dans le/les domaines métiers sur lesquels vous intervenez (assurer la fiabilité et la qualité des données, nettoyer et préparer les données...).   Structurer et exploiter les données grâce à la Data visualisation.    Analyser ces données  et faire des recommandations pertinentes pour faciliter les prises de décisions du client/des métiers.      La majeure partie des projets de nos clients sont sur des  environnements techniques récents  (Python, R, Power BI, BO, Talend, écosystème Big Data : Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Scala...) et en méthodologie Agile Scrum.    ________________________________        PROFIL RECHERCHÉ       Ton profil :  diplômé(e) d'un Bac+5 dans le domaine de la Data (Université ou Ecole d'Ingénieur), tu as au moins 3 ans d'expérience sur un poste similaire et tu sais évoluer en environnement Agile.      Ta personnalité :  tu es une personne organisée, rigoureux(se), force de proposition, tu disposes d'un bon relationnel et tu aimes le travail en équipe. Tu apprécies et contribues à développer un contexte de travail bienveillant et qui favorise le partage de connaissances. Enfin, tu sais aussi être force de proposition sur les améliorations qualités à apporter.      Type de contrat proposé :  temps plein |  Niveau de poste :  confirmé    ________________________________        PROCESS DE RECRUTEMENT       ν  Alexandra ou une personne de l'équipe recrutement IDF / Nord-Ouest te contactera pour un premier échange téléphonique, puis elle te recevra dans le cadre d'un  entretien RH .      ν  Si cet entretien est validé, tu rencontreras alors Olivier, Directeur de l'Agence de Nantes, pour un  entretien technique.     ________________________________        NOS AVANTAGES       Transport  pris en charge à  75% | Tickets resto  pris en charge à  60% | Mutuelle  prise en charge à  60%       10 jours de RTT en plus des 25 jours de CP |  Mode de travail :  hybride | Accès au CSE (billetterie, voyages...)      Des parcours de formations personnalisés  (75% de nos collaborateurs ont suivis au moins 1 formation en 2022)      En tant que signataire de la charte de diversité en entreprise, Alteca favorise un environnement de travail inclusif et respectueux de tous. A compétences égales, tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap.       Votre chance c'est votre talent, la nôtre c'est de le développer : rejoignez-nous !

title: Product Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Статистическое моделирование, Моделирование данных, +8 more
job_description: At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. We offer hundreds of thousands of audiobooks and ebooks to customers in more than 27+ markets, with several new markets launching in the coming year. Storytel is Northern Europe's largest audiobook streaming service and we’re now looking for a Product Data Analyst to join the team! Storytel’s vision is to make the world a more empathic and creative place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed anytime, anywhere by anyone.   About The Team   As a Product Data Analyst, you will belong to the Analytics team who is responsible for delivering insights to the entire Storytel organization. We combine technical and statistical skills with business acumen and tailored communication to drive change at Storytel, using data. Our stakeholders work in domains ranging from product development and content management to business strategy and marketing.  Our technology stack is built on top of Google Cloud Platform and includes but is not limited to BigQuery (SQL), Looker and Jupyter Notebooks/Python.   About The Role   As a Product Data Analyst at Storytel you will have the opportunity to provide the organization with actionable insights to facilitate decision-making and enable commercial opportunities. End-to-end responsibility ranges from problem articulation, preparing & structuring of underlying data assets, analysis & data visualization as well as communication of final recommendations to business stakeholders. You master the intersection of traits such as statistical understanding, programming, presentation and people skills. You will also have the opportunity to be an internal data ambassador and upskill business stakeholders in order to grow data literacy at Storytel.   Some Other Things You Will Do Is    Use data to enable Product Team decisions  Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for a given product team  Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas  Give concrete product recommendations in the relevant Product Team, based on insights from analyses and experiments  Manage working with different Product Teams, enabling their analyses while prioritising your work and effectively managing your time and their expectations   Ensure that the product team understands and have access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.  Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments     About You   To be successful in this role we believe that you have:   Experience working in SQL and Python (including pandas and data visualization packages)  Sound knowledge of conducting experiments (A/B testing) and implementing appropriate analyses (this includes an understanding of relevant statistics concepts)  Exposure to working with digital consumer-facing products, especially a streaming service is a plus  Experience with Looker is a plus  Analytical thinking and curiosity - we want you to feel comfortable exploring data and finding potential opportunities for improvement  Independent and self-driven - to be able to support multiple product teams we need you to be motivated and comfortable working independently     And for some bonus points if you have    Experience in the GCP tool stack (Looker, BigQuery, etc.)  Experience with data modelling and engineering procedures  Experience with statistical modelling  Experience in applying Machine Learning techniques to solve business problems  Experience with the modern data stack and ecosystem     What We Offer   At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy. We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities when possible and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in.  Storytel’s culture encourages self-leadership, innovation, collaboration – and our employees share a common passion for high-quality content and stories. There is a strong emphasis on continuous development, learning through experimentation and actively sharing feedback to constantly improve performance.  Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. We like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterized by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it. And of course - you get unlimited listening to audio and ebooks from our service!  Does this sound like you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, please submit your application in English and we will contact you as soon as possible.

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: NumPy, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: Our Vision  FLYR Labs is focused on the relentless application of advanced and intuitive technologies that help transportation leaders unlock their ultimate potential.  Starting with airlines, we provide the Revenue Operating System that reshapes how travel and transportation businesses plan their commercial operation. We displace legacy data, forecasting, pricing, and reporting solutions with a single enterprise SaaS platform that leverages the latest advancements in deep learning, cloud computing, and user experience.  Our hyper-accurate contextual forecasts enable the most effective scheduling, marketing, and leadership decisions while directly managing the pricing for billions of dollars worth of product and revenue.  Flight Itinerary (About The Role)  We’re looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our leading-edge, enterprise customer implementation team. This team delights new customers throughout the onboarding process, applying best-in-class AI solutions that revolutionize their revenue operations. The Data Analyst will play a key role in ensuring our customers see rapid time-to-value, applying her or his technical expertise to build, implement and maintain complex and performant models.   What Your Journey Will Look Like (Responsibilities)    Influence the strategic evolution of our real-time predictive models that will revolutionize revenue operations for the transportation industry.  Deploy and iterate on scalable practices for model evolution, evaluation, and productization.  Engage directly with customers through presentations, ad hoc touch-points, Q&A, and explanation of model performance and behaviors.  Own responsibility for highly technical tasks and ensure successful project execution.  Collaborate closely with FLYR’s Data Platform team to communicate opportunities for tool improvements and to share learnings and best practices.  On-call support during project go-live.     What To Pack For This Trip (Qualifications)    Advanced SQL - You know your way around analytical and aggregate functions, complex joins, window functions, and are confident in wrangling all types of data in SQL.  Strong Python skills - You are well-versed in common data science libraries such as Pandas and NumPy but are also able to write basic Python code that is clean, well-documented and tested.  Experience working with large datasets for ETL activities; experience with task orchestration tools like Cloud Composer, Airflow and DBT are a plus.  You are highly curious and willing to dive into data to uncover the truth and discover actionable insights. You are always asking relevant questions and you know how to find answers within data.  You are a strong communicator and team player and have experience collaborating across multiple teams and external partners.  Experience with data visualization (Tableau, Looker, etc.) and cloud computing platforms (GCP, etc.) is a plus.  You have 3+ years of experience tackling similar problems academically and/or professionally and a proven history of delivering results.    First-Class Amenities   A commitment to your career by keeping the conversation central to your growth  Dedicated learning and support to stimulate your growth  Become a shareholder of FLYR and share in our success  We are dedicated and devoted to our shared success as we are offering permanent contracts right from the start  You can take 25 days off to provide you with time to recharge your batteries  Not a morning person? We provide flexible work hours for you to be at your best  Hybrid working philosophy - work from the office and work from home in agreement with your manager  A modern office in the heart of Amsterdam with rental e-bikes and stocked with snacks and beverages, lunch reimbursements, social events and Friday drinks  Top quality tech equipment so you can be at your best  Discounts and budget to keep you healthy and fit!    Our Commitment to Equality  Here at FLYR, we’re committed to growing with intention, having our teams better reflect the world around us. We strive to create an environment of inclusion and even more importantly, belonging, where psychological safety, empathy, and human connection are at the center of our leadership principles. Not only does this enable us to create better products and have a better work environment, it’s good for the bottom line and it’s the right thing to do.  FLYR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, genetics, marital or veteran status. In addition to federal law requirements, FLYR complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates.  Privacy Policy  All applicants, including those based in California or the EU, are encouraged to review our Privacy and Cookie Policy.

job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               Taken en verantwoordelijkheden    Samsonite Europe aims to provide a great online experience! Join the digital team and become part of an industry-leading luggage brand.     This is a position within our E-Commerce & Digital Marketing department. If you love creating data-driven decisions to drive an excellent customer experience for several Samsonite brands (Samsonite, American Tourister, Lipault, Gregory), we want you on our team! The role requires someone who is self-motivated with a cutting-edge attitude and loves data.     As a digital data analyst you will help our organization to make data-driven decisions the norm. You will create a culture that encourages critical thinking and curiosity and ensures that our decisions, from the tactical to the strategic, are always supported by data. You will relieve all the pains in the user journeys, maximize conversion and engagement rates across all our digital channels.     Reporting to the Digital Marketing Manager, you will be part of a young and dynamic Digital team and have the possibility to interact with many other departments as country teams or the Brand marketing teams.      Key Responsibilities      HELP US MAKE DATA-DRIVEN DECISIONS      Work with business stakeholders and ensure that they can make data-driven decisions  Translate business objectives into measurable KPIs both in the context of projects and for daily activities  Make data transparent for your stakeholders to support their strategic decisions. Collect, analyze and visualize data within a digital omnichannel context  Create and automate digital reporting and manage the quality of the data and reports   Ensure continuous improvement of both the methodology and the dashboards and data themselves with a view to refining insights  Train, support and advise business stakeholders on the preparation of simple digital analytics reports, the formulation of business requirements and the interpretation of digital analytics reports  Always on the lookout for improvements and make recommendations in this respect  Work closely with various internal teams to provide a coherent picture of the digital 'end-to-end' customer experience and the digital path the customer follows  Proactively monitor data to identify pain points and suggest improvements  Enable business stakeholders to analyze digital customer behavior across all digital touchpoints  You aggregate and organize data from different sources (Google Analytics, search, advertising, big query, CRM, Salesforce, Content square etc.)     Profiel kandidaat     Applicants Should Ideally       Have several years of experience in digital (customer) data analysis.  Have knowledge/experience of digital marketing, e-commerce and e-care, including web analytics, social media and conversion marketing.  Have experience with the use of analytical tools (Google analytics, Big Query, Datastudio, Similarweb, Salesforce, Content square...).  Knowledge of tag management is a strong asset.  Be fluent in PowerPoint and Excel and have a basic knowledge of web technologies.  Have good analytical skills. You are a critical thinker and a good problem solver.  Be a real team player who can work well with colleagues from different teams, both from a business and a more technical background.  Have strong communication and presentation skills. You love to make data transparent for business and enjoy taking on less experienced colleagues.  Be willing to further develop skills in a team-oriented, fast-changing environment.  Be fluent in English (Dutch or French is an asset).  Have the ability to multitask.  Be intensely passionate to helping us grow our digital footprint.  Embrace new, digital media technologies and capabilities     Geboden wordt   Next to this challenging role, we also offer a very attractive compensation package, including an excellent pension scheme, a competitive group insurance, lunch vouchers and extra holidays.   We are committed to a diverse and vibrant culture, welcoming people from all walks of life. Our long-standing commitment to diversity and inclusion empowers each of us to bring our authentic selves and unique differences to work every day. title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Python, +8 more
job_description: About MAG (in brief!)        At MAG Interactive we make mobile games. We are so lucky to work in such a fun industry! Our games have been downloaded more than 350 million times all over the world.     We put our success down to the awesome people who work here and we hope you'll want to come and join the family!      The role - Data Analyst      You will help us to continue to make best use of the huge amount of player data we have, to improve our games and to help our teams make better decisions. With more than 2 million data points collected every minute, there’s a vast amount of data to play with!     This is a really impactful role here and through your careful data analysis you will help to shape our games!     You will be responsible for maintaining, designing and implementing data pipelines and dashboards for our games. You will build strong relationships with the product teams and our game designers where you will delve into the data to help them to understand the players, while also helping to provide insights to impact the game and its economy.     You will also conduct research into how we can leverage our rich data collection to add value to the business as a whole.      The team      The team is growing, but it is currently made up of 6 team members, a mix of data engineers and data analysts.      What you’ll be doing       Collaborate with product teams to set up in-game tracking, identify tracking issues and leverage tracking data analytics to provide insights.  Act as the liaison between product, game developers and data engineers to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.  Work together with key stakeholders and the game teams to optimize game economy, evaluate game performance and offer suggestions accordingly.  Work with the game teams to provide insight into player behaviour using data collected from users and games to answer key business questions.  Build automated dashboards and reports to facilitate company-wide awareness and understanding of key business metrics and players’ experience.  Identify errors and solve issues to ensure delivery of accurate metrics related to retention, monetization and user acquisition.  Ensure we continue to collect and document appropriate data.  Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis to identify strategies to improve engagement, retention and monetization.  Develop methodologies to improve the in-game user experience such as predicting when users are likely to perform certain actions, churn or monetize.  Manage multiple projects at a time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment.       Your skills/experience       Excellent SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets. You would consider SQL to be your bread and butter!  Experience delivering clean, accurate and understandable data reports, visualization and dashboards.  You have experience with visualisation tools such as; Tableau, Looker or PowerBI.  Prior experience performing quantitative analysis.  High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail.  You are curious and driven to discover the underlying explanations of things!          Nice to have (but not essential)       Proficiency in relevant scripting language(s), e.g. Python, R  True passion for understanding users' social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity  An understanding of mobile game/app KPIs and the rationale and calculation behind them       Perks and Benefits         Generous company bonus  Company mobile phone and contract  Favorable pension and private health insurance package  Flexible work hours  Seasonal kick-offs  Gym allowance  Generous learning and development budget  Monthly After works  Enhanced parental leave  Company wide carbon off-setting and CSR initiatives  Free Swedish lessons (if you wish to learn the language!)       At MAG, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated and empowered to bring their true selves to work!       Our recruitment processes are designed to prevent bias and discrimination against people regardless of; gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, or any other aspect.       About MAG      We are MAG Interactive – a leading mobile developer and publisher of casual mobile games built on a wealth of creativity and passion. We thrive on creating quality experiences that make our players want to come back for more. And Players agree! Combined, the Company’s games have been downloaded more than 350 million times. We create a good times factory with a global reach that continues to grow.     We are all part of a creative, positive and trusting environment where everyone has a sense of ownership over their activities and pride in their work. This open and collaborative working culture at MAG is key to our ability to continuously create top notch games.  Every game released from MAG Interactive has reached a multi-million player base and reached the #1 position in its category in a large number of countries. Our games have been selected Best of Google Play, Best Of App Store by Apple and have reached the #1 word game spot in over 100 countries.

job_description: Descrizione azienda    Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.   Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Posizione    Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.    Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.   Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.    Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?    Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?     realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.     Requisiti   Sei tu la persona giusta?   Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. title: Data Analyst (Engineer)

job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Developing documentation and data governance  Owning the entire ETL process  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge     Nice to have    Advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: Life is full of risks, from unexpected hurricanes to earthquakes, terrorism to cybercrime, always ending up with financial impacts. They can't be controlled but can be managed. Join Aon to help our clients manage these risks in the world of reinsurance. Currently we are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to work in our analytical hub for CEE (Central and Eastern Europe) and MENA (Middle-East North Africa) based in Prague (Czech Republic).     What The Day Will Look Like       Proactively connecting with colleagues across the region to understand and validate the data  Producing data analysis and reports for internal and external clients  Performing technical analysis and getting an innovative insight into insurance/reinsurance companies, their portfolios and reinsurance contracts  Building and maintaining dashboards and analyses using data visualisation tools  Participating to the united effort to improve data management       Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success       Bachelor's degree in the fields of IT / Mathematics / Statistics / Economics  Fluency in English  Computer literate including knowledge of Microsoft Excel and if possible Tableau  Communicative and open to new challenges  Knowledge of the insurance or reinsurance industry appreciated       How This Opportunity Is Different     This is an exciting and varied role in the very international reinsurance industry. You will be provided with training to the world of reinsurance and our analytical methods, including Tableau. It is a superb opportunity to work for us, a global leader with a large data access. Competitive salary and attractive compensation package awaits you, including pension scheme contributions, language courses and high quality working conditions in our modern offices in the city center of Prague.     How We Support Our Colleagues     In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two “Global Wellbeing Days” each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognize that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!   Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.   Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.   Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, domestic partner status, or other legally protected status. job_description: Company Description    We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.    Job Description    Verisk ISO in Krakow is a team of over 50 passionate analysts.  We work on various Insurance Data Analytics projects. We keep developing new solutions for our clients and collaborate closely with our international colleagues. We work with analytic products at various stages of data lifecycle (planning, collecting, processing, analyzing, publishing).  Our managers (quite a big team now: Kasia, Marek, Alina, Jola, Ola, Aparslan and Agnieszka, Asia) are looking now to grow this amazing group of analysts. We hire people with broad analytical skillset with innovative mindset, who are ready to continue or start their career in data analytics.    Qualifications     Knowledge of Excel and SQL  Nice to have one of following: Python / VBA/ Power Query  Attention to detail to follow elaborate instructions and to spot even little differences in data.   If you are looking to change your career into Data Analytics, do not hesitate to apply! We will have a conversation around your interests and skills and discuss what would be the best position for you.    Additional Information    In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.  For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.  Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.  Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.    Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other   Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes   Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries    Verisk Businesses   Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision  Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences  Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient  Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.  Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance  Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement   Life Insurance Solutions  – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.  Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.   Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product,  Proton Mail , is now the world’s largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as  Proton VPN ,  Proton Calendar , and  Proton Drive , give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.   Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times , some of the world’s largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.   Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world’s most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.    Purpose of the role    We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.    What You Will Do      Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data  Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources  Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization  Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format  Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated  Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit  Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units      Job Requirements      Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.  Strong analytical skills  Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics  at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field  Advanced knowledge of SQL  Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau  Good knowledge of Python is a plus  Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas      Why should you join Proton?      Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.  Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world’s top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.  Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.  Grow with us - We’re one of Europe’s fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.  Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else’s problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.  Benefits – these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.     Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.
