job_description: SumUp is a digital ecosystem dedicated to local entrepreneurs. Our range of solutions answers all our merchants' challenges; from reservations, through click and collect, deliveries and digital payment, to the management of their business thanks to intuitive and comprehensive financial analytics.  In SumUp POS, we are creating the world’s most complete Point of Sale, for all merchants in all businesses. We take care of the details so that merchants can focus on what they do best. We help merchants better connect to their business, to their customers and to each other.  SumUp POS offers more than a cash register, it offers an innovative ecosystem where our POS Tribe of over 400 people in Paris, Milan, Barcelona, Germany and the UK are working hard to go as far as possible and become the European leader in our market.   What you’ll do:     Build clear product KPIs and data models to help measure the effectiveness of our product strategies in achieving overall business goals  Empower our product lifecycle from ideation to launch with data-driven insights, quantitative analyses, actionable recommendations and other ad hoc support  Generate reports, dashboards, presentations etc. to nurture a data-driven community  Build and maintain a strong communication network with Product, Engineering, Data Platform & Commercial stakeholders     Previous experience:      5+ years of experience in a similar role working with Product & Engineering  Experience with Segment and Google Analytics (or similar product analytics tool)  Experience in designing and analyzing experiments (A/B tests)  Experience with Snowflake, BigQuery, or similar   Great visualisation skills, ideally with Tableau  Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple priorities and roadmapStrong SQL and data modelisation skills, with Dbt a big plus     Why you should join SumUp:     Have full autonomy (for real!) to propose, lead and implement changes that will up our game.  You will have the freedom to drive your career, own projects and make an impact across the company.  An amazing team and work environment that works with passion and purpose to achieve incredible results.  We get together regularly for breakfasts, team events, office parties and sports.    Additional Information 💫   Start date: as soon as possible  Full-time  Work office location(s) - Hybrid, based from Paris, Barcelona, London, Milan  Remote working: Yes - need to be based in country Location    Meet us! 💬   Recruiter Interview - 30 Minutes  VP Product Exec Interview - 45 Minutes  Analytics Lead - 45 Minutes  Test - with restitution to the product analyst pool   Bar Raiser Interview - 45 Minutes     About SumUp   We believe in the everyday hero.  Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founders mentality and a 'team-first’ attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.   SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.    Job Application Tip   We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Business Data Analyst-(H/F)
company_name: Societe Generale Corporate and Investment Banking - SGCIB
skills: Skills: VBA, Commerce, +8 more
job_description: 23000EBY     Vos missions au quotidien    Vous souhaitez mettre vos compétences data au service de la performance de l’entreprise dans le domaine bancaire ? Alors rejoignez-nous !   Dans le pôle Global Banking and Investors Solutions, la ligne métier PCM est en charge de la commercialisation et de la création de solutions de Payment et de Cash Management pour la clientèle Corporate, en France et à l’international. Vous participerez aux travaux de conception et développement d’outils de pilotage de la performance financière et commerciale (performance passée et prévisions), et analyses des données.   Concrètement, vous serez amené(e) à :   Intéragir avec le management, notamment la direction commerciale, pour comprendre les besoins de pilotage, et proposer des outils pour y répondre,  Développer et tester :   Des outils permettant de calculer et restituer les KPI / tableaux de bords définis sur la performance passée,  Des outils permettant de fournir des prévisions sur la valeur de KPIs financiers et / ou commerciaux sur la base des données passées et des anticipations macro-économiques définies par la banque,   Contribuer aux premières analyses de données,  Vous formez le métier à l’usage des outils et vous rédigez la documentation (utilisateur et technique) pour transférer l’exploitation des outils / modèles que vous aurez créés.       Et si c’était vous ?      Vous êtes étudiant(e) de niveau Bac +4/5 en école de commerce, d’ingénieur ou université avec une spécialité en Fiance/Data/Développement,  Vous êtes attiré(e) par le domaine de la finance, la data et le développement d’outils,  Vous savez développer avec Excel, VBA et Python,  Une maîtrise de Power BI et / ou Knime est un plus,  Vous avez le sens du travail en équipe, le sens de la relation client et faîtes preuve d'adaptabilité et de flexibilité,  You're fluent in english ? Vous êtes le(a) candidat(e) idéal(e) !       Plus qu’un poste, un tremplin    Dès votre arrivée, vous serez intégré(e) dans nos équipes et apprendrez chaque jour aux côtés de nos experts qui vous accompagneront dans vos missions. Progressivement, vous gagnerez en autonomie sur vos projets pour faire de cette expérience un vrai accélérateur de carrière. Vous découvrirez également toute la diversité de nos métiers, dans un secteur qui évolue et innove en permanence.   En tant que stagiaire, vous pourrez bénéficier de jours de télétravail selon le rythme de votre service, d’une prise en charge de 50% de votre titre de transport et de la billetterie à prix réduits de notre Comité d’Entreprise (concerts, cinéma, sport…). Lors de votre présence sur site, vous accéderez à une offre variée de restaurants d’entreprise et de caféterias à un tarif très compétitif.   A la fin de vos études, diverses opportunités pourront s’offrir à vous, en France et à l’international.     Pourquoi nous choisir ?    Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.   Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir.   Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partis de notre ADN. Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !   Vous hésitez encore ?   Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent s’engager quelques jours par an pour des actions de solidarité sur leur temps de travail : parrainer des personnes en difficulté dans leur orientation ou leur insertion professionnelle, participer à l’éducation financière de jeunes en apprentissage ou encore partager leurs compétences avec une association. Les formats d’engagement sont multiples.   Nous sommes un  employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances  et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à  promouvoir tous les talents , quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, parentalité, origine ethnique, nationalité, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

job_description: With over 6 million users and an impressive 4,000 new customers joining every day, Lydia aims to become one of Europe’s leading financial services organizations. Founded in 2013, Lydia has been recognized as one of France’s most promising start-ups through its inclusion into the "Next 40" ranking and its recent “Unicorn” status.     After raising $103 million from investors in 2021, we have plans to accelerate our international deployment while continuing to offer additional innovative solutions in Europe. From top-security contactless mobile payment to a wide array of app-based services, Lydia puts its clients at the center of the digital experience.     Part of our growth strategy is centered around attracting top talent to help us nurture our ongoing success. We are now looking for our new Data Analyst / Analytics Engineer.  Reporting to our Product Vertical Lead, you will join the Branking User Experience team with mission to leverage the different data collected by Lydia to help your team to make accurate and informed decisions. Challenge A/B tools to optimize and drive future product developments.  Perform market activity analysis and any other analytics that would help guide product and business decision making.  Construct specialized data models based on product needs and business requirements.  Contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data Products by ensuring reliability and consistency of all the data we collect.         You are in the right place if :      You hold a Master’s degree in Business or Engineering from a top-tier institution;  You have first experience in Data Analytics, preferably in a start-up environment;  You are fully-proficient in SQL and data visualization tools;  You are comfortable working with large datasets and write complex SQL queries;  You have strong analytical skills and a problem-solving mindset;  You are a team player with a marked ability to start and lead new projects by yourself;  You have excellent written and spoken communication skills in English;  You are passionate about building Tech Products that can have an impact on people’s daily life, and a strong interest in FinTech.         Oh and by the way, here’s the Data stack in place today :      Storage and Processing: Big Query / MariaDB  Transformation: Airflow  BI Tool: Metabase  Product Analytics Tool: Amplitude         Recruitment Process :      Phone interview with our Talent Acquisition Recruiter  Phone interview with the Squad Manager  Home-assignment: technical and analytical test  Physical Interview with the Squad Manager & a member of the team               *  Job is opened to Lydia’s Paris French office    At Lydia, we believe that diversity is a strength. Diversity is part of our culture and identity. We want to create an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value to the company. Lydia is therefore proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. job_description: Company Description    We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.    Job Description    Verisk ISO in Krakow is a team of over 50 passionate analysts.  We work on various Insurance Data Analytics projects. Depending on the team we are using SQL, Python or R. We keep developing new solutions for our clients and collaborate closely with our international colleagues. We work with analytic products at various stages of data lifecycle (planning, collecting, processing, analyzing, publishing).  Our managers (quite a big team now: Kasia, Marek, Alina, Jola, Ola, Aparslan and Agnieszka) are looking now to grow this amazing group of analysts. We hire people with broad analytical skillset with innovative mindset, who are ready to continue or start their career in data analytics.    For One Of Our Teams We Are Looking For a Person, Who Will Be Working On Improving Processes Using Mainly SQL, Python And VBA And     Automating office applications (Access, Excel, Word, Outlook) with Python and VBA  Data extraction, loading, transformation and verification.  Working with cloud-based database solutions.     Qualifications     Experience/Knowledge of SQL, Python and VBA (junior/mid level)  Nice to have: experience/knowledge of implementing SQL and VBA solutions to Python code.  Must have: attention to detail to follow elaborate instructions and to spot even little differences in data.  Nice too have: experience in following Python libraries:   Pandas  NumPy  Requests  Win32    Additional Information    In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.  For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.  Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale. We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.  Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.    Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other   Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes   Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries    Verisk Businesses   Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision  Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences  Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient  Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.  Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance  Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement   Life Insurance Solutions  – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.  Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger  Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.  All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.  http://www.verisk.com/careers.html  Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

We are a dynamic and forward-thinking consultancy firm that operates across a wide range of industries, creating solutions that are tailored to specific needs. We bring long-lasting impact and growth to our partners and clients.   With our multidisciplinary teams we create bold strategies and innovative solutions that are tailored to our client’s needs and help them capitalizing opportunities. What You Will Do       Performing data analysis in the field of Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM analytics, and/or Risk analytics  Analyses conducted in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.  Communicating analyses via compelling presentations  Solving problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis  Preparing and facilitating workshops  Managing stakeholders and communicating with executives      What you’ll bring        0 - 2 years of professional work experience in the analytics domain  An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g. mathematics, computer programming, etc.)  An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis  Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. title: Junior Data Analist
skills: Skills: Python, Финансовая математика, +8 more
job_description: Note: This position requires an excellent command of the Dutch language.       Junior Data Analist   Jij zit als Junior Data Analist uitstekend op je plek bij BrightStone Group omdat je dát juist het liefste doet: waarde toevoegen door creatieve oplossingen te bedenken en data inzichtelijk te maken voor jouw collega’s. Jij automatiseert routinematige werkzaamheden 1.000 keer liever dan ze te accepteren als terugkerende handelingen. Jij hebt kennis opgedaan in programmeren en weet de toegevoegde waarde van machine learning algoritmen te benoemen. Jij en je team leren liever elke dag nieuwe dingen.      Ben jij nieuwsgierig? Mooi!   Werken bij BrightStone Group is op ontdekkingsreis gaan: altijd op zoek naar nieuwe bestemmingen en nieuwe oplossingen. En het mooie is: jouw rugzak met kennis, ervaringen en vaardigheden wordt gedurende die reis alleen maar waardevoller. Vallen, opstaan, fouten maken, daarvan leren, het hoort er allemaal bij. Groeien, leren en presteren in onze projectteams, vaak opdrachten voor banken en andere grote financiële instellingen. Die kans grijp je natuurlijk met beide handen aan als Junior Data Analist bij BrightStone Group. Wij werken alleen met enthousiaste, kritische teamspelers die informatie(stromen) analyseren én doorgronden. Zo lever jij met jouw team topkwaliteit en word je elke dag beter.      Wat ga je doen?    Verzamelen, structureren en controleren van data. Altijd met het doel: hoe kunnen we daar nog meer impact mee maken?  Verder helpen van onze organisatie, door nog slimmer, beter, sneller of gewoon anders data te benutten of te combineren;  Ontwikkelen van datamodellen en bijdragen aan datavisualisatie. Hoe complex ook, jij maakt het inzichtelijk;  Schrijven van rapportages waarin je de bevindingen uit je onderzoek opneemt;  Onderzoeken en stroomlijnen van diverse processen;  Geven van advies aan senior management. Jouw werk maakt verschil en doet er echt toe.       Hier mag je op rekenen    Een brutomaandsalaris van minimaal € 2.800 tot maximaal € 3.400;  Een uitdagend tailor made leerpad;  1-op-1-begeleiding en career counseling door een fieldmanager;  Toegang tot de Bright Academy en een online leeromgeving.  22,5 vakantiedagen op basis van 36 uur.       Dit neem je mee    Ten minste een hbo- of wo-opleiding, bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Quantitative Finance, Computer Science, Econometrie, Wiskunde of een vergelijkbare studie;  Ervaring met data modellering, procesoptimalisatie, visualisatie tooling en het verkrijgen van praktische inzichten;  Een sterk analytisch vermogen. Daarnaast ben je pragmatisch en creatief;  Interesse in (complexe) datavraagstukken;  Basiskennis van ten minste 1 programmeertaal, zoals Python, SQL of R.      Heb je vragen of wil je meer weten over deze vacature?  Hamce Adam kan jou op weg helpen via hamce.adam@brightstonegroup.nl

job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights  Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge  Previous experience in the financial/banking industry     Nice to have    Advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming  Experience in Accounting    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: Descripción de la empresa        ¿Quiénes somos?    Firma española de consultoría tecnológica con más de 300 profesionales con perfil multidisciplinar, de altísimo rendimiento, titulados superiores y presencia en toda España (8 oficinas). Las claves del éxito de nuestro modelo de Compañía son: profesionalidad y rigor, orientación al cliente, uso de todo tipo de tecnologías, innovación para construir soluciones diferenciales en el mercado, experiencia (grupo con más de 20 años trabajando juntos, caso único en el mercado), sentido práctico y máximo compromiso con nuestros proyectos, clientes y equipos.       ¿Qué te ofrecemos?    Proyectos funcional y tecnológicamente atractivos (intensivos en el uso del dato extremo a extremo), carrera profesional y seguimiento personalizado de tu evolución (nunca serás un número), buen ambiente de trabajo y entusiasmo por crecer conjuntamente (el profesional y la Firma) en una Compañía entre las 100 Compañías TIC más grandes de España y en proceso continuo de expansión (diez años seguidos creciendo a doble dígito).       ¿Qué te proporcionamos desde el primer día?    • Heterogeneidad de proyectos y tecnologías.  • Integración en un equipo de profesionales con amplia experiencia en el mercado.  • Oportunidad única de participar en una Firma en continuo crecimiento.  • Aprendizaje acelerado y desarrollo continuo de competencias.  • Buen ambiente de trabajo y un entorno orientado a la innovación continua.  • Buenas condiciones laborales: flexibilidad en la incorporación (inmediata o a convenir), contrato indefinido, retribución en función de experiencia, subidas salariales semestrales…      Descripción del puesto          ¿Qué buscamos?            Recién titulados o con una experiencia de hasta tres años en Ingeniería Informática, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones, Matemáticas, Estadística, Ciencias Físicas, Computación, etc.  Se valorarán conocimientos en bases de datos.  Actitud positiva y mentalidad innovadora: ilusión por aprender y desarrollar una carrera profesional en consultoría; ganas de "disfrutar" trabajando en un entorno distinto; capacidad de compromiso con los compañeros, con los proyectos y con los clientes.

title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Marketing
skills: None
job_description: Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.  A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.  Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.  At Vinted, marketing is one of the most impactful channels to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. As a Digital Marketing Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, e-commerce, and consulting apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. In this team we develop statistical models and KPIs to understand the performance of paid digital and influencer marketing as well as run AB tests to fine tune CRM messages to our customers. We are developing front end tracking in order to understand our organic marketing (SEO and ASO) impact. Finally, we look after the marketing data pipelines and data structures to ensure the best analytics performance, accurate data, and GDPR compliant set up. You will have plenty of independence to show your talent but at the same time all the support from the team, the DSA guild, and your lead that you may need. You will be crucial in moving millions of people to the path of sustainable consumption.  Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:   Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.   Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.   Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.      In this position, you’ll:    Analyse how a multitude of paid and unpaid marketing channels drive user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue  Support sustainable growth of Vinted by helping to understand organic marketing (SEO and ASO) impact on customer acquisition and engagement  Help to set up, analyse, and interpret marketing CRM AB tests  Develop marketing KPIs to track campaign and overall business performance  Build impactful visualisations that can drive marketing investment decisions  Pitch your findings to your team and marketing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success  Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation  Help with ad-hoc requests (data questions and consultations, data bugs, analyses, etc.)     About you:    Experience in statistical modelling and hypothesis testing  Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R) and fluency with SQL   Experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)  Understanding of marketing tracking and performance measurement in a privacy focussed environment  Highly business-results oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem solving  A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences  Collaborative team player who can build relationships across the company  Adaptable to changing environment and love learning and developing  Exceptionally attentive to details  Excellent written and spoken English  Extensive data science / analytical / BI or similar work experience     Bonus if you have any of the following:    Strong domain knowledge in digital marketing data  Knowledge of Scala and understanding of Git   Econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)    Work perks:   Opportunity to join our share options programme  Learning budget (10% from gross yearly salary)   30 working days of holiday   Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic  Frequent team-building events  A personal budget for shopping on Vinted  A daily allowance for ordering lunch  Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year and up to 21 days outside the EU  Dog-friendly office  Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget of 540 for home workplace furniture)    We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.  Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.  The salary range for this position is 51,000 - 82,000 EUR GROSS / year.  If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

title: (Junior) Consumer Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
company_field: Retail Health and Personal Care Products
skills: Skills: Маркетинговые исследования, Панель управления, +8 more
job_description: Job Description      Johnson & Johnson New Planned Consumer Health Company,   based in Skillman, N.J., is one of the world's largest consumer health and personal care products company. Our consumer companies produce many of the world's most trusted brands, among them JOHNSON'S® Baby, BAND-AID®, NEUTROGENA®, TYLENOL®, MOTRIN®, and LISTERINE®. Each one of our consumer businesses embraces innovative science to create products that anticipate consumer needs and create experiences that help them live healthy, vibrant lives.     (Junior) Consumer Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)       Standort- Neuss       Lernst Du gerne Neues? Siehst Du, was hinter den Zahlen und Daten steckt? Findest Du es spannend, was Verbrauchen denken, fühlen und wollen?     Wir suchen Talente, die ihre Karriere als Teil des Consumer Business Intelligence Teams von Johnson & Johnson Consumer Health beginnen oder ausbauen möchten.   Das Consumer Business Intelligence (CBI) Team ist der interne strategische Geschäftspartner für 12 Länder in Zentraleuropa und für deren Markenportfolio, das aus wachstumsstarken Marken wie Neutrogena, Listerine, Nicorette, o.b und Penaten und vielen anderen besteht.   Als CBI-Team sprechen wir für unsere Verbraucher und Käufer. Wir versorgen Management, Marken- und Vertriebsteams mit wichtigen Marktinformationen. Wir verbinden Funktionen, Erkenntnisse und Menschen, um den Erfolg und die Leistung unserer Marken zu gewährleisten.   Deine Hauptaufgaben und Verantwortlichkeiten-      Du schaffst ein teamübergreifendes Bewusstsein für Branchen-, Wettbewerbs- und Digitaltrends    Du verstehst Verbraucherbedürfnisse und kannst auf Basis von Trendanalysen Vorhersagen treffen sowie Marktchancen identifizieren. Im Zuge dessen entwickelst du neue Geschäftsstrategien    Du nimmst an kreativen Diskussionen mit diversen Teams teil, stellst den Status quo in Frage stellen schaffst durch neue Ideen einen Mehrwert für das Unternehmen    Du identifizierst die richtigen Daten, Metriken und analytischen Ansätze und entwickelst eine ansprechende Visualisierung dieser, um evidenzbasierte Entscheidungen und quantifizierte Empfehlungen für das gesamte Unternehmen zu liefern    Du analysierst eine Vielzahl von komplexen Daten und schlüsselst diese in interpretierbare Ergebnisse auf - durch Anwendung von Dashboards und Datenvisualisierung-Programmen (z. B. Tableau, Power BI, Nielsen, GfK, Excel) und/oder anderer digitalen Quellen (Google, Amazon, Facebook)    Du fungierst als Berater für Marktforschungstechniken, Shopper Research, syndizierte Daten und digitale Echtzeitdaten (z. B. Online-Produktbewertungen, soziale Medien)    Überdurchschnittlich abgeschlossenes betriebswirtschaftliches (Fach-) Hochschulstudium bevorzugt mit Schwerpunkt Marketing, Finanzen oder Informationstechnologie. Ebenso Psychologie oder Mathematikstudium    Idealerweise 2 - 5 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse und/oder Business Intelligence im Konsumgüter- oder Marktforschungssektor, alternativ in informationsbasierten Unternehmen.    Lernbereitschaft, aktives Erkennen persönlicher und organisatorischer Chancen und Umsetzung von Plänen zur Behebung dieser Chancen    Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse von Microsoft Office; Microsoft Excel, Power Pivot und PowerPoint, Erfahrung mit Datenvisualisierungs- oder BI-Tools wie Tableau, Power BI usw. ist ein Plus    Idealerweise ein grundlegendes Verständnis von Statistik- und Modellierungskonzepten    Konzeptionelles Denkvermögen, Spaß an analytischen Aufgaben und Fähigkeit komplexe Sachverhalte in realistische Maßnahmenpläne zu übersetzen    Hohe Belastbarkeit und Einsatzbereitschaft sowie ein Höchstmaß an Detailgenauigkeit    Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeit in Deutsch und Englisch    Innovationsbereitschaft, flexibles Mindset und Spaß an agilen Arbeitsweisen- und Prozesse      Die Förderung und Entwicklung unserer Mitarbeiter/innen sind zentrale Werte unserer Unternehmenskultur. Menschen, die in einem internationalen Unternehmen ihre Potenziale entfalten und an ihren Aufgaben wachsen möchten, finden bei uns beste Voraussetzungen. Neben der intensiven Einarbeitung und der bedarfsgerechten Weiterbildung sind hervorragende Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten - national und international - sowie eine attraktive Vergütung und überdurchschnittliche Sozialleistungen wichtige Elemente für unsere Mitarbeiter.    Primary Location    Europe/Middle East/Africa-Germany-North Rhine Westphalia-Rhein-Kreis Neuss    Organization    Johnson & Johnson GmbH    Job Function    Market Research    Job Qualifications    Qualifikationen-

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Java, Google Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Als data-analist speel je een belangrijke rol in het optimaliseren van de bedrijfsprocessen en fungeer je als interne ambassadeur van een moderne data-driven organisatie. Je rapport aan de Chief Product Officer en werkt nauw samen met de Head of e-Commerce.        Jobinhoud     Je weet data om te vormen tot inzichten die de commerciële en stragische besluitvorming in de organisatie ondersteunen.   Je brengt de data- en rapporteringsnoden voor de business in kaart en ontwikkelt ze.   Je analyseert gegevens uit verschillende bronnen, maakt hier heldere rapportages van en geeft op basis hiervan aanbevelingen aan de verschillende afdelingen binnen de organisatie.   Daarnaast coördineer je de opbouw van een nieuwe BI omgeving voor Neckermann en onderhoud je de huidige omgeving in Power BI.   Je bent de schakel tussen externe technische partijen en de business.   Je werkt mee aan de uitbouw van een nieuw dataware house.   Je analyseert de data van verschillende e-commerce tools om zo inzichten te verwerven over het surf – en koopgedrag van bezoekers en de performantie van onze website.  Op basis van jouw analyses ondersteun je het eCommerce team met het optimaliseren van de conversieratio.         Profiel     Je beschikt over een master in een analystische richting (TEW, Handelswetenschappen,…)   Minstens 3 jaar relevante ervaring (BI Specialist / Data Analist /...)  Je bent gepassioneerd door data en je volgt de evoluties op inzake business analytics, data architecture, machine learning en generatieve AI,…   Kennis en ervaring met Power BI, SQL en Excel zijn essentieel.   Pluspunten: Kennis Azure en Google Analytics   Kennis van programmeertalen zoals Phyton of Java   is zeker waardevol.  Vertrouwd met data warehouse structuren en cloud databases.   Je hebt een nieuwsgierige en kritische geest en bent bereid om constant bij te leren in een snel evoluerend vakgebied.   Verbaal sterke vaardigheden om data te vertalen naar de organisatie.   Sterk autonoom        Ons aanbod      Een contract van onbepaalde duur in een voltijdse tewerkstelling.  Een functie met veel autonomie waarin ondernemerschap sterk gemotiveerd wordt.  We ondersteunen jou in jouw verdere ontwikkeling en begeleiden jou in het volgen van de nodige opleidingen en trainingen.  Een open en informele werksfeer met korte communicatielijnen.  Hybride werken is deel van onze bedrijfscultuur, naast een grote autonomie kan je afwisselend thuis en op kantoor werken.  een marktconform salarispakket aangevuld met interessante extralegale voordelen (bedrijfswagen met tankkaart, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, bonussysteem, mooie kortingen op je persoonlijke vakanties)  20 vakantiedagen, aangevuld met 6 Happy Days

title: Data Science Analyst
skills: Skills: PowerPoint, Python, +8 more
job_description: Please be informed that this is role based in Wroclaw.     Model: Hybrid          CRISIL Global Research & Analytics (GR&A)  is the largest and top-ranked provider of high end research and analytics services to the world's leading commercial and investment banks, insurance companies, corporations and asset management firms. It has deep expertise in the areas of equity research, fixed income research, valuations, pricing complex derivatives, structured finance, risk management, actuarial analysis, and business intelligence. For more information, please visit www.crisil.com/gra. These positions are for CRISIL GR&A’s rapidly expanding risk and analytics practice.      The Data Science Analyst would be particularly responsible for:       Perform analyses to answer business questions leveraging Python and other data science tools,  Most of the time this role will be writing code to perform analyses,  Extract and transform data from multiple sources, and develop processes for data cleaning, integration, and validation,  In a smaller scale, collaborate with the team to develop reports and dashboards using visualization tools such as Tableau / PowerBI to communicate findings effectively for better and faster business decisions,  Assist with creating the final presentation deliverable using PowerPoint or other tools.       Qualification:       Bachelor’s Degree in data science, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Business Administration, Finance, or related subjects.       Skills required:       Excellent level of English,  Knowledge of Python, with SQL and R also helpful,  Positive, proactive, creative, and team-oriented approach,  High level of attention to detail and accuracy.  Written communication: Clear communicator competent at explaining technical content to a non-technical audience, and distilling key messages from analysis in verbal, memo & PowerPoint format,  Quantitative abilities: Comfortable manipulating large datasets to produce descriptive statistics. Ability to implement more advanced models desirable but not expected for this level,  Results oriented: Ability to thrive under ambiguity and time constraints to develop thoughtful, accurate insights,  Interest in finance is a plus.       Our offer:       Stable employment in an international company;  Employment contract;  Flexible working hours - Home Office;  Benefits - Medicover, Multisport, Group insurance;  Possibility of using many courses in technical areas as well as soft skills. Mikolaja 7 or any other entity of CRISIL group places and processes my personal data in its database. I also express my consent to sending my personal data to third parties within CRISIL group pursuant to the Personal Data Protection Act of 29th August 1997 (Journal of Laws of 2002, No. 101, position 926 as amended). I submit the data voluntarily. I have been informed about the right of access to the content of my data and about the possibility of correcting them."

title: Principal Data Analyst - Growth
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Data-driven Decision Making, +8 more
job_description: Principal Data Analyst – EU GTM Market - Multi-Product Growth    As the Principal Data Analyst for the European multi-product Growth team , you will be instrumental in transforming SumUp from a single product company to a leading product-ecosystem provider.  You will be part of the European Markets multi-product growth team. This is essentially a group of cross-functional growth hackers with the mission of completely transforming SumUp’s go-to-market from the current approach of leading with our successful card acceptance product to an integrated ecosystem of products that help small merchants power their business. Your mission will be to support the team with implementation, execution and analysis of experiments that make SumUp a true multi-product player.  This role offers the opportunity to make an impact as a key contributor for one of SumUp’s most important strategic initiatives.   What You’ll Do     Implement dashboards and reports to measure success of growth experimentation  Perform analysis to guide the direction of growth initiatives  Transition to a wholistic revenue perspective across all revenue generating products  Co-create and implement CLTV metric across the EU GTM  Communicate actionable insights to stakeholders, promoting adoption of data-driven decision making  Establish best practices for experimentation across products and marketing campaigns     You’ll be great for this role if     You have exceptional data driven problem solving skills  You can independently turn data into user friendly dashboards, allowing team members to monitor performance, to catch growth & optimization opportunities   You bring at least 5 years of Data Analyst work with you  You have advanced knowledge of SQL and Tableau  You are excellent at communicating in written and spoken English      It's a plus if you have:     Solid knowledge of statistical programming languages, such as R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.     Why you should join SumUp     Opportunity to work with a truly global, multicultural team (we are 3200+ people from 80+ countries, spread across 4 continents).  28 days’ paid leave  Competitive salary package and virtual stock option programme  Learning & development budget for attending conferences and external training  SumUp Corporate Pension Scheme  Wellness benefits: in-house fitness classes with Fitness Matters, in-house Yoga teacher, gym in the office, football & running teams, subsidized Urban Sports Club  A lot of other cool benefits such as Bike leasing, Subsidised Public Transport Card, Language Learning platform/courses, Kita placement assistance, relocation assistance, 2x per week subsidised office lunches, and a brand new beautiful place to work in the heart of Berlin!     About SumUp   We believe in the everyday hero.  Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we're creating tools that help them run their businesses. With a founder’s mentality and a 'team-first’ attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.   SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.    SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate    Job Application Tip   We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don’t tick every box, it’s ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.

title: Insight Analyst (m/f/x)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Microsoft Excel, +6 more
job_description: We are Tipico, the leading sports betting provider in Germany and one of the most exciting tech companies in the industry. We are fuelled by our passion for the perfect product, using the newest tech stack to make advances every single day. Our culture is bursting with energy and ambition where we generate intense moments of Spannung, thriving through our values of Trust, Progress, and Passion. We push the limits of what’s possible because we believe that when adrenaline meets progress, awesome things happen.     Are you ready to turn up the power and bring the thrill of Spannung into your working life? Then show us your game face – because we’re looking for an  Insight Analyst (m/f/x)  to join the team!     The Insight Analyst is responsible for monitoring and analysing the development of all our business areas within the Online and Retail business units. The role also involves conducting product, customer and service-related performance analysis, business modelling and reporting, as well as acting as an internal consultant to our various teams. You will provide evaluation of Acquisition, Retention and Marketing campaigns as well as give recommendations on how to achieve better results, as we are always searching to improve.      Your playing field:     Supporting . By providing number-based recommendations and acting as a sparring partner for healthy debates, you will support decision makers. You also will support various projects from an Insight/ Data perspective.   KPIs.  You will monitor KPIs, understand and analyse reasons for KPI development together with the KPI owners.   Team Player . As a real Team Player, you will create and support your team members with business cases for various topics such as retention campaigns, product launches and changes in the payment portfolio.   Reporting.  You will provide actual vs budget reporting to budget holders in the Online department and support them in the budgeting process.   Evaluation . For continuing to redefine new levels of excellence, you will evaluate CRM, VIP and Marketing campaigns and discuss learnings with campaign owners.   Data.  We believe in data to make informed decision, you will build a standard reporting set for Gaming, Sports, CS, Payments and Fraud/ Risk as well as support in the development of new data models.       Which skills you should bring to the pitch:     Experience.  You have at least two years’ experience in a similar role within the gaming industry.   Technical.  For this role you would need Advance SQL and Excel skills/experience are essential.   Collaborative.  You will share the knowledge gathered and present findings from data analysis with your team.   Ownership & accountability . You take responsibility and hold yourself and others accountable to meet targets and commitments.   Self-motivated & Self-driven.  You have the ability to do what needs to be done without influence from other people or situations and are driven by your own desire to achieve.   Solution-oriented & Hands-on. You consistently achieve results, even under tough circumstances and are never too good for operational work.   Language.  We are an international company with over 40 different nationalities. For a better understanding and communication, English is our language.       This is how we score with you:     Established International Group. We have a solid foundation on which to grow.   Personal and Professional Growth. We offer you opportunities to develop and grow to unlock your potential.   Competitive Package. We care for our employees, offering an indefinite contract, competitive salary, Private health and dental insurance and free parking.   On-site childcare. Worried about where to leave your 3+ year old kids?We’ve got a game plan.   Sports Incentive. We want you to remain active and will subsidise a membership of the sport of your choice.   Modern offices. Our very own Tipico tower provides an open plan space with the latest technology.   Events. Sponsored Charity and Team gatherings, we like to have fun together as one team and reinforce our connections.   Supportive Environment. We believe in collaboration and working together as a team but we also give importance to the uniqueness of each and every one of us.      Think a career at Tipico is right for you? Apply now and join our winning team.  If you have any questions or comments about this role, our TA team is happy to help you!   Feel free to reach out to us on our social media channels  We look forward to your application!

job_description: In this role, you have significant influence on the business, profitability and strategy. Yo are convincing, persistent and highly analytical. The Data Analyst Costing is responsible for the correct costing of the Repair and Maintenance contract of the customers. You have a lot of contact with other departments such as product development, control, commercial services.     Modeling the expected repair and maintenance costs to support long -term repair & maintenance contract   Merging and analyzing data from various sources  Making costing proposals and presenting for (higher) management  Participate in multidisciplinary projects to improve services and reduce costs  Support other departments with data and cost price related questions      | WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?    To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience:     You already live in the Netherlands  You have a completed university education in, for example, econometrics, technical business administration or a related field  Minimum of 2 years of working in industry   You have very good analytical skills and have an eye for detail  experience with solving data related issues using various analysis tools, including Microsoft Excel, SQL and/or MatLab  Stress resistance, result orientation and ambition  Mentality to independently identify problems, to submit solutions and to put them into practice  Good communication skills in both Dutch and English      | WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?    TMC Data Science belongs to enthusiastic group of about 60 professionals in 7 different key competencies of Data Science. From Data Analysts to Machine Learning Engineers, and from juniors to seniors. We share all our knowledge with each other. In the form of Workshops, Quick Scans, Pizza Sessions, Office Days and Q-meetings. We have a strong network, sky-high ambitions and together we'll take care of your career! We also have our own Cell Council that organizes many activities such as bbq's and game nights.   | WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?   TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.   At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.   As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.    | WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?    We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:     You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security;  You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing;  We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills;  The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network;  The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups.     TMC is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: About Lendable    Lendable is on a mission to make consumer finance amazing:  faster, cheaper and friendlier.    We’re building one of the  world’s leading fintech  companies and are off to a strong start:     One of the UK’s newest unicorns with a team of >250 people  Among the top 10 fastest-growing tech companies in the UK  Profitable since 2017  Backed by top investors including Balderton Capital and Goldman Sachs and most recently OTPP (Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan) in 2022  Loved by customers with the best reviews in the market (4.9/5 across 10,000s of reviews)     So far, we’ve rebuilt the  Big Three  consumer finance products from scratch: loans, credit cards and car finance. We get money into our customers’ hands in minutes instead of days.   We’re growing fast, and there’s a lot more to do: we’re going after the two biggest Western markets ( UK and US ) where trillions are held by big banks with dated systems and painful processes. We launched our  loans product in the US  in 2022 with more product launches to follow this year!   Join us if you want to     Take ownership across a broad remit. You are trusted to make decisions that drive a material impact on the direction and success of Lendable from day 1  Work in small teams of exceptional people who are relentlessly resourceful to solve problems and find smarter solutions than the status quo  Build the best technology in-house, using new data sources, machine learning, and AI to make machines do the heavy lifting      About The Role    This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to be at the forefront of shaping the lending industry. A successful candidate for this role would be instrumental in driving the  commercial, credit, and product  objectives of our company.   Working closely with our credit and growth teams, you will have the chance to work on exciting projects, ensuring that we have  the right metrics  in place for our lending products. You will be responsible for analyzing our existing lending products, identifying  areas for improvement , and devising plans for  future products . With your inquisitive nature and problem-solving mindset, you will help our team stay on top of industry trends, ensuring that we are always one step ahead of the competition.   You will also be responsible for strategic reporting, where you will focus on market insights and origination funnels, providing reasons and calls to action when analysing the variation of lending via our distribution channels.   Some of the things you'll get involved in     Using your analytical and problem-solving skills to generate key insights from data, and use that insight to drive meaningful change in our strategy  Owning and improving our lending engine analytics.  Using data and analytics to drive decisions about who we should lend to and where the best opportunities to grow our business lie.   Presenting your findings to senior leaders in the company, then work with the product/tech team to get them implemented     What do you need to succeed in this role     1-2 years of professional experience  Experienced using Python and familiarity with SQL  Someone that loves numbers! You’ll be working with numbers every single day in this role so you’ll be able to demonstrate your ability to work with complex data sets, analyse them and draw insights  You’ll have a natural curiosity and love to dig into things to understand how they work.  Startup mindset. We’re a fast-growth tech startup so you’ll be super excited to work in an entrepreneurial environment and have a real impact on the business     The interview process   We’re not a corporate so we try our best to get things moving as quickly as possible. For this role we’d expect:     A quick phone call with one of the team  Remote (video call) analytical case study (45 mins)  Business case study interview (1hr) (remote/office)  Final onsite interview (1-2.5 hours)  Meet the team you’ll work with daily     Life at Lendable (also check out our Glassdoor page)     The opportunity to scale up one of the world’s most successful fintech companies.  Best-in-class compensation including equity.  You can work from home every Monday and Friday if you wish - on the other days, we all come together IRL to be together, build and exchange ideas.  Our in-house chef prepares fresh, healthy lunch in the office every Tuesday-Thursday  We care for our Lendies’ well-being both physically and mentally, so we offer the highest coverage when it comes to private health insurance   We organise an annual trip with the whole company, to celebrate our milestones and reflect on our achievements  We're an equal-opportunity employer and are looking to make Lendable the most inclusive and open workspace in London     ps. Sadly we do not offer sponsorship for this

title: Information Analyst
skills: Skills: IT Solutions, Сетевая безопасность, +4 more
job_description: Established in 1977, GOAL is an international humanitarian agency, with a team of 2,400 personnel, dedicated to alleviating the needs of the most vulnerable communities. Currently operating in 14 of the world’s most vulnerable countries, GOAL delivers a wide range of humanitarian and development programmes, ranging from humanitarian relief in disaster situations, to focusing on nutrition, food security, and building greater resilience and sustainable livelihoods.     GOAL has an annual budget of an estimated €200 million and is supported by a range of donors including the Governments of Ireland, UK, USA, the European Union, individuals, trusts and foundations. GOAL values the power of partnership and works with local and international partners to achieve its mission.      The Role   We are looking for a talented and motivated individual to be our new Information Analyst. This is great opportunity to contribute to an International NGO and help GOAL delivering its global humanitarian programmes that transform lives every day. The key to success in this role will be a strong attention to detail with a passion to learn more about data protection.     The Information Analyst will play an important role in leading training and management for staff on SharePoint functionality and permissions management and we seek an ambitious self-starter with an eye for creating engaging and visually appealing training material.       Duties and responsibilities     Data Security and Management    Maintain the implementation of information security architecture and security controls within Sharepoint to address the current and emerging information security and compliance requirements of the organisation.  Lead training and management for staff on SharePoint functionality and permissions management  Make certain that the company's data remains secure within Sharepoint by keeping up to date on the latest cyber security threats and update systems where appropriate  Assist in the creation of new SharePoint sites and roll-out of standardised SharePoint policy  Assist in process and data flow mapping  Assist in the maintenance of confluence and Jira workspaces  Implement security measures on new SharePoint sites  Assist with the change management process in the development and roll-out of standardised SharePoint structure  Perform administrator functions within Goals digital environment  Conduct monthly Sharepoint file deletion reviews, security audits, and permission review management with Syskit  Conduct regular reviews of information security systems to ensure security integrity  Build strong relationships with the IT team and relevant stakeholders to ensure understanding, engagement, and support for Data project delivery across all functional areas within GOAL.       Learning:     Assist with the creation of Digital Skills Strategy  Create and conduct regular trainings for staff on key areas in IT, data security, and data protection.  Work to improve uptake of core training around IT, cybersecurity, phishing, and data protection.  Work closely with MEAL (MIS), IT Solutions, and HR on the development and rollout of training  Meet with departments and countries and conduct needs requirement exercises to identify appropriate SharePoint and data storage solutions and training requirements  Liaise between departments and the DPO office to ensure issues are addressed in an effective and timely manner.        Qualifications and Attributes     Essential    An undergraduate qualification in IT, Business, Economics, or International Relations  Post-graduate work experience       Desirable    Experience in designing or conducting training online.  Familiarity with Data Protection regulations

title: Data Analist CBR

job_description: CBR in Rijswijk zoekt een business Data Analist voor 32 - 37,5 uur | Dutch required!   De afdeling data-analyse maakt onderdeel uit van de stafdiensten die ondersteunend werken aan de primaire processen van CBR. Een goede werk-privé balans staat centraal bij CBR, het is mogelijk om in deze rol vier dagen van 9 uur te werken.      Jouw uitdaging   In deze rol ligt de focus op data-analyse en ondersteuning van de verschillende divisies op het gebied van KPI's, dashboards en alles wat te maken heeft met de stroom van cijfers. CBR is volop in beweging en investeert in een nieuwe IT-infrastructuur. Als business partner en data-analist ben je sterk in het doorgronden van operationele processen en het omgaan met de grote datastromen die daaruit ontstaan. Verder houd je je bezig met het identificeren, analyseren en specificeren van de informatiebehoeften van de business. Je analyseert de gegevens en verwerkt deze tot informatie en dashboards.      Wat ga je nog meer doen...    De informatie behoeften afstemmen met de business en de functionele specificaties overdragen aan de BI-ontwikkelaar  Verzamelen en controleren van gegevens en deze verwerken tot informatie en dashboards  Informatie en verschillende dashboards analyseren en omzetten in kennis ter verbetering van de besluitvorming  Bewaken en beheren van het portfoliomanagement  Signaleren van risico’s, knelpunten en afwijkingen in de datamodellen  Een directe bijdrage leveren in de doorontwikkeling van de databeschikbaarheid en kwaliteit  Actief meedenken en participeren ten aanzien van verbeter- en verandermanagement in de business        CBR vraagt    Een afgeronde studie op hbo- of wo-niveau, bij voorkeur richting bedrijfseconomie of data science  Relevante werkervaring binnen het vakgebied van data-analyse en managementinformatie  Uitstekende kennis van Excel (professional level)  Bij voorkeur kennis van / ervaring met databases (SQL) en BI tooling  Een prioriteitensteller, die doorvraagt en denkt in oplossingen  Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal       Je bent    Analytisch sterk en in staat bedrijfsprocessen snel te doorgronden  Klantgerichtheid en samenwerken is voor jou een vanzelfsprekendheid  Proactief en je kunt goed zelfstandig 'doorpakken'       CBR biedt...   Een functie met impact gericht op verkeersveiligheid. Je houdt van werken in een dynamische werkomgeving waar verandering en vernieuwing hoog op de agenda staat. Verder bieden we:   een jaarcontract voor 37,5 uur per week met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband;  een bruto maandsalaris van maximaal € 5.000,- (inschaling afhankelijk van relevante werkervaring) op basis van een 37,5-urige werkweek;  8% vakantietoeslag + 8.33% eindejaarsuitkering;  ruim zes weken vakantie bij een fulltime dienstverband;  een goede werk/privébalans en dus heb je bij het CBR de mogelijkheid om ook thuis te werken;  een fietsregeling;  een vergoeding van € 40,- bruto per maand op je zorgverzekering;  volop trainings-, opleidings- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden in een mensgerichte organisatiecultuur met een mooi maatschappelijk doel;  uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een goede verlofregeling en pensioenopbouw via het ABP.       Benieuwd naar werken in deze functie bij CBR?   Onze Senior Lead Recruiter Anette Bouvy-Appelhof vertelt je er alles over! Je bereikt Anette door een app te sturen naar: 06 - 12 70 26 58.

job_description: ÜBER RIMOWA:    Herzlich willkommen bei RIMOWA – der ersten deutschen Maison der LVMH Gruppe. Wir sind eine globale Lifestyle-Marke und verfolgen das Ziel, essentielle Begleiter für lebenslanges Reisen zu entwickeln. Seit über 125 Jahren stellen wir einzigartige Produkte her, die Luxus und Funktionalität, Tradition und Innovation, Handwerkskunst und zeitloses Design miteinander verbinden. Wir bei RIMOWA glauben, dass große Ziele nur mit zuverlässigen Begleitern erreicht werden können. Deshalb steht bei der Entwicklung unserer Produkte insbesondere ihre Langlebigkeit im Fokus. Denn die bedeutendste Reise dauert länger als ein einzelner Trip – sie währt ein Leben lang.      IHRE AUFGABEN:    Zur Verstärkung unseres Global Industrial Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine*n Power BI / Data Analyst (m/w/d). In dieser Rolle berichten Sie an den Industrial Director und sind für folgende Tätigkeiten verantwortlich:   Teilnahme an der Projektplanung und -verwaltung, einschließlich der Ermittlung der Anforderungen für ein bestimmtes Projekt, der Entwicklung, des Testens und der Bereitstellung von BI-Berichten/Dashboards  Experte für die Analyse der Betriebsablaufzeit  Erstellung und Verwaltung von analytischen Dashboards und Berichten  Gelegentliche Beratung der Abteilungsleiter mit dem Ziel einer tieferen Kenntnisvermittlung von Power BI-Berichten / Dashboards  Unterstützung von Fachexperten aus anderen Abteilungen, um die Auswirkungen und den Wert von Inhalts- und Designstrategien mit datengestützten Analysen zu erkennen  Sie denken proaktiv über verwandte Systeme/Anwendungen nach und geben regelmäßig Feedback, um die Datenprozessoptimierung zu gewährleisten  Enge Zusammenarbeit mit der IT-Abteilung, zur Sicherzustellung der Prozessrationalisierung und Prozesszuverlässigkeit  Zusammenarbeit mit der Controlling-Abteilung, um finanzielle Ziele in Prozessziele umzusetzen  Erlernen und Aufrechterhalten von Kenntnissen der Softwareplattformen für die Erstellung und Bereitstellung von BI-Berichten/Dashboards          IHR PROFIL:     Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossen Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Data Science oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang / Ausbildungsberuf  Sie bringen Berufserfahrung in Big Data, Data Analytics, BI, Reports und KPIs mit  Sie zeichnet eine hohe Zahlen- und IT-Affinität aus  Sie sind ein Teamplayer mit schneller Auffassungsgabe und analytischer Denkweise  Sie verfügen über verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zur internationalen Kommunikation       UNSERE BENEFITS:    Wir bieten Ihnen einen interessanten Arbeitsplatz in einem innovativen, internationalen Produktionsumfeld. Sie haben die Möglichkeit selbstständig als auch lösungsorientiert zu arbeiten und stehen im ständigen Austausch mit anderen Fachabteilungen. Wir offerieren Ihnen große Mitgestaltungsspielräume sowie hohe Eigenverantwortungen innerhalb der internationalen LVMH Konzern Gruppe. RIMOWA verfügt über ein starkes Gruppennetzwerk in der Sie individuelle Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, viele spannende Projekte & Benefits am Kölner Standort erwarten.      30 Tage bezahlter Urlaub pro Jahr  Flexible Arbeitszeiten und Home Office  Attraktive Vergütung & Gewinnbeteiligungssystem  Spannende Projektmöglichkeiten  Firmenvorteile (z.B. für Sport, Lifestyle, Mode, etc.)  Regelmäßige Private Sales bei RIMOWA und der LVMH Gruppe  RIMOWA Essential Cabin als Geschenk nach der Probezeit  30% Rabatt auf das RIMOWA-Sortiment  Internationales und interessantes Umfeld innerhalb der LVHM-Gruppe  Individuelle Entwicklungs- und Coachingmöglichkeiten  Betriebliche Altersvorsorge  LVMH Herzfond  Voiio Family Service  Hervorragende Mobilität: Jobticket, Jobrad / Fahrradleasing, verkehrsgünstige Lage mit Mitarbeiterparkplätzen sowie überdachten Fahrradparkplätzen  Vielfältiges als auch qualitatives Betriebsrestaurant       WERDEN SIE TEIL VON RIMOWA:       Bitte senden Sie uns Ihre vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen einschließlich Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellungen mit Angabe des nächstmöglichen Eintrittstermins an Loreen Lamdi.      Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung!     Suchen Sie uns auf Instagram und Twitter @RIMOWA oder besuchen Sie uns auf unserer LVMH Karriere Seite:  https://www.lvmh.com/talents/work-with-us/job-offers/view-our-current-opportunities/?job=&place=8052&experience=&activity=&contract=&reference=&order=company&by=desc         Unsere integrative und vielfältige Kultur zu feiern, ist ein Kernstück der DNA von RIMOWA. Wir wissen, dass unser Geschäft nur dann florieren kann, wenn wir in allen Ländern, in denen wir tätig sind, über vielfältige Talente mit unterschiedlichen Hintergründen, Fähigkeiten und Fertigkeiten verfügen und unsere breite Kundenbasis widerspiegeln. Wir betrachten Vielfalt als einen der wichtigsten Faktoren für das Wachstum unseres Unternehmens.

title: Data Analyst - Transportation
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: A Transportation Data Analyst monitors and analyzes transportation network performance, identifies opportunities and risks and provides recommendations for action plans to reduce associated risks and improve efficiencies.   Your Role   Transportation is an essential and often critical component for the success of organization's supply chain and the business as a whole, making the transportation data analyst an essential role. You will become part of the Transportation team in Benelux within the business unit Contract logistics. It’s a full time position, and applications are welcome from Belgium or Netherlands, as you can be based in one of those countries according to your preference.   Your Responsibilities     Design and implement methods to gather and manage transportation data;  Research and seek out the most cost-efficient shipment procedures and methods;  Review and analyze gathered data to locate gaps and opportunity areas in the transportation network and develop methods to improve;  Monitor transportation spend and measure transportation providers performance and report to management;  Support Logistics Engineers and Procurement teams with reporting and analytics, including tender and network design analysis;  Build dashboards, presentations and reporting of transportation related activities, including monthly/quarterly BU reporting;  Become a Leading user of the Company’s transportation management systems.       Your Skills And Experiences       A completed HBO level/university level degree;  You are experienced in analyzing and improving supply chain data, information and processes, including a good understanding of all aspects of supply chain processes;  You have exceptional ability to conceptualize large-picture projects and foresee challenges that need to be addressed;  You have excellent mathematical and analytical skills, meaning a working knowledge of data analysis and forecasting tools + ability to develop actionable insights from data;  You have strong working experience with Power BI or Tableau or similar analytical tools;  You are a self-driven, multi-tasker, with attention for details, motivated to make a quality impact within the scope of your function;  Good verbal and written knowledge of English. Another EU language is a plus;  Available for 32h minimum per week, preference is full time. You have around 2 years of relevant work experience.      Good Reasons to Join   We offer you a challenging position in a dynamic working environment in which development and progress are important. You will join an ambitious and energetic team. We work in a flexible working schedule whereas your private life- work balance is optimal, including the possibility to work via home office days. You will start with an annual contract, and if everyone is satisfied, resulting in a permanent employment afterwards. In addition to an excellent salary, we also offer a good pension scheme. You will have 24 vacation days and 3.5 atv days and you have the option to buy additional days. Kuehne + Nagel is a good and reliable company, therefor a VOG is requested at the start.

title: Data Analyst
