job_description: Con Head Office globale basato a Milano, Mapei è oggi il maggior produttore mondiale di prodotti chimici per l’edilizia. Oltre 10.500 persone sono impegnate presso le nostre 87 consociate, 81 stabilimenti, 31 centri di ricerca nel mondo.  Lavorare in Mapei significa far parte di una squadra vincente, costantemente impegnata a essere sempre un passo avanti. Cerchiamo persone con una forte motivazione a inserirsi in un  contesto internazionale , con spiccata flessibilità, dinamismo e passione. Sposare la filosofia Mapei significa crescere insieme e costruire senso di appartenenza e condivisione dei valori aziendali.  Ricerchiamo    LAUREATI – CORPORATE PRODUCT MASTER SPECIALIST/DATA ANALYST     La sfida:   Farai parte di un team che contribuisce alla trasformazione digitale di Mapei, maturando competenze analitiche molto strutturate, in un contesto di relazioni internazionali, con colleghi di tutto il mondo.  Parteciperai ad attività di analisi di processo dedicate ai Roll - out sul catalogo prodotti aziendale. Inoltre parteciperai alle analisi e interfacciamenti riguardanti listini elettronici e cataloghi elettronici.  Più in dettaglio questo ruolo prevede:     Attività di roll out del sistema AX nelle varie consociate e promuovere il processo e procedure.   Analisi delle caratteristiche di prodotto ai fini della creazione anagrafica del prodotto stesso sui vari sistemi in uso del Gruppo, attraverso un lavoro di coordinamento delle varie funzioni al fine di reperire tutte le informazioni necessarie alla definizione del codice prodotto.   Analisi dell’interfaccia dei sistemi informatici coinvolti nel processo EDI, coordinando l’attività a livello centrale, con costante interfaccia con i referenti Product Master delle consociate estere   Analisi il processo di data exchange, identificando mancanze e soluzioni ed eventualmente rimodellare i dati per sviluppare il processo verso terze parti in maniera lineare.   Raccolta dai Product Manager (in Italia e all’ estero) delle richieste di creazione di nuovi codici prodotto o di modifiche di codici esistenti, attivando il ciclo di approvazione degli stessi.    Inserimento a sistema dell’anagrafica prodotto e di tutte le informazioni necessarie   Comunicazione alle diverse funzioni aziendali interessate della creazione di nuovi codici    Revisione/aggiornamento e divulgazione di tutte le procedure Corporate e dei Processi legati allo sviluppo del prodotto       Requisiti richiesti:      Laurea in Economia/Statistica/Ingegneria Gestionale/Informatica   Esperienza minima su analisi dati complessi (non di natura finanziaria)   Ottime conoscenze del pacchetto office (Microsoft  Excel , in particolare  POWER QUERY, PIVOT, CERCA VERT, CERCA SE )    Conoscenza fluente della lingua inglese    Atteggiamento proattivo e dinamico   Orientamento a svolgere attività di analisi   Problem solving e approccio orientato ai dati   Precisione, puntualità e senso di responsabilità   Disponibilità a trasferte in Italia e all’estero       Ulteriori informazioni:   Sede di lavoro: Milano  Contratto a Tempo determinato di un anno (con possibilità di stabilizzazione)  L’azienda garantisce il trattamento dei dati ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo n. 2016/679, rinviando all’informativa privacy disponibile proseguendo con la presente candidatura.  La ricerca è rivolta a candidati di entrambi i sessi. (L. 903/77).  Esplora le Opportunità di carriera sul sito www.mapei.com

job_description: Aufgaben    Als BI Analyst im Marketing bist Du für die Analyse quantitativer und qualitativer Daten, unter Zuhilfenahme von Prognose- oder Vorhersagemodellen, sowie für die Ableitung von Impulsen für strategische Marketing-Entscheidungen und –Planungen zuständig. Zu Deinen herausfordernden Aufgaben gehört:      Entwicklung von Prognoseszenarien und -modellen zur Optimierung der Marketing Planung & des Auftrags-, sowie Budgetforecasting  Erstellen von Analysen, Prognosen und Reports in den Bereichen Kundenverhalten, Umsatzentwicklung und Sortimentsanalyse  Erfolgscontrolling der Marketing-Kampagnen, Entwicklung von Interpretationshilfen und Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen  (Weiter-) Entwicklung, Überwachung und Steuerung der BI Systeme sowie Weiterentwicklung unserer Channelattributionsmodelle  Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Bereichen Werbung, Category Management, Controlling und IT       Stärken    Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Mathematik/Statistik/Wirtschaftsinformatik oder BWL und bringst Berufserfahrung in der datengetriebenen Analyse von (Online-) Marketing- und Sales-Maßnahmen mit. Darüber hinaus überzeugst Du uns mit folgenden Qualifikationen:      Erfahrungen mit einem BI-/Visualisierungstool (Power Bi, Qlikview, Tableau oder andere)  Kenntnisse im Umgang mit relationalen Datenbanken und SQL  Praktische Erfahrung mit Statistik-Software-Paketen (z.B. SPSS) und Business Intelligence Tools  Wünschenswert sind Kenntnisse in Python  Erfahrung in der Anwendung statistischer Methoden  Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten, konzeptionelles Denken und Marketing-Verständnis       Lohn & Sozialleistungen        Fairer Lohn für Festangestellte und Zeitarbeitnehmer sowie angemessene Vergütung von Praktika  Firmeneigener Tarifvertrag mit dynamischer Gehaltsentwicklung  Attraktive betriebliche Altersvorsorge mit 2/3 Arbeitgeberanteil  Berufsunfähigkeitsversicherung für eine Absicherung bis zum Renteneintritt  Fahrtkostenerstattung für den täglichen Arbeitsweg (bis zu 45 km pro Strecke)  Vergünstigte Krankenkassenbeiträge durch Kollektivverträge  Gesetzlicher Anspruch auf bis zu 5 Wochen Vaterschaftsurlaub  Finanzielle Unterstützung bei notwendigem Umzug       Über uns    „Fortschritt in Verantwortung für unsere Kunden.“ – so lautet das Markenversprechen der größten Versandapotheke Europas und bekanntesten Apothekenmarke Deutschlands. Als Apotheke mit einem umfassenden Leistungsangebot steht DocMorris für eine bundesweite sichere und qualitativ hochwertige pharmazeutische Versorgung. Für das Tochterunternehmen der Schweizer Zur Rose Group AG arbeiten am Standort im niederländischen Heerlen rund 700 Mitarbeiter in einem hoch dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld an dem Anspruch, Treiber und Vordenker von patientenorientierten und innovativen eHealth-Anwendungen zu sein.      Kontakt       Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung! Bei Fragen steht Dir Matthias Wegerle unter der Telefonnummer +49 (0)621 397316 654 gerne zur Verfügung.

title: Data Analyst Power BI (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: Microsoft Power BI, Английский язык, +6 more
job_description: Rund um die weltweite Vermarktung und den Einsatz von Paessler PRTG verarbeitet unser Business Intelligence Team schon heute eine Reihe von verschiedenen Daten. Um die Qualität und den Wert dieser Daten weiter zu erhöhen und unseren internen Fachabteilungen die bestmögliche Grundlage für datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu bieten, suchen wir dich!      Du wirst ein Teil unseres interdisziplinären 7-köpfigen BI Scrum Teams, wobei dein Schwerpunkt auf der Durchführung und Aufbereitung von Datenanalysen sowie auf der Erstellung von ansprechenden Dashboards und Reports für unsere Fachabteilungen liegt.     Du hast bereits im professionellen Umfeld als Daten Analyst gearbeitet und hast Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten? Du zeichnest dich durch analytisches Denkvermögen, Qualitätsbewusstsein sowie einen Blick fürs Detail aus?     Dann bewirb dich jetzt!      DEINE AUFGABEN       Als Data Analyst:in entwirfst und entwickelst du aussagekräftige Reports und Dashboards  Du übernimmst Verantwortung für die Weiterentwicklung und Pflege unserer Power BI Data Sets und Business-Datenmodelle   Du führst Datenanalysen durch und übernimmst die Aufbereitung und Kommunikation der Ergebnisse  Du kümmerst dich um Schulung und Unterstützung der Fachabteilungen im Bereich KPIs und Datenvisualisierung  Du unterstützt bei der Weiterentwicklung in Richtung Advanced Analytics und Self-Service BI  Gemeinsam mit deinem Team stellst du die geforderte Datenverfügbarkeit und -qualität sicher       DEIN PROFIL       Du kannst auf mindestens 2 Jahre professionelle Erfahrung im Bereich der Datenvisualisierung und Entwicklung von Berichten mit Microsoft Power BI aufbauen  Du bringst Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten mit und verfügst über starke Kompetenzen im Bereich Business Intelligence   Du bist vertraut mit der Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform (SQL Server, Synapse, Purview) und den zugehörigen Programmiersprachen SQL und DAX  Du verfügst über Erfahrung mit relationalen Datenbanken, der Modellierung von Datenmodellen und Self-Service BI  Du hattest bereits Berührungspunkte mit Advanced-Analytics-Methoden  Du besitzt idealerweise erste Kenntnisse in der Verarbeitung von Daten mit ETL-Prozessen und Streaming  Du bist ein Teamplayer mit der Fähigkeit, objektiv und klar zu kommunizieren  Du bist vertraut mit der Arbeit in agilen Teams und besitzt eine hohe Lernbereitschaft   Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse       FAKTEN, DIE DICH INTERESSIEREN       Vielfältige Weiterbildungs- und persönliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten  Zeit, um sich mit innovativen Themen und Technologien zu beschäftigen  Eine strukturierte Einarbeitung durch ein erfahrenes Team  Flexible Arbeitszeiteinteilung, umfangreiche HomeOffice-Möglichkeiten und ein familienfreundliches Umfeld  Unbefristeter Einstieg in unserem Headquarter in Nürnberg  Entspannt zur Arbeit: Zuschuss zum Deutschlandticket-Firmenabo, Bike-Leasing, Fahrradkeller mit Duschen und ausreichend Parkplätze  Moderne Arbeitsplätze in einem ansprechenden Industrie-Loft-Büro mit eigenem Bistro  Die Paessler AG ist ein profitabler, schnell wachsender und dabei langfristig denkender Mittelständler, seit 20 Jahren auf dem Markt und mit aktuell 350 Mitarbeitenden weltweit erfolgreich       HAST DU INTERESSE?      Dann nimm ganz einfach über den Bewerbungs-Button Kontakt mit uns auf.     Oder kontaktiere mich direkt für diesen Job:   Marco Krämer, Elisabeth Plüsch  contacthr@paessler.com      Eine wichtige Bemerkung zum Schluss:   Für uns ist Diversität selbstverständlich, wir begrüßen sie und möchten sie nach allen Kräften fördern. Unsere Stellenanzeigen richten sich an Menschen, nicht an ein Geschlecht (ebenso wenig an eine sexuelle Orientierung, eine Herkunft oder einen Glauben). Wenn du in unseren Anzeigen eine Formulierung siehst, die sich auf ein bestimmtes Geschlecht bezieht, dann dient das nur der einfachen Lesbarkeit. Stolperst du daneben über etwas, das wir hätten besser machen können, bitten wir dich, uns darauf hinzuweisen (auch im späteren Bewerbungsprozess). Individualität sprengt sprachliche Grenzen, doch muss sich auch unsere Sprache weiterentwickeln. Bewirb dich bei uns und mache unsere Unternehmenskultur bunter!

title: Business Intelligence Consultant
skills: Skills: SQL, SSIS, +8 more
job_description: Ønsker du å bidra til å øke forretningsverdi gjennom utnyttelse av data?    Interessert i å bli en del av et team som utvikler fremtidens analyseløsninger?     Klar for å bli en del av et av et voksende BI-miljø med fokus på tverrfagelighet og personlig utvikling?         Praktisk informasjon   Sted:  Oslo , Norge | Visumkrav: Gyldig arbeidstillatelse | Språkkrav:  Norsk  og  engelsk  på et profesjonelt nivå – muntlig og skriftlig | Søknadsfrist:  Vi behandler søknader fortløpende      Hos oss vil du jobbe med  innovative og framtidsrettede  løsninger sammen med dyktige kollegaer fra datainnsikts-teamet. Kundene våre ønsker å bli mer datadrevet gjennom å utnytte verdien som finnes i tilgjengelige data, både for rapportering, analyse,  prosessoptimalisering  og prediksjon. Du vil være med på reisen med kunden og optimalisere kundens  forretningsprosesser  ved hjelp av gode visualiseringer.      Dine ansvarsområder    Forme og skape  skreddersydde BI-løsninger  som gir verdifull innsikt for våre kunder  Utvikle kundeforhold ved å forstå kundens behov og optimalisere  BI-dashboards,  rapporter eller andre  visualiseringspresentasjoner   Rapportering og sikre live dataanalyse, samt hente ut data for å bedre forstå kundens trender og mønstre, og  implementere strategier  for datainnsamling og ulike teknologier  Identifisere muligheter for å drive og optimalisere kundens forretningsprosesser og samarbeide med teamet for å implementere disse endringene på en effektiv måte       Gode datainnsiktsløsninger krever mange slags kompetanser og vi ser etter kollegaer som:    Tidligere vært i en kundeorientert rolle, gjerne som konsulent  Har høyere utdannelse innen IT eller økonomi  Evner å vekke data til live gjennom  intuitive visualiseringer  og  rapporter   Dypdykker i dataene for å finne årsakssammenhenger, avvik og alltid fokuserer på  forretningsverdi  og formål  Har kjennskap til  ETL-verktøy  (Synapse, ADF, SSIS), kuber og datamodellering,  skybaserte løsninger  (Azure, AWS, Snowflake, Google)       Vi ser gjerne at du er:     Analytisk  med et ønske om å utvikle deg teknisk  Kreativ og stadig på jakt etter  innovative   løsninger    Srukturert  og har høyt fokus på datakvalitet og –sikkerhet      Vi ser etter både  arkitekter ,  utviklere  og  analytikere . Gjerne at du jobbet noen år med BI-løsninger allerede, men vi er også åpne for å ansette deg som ønsker å ta steget inn i en spennende verden med BI-prosjekter.      Som en del av Inmeta tilbyr vi:     Kompetansehevingsmuligheter , samt konferanser nasjonalt/internasjonalt  Bedriftsreiser en gang I året, i mai reiser vi til  Sevilla   Jevnlige sosiale og faglige arrangementer, Hack-a-thon  Bedriftsavtale med Sats og andre gode rabatter  Samarbeid i  tverrfaglige team  med våre anerkjente data scientister, systemutviklere og sikkerhetseksperter.  Muligheten til å delta i  globale utviklingsteam , som en del av Crayon-konsernet       Hvem er vi?    Inmeta er et IT-konsulentselskap med mer enn 250 ansatte i Norge.  Vi er en del av Crayon Group som har hovedkontor i Oslo. I tillegg har vi kontorer i Trondheim, Bergen og Hamar. Vi er et solid fagmiljø innen forretningsrådgivning, design, utvikling, data og AI og vi bistår virksomheter hele veien fra strategi til realisering av verdi. Vi tilbyr en kultur der du vil bli «sett» og verdsatt av et tverrfaglig miljø.     Du kan være med på å tilføre verdi gjennom kunnskap og kreativitet. Vi tilbyr faglig og personlig utvikling, konkurransedyktige betingelser og utfordrende og meningsfylte oppdrag. Vi er opptatt av en bærekraftig utvikling og ønsker å bruke vår digitale kompetanse for å bidra til et mer bærekraftig samfunn!

title: Data analyst | Deals (M&A) | CDI | H/F
skills: Skills: Microsoft Power Query, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: La Data n’est pas qu’un buzzword chez PwC. C’est une communauté, réunissant déjà 300 experts. Le vrai plus, c’est que cette communauté est sans frontières ! Nos collaborateurs travaillent au quotidien avec tous les métiers et avec notre réseau international. Et pour être au top de l’innovation, on a ce qui se fait de mieux en matière d’environnement de travail et d’outils technos : datalab, delta room, intelligence artificielle, machine learning…   Résultats ? Une activité multipliée par 2 en 3 ans (et ce n’est pas fini), une expertise reconnue et une position de leader en France.   Bienvenue au cœur du big bang !   Avec 300 professionnels, le pôle Deals (M&A) accompagne les entreprises et fonds d’investissement dans leurs projets d’acquisition, de cession, de restructuration, ou de prise de décisions stratégiques.   Dans ce contexte, l'équipe Deal Analytics, en fort développement, réalise des analyses approfondies afin d'apporter des éclairages nouveaux à ses clients, à tous les stades d'un processus M&A.    Ce que vous pouvez attendre de nous :    Vous prenez part à des projets variés, inscrits dans le temps du Deal (4 à 8 semaines) et êtes impliqué dans les domaines suivants :      Apporter un nouveau regard sur la performance de l'entreprise, par exemple : Exploiter des données transactionnelles pour analyser certains axes de rentabilité, mener des analyses prédictives    Exploiter des données externes, afin de les coupler aux données de l'entreprise et ainsi élargir le champ des analyses pertinentes    Utiliser la Data Visualisation pour explorer le résultat des analyses      Vous êtes le moteur du développement de l'équipe :      Travailler au sein d'une équipe jeune, dynamique et être pleinement impliqué dans les décisions de l'équipe    Travailler en autonomie, inventer de nouvelles manières d'aborder les problèmes, interagir avec le client et partager ses réalisations    Participer à des événements internes et externes (conférences, forum ou présentations écoles etc.)      Vous êtes le moteur dans la mise en œuvre de nouvelles approches au sein de nos équipes Transactions:      Former les équipes à de nouvelles méthodologies et compétences    Accompagner les équipes dans le cadre des projets Transactions       Ce que nous pouvons attendre de vous :        Vous êtes diplômé(e) d’une école d’ingénieur ou d’école de commerce avec spécialisation data et des connaissances en finance d’entreprise    Vous avez d’excellentes capacités analytiques et de résolution de problèmes complexes    Curiosité, proactivité, ouverture, flexibilité et créativité vous définissent    Vous avez d’excellentes capacités de communication et fortes qualités relationnelles    Vous maîtrisez Excel    Vous avez la volonté de participer au développement d’une équipe en plein essor, goût entrepreneurial    You speak English very well      Seraient un plus :      Une connaissance des modules data avancés d'Excel (PowerQuery, PowerPivot)   Une première expérience avec un outil de visualisation (Tableau, PowerBi)   Une première expérience avec Python et/ou R       Ces avantages que nous vous offrons :        Flexibilité avec la charte FlexWork : télétravail étendu, mobilité géographique, FlexTime , Dress for your day    Pass mobilité durable pour couvrir vos dépenses de mobilité durable    Programme Be Well, Work Well pour prendre soin de sa santé (partenariat Gymlib, application United heroes, associations sportives, formations mindfulness…)    Programme Family Care pour vous accompagner dans vos projets de parentalité comme dans les moments difficiles    Écosystème de santé pour trouver à qui parler, être écouté et aidé quelles que soient vos difficultés professionnelles ou personnelles    Crédit de 3 jours par an sur le temps de travail pour des missions d’engagement sociétal    Mobilité interne et internationale possible à partir de 18 mois d’ancienneté    Crystal Park (site de Neuilly-sur-Seine) : parc privatif de 2 hectares, conciergerie, salle de musique, salle de sport, Café Joyeux…    Programme New World. New Skills pour monter en compétences sur les enjeux de demain (ESG, technologies, inclusion des diversités) et plateforme Vantage de formation à la demande    Et aussi : RTT, mutuelle santé et prévoyance, restaurants d'entreprise et titres-restaurants, avantages du Comité Inter-Entreprises…        Toutes nos offres sont ouvertes aux personnes en situation de handicap

title: Data Analyst (Assortment)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Company Description    AUTODOC company, the European e-commerce leader in sales of auto parts, is looking for a Data Analyst in the Assortment department.   The Assortment Analyst will work directly with the category management team and be responsible for analyzing consumer and category data to provide business insights and recommendations to improve sales, operations, and category productivity.   To be successful in the position, requires balancing assortment analytics with technical skills, and the understanding of business units strategies.    Job Description      Responsibilities        Analyze assortment to provide recommendations aligned to category management strategy  Provide analysis and insights to determine category trends and improve category performance.   Data mining, data integration, trend analysis, and custom analytics for category management.  Estimate the business impact of pricing and assortment initiatives and help to build business cases for them.  Develop automated and interactive dashboards/reports that support business stakeholders' needs and allow them to make decisions quickly.  Partner with the Data Engineering team to define and build reliable data sources.      Requirements       3+ years of analytical experience in e-commerce, retail, or other relevant industry.  Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze data and translate it into insights and recommendations.  Bachelor's degree in any related field.  Proficiency in SQL, Python, and Excel.  Proven experience designing and enhancing dashboards using BI tools.  Experience turning complex data results into meaningful visualizations with clear insights  Good communication skills, and ability to communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Fluent English.       What do we offer?      Competitive salary based on your professional experience  Stable employment in the fast growing international company  Wide benefit system  Dynamic work environment  Ability to influence business and its results  Professional growth — you will attend free external and internal courses  Paid business trips and payment for participation in conferences  Paid corporate language classes (English, German, Polish)      Join us today and let’s create a success story together!

title: Wavemaker I Data Analyst with Python
skills: Skills: Математика, Agile Software Development, +8 more
job_description: Data Analyst with Python     About Us    Wavemaker is a billion-dollar revenue agency that sits at the heart of GroupM and WPP. Our ambition is to be the most distinctive and admired media, content and technology agency in the world.   Wavemaker’s global research and development team, located in Warsaw, is a group of more than 30 software developers and data scientists, developing tools and solutions for the whole agency. We are mainly cooperating with our colleagues in USA, Canada, UK, France, Germany, Italy, Australia, China and India.    We Are Looking For    We are looking for a data analyst who is especially fluent in working with multiple, often unstructured, data sources. This post will be part of the data science team striving to make best use of the agency’s, clients’ and third-party data and technology to optimize the ROI of client’s digital investment.   This will be achieved through developing working relationships with Wavemaker media planning teams around the world, mapping existing processes, finding optimization opportunities and supporting the delivery of new solutions, all aligned to the development team’s vision and standards.   The ideal applicant does not necessarily have to be proficient with Python or digital marketing from the day one. We are looking for candidates who are data-savvy, quick and eager to learn, have decent people skills and flourish in a constantly changing environment.   Bachelor’s degree, preferably with a concentration in mathematics, statistics, econometrics or data science is preferred.    Requirements     Musts      Intermediate knowledge of Python  Decent verbal and written English skills  Exceptional organizational skills, multi-tasking capabilities and detail-oriented  Strong analytical abilities and quantitative skills, including math proficiency  Experience of working with digital data sources  A passion for process efficiency, and making things better   Nice to Haves      Experience in the (digital) media industry  Familiarity of R and/or Julia  Familiarity of SQL  Experience of working with version control systems, e.g. Git  Experience of working with in-house IT teams and/or managing external suppliers  Experience in agile software development      We Offer      Competitive salary, depending on your skills and experience  Professional development in a role of either data scientist or software developer  FTE contract  Flexible working hours  Possibility to work part-time remotely (work from home)

title: Data Analyst Telco
skills: Skills: Английский язык, PowerPoint, +8 more
job_description: Advanced Global Solution AGS S.p.A. è una solida azienda italiana con una ventennale esperienza nella consulenza IT e nella realizzazione di soluzioni applicative custom, sistemi di Automation e Industrial IOT per la digital trasformation d’impresa.  Dal 2019 è inoltre General contractor e tramite la sua controllata Pessina Costruzioni S.p.A. offre soluzioni di efficientamento energetico, facility management e riqualificazione edilizia civile, industriale e della pubblica amministrazione.  La Divisione Industry include Elkar, Plastidite e Trend. Elkar è specializzata nella produzione di lastre MATERICA per facciate termoventilate, Plastidite nella produzione di lastre PMMA mentre Trend trasforma e taglia lastre e blocchi di materia polimerica in prodotti finiti utilizzati in vari ambiti.  L’azienda ha oltre 680 dipendenti e sedi operative a Milano e Roma più tre sedi produttive in provincia di Bergamo, Lecco e Trieste.  Presso la sede direzionale di Pero è presente il centro internazionale di Ricerca e Sviluppo composto da professionisti del mondo accademico e esperti del settore, che collaborano on il PoliMi su progetti in diversi ambiti applicativi dall’Intelligenza Artificiale ai materiali costruttivi.  L’azienda serve circa 200 clienti con un portafoglio di servizi ricco e differenziato per aiutarli a navigare in un contesto di business sempre più dinamico e complesso. Nel 2021 ha raggiunto ricavi annui per 141 milioni di euro.  Per maggiori informazioni, visita il sito www.ags-it.com.     All’interno della nostra divisione Consulting siamo alla ricerca di un  Data Analyst Telco  per clienti leader nel settore Finance, Pharma, Telco, Digital, Farmaceutico, Medicale e Automotive.      Attività:       Produrre analisi e dashboard  Confrontarsi con i dipartimenti interni al Team Technology per indirizzare e supportare il processo di network capacity  Gestione ed evoluzione il prodotto di capacity planning  Raccogliere feedback dai clienti interni e seguire il fornitore per le implementazioni  Definire i KPI di performance e QoS       Cosa richiediamo:       Laurea magistrale in materie scientifiche, preferibilmente ingegneria.  Conoscenza approfondita dei prodotti applicativi di Excel e PowerPoint e del pacchetto Office in generale  Conoscenza base di SQL per scrivere query  Capacità analitiche e di sintesi  Buona conoscenza dell’Inglese       Soft Skills:    Orientamento al Team Working e spirito collaborativo;  Proattività e doti di problem solving;  Capacità di organizzazione e pianificazione: rispetto delle scadenze e tempi di progetto  Flessibilità e proattività  Curiosità e aggiornamento verso nuovi trend tecnologici       Cosa offriamo:    Inserimento nella nostra divisione Consulting;  AGS Academy con programmi di formazione per favorire l’aggiornamento continuo e la crescita professionale;  Possibilità di accedere a numerose convenzioni bancarie, finanziarie, beauty, travel e restaurant;  Inserimento in un Team di AGS con possibilità di smart working  Possibilità di crescita professionale;  Campagna incentivi e bonus in base alla qualità dell’attività lavorativa svolta;  Assunzione con contratto a tempo indeterminato (RAL commisurata alla seniority) / p.iva         Il presente annuncio si rivolge ai candidati di ambo i sessi (L. 903/77).

title: Junior Insight Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Interpretation, Презентации, +8 more
job_description: Job Description     ABOUT THIS JOB    The role will be analytical support for senior team members and Client Business Partners. An Insight Analyst will be in support of 1 or several clients. This role will be part of an International Community with the expectation to be connected with other Support Centre Analysts and the broader International Analytical Community in order to encourage best practice sharing & collection.    Responsibilities      Assists with the execution of projects by compiling, analyzing, and interpreting sales data, writing client reports, and constructing presentations  Analyzes and interprets sales data and consumer data  Summarizes data in tables, charts, and graphs reviews data for errors and inconsistencies  Draft reports and presentations with simple data interpretation (category overview as well as issue-based)  Set up and refresh cyclical reports  Support Client Business Partners and Nielsen Local Teams on quotations requested from Client  Connect as appropriate with the broader international analytic community for best practices approach understanding and sharing      a Little Bit About You    Curiosity drives your interest in what moves the market. You find potential in percentages. Managing time and deadlines comes naturally to you.    Qualifications      University degree in Marketing, Economics or related field a must  Strong numerical, analytical and written presentation skills  Very good knowledge of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint  Very good written and spoken communication skills in English  Results-oriented personality and ability to work to tight deadlines  Strong interpersonal skills in a multicultural setting  Ability to work both independently and as an enthusiastic team player  Comfortable working in a virtual environment  Interest in the FMCG industry  Power BI expertise is an asset      Additional Information     About NIQ    NIQ, the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, reveals new pathways to growth for retailers and consumer goods manufacturers. With operations in more than 100 countries, NIQ delivers the most complete and clear understanding of consumer buying behavior through an advanced business intelligence platform with integrated predictive analytics. NIQ delivers the Full View.   NIQ was founded in 1923 and is an Advent International portfolio company. For more information, visit NIQ.com   Want to keep up with the latest updates on our business and #LifeAtNIQ? Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook    Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion    NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.   We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.   Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/    NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

job_description: Détail de l'offre      Informations générales      Entité de rattachement   Nous sommes une ESN agile, un groupe international certifié Top Employer Europe 2023.  A l'ère de la post-transformation digitale, nous mettons tout en œuvre pour que chacun de nos 27 000 athlètes du digital puisse se renouveler perpétuellement, en vivant positivement son propre flow digital.  Chacun de nos talents peut ainsi façonner son parcours de carrière selon ses appétences, entreprendre de manière pragmatique avec ses clients pour un monde à impact positif, innover localement dans 27 pays et harmoniser son investissement professionnel et son bien-être personnel.  Rejoignez Inetum. Live your positive digital flow.  Tous nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes en situation de handicap. job_description: Who are we ?       The Positive Thinking Company is a global tech partner that delivers end-to-end tech solutions. As a Positive Thinker you...  · Speak fluently  Dutch or French  and have a good knowledge of  English .  · Have at least  3 years of experience  as a BI developer/analyst.  · Will be an outstanding candidate if you share our values: Positive thinking, Collaboration, Evolution, Commitment.  · Hold a degree in Computer science or Economics, but above all we are looking for a passionate person who can present a project that he/she is proud of 😉       What will you do ?       As a BI specialist, you oversee different phases on the whole BI chain.  You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients and sectors and on a daily basis you will:  · Collect requirements from the business  · Identify and collect the data from different data sources  · Develop, design and implement ETL solutions and data storage systems, through your knowledge of ETL tools (Informatica, Data integrator, Talend, SSIS …)  · Model Data (datawarehouse, data vault, data marts), CDC, Data Lake  · Integrate data in the data warehouse and create data marts  · Ensure the data quality and analyse data  · Present reports and create insightful information and help managers make better data-driven decisions, through your knowledge of reporting tools (Tableau, SAP BI, Power BI, Qlik…)  · Provide expertise advice for the continuous improvement of the data capabilities     The technical environments available with our customers are:  SQL, Oracle (Data integrator, OBIEE...), Informatica, Microsoft (SSIS, SSRS, SSAS), Azure SQL, Amazon Redshift, PosgreSQL, Talend, Alteryx, IBM (Datastage, Cognos), Kimball, DataVault, SAP (SAP BI, Data integrator) …      On top of that, you could be involved in our solution centres where we develop tailored solutions for our clients. For some concrete examples of projects, check our uses cases: https://positivethinking.tech/use-cases/?exp%5B%5D=expertise-data-analytics)       What are we offering you ?       -  EVOLUTION   o Personal follow-up during your career at PTC  o Catalogue with a wide variety of trainings for hard- and soft skills, private language classes, unlimited access to an E-learning platform (Udemy, Pluralsight, DataCamp…) and possibility to get certified every year  -  COLLABORATION   o Opportunity to join the BI community and participate in knowledge sharing sessions, events, workshops, etc.  o Join one of the passion communities and practice your hobby or share your interests with other positive thinkers  o International collaboration, possibility to work worldwide  -  ON TOP OF THAT:   o Competitive salary with a flexible mobility package (variety of choice, including: Electrical cars, electrical bikes, payment of rent/mortgage...)  o You will become part of a growing team of people keen on applying the latest technologies and knowledge. You will be able to work in a dynamic, innovating environment with the proper touch of geekiness and yearning for board games.

title: Data Analyst (Mobile)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Google Analytics, +8 more
job_description: ABOUT US    Hostelworld Group PLC a ground-breaking social network powered OTA focused on the hostelling category, with a clear Mission to help travellers find people to hang out with.  Our Mission statement is founded on the insight that the vast majority of travellers go hostelling as a means to meet other people; which we facilitate through a series of Social features on our platform that connect our travellers in hostels and cities based on their booking data.     To date the strategy has been extraordinarily successful: accelerating revenues beyond pre pandemic levels, generating significant word of mouth from our customers, and strong endorsements from our Hostel partners. As a consequence, we expect to serve almost 8M travellers on our platform with a GMV in the range of €500M in 2022; and continue to grow GMV to €700M+ by 2025. More details of our growth strategy and our significant growth ambitions are available in our recent Capital Markets Day presentation on our corporate website.     Founded in 1999, Hostelworld is a well-known trusted brand with 250 employees across 11 countries; hostel partners in 170 countries; and a strong commitment to building a better world in all that we do. In particular, our focus in the last few years has been on improving the sustainability of hostelling industry, through our membership of the Global Sustainable Tourism Council (GSTC); our active involvement in the Global Tourism Plastics Initiative (GTPI); our partnerships with Bureau Veritas to establish emissions benchmarks for the hostelling industry; and our recent partnership with the South Pole to offset all our greenhouse gas emissions in 2021 and 2022.     Hostelworld is listed on the London Stock Exchange, Dublin Euronext and is an Investors in Diversity accredited employer.      THE OPPORTUNITY   The company’s highly valued culture is characterised by collaboration, innovation, respect, communication and smart thinking. The senior management team has managed to maintain the positive characteristics of a start-up ethos, combined with a professional and mature approach to growing and scaling as a publicly listed business.  Working at Hostelworld means working in a global company defined by an innovative culture, collaborative teams and professional growth; this is what we offer our employees. And, importantly, we recognise their efforts and reward their achievements.      THE ROLE & TEAM   We have a matrixed structure here at Hostelworld; with Growth teams comprising of people across Technology, Product, Marketing and Analytics & Insights – all working towards one common goal and with aligned objectives.  Our Growth units use an extensive range of data sources to track the full user journey to understand what is going well for our users, where we can optimise and what to build next. As the Mobile Analyst you will be key to these data driven decisions, working within our Mobile Growth unit, enabling the team to apply insights you derive from mobile/app analytics to improve customer experience.   In this role, while you are embedded in the Mobile growth team, you are a member of the centralised Analytics team, reporting to the Head of Growth Analytics (with a dotted line to the Head of Mobile). The Analytics function will provide you with a range of supports to build out your analytics toolkit as well as membership with the Analytics Institute of Ireland.      WHAT YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR    You will report directly into our Head of Growth Analytics and work with our Mobile Growth Team in discovering opportunities for growth in mobile native apps. This includes working with our product team to deliver insights from Firebase/Segment and driving action with our marketing executives with insights from Branch data.   Implement tracking and create user journey datasets using the data available to you from Branch, Google Analytics, Firebase, Segment etc.  Create insights and reporting on user journeys, user behaviours, and long-term trends in the adoption of our products to identify opportunities for growth.  Analyse the results of experiments to determine what should launch or not. Learn from and iterate on those experiments by identifying additional opportunities to drive growth  Keep the company up to date on overall user analytics metrics through dashboards and regular team updates.  Collaborate with stakeholders across the organization to establish the highest business priorities and opportunities by measuring expected reach and impact.  Collaborate and share learnings with wider analytics team to ensure consistent analytics standards and rigour is applied to in all use cases.       WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR    3+ years’ experience with quantitative data analysis.  2+ years’ experience working collaboratively with product team members such as: product management, engineering, design, data science, data engineering etc.  2+ years’ experience with product optimization i.e., funnel/website optimization and/or outbound communication channels like email or push notifications.  2+ years direct experience using web analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, Firebase, Branch, Adobe Analytics, Tableau, Segment, etc) and other tools to extract, analyse, and visualize data.  Experience in making analytical, data-driven decisions and communicating the results of analyses.  Advanced SQL experience (querying both structured & unstructured data types)  Experience in statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, product experimentation, regressions, experimentation logic and biases).  Highly analytical mindset with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data.       We welcome applications from all backgrounds and commit to ensuring equal opportunities for everyone.

title: Data Analyst - Scores & Etudes
skills: Skills: High Level Of Accuracy, Статистика, +8 more
job_description: Intégré(e) à la Direction Finance, Données & Acceptation, au sein du Service Modélisation Risque & Valorisation Clients, vous contribuez, dans le respect de la réglementation et des normes Groupe, au développement des activités : à l’accroissement du volume d’encours et à la maitrise des risques associés, en garantissant l’optimisation des actions Risque et Marketing, et en assurant la mise en œuvre d’outils d’aide à la décision depuis l’octroi jusqu’au recouvrement (en passant par l’engagement Client).          Pour cela :      - Vous élaborez des modèles statistiques (scores / algorithmes), en définissez les usages en lien avec les métiers, et en assurez le suivi régulier (backtest) permettant d’évaluer leur efficacité.  Vous produisez des études (bilans / mesures d’impact) permettant d’apporter les éclairages nécessaires au bon fonctionnement et pilotage des activités.  Vous réalisez des tableaux bord, les analysez et les faites évoluer, en ayant un rôle d’alerte au regard des tendances observées.     - Vous contribuez à l’évolution des règles et normes afin d’optimiser la production et maintenir un niveau de risque sous contrôle, en préconisant des ajustements ou nouvelles mesures, et en orchestrant leur mise en œuvre.  Vous participez également au développement de nouveaux produits / nouvelles fonctionnalités (règles et recommandations).     - Vous assurez la mise en production et la maintenance évolutive des systèmes experts dans un moteur de règles (programmation), et vous rédigez les différentes documentations associées.     - Vous garantissez la pertinence des données dans le Système d’Information et participez à son évolution.  Vous contribuez au développement de la stratégie Data, et participez à la veille technologique.     Profil recherché :   - Issu(e) d’une formation supérieure (Bac+5) en Statistiques, vous maîtrisez SAS, la manipulation des bases de données, et les techniques de modélisation / scoring. La connaissance des environnements Big Data & Data Science est un plus.  - Idéalement, votre parcours professionnel vous a permis d’acquérir des connaissances dans le domaine de la gestion du risque client.  - Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre rigueur, votre sens de l’organisation, et votre capacité d’analyse. Vous démontrez des capacités d’adaptation, et possédez une réelle aptitude à travailler en équipe. Vous êtes force de proposition, et faites preuve d’ouverture d’esprit et de curiosité.

title: Data Analyst, Metrics & Reporting
skills: Skills: Визуализация данных, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Job Description & Summary  As a Data Analyst on the Assurance Technology Metrics & Reporting team you will play a critical role in the data investigation, wrangling, and visualization processes within our reporting delivery pipeline. Working directly with our business and internal stakeholders you will be responsible for managing the reporting request intake process, scheduling and leading requirements gathering and data onboarding sessions with various stakeholders, creating final reporting deliverables, and managing report update and decommission requests. You will be expected to adhere to all internal and external data and privacy guidelines, and to maintain a broad knowledge of various data extraction techniques and data sources. You will also be expected to maintain a broad knowledge of various data visualization and reporting techniques, leveraging human centered design principles in report creation and delivery.   Responsibilities     Communicate effectively with internal teams and stakeholders both virtually and in-person, including communication with both technical and non-technical team members   Create and deliver best practice recommendations in data wrangling and visualization best practices.   Proactively understand and adhere to all internal and industry standard data privacy and protection practices.    Work with agility in meeting rapidly changing deadlines and shifting priorities   Work collaboratively with reporting team members to deliver high quality reporting solutions.   Create and maintain a data dictionary of all available data sources, and their attributes.    Maintain and review report level data access on a routine basis   Work with Quality Assurance teams and business stakeholders to validate data and visualization output for accuracy and completeness     Minimum Requirements     Experience working with data warehouses, including data warehouse technical architectures, infrastructure components, ETL/ELT and reporting/analytic tools and environments.   Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, or equivalent practical experience.   2 years of experience in Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Analytics, Data Visualization or an equivalent position.   Experience in collecting requirements from business stakeholders    Experience combining data from multiple sources and presenting the data in visually appealing and understandable format leveraging PowerBI   Experience with DAX and Power Query, PowerBI Report Builder, and experience with creating and maintaining paginated reports   Experience deploying and maintaining dashboards on the PowerBI Service    Experience with PowerBi, Tableau, and various other data visualization tools    Experience utilizing insights to drive business decisions at all levels of an organization.   Ability to translate complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience.   Excellent communication skills.   Experience with data querying languages (i.e SQL, Python, R, etc)     Preferred Requirements     Experience with Microsoft Data Factory, Microsoft SQL Server, Azure Storage Accounts, Microsoft Power Platform, On-Prem data Gateways and Data Flows.   Azure - Azure Data Factory, Pipelines, integration tools, Function apps & App Services, Azure Blob Storage (having 3 of these or more would be amazing!)      Our offer     Work flexibility - openness for your preferences regarding contract form (B2B or employment contract), hybrid working model, flexible start of the day, workation, sabbatical leave and additional summer solutions (e.g. Slow Fridays)   Development and upskilling - our full support during onboarding process, mentoring from experienced colleagues, training sessions, workshops, certification co/financed by PwC e.g. Microsoft and Celonis and conversations with native speaker   Wide medical and wellbeing program - medical care package (incl. dental care, freedom of treatment, physiotherapy), various insurance packages (incl. foreign travel insurance), coaching, psychological consultations, concierge for young parents, sports groups and more   Access to an online cafeteria where you may find i.a. vouchers (e.g. Zalando, Ikea, Allegro, Frisco), discounts for IT devices (e.g. Apple, Lenovo, Orange) and car purchase, Multisport card,   3 paid hours for volunteering per month   and when you start enjoying PwC as much as we do, you may get a financial bonus in exchange for recommending your friend to work with us. title: Alternance - Data Analyst - Data ETL & Visualisation (h/f/d)
skills: Skills: Социальные навыки, Visualization, +8 more
job_description: Job ID:  32979   Site:  Toulouse   Grade  :  N/A  Vitesco Technologies est un des principaux équipementiers internationaux, spécialisé dans le développement et la fabrication de technologies de propulsion de pointe pour une mobilité durable. Avec des solutions systèmes intelligents et des composants pour les véhicules électriques, hybrides et thermiques, Vitesco Technologies contribue à rendre la mobilité propre, efficace et abordable. La gamme de produits comprend des moteurs électriques, des systèmes de contrôle électroniques, des capteurs, des actionneurs ainsi que des solutions de post-traitement des gaz d’échappement. En 2020, Vitesco Technologies a enregistré environ 8 milliards d’euros de ventes et emploie près de 40 000 personnes dans environ 50 sites dans le monde. Son siège est situé à Regensburg, en Allemagne.   L‘équipe :    Au sein de l’équipe Data Analytics de l’entité Engineering de Vitesco Technologies, nous mettons en œuvre les techniques Cloud, Big data, Data Analytics, Intelligence Artificielle, Web permettant la digitalisation du contrôle moteur des véhicules (automobiles, moto, …) et de la R&D.  Notre périmètre d’activité couvre les différents domaines de la donnée :    Acquisition des données : IoT, uploader    Stockage et transformation des données : technologies cloud (AWS,..)    Visualisation des données : Business Intelligence, Dashboarding, Analyse big data    Valorisation des données : intelligence artificielle, prédictive maintenance, enrichissement des données     Vous serez intégré dans une équipe jeune, dynamique, polyvalente et orientée solutions, organisée en méthode Agile (principalement SCRUM).   Contexte :    Dans le cadre de l'électrification du secteur automobile nous sommes amenés à développer de nouvelles technologies, de nouveaux composants.  L’augmentation du nombre de fonctionnalités et la validation de la robustesse des systèmes automobiles demandent une volumétrie de tests de plus en plus importante. Pour évaluer la performance et la robustesse des systèmes dans toutes les conditions réelles d’utilisation, des essais sur banc et des roulages de flotte de véhicules pré-série sont réalisés. Pour analyser une telle volumétrie de données des solutions big data sont déployées.   Mission :    Vous travaillerez au sein du pôle « Gestion des données de flottes véhicules ». Vos travaux porteront sur la transformation, l’analyse et la visualisation de données de flotte de composants dans l'objectif de fournir aux équipes projets des tableaux de bord (dashboards) et résultats d’analyse adaptées à leurs besoins.  Vos activités de développement :    Transformation, nettoyage, structuration des données (Python)    Création de dashboards de visualisation de données de flottes (outils Metabase, PowerBI)    Exploration de données, analyses statistiques    Adaptation du system d’alerting    Validation des développements     Les développements seront principalement réalisés en Python et SQL dans un environnement cloud AWS.  Vos activités de gestion de projet :    Comprendre les besoins des clients internes et définition des cahiers des charges    Assurer la communication avec les clients internes et synchronisation des activités      Durée  :  1 an  (Septembre 2023 - Septembre 2024, adpatable à +/- 1 mois)   Profil :      Bac +3 minimum    Dominante : Informatique / Data / Mathématiques    Notion en physique théorique    Technologie : Python, SQL, AWS    Langue : Français (bilingue) et Anglais (bon niveau)      Soft Skills :      Organisé    Curieux    Dynamique    Esprit d’équipe    Bon savoir être      #WEAREELECTRIFIED - Les + Vitesco Technologies   > Gymnase  > Télétravail  > Entreprise engagée dans la diversité & l’inclusion  > Médecin & service médical sur site  > Forfait d’indemnité kilométrique vélo  > 80 % remboursés sur les abonnements de transport  > Restaurant d’entreprise  > Conciergerie  > Entreprise « Parents friendly » (places en crèche, jours enfant malade, horaires flexibles)   Temps de travail:  Temps plein   Votre contact:  Clara Bidau

title: Data Analyst F/H
skills: Skills: Большие массивы данных, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: Depuis notre création en 1996, toutes nos collaboratrices et tous nos collaborateurs ont la même ambition: être l'opérateur qui fait grandir les relations humaines. Nous innovons au service de technologies qui font grandir les amitiés, les liens de famille, les histoires d'amour, les engagements solidaires, les projets collectifs. Nous avons créé le premier forfait illimité, nous avons lancé l'internet mobile. Chaque jour, nous redoublons d'efforts pour fournir un réseau encore plus puissant et étendu pour connecter tous les territoires. Nous sommes 9 500 artisans des liens humains, passionnés, au service de 25 millions de personnes partout en France. Nous sommes 9 500 engagés pour l'inclusion, tous différents : par notre parcours, notre métier, nos idées. Alors si pour vous faire grandir les relations humaines est un métier, on est fait pour être ensemble.    La Direction DPPS (Produits et Plateformes de Services), en innovation continue, a pour rôle de concevoir, développer et déployer les nouveaux produits et service du fixe du futur. Elle s'inscrit ainsi au coeur du business Fixe de Bouygues Telecom.  En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de l'intégration, du traitement et de l'analyse des données pour aider à prendre des décisions éclairées, améliorer l'efficacité opérationnelle et la qualité de service chez nos clients.   Vos principales missions seront les suivantes :  - Collecter, nettoyer, analyser, mettre en forme et interpréter des données provenant de diverses sources internes et externes. - Collaborer avec des équipes interfonctionnelles pour identifier les indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) et les objectifs de l'entreprise. - Utiliser des outils d'analyse de données et des logiciels de visualisation (tels que Excel, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI) pour traiter et analyser des ensembles de données volumineux. - Développer et maintenir des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des visualisations de données pour faciliter le suivi des performances, leurs dérives et la prise de décision. - Identifier les tendances, les anomalies et les opportunités d'amélioration dans les données et leurs croisements. - Présenter les résultats de l'analyse aux parties prenantes et formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les opérations et les performances. - Contribuer à des projets d'analyse prédictive pour anticiper les tendances et les problèmes potentiels.     A propos de vous  - Diplôme en informatique, statistiques, mathématiques, ingénierie ou dans un domaine connexe. - Expérience professionnelle en tant que Data Analyst, de préférence dans le secteur des télécommunications. - Solides compétences en analyse de données dans un environnement Big Data. - Maîtrise des outils et des langages de programmation pour l'analyse de données, tels que Excel, Hadoop (Hive, SQL), Python, R ou SAS, Spark, AIrflow - Expérience avec des logiciels de visualisation de données, tels que Tableau ou Power BI. - Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale, avec la capacité de présenter des données complexes de manière claire et compréhensible. - Capacité à travailler en équipe et à collaborer avec des collègues de divers services et niveaux hiérarchiques. - Connaissance du secteur des télécommunications et de ses tendances, défis et réglementations.   Le Cadre de Travail  Le Technopôle réunit une partie des équipes et favorise la collaboration ainsi que la créativité à travers une grande variété d'espaces sur place (CSE, salle de sport, nombreux points de restaurations et espaces de pauses, espace bien être, conciergerie, banque, etc.).   Les Avantages & Rémunération  Selon expérience, nous proposons un rémunération fixe annuelle brute sur 13,1 mois + intéressement / participation + avantages groupe variés + 2 jours de télétravail hebdomadaire.   Le Processus Recrutement  Entre 2 à 3 entretiens maximum qui vous donneront une vision précise du poste et de la culture réseau de Bouygues Telecom.  N'hésitez plus et rejoignez-nous !

title: Customer Data Platform Analyst
skills: Skills: Business Analysis, Управление проектами, +8 more
job_description: WHO ARE WE?    At Vertiv, we build products that keep critical technologies running 24/7. We are proud we were the first to protect mainframes with precision cooling systems. We were the first to introduce an integrated enclosure system to distributed networks. We help some of the largest names in the industry bring new capacity online faster and at a lower cost when search and social media increased demand for storage and computing. Our portfolio spans power, thermal and infrastructure management products, software and solutions, and is complemented by a network of nearly 250 service centers worldwide.        JOB SUMMARY    The position has control over all aspects of Vertiv Global Customer Data Platform (CDP) that combines data from multiple tools to create a single centralized customer database containing data on all touch points and interactions with Vertiv products or services. CDP database can then be segmented in a nearly endless number of ways to create more personalized marketing campaign. CDP Analyst will be responsible for the administration and support of Global CDP platform and processes that include design, importation, delivery, and support of all contents. This position will ensure that the platform is configured in accordance with defined data governance, and that data integrity is maintained.   He/She need to have a strong understanding of best CDP practices and be fully trained on the various features and operations of customer and contacts data.        ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:     Act as a subject matter expert (SME) for CDP in the development of business architecture framework, tools selection, design and development;  Provide CDP application troubleshooting, monitoring and problem resolution to all internal and external contacts;  Facilitate workshops around CDP to understand business user challenges, define process requirements and document future state process maps;  Write specs, manage project execution, and support the definition of system roll-out strategy including change management;  Plan and execute unit, regression, integration, and acceptance testing related to CDP System enhancements, changes, and upgrades;  Perform system administration of CDP including enabling/disabling users, assigning/creating/maintaining security roles, supporting and training business users, working with software vendor to resolve reported issues, and monitoring system performance;  Collaborate with multiple division and teams to migrate the required digital assets into CDP;  Identify and report opportunities to leverage CDP application to improve business processes, data governance and support efficiency efforts cross-functionally across the business;  Assist with change management and training initiatives related to CDP system;  Help form vision, roadmap, and goals for CDP system and integrated applications in line with the global strategy;  Ensure that solutions developed within the area of responsibility are aligned to enterprise architecture standards and principles, leverage common solutions and meet financial targets (cost and benefits).          INTERACTIONS:      Sales and Marketing Managers, Regional Marketing team, Sales Representatives;  Master Data Management team;  IT Management.        MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:      Ability to work independently with minimal direction including providing regular status on assigned activities;  Ability to engage, envision, and collaborate to build solutions that encompass the end to end processes;   Clear understanding of the application, supporting infrastructure, and systems integration;  Consulting approach, ability on understanding internal customer needs;  Ability to multitask and complete tasks in a timely manner;  Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented and metric-intense environment;  Familiarity with process design, design thinking, process re-engineering, lean and/or value stream mapping principles;  Project management skills.        BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:     Bachelor's degree with preference for Information Systems or Computer Science as field of study;   Strong business analysis, project management, and communication skills with 3+ years of experience in a company of similar size, revenue, complexity and geographic diversity;  Deep knowledge in Customer and Contacts management and data governance;  Experience in one CDP software platform and related processes is preferred.       Are  You  the one we are looking for? Perfect! Apply directly to this job ad and take the first step towards a career with Vertiv!

title: Data analyst
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Аналитические навыки, +8 more
job_description: Solliciteer direct     Veel uitdagende data projecten om je groei te boosten  Goede balans tussen werk en privé  Bijdragen aan de energietransitie      Waarom kiezen voor Eneco    Meer dan ooit vraagt de wereld om duurzame energie. Eneco loopt daarin voorop en wil in 2035 compleet klimaatneutraal zijn. Met voor alle klanten betaalbare energie, een uitstekende digitale service en een aanbod dat aansluit op hun behoeften. Zodat klanten hun energievoorziening zelf in de hand hebben, hun energierekening kunnen verlagen en hun CO2 voetafdruk verkleinen. Met ons team willen we de verwachtingen van onze klanten overtreffen. Kom jij ons meehelpen?    Dit ga je doen    Alle mogelijkheden van data uitnutten in het belang van onze klanten en Eneco. Dat is het domein van Analytics & Data driven marketing. We bouwen hard aan een data science platform waarmee we onze klanten kunnen helpen de juiste keuzes te maken in de energietransitie. Daarbij maken we gebruik van zowel offline als online gedragsdata en zetten we geavanceerde algoritmes in. Hierdoor helpen we onze klanten stappen te zetten op gebied van duurzaamheid.   Je speelt een belangrijke rol bij onze transitie, van commodity- naar dienstenleverancier. Als Data Analyst gebruik je grote verscheidenheid data en data science technieken om verbruik van onze energieproducten te analyseren. Zo houd jij onze businessmodellen up-to-date en draag jij bij aan het creëren van een optimale dienstverlening voor onze klanten.    Gaat dit over jou?    Je werkt samen als één team aan het waarmaken van één missie. Daarbij ben je proactief om te helpen de energietransitie te versnellen. Je creëert ruimte om inzichten en meningen met collega's uit te wisselen en neemt verantwoording om bij te dragen aan het gezamenlijke plan.   Om onze dienstverlening (nog) beter te maken, innovatieve pricing strategieën te bedenken en te implementeren en nieuwe bundels van commodity en non-commodity producten bij Eneco op de kaart te zetten, is lef, aanpakken en strategisch kunnen schakelen onmisbaar. Je bent een analyst met een stevige persoonlijkheid, die eenvoudig de verbinding tussen verschillende disciplines legt en conceptueel denkt. Je staat bekend om je haarscherpe analytische vermogen en je ijzersterke consultancy- en communicatieskills. Jij bent een positieve, overtuigende, sociale expert op je vakgebied, die:     een relevante wo-opleiding heeft afgerond, denk aan economie, econometrie, bedrijfskunde of bedrijfseconomie   4-6 jaar ervaring als data analyst   ervaring met dataverwerking en programmeertalen (SQL, R, Python)   ervaring met het bouwen van voorspel- & optimalisatie modellen is een pré  ervaring met Azure Devops, Airflow en Docker is een pré  ervaring in telco, energie of verzekeringsindustrie is een pré  een agile mindset combineert met denken, doen en humor goed in staat is om complexe materie simpel en begrijpend te maken      Je bent verantwoordelijk voor      Je maakt slim gebruik van beschikbare data, bouwt (voorspel) modellen en zorgt dat deze worden toegepast   Analyseren van energie verbruik van onze klanten met als doel financiële riscio's te mittigeren   Je verzamelt, analyseert en interpreteert cruciale informatie vanuit zowel inkoop- als verkoopmarkten en brengt de invloed hiervan op de tarieven van Eneco in kaart   Vanuit jouw expertise adviseer je management over het optimale prijsbeleid en marketeers van Eneco, Oxxio en Woonenergie over prijstellingen en proposities   Monitor en implementeer relevante prijs wijzigingen.      Dit worden je collega's    Onze marketing afdeling bestaat uit drie domeinen: Proposition marketing, Analytics & Data driven marketing en Customer Experience marketing.   De multidisciplinaire domeinen zijn ingedeeld in value streams en werken samen aan één doel: meerwaarde voor de klant creëren. Je werkt zelfstandig met veel kennis en ervaring om je heen. UX-designers die het idee vormgeven, developers die bouwen, propositie-marketeers die het idee uitdragen en productmanagers die het vermarkten. Een gloednieuw klantwaarde-model helpt ons daarbij. Op strategisch en tactisch, maar ook op operationeel niveau. Dat maakt onze marketing afdeling een richtinggevend kompas voor heel Eneco.   Op ons hoofdkantoor werk je in prachtig modern en licht gebouw, op een locatie die uitstekend bereikbaar is: op 2 minuten loopafstand van metro en treinstation Rotterdam-Alexander. Momenteel werken we allemaal thuis vanwege Corona. Als we weer gedeeltelijk naar kantoor gaan blijven we hybride werken. Je werkt dan 40% op kantoor en 40% dagen thuis. De andere dag bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken.    Dit hebben we je te bieden      Bruto jaarsalaris tussen de €46.000 en €70.000      Inclusief 8% vakantiegeld, goede pensioenregeling en ouderschapsverlof.     FlexBudget bovenop je brutosalaris     Laat het uitbetalen, koop extra vakantiedagen of spaar het op.     Alle kans jezelf te ontwikkelen     Eneco zet vol in op persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling.     Hybride werken, thuis of op kantoor     Je werkt 40% op kantoor en 40% thuis. De andere dag bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken.    Werken bij Eneco is voor iedereen    Onze klanten zijn divers, en wijzelf ook. Ruim 4.000 Eneco-talenten zorgen voor een open, fijne cultuur waarin iedereen kan groeien en bloeien. Zo creëren we de ideale voedingsbodem voor creatieve inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En die kunnen we goed gebruiken om onze ambitieuze missie waar te maken: klimaatneutraal zijn in 2035. Weet je wat het leuke is? Van talent hebben we bij Eneco nooit genoeg. Dus laat van je horen en solliciteer. Samen met jou gaan we voor duurzaam.    Werk dat werkt voor jou en het klimaat    Kies je voor een carrière bij Eneco, dan kies je voor ambitie, groei en kansen. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en het werk te doen zoals het bij jou past. Daar hoort ook een goede werk-privébalans bij. Je kunt je tijden flexibel indelen en deels thuiswerken als je functie dat toelaat.   Zo werk je aan je eigen toekomst, maar óók aan die van de wereld. Want samen met je 4.000 collega’s ga je voor die ene grote missie: klimaatneutraal in 2035. We helpen klanten sneller verduurzamen, bedenken innovatieve oplossingen en pakken kansen met beide handen aan. Doe je mee?    Zo gaat het verder     Meer weten over deze functie?    Houd er rekening mee dat het voor deze functie belangrijk is dat je de Nederlandse taal, in woord en geschrift, goed beheerst. Please note, it is important for this position that you have good command, both written and spoken, of the Dutch language.   Wil je meer weten over deze vacature bij Eneco? Remko Strik beantwoordt met plezier jouw vragen via 06-29606725. Voor meer informatie over de sollicitatieprocedure neem je contact op met Recruitment via [email protected]   Meteen solliciteren? Dat kan natuurlijk ook, via ons recruitmentsysteem. Klik op de 'solliciteer' button en stuur je cv met motivatie. Je ontvangt zo spoedig mogelijk een reactie.   Een online assessment kan onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure.   Met deze vacature willen wij zelf een nieuwe Eneco collega werven. Dit is dan ook geen oproep voor acquisitie.

title: Analytics Consultant – McKinsey Digital
skills: Skills: R, Решение задач, +8 more
job_description: Qualifications     Degree in a technical subject such as computer science, engineering, IT, hard sciences or mathematics; advanced degree is a plus  Programming experience in either Python or R  Outstanding records of academic and managerial or professional achievement  Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills  Strong record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting  Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment  Ability to work effectively with people at all levels in an organization  Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writing - in English; fluency in the local language is a plus  Willingness to travel      What You'll Do    You’ll work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants including data scientists and data engineers, playing an active role in all aspects of client engagement.  Your responsibilities will include gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.  You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as more formal training in your first few years. Additionally, you’ll receive guidance and support from your local office and practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.  Your role differs from our regular consultant position in that you will be taking a hybrid role of both a management consultant and a data scientist. This means you will work on projects focused on analytics and leveraging programming to conduct more advanced analyses.    Who You'll Work With    You will be based in our Copenhagen office as part of our McKinsey Digital practice.  Digital McKinsey brings together the best of McKinsey’s digital capabilities to help our clients use digital technology to transform their businesses. As part of this group, you’ll join a global team working on everything from IT modernization and digital strategy to agile, cloud and digital business building.  You’ll have the opportunity to work on projects across all industries and functions and will be fully integrated with the rest of our global firm, but have a focus on our more advanced projects in terms of analytics and digitalization. You’ll also work with colleagues from across McKinsey & Company, frequently in teams together with our data scientists and data engineers, to help our clients deliver breakthrough products, experiences, and businesses, primarily on technology topics but also non-technology topics.  Our office culture is casual, fun and social, with an emphasis on education and innovation. We have the freedom to try new ideas, experiment and are expected to be constantly learning and growing. There is also a strong emphasis on mentoring others in the group, enabling them to grow and learn.

title: Senior Data Analyst (f/m/d) - onsite or remote / home office
