title: Consultant AI & Data Analytics / Data Science (m/w/d) in Berlin
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: Du machst den Unterschied.  Ob im Business Audit & Assurance, Risk Advisory, Tax & Legal, Financial Advisory oder Consulting: Wir bei Deloitte unterstützen unsere weltweiten Mandanten dabei, sich kontinuierlich weiterzuentwickeln. Entdecke ein vielfältiges Arbeitsumfeld, das ständig in Bewegung ist und immer um ein Zentrum kreist: dich und dein Know-how. What impact will you make?   Du willst im Bereich  Risk Advisory – Digital Risk  Kunden bei einer sicheren Digitalisierung und dem erfolgreichen Einsatz agiler Methoden begleiten? Unser Team stellt Kunden kontinuierlich neue und etablierte Services zur Reduzierung der digitalen Risiken zur Verfügung und deckt dabei ein vielfältiges Leistungsspektrum ab. Sichere unseren gemeinsamen Erfolg und mach mit uns den Unterschied: als  Consultant AI & Data Analytics (m/w/d).    Standorte:  Düsseldorf  , Berlin  , Frankfurt (Main)  , Hamburg   und München .    Dein Impact:    Als Consultant AI & Data Analytics (m/w/d) berätst du Mandanten im Risikomanagement nachhaltig. In diesem Rahmen erarbeitest und setzt du innovative, cutting-edge Lösungen um.     Fachkompetenz: Du bringst deine Kenntnisse und kritisches Denken ein, um komplexe Probleme geschickt mit Technik zu lösen. Von der Handlungsempfehlung bis zur Umsetzung  Artificial Intelligence: Dein Fokus liegt auf diversen Leistungskernen und ihrem Einsatz: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, NLP, Computer Vision, Trustworthy AI  Aufgabenvielfalt: nicht nur AI, sondern alles, was dazu gehört – Data Management, Data Engineering, Data Science, Analytics… wir bieten Kunden ein breites Beratungsspektrum an  Technologie: Alles dreht sich um Big-Data und Cloud Technologien – vor allem Amazon Webservices (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure      Dein Skillset:      Abschluss in Informatik, Statistik, Finanz-/Wirtschaftsmathematik, Ingenieurwesen oder Naturwissenschaften, Know-how in Programmiersprachen und Analysewerkzeugen  Sicherer Umgang mit Python und Frameworks (sklearn, TensorFlow, Keras, Pytorch) oder R (bzw. Java, C++), Daten-Mgt (SQL, Spark, Hadoop) und Analyse-Tools (u.a. Qlik, Tableau)  Freude an komplexen Aufgaben und wie sie ebenso kreativ wie konzeptionell zu lösen sind – vor allem mit Daten und statistischer Modellierung  Winning Attitude, die sich im Tagesgeschäft in unternehmerischem Handeln, Wissbegierde und Kreativität sowie einer kunden- und teamorientierten Haltung zeigt  Reisebereitschaft sowie Deutsch und Englisch sehr gut in Wort und Schrift      Deine Chance:      Spannende Aufgaben in einem innovativen Umfeld mit hochmotivierten Kolleg:innen, die sich schon jetzt auf deine Impulse freuen  Gute Rahmenbedingungen mit attraktivem Gehalt und zahlreichen Zusatzleistungen, z. B. Firmen-Smartphone zur privaten Nutzung, Fahrradleasing und Corporate Benefits  Work-Life-Balance durch Remote-Working & Teilzeit, Sabbaticals, Mitarbeiter:innen-Events, Well-being Angebote wie z. B. Gesundheitstage, Kooperationen mit Fitness-Anbietern und den Familienservice, der dich bei privaten Herausforderungen unterstützt  Exzellente Weiterbildung in On- und Offline-Seminaren und im Rahmen der Berufsqualifikation, z. B. durch [bitte fachspezifisches Training einsetzen]  Vielfältige Gestaltungsräume und aktive Förderung einer inklusiven Unternehmenskultur – u. a. durch unsere globale Diversity & Inclusion-Initiative ALL IN und lokale Mitarbeiter:innen-Netzwerke      Bist du bereit? Mach mit uns den Unterschied!    Unser Recruiting-Team freut sich auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen (CV sowie Abitur-, Hochschul- und Arbeitszeugnisse) über unser Online-Formular. Ein Anschreiben ist nicht notwendig.    Gleiche Chancen für alle:  Wir freuen uns über Bewerbungen von Menschen, die so vielfältig sind wie wir – unabhängig von Alter, Behinderung, ethnischer Herkunft und Nationalität, Geschlecht, Religion, sexueller Orientierung oder sozialer Herkunft.  Noch Fragen?  Alle Infos zu unserem Bewerbungsprozess findest du in unseren   Bewerbungs-FAQs .    Job-ID: 37021

title: Analityk danych internetowych (wszystko.pl)
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Решение задач, +8 more
job_description: Tworzymy nowoczesną platformę sprzedażową, dedykowaną wszystkim sprzedawcom w Polsce. Nasza platforma e-commerce wszystko.pl będzie dawała możliwość sprzedaży produktów, każdemu, kto ma zarejestrowaną działalność gospodarczą. Podążając za najnowszymi trendami w e-handlu i wykorzystując doświadczenie technologiczne spółki Comarch - lidera branży informatycznej w Polsce, budujemy portal, który połączy sprzedawców z klientami. Na naszej nowej platformie zakupowej, użytkownicy będą mogli kupić produkty we wszystkich kategoriach, a właściciele biznesów online będą je sprzedawać bez ponoszenia dodatkowych kosztów (0% prowizji od sprzedaży). Nie czekaj, sprawdź ofertę i aplikuj!    PROFIL PRACOWNIKA    Wykształcenie wyższe  Bardzo dobra znajomość:   Google Analytics (GA4)  Looker Studio (wcześniej Google Data Studio)  Google Tag Manager  MS Excel   Umiejętność:   działania na dużych zbiorach danych (obsługa Big Query bądź innego narzędzia, znajomość SQL)  wyciągania wniosków i dawania insightów  posługiwania się metodami statystycznymi oraz zwięzłej prezentacji wniosków i wyników analiz  tworzenia raportów, analiz, prezentacji   Znajomość zagadnień z obszaru E-commerce, marketingu internetowego (SEO, SEM, trackowanie użytkowników, marketing automation, UX/CX, itp.)  Minimum 2 lata doświadczenia na podobnym stanowisku  Mile widziana - znajomość narzędzi powerBI/Tableau      TWOJE ZADANIA      Implementacja niezbędnych elementów i narzędzi (określanie celów, wdrożenie, konfiguracja, audyt) i koordynacja analityki prowadzonych działań digital marketing i e-commerce  Analiza konwersji na stronie i rekomendacje rozwiązań poprawiających konwersję  Prowadzanie bieżących analiz na podstawie zebranych danych  Ewaluacja działań digital marketingowych i e-commerce  Monitorowanie trendów rynkowych i działań konkurencji  Rekomendacja rozwiązań biznesowych na podstawie analizy danych  Analiza wyników w Google Analytics oraz wewnętrznych systemach biznesowych, tworzenie raportów  Udział w przygotowaniu strategii i realizacji działań marketingu internetowego zwiększających sprzedaż na marketplace  Analiza ruchu i zachowania użytkowników oraz monitoring efektywności działań marketingowych  Przygotowywanie raportów i wizualizacja danych, generowanie danych i baz z systemów analitycznych  Wsparcie, utrzymanie i rozwój rozwiązań oraz narzędzi w obszarze analityki internetowej  Wyciąganie wniosków na podstawie danych i przygotowanie rekomendacji      DLA CIEBIE      Praca w trybie hybrydowym (po okresie wdrożenia)  Elastyczne godziny pracy  Dostęp do prywatnej opieki medycznej dla Ciebie i Twojej rodziny  Indywidualny plan szkoleń i konferencji, dostosowany do Twoich potrzeb  Inspirujące zadania w ramach współpracy z doświadczonym zespołem programistycznym

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Cultural Affairs, Контроль качества, +7 more
job_description: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com        We are hiring freelance English-speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research, and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.         This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.         Requirements        Full Professional Proficiency in English  You must be living in Ireland for the last 2 consecutive years  Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Ireland  Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over.        Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.            Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?     Earn extra income  Access to our community well-being initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community        Don’t miss the chance to earn extra income working from the comfort of your own home. This is a great opportunity for you and your friends!         Access the link to apply:           https://telusinternational.headway.ai/searchResults/REQ_ID_2710/?org_id=2b98c4a4-4a39         Important reminder:    Please make sure that the email address on your CV matches the one you use to register. Also, the location on your device must be set up properly when creating an account website so we can validate your country of residence.

title: Junior Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: Job Title: Junior Data Analyst  Reports to: Insights Manager  Direct Reports: none  A role with Kooth is an exciting chance to join a fast growing business with a social purpose. Our mission is to provide welcoming and effective digital mental health support across the UK.  Working in partnership with the NHS and local authorities, we are already the UK’s largest digital mental health platform for young people aged 10-25. We are now rapidly expanding into supporting the UK adult population, providing corporate solutions to help build mentally healthy businesses, and expanding internationally.  Enable data driven decisions, clinical excellence and commercial success throughout Kooth, by the provision of data and insights via dashboards, reporting and pieces of analysis, using data manipulation and visualisation tools to access Kooth's data model.  Role Objective   Main responsibilities:     Support evidence based Product Development through analysis of service user behaviour  Enable commercial success through delivery of insights and narrative aligned to strategic communication  Support research team in the delivery of Clinical and Economic Evaluations  Provide data and insights to enable optimisation of clinical and service delivery processes  Optimise dashboards with new data points and improved functionality  Optimise data model through the addition of new data points and efficiency improvements, allowing for complex analysis and faster end use  Work closely with function leads and Insights Team colleagues, in translating insights requirements into work plans  Communicate progress, issues and blockers on tasks and projects     Requirements    Demonstrative experience using Tableau, and an awareness of Tableau Prep  Good understanding of Programming languages such as PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Python  Thorough visualization and data analysis skills  SQL experience  Good time management and strategic planning skills  High levels of attention to detail and accuracy when working   Passion for mental health   Excellent collaboration and communication skills  A degree in a relevant subject such as Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics     Benefits    28 days (plus Public Holidays)   Yearly professional training programmes structured around you   Pension contributions   Flexible remote working from home   Private medical insurance with AXA including, an EAP programme, 24/7 Telephone Mental Health & GP Support,    Annual company share option awards   Life Assurance (up to four times the amount of your annual salary)   Cycle to work scheme  Incapacity Income Protection

title: Danish Language Data Analyst - Barcelona
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Аналитические навыки, +8 more
job_description: Work Location : Barcelona, Spain   Work Schedule : Monday – Friday during regular business hours   Engagement Model : Long term   Languages Needed : Danish   Project   Duration:  Indefinite   Start Date : ASAP     We are looking for Danish Speakers to join us on a new innovative and interesting project to improve Artificial Intelligence and technology that makes our everyday lives better (i.e., speech or text recognition, input methods, keyboard/swipe technology, or other areas of human-machine interaction related to languages).      Role Summary   Language Data Analysts will focus on speech or text recognition, input methods, keyboard/swipe technology, or other areas of human-machine interaction related to languages.      Role  Responsibilities   Classify, sort, label, and annotate data   Job requirements   Role Requirements    Eligible to work in Barcelona  Idiomatic fluency in Danish  Advanced fluency in English (tests and training materials are in English)  No previous experience or training in the field is required - we will provide training  Ability to work onsite at our offices in Barcelona  Detail-oriented and comfortable with repetitive tasks  Team player      DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.     We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our department focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.     To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

title: Datový analytik
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Microsoft Office, +8 more
job_description: Do našeho týmu hledáme analytika tržních dat se zaměřením na náhradní díly v oblasti automotive!      Co bude Vaše náplň práce:       sledování trendů na trhu s náhradními díly pro osobní automobily  monitorování celosvětového ekonomického vývoje v automotive  předpověď vývoje automotive trhů  analýza a hodnocení vývoje poptávky pro náhradních dílech  vyhledávání a interpretace dat, které chybějí  vizualizace získaných dat a jejich prezentace       Jaký by měl být Váš profil:       SŠ/VŠ vzdělání  1-2 roky praxe v oblasti analýzy trhu výhodou  plynulý anglický jazyk - čeká Vás denní komunikace  znalost nástrojů MS Office (Power BI nebo Tableau, základy SQL, VBA, MS výhodou)  strategické a analytické myšlení  schopnost pracovat v týmu       Nabízíme:         zajímavou a velmi pestrou pracovní náplň  pracovní smlouvu na dobu neurčitou  flexibilní začátek/konec pracovní doby  možnost práce z domova  týden dovolené navíc = 25 dní  roční bonus  příspěvek na firemní stravování a na penzijní pojištění  příspěvky na sport, kulturu a zdraví v benefitním programu Cafeterie  vzdělávací kurzy, školení a firemní akce  zázemí a podporu velké nadnárodní společnosti      Těšíme se na Váš životopis v anglickém jazyce!

Co bude Vaše náplň práce:       sledování trendů na trhu s náhradními díly pro osobní automobily  monitorování celosvětového ekonomického vývoje v automotive  předpověď vývoje automotive trhů  analýza a hodnocení vývoje poptávky pro náhradních dílech  vyhledávání a interpretace dat, které chybějí  vizualizace získaných dat a jejich prezentace       Jaký by měl být Váš profil:       SŠ/VŠ vzdělání  1-2 roky praxe v oblasti analýzy trhu výhodou  plynulý anglický jazyk - čeká Vás denní komunikace  znalost nástrojů MS Office (Power BI nebo Tableau, základy SQL, VBA, MS výhodou)  strategické a analytické myšlení  schopnost pracovat v týmu       Nabízíme:         zajímavou a velmi pestrou pracovní náplň  pracovní smlouvu na dobu neurčitou  flexibilní začátek/konec pracovní doby  možnost práce z domova  týden dovolené navíc = 25 dní  roční bonus  příspěvek na firemní stravování a na penzijní pojištění  příspěvky na sport, kulturu a zdraví v benefitním programu Cafeterie  vzdělávací kurzy, školení a firemní akce  zázemí a podporu velké nadnárodní společnosti      Těšíme se na Váš životopis v anglickém jazyce!

title: Customer Insights Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
skills: Skills: A/B тестирование, Инвестиционно-банковская деятельность, +8 more
job_description: About Agoda    Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.     Get to Know our    Team:     The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.   Due to continued expansion,  there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:       Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.    Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap    Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders        What you’ll Need to    Succeed:        Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study    0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company    Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.    Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English    Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence    Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes    Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently        It’s Great if you    Have:        Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce    Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics    Strong presentation and negotiation skills      #entrylevel #STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco title: Data Analist - startersfunctie (Dutch speaking)
skills: Skills: Ad Hoc Analysis, Data Analytics, +5 more
job_description: Van leuk werk, komt goed werk !     Whooz is onbetwist marktleider en dat willen we graag blijven. Onze medewerkers hebben veel kennis en ervaring, zijn innovatief, hebben grote ambities en vooral veel plezier. Ons team bestaat uit enthousiaste medewerkers, die met elkaar zorgen dat we onze klanten nóg beter, efficiënter en daadkrachtiger kunnen helpen met het bereiken van hun doelen.      Whooz koestert een informele en nieuwsgierige cultuur waar mensen oprecht blij worden van data. Van leuk werk, komt goed werk, nietwaar? En als dit werk tot nieuwe toepasbare inzichten leidt, worden we al helemaal vrolijk. Dat verveelt nooit en dat merken we elke dag.       Puzzelen met data    De toepassing staat voorop    Zelfstandig in een team    Jezelf ontwikkelen door onze dienstverlening te ontwikkelen    Eigenwijs    Hybride werken      #WhoozLovingData          DATA ANALIST – startersfunctie      Kom jij net van hogeschool of universiteit en heb je zin om in de praktijk echt met data aan de slag te gaan, dan hebben we voor jou de juiste functie! Bij Whooz helpen we in een team met specialisten elke dag onze klanten om met data antwoorden te geven op marketing- en locatievraagstukken.     Dus puzzel jij graag met veel data en creëer je graag waarde voor onze klanten door data om te zetten naar inzichten? Dan ben jij wellicht degene die we zoeken.     Wat we bieden is een mooie functie waarbij je data bewerkt en analyseert om vervolgens waardevolle inzichten te creëren voor onze klanten. Niet de data, de tool of de methodologie staat voorop, maar de toepassing van de klant! Stap voor stap begeleiden we jou op een informele manier, zodat je leert hoe jouw analytische skills waarde brengen aan de hand van concrete vraagstukken binnen klantanalyse, -werving en -behoud.     Al snel voer je in het team van analisten zelfstandig en in teamverband analyses uit voor onze opdrachtgevers. Daarnaast doe je dataleveringen aan licentieklanten en ondersteun je onze klanten in het vinden van waarde in data. Je bent nauwkeurig en analytisch en vindt het leuk om concreet aan de slag te zijn met data en klanten.     We snappen dat je wellicht nog niet 100% weet wat je wil voor de rest van de carrière en daarom is er binnen Whooz altijd ruimte om aan de hand van je interesse en/of nieuwe vragen uit de markt nieuwe technieken te proberen en nieuwe toepassingen te ontwikkelen. Bijvoorbeeld door een nieuwe manier en/of vorm te bedenken waarop we inzichten generen voor onze klanten of door mee te werken aan de ontwikkeling van een nieuw product.     Het allerbelangrijkste voor ons is dat je echt enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en dat je altijd nieuwsgierig bent naar nieuwe inzichten. Aangezien veel van onze klanten werken in het marketingveld is het fijn als je affiniteit hebt met (online) marketingtoepassingen. Vanzelfsprekend ben je veel met data in de weer, maar je schroomt niet om aan de klant je gevonden inzichten te presenteren, je advies toe te lichten en proactief met hem mee te denken.         Wat bieden we        Onze medewerkers vinden het fijn dat er een informele sfeer en open cultuur heerst binnen Whooz, waarbij we binnen het team samen de klant helpen en onze doelen behalen. Ook is er altijd ruimte voor eigen inzicht en ideeën. Ben je een beetje eigenwijs? Helemaal goed want dat zijn wij ook. We bieden een marktconform salaris en bieden je ruimte om je binnen je werk te ontwikkelen. De meeste dagen werken we met elkaar op ons ruime kantoor nabij het centrum van Den Haag, maar er is zeker ook ruimte en flexibiliteit om een deel van de dagen thuis te werken.         Functie-eisen      Naast dat iemand met HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau zoeken, vinden we het belangrijkste voor deze functie is, dat je iedere keer weer enthousiast wordt van data en analyses en de mogelijkheden die deze bieden voor organisaties. Vanzelfsprekend is het wenselijk dat je beschikt over analytische vaardigheden (statistiek, clustering, modellering, dashboarding) en datamanagement vaardigheden (dataprocessen inrichten en runnen). Kennis van het toepassen van technieken, zoals web scraping en artificiële intelligentie, voor het verzamelen en genereren van data is een pré. Je bent daarnaast servicegericht, professioneel, zelfbewust, communicatief vaardig en kunt zelfstandig, maar ook samen werken. Voor communicatie met onze klanten is een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal een must.        Ben jij de oplossingsgerichte dataliefhebber die wij zoeken? Neem dan contact met ons op. Je kunt je motivatie en CV sturen naar info@whooz.nl t.a.v. Peter.      We zien bij Whooz absoluut de toegevoegde waarde van recruiters in sommige wervingstrajecten. Acquisitie en benadering door recruiters op basis van deze vacature wordt echter niet op prijs gesteld!

title: Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent German

job_description: Job Title:  Privacy Data Analyst - Fluent German      Work Type:  In Office      Location:  Alchemia Office, Gdańsk     The Privacy Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the privacy policies for our clients products by reviewing and processing privacy requests. As a Privacy Data Analyst, you will follow clear guidelines that allow you to make sound decisions. You will have a thirst for knowledge, impeccable judgment and be comfortable operating in a fast paced, dynamic environment.         DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES       Review and process incoming privacy requests through online tools in market language and for various other markets as required using translation tools  Evaluate validity of each request in line with our clients policies  Continually educate yourself about changes to policies and protocols  Work closely with our clients policy specialists to address complex privacy cases and regulatory inquiries using the clients response framework  Maintain a high level of quality in each case that you review  Achieve weekly productivity deliverables as part of daily workflow  Effectively collaborate with team members on a range of projects to improve internal efficiency and effectiveness  Develop skills in a number of different areas including data, tools and quality assessment for various markets as required using translation tools          REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE       B.A. or B.S. degree/masters or equivalent  1+ years professional experience working in online operations, privacy or legal support role  Fluency in written and spoken  English and German  language for this role is essential  Motivated by working in an environment that requires strong attention to detail  Excellent communication skills both verbal and written  Self-starter who is intellectually curious  Demonstrates ability to exercise impeccable judgment  Ability to work in a fast paced environment with high volume and complex demands  Ability to be flexible and adaptable to meet changing business needs  Intermediate I.T skills with the ability to quickly learn new tool       Competencies    Initiative  Solution Orientation  Collaboration  Organizational Commitment  Customer Focus  Teamwork  Results Orientated  Attention to detail  Problem Solving & Information Gathering  Resilience & Adaptability          WHAT WE OFFER:    Product Training and upskilling processes  Vibrant, multi-cultural environment  Career & Personal Development  Quarterly performance bonus  Subsidized Life Insurance  Private medical care package  Cafeteria program with wide range of employee benefits (including Multisport)  Internal Team and Wellness Activities  Work in a modern office environment with access to free snacks and drinks          Explore Majorel   The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.     Majorel is an equal opportunity employer that embraces diversity. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunities for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Majorel are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to gender, age, ethnicity, race, nationality, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status or any other basis as protected by local law.     Majorel and its employees do not tolerate, engage in or support Human Trafficking, Forced Labor or Child Labor of any kind through Majorel’s activities, including in its supply chain, or assist Majorel clients or any other party in doing so.

title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Growth
skills: Skills: Data-driven Decision Making, Модели данных, +8 more
job_description: Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.  A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.  Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.  As our new Decision Scientist in the Data Science & Analytics department (Growth domain), you’ll help Vinted achieve its mission of making second hand first choice worldwide. By solving complex problems you’ll improve the Vinted product and facilitate data driven decision making. You’ll be working on complex and strategic projects that will substantially impact the course of the company during this exciting phase of rapid growth. Growth domain at Vinted is focused on expanding our user base by optimising the user funnel, ensuring sellers are as successful as they can be, and taking care of efficient geographical expansion and marketing tools. The focus of this role will be on growing lister engagement.  You will be part of a cross-functional product team working alongside Product Owner, Designer and Engineers. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics, Growth and you will be part of the Vinted Data Science & Analytics Guild with fellow data roles from other domains (i.e. being part of the same guild, you will collaborate and learn alongside other Decision Scientists from other domains).  Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:   Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.   Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.   Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.     In this position, you’ll:   Be your team’s primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questions  Ensure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)  Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions   Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)  Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues  Enable stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)  Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests  Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses    About you:   Intermediate work experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist or Business Strategist or in a related position  Highly results-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes  A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences  Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills  Excellent written and spoken English  Strong interpersonal skills  A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field  Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)  Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)  Programming experience (Python/R/Scala)  Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques  Advantage: experience working in a tech company or in a cross-functional product development team  Advantage: 3+ years of working experience    Work perks:   Opportunity to join our share options programme  Learning budget (13.2 % from net yearly salary)   25 working days of holiday  Remote workout classes  Mental- and emotional-health support from Mindletic  Private health insurance   A canteen that serves homemade food at friendly prices  Monthly team-building events  A personal budget for shopping on Vinted  Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year  Dog-friendly office  Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided + a personal budget of up to 540 € for home workplace furniture)    We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.  Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.  The salary range for this position is   2,900 - 5,100 €  (gross) per month.  If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Online Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer    flexible work-from-home    opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are    part-time   , and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com      We are hiring freelance  English  speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local  geography .     This is a  freelance  position on a  flexible schedule  - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.     Requirements   Full Professional Proficiency in  English   You must be living in  The United Kingdom  for the last 2 consecutive years  Ability to follow  guidelines  and do  research  online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in  The United Kingdom   Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over.  Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a  long-term project  and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.      Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?   Earn extra income  Access to our community wellbeing initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community      For more information please contact sourcingteam22@telusinternational.ai

This is a  freelance  position on a  flexible schedule  - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.     Requirements   Full Professional Proficiency in  English   You must be living in  The United Kingdom  for the last 2 consecutive years  Ability to follow  guidelines  and do  research  online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in  The United Kingdom   Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over.  Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a  long-term project  and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.      Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?   Earn extra income  Access to our community wellbeing initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community      For more information please contact sourcingteam22@telusinternational.ai

We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    Get to know our team:     The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. title: Informatieanalist Cloud-applicaties
skills: Skills: Финансовые услуги, Управление вознаграждением работников, +8 more
job_description: Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging?  Heb jij een passie voor softwareontwikkeling en wil jij meewerken aan o.a. de doorontwikkeling van het klantportaal voor de leaseklanten van VWPFS? Ben je op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging vol diversiteit? Dan is dit dé baan voor jou! Als informatieanalist Cloud-applicaties bij Volkswagen Pon Financial Services hou jij je multidisciplinair bezig met de diverse applicaties en productlijnen van dit bedrijf. Lees snel verder of solliciteer direct.     Wat ga je doen als informatieanalist?  Volkswagen Pon Financial Services kent een stevige change-agenda waarin verschillende productteams op een agile manier werken aan digitale oplossingen voor hun klanten en collega's.  Strategische uitdagingen liggen op het integreren en migreren van het IT-landschap, selfservice, optimale klantbeleving en datakwaliteit.   Als informatieanalist werk je samen met collega's toe naar het beste resultaat voor jullie stakeholders. Je zorgt samen met de product owner voor duidelijke epics en user stories aan de hand van requirements die jullie samen verzamelen bij de stakeholders. Als informatieanalist zorg je dat de ontwikkelaars beschikken over een ontwerp dat past in de architectuur van VWPFS. Het komt ook voor dat je zelf mee-ontwikkelt of test als dat voor het behalen van het sprintdoel nodig is.  In deze uitdagende rol ben jij verantwoordelijk voor het perfectioneren van het klantportaal, dat talloze zakelijke en particuliere klanten dagelijks gebruiken. Jouw expertise komt goed van pas in het Cloud-team, waar je samenwerkt aan de (door)ontwikkeling van verschillende (backoffice-) applicaties. Je krijgt bijvoorbeeld de kans om de online calculator verder te ontwikkelen voor het berekenen van financial lease-contracten.  En er is meer: jouw werk heeft een Europese impact! De door jou ontwikkelde applicaties worden namelijk binnen de hele VW-groep ingezet. Zo draag jij bij aan de groei en innovatie van dit bedrijf op internationaal niveau.     Hier herken jij jezelf in   Je bent hbo/wo technisch opgeleid (denk aan Bedrijfskundige Informatica of Informatie Management).  Je hebt tenminste 3 jaar ervaring als informatieanalist of soortgelijk, waarbij je kennis hebt opgedaan van API’s, integraties, informatiestromen, Cloudsystemen, Cloudintegraties en datamigraties. Ook heb je ervaring met Agile werken.  Je hebt ervaring met het werken met externe ontwikkelpartij in het buitenland en weet de vraag vanuit zowel business als vanuit IT goed op tafel te krijgen.  Je bent in staat om verschillende scenario's op analytische wijze te doorgronden en weet de juiste toon te vinden om tot oplossingen te komen waarbij alle partijen tevreden zijn.  Je hebt een proactieve houding, komt graag snel tot nieuwe oplossingen en beschikt over belangrijke competenties zoals pragmatisme, flexibiliteit en humor.      Arbeidsvoorwaarden  Na een goede inwerkperiode op kantoor kies je samen met VWPFS jouw optimale balans tussen werken op kantoor of thuis. Op hun kantoor langs de A1 zijn alle faciliteiten voor jou aanwezig. Leuke collega’s, goede koffie uit de Volkswagen koffiebus, of even ontspannen met je collega’s in de game-room. Om ook thuis je werk goed te kunnen doen overleggen ze vaak digitaal en krijg je een tegoed van € 900,- in de Coolblue thuiswerkwinkel om je thuiswerkplek goed in te richten.  Ook je arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn goed geregeld. Je ontvangt een goed salaris afhankelijk van je ervaring. Iedere maand ontvang je daarnaast een vrij besteedbaar Individueel KeuzeBudget, ter hoogte van 20,48% van je bruto salaris. Je kunt dit laten uitbetalen op een moment dat jou uitkomt, maar je kunt het ook gebruiken om extra vakantiedagen te kopen, te sparen voor een sabbatical, een fiets te leasen of er een opleiding mee te betalen. Naast de vakantiedagen die je kunt kopen vanuit je Individueel KeuzeBudget krijg je standaard al 25 vrije dagen per jaar.  Daarnaast doen ze een flinke bijdrage in de opbouw van je pensioen en zijn er diverse kortingen waar je gebruik van kunt maken; op hun eigen leaseproducten en om jezelf te verzekeren.  Tenslotte investeren ze in jouw ontwikkeling door een vrijwel onbeperkt aanbod aan online trainingen, en door gerichte trainingen aan te bieden die je helpen beter te worden in je vak. Denk aan businessleasing-processen, configuratietraining Miles en VNA-leasing.     Waar kom je te werken?  Volkswagen Pon Financial Services is een joint venture van Volkswagen Financial Services AG (gelieerd aan Volkswagen AG) en Pon Holdings. Ze financieren, leasen en verzekeren niet alleen de mooiste automerken, maar bieden ook financiële oplossingen voor elke vorm van mobiliteit. Dat doen ze voor autodealers, wagenparkbeheerders, midden- en kleinbedrijf en particulieren. Hierin is geen vraag te gek en geen oplossing te vergezocht. Al hun medewerkers geven elke dag het uiterste om de flexibele, betrouwbare en professionele partner voor hun klanten te zijn. Daar krijgen se energie van en zijn ze trots op! In 2022 is VWPFS gecertificeerd als Great Place to Work. Wil je alvast een beeld krijgen van waar je gaat werken? Bekijk ook eens de werken bij VWPFS- en DFM-film!      Interesse? Solliciteer!  Klinkt deze vacature van informatieanalist Cloud-applicaties interessant voor jou? Solliciteer dan direct! Wil je graag eerst nog wat meer weten? Dan vertelt Youssef el Berrah je graag meer. Je bereikt hem op 06 2834 6666 of via youssef@wervingopmaat.nl.

title: Product Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: What’s the role?   You will join TotallyMoney’s data team with the purpose of empowering and increasing the number of data-driven decisions, through the generation of high-quality, relevant, data insights so that we can offer our customers clear, personalised, actionable financial insights and the business can unlock growth and scale efficiently.   Requirements    Understand our product, its drivers, user journeys, customer behaviours and key features.  Work closely with Product Managers and Team Leads to ensure data driven decisions are being made.  Become a subject matter expert in our customer lifecycle, performance funnels, data-tracking and the governing business logic of our platform; build strong relationships across functional areas to facilitate this.  Using your unearthed customer insight to contribute to the development of data-driven customer-facing product features to help improve their financial lives.  Analyse the data and provide actionable insights to help product managers and business stakeholders make optimal decisions.  Apply your quantitative analysis skills and data visualisation abilities to see beyond the numbers and showcase how TotallyMoney is performing against our long-term objective.  Work collaboratively with fellow team members and data engineers to contribute to the design and build of TotallyMoney’s proprietary data platform.  Have an aspiration to develop data science and machine learning skills to further enrich and analyse our data sets.  Provide ad hoc analysis to support functional team troubleshooting and/or insights generation  Troubleshoot and resolve data issues – inaccuracies, errors, business logic failures, interpretation and understanding challenges     Must haves     Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships.  Great oral/written communication and presentation skills – clear and concise  An analytical mind, with the ability to distinguish between what is important and what is not, making the complex simple  2-4 years in a data-focused, analytical role, or an adjacent field  The drive to develop a career in Data.  Strong knowledge of SQL  Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills  Strong judgement and an understanding of what drives business value  Outcome-oriented - proven ability to identify tangible benefits, opportunities and pursue them to realisation  A keen interest in technology products and how users interact with them  Strong mathematical ability (A/A* at A Level)     Nice to haves     Experience with Snowflake, dbt and/or ThoughtSpot.  Working knowledge of python  A 2:1 (or better) degree from a top-tier University     Benefits    Competitive salary, commensurate with experience  Flexible working hours & and a hybrid working environment - we’re in the office a minimum of 2 days per week.  On-target bonus scheme based on company performance.  25 days of annual leave (plus 8 bank holidays), 2 additional free days off at Christmas time, and the option to purchase an extra week off.  Enhanced maternity leave.  Ability to work abroad for up to 8 weeks per year.  Vitality Health Insurance and reward scheme (inc. 50% off Virgin Active gyms), Perkbox membership, wellbeing budgets and Cycle to Work scheme.  Mental health and wellbeing perks like talking therapies with Self Space, monthly mindfulness and fortnightly yoga.  Access to healthy training budgets.  2 paid days off per year for charity volunteering.  2 annual company socials, plus a regular social calendar throughout the year.  Free breakfast on Thursdays at our all-company meeting.  When in the office, we enjoy a well-stocked fridge and food cupboards, and a variety of social activities, such as football, badminton, book club and a Catan league.     Who is TotallyMoney?    We’re on the path to National brand recognition, having been chosen by nearly 5 million customers since our launch  6th on the Best Company To Work for in Finance (2022)  9th on the Best Company To Work for in London (2022)  Winners of the Best Free Credit Report Provider at the 2018 and 2019 Money Net Personal Finance Awards  Holders of a 3-Star Best Companies accreditation for “Extraordinary” levels of staff engagement   Redefining how lenders help meet their customers’ needs  Champions of diversity – of both people and thought  Signatories of the HM Treasury Women in Finance Charter     About Totally Money   Totally Money is using technology to redefine consumer credit. Everyone who works here shares the same belief; that people’s financial data should work for them, not against them.  Totally Money is a FinTech scale-up based near Old Street’s Silicon Roundabout, positioned between Shoreditch’s cutting-edge start-ups and the City’s forward-looking financial institutions.

title: Data Analyst in the area of IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenance (m/f/d)
skills: Skills: Algorithm Development, Matlab, +8 more
job_description: Innovation - Tradition - We-Feeling   This is the world of Wölfel. Do you have a great passion for analysing complex data and enjoy solving challenging tasks? Then we would be delighted if you became part of our international team and supported us as full-time Data Analyst in the area of IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenance (m/f/d) in Hamburg.  As an innovative and crisis-proof family business, we have been offering engineering services and system solutions in the fields of structural dynamics, vibration technology and acoustics for over 50 years. We are looking for talents who want to make a difference and drive things forward.   Location:  Hamburg   Area:  Mechanical and electrical engineering, Wind energy   Date:  as of now   Career level:  Entry-level professional, Experienced professional    What You Can Expect     You shape our future: Your area of responsibility as a Data Analyst (m/f/d) is broad and includes the technical implementation and coordination of project work in the area of IIoT/Monitoring. In addition, you will develop algorithms for monitoring machines as well as structures in the mechanical engineering, wind energy and rail industries. In doing so, you will analyze sensor data as well as operating data and develop mechanical and physical models in order to convert them into physical algorithms. Furthermore, you will take over the training of AI models that extend the physical algorithms.  Your expertise is required: You will design innovative monitoring concepts for monitoring and optimizing machines (predictive maintenance, Industry 4.0). In addition, you integrate the monitoring data and suitable alarms values into online dashboards, which are used by our customers to monitor their machines.  With your team spirit to success: As a Data Analyst (m/f/d), you can expect a dynamic team in which you have many opportunities to develop freely and actively participate. You will contribute your ideas to innovative projects and regularly exchange information about the latest technologies with Wölfel's agile algorithms and AI team.     What We Expect From You     Education: You have successfully completed your master's degree in mechanical engineering, civil engineering, physics, mechatronics with a major in mechanical engineering or a comparable course of study.  Experience and knowledge: You bring valuable experience in the field of algorithm development and have extensive knowledge in both structural dynamics and mechanics. You also bring very good programming skills (Matlab and/or Python).  Personal strengths: You quickly familiarize yourself with technical topics, you are committed, customer-oriented and communicative. A self-dependent and reliable way of working is a matter of course for you and you bring along a high degree of analytical skills. Good German and very good English skills round off your profile.    Do you only partially fulfill the above requirements as a Data Analyst (m/f/d)?  No problem, we will support you in your development. The decisive factor for us is that you are enthusiastic about your tasks.    Our Benefits For You     Attractive working environment: Permanent employment contract, appropriate remuneration, crisis-proof and family-friendly workplace, flexible working hours, individual home office options, flat hierarchies, team-oriented working atmosphere, modern working environment.  Innovation and development: A variety of innovative projects with a high level of personal responsibility, use of the latest technologies and methods, opportunities to drive new topics forward, individual career paths and training opportunities adapted to your interests and goals.  Feelgood benefits: Free drinks, JobCycle, travel allowance, company location in a central location near the town hall in Hamburg, annual company events and much more.     About Us    Would you like to learn more about us? You can also find interesting insights into our company and the Mainfranken region at  www.woelfel.de  and in our company portrait at  www.wiefuerdichgemacht.com  .     Your Application    You want to become part of the Wölfel family? Then apply by clicking on the "APPLY NOW" button.  Please understand that we only accept applications via our online form.   We are looking forward to your application! If you have any questions about this position, please do not hesitate to contact Ms. Elke Gernert by phone at 0931/49708-0.

job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                We are now looking for an Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) to join our busy Marketing and Communications team based in the City of London, with hybrid working!    The Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) will be responsible for data interpretation and behavioural analysis across multiple channels, and identification of trends in the financial services sector, building a solid foundation on which to make suggestions for content.   This insight coupled with a strategic approach to digital data will help inform the Marketing and Communications team’s strategy.    Salary:  £14,000 - £20,000 depending on the hours you work and your skills and experience (£30,000 - £36,000 Full time equivalent).    Hours of Work:  Part-time, 16-20 hours per week (Tuesdays are office based and ideally Thursdays, with remaining hours completed remotely)     Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) Duties       Conduct research to provide insights into user sentiments on key trends and advise on future content creation.  Provide key insight from internal and external sources to inform content and business decisions  Use data tools and research to answer key business questions  Advocate for CISI members through content selection  Work collaboratively with colleagues across the Marketing and Communications team, IT, and other departments  Pull together multiple data sources to create a coherent story or outcome  Work with the UX team to present CISI content in a digestible and coherent way  Track content to provide management information       Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) Requirements      You must be a self-starter with:      5 + years’ relevant experience  Experience ideally gained in the professional services sector  A proven track record of working successfully with corporate clients  A proven track record of delivering results against KPIs and deadlines  Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  A passion for data and research  Energy, personal stature and interpersonal skills to represent the Institute and maintain relationships at all levels  Excellent organisational skills  Strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of Google Analytics, Excel, MS office packages and MS Power BI  The ability to interpret data in such a way as to enhance the CISI membership offering       Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) Benefits      We offer a competitive remuneration package, which includes:      7½% company pension contribution into a personal pension, in addition to your own contribution of 1½% via salary exchange  Life insurance and income protection insurance  A Wellness Allowance of up to £30 a month  26 days pro-rata for part-time and the institute closes for three days between Christmas and New Year.  A travel allowance after passing probation which has a minimum value of £2,500 per annum (pro rata for part-time)  After one year’s service, private medical insurance cover, and annual travel insurance  Cover (pro-rata for part-time)      If you think that you are suitable for this Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) position, please apply now!    We value the contribution that employees with different views and experience bring to the Institute and are committed to promoting equity, inclusion and diversity. We hope to receive applications from a wide range of talented people irrespective of their race, religion or belief, gender, age, gender identity, neurodiversity, disability, sexual orientation, ethnic origin, political belief, social class, relationship status or caring responsibilities.   The Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment is the leading professional body for securities, investment, wealth and financial planning professionals. Formed in 1992 by London Stock Exchange practitioners, we have a global community, which aims to promote high standards of competence and integrity to more than 43,500 members in 116 countries. We are also the main examining body for the sector, offering our internationally recognised exams globally.   Our purpose is "To champion lifelong learning and integrity, raising individual standards of knowledge, skills and behaviour globally to enhance public trust and confidence in financial services."

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: Wallex Lab is a rapidly growing start-up company, with an already renowned international profile and reach, providing digital technological, and advisory services to international companies, the realization of whitelabel fintech products and solutions, as well as other digital services.  We provide a workplace with a unique international atmosphere combining respect, trust, and ambition. Our main goal is to bring out the best of every team member and help them unlock their full potential and reach their personal and professional goals. We are rapidly growing, and are looking for leaders in each position, who want to develop as much as they can. We provide excellent growth opportunities, combined with a positive modern and international work environment and team, we are looking for a long-term commitment with highly motivated individuals.  The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large and complex data sets to provide actionable insights to our business team.  We are looking for long-term commitment-oriented individuals, who have the availability to travel and welcome the opportunity to grow.   Key Responsibilities:    Collect and organize large and complex data sets from multiple sources including databases, APIs, and web scraping tools  Analyse and interpret data to identify patterns, trends, and correlations  Develop and maintain data models and dashboards to support data-driven decision making  Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, marketing, and engineering to identify opportunities and areas of improvement  Conduct ad-hoc analysis and provide data-driven recommendations to support business initiatives  Monitor and report on key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track business performance  Identify and implement data quality improvements and best practices     Requirements    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field  2+ years of experience in data analysis or a related field  Proficiency in SQL and experience with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle  Experience with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI  Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate and analyse complex data sets  Excellent communication skills and the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner  Experience in the fintech industry is a plus     Benefits    Attractive remuneration package  Annual bonuses  Learning Hub  Inspiring atmosphere   Future career development in an International company leading the innovative Fintech and blockchain space  Tailor-made personal benefits package   Wellness programs including additional health insurance, sports activities, and many more  Free assorted snacks, coffee, and fruits in the office  Free parking with a designated space, free electric cars, bikes & public transport     If our position matches your future career goals, we would be very pleased to receive your up-to-date CV in English, together with a reference letter.  All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.   Disclaimer:    WallexLab is an employer that is taking hiring decisions and making employment practices solely on the qualifications, and merit of the candidates. The company is offering equal opportunities to all applicants and is committed to inclusion and diversity in the workspace. Any form of discrimination or harassment, which is based on religion, sex, color, race, sexual orientation, origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic which is outlined by the local, state, or federal law is prohibited at WallexLab.  Any policies such as recruitment, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation or benefits, apprenticeships, or training are based on individual performance.

job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Data Analyst in the area of IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenance (m/f/d)
skills: Skills: Algorithm Development, Matlab, +8 more
job_description: Innovation - Tradition - We-Feeling   This is the world of Wölfel. Do you have a great passion for analysing complex data and enjoy solving challenging tasks? Then we would be delighted if you became part of our international team and supported us as full-time Data Analyst in the area of IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenance (m/f/d) in Berlin.  As an innovative and crisis-proof family business, we have been offering engineering services and system solutions in the fields of structural dynamics, vibration technology and acoustics for over 50 years. We are looking for talents who want to make a difference and drive things forward.   Location:  Berlin   Area:  Mechanical and electrical engineering, Wind energy   Date:  as of now   Career level:  Entry-level professional, Experienced professional    What You Can Expect     You shape our future: Your area of responsibility as a Data Analyst (m/f/d) is broad and includes the technical implementation and coordination of project work in the area of IIoT/Monitoring. In addition, you will develop algorithms for monitoring machines as well as structures in the mechanical engineering, wind energy and rail industries. In doing so, you will analyze sensor data as well as operating data and develop mechanical and physical models in order to convert them into physical algorithms. Furthermore, you will take over the training of AI models that extend the physical algorithms.  Your expertise is required: You will design innovative monitoring concepts for monitoring and optimizing machines (predictive maintenance, Industry 4.0). In addition, you integrate the monitoring data and suitable alarms values into online dashboards, which are used by our customers to monitor their machines.  With your team spirit to success: As a Data Analyst (m/f/d), you can expect a dynamic team in which you have many opportunities to develop freely and actively participate. You will contribute your ideas to innovative projects and regularly exchange information about the latest technologies with Wölfel's agile algorithms and AI team.     What We Expect From You     Education: You have successfully completed your master's degree in mechanical engineering, civil engineering, physics, mechatronics with a major in mechanical engineering or a comparable course of study.  Experience and knowledge: You bring valuable experience in the field of algorithm development and have extensive knowledge in both structural dynamics and mechanics. You also bring very good programming skills (Matlab and/or Python).  Personal strengths: You quickly familiarize yourself with technical topics, you are committed, customer-oriented and communicative. A self-dependent and reliable way of working is a matter of course for you and you bring along a high degree of analytical skills. Good German and very good English skills round off your profile.    Do you only partially fulfill the above requirements as a Data Analyst (m/f/d)?  No problem, we will support you in your development. The decisive factor for us is that you are enthusiastic about your tasks.    Our Benefits For You     Attractive working environment: Permanent employment contract, appropriate remuneration, crisis-proof and family-friendly workplace, flexible working hours, individual home office options, flat hierarchies and team-oriented working atmosphere.  Innovation and development: A variety of innovative projects with a high level of personal responsibility, use of the latest technologies and methods, opportunities to drive new topics forward, individual career paths and training opportunities adapted to your interests and goals.  ﻿Feelgood benefits: JobCycle, travel allowance, annual company events and much more.     About Us    Would you like to learn more about us? You can also find interesting insights into our company and the Mainfranken region at  www.woelfel.de  and in our company portrait at  www.wiefuerdichgemacht.com  .     Your Application    You want to become part of the Wölfel family? Then apply by clicking on the "APPLY NOW" button.  Please understand that we only accept applications via our online form.   We are looking forward to your application! If you have any questions about this position, please do not hesitate to contact Ms. Elke Gernert by phone at 0931/49708-0.

title: Data Analyst (m/f)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Qlik Sense, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                 Who Are We    For over 20 years, Neotalent within Novabase group, has been the right answer to the greatest need digital transformation brings to organizations - Talent.  We have a talent for that.  We are specialists in developing people and combining them with the most ambitious projects. From software to complex engineering, from infrastructures to applications, we find, recognize and grow talent to offer them the most challenging projects and strengthen our project teams. We learn about people, their knowledge and how to productively use that knowledge to help companies transform, because what the digital economy needs is talent.  The world lives by rules of agility, immediacy and quick responses, so we are dynamic, responsive and aligned with the speed of the digital revolution. We have a new way to address challenges by adding speed to knowledge, connectivity to reliability and bringing agility to the reality of finding, managing and matching talent with projects.  Neotalent, the responsive people.    What Is Your Mission    We are looking for a  Data Analyst  to join one of our biggest clients - market leader in the mobile world in Lisbon area.  As a Data Analyst you will improve the overall solutions based on detailed analysis. This is an excellent opportunity for a true passionate Data Analyst to improve analytical skills through daily challenges and develop deep knowledge within the Mobile App market in a fast-growing technology startup.    The Talent That We Are Looking For     Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or equivalent field;  At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst;  Strong know-how with SQL;  Experience with Qlik Sense Platform or other BI tool;  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills;  Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders;  Exceptional written and verbal communications skills (fluency in English)     Why Neotalent     More than 20 years of experience in technology and business development;  Access to ongoing technical training and solid performance evaluation and career management methodologies;  Opportunity to be seen and recognized, to work on the best projects and to make choices that guarantee an exciting career;  Opportunity to work on international projects and be part of an Everyshore for EveryChallenge paradigm.     To Apply    Please send your CV to with MVT_Data in the email subject.  web:54.177.211.206:LinkedInBot/1.0 (compatible; Mozilla/5.0; +http://www.linkedin.com):2023-05-23 12:54:30
