title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               A leading global insurance business has an urgent 6 months + contract requirement for a Data Analyst to partner with all areas of the business and IT to help build out and maintain analysis data sets required by end users from our core underwriting systems, including the enterprise data warehouse.   You will have a strong understanding of SQL and data modelling techniques with the ability to retrospectively document a database data model, and map this to front-end screens.     Key Responsibilities       Work with business teams to understand their reporting use cases and turn those reporting use cases into deliverable scope statements  Translate business reporting uses cases / requirements into technical data requirements, e.g. source-to-target mappings, by iteratively building out proof of concept (PoC) SQL outputs that satisfy those requirements  Unit test PoC SQL outputs ensuring data presented does not break data integrity and aligns with data shown in persisted database layer  Liaise with Data Engineering Team to turn PoC SQL outputs into automate data feeds / sets in Power BI / SQL database depending on the skill set of the end user  Independently create data dictionaries for internal front-end systems detailing how fields in the user interface map to the database, including entity relationship diagrams  Ensure timely completion of project milestones with help from the Delivery Manager, identify scope creep, anticipate bottlenecks and escalate as appropriate       Essential Skills / Experience       London Market insurance experience is essential  Working with multi-system architectures;  Able to work with analysis and reporting solutions involving large sets of relational / star-schema data;  Data mapping and data analytical skills using SQL and Excel;  Keen eye for detail, ability to scrutinise, think critically, and ask the right questions.  Line management of technology resources to deliver on set tasks and objectives  SQL with ability to navigate database solutions (tables/view/stored procedures)  Innovative mind-set with rigorous standards of quality;  Excellent communication skills: verbal and written;Pro-active, self-organiser who can plan detail of work to be undertaken and act to ensure it happens.

title: Online Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer    flexible work-from-home    opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are    part-time   , and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com      We are hiring freelance  English  speaking Online Data Analyst’s for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local  geography .     This is a  freelance  position on a  flexible schedule  - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.     Requirements   Full Professional Proficiency in  English   You must be living in  The United Kingdom  for the last 2 consecutive years  Ability to follow  guidelines  and do  research  online using search engines, online maps and website information  You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in  The United Kingdom   Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. Maps, News, Audio tasks, Relevance)  Applicants must be 18 years or over.  Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a  long-term project  and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.      Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?   Earn extra income  Access to our community wellbeing initiative  Remote work & Location Independence  Be your own boss  Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle  Be a part of an online community      For more information please contact sourcingteam22@telusinternational.ai

Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Financial / Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Управление данными, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Looking for a financial analyst for a temporary assingment (3 months). Focus on Excel and Tableau/Power BI.  As a global leader in information and analytics, the comapny helps researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. We do this by facilitating insights and critical decision-making for customers across the global research and health ecosystems.  In everything they publish, they uphold the highest standards of quality and integrity. the company brings that same rigor to our information analytics solutions for researchers, health professionals, institutions and funders.    Tasks And Responsibilities     Responsible for the reporting an analyses in Excel  responible for weekly reporting  stakeholder management   Provides master data sets  make analyses visual in for example Power Bi.  Resolves issues with pricing, contracts and commercial operations  Responsible for the annual update of the company market potential in the Netherlands for all divisions, distribution and discussion with Sales Managers    What are we looking for?    Minimum Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Data management  Preferably 2-3 years of experience in Power BI  Fluency in English is mandatory  Strong Excel skills  Experience in a multinational firm is a plus  Energetic, team-oriented, and proactive  High level of honesty, commitment, and responsibility     Job Offer     Gross salary between €3500,- and €4500,- depending on your experience  32 -40 hours a week  Possibility to work in one of the biggest international companies in Amsterdam  Travel allowance  Possibilities to develop yourself via training and courses

title: Data Analyst (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: Cluster Analysis, Attribution, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               ZEIT ONLINE ist eines der größten und erfolgreichsten Online-Nachrichtenmedien und Info-Portale Deutschlands, mehrfach ausgezeichnet für Journalismus und Design. Zu der gesamten Plattform gehören ein umfassendes Portfolio an Angeboten zur Studien- und Berufsorientierung (Berufstest, Studium-Interessentest, Suchmaschine für Studiengänge, CHE-Hochschulranking), unsere Stellenmärkte und Spiele sowie Apps. Wir ergänzen höchste journalistische Ansprüche um Produkt- und Technik-Exzellenz – und die Freude an der gemeinsamen Arbeit.  Bereichere unser Team als   Data Analyst (m/w/d)   Vollzeit - Buceriusstraße, 20095 Hamburg, Deutschland - Remote (hybrid) - Mit Berufserfahrung   Aufgaben   Wir als Data-Team entwickeln und betreiben verschiedene analytische Produkte, die auf großen und zahlreichen Datenquellen und Data-Pipelines basieren. Wir unterstützen dabei unter anderem die Redaktion und die Produktentwicklung, ihre Maßnahmen und Entscheidungen auf Basis dieser Datengrundlage zu treffen.   Bei uns verwandelst du Daten in aussagekräftige Erkenntnisse: Du übersetzt komplexe Muster in prägnante Erklärungen, visualisierst, abstrahierst und kommunizierst diese Ergebnisse an unterschiedliche interne Interessengruppen und verbindest sie mit früheren Ergebnissen, bestehenden Theorien und Stakeholder-Erwartungen.   Dazu gehören das Monitoring, das Reporting und die Analyse von relevanten Business- und Performance-Kennzahlen.   Du bist (mit-)verantwortlich für die ganzheitliche (Web-)Datenanalyse und die Verbesserung der Analyseprozesse. Dabei arbeitest du in bereichsübergreifenden Projekten an der Schnittstelle zwischen den Bereichen Produkt, Redaktion, Data und Engineering.   Durch die Auswertung von A/B- und multivariaten Tests findest du Wettbewerbsvorteile und Optimierungspotenziale, die als Grundlage für wichtige und riskante Produktentscheidungen dienen.   Ebenso entwickelst du quantitative Modelle zur Vorhersage und Bewertung des Nutzungsverhaltens unserer Leser:innen, um diese besser kennenzulernen, und entwirfst Machine-Learning-Lösungen für verschiedene Anwendungsfälle wie Churn Prediction, Reichweiten-Attribution oder User Clustering.     Profil    Ein Hochschulstudium im Bereich der MINT-Fächer, BWL oder VWL mit Informatik-Schnittpunkten oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung.   Du kannst bereits auf erste fundierte Erfahrungen in der Datenanalyse und der Beratung von Business-Stakeholdern zurückgreifen.   Programmierkenntnisse in Python/R und SQL zählen zu deinem technologischen Portfolio.   Erfahrungen in der Anwendung von Machine-Learning-Algorithmen und Data-Mining-Methoden vom Konzept bis zur Produktion bringst du mit.     Wir bieten    Ein Team, auf das du bauen kannst. Wir sind ein interdisziplinäres Team mit viel Erfahrung im gesamten Data-Umfeld. Von uns kannst du lernen, und gemeinsam können wir wachsen.   Vernetzung & Entwicklung: Wir bieten allen Mitarbeiter:innen ausgezeichnete Möglichkeiten innerhalb unserer Verlagsgruppe. Nutze z. B. unser internes Mentoring-Programm oder auch die Webinare der ZEIT Akademie oder von ZEIT Sprachen – darüber hinaus gibt es eine große Auswahl an E-Learning-Angeboten.   Attraktiver Standort: Dein zukünftiger Arbeitsplatz befindet sich in zentraler Lage mit bester Anbindung an den öffentlichen Nahverkehr – einen entsprechenden Fahrtkostenzuschuss oder auch ein JobRad gibt es natürlich auch.   Flexibilität: Aktuell und zukünftig arbeiten wir bis zu 50 % remote, die Möglichkeit, vor Ort zu arbeiten, gibt es aber zu 100 %.   Unterstützung: Das ganzheitliche Unterstützungsprogramm »Employee Assistance Program« bietet dir schnelle und wirkungsvolle Hilfe bei beruflichen und privaten Fragestellungen – auch in besonderen Krisensituationen.   Vergünstigungen: Ob Corporate Benefits, ZEIT Kulturkarte oder Ticket Sprinter – nutze gerne die vielen Vergünstigungen für Museen, Theater, Festivals, Produkte und Konferenzen.   Unternehmenskultur: Erste Einblicke findest du bei kununu, LinkedIn, Xing oder auch auf unserer ZEIT Karriereseite.   Sicherheit: Wir stellen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt ein!     Wir kümmern uns umeinander.   Die ZEIT Verlagsgruppe ist ein Arbeitgeber, der für Chancengleichheit und einen respektvollen Umgang steht. Wir setzen uns ein für faire Beschäftigungsmöglichkeiten, unabhängig von ethnischer oder sozialer Herkunft, Geschlecht, Religion, Weltanschauung, Alter, sexueller Identität oder Behinderung. Unser stetiges Ziel ist es, ein wertschätzendes und anerkennendes Arbeitsumfeld für alle Beschäftigten zu schaffen.

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Решение задач, +4 more
job_description: Per una solida realtà, attiva nel settore servizi, leader sul territorio nazionale, siamo alla ricerca di un Data Analyst.  Posizione:  La persona, riportando al responsabile di divisione, avrà il compito di supportare il team in attività di analisi specifiche sui consumi effettuati sia lato B2B che B2C e riportare, attraverso l'applicativo di fatturazione, il resoconto al responsabile, confrontandosi con lui su eventuali correzioni. Avrà poi come task quello di gestire la fatturazione attiva per la divisione B2C ed elaborare report con creazione di modelli matematici di misurazione della performance, confrontandosi anche con l'ufficio IT per l’analisi e la gestione dei dati del database.  Requisiti:  Il candidato ideale ha conseguito una laurea in discipline economiche, matematiche o statistiche ed ha maturato esperienza di almeno 3 anni in ruoli in cui sono state richieste elevate capacità di analisi quantitative di dati. La competenza di Excel è eccellente, così come altri ERP utili all'analisi di dati. Completano il profilo grandi doti di organizzazione e di concentrazione.

title: Data Analyst Export
company_field: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
skills: Skills: Решение задач, Data Analytics, +7 more
job_description: La Poste Groupe change, nos métiers évoluent. Etre toujours au plus près des Français, développer la confiance dans le numérique et être acteur de la transformation écologique, c'est aussi le sens de notre métier. Chaque jour, sur l'ensemble du territoire, nos 250 000 collaborateurs imaginent les services de demain. Rejoindre La Poste Groupe, c'est rejoindre une entreprise responsable ! Vous aussi, engagez-vous à nos côtés pour donner du sens à votre métier.   Mission   Pour accompagner la croissance du e-Commerce à l’international, la Direction des Opérations Internationales (DOI) a pour mission d’améliorer l’expérience client et la compétitivité des offres.Au sein de la DOI, vous avez en charge les outils de pilotage de la supply chain, proposez et mettez en œuvre les outils d’aide à la décision : Organiser et piloter les échanges de données :Pilote les échanges de données entre les parties prenantes : centres opérationnels, opérateurs de transport et postes étrangèresEst moteur sur le développement d’outil de supervision métier notamment sur l’absence de transmission d’informationAnalyse les dysfonctionnements en coordination avec les équipes SI ou techniques de La Poste et les partenaires externesGarantir l’efficience opérationnelle et la satisfaction client :Est force de proposition sur la mise en place d’outils dédiés basés sur des technologies innovantesIdentifie les impacts clients ou impacts pour la Poste des écarts ou des situations spécifiques rencontréesLance les plans d’actions en partenariat avec les équipes de la DOI, des opérations et des partenaires du transportAssurer la veille règlementaire sur la Data : Est porteur du changement des normes et règlementations pour La Poste Accompagne les parties prenantes et s’assure de la faisabilité et de la compréhension des enjeux techniquesParticipe aux instances internationales Poste basé à Paris 15.   Profil     Anglais professionnel indispensable   Esprit de synthèse   Capacité analytique    Formation et expérience   Diplômé d'un Bac + 5 "DATA", vous possédez une expérience de 5 années dans la logistique ou les SI associée idéalement à une expérience en management de projet.

title: Senior Data Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
skills: None
job_description: About Agoda    Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    Get to know our team:     The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.   Due to continued expansion,  there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:       Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.    Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap    Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders       What you’ll Need to Succeed:        Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study    4+ years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company    Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.    Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English    Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence    Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes    Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently       It’s great if you have:        Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce    Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics    Strong presentation and negotiation skills      #STRA#ANLS#MRKT#3 #sanfrancisco #sanjose title: Junior project manager - Categoria Protetta
skills: Skills: Презентации, Организаторские навыки, +8 more
job_description: Chi siamo   Siamo una software house che si occupa dello sviluppo di soluzioni e di applicazioni destinate alla pubblica amministrazione e alle PMI del settore utility; ci occupiamo anche di servizi di consulenza, assistenza e Business Process Outsourcing sempre destinati al settore dei servizi di pubblica utilità.      Realizziamo, inoltre, progetti di Business Intelligence in ambito Fashion, ancora una volta insieme ai maggiori player del mercato.      Abbiamo un headquarter a Milano e due distaccamenti a Siena e Treviso che ci permettono di operare in tutta Italia sempre contraddistinti da una grande dinamicità, un grande desiderio di crescita e un coinvolgimento sempre maggiore su progetti innovativi nel panorama Utility nazionale.  Non siamo la solita consulting company: i rapporti tra i diversi team all’interno dell’organizzazione sono immediati così come quelli tra i colleghi. L’ambiente aziendale, infatti, rimane sempre a misura di persona sebbene sia sempre in movimento per la continua crescita e per i numerosi progetti.      Chi cerchiamo   Junior Project Manager IT appartenente alle categorie protette art.1 legge n. 68/99      Cosa farai   Coinvolto/a principalmente in progetti afferenti al Settore Energy, Gas & Power, ti occuperai di assistere e affiancare i PM Senior nelle seguenti attività:   Avviare, pianificare, svolgere e controllare i progetti fino alla loro chiusura.  Gestire l’allocazione delle risorse e la pianificazione dell’inizio del progetto  Monitorare l’avanzamento delle attività garantendo elevati standard di qualità nelle soluzioni che avrai sviluppato  Segnalare tempestivamente eventuali criticità che possano avere un potenziale impatto sulle tempistiche di implementazione individuando azioni correttive o scenari alternativi  Assicurare il raggiungimento del massimo vantaggio per il cliente mantenendo la redditività del progetto   Inoltre, ti sarà data sempre sempre maggiore autonomia nelle attività in base ai successi che riporterai e alla abilità che riuscirai a dimostrare.      Le tue skill    Laurea in ingegneria o materie scientifiche/economiche  Almeno 1 anno di esperienza lavorativa nel ruolo, preferibilmente in aziende medio-grandi  Capacità di organizzare SAL  Capacità di redigere documentazione progettuale  Capacità di produrre presentazioni per status update  Ottima conoscenza di MS Excel finalizzata alla realizzazione di reportistica  Conoscenza approfondita del pacchetto OFFICE  Conoscenza dei concetti di project management e organizzazione aziendale  Attitudine al problem solving  Capacità di team player: devi sapere condividere le tue idee, comunicare correttamente e avere spirito di cooperazione  Doti relazionali: devi essere di comunicare in maniera chiara con i diversi interlocutori aziendali e a seconda dei rapporti con i differenti stakeholder.       Sede di lavoro: Milano      Offriamo un inserimento diretto in azienda, full-time, dal lunedì al venerdì, possibilità di smart-working parziale, retribuzione in linea con l'esperienza maturata.   La ricerca è rivolta esclusivamente a candidati iscritti o iscrivibili al collocamento mirato (L. 68/99).

title: Data analyst débutant(e)
skills: Skills: R, Unix, +8 more
job_description: Job Description   Vous êtes récemment diplômé(e) ? Débutez votre carrière par une expérience stimulante au cœur d’équipes internationales, engagées dans la transition énergétique !    Nous recherchons pour une durée de 12 mois au CSTJF à PAU (64), un(e) Data Analyst débutant(e) pour travailler sur le catalogue et la cartographie des données métier.    Nous vous proposons un Contrat de Professionnalisation Temps Plein qualifiant de 12 mois (100% en entreprise) incluant 15% de formation interne (métier, linguistique, outils…) dispensée par des organismes sélectionnés par TotalEnergies.  Ce contrat vous permettra d’acquérir une année d’expérience professionnelle tout en étant formé aux spécificités de votre métier en lien avec les activités de la Compagnie. Un réel atout pour booster votre employabilité !    Pour postuler à cette offre, vous devez impérativement posséder, à la date d’embauche, un titre de séjour valide pour la période couverte par cette offre (minimum 13 mois).   Attention, la conclusion de ce contrat de professionnalisation ne permet pas la délivrance d’un titre de séjour (article R.52221-6 du Code du travail).   Ce poste ne s'adresse pas aux personnes recherchant une alternance avec une école ou une formation diplômante, mais aux personnes récemment diplômées à la recherche d’une première expérience.   Au sein de l'équipe Projet Assurance de la technical line  « Industrial projects » , sous la supervision du Data lead des projets industriels, vous travaillerez avec les équipes métiers, les squads de développement des initiatives digitales, les product owner et les spécialistes data de la technical line Datatech.  Le domaine projet industriel, participe à la transformation digitale de la compagnie. Son objectif est de capitaliser et valoriser les données issues de l'ensemble des activités de siège, des filiales et des projets afin d'alimenter efficacement des initiatives digitales (logiciels data driven) créatrice de valeur et en cours de développement. Le portefeuille logiciel et data du domaine étant hétérogène, du fait de la répartition géographique des activités et les diverses réorganisations, l'inventaire et l'organisation des données, est le vecteur obligatoire pour atteindre la capitalisation et la valorisation des données.   Vous travaillerez sur 3 grands volets qui se traduiront par les activités suivantes  :   Volet 1 - Activités Data Catalog      Assister le data lead dans la préparation et le déploiement du Data catalog   Opérer le logiciel data Galaxy en lien avec Datatech et les entité PJC pour cataloguer et cartographier les données métier   Participer à l'établissement de la gouvernance DATA Catalog de PJC   Organiser les sessions d'atelier d'identification et d'inventaire des données avec les entités de PJC et les PO des initiatives digitales (mobilité vers Paris Totalenergies Digital factory nécessaire de temps en temps)     Volet 2 - Architecture Data des initiatives digitales      Assister le data manager pour étudier et déployer une architecture data cohérente et homogène entre les initiatives Digitales pour permettre une interopérabilité pérenne indépendante des éditeurs de logiciels     Volet 3 - Information management      Formaliser et déploie la gouvernance information management (gestion des espaces de travail) de PJC   Recueillir les besoins métier   Mettre en place ou crée les outils de gestion des droits d'accès des différents supports de stockage   Inventorier des outils digitaux utilisés au périmètre PJC   Réaliser l’on-boarding des nouveaux collaborateurs sur le Digital pour l'utilisation des outils     Candidate profile   Récemment diplômé(e) d'un Master 2 en école d'ingénieur ou université avec une spécialisation en Data Analyse, vous êtes à la recherche d'une opportunité dans un environnement international et innovant ?  Vous avez de solides connaissances du data management et data catalog ? Des connaissances en web sémantiques seraient un plus.  Vous êtes compétant(e) en base de données et gestion de base de données (SQL/NoSQL) ?  Vous maîtrisez les langages de programmation (Python, R, C++, dax…) ? Et vous maîtrisez les systèmes d’exploitation (Unix, Windows…) ?  Vous êtes à l'aise avec JavaScript, Node.JS ?  Vous faites preuve d'autonomie et de rigueur, êtes force de proposition dans la construction ou l’évolution de nos méthodes d’analyse, avez une capacité d’adaptation et de communication au sein d'une équipe.  Alors, n'attendez plus... postulez pour rejoindre les équipes TotalEnergies à Pau !  Dans le cadre de sa politique Diversité, TotalEnergies étudie, à compétences égales, toutes candidatures dont celles de personnes en situation de handicap.   Offer ID   72943BR   Metier   Management, Architecture, Sécurité, Management de Projets SI, Digital SI   Region, department, area   64 - Pyrénées-Atlantiques   Workplace location (Precisions/Keywords)   PAU   Employment type   CDD   Contract duration   12   Duration unit   Mois   Experience Level Required   Moins de 3 ans   Branch   One Tech   About Us / Company Profile    TotalEnergies  est une compagnie multi-énergies mondiale de production et de fourniture d’énergies : pétrole et biocarburants, gaz naturel et gaz verts, renouvelables et électricité. Ses 105 000 collaborateurs s'engagent pour une énergie toujours plus abordable, propre, fiable et accessible au plus grand nombre. Présent dans plus de 130 pays, TotalEnergies inscrit le développement durable dans toutes ses dimensions au cœur de ses projets et opérations pour contribuer au bien-être des populations.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: First Digital Finance Corporation (FDFC) is a fin-tech company building disruptive and innovative products in retail credit for Southeast Asia.   The company operates BillEase, the top-rated, buy now pay later (BNPL) platform for merchants and their customers in the Philippines with more than 1m downloads.    Vision:  Build financial services that delight and enable consumers    Mission:  Use software and AI and to build financial products that are at least 10x better than status quo for our customers    The Role      Your Responsibilities Will Include       Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks  Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets  Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets  Create best-practice reports based on data mining, analysis, and visualization  Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data  Work directly with managers and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships  Design and develop reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively present data-driven insights and trends.  Analyze large and complex datasets using statistical techniques and data mining methods to identify patterns, correlations, and trends.  Perform data cleansing, validation, and quality assurance to ensure the accuracy and reliability of the analysis.  Conduct ad-hoc data analysis and generate actionable insights to support business decision-making and address specific inquiries.  Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data availability, accuracy, and integrity by defining data collection and transformation processes.  Develop and maintain data models, data dictionaries, and documentation to support data analysis and reporting.  Identify opportunities for process improvements and data-driven optimizations by monitoring and evaluating key metrics and performance indicators.  Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in data analysis and visualization      Ideal Profile      Skills Required       Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong understanding of data analysis techniques, methodologies, and best practices.  Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis from relational databases, particularly PostgreSQL.  Experience with data visualization tools and techniques, such as Tableau, Power BI, or Python libraries.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex datasets and draw actionable insights.  Knowledge of statistical analysis and data mining techniques, such as regression analysis, clustering, and hypothesis testing.  Familiarity with data preparation and wrangling techniques, including data cleansing, transformation, and aggregation.  Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R for data analysis and manipulation.  Experience working with large datasets and using data querying languages or tools (e.g., SQL, Spark) is a plus.  Knowledge and experience with additional databases, such as ClickHouse and MongoDB, for handling diverse data storage needs.  Understanding of OLAP (Online Analytical Processing) concepts and experience with OLAP tools and technologies.  Familiarity with data warehousing concepts, including dimensional modeling and star schema design.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present and explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders      What's on Offer?      Work alongside & learn from best in class talent  Excellent career development opportunities  Opportunity to make a positive impact

title: Data Analyst im Bereich IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenan ...
skills: Skills: Профилактическое техническое обслуживание, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               Innovation - Tradition - Wir-Gefühl   Das ist die Welt von Wölfel. Sie haben eine große Leidenschaft für die Analyse komplexer Daten und lösen gerne herausfordernde Aufgaben? Dann freuen wir uns, wenn Sie unser internationales Team ab sofort als Data Analyst im Bereich IIoT / KI / Predictive Maintenance (m/w/d) am Standort Höchberg (bei Würzburg) unterstützen.   Als innovatives und krisenfestes Familienunternehmen bieten wir seit über 50 Jahren Ingenieurdienstleistungen und Systemlösungen auf den Gebieten der Strukturdynamik, der Schwingungstechnik und der Akustik an. Wir sind auf der Suche nach Talenten, die etwas bewirken und vorantreiben wollen.   Standort: Höchberg (bei Würzburg)   Bereich: Maschinenbau und Elektrotechnik / Windenergie   Zeitpunkt: ab sofort   Karrierelevel: Berufseinsteiger     Was Sie Erwartet        Sie gestalten unsere Zukunft: Ihr Aufgabengebiet als Data Analyst (m/w/d) ist breit gefächert und beinhaltet die technische Umsetzung und Koordination von Projektarbeiten im Bereich IIoT/Monitoring. Daneben entwickeln Sie Algorithmen zur Überwachung von Maschinen sowie Strukturen in den Branchen Maschinenbau, Windenergie und Rail. Hierbei analysieren Sie Sensordaten sowie Betriebsdaten und entwickeln mechanische und physikalische Modelle, um diese in physikalische Algorithmen umzusetzen. Des Weiteren übernehmen Sie das Training von KI-Modellen, welche die physikalischen Algorithmen erweitern.    Ihre Expertise ist gefragt: Sie entwerfen innovative Monitoringkonzepte zur Überwachung und Optimierung von Maschinen (Predictive Maintenance, Industrie 4.0). Zudem integrieren Sie die Monitoringdaten und daraus abgeleiteten Alarmierungen in Online-Dahsboards, welche von unserer Kundschaft zur Überwachung ihrer Maschinen genutzt werden.    Mit Ihrer Teamfähigkeit zum Erfolg: Sie erwartet als Data Analyst (m/w/d) ein dynamisches Team, bei dem Sie viele Möglichkeiten haben, sich frei zu entfalten und aktiv mitzugestalten. Sie bringen Ihre Ideen in innovative Projekte ein und tauschen sich dabei regelmäßig mit dem agilen Algorithmen- und KI-Team von Wölfel über neueste Technologien aus.        Was Sie Mitbringen Sollten        Ausbildung: Sie haben Ihr Masterstudium im Bereich Maschinenbau, Bauingenieurwesen, Physik, Mechatronik mit der Vertiefung Maschinenbau oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang erfolgreich abgeschlossen.    Erfahrungen und Kenntnisse: Sie bringen wertvolle Erfahrungen im Bereich der Algorithmenentwicklung mit und haben umfassende Kenntnisse sowohl im Bereich Strukturdynamik als auch Mechanik. Sehr gute Programmierkenntnisse (Matlab und/oder Python) bringen Sie ebenfalls mit.    Persönliche Stärken: Sie arbeiten sich schnell in technische Themen ein, sind engagiert, kundenorientiert und kommunikativ. Eine eigenverantwortliche sowie zuverlässige Arbeitsweise ist für Sie selbstverständlich und Sie bringen ein hohes Maß an analytischen Fähigkeiten mit. Gute Deutsch- und sehr gute Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.      Sie bringen die genannten Anforderungen als Data Analyst (m/w/d) nur teilweise mit? Kein Problem, wir fördern Sie in Ihrer Entwicklung. Ausschlaggebend für uns ist, dass Sie sich für Ihre Aufgaben begeistern.     Was Wir Bieten        Attraktives Arbeitsumfeld: Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag, leistungsgerechte Vergütung, krisensicherer und familienfreundlicher Arbeitsplatz, flexible Arbeitszeiten, individuelle Home-Office-Möglichkeiten, flache Hierarchien, teamorientierte Arbeitsatmosphäre, moderne Arbeitsumgebung.    Innovation und Entwicklung: Vielfältige innovative Projekte mit hoher Eigenverantwortung, Einsatz neuester Technologien und Methoden, Möglichkeiten neue Themen voranzutreiben, individuelle Karrierewege und Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten angepasst an Ihre Interessen und Zie

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Аналитические навыки, +7 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.  At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.  As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.  With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.  So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! job_description: Wir sind die Positive Thinking Company. Wir suchen dein Talent und deine Leidenschaft zur Verstärkung unserer Data & Analytics Experten. Schließ dich uns an, entfalte Deine Fähigkeiten und Talente und stecke unsere Community mit Deiner Begeisterung und deinen Ideen an.  Was uns wichtig ist? Die 3 W’s: Wissensaustausch, Weiterbildungen und Weiterentwicklung. Interessiert? Dann wird’s jetzt spannend:   Aufgaben    Deine Leidenschaft    Analyse fachlicher Anforderungen und Ableitungen analytischer Zielsetzungen für Kunden   Zusammenhänge komplexer Geschäftsdaten erzeugen und diese in performanten Reports visualisieren   Self-Service Datenanalysen gestalten sowie die Datenvorverarbeitung   Konsolidierung von Daten zur Ableitung angemessener Handlungsempfehlungen     Dieses Wissen bietet unseren Kunden echten Mehrwert. Du bist das Bindeglied zwischen IT und Business. Du konzipierst. Du realisierst. Du treibst voran.   Qualifikation    Dein Talent    Masterabschluss, vorzugsweise in (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder einer vergleichbaren Studienrichtung   Ca. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics   Technologieerfahrung: Tableau, Qlik, Power BI, Cognos BI, Tools wie Alteryx oder Yellowfin   Erfahrung in R Shiny, KNIME oder Visual Analytics ist von Vorteil   Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse   Reisebereitschaft innerhalb der DACH Region     Benefits    Deine Community   Bei uns schließt Du dich einem dynamischen, erfahrenen Team von anderen engagierten und leidenschaftlichen Data und Analytics Specialists an. Wir wollen immer an unsere Grenzen gehen, um gemeinsam, als Positive Thinking Company, die besten Lösungen zu entwickeln.  Täglich arbeitest du mit inspirierenden Kollegen aus unseren vielfältigen Domains zusammen. Dabei arbeitest du mit Persönlichkeiten wie Bereichsleitern, Projektmanagern, Product Ownern, Entwicklern, Business Analysten und dem Vertrieb zusammen. Unsere Community ist divers: Wir bringen unterschiedliche Backgrounds mit und bündeln unsere kreativen Ideen und Fähigkeiten, um voneinander zu lernen.  Von Anfang an wirst Du in eine Kultur eintauchen, die geprägt ist von Kreativität, Spaß und Zusammenarbeit. Wir lernen aus Fehlern, um unsere Innovationskraft zu beflügeln.   Unser Versprechen   Wir bieten Dir eine Kultur, die von unseren Führungsleitsätzen angetrieben wird: unternehmerisch, ergebnisorientiert, Eigenverantwortung fördernd und sich gegenseitig zum Erfolg verhelfend. Wir schaffen Transparenz über Unternehmensziele, Zusammenarbeit und Unterstützung durch ein internationales Team auf Augenhöhe. Wir leben Austausch, Teamgeist und einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. Das verbindet uns hierarchieübergreifend – auch im Home-Office. So erhielten wir in 2022 die kununu Auszeichnung „TOP Company“.  Das erwartet Dich bei uns:   Onboarding: Du bist ab dem ersten Tag intern vernetzt: Welcome Day, Hello Drink, Mentorenprogramm   Entwicklung: Entwicklung ist bei uns individuell auf Deine Stärken ausgerichtet: Regelmäßige Feedbackgespräche, Karrierepfade, Career Committees, Online Trainingskatalog, Internationales Arbeiten mit unterschiedlichen Kulturen   Work-Life Balance: Raum für Deine persönliche Lebensplanung (Sabbatical, Remote Working aus dem Ausland, hochflexible Arbeitsmodelle, Elternzeitprogramme, 30 Tage Urlaub, Feiertagskalender Baden-Württemberg)   Events: Fachlich und mit Spaßfaktor (Summer-Tech-Event, lokale Afterworks, Sportevents, Teamevents, Weihnachtsfeiern)   Netzwerken: Connecte Dich mit Deinen Kollegen: innen: Communities, Lunch Breaks, interne Know-How Sessions   Fehlerkultur: Mache Fehler und teste Dich aus: Wir geben Dir den Freiraum neuesten Technologien zu arbeiten   Prämien: Eine Vielzahl an Prämien für Dein zusätzliches Engagement   Weitere Vorteile: Digitales Mobilitätsbudget, Corporate Benefits, Jobfahrrad, betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement     Aber genug von uns, jetzt bist Du dran.  Du hast noch Fragen? Kontaktier uns gerne.

title: Data Analyst (Product Data Analyst)
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Математика, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights  Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

title: Data Analyst - BSEU Raw Materials Planning
skills: Skills: Технологическая подготовка производства, Планирование потребности в материалах, +8 more
job_description: POSITION SNAPSHOT  JobReq ID: 47001  Type of work: Hybrid  Type of contract: Open-ended/permanent  Full/Part Time: Full time  Location:  ROMA, Italy   Our Company   Bridgestone in Europe, CIS, Middle East, India and Africa (BSEMIA), headquartered in Zaventem (Belgium), is a subsidiary of Bridgestone Corporation, a global leader providing sustainable mobility and advanced solutions.  In addition to our premium tire products, we offer a growing portfolio of tire-centric and mobility solutions. Together with our partners and guided by "Serving Society with Superior Quality”, that has been our mission since Shojiro Ishibashi founded Bridgestone in 1931, we are working to accelerate sustainable mobility innovations and solutions. Through innovative technology, we are committed to easier, safer, smoother and seamless mobility for our society and customers improving how people move, live, work and play.  Bridgestone also benefits from a significant retail network throughout the region – in fact our retail presence in the EMIA region is the largest in the tire industry. Through 17 distinct retail partners, we have around 3,500 outlets across Europe, the Middle East and Africa as well as around 2,500 outlets through our partner network in India. This network offers a selection of services, concepts and mobility solutions.  At Bridgestone we pride ourselves on the strong relationships we maintain with everyday drivers and this extensive retail network is one of the core reasons why.  You can learn more about our Group at https://bridgestone-emia.com/  In line with the “Bridgestone Essence”, our work environment is based on integrity and teamwork, where everyone can learn from each other and contribute with their own ideas in achieving the coming goals.  We want to hear from people who can take the challenge, unleash their creative potential and contribute to the company success demonstrating ownership, courage and agility. We want you to develop your skills, expand your knowledge and be proud of your work.   Position Description     Job purpose    As a key member of the Raw Material Planning team you oversee the periodical calculation of the material gross requirements on operational, tactical and strategic horizons.  Based on processes and routines with central and plant stakeholders, you collect all production planning inputs, and review with a critical eye. You keep track of major developments in new and changing tyre and compound specifications. These inputs enable you to calculate and analyze raw material requirements for all plants across Europe.  You act as owner for defining gross raw material requirements, act as owner to collect and challenge all required inputs. Good connection with stakeholders in central and local production planning teams and stakeholders within the European Technical Center will be important.  Within the Raw Material Planning team, you will keep the link with Raw Material Category Planners, who will use your work out as input to make the net raw material planning and order to suppliers. You realize that the quality and timeliness of your work has a direct and important effect on your colleague’s work and output of the entire Raw Material Planning team.  You take ownership of part of the reporting related to gross raw material requirements, leveraging OMP as tool for daily operations and KPI tracking.    Main responsibilities / Key result areas :     GATHER INPUTS PRODUCTION PLANNING   Gather production planning inputs for different categories including tyre production, compound production, bladder production and other  Compile production planning inputs in operational weekly cycles, tactical monthly cycles and yearly strategical cycles  Lead routine meetings with production planners to understand what is behind the volumes in the production plans, understanding and seeing risks and opportunities  Analyze inputs from production planning to identify most accurate inputs and pro-actively identify attention points for material planning  Need for special attention to trial production planning   GATHER INPUTS SPECIFICATIONS   Create on continuous basis visibility on upcoming new specifications for both tyres and compounds  Lead and or join routine meetings with plants and European technical center to ensure all required specs data is available to ensure timely ordering of raw materials  Collaborate closely with local stakeholders in plants finance and technical service teams to be aware about status and progress   MAINTAIN MASTER DATA   Maintain material master data in OMP  Track and maintain specs master data in OMP  Maintain data translation tables in OMP   ANALYSIS   Consolidate received and reviewed inputs  Analyze gathered inputs to detect potential errors   BOM EXPLOSION   Run BOM explosions in OMP based on consolidated inputs  Add extra requirements after BOM explosion  Translate and split material codes   VALIDATION   Challenge outputs versus different data sources  Validate outputs against own data records  Validate outputs with stakeholders who provided inputs   REPORTING   Prepare and analyze reports and KPI’s related to gross requirements   MANAGEMENT AND DEVELOPING OF THE FOLLOWING ANALYTICS:   BOM Availability report  Multi level BOM report  Weekly inventory Adherence  Monthly inventory projection report  Inventory target setting  Weekly open PO visibility report  Global position tables  Lead time adherence  Material Segmentation  Material Prioritisation       Bridgestone BEHAVIORS   Qualified candidates for this important position will therefore need to demonstrate the following:    Agility – implement the project in an agile way meaning ‘implement per increment’ working on holistically on the improvement of the various dimensions of raw material planning (strategy, data, governance and process, people and technology)  Courage – challenge the status quo and aim for the industry standards and best practices. You lead by example.  Ownership – be the face of your projects. You represent the project approach, the team and the projects results      Bridgestone LEADERSHIP ESSENCE   Qualified candidates for this important position will therefore need to demonstrate the following:    Establishes strategic direction and effectively communicates the vision: Communicates a clear and inspiring vision for the business; drives competitive and innovative strategies and is able to generate alignment against the strategic direction  Demonstrates business acumen to achieve results through others: Understands, educates and applies the fundamental business concepts by which a company operates in order to deliver results and create a climate that fosters personal commitment to excellence  Promotes and enhances company culture: Champions the organization’s shared values and beliefs  Effectively manages across cultures: Achieves effective collaboration, alignment, and communication across multiple dimensions of cultural diversity  BOSS focused - serves the customers having the end users in mind: Makes BOSS (end users) and their needs a primary focus of one’s actions; develops and sustains productive relationships with BOSS; leverages BOSS intimacy in the development of new products, services and competitive advantage  Demonstrates self-awareness and emotional intelligence: Recognizes one’s personal strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and limits. Understands emotions and their effects  Intellectually curious in support of learning agility: Actively identifies new areas for learning; regularly creates and takes advantage of learning opportunities; uses newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learns through their application  Embraces and leads change and innovation: Encourages different and innovative approaches to address problems and opportunities; facilitates the implementation and acceptance of change within the organization  Identifies and develops organizational talent: Attracts high calibre diverse talent , leads and guides others to accomplish organizational goals and objectives through on-going development and collaboration     Required Capabilities    Personal attributes:  open minded, attention to detail, team player, assertive, strong communicator with stakeholders, analysis skills, presentation skills.  Affinity with IT systems and technology, OMP knowledge, SAP knowledge and hands-on experience  Advanced knowledge of Power-BI, Access and Excel (Macros and Queries)  Core competencies :    Critical analysis  Eye for details  Grasp large amount of data and information  Problem solving  Collaboration and teamwork  Adaptability    Management competencies :    Work across departments  Lead discussions and alignment  Helicopter view    Job specific competencies :    OMP and SAP systems and business processes knowledge/experience  Proficient with office tools as outlook, excel, access,…     Experience   For this position we expect a professional experience of +3 years working in data analytics or supply chain planning roles / similar through experience.  MORE INFORMATION  All applications will be reviewed. Our Recruitment team will contact the suitable applicants for the next step of the recruitment process.   We are looking forward to hearing from you!   DISCLAIMER  Diversity and inclusion are a central part of Bridgestone EMIA’s values at the highest level. This is key for our people to show a passion for excellence for improving society connected to the world in which we live. Our commitment to diversity, is linked to our founders mission of ‘Serving Society with Superior Quality’, which is essential in shaping and creating the organization, serving all people, respectfully, connected to our business. We recognize that everyone is different and that attracting, developing and retaining our employees will create a sustainable working environment which is essential to our success. This means that all job applicants and members of staff will receive equal treatment and that we will not discriminate in particular on grounds of gender, marital status, race, ethnic origin, color, nationality, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, religion or age.

title: DATA ANALYST - H/F
skills: Skills: Каталог, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: Au sein de la Direction Achats du Groupe, rejoignez le Département Outils Méthodes et Performance en tant que Data Analyst et participez à la transformation de la fonction Achats !   En pleine transformation digitale, vous soutenez le service en étant garant de la qualité des données et des reportings. Vous êtes responsable de l'extraction, intégration et surveillance des paramètres achats.   Vous établissez les KPI et les synthèses soutenant les activités opérationnelles du service achats.   Plus précisément, votre rôle s'articule en 5 axes principaux     Utilisation enrichissement des données     Prise de connaissance et utilisation des données de l’entreprise dans une logique de self-service.   A cet effet, vous utiliserez les données du datalake d’entreprise, d’applications métier dédiées et serez amenez à les enrichir (ex : web scraping)     Dataviz, reporting et analyse des données     A l’aise sur le traitement des données, vous réalisez :     Des analyses ad hoc pour répondre à des sollicitations particulières (ex : question spécifique, sollicitation dans le cadre de réponse à appel d’offres, etc.)  Des viz et du reporting à destination de la communauté des acheteurs. Vous participez à la définition, création et mise en place d’indicateurs pertinents pour le pilotage de la performance des achats  Data management et catalogue achats     Vous participez à la mise en cohérence des données, en lien avec les domaines du SI et plus généralement vos actions participent à la démarche de data management.   Vous êtes associé spécifiquement à la gestion, la pertinence et la cohérence des données du catalogue fournisseur, sujet central unifiant dans un catalogue Dalkia la diversité des catalogues fournisseurs. Ce catalogue constitue un véritable référentiel pour les collaborateurs de Dalkia, source de gains et d’optimisation au niveau des achats.     Animation de la communauté des acheteurs     De par votre position centrale dans l’utilisation des données pour les achats, vous assurez aussi un rôle dans la conduite du changement. Ainsi, vous vous assurez de la bonne utilisation / déploiement des reportings / analyses que vous mettez en place. Vous mettez des indicateurs en place à cet effet.   Vous êtes également associé au déploiement des nouveaux outils des systèmes d’information (ex : Ivalua).     Tech     Présentant un intérêt pour les outils de traitement des données, vous travaillez avec le souci d’optimiser vos tâches et celles de vos collaborateurs. Vous utilisez les bons outils et veillez à automatiser les tâches qui peuvent l’être.

title: Statistical Analyst (Bangkok Based, Relocation Provided)
skills: None
job_description: About Agoda    Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.    Get To Know The Team:     The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.   Due to continued expansion,  there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:       Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.    Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap    Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders        What you’ll Need to    Succeed:        Bachelor’s degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study    0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company    Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.    Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English    Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence    Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes    Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently        It’s Great if you    Have: title: Medewerker verkoop binnendienst
skills: Skills: НИОКР, Infor Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP), +8 more
job_description: Wigersma & Sikkema B.V., opgericht in 1921, is gevestigd in Doesburg en ontwikkelt, produceert en levert meet- en regelapparatuur voor de distributie van aardgas. Denk daarbij aan instrumenten voor volumeherleiding, systemen voor afstandsuitlezing, gasdrukregelaars en inspectiesystemen voor gasstations. Met deze hightech producten zijn wij marktleider in Nederland en krijgen wij internationaal steeds meer voet aan de grond. Met jarenlange kennis en ervaring en eigen R&D en productie kunnen wij optimaal inspelen op veranderingen in de markt, zoals bijvoorbeeld waterstof en groen gas. Wigersma & Sikkema staat bekend om kwaliteitsproducten, snelle levertijden en uitstekende technische service. Wigersma & Sikkema groeit door en heeft op de commerciële binnendienst een vacature voor minimaal 32 uur:      Medewerker Verkoop Binnendienst      Een dynamische baan met veel mogelijkheden in een       groeiend innovatief bedrijf        De functie:      Als medewerker op onze verkoop binnendienst werk je nauw samen met de rest van het sales team op de binnen- en buitendienst. Je maakt offertes, onderhoudt contact per telefoon en e-mail met klanten en voert orders in ons Exact systeem in. Daarnaast schakel je intern makkelijk met de andere afdelingen (Inkoop, Productie, Service, R&D & Finance). Samen met collega’s op de binnendienst ben je verantwoordelijk voor de optimale afhandeling van klantcontacten en de ondersteuning van de buitendienst collega’s. Je rapporteert aan de commercieel directeur. Je doorloopt een inwerkprogramma zodat je de producten van Wigersma & Sikkema en je collega’s goed leert kennen. Doordat je technische productkennis groeit kun je onze klanten steeds beter van dienst zijn.      Kerntaken van deze functie:   · Het adviseren van klanten, zowel telefonisch als per mail.  · Invoeren van orders in het ERP-systeem (Exact).  · Opstellen, uitbrengen en opvolgen van offertes in nauwe samenwerking met je collega’s van de buitendienst;  · Ondersteuning van de buitendienstcollega’s.      Je hebt of bent:        · Leergierig en nauwkeurig (je staat bekend als “Pietje precies”).  · MBO 4 werk- en denkniveau.  · Aantoonbare technische affiniteit.  · Een paar jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke binnendienstrol.  · Goede sociale vaardigheden.  · Een handige organisator die goed mondeling en schriftelijk kan communiceren in het Nederlands, Engels en Duits.  · Woonachtig binnen een straal van 50 km van Doesburg.        Wigersma & Sikkema biedt:         Je komt te werken binnen een inspirerende en stabiele organisatie met nationale én internationale ambities waar de technische uitdaging hoog is. De sfeer is informeel, lijnen zijn kort en er is veel ruimte voor persoonlijke inbreng. Daarnaast zijn er voldoende ontwikkel- en groeimogelijkheden. Zo krijg je de ruimte om relevante trainingen en cursussen te volgen.          Wigersma & Sikkema biedt een uitstekend salaris op basis van jouw kennis en ervaring, conform de CAO Metaal & Techniek. Je pensioen bouw je met een zeer gunstige eigen premiebijdrage op bij het pensioenfonds PMT. Daarnaast bieden wij je de mogelijkheid tot het verkrijgen van een vast contract, kun je 13 vakantiedagen bijkopen boven op je standaard aantal van 26 dagen en zijn er veel interne en externe ontwikkelmogelijkheden.            De procedure :     Is jouw interesse gewekt en ben jij de ideale persoon voor ons bedrijf? Neem dan direct contact op met Brent Teijssen.     Hij ontvangt graag jouw sollicitatie + CV via sollicitaties@wigersma-sikkema.com.

title: Mitarbeiter Marketing (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: Истории успеха, Информационные рассылки, +1 more
job_description: WERDE TEIL DER RUF-FAMILIE!    RUF Maschinenbau ist ein in zweiter Generation familiengeführtes Unternehmen, das sich bereits vor über 35 Jahren auf die Entwicklung, Produktion und dem Vertrieb von Brikettiersystemen spezialisiert hat. Als Weltmarktführer in diesem Bereich sind wir in über 100 Ländern der Welt aktiv.     Durch die eigene Fertigung der Bauteile und die komplette Produktion der Maschinen ist RUF in der Lage, schnell und flexibel auf die Bedürfnisse des Kunden zu reagieren. Rund 150 Angestellte weltweit entwickeln, produzieren und vertreiben hoch innovative, modulare und individuelle Brikettiersysteme für Holz, Metall und andere Reststoffe. Über die Jahre hat RUF mehr als 5.000 Maschinen verkauft und zahlreiche Probe Verpressungen mit einer großen Anzahl von verschiedenen Materialien durchgeführt.     Ein tolles Arbeitsklima innerhalb eines familiären Teams, ein Umgang auf Augenhöhe zwischen allen Mitarbeitern und gelebte Wertschätzung stehen bei RUF im Mittelpunkt.     DEINE AUFGABEN:      Unterstützung und Umsetzung von Content-Marketing-Kampagnen auf On- und Offline-Kanälen entlang der Customer Journey sowie interner Kommunikationskampagnen  Zielgruppenspezifische Content-Produktion, z. B. Case Studies, Video- und Social Media-Content, Händlerinformationen, Blogbeiträge, Fachartikel, Whitepaper, Website- und Newsletter-Content  Konzeption, Texten, Umsetzung, Visualisierung und kontinuierliche Optimierung der crossmedialen Content-Strategie für unsere externe und interne Kommunikation  Gestaltung und Umsetzung von Foto- und Videocontent (Briefing und Koordination von externen Dienstleistern sowie selbstständige Durchführung von eigenen Foto- und Videoaufnahmen)  Inhaltliche und organisatorische Gestaltung der Pressearbeit   Erstellung und Überarbeitung von vertriebsunterstützenden Materialien einschließlich Broschüren, Prospekten, Projektblätter etc.     Das zeichnet Dich aus:     Erfolgreich abgeschlossene Ausbildung oder eine zusätzliche berufliche Weiterbildung im Bereich Marketing, Kommunikation, Medien oder vergleichbare Fachrichtung  Berufserfahrung im (Content-) Marketing, bei einer Agentur oder in der Industrie/Maschinenbau mit B2B Schwerpunkt ist wünschenswert  Erfahrung in der Konzeption von digitalen Content-Marketing-Kampagnen entlang der Customer Journey und dem dazugehörigen Projektmanagement und der Erfolgskontrolle  Kenntnisse im grafischen Bereich, optimaler Weise mit der Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, und Videoschnitt)  Kommunikationsstarke und teamfähige Persönlichkeit, die gerne selbständig arbeitet  Technisches Verständnis, idealerweise im Bereich Maschinenbau wünschenswert  Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift  Fotografie- und Videokenntnisse sind von Vorteil     Unser Angebot an Dich:  Internationales Arbeitsumfeld, geprägt von DU-Kultur, gegenseitiger Wertschätzung und angenehmen Betriebsklima  Faire Vergütung mit attraktiven Zusatzleistungen  30 Urlaubstage  Pausenverpflegung: Wir bieten jedem Mitarbeiter täglich kostenfreie Getränke und eine gesunde Brotzeitauswahl.  Gesundheitsprogramme sowie Ruhe- und Sozialräume: In den Pausen stehen Küche- und Brotzeitraum zur Verfügung.      Bitte sende Deine aussagekräftigen Unterlagen unter Angabe des frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins an:      Ruf Maschinenbau GmbH & Co. KG  Frau Franziska Pfluger  Hausener Str. 101  86874 Zaisertshofen  E-Mail:  Personal@brikettieren.de      Oder nutze unser  Online-Bewerbungsformular  unter:  Mitarbeiter Marketing (m/w/d) | RUF Maschinenbau (brikettieren.de)

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

HUBER+SUHNER BKtel bietet Ihnen alle Vorteile eines erfolgreichen, flexiblen und stetig wachsenden High-Tech Unternehmens: z.B. eigene Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten mit interessanten Aufgaben, gute Verdienstmöglichkeiten, flexible Arbeitszeiten und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten. Insgesamt eine von Vertrauen, Respekt und Wertschätzung geprägte Unternehmenskultur in einem mittelständig geprägten Unternehmen mit der Sicherheit eines Konzerns im Hintergrund. job_description: Empira Investment Solutions S.A. ist eine Kapitalverwaltungsgesellschaft mit Sitz in Luxemburg.
