title: Policy Analyst
skills: Skills: Французский язык, Аналитические навыки, +8 more
job_description: The Centre for Entrepreneurship, SMEs, Regions and Cities (CFE)   helps local and national governments unleash the potential of entrepreneurs and small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), promote inclusive and sustainable regions and cities, boost local job creation, and implement sound tourism policies. It includes the Secretariat serving the Regional Policy Development Committee (RDPC) and its three Working Parties on Urban Policy, Rural Policy and Territorial Indicators and the Expert Group on Multi-level Governance, the Committee on SMEs and Entrepreneurship (CSMEE), the Tourism Committee and its Working Party on Tourism Statistics, and the Local Economic and Employment Development (LEED) Directing Committee.     The CFE is looking for a Policy Analyst to work on policies for entrepreneurship and the development of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). The selected person will contribute to a range of projects undertaken by the Entrepreneurship Policy and Analysis Unit involving assessments of policies to support business creation and development of related indicators and evidence. This will include analysis and recommendations on inclusive entrepreneurship policy, i.e. policies and programmes to improve equality of opportunities in entrepreneurship, notably among women, youth, seniors and immigrants.      The successful candidate will also contribute to other projects, for example on national and regional start-up ecosystems, business incubation, clusters and indicators or entrepreneurship policies. The post will involve preparing analytical reports with policy recommendations, working with online capacity-building tools for policy development by policy makers, and organising workshops and conferences.  The successful candidate will work as part of a team, under the direction of the Head of Unit of Entrepreneurship Policy and Analysis Unit, and will be under the overall supervision of the Head of the Entrepreneurship SME and Tourism (EST) Division.       Main Responsibilities      Research, analysis, drafting and data collection   Assemble, check and analyse international data on entrepreneurial activities and barriers, including for disadvantaged and under-represented groups in entrepreneurship.  Prepare short discussion papers on youth entrepreneurship policy issues (e.g. effective delivery of support, provision of entrepreneurship finance, provision of entrepreneurship training).  Prepare working documents on inclusive entrepreneurship policies in selected countries and on selected inclusive entrepreneurship policy topics, e.g. financing entrepreneurship, building networks for entrepreneurs, providing advice to entrepreneurs.  Undertake assessments of international practices in the design and delivery of selected entrepreneurship policy instruments.  Prepare case study reports on entrepreneurship in selected countries or regions.  Draft clear, concise contributions to reports for consideration by OECD committees as well as policy briefs and other communications aimed at policy-makers and wider audiences.  Draft other documents, such as seminar proceedings and meeting minutes.      Liaison and representation   Develop and maintain working relations with senior officials in national administrations and international organisations, as well as colleagues in CFE and across the organisation in developing joint outputs.  Lead and contribute to the organisation of seminars, conferences and workshops.  Participate in missions and represent the OECD in relevant international and national fora and deliver presentations and papers.  Keep abreast of policy issues and general developments in the area of policies for entrepreneurship.       Ideal Candidate Profile      Academic Background   An advanced university degree in economics, social sciences or a related field.      Professional Background   A minimum of three, preferably five years' experience in policies for entrepreneurship, acquired in a policy environment or research institution.  Sound knowledge of the theory and practice of entrepreneurship policies.  Experience in research and analytical activities, excellent drafting skills, ability to organise and summarise complex material clearly.  Proven ability to organise and manage projects within strict deadlines and budget with a minimum of supervision.      Languages   Fluency in one of the two OECD official languages (English and French) and a knowledge of, or a willingness to learn, the other.  Knowledge of other languages would be an asset.      Core Competencies   For this role, the following competencies would be particularly important: Analytical thinking, Drafting skills, Client focus, Diplomatic sensitivity, Strategic networking.  Please refer to the level 3 indicators of the OECD Core Competencies.       Contract Duration    One-year fixed term appointment, with the possibility of renewal.       What the OECD offers    Depending on level of experience, monthly salary starts at either 6,672 EUR or 8,232 EUR, plus allowances based on eligibility, exempt of French income tax.      Please note that the appointment will be based on the candidate’s level of experience and demonstrated ability to perform the functions at the expected level.     Applications from an OECD member country* nationals should be submitted online by 26 May 2023.     You will need to enter your CV, a cover letter. Please mention 'LinkedIn' in the source field and in your cover letter.      Apply today!      The OECD is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes the applications of all qualified candidates [who are nationals of OECD member countries] *, irrespective of their racial or ethnic origin, opinions or beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, health or disabilities.  The OECD promotes an optimal use of resources in order to improve its efficiency and effectiveness. Staff members are encouraged to actively contribute to this goal.     *OECD member countries: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Canada, Chile, Colombia, Costa Rica, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Japan, Korea, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Mexico, Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovak Republic, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, United Kingdom and United States.

title: Composiet medewerker
skills: Skills: Композиты, Baan ERP, +8 more
job_description: Stratos Yacht B.V., bouwer van luxe Nederlandse motorjachten (onderdeel van de Lengers Group) zoekt     medewerkers voor onze locatie in Lelystad. Voor onze composiet productie zijn wij per direct opzoek naar composiet medewerkers.          Wie zijn wij;         Reeds vijf decennia en drie generaties lang levert de familie Lengers exclusieve jachten gepaard met een uitzonderlijke service, waarbij de klant centraal staat. Als trotse vertegenwoordiger van de gerespecteerde merken Sanlorenzo, Prestige en Sacs zowel als dealer als partner in Noord-Europa, hebben wij ook het voorrecht om alle prestigieuze jachtmerken te vertegenwoordigen als vertrouwde en gecertificeerde jachtmakelaar in het topsegment.       Met de lange en bewezen kennis van de markt en de wensen van de klant heeft Lengers het merk STRATOS in het leven geroepen.        De Stratos is een SUV on the water; een volledig nieuw en groeiend Nederlands botenbedrijf dat zich laat kenmerken door ongeëvenaarde zeewaardigheid en vaareigenschappen. De productie hiervan vind plaats op onze werf in Lelystad waar de kernwaarden kwaliteit en betrouwbaarheid centraal staan. Met 8 verkoop en service locaties in binnen- en buitenland zijn wij o.a. thuis in het Middellandse Zeegebied, waar veel van onze klanten varen.       Bij de Lengers Group staat de persoonlijke behandeling van de klant centraal.        Binnen het bedrijf heerst een familiegevoel waarin je als klant en personeelslid warm ontvangen en opgenomen wordt. Dit is dan ook waar Lengers Yachts bekend om staat.        Wie ben jij;        Als   medewerker   bent je mede verantwoordelijk voor de bouw van deze high end composieten jachten. Je helpt mee aan het bouwen van deze hightech jachten met behulp van de modernste technieken op composiet gebied w.o. vacuüm infusie en de Prepreg methode met de modernste machines. Met de mensen waarmee je werkt, de faciliteiten, het gereedschap en het product waaraan je werkt zijn geweldig en geven een gevoel van trots.      Je bent gedreven, precies en werkt netjes en georganiseerd. Je bent een team speler en hebt geen 8 tot 5 mentaliteit , je bent een bewoner van ons bedrijf en hoort bij onze familie.   Ervaring is belangrijk , heb je die niet maar spreekt dit jou wel aan kunnen onze zeer ervaren professionals jou leermeester zijn en jou opleiden tot vakman.       Wat doe je zoal;       Op de composietafdeling krijg je te maken met verschillende fases in de bouw van de STRATOS met de daarbij behorende verschillende productiemethodes , je doorloopt elke fase en wij en jij ontdekken jouw talenten en zullen deze samen met jou bespreken en verder ontwikkelen.      Afhankelijke van welke ervaring jij al hebt of nog moet ontwikkelen kijken wij samen met jou naar de beste werkplek in het proces.       Een kleine impressie van onze faciliteiten;    Verwarmde productieruimtes van totaal ongeveer: 1750m²  Post-curen oven van ongeveer 110m², mogelijk tot opstoken tot 100 ° met bijbehorende meet apparatuur.  Aparte verwarmde en geconditioneerde Prepreg ruimte   Overige verwarmde Vinylester werkruimtes  Aparte slijp ruimte (Ca. 180m²) met afzuiging en gereedschap  Compleet nieuw aangelegd sanitaire ruimte met o.a. toilet gelegenheid, douches en omkleedruimte  Met de nieuwste vacuüm en injecteer machines worden alleen de beste materialen verwerkt          Wat vragen wij;     ervaring met composiet materialen is een pre’  bereid tot het volgen van interne/externe opleidingen  gedreven , zelfstandig en stress bestendig  structuurmatig kunnen werken  affiniteit met maritieme sector   je bent een enthousiaste aanpakker en je kunt goed in een team werken   je ziet en neemt jouw verantwoordelijkheid   je vind het leuk iets onder jouw handen tot stand zien te komen. title: Performance Engineer
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Английский язык, +8 more
job_description: In this role you will be responsible for the analysis of car data, suggesting setup directions to Race Engineer, supporting car preparation and chassis related electronic mapping for improving on-track performance of SAT cars. You will attend races and tests events onsite or remotely as part of the Race Engineering team.      Responsibilities:    Identifying main car limitation and supporting car development in the short (race by race) and medium (current season) terms.  Supporting simulator activity and driver preparation.  Ensure that collaboration between Race Engineering, Vehicle Performance sub-groups and Aero Performance is open and honest and constantly improves.  Support car setup definition between simulator, pre-event, and in-event activities.  Analyse car data to provide quantified and data-driven recommendations for improving car performance.  Work with Race and Performance engineers, Vehicle Performance sub-groups and Aero Performance group to support car setup definition, short and medium-term development, and simulator activity.  Execute the day-to-day tasks, providing regular feedback and updates to Chief Race Engineer.  Support simulator sessions ensuring efficient collaboration with race and performance engineers, VPG members, APG members and RedBull Technology engineers.  Support development of new data analysis methodologies for implementation in VPG data science framework.  Maintain and develop good relationships with drivers, Race & Control engineers.  Provide flexible remote and trackside attendance and attitude to work, both in line with the requirements of the role and any specific requirements of the VPG activities.  Always work in a professional manner regardless of the task set and be pro-active in promoting a positive image for the department/team/sponsors.       Experience needed:    MSc or PhD level degree in a STEM discipline.  F1 experience at a Performance Engineer level, ideally experience in vehicle dynamics, tyre engineering, simulation and aero performance areas.  Strong, broad understanding of F1 car performance, car data analysis, simulations, and interaction with driver.  Ability to scope all tasks thoroughly.  Have open and honest collaboration with other team member and between the various groups involved in the car setup definition.  Provide technical input for data analysis methodologies improvement.  Deliver timely information and reporting (delivering to deadlines set on the job list and keeping on top of communication).  Initiative and Innovation.  Ability to work with the team, external groups, and colleagues.  Fluency in English.

job_description: Au sein du Pôle Marketing Digital, je suis responsable de la Web Analyse du site web et application mobile et du CRO sur nos parcours digitaux :      Mes missions s’articulent autour des axes suivants :       Collecte des données et Web Analyse  :   Je suis responsable de la data analytics collectée (GTM, Whitelisting…) avec l’approche RGPD compliant (One trust)   Je suis garant(e) de la définition du plan de Marquage et de son suivi dans le temps  J’implémente des tags tiers dans Google Tag Manager (tags média, nouveaux partenaires …)  Je pilote la performance Web Analytics en transverse  Je propose des KPI de suivi et construis des Dashboards associés (GA et Data Studio) pour accompagner les équipes métiers dans l’analyse de leurs actions et la prise de décision (E-Merchandising, Contenus digitaux, Trafic, Digital Factory, CRM, Data…)  J’accompagne les équipes internes sur la prise en main des Outils Analytics (GA4/Contentsquare)       CRO :    Je suis responsable de la démarche CRO au sein de l’équipe  Je gère en mode agile toutes les analyses des parcours digitaux (performance commerciale, performance de navigation) et je propose des pistes d’optimisation des parcours/quick wins (recommandation, cadrage, suivi, analyse)  Je gère des AB tests réalisés dans une démarche d’optimisation continue des parcours ou des mises en avant  En collaboration étroite avec les équipes métier et Digital Factory, je contribue à l’amélioration de l’expérience client. Projets et veille :    Je contribue au projet de la mise en place de Customer Data Plateforme et le déploiement des cas d’activation   Je suis force de proposition sur les nouveaux outils, la data visualisation et l’optimisation de l’expérience client  J’assure le suivi du développement des features analytics dans le cadre des évolutions majeures, leur recette et mise en ligne en agile.           Mon profil :       Diplômé(e) d’une formation supérieure en Ecole de Commerce ou Université, je justifie d’une expérience significative d’au moins 3 ans en agence ou chez l’annonceur dans la Web Analyse et Tracking.   Je maitrise les outils d’analyse Google (GA 360/GA4, Data Studio, GTM).  Je suis capable d’utiliser les outils tels que Contentsquare et AB Tasty (ou similaires).  Je suis très rigoureux(se), dynamique, agile et autonome. J’aime travailler en équipe et apprécie le contact.   J’ai le sens du résultat et de la performance. Je fais preuve d’une excellente organisation et d’une bonne gestion des priorités.       Mon contrat :     Poste à pourvoir en CDI dès que possible  Poste cadre  Poste basé à Issy les Moulineaux (92)  Possibilité de télétravail jusqu’à 2 jours par semaine       Picard est une entreprise handi-accueillante.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Python, Компьютерная наука, +8 more
job_description: At Alpha Bank, we are shaping the future of banking in Greece.     Through our large-scale Transformation Program, we are changing the way we operate, the way we deliver results and the way we service our Customers.     · We understand our Customers’ needs and design experiences around them.  · We work in partnership and invite diversity of skills and perspectives.  · We are forward-thinking and drive continuous improvement.  · We make things happen; we execute quickly and focus on what is essential.     If you are a change enthusiast who sets ambitious goals and works with a sense of purpose, we want to get to know you!     Join our team and #be_part_of_tomorrow     #AlphaBank #TheAlphaBlueprint #Tomorrow        The  Data Scientist  will be placed in the Customer Value and Data Management Division of Alpha Bank. He/she will work closely with the various Divisions of the Bank to understand their challenges in depth and will use data to propose solutions and support decision-making. The ideal candidate should have excellent collaboration skills, should be able to communicate key data insights to involved stakeholders and should demonstrate eagerness to search for new things and develop his/her knowledge further.         What you will be doing       Engage with business teams to find opportunities, to understand requirements and to translate those requirements into technical solutions.  Support the Project Manager in the preparation of delivery plans, identifying data and technology requirements.  Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation and implementation, applying tried-and-true techniques or developing custom algorithms, as each business problem demands.  Collaborate with data engineers, Business Intelligence analysts and platform owners to integrate the results of the machine learning models in real-time and/or batch solutions.  Monitor model performance in production and assess the need for model improvement or decommissioning.  Research new data science technologies and methods to improve the technical capabilities of the team.          What you need to have       A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics or in any other related field of study. A Master’s degree in a relevant field will be considered a plus.  At least two (2) years of professional experience in the design, implementation and productization of advanced analytics solutions.  Knowledge of advanced analytics algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, anomaly detection, forecasting, optimization and Natural Language Processing (NLP).  Strong programming skills in Python or in a similar programming language.  Knowledge of SPSS Modeler or similar data science solutions.  Understanding of the machine learning model lifecycle and Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) practices.  Familiarity with data modeling and data management concepts will be considered a plus.  Experience in the financial services sector will be considered an asset.  Excellent communication skills, along with the ability to present complex solutions in a clear and simple manner.  Willingness to put effort and to demonstrate commitment to achieve results.  Eagerness to step out of one’s comfort zone, so as to learn and push colleagues to do the same.  Openness to taking on new challenges and driving change in the Organization.  Excellent command of the English and the Greek language (both written and spoken).                 What we offer           It’s all about our people. At Alpha Bank, you will enjoy:           An opportunity to join the most robust financial institution in Greece with a leading role in the Greek economy.  A friendly, modern, collaborative and award-winning work environment (Piraeus Port Plaza) that supports taking initiative and action.  A culture that centers around learning and continuous development and encourages everyone to bring their best self to work.  The opportunity to challenge your thinking through your participation in complex tasks and transformation projects.  A competitive salary and benefits.  An annual bonus scheme based on performance.  A buddy to provide support with onboarding.  Access to LinkedIn Learning and to continuous training.           Alpha Bank offers a remote interview process and a work-from-home scheme.                All applications will be acknowledged and treated in utmost confidence.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Sales Specialist
skills: Skills: Продажи, Sales Target Management, +7 more
job_description: Yellow Malta would not be an industry leader without its successful sales specialists.      We are seeking sales specialists to join our team and sell digital marketing products that support local businesses by improving their online presence and attaining their marketing objectives.        Role Description     The ideal candidates are hungry to learn about digital marketing and successful selling techniques. They are looking to launch or re-launch their careers and want to be rewarded for their outstanding performances. They have strong listening skills as well as an ability to offer solutions to customers in a compelling way. The sales specialists must be both approachable and professional in extending Yellow’s reach and impact. They have the strong ability to take initiative and confidently direct customer interactions.     The chosen candidates will be given full training in digital marketing and selling techniques.        Role Responsibilities   Attend in-person customer meetings with both existing and new customers on a daily basis  Oversee the entire sales process from start to finish and ensure that it is carried out in line with company standards  Identify customer challenges and offer the right solutions  Provide top-tier support to clients throughout the customer journey  Ensure that customer data is consistently kept up-to-date on the company’s CRM system  Collect customers’ digital assets required to fulfil digital products  Adhere to and reach set sales targets, goals and objectives  Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders         Attitude & Attributes   Willingness to learn and take on new challenges  Able to multitask, prioritise and manage work efficiently  Client-oriented and target-driven attitude  Works well both in a team and independently  Outgoing personality and is not afraid to challenge the status quo  Eager to learn and grow  Winning mentality and a strong sense of ownership  Excellent command of written English (UK)  Fluent in both written and spoken Maltese and English Languages  Hold a valid driving licence       We want the best of the best and make sure that top performers are rewarded. The position comes with a fixed salary, uncapped commission, company car and monthly fuel allowance.         About this job        30 Days   Learning about Yellow’s history, mission, vision, and values  Training in digital marketing, company products and selling techniques  Training in Yellow’s sales process and systems  Conducting in-person sales calls supervised by Yellow’s industry experts  Shadow fellow Yellow Sales Specialists   60 Days   Strengthening solutions and industry knowledge through one-on-one coaching  Understanding how to recognise and uncover potential opportunities  Working hand-in-hand with the line Manager to further develop your potential   90 Days   Garnering expert understanding and knowledge of Yellow’s sales model  Creating solid relationships with your clients  Attaining constant win-win-win outcomes         You will be successful if:   You want to win all the time and find motivation in temporary setbacks  You do not believe in settling — you find ways to overachieve and keep improving  Your ability to learn is unmatched and you are hungry for more knowledge  You love connecting with people in-person  You have experience in sales and are looking to further develop your career         About Us     Yellow is a privately owned, family-run company that quickly blossomed from a humble operation established in 1997 into one of Malta’s largest and most successful companies.      At its core, Yellow.com.mt is committed to empowering local businesses, startups, and SMEs with innovative advertising solutions that aim to engage and captivate the masses.      With over 25,000 local businesses registered on its digital platform, Yellow.com.mt has emerged as Malta's foremost directory and advertiser for vendors and shoppers alike. The platform enjoys unparalleled brand recognition and is associated with quality and excellence.     With over 14,000 listings on Google's first page and rankings for over 40,000 keywords on search engines, Yellow.com.mt is adept at providing businesses with the reach and visibility they need to succeed in today's digital age.        What we value:      Attitude  — We do not tolerate disrespectful or ill-mannered behaviour – everyone’s contribution counts at Yellow.      Quality   — We are consistent in terms of quality and aim to satisfy our clients’, partners’ and employees’ expectations.      Diversity  — Our differences are what makes us a successful and resilient team. Diversity is the essence that pushes us to reach our objectives.      Change  — We challenge the status quo, sail towards change and take prudent risks – innovation is the golden rule at Yellow.      Passion  — Our combined passion and commitment towards our jobs and the Company give us a sharp edge. We bleed Yellow.      Community  — We give back to the community and the environment, both as a Company and individually. We work for a better tomorrow.      Teamwork  — Each individual recognises the importance of everyone working at Yellow. We offer support to each other and the Company.      Responsibility  — We are responsible and accountable for each action and decision that we take – individually, as a team, and as a Company.      Honesty   — We interact with all team members, clients and stakeholders with honesty, integrity and complete transparency.      Value  — We manage all parts of our business to increase the shareholders’ value, confirming trust in their investment.

job_description: Why We Work at Dun & Bradstreet   Dun & Bradstreet unlocks the power of data through analytics, creating a better tomorrow. Each day, we are finding new ways to strengthen our award-winning culture and accelerate creativity, innovation and growth. Our 6,000+ global team members are passionate about what we do. We are dedicated to helping clients turn uncertainty into confidence, risk into opportunity and potential into prosperity. Bold and diverse thinkers are always welcome. Come join us!       About The Role    The Marketing Analytics team at Dun & Bradstreet provides our internal partners with data-inspired insights that drive targeting, segmentation and resource prioritization. We are at the heart of data-driven marketing and our work is powered by the world’s largest and best source of business-to-business data: Dun & Bradstreet.  The Data Scientist will partner closely with the marketing and sales teams to provide analytics, including segmentation and modelling, to drive targeted upsell, cross-sell and new customer acquisition campaigns. The Data Scientist will also deliver predictive analytics to support customer retention campaigns.  We are looking for a self-starter who possesses intellectual curiosity, exceptional analytical skills and the ability to communicate complex topics concisely. The ability to turn data into stories that influences decision-making and automate analytical processes will be key to success in this role.       Responsibilities     Partnerships with marketing and sales teams to establish priorities and drive business outcomes  Build and deploy machine learning models for upsell, cross-sell and new customer acquisition campaigns  Utilize product usage data to develop predictive customer retention models  Develop customer lifetime value and spend benchmark analytics  Measure impact of targeting and segmentation outcomes  Provide thought leadership to continuously improve outcomes and processes, including scaling and automation  Be a catalyst for improvement of existing data sources and predictive analytics  Scale and appropriately visualize key insights, creating effective stories that influence business outcomes        Skills     Minimum of three years analytical experience  Demonstrated influencing skills at senior levels and across multiple functions.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  Advanced R, Python or Julia programming skills  Machine learning expertise, particularly with classification and clustering algorithms  Ability to query and manipulate very large datasets  Experience working with data warehouses such as Redshift, Databricks or Snowflake  Advanced Tableau or Power BI dashboards building skills  Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or a quantitative field is preferred

title: Data Analyst - Poland

job_description: Job Description     Building a business from their passion for energy markets. That’s what our founders did in 2005 and that’s still what they do today, supported by an international team of energy experts who help spread this passion all over the world. What does our team bring to the table? A set of highly specialized consultancy services: quality energy risk management, procurement, financial controlling, sustainability, and data management solutions based on the most in-depth knowledge of energy procurement that you can find. At E&C Consultants, energy buying isn’t just a branch of our business – it’s in our DNA    As a  Data Analyst you will work with ePoint  - a unique web application developed by E&C which brings together and visualizes information on a global energy portfolio to the last detail. It holds information on their consumption, contract situation, hedging situation, risk management and on the energy markets. We are looking for an operator that will manage a set of client sites.   E&C has  a new opening for a data analyst for our office in Wroclaw, Poland (Hybrid or remote working is also a possibility!) ,  and you will join an international team working with energy data from all over the world.    What will you do?       Work with data to support E&C's contracting & risk management activities   Deliver ePoint sites and reports  Take responsibility of for correct and timely processing of energy prices, energy contracts and hedges of our clients around the world  Make regular and random data quality checks  Process and manage data of our clients in our SQL database  Develop tailor-made reports/dashboards/graphs for our clients regarding their energy data portfolios, using Power BI  Learn to become a specialist in different energy markets across the globe,  Perform various data management activities relating to data reporting.      What do we offer you?      A long-term and full-time contract  Balance Days resulting in 46 days off / year  Flexible hybrid/remote work mode possible after initial onboarding   Challenging and interesting environment in the continuously evolving energy sector  International work environment with more than 25 nationalities and English as main working language  Flat company structure with agile way of working, offering autonomy and empowerment from day 1  Intensive onboarding procedure with a buddy and an internal training program  Regular discussions on your role(s) and competencies with your team leader, allow you to define a challenging career path that makes the best use of your talents and interests  A competitive salary     Job requirements    What makes you a perfect match?      Most of all, a can-do attitude and eagerness to learn  1-2 years of experience in data reporting or analytics is preferred  Proficient excel and real interest in working with it every day , experience with PowerBi is a plus  Business English  Accuracy, being meticulous and detail-focused  High sense of ownership

title: Consultant.e BI
skills: Skills: SSRS, Функциональные требования, +6 more
job_description: 📣   Qim info, qui sommes-nous ?       Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004 et implantée sur Genève, Lausanne, Annecy et Zurich, Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un Système d’Information.     Avec 473 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents !     Fin 2021, Qim info obtient une note de 4.31/5 au label Happy at Work® qui permet de mesurer le bien-être et les facteurs de motivations des collaborateurs.     Et se place en 3ème position du classement ICTJournal en 2022.     📌   En quelques mots       Dans le cadre de notre croissance sur la région Auvergne Rhône-Alpes et du développement de nos activités sur Lyon, nous recherchons actuellement  des Consultant.e(s) BI en CDI  pour accompagner les équipes de nos clients des secteurs de la banque et de l'industrie.     🎯  Votre mission       Dans le cadre de ces activités et rattaché.e au Pôle Data, vous intégrez les équipes de nos clients afin d'assurer la prise en charge des tâches de Build & Run de nouvelles solutions BI.     Vous serez en contact avec le métier et les utilisateurs finaux afin d'assurer le recueil du besoin, la rédaction de spécifications fonctionnelles/techniques et la partie support.     Plus précisément, vous serez en charge de plusieurs sujets :      Elaborer les spécifications techniques des besoins liés au reporting et à l’analyse de données et établir le chiffrage des demandes.  Participer à l’enrichissement et à la maintenance du DataWarehouse.  Identifier, Extraire et Modéliser les données pour mettre en place les indicateurs  Développer les applications décisionnelles (Graphs, tableaux, indicateurs, etc.) à l’aide des outils Qlik.  Assurer une architecture fiable, évolutive et performante.  Travailler de manière collaborative au sein de l’équipe informatique, parfois avec des prestataires extérieurs.  En lien avec l’équipe support, installer des nouveaux produits, effectuer des migrations, des montées de version  Effectuer les tests de premier niveau et le suivi des phases de recette.  Respecter les engagements en matière de délais et de qualité du service apporté  Assurer la maintenance et les évolutions des applications déployées  Former les utilisateurs à la prise en main des applications et leur apporter un support quotidien.  Réaliser et maintenir la documentation technique.  Etre force de proposition sur les solutions techniques à mettre en place (ETL, les technologies autour des Datawarehouse).      💼   Votre profil        Expérience de 3 à 5 ans en tant que Consultant BI  Très bonne connaissance des concepts BI (ETL, modélisation, reporting, dashboarding...)  Bon niveau SQL, Power BI, SSRS  Bon niveau en développement ETL (Informatica, Talend...)  Bonne connaissance en modélisation des données décisionnelles      Vous êtes capable de prendre en main rapidement des sujets techniques, êtes autonome, rigoureux(euse) et méthodique ?     Ce poste est fait pour vous !     🏆   Conditions du poste        Lyon📍  Poste en CDI 📄  Télétravail (en moyenne) à hauteur de 2 ou 3 jours / semaine 💻  Démarrage dès que possible 📆  Rémunération en CDI à partir de 42K bruts annuels      💥  Les étapes pour nous rencontrer        Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est votre premier point de contact. A votre écoute, leur métier est de comprendre votre parcours, et de tenir compte de votre projet de vie et de vos attentes afin de vous proposer des missions qui vous correspondent.  Selon votre domaine d’expertise, nous vous proposons d’échanger et de parler technique avec l’un de nos collaborateurs.  Contexte, constitution de l’équipe en place, objectifs, expertise technique demandée, challenges à relever : cet entretien avec un Business Manager vous permet de connaître en détail les missions ou projets sur lesquels nous pourrions être amenés à travailler ensemble.  Un nouveau challenge au poste qui vous correspond !      🙌   Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?       🛠 Une expertise reconnue dans le monde du conseil avec une activité tournée autour d’une dizaine de secteurs d’activités et une connaissance de l’ensemble des métiers de l’IT  🤜🤛 Une proximité et un suivi RH & managérial de qualité avec nos consultants pour les accompagner dans leur montée en compétences et dans leur mission au quotidien  🥳 Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi partager plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim techs talks, soirées d’entreprises, Weekend Qim… de nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année, de quoi se créer de beaux souvenirs ensemble !     🔎   Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ?       Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature 😊

title: IT Business Analyst (Data)
skills: Skills: IT Business Analysis, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: FrieslandCampina is on a digital, data-centric transformation journey. A critical enabler is the global Azure data platform that we are building. It is designed to support a hub-spoke data & analytics operating model, with re-usability of data and enablement of DevOps at the core.   As a Power BI Developer, your role is to translate project definitions and ad-hoc requests into new and innovative solutions. As part of one of the Agile teams, you will plan and implement technical solutions within our cloud-based Azure platform. At the same time, you will be a key player in various company-wide data-driven projects and working groups.   You will be working within the Data & Analytics team: an international team with data professionals, generating high-quality reports and analyses while working closely with the business. This team provides insights to support the business in taking actions that add value.     What We Ask     Our ideal candidate is a hard-working and well-organized person with experience in BI development, willing to learn and grow. You should have genuine interest in BI development and understanding of BI concepts, tools and technologies. You are a team player, customer-oriented, and driven to make things happen, even when it is never been done before. Being open and transparent are key traits we would like to see in you.   To succeed in this role, you should demonstrate:     Bachelor's degree level, preferably in Analytics, Statistics, Computer Sciences, or Information Systems  1-2 years of relevant experience in a similar position, preferably in an international environment  Deep understanding of Power BI (including DAX and M Query) or similar BI tool  Data modeling and data visualization skills  Highly Numerate- scales of number and understanding  Ability to do great presentations  As an international company, our primary business language is English, and we often work with remote teams. Bringing in excellent communication skills and good cultural awareness will accelerate your success!       What We Offer     Next to our unique company culture of Dutch heritage and international presence, we offer you an environment in which you can form and carry out your own creativity and passion to develop the use cases with business. You will get to explore different approaches, share your experiences and grow together as a community.   Furthermore:     We offer a good work-life balance, and competitive salary & benefits package so you can enjoy it  Diverse training and mentoring programs to help you grow on your own professional journey  Exceptional support of cross disciplinary movement within the company to broaden your knowledge and growth paths  A friendly and informal working environment, yet professional team members as sparring partners  Autonomy and trust to create longer term impact that helps bring better nutrition to the world  When working in the central office: free cheese and milk at lunch, and barista coffee to help you go through your working days with a lot of joy       Vacancy Description     Main Accountabilities:     Liaise with various departments within the organization to understand their data and analytics needs  Develop and maintain reports in Power BI to provide new insights to drive business decisions  Publish internal reports to Power BI Service and ensure that the right access is granted, using security groups and row-level security  Answer ad-hoc questions using a variety of different resources (SQL, Report Manager, Excel etc)  Work within the framework of a team  Troubleshoot issues and train internal users on the use of our Power BI platform  Identify areas for improvement to rationalize existing processes to reduce production time and cost and improve output  Delivering objectives set by the Product Owner

All applicants will be assessed in terms of their competences, knowledge and skills.    We are waiting for your application!

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: System Developer GIS
skills: Skills: GIS Applications, GIS, +4 more
job_description: Vill Du bidra till etableringen av storskalig solkraft och biologisk mångfald?     Sunna utvecklar och äger storskalig solkraft, i syfte att bidra till omställningen mot förnybar energi och elektrifieringen av samhället. Nu söker vi en systemutvecklare som vill bidra och vara en del av vår spännande resa som ett snabbt växande bolag inom en framtidsbransch.      o Vem söker vi?   Vi söker dig som är systemutvecklare med flera års erfarenhet av GIS system. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra ingenjörer och projektledare med utveckling och design av våra egna Web GIS plattform. Du kommer att vara en del av företagets organisation för affärsutveckling och kommer att rapportera direkt till Sunnas VD och CCO, samt kommer få möjlighet att verka i en lärorik och utmanande miljö på ett bolag som växer snabbt och har höga ambitioner. Vi har vårt huvudkontor i Åre och även kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg. Denna roll har placering primärt i Åre, men med goda förutsättningar till distansarbete. Rollen kan komma att innebära resor och platsbesök.      o Arbetsuppgifter    Underhålla och vidareutveckla våra Web GIS plattformar  Bygga och underhålla API integrationer med externa parter  Hantera och optimera olika typer av databassystem  Underhålla och kvalitetssäkra datakällor  Bygga landing zone i GCP  Migrering av befintliga datakällor och plattformar till GCP  Utvärdera ny teknik och plattformar inom GIS området       o Minimikrav    Kunna minst 2 olika programmeringsspråk  Flytande engelska i både tal och skrift  Goda Linux kunskaper  Goda GCP kunskaper       o Meriterande kunskaper    Python  Bygga egna API'er  Flytande Svenska  Flera års erfarenhet inom geo spatial data processing/mapping  Hantering och analys av sattelitdata       o Som person är du:    Nyfiken och självgående  Genuint intresse för natur, friluftsliv och bevarande av biologisk mångfald  Noggrann och analytisk   Lösningsorienterad      För att trivas på Sunna tror vi dessutom att du är social, genuint intresserad av att göra gott för kommande generationer samt att du trivs bäst i en naturnära miljö.      o Vad kan vi erbjuda dig?   Vi på Sunna verkar inom en bransch som ska förändra framtiden. Vi kommer att ge dig goda möjligheter att växa med oss, samt bidra till klimatomställningen i Sverige. Tillsammans skapar vi plattformen för nästa industriella revolution samtidigt som vi ser till att det sker på ett långsiktigt hållbart sätt med biologisk mångfald i fokus. Vår verksamhet vilar på en trygg och stabil grund som bygger på långsiktighet. Det gör att vi vågar vara modiga, gå ett steg längre och göra saker annorlunda. Vi är ett härligt och dedikerat team som verkligen vill förändra förutsättningarna för en hållbar och långsiktig energiproduktion.      o Utvecklingsmöjligheter   Sunna har som ambition att bygga 1 gigawatt solenergi innan 2030 och i dagsläget har vi mer än 250 megawatt under utveckling i vår projektportfölj. Sverige ligger efter många andra länder i Europa inom solenergi med mindre än 1% elproduktion från sol. Potentialen är stor för att den andelen ska kunna växa kraftigt de kommande åren. Vi har stora ambitioner för vad Sunna skall vara om några år och det finns goda möjligheter för dig som nyanställd att utvecklas med oss i takt med att både vi och branschen växer.      o Vem ska personen rapportera till och arbeta med?   Primärt   VD och CCO.      o Hur ansöker jag?   Skicka CV samt personligt brev med en tydlig motivering till varför just du passar hos oss:   cv@sunnagroup.com       o Ansökningstid   Senaste datum för ansökan är 1 juni 2023. Rekrytering sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan dess. Tjänsten kan komma att kräva en godkänd bakgrundskontroll.      o För mer information:   Kimmo Auriemma, CCO  kimmo@sunnagroup.com  www.sunnagroup.com      o Om Sunna Group AB:   Vår ambition är att öka mängden solel i energisystemet. Vi utvecklar, äger, förvaltar, producerar och säljer storskalig solkraft i Norden. Tillsammans med nordiska kapitalpartners är Sunna en hållbar och långsiktig aktör på den svenska energimarknaden.  “Vi gillar riktigt dåliga lägen”  där hopplös mark kan få nytt värde och bli en långsiktig investering för att säkra framtidens energiförsörjning och främja biologisk mångfald.      Sunna erbjuder företag och kommuner tillgång till större mängder grön, lokalt producerad solel vilket möjliggör snabbare regional etablering och expansion av företag, lägre lokala elpriser på sikt samt stöd till elektrifieringen av samhället i stort. Vårt mål är att bygga 1 gigawatt innan år 2030.     Sunna har sitt huvudkontor i Åre, men vi har även kontor i Stockholm och Göteborg. Vi har en remote-first policy och skapar förutsättningar för våra medarbetare utifrån denna.     Läs mer om oss på sunnagroup.com

title: Analista de Software
skills: Skills: Basque, Project+, +8 more
job_description: GRUPO SEIDOR, Multinacional referente en soluciones de consultoría de software de gestión y en servicios TIC de valor añadido. Multinacional española en plena expansión, y con más de 5.400 profesionales en su plantilla a nivel global.     Nuestro equipo se encuentra en búsqueda de ampliar su familia con profesionales con ganas de aprender y crecer junto su equipo. ¡si estás buscando un nuevo reto junto a un equipo dinámico, apasionado de las nuevas tecnologías y altamente cualificado! ¡Lo has encontrado! Buscamos un Analista de Software, para integrarse en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados realizando labores de Oficina Técnica en un cliente del Sector Público.      Las principales funciones a desarrollar serán:   Comprender y establecer de manera formal las necesidades del cliente.  Definir un proyecto que ofrezca una solución integrada.  Asegurar que los entregables sean lo que el cliente espera y se ajusten a las necesidades del proyecto en su conjunto.  Realizar análisis y diseño de sistemas nuevos, mejoras a sistemas existentes y mantenimiento a aplicaciones y procesos en producción para los sistemas de la empresa, de acuerdo a los procedimientos técnicos, operativos y de seguridad establecidos.  Detectar cuáles pueden ser los riesgos potenciales y determinar cuáles serán las acciones preventivas. Nivel de Euskera B2 o C1      ¿Qué ofrecemos?  Los candidatos seleccionados se integrarán en un equipo de profesionales altamente cualificados, con amplias posibilidades de desarrollo profesional en continuo proceso de expansión  · Salario competitivo en función de la experiencia y valía demostrada.  · Contrato indefinido  · Estabilidad laboral  · Flexibilidad de horario de entrada/salida  · Formación continua

title: Assistant, HR Data Analytics
skills: Skills: Профессиональные навыки работы с компьютером, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: Primary Location    Belgium-Brussels    NATO Body    NATO International Staff (NATO IS)    Schedule    Full-time    Application Deadline    11-Jun-2023, 11:59:00 PM    Salary (Pay Basis)    4,384.94    Grade    NATO Grade G10-G12   We have also launched a campaign to recruit a G10/12 Oracle Developer (Pensions) and a G10/12 Oracle Developer (Payroll) in support of the same team.      SUMMARY      Within the Executive Management Division (EM), NATO’s International Staff (IS) Human Resources (HR) Directorate is comprised of four pillars: Talent Management and HR Integration (TMHRI); Staff Services (pay and benefits, pensions, personnel support); HR Policy and Strategy Coordination (IS and NATO-wide HR policy); a newly created Data Analytics section and the Medical Service.   As part of the Data Analytics Section reporting to DASG HR, the incumbent will provide user support for the absence management system and associated workflow and assist in the provision of data analytics, statistics, organization charts and re-organization management tasks. S/he is also responsible for carrying out administrative duties related to the processing and updating of HR related information in the areas of HR planning and employment records for permanent and temporary civilian staff. He/she will support the Section in its day-to-day activities and tasks such as the maintenance and updating of personnel records and HR-subject related files.      QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE      Essential    The incumbent must:      have a good general education, equivalent to higher secondary level;    have at least three years of previous experience in a similar post involving data analysis, record keeping, HR reporting;    have demonstrated knowledge of HR practices and regulations;    Have experience with use of data visualisation tools    be computer literate and possess knowledge of HR integrated applications and databases and other Microsoft Office programmes used for record keeping and statistics and the use of Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) in conjunction with the Office suite    have practical experience in the extraction of data from HR-related applications and the preparation of clear and concise reports for presentation and/or distribution;    possess the following minimum levels of NATO's official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one and III (“Intermediate”) in the other.       DESIRABLE    The following would be considered an advantage:      experience in data modelling, diagramming, and application module design;    knowledge of Prince2 project management methodology;    experience in user training;    experience in NATO working environment or other International Organisations or Public Administrations;    experience in the field of data protection;    knowledge of NATO structure and activities;    knowledge of the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations (CPRs);    knowledge of other NATO member country languages;    level V (“Advanced”) of NATO’s second official language (English/French).    MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES       Expertise Development    Contribute to the work of the Section in its day-to-day activities through the maintenance and updating of personnel records and related files. Provide statistics,organisation charts and re-organisation management updates within agreed upon timeframes. Act as point of contact for staff to provide advice in the use of the electronic system for the request, approval and recording of leave or other absences and associated workflow..    Information Management    Update and maintain employment records, personnel and organisational design related files. . Produce data analytics reports and statistics in support of senior management decision making.. Suggest improvements to the PMIS and associated workflows.    Knowledge Management    Extract data from the PMIS system for the preparation of reports and distribute to requestor(s). Perform database queries and provide relevant statistics. Prepare and update organisation charts data and execute changes and tasks related to re-organization management.    Stakeholder Management    Work with all civilian staff, including temporary staff and consultants, located at NATO Headquarters (HQ), in a flexible, but effective manner. Work in concert with and support the work of the colleagues in Staff Services and Human Resources as a whole. Liaise with divisional points of contact on issues related to the provision of HR reports.    Project Management    Participate in and contribute to projects assigned to the Data Analytics section, as well as to HR-related initiatives. In close co-operation with the Organisational Design and Development team (ODD), contribute to the implementation of organisational restructurings and establishment changes.   Perform any other related duty as assigned.      INTERRELATIONSHIPS     The incumbent reports to the Head of Section on a daily basis. He/she will interact frequently with all members of the Unit and with divisional points of contact for requests to access and store personnel records and administrative files, as well as for the provision of HR and ODD related information.   The incumbent with liaise with PMIS end users NATO wide in order to assist them with building of data extraction queries      COMPETENCIES     The incumbent must demonstrate:      Achievement: Works to meet standards;    Analytical Thinking: Sees basic relationships;    Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work;    Conceptual Thinking: Sees patterns based on life/work experience;    Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems;    Empathy: Reads non-verbal cues and understands meanings;    Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade;    Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation;    Teamwork: Co-operates.    CONTRACT      Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years’ duration; possibility of an indefinite duration contract thereafter .   Contract clause applicable:   In accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations, the successful candidate will receive a definite duration contract of three years, which may be followed by an indefinite duration contract.   If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.   Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.   NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post.   Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.      RECRUITMENT PROCESS     Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:      For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );    For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment      Please note that at the time of the interviews, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of their education and professional experience as relevant for this vacancy.   Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate) and approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser.   More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm).      ADDITIONAL INFORMATION     NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.   Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.   Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.   Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.   The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.   The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.   Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.   For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.

title: IT Business Analyst for Human Resources
skills: Skills: Business Case Development, Бизнес-требования, +8 more
job_description: The Position   IT Business Analyst    Purpose  :    As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with People & Culture and Informatics stakeholders and with stakeholders punctually with stakeholders from other Business Units. Your goal is to understand and anticipate business needs within a project or product team context. You understand the strategic business- and IT drivers and will act as a change agent to plan and implement technology change initiatives across the organization in accordance with identified business needs integrated with the necessary reliability, usability and scalability.    The Role      Provide expertise by identifying, evaluating, designing and deploying systems and processes that are lean thus cost effective and align with user requirements and technology roadmaps  Business requirement analysis, business case development, and the ability to make recommendations to improve the experience on technology products  Proven expertise in business process and/or data modeling, by analyzing, defining and documenting detailed process workflows through user interviews, facilitated workshops and expert engagement  Working with business users of new and/or changed products to modify their processes and/or ways of working to derive the economic benefits  Develop and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of management and stakeholders in Business and IT  Ensure all applications supporting the business are compliant with internal Roche security, risk management policies and practices, external regulatory and statutory requirements  Facilitate and validate system and user acceptance testing       Who You Are      Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or HR oriented Degree  3-5 years experience as Business Analyst,HR domain background is preferred  Extensive IT Project and Agile Methodolgies Experience in mid and large scale projects and products  Familiar with the concepts, standards, technology, tools, processes, procedures, software and services in use for delivering information services  Strong influencing, communication and team-working skills at all levels as well as negotiation skills and proven track record in getting mutual decisions and sign-offs  Technically and economomical oriented analytical mindset paired with problem-solving skills, along with experience of applying industry standard business analysis methods   Must be able to work with minimal supervision. Ability to plan own work to meet objectives, and to work independently      At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!    Who we are   At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.    Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Business Data Analyst Lead H/F
skills: Skills: Python, Проектирование баз данных, +8 more
job_description: The Business Data Analyst (BDA) Lead is the interface between the Data and business teams. The BDA Lead is in charge of understanding the demands of Procurement department and carefully providing and planning a solution. The BDA Lead is a data-driven professional, uses the data analysis process to understand, interpret, and predict patterns in business, and then use those data-driven insights to enhance their business process and making decisions. The BDA Lead aims to identify opportunities to grow, optimize, and improve an organization’s business processes. His function is on of vision and strategy implementation. The BDA Lead also helps in making judgments that are aligned with corporate objectives.      Main responsabilities :   Manages Business Data Analysts  In charge of prioritization of business requirements according to the objectifs requested  Collaborates with the Business Data Analyst and Scrum master to define what it is expected  Lies at the intersection of Data Analysis and Business Analysis   Creates and modifies computer programs to extract information from company databases  Interacts with data engineer and data scientists to understand how data needs to be converted, loaded and presented  Develops and deploys dashboards, reports, to collect data-backed insights  Interprets key business data sets  Provides insights on potential areas of growth, optimization, and improvements  Works cross-department on data-driven strategies that improve business processes and decision-making  Is responsible of writing or providing US stories or/and Business Rules.      Training & experiences :   BS/BA Degree (MS preferred) preferably in Computer Science, Statistics, Math or equivalent combination of education and experience.)  1-5 years of experience with data analysis and preparation, including experience with very large data sets  Experience working with unstructured data sets is a plus  Mathematical skills to help collect, measure, organize and analyze data   Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, R, Python  Technical proficiency regarding database design development, data models  Knowledge of data visualization  Knowledge of how to create and apply the most accurate algorithms to datasets in order to find solutions   Knowledge of the project management process.   3+ years in management/executive role  Experience in Agile Development      Skills :   Strong communication skills and collaboration.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with a strong desire to work Individual in multifunctional teams  Good curiosity to explore issues, open minded and problem-solving skills  Good sense of organization and priorization of business requirements  Creativity to get and interpret data   Self-motivation to spend time working independently with their data sets and research.  High Understanding how businesses function is key to recognizing potential areas of improvement.  Adept at queries, writing reports and making presentations.

title: Market Intelligence Analyst
skills: Skills: PowerPoint, Microsoft Excel, +8 more
job_description: OW  a controlled 50/50 joint venture between  EDP  and  Engie  is looking for a proactive and analytical " Market Intelligence Analyst ".     Are you willing to join a passionate and high performing team, in a cross-cultural, fast-paced, and strongly gr OW ing environment?      GENERAL DESCRIPTION      Corporate EPCI is enhancing its Market Intelligence skills, centralizing the information available in the market, and putting it at disposal of the whole company. Apart from creating, updating, and managing the databases, the team is developing in house Market Intelligence tools and providing different teams with periodic reports.      MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES      As Market Intelligence Analyst you will:   Build, update and maintain the OW Market Intelligence Database including information both from public data sources and internal knowledge.  Develop and maintain visual in-house Market Intelligence tools and dashboards to translate data contained in the OW Market Intelligence Database into executable insights.  Build and automatize the creation of regular reports and studios to periodically share with different stakeholders across the organization.       ACADEMIC BACKGROUND      University Degree Level.      LANGUAGES      OW has an international team of employees and the working language is English.      REQUIREMENTS       Advanced Excel based modelling (Visual Basics) and Power BI knowledge are essential.  Experience in creating data bases and modelling in Excel, SQL, Power BI, or more sophisticated architectures.  Experience with coding and statistical software as SQL, R or Python.       OTHER SKILLS       Competence with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.  Analytical and critical thinking.  High standards of organisational skills, ability to prioritise workload, able to work under pressure.  Positive & proactive attitude with self-motivated outlook.  Able to work with different teams, sometimes situated in other offices or countries.       OTHER REQUIREMENTS      Job location will be Madrid.      By selecting “Apply” above, you indicate:     you have read and acknowledge OW Candidates Privacy Notice:  https://www.oceanwinds.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/OW_Privacy-notice-for-candidates_v3.pdf   OW is authorized to store your CV in case your job application is unsuccessful to use it in another recruitment process that may arise in the future

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Data Preparation, СУБД, +8 more
job_description: Job description:         JOB PURPOSE          The Data Engineer will contribute in supervising our corporate analytics and data science platform. The ideal candidate will join the team Cloud Data Platform addressing data operations and modeling, based in Milan.               RESPONSIBILITIES            Design and implement data operations and pipelines, modeling and integration, working with global stakeholder and end users   Develop, deploy and govern highly efficient ETL and data curation processes using big data and cloud technologies and platforms (e.g., Azure, Databricks, git,)   Model and govern a core of key data sets, making them available, certified, reliable and easy to be accessed/integrated by other enterprise users-component-systems (e.g. normalized E/R models enriched by data catalogues /glossaries)   Maintain and optimize existing data pipelines integrating heterogeneous data, either starting from internal or external sources (e.g. maintaining data lineages lineage e2e)   Address a unified historical track of data, in order to provide a coherent time navigation of the data model in the long term   Manage and maintain data access based on role and groups based control               KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS           Excellent experience in processes related to data preparation/integration/modeling and governance.    Solid experience in designing and managing end-to-end data pipelines.    Deep knowledge of SQL programming language.    Solid experience in DBMS/Data warehouse modeling, optimization and management.    Deep knowledge of Slowly Changing Dimension Techniques.    Experience of the main big data technologies and tools (i.e. Spark, mlFlow, Azure ML, Hive, Docker, Kubernetes, etc.).    Deep knowledge in developing microservices, API (i.e. using REST, Graph-QL).    Advanced experience in enterprise development frameworks and programming languages (e.g., PySpark, Scala, Python, Java).    Knowledge of use and configuration of one or more of the cloud infrastructures and platforms, with a special regard to Microsoft Azure.    Knowledge and experience in stream-processing systems and lambda-architectures (e.g. Azure Event Hubs, Spark-Streaming, Kafka, etc.).    Expertise in developing and integrating advanced analytics and machine learning tools and libraries (e.g. PyTorch, Keras, Tensorflow).    Bachelor or Master's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or related STEM discipline.    3+ years experience in intensive data ops. in the context of Big Data and cloud infrastructures / platforms.    Fluent in Italian and in English written and spoken.    Organizational and self-management skills during work peaks.    Proactive self-starter with ability to manage multiple initiatives at once.    A good knowledge of retail and/or logistics processes and back end operational systems will be considered a plus.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Feature Extraction, +8 more
job_description: Posizione      Banco BPM è alla ricerca di un data scientist da inserire nel team Data & Analytcis. L’obiettivo del team è quello di supportare il Gruppo nell’adozione di sistemi di AI in risposta alle emergenti necessità delle aree di business, controllo e operation.     A titolo esemplificativo, si riportano di seguito le principali attività in carico alla funzione:   Sviluppare modelli di AI che rispondano alle esigenze di business. Questo include la gestione delle attività di sviluppo end-to-end, dalla preparazione del dato al rilascio in produzione del modello;  Contribuire allo sviluppo di un framework sostenibile di strumenti analitici a supporto dell’azienda;  Identificare possibili soluzione tecnologiche che rispondano alle esigenze del Gruppo e concorrere allo sviluppo o all’integrazione;  Supportare l’adozione di un framework di ethical AI in linea con le nuove normative;  Monitorare le best practice di mercato sugli ambiti di competenza, in un'ottica di miglioramento continuo;  Supportare le funzioni del gruppo nella diffusione e adozione di una data culture sempre più radicata.       Requisiti      Competenze tecniche:   Conoscenza delle principali tecniche di data wrangling, cleaning, exploration e feature extraction;  Conoscenza dei fondamenti di Machine Learning e degli algoritmi principali di clustering, classificazione e regressione;  Gradita conoscenza di deep learning nei vari ambiti applicativi e delle principali tecniche di Natural Language Processing;  Forte passione per l’Advanced Analytics;  Conoscenza di almeno uno dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per l’implementazione di soluzioni di Advanced Analytics (e.g. Python, SAS);  Gradita conoscenza di utilizzo di piattaforme big data e di linguaggi di programmazione utili al calcolo distribuito come pySpark;  Conoscenza di software/librerie di Data Visualization;  Gradita conoscenza di base di SQL.       Educazione e caratteristiche personali       Laurea in Matematica, Fisica, Computer Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica o simili;  Esperienza di implementazione di modelli di advanced analytics in ambito universitario e/o lavorativo o esperienze di sviluppo software per l’analisi dati ad alte prestazioni;  Attitudine al lavoro di gruppo, flessibile e dinamico, volto al raggiungimento di obiettivi di progetto;  Buona conoscenza dell'inglese. La conoscenza di una seconda lingua straniera è un plus;  Ottime capacità di diagnosi e di problem-solving, di comunicazione, di organizzazione del proprio lavoro, di gestione del tempo;  Attitudine al pensiero critico.       Altre informazioni        Tipologia di contratto: a tempo indeterminato
