title: Business Analyst Junior
skills: Skills: Business Analysis, PowerPoint, +8 more
job_description: Nous recherchons :    Un.e Business Analyst    CDI à pourvoir idéalement le plus tôt possible      Au sein de la Direction financière, vous avez pour missions suivantes :   Effectuer des analyses ad hoc sur les ventes et le mix produit afin de soutenir les prises de décision de la stratégie marketing  Analyser le succès des lancements produits à travers l’analyse de la performance des campagnes marketing et l’impact du soutien média  Réaliser des analyses et rapports sur les performances des différents canaux de ventes (livraison, Click & Collect, etc)  Evaluer la performance des différents tests produits effectués sur un panel de restaurants tests  Participer à la validation du CA des restaurants pour la clôture mensuelle  Participer à la projection des ventes et à l’élaboration du budget des ventes de Burger King France      Vous serez amené.e à interagir avec de nombreux départements et notamment les départements marketing, supply chain et opérations. Les différentes analyses que vous mènerez permettront d’assister le marketing et le COMEX dans la prise de décision stratégique.     Profil : Diplômé.e d'une formation Bac+5, vous justifiez d'une première expérience en stage ou en alternance sur un poste similaire (Contrôle de Gestion, Business Analysis, Forecasting, Pricing).  Excel (niveau avancé) et PowerPoint sont des éléments que vous connaissez.  Vous disposez d’un anglais courant. (A l’oral et à l’écrit).     Vous êtes particulièrement rigoureux.se et proactif.ve et vous faites preuve d’une grande force de proposition pour trouver des solutions aux problèmes auxquels vous êtes confronté.e.  Enthousiaste et impliqué.e, votre esprit d’initiative et votre relationnel vous permettront d’assurer avec succès les missions qui vous seront confiées et de vous intégrer parfaitement au sein du département.      CDI à pourvoir idéalement le plus tôt possible et basé à Clichy (Métro St Ouen – ligne 14).         «Sachez que chez Burger King on a très très à cœur de donner sa chance à tout le monde, c’est pourquoi nos postes sont handi-accueillants.»

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Python, Английский язык, +7 more
job_description: We are looking for a smart and motivated  Data Scientist  who will join Growens to guide and inspire the organization on business potential through analytics.      About Growens   Working at Growens means joining an international group of tech companies where people are the heart of the business. We are committed to creating a work environment that is fair, transparent and motivating while promoting merit, well-being and people development. A flexible way of working fuels a constant strive for innovative processes & solutions: all of us can choose whether to work from home, from the office or from anywhere else, at any time.      Your impact   As a  Data Scientist , you will report directly to the Head of Analytics & Digital Integration. You will gather and analyze data using various types of analytics and reporting tools to detect patterns, trends, and relationships in data sets.      Some examples of your responsibilities:       Problem Analysis and Management     Identify opportunities for business-led delivery ; coach employees to make use of data and analytics.  Identify data-driven/ML business opportunities   Prioritize, scope, and manage data science projects  and the corresponding key performance indicators (KPIs) for success   Interact and translate analytic insights  for internal business stakeholders and other IT team       Data Collection, Preparation, and Exploration        Understand new data sources  and process pipelines and catalogue/document them  Acquire access to various databases and other sources systems    Create data pipelines  for more efficient and repeatable data science projects   Display drive and curiosity to understand the business processes  at their core   Network with domain experts  to better understand the business mechanics that generated the data   Apply visualization techniques  (using BI tools)  and statistical analysis  to make value out of data       Machine Learning          Apply various ML and advanced analytics techniques  to perform classification or prediction tasks; for example, from an understanding of financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, marketing   Collaborate with data engineers  to evaluate and implement ML deployment        What we Offer:     Make a difference : you'll give a huge contribution to the growth of the Group.    Learn and grow : will work closely with important stakeholders to drive business insight.   Flexibility : trust is one of our values and we strongly believe in results, no matter how many hours you spend in the office   International environment : we are an international reality present in different countries and different cultures.        What we are looking for:      Passion:  you love what you do, you go the extra mile, eager to tackle challenges and solve problems. You are passionate about data and you have strong analytical thinking skills.   Open-Mindedness:  you embrace change and you love to learn and keep up to date. You value other people’s points of view and you love to debate ideas, brainstorm, collaborate and evangelize. You have the ability to get into the details, while also seeing and understanding the big picture.   Drive:  You are ready to advise and support to achieve successful outcomes in a fast-moving, strongly results-driven environment   Autonomy: you have the ability to organize your work activities    Interpersonal skills:  you can build quality relationships with everybody, be diplomatic, and be capable of resolving disputes in a responsible manner as conflicts may arise. You have excellent collaborative skills.    Proficiency in English and Italian:  you read, write, and speak proficiently in English and Italian.       Technical qualifications:    At least 3 years of working experience in a similar position;  Degree in Statistics, Mathematics or Physics;  Solid statistical background related to:     - Multivariate analysis (regression, cluster analysis, factor analysis etc.);   - Predictive analysis / Scoring;   - Programming in R or Python      Good SQL  Experience with BI Tools (like Spotfire, and PowerBi…)        When you join our company, you can expect:    Full-time work in a fast-growing, exciting project with worldwide recognition as a market leader in our industry.  Many opportunities for professional development through your daily exposure to marketing-leading products, and also through access to online training resources and offline events (attendance to conferences, etc.);  Competitive salary plus incentive-based compensation.       Type of contract & location    We offer a   permanent contract;    We have offices in Cremona & Milano, but you can also choose to work remotely (from Italy) as stated by our way of working. If you do work remotely, we will ask you to be flexible about joining the rest of the team in our Cremona or Milano offices from time to time for in-person meetings and workshops.        Growens is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, gender, ancestry, colour, religion, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, medical condition, disability, or any other basis protected by law.

title: Digital Analytics & Engagement Expert
skills: Skills: A/B тестирование, Google Analytics, +6 more
job_description: About Us:   OPAP is the top gaming company in Greece and among the most recognized ones in its sector worldwide. Our aim is to establish OPAP as a world-class entertainment and gaming company, having long-term strategic priorities focus on the customers, on the people, on the network, on the products and on the digital-technological capabilities. We are currently a highly esteemed employer, offering career opportunities and a unique work experience to exceptional professionals and talented young people, through our dynamic Selection & Recruitment Program as well as our Internship/Graduate Programs. Our main objective is to develop a high-performing Team by attracting new talents, as well as developing and creating stronger bonds between our people.         So what’s the challenge…      The Digital Analytics & Engagement Expert’s role is to measure, monitor & evaluate the activity of all OPAP’s digital assets, assess their performance and achievement of business mandate and utilize operational insights and market good practices in order to provide actionable recommendations to the relevant teams to improve their digital assets efficiency, effectiveness and users’ engagement.        Your day to day will include:    Translating business requirements and mandating of digital assets into specific metrics and designing automated data dashboards, user journey funnels, traffic heatmpaps, etc. that will enable the accurate monitoring of their efficiency and impact   Working closely with BI & Business Analytics Teams to define & develop the necessary datamarts per digital asset utilization  Analyzing digital data and measures digital assets performance to identify insights and opportunities to increase user engagement, enhance effectiveness and drive business growth  Supporting the design of effective data visualizations, reports and analytical solutions utilizing self-service reporting tools (i.e. PowerBI, Tableau)  Combining sophisticated digital analytics with qualitative metrics on user behavior on digital assets (e.g. insights from digital monitoring tools – heatmaps, clikmaps, etc) to extract meaningful insights for business owners  Coordinating and executes A/B Testing assessment processes to identify optimum user journeys and validate designs efficiency  Working closely and share knowledge with other Digital Team functions, as well as other departments such as Product, Online, Retail, Marketing & Business Intelligence to increase data and analytics maturity  Monitoring and reporting on key digital engagement metrics, such as user navigation, user retention, and conversion rates, and make recommendations for improvement  Collaborating with cross-functional teams to ensure that digital engagement and analytics efforts are aligned with Business goals and objectives  Proposing and supporting the implementation of action plan to improve user engagement and retention across various digital channels, including websites, mobile apps, IoT devices, etc.  Coordinating the necessary processes and procedures for the efficient monitoring & reporting of user behavior on digital assets, according to the relevant regulatory frameworks  Updating timely, industry trends and best market practices in digital analytics and engagement, and making recommendations for continuous improvement  Ensuring compliance with the regulatory framework and rules regarding the exchange of customer information and data       What you need to succeed:     Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer science, or a related field  6+ years of experience in digital analytics and engagement, in data driven organizations  Sound knowledge of the digital ecosystem, digital functions and relevant applications  Strong knowledge of digital analytics tools, such as Google Analytics, Data Studio, Adobe Analytics, and Mixpanel   Experience with A/B testing and optimization techniques   Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills  Strong written and verbal communication skills   Experience in the gaming industry is a plus          What we offer to our candidates:    Opportunity to work with #dynamic people full of #passion #integrity & #fun  Modern & award winning workplace environment  Competitive compensation package  Competencies’ & Career Development opportunities  Private health coverage   OPAP Group is an equal opportunity employer         Does this sound like you? If yes, we would love to meet you!

title: Business & Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Oral Communication, Бизнес-аналитика, +8 more
job_description: The Company      Bandai Namco Europe is a leading global publisher and developer of entertainment content for platforms including all major video game consoles and PC.     BNEU is the western content hub of Bandai Namco Entertainment Inc.(BNEI), and is building its reputation with franchises such as LITTLE NIGHTMARES™, THE DARK PICTURES ANTHOLOGY, and the upcoming UNKNOWN 9™ Awakening - developed by the recently acquired Reflector Entertainment based in Montreal, QC.     Part of the Japanese Bandai Namco group, an entertainment industry leader with a presence in video games, toys and amusement parks, Bandai Namco Europe has 15 international offices with operations in 50 countries around the world.     Our company motto is ‘Fun for all into the future’! Find out why you should join the Bandai Namco Europe family in Lyon, France by watching this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3GnkNb70G3o         Job Description      You will join the Business Intelligence department, and will report to our Lead Data Scientist.  You will proactively analyse and facilitate the access to information on the current business and identify opportunities or risks. Additionally, you will provide analyses and input regarding market conditions, competition, and effectiveness of the sales to Management and internal teams (especially the Digital Sales Team, Business Intelligence and Financial department).     Your main responsibilities will be as follows (non-exhaustive list):      Conduct in-depth analysis of digital sales of Bandai Namco games in EMEA: forecasts, recommendations for product life cycle management (promotions, visibility, transition to new business models)  Ensure a competitive intelligence monitoring on the digital video game distribution market in collaboration with the other members of the business intelligence group and relay the information internally  Participate in the monitoring of player engagement for Bandai Namco titles: analysis and recommendations based on in-game data, gameplay and usage data  Participate in the continuous improvement of forecasting and sales management tools: creation of dashboards, KPIs, predictive models to meet the needs of various internal teams          Candidate Profile       3+ years of experience in data/business analytics  Entertainment or digital media industry experience is appreciated  Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics or engineering school  Understanding of Marketing, Business and products is a must - ability to provide analysis with a business/marketing approach  Strong skills and genuine appetency for analytics and statistics  Unmatched passion for data, gleaning insights from data, and making decisions based on data  Strong Microsoft Word, Power Point and Excel skills including VBA, Pivot Table, modelling techniques, forecast, selling curve  Strong software skills including data visualization tools: Power BI (preferred), DAX language, Tableau software, Looker, Qlik  Skilled in Python, SQL and Power Query  Knowledge in machine learning and tools auto ML and auto AI is a plus  Ability to present information in simple terms and synthetize data from various sources  Excellent English skills required (oral communication and writing skills)  Good communication skills in French  Team spirit  Ability to bring people together around a project  Proactive with an entrepreneurial mindset          Sounds interesting?       Please send us your CV and cover letter   in English  .      Additional Information       Job location : 15, rue Felix Mangini, 69009 LYON – FRANCE / This position is not eligible to full remote   Start date : asap   Contract : full time (permanent)   Remuneration : fixed and variable compensation   Benefits : flexible working hours, 2 teleworking days per week, lunch vouchers, profit sharing, reimbursement of public transportation costs, work council advantages (gift vouchers, discount on services..), new building with various facilities (gym room, gaming room, nap room, car/bike/scooter parking, cafeteria and coffee corners..)

title: Data Analyst (h/f)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, HTML, +8 more
job_description: Vous souhaitez mettre vos compétences au service d’un acteur majeur de la transition énergétique, expert et distributeur du gaz naturel ? Alors rejoignez-nous et       Devenez DATA ANALYST     (h/f)       Douai (59)       Votre rôle en quelques mots !     Ingénieur informatique, data analyste, vous êtes expert en data. Vous souhaitez contribuer à la qualité des données et créer de la valeur ajoutée avec des bases de données au service de la performance opérationnelle et de la satisfaction des clients.   Vous travaillez en mode collaboratif et avez à cœur de faire parler les données.     Votre environnement de travail :     Venez rejoindre la cellule Hypervision de la Délégation planification et programmation des interventions de la Direction Réseaux GRDF Nord-Ouest.   Les principaux objectifs de cette cellule sont :       de produire des modèles de prévision, court et moyen terme, d’activités des agences d’intervention qui réalise les interventions sur les réseaux gaz et chez les clients de GRDF,    de réaliser des reportings à destination des acteurs pour garantir la réalisation performante des activités    de garantir la qualité et la cohérence des bases de données,    d’identifier des marges de performances dans la modélisation des données et la réalisation des activités    d’animer les différents métiers et d’optimiser les processus de planification moyen et long terme       Des déplacements sont à prévoir sur l’ensemble du territoire Hauts-de-France et Normandie.     Vos missions :     En tant que CHARGE DE PROJET ET D'EXPERTISE DATA JUNIOR, vos principales missions sont :       Contribuer à l'amélioration de la qualité, de l'exhaustivité des données et garantir la cohérence des bases de données techniques, clientèles, au service de la sécurité industrielle, de la performance opérationnelle et de la satisfaction des clients.   Modéliser et proposer des scénarios d’activités prédictifs.   Extraire, analyser, concevoir et produire des informations issues du traitement des données internes et externes existantes à destination des managers dans le cadre d'actions de pilotage ou d'amélioration de la performance.   Contribuer aux actions de sensibilisation de l'ensemble des collaborateurs à l'importance de la qualité des données.   Développer et piloter des opérations automatisées de mise à jour des données.   Développer des outils informatiques ou des applications locales, à la demande des managers opérationnels.   Produire des données permettant d'éclairer l’APPI dans les choix et les stratégies de planification   Assurer une veille technologique dans le domaine des datas et de l’intelligence artificielle.        Qui êtes-vous ?     De formation d'Ingénieur Informatique ou Data analyst vous maitrisez :       DATAIKU, ORACLE, programmation PYTHON - Anaconda & Jupyter, requêtes SQL et outils de Machine Learning.    L'analyse géospatiale, des logiciels de datavisualisation (PowerBI, AEDG, Microstratégy et WEMAPS) .    Des logiciels et langages de développement WEB (HTML, PHP...)       Vous faites preuve de Rigueur, de capacité d'analyse, de synthèse et d'animation. Autonome et à l’écoute de vos clients, vous possédez des qualités pédagogiques et rédactionnelle. Vous êtes en permanence en veille technologique (Intelligence artificielle).   Au-delà de votre expérience professionnelle, ce sont vos qualités relationnelles, votre savoir-être et votre motivation qui feront la différence.     Votre rémunération !     Nous vous proposons une rémunération complète et attractive !   Un fixe sur 13 mois (selon diplômes, expérience professionnelle liée à l’emploi, situation familiale) .   Viendra s’y ajouter une rémunération variable par le biais d’une prime d’intéressement. Vous avez également accès à l’épargne salariale et êtes couvert par notre mutuelle d’entreprise.   En tant que salarié des IEG ( Industries Électriques et Gazières) vous bénéficiez de l’avantage énergie (gaz/électricité).   Cet emploi est éligible au travail à distance selon l’accord TAD en vigueur au sein de GRDF.   Au-delà de votre rémunération, GRDF vous offre un cadre de travail agréable permettant de concilier vie pro/vie perso (27 jours de congés payés + 20 jours de RTT/an environ) et un parcours professionnel riche et varié, ainsi que des formations pour se professionnaliser.     Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?     Intégrer GRDF c’est :       Rejoindre une entreprise responsable, reconnue pour son excellence dans les domaines de la qualité (Iso 9001), de la protection de l’environnement (Iso 14001) et de l’éthique (Iso 37001), engagée pour la transition énergétique grâce aux enjeux du gaz vert, et pour la diversité et le bien-être de ses 11500 collaborateurs.    Une expérience unique pour vous faciliter l’accès à l’emploi et un réseau de CFA partenaires sur l’ensemble du territoire afin de faciliter votre intégration à la formation spécifique sur nos métiers.       GRDF Nord-Ouest, employeur de référence en région Hauts-de-France et Normandie, est engagé auprès de ces Territoires en tant qu’entreprise « Responsable » et contribue à la transition écologique grâce à l’essor des gaz verts. Ces engagements de Responsabilité Sociétale de l’Entreprise sont reconnus par le label de référence RSE « LUCIE 26000 ».

title: BI Specialist
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Английский язык, +8 more
job_description: The Job      The Analytics & Reporting team is striving to significantly contribute to the company's decision-making process. We strongly believe that our data will set us apart and help us succeed in becoming a data driven company.      Members of our team work to fully understand and make sense of data. To do this we partner up with the business teams to help them drive direction with data.      We like to collaborate as a team and with other stakeholders across the company to get our work done, and we like to continuously look for other ways on how we can further improve.      Functionally, as our BI Specialist you are responsible for gathering the requirements from the business teams and translating the data into valuable insights.      Your Mission       Develop and improve BI solutions: data models, reports, and dashboards;  Apply business logic to various datasets to meet the reporting requirements;  Create intuitive and interactive reports and dashboards using Power BI for data driven decision-making;  Support in various projects to ensure the reporting requirements are clear and advise on data setup;  Inspire and train business teams on exploring the possibilities of using data;  Gather and translate the business requirements into a BI solution.          Your Talent       In depth knowledge of Power BI and/or Tabular Models and BI concepts, preferably using the Microsoft BI Stack;  You have 2 years+ experience working as a Power BI / front end specialist;  Bachelor’s degree level or higher;  Strong expertise in data visualization;  Strong analytical skills applied at root cause analysis and issue resolution;  Excellent communication skills. You can discuss topics across a diverse group of business and cross-functional stakeholders. You ask the question behind the question;  Excellent knowledge of the English language (written and spoken);

title: Center Operations Specialist
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Служба поддержки, +2 more
job_description: U.S. Citizenship Required***    Why join our team?   With a mission that spans the globe, the USO provides a rewarding and fulfilling work environment. Our team is exceptional, and we offer generous paid time off, including volunteer days and military leave. We have a remarkable 401k match, comprehensive benefits, and opportunities for training and education reimbursement. Our team members are passionate about putting the mission first, and we have a lot of fun while doing it. Working for the USO isn't just a job – it's a calling, and we believe in doing what you love and loving what you do.  Don't just take our word for it. An independent external survey found that   97% of employees enjoy their work  90% are satisfied with their pay and benefits  95% would recommend working here to friends and family  95% would recommend our USO services to a friend.   The Center Operations Specialist is responsible for maintaining a warm, friendly, inviting environment for troops as well as assisting with the day-to-day activities of a USO Center during an assigned shift.   Principal Duties and Responsibilities (*Essential Duties)    Meet, greet, welcome and assist visiting guests. Orient and assist guests with center amenities, tours, classes, programs and services. Provide quality customer service in a variety of areas, including but not limited to relevant, informative travel advice and complaint resolution.*  Monitor and maintain readiness, availability, and cleanliness of activity and lounge areas (i.e. check-in area, coffee/snack stations, computer stations, media/gaming rooms, kitchen/café areas, pavilions/patios and outdoor areas, rest rooms, offices, storage rooms, etc.).*  Monitor and maintain operability for all facilities and equipment (i.e. coffee makers, popcorn machines, telephones, computers, Wi-Fi accessibility, cash registers, gaming consoles, etc.).* Monitor supply inventory and replenish stock.*  Supervise volunteers during assigned shift, ensuring that quality customer service and support is provided in a manner consistent with service delivery standards, as well as USO Policies, Procedures and Core Values.*  Process cash or credit card sales, balancing money and credit charges with cash register totals at the beginning and end of assigned shift. Maintain customer profile records in Daily Cash Receipts Log.*  Assist with programs and events as needed.*  As directed by Center Manager and/or Regional Leadership, assume responsibility for center operations as needed.  Other duties as assigned.    Job Specifications    High School Diploma or equivalent. Bachelor’s Degree preferred.  0-3 years work experience in retail, customer service, recreation facility or related role. Relevant experience in a not-for-profit, military, multicultural and/or global organization preferred.  Strong interpersonal and customer service skills. General knowledge of military community preferred.  Demonstrated proficiency in written and oral communications as well as knowledge of various software programs including but not limited to Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.  Fluency in English with the ability to speak, read, and write in the language of the host and neighboring countries preferred.  Strong interpersonal and customer service skills. Ability to interact with USO Leadership, the general public and military audiences at a variety of levels with integrity and professionalism.  Demonstrated ability to exercise sound judgment related to controversial and/or culturally sensitive subjects. Ability to handle confidential information with tact and poise.  Must be punctual, organized and self-motivated, with the ability to quickly and easily adapt to changing organizational needs.  Ability to achieve desired results while working collaboratively in a team environment.  Ability to perform basic math and follow proper cash/donation handling and reporting procedures.  Ability to obtain and maintain proper credentials necessary to access USO Center locations and facilities including but not limited to security, credit and/or background screening, SOFA status, valid driver’s license.  Must be a strong advocate of the USO’s mission to lift the spirits of America’s troops and their families.    Details    This position is located in Kaiserslautern, Germany. Preference will be given to local candidates within commuting distance to the location.   U.S. Citizenship Required  This position does not offer SOFA status or logistical support.  USO locations will adhere to local area and DOD guidelines regarding COVID vaccination/testing requirements. Employees may be required to be vaccinated or tested regularly per local requirements.  Resume and cover letter are required for full consideration.  Background check – education, criminal and driving required.  The statements contained herein describe the scope of the responsibility and essential functions of this position but should not be considered to be an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Individuals may perform other duties as assigned including work in other areas to cover absences or relief to equalize peak work periods or otherwise balance the workload.   If that’s not enough to convince you, here are some  direct quotes from employees     The organization truly cares about the people who work here.  I have been with the USO for 4 years and have consistently been able to grow in my knowledge and position. It is a fun place to work and my work/life balance is manageable. The way the organization has handled COVID has been top notch - I never felt fearful that I would lose my job or be put in a situation where I did not feel safe. The benefits are great - PTO and 401k matching are top level.  There is great consideration given and extended in the following areas organizational core values for all, work-life balance, impact we can actually see (and even experience as a staff member- the feeling of making an impact is priceless), autonomy with respect to current position within the organization.  Everyone is friendly and easy to talk to. We collaborate well together and share ideas and interests to create fun activities for our overall goal in the community. I couldn't think of a better organization to work for.  The mission alone provides a positive and meaningful purpose, where people should want to work and be a part of. Most of the people who work for the USO and volunteer for the USO have giving hearts and want to make a difference. This also makes the organization a place where people would want to work.  The mission and opportunities to make a Difference are amazing. There is no doubt that the USO is one of the most forward-facing, frontline serving nonprofits that I know of.    Apply today and be a force behind the forces        U.S. Citizenship Required***

title: BI Specialist
skills: Skills: Панель управления, Database Tools, +8 more
job_description: Hoe  Als BI-dashboarding specialist creëer je dashboards voor diverse commerciële en operationele afdelingen binnen de Zakelijke markt van KPN. Jij maakt gebruikt van de volledige potentie van de data om de bedrijfsvoering werkelijk op basis van data te sturen.  Waarom  Binnen de KPN Zakelijke markt streven we ernaar om samen nog meer op basis van data te werken. Ons doel is om verder te digitaliseren en onze klanten en medewerkers van KPN beter te ondersteunen met waardevolle inzichten, analyses en data producten. We geloven dat een gezamenlijke inzet van data ons in staat stelt om betere beslissingen te nemen en onze gemeenschap als geheel te versterken.  Waar  Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s in Zoetermeer of Amsterdam Sloterdijk. Onze locaties liggen vlak naast de stations, waardoor we gemakkelijk met elkaar in contact kunnen komen. Daarnaast is er de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken.  Met wie  In een hecht en ervaren team van ongeveer 10 collega's werk je samen met verschillende afdelingen, zoals Sales, Marketing, Digital en Service. Gezamenlijk zetten jullie je in voor de verbetering en vernieuwing van het rapportagelandschap, met als doel om de commerciële, financiële en operationele besturing van de KPN Zakelijke Markt te optimaliseren. We streven naar een gemeenschappelijk succes en een gedeelde verantwoordelijkheid voor het bevorderen van de bedrijfsprestaties.  jouw grootste impact  Jouw inzichten en actie gerichte dashboards dragen bij aan fact-based commerciële besturing, strategische projecten en digitale klantreizen. Je draait mee in projecten met focus op het creëren van de juiste inzichten over de hele keten en het maximale uit de beschikbare data te halen  jouw rol als  De BI Specialist Zakelijke Markt heeft de focus op het ontwikkelen van de inzichten voor commerciële, operationele besturing en strategische projecten. Je ontwikkelt informatieoplossingen, zoals Dashboarding en Selfservice oplossingen met onder andere PowerBI.   Je analyseert de business vraag en adviseert over passende oplossingsrichtingen   Je maakt passende dashboards welke de stakeholders helpen de benodigde acties en kansen te identificeren  Je weet (complexe) data te vertalen en visualiseren naar actiegerichte inzichten  Je ziet kansen voor nieuwe toepassingen met de beschikbare data en je begeleidt de business bij het gebruiken van de dashboards   Je spreekt de taal van de klant, kent de business en maakt de vertaling naar innovatieve kansen  Je creëert een visie op het informatieproduct en stelt de BI gerelateerde requirements vast       Wat breng jij ons    Je hebt kennis van BI en database tools voor het bouwen van dashboards, het integreren van datasets en je bent in staat om het verhaal over te brengen naar de Business. Je bent een Team speler.   Data gedreven en analytisch, kan de business wens naar techniek vertalen (en omgekeerd)  Actuele kennis van datamodellering en visualisatie in PowerBI  Ontwerpen, ontwikkelen en onderhouden van rapportages en dashboards  Beheersing SQL en SQL Server (Analysis Services)  Azure (ADF, SQL, Storages, Azure Dev-Ops (CI-CD)) kennis is een pré (of wens om dit te ontwikkelen)       Wat krijg je ervoor terug     Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal €3690,- en maximaal €5097,- afhankelijk van je werkervaring  Een 37-urige werkweek  Mogelijkheid tot keuzetijd tot 40 uur per week, 8,5% bruto salaris erbij  Een toeslag van 10,5% van je bruto maandsalaris  Een variabele-bonusregeling van 7% behorende bij schaal 10  Jaarlijks een individuele en collectieve verhoging vanuit KPN CAO  Een mobiele telefoon en laptop  Goede doorgroei- en opleidingsmogelijkheden en een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget van €1.500, -, Sterker nog, we verwachten van jou dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen!   Deelnemen aan het nieuwe werken (werken waar en wanneer je wilt)  Thuiswerkshop om je werkplek thuis optimaal in te kunnen richten  50% korting op KPN-producten en -diensten  Een reiskostenvergoeding voor woon-werkverkeer  Uitstekende pensioenvoorwaarden       Wie zijn wij    Ons team bestaat uit BI consultants, BI Specialisten, Data Marketeers en Analisten. Gedreven door passie voor de (klant) data en resultaat werk je met een groep van jonge en gedreven professionals aan één gezamenlijke doelstelling: een data gedreven KPN!

title: Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Web Concepts, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: Import.io is on a mission to enable web data. The web is the world’s largest database, but getting data from the web is hard. Import.io is on an ambitious mission to solve that problem and make web data a reliable, high-quality data source. We have built the world’s only   enterprise Web Data Integration platform that can parse data from any website, at scale and deliver that data accurately, on time, every time. Our customers are among the world’s leading organizations and they use web data on their most important business problems, running mission-critical applications and services with the web data that we provide to them. Together we can make sure that no one ever has to write a web scraper again – we’re just getting started.   Import.io is looking for a  data analyst  to join our growing data engineering team. We visit millions of web pages daily, extracting billions of data points in the process. Our data engineering team is responsible for keeping things running smoothly, monitoring operations, improving extractor efficiency, or repairing misbehaving extractors.    We currently have two positions available.     We are looking for people to work on rotation shifts from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and from 4 p.m. to midnight to cover different time zones. Rotation to discuss.       Requirements      Required Skills      Experience in dealing with incident detection, resolution, and coordination of resolution efforts.  Outstanding problem-solving abilities  Familiarity with javascript, typescript, or other scripting languages.  Expertise with common web concepts – HTML, DOM, CSS, XPath.  Strong verbal and written communication skills in English.    Preferred Skills      Understanding of network concepts like caches & proxies.  Familiarity with software engineering practices like SCM and CI/CD.       Responsibilities     As a key member of this team, you will primarily be handling internal escalations of customer requests, ensuring that these get resolved in a timely manner. This involves understanding the issue, finding the answer, and either responding to the customer or coaching your teammates on the appropriate response. Communication with the customers, both internal and external, is critical, so a strong customer service mindset is critical     In This Role, You Will       Monitor extractor operations; identify, troubleshoot, and resolve extraction issues.  Investigate and resolve technical issues from customers.  Build new extractors for customers as needed.  Guide and coach application analysts in the resolution of customer inquiries.  Responsible for working on rotational shifts, holidays, and weekends as required.       Benefits       Comfortable office in the Market Square with friendly atmosphere  Development fund of 3k PLN per year per head  Flexibility in choosing the type of contract  Possibility to work remotely  Paid holiday  Private healthcare (Luxmed)  Sports card (Multisport)  Free English classes  Team building and socializing events  Competitive salary  Decent coffee & fresh fruits in the office  Table football, Udemy access etc.

title: Business Analyst

job_description: Are you ready to learn fast and have a real impact at our brand new Italian office? 🇮🇹  Join our amazing team of Business Analysts and rise to the challenge to evolve in the IT sector! If you have always found it exciting to start in tech sales, we offer an extraordinary chance to learn and grow as a business expert.       What your job will be    You'll be directly in contact with the clients to  implement Odoo  and help them with the good use of Odoo Software (eCommerce, Manufacturing, Inventory, Project, Website, etc.) Therefore, you will analyse their needs and deliver personal training sessions. Basically, you'll be responsible to deliver the best management solution to your customers 🔥     As a Business Analyst, you will also support the growth of our partner network. You will help & coach our partners, from all around the world, to implement their customers projects and to become Odoo Experts. You will also have the opportunity to develop larger accounts (Medium Market & Corporate), deal with companies from 100 employee and manage bigger & long-term projects.  The goal is still to implement our software and deliver tailor-made training.  You could evolve as Project Director 😎     You'll work on various different projects at the same time.You will quickly get involved in your first projects from the very beginning receiving the support from experienced colleagues. You will progressively increase your level of autonomy without forgetting that two heads are better than one 🧠 You won't have time to get bored as each project is different (industry, scope, etc.), and you will learn a lot!     Do you have experience in Accounting, Finance, HR, Supply chain, Manufacturing, e-commerce, Marketing? Even Better. We want our Business Analysts to be able to implement Odoo from A to Z in any company, sector and business area. To do so, bringing people having a few years of experience on the field is necessary as well as an important plus for your application ⚡       Your responsibilities     Gain the trust of your customers  Analyse the customer needs and suggest solutions  Implement the agreed solutions (configuration & development)  Make your customer/partner an Odoo Champion (training)  Follow the project and communicate about its status and the ongoing tasks  Organise and follow up Odoo implementations  Feedback to the Product Owners  Coaching & Training  Feedback for department improvement        Your profile     0 to 5 years of experience  Bachelor's or Master's degree (ideally business-related)   Fluent in Italian (C1-C2) and English   Learn fast & Multitasking  Good communication & negotiation skills  Autonomous, Assertive & Proactive  Affinity with the IT world  Valid work permit for Italy        Nice to have     Fluent in another European language  Experienced in management software implementation  Being certified by a recognized organism (APICS, CFA, ect.)  Technical knowledge (XML, Python, JS)        What is great about this job:     Get the chance to be one of the first Business Analysts and be a pillar in the evolution of the new Odoo subsidiary 🇮🇹  Get real responsibilities and autonomy in a fast evolving company 🚀  Great team of dynamic people in a friendly and open culture  Diversity in the projects  Expand your knowledge of various business industries  Two weeks of intensive functional training with a final certification       At Odoo, we are committed to a diverse, inclusive, and authentic work environment. So if you're interested in this position, but your past experience doesn't perfectly match all the qualifications in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other positions.

job_description: Vous justifiez d'une expérience réussie d'au moins trois à cinq ans en tant que  Data Analyst  ou  Chef de Projet Data  sur un  environnement bancaire , alors n'hésitez pas postulez à cette offre !    Rejoindre  La Banque Postale , c'est intégrer une  banque citoyenne, dynamique et innovante , qui poursuit un développement accéléré sur les marchés de la banque de détail, de l'assurance et de la gestion d'actifs.     Banque de service public, La Banque Postale accompagne ses clients dans une relation bancaire durable : 10,7 millions de clients particuliers et 400 000 clients entreprises, professionnels, acteurs de l'économie sociale et du secteur public local lui font confiance.     Attentive à ses collaborateurs, elle leur propose des parcours diversifiés et investit dans leur formation tout au long de leur parcours professionnel.     Vos missions     Le pôle Data Management est responsable des missions suivantes :     Alimentation mensuelle du datamart centralisant les données nécessaires au pilotage et à l'analyse de l'activité,  Développement et maintenance évolutive de tableaux de bord,  Réalisation d'études / analyses ponctuelles pour le compte de nos clients internes,  Mise en place d'une couche décisionnelle adossée au datalake de la Banque    Nous cherchons à renforcer ce pôle en recrutant un  Chef de Projet Data , qui aura pour principales missions la prise en charge des tableaux de bord du pôle, l'intégration de données RSE internes ou externes, dans le datamart, ainsi que la mise en place et l'intégration de KPI RSE permettant de mesurer l'activité de la Direction dans ce domaine, en lien avec la Direction de l'Engagement Citoyen.           Missions       Modélisation :  recenser et intégrer dans le datamart, les données élémentaires nécessaires au calcul d'indicateurs RSE, en lien avec les métiers et la maîtrise d'ouvrage (MOA)   Urbanisation :  Accompagner le pôle dans la rationalisation des tableaux de bord dont il a la charge (12)   Développement :  Concevoir et réaliser les nouveaux tableaux de bord   Data Quality  : contribuer activement à l'identification et à l'analyse des incohérences, en lien avec les métiers, la MOA et la DSI.     Titulaire d'un Bac + 5 MIAGE / MASS / Informatique, vous justifiez d'une expérience réussie d'au moins trois à cinq ans en tant que  Chef de Projet Data  ou  Data Analyst  sur un  environnement bancaire.           Compétences indispensables      Maîtrise de SQL  Maîtrise d'un outil de data visualisation (idéalement QlikSense)  Pack Office (Excel, Powerpoint)  Culture bancaire  Gestion de projet  Aisance écrite et orale  Excellentes capacités d'analyse et de synthèse  Curiosité, rigueur et organisation    Compétences souhaitables      DataIku (Data Science Studio)  Python  SAS.        Citoyenne, La Banque Postale s'engage en faveur de la diversité et de l'égalité des chances pour donner accès à tous ses métiers sans discrimination de genre, d'origine sociale ou culturelle, d'orientation sexuelle ou de handicap. Rejoignez-nous et construisons ensemble la Banque préférée des Français.     Rejoignez La Banque Postale, Citoyenne !

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Pandas (Software), +8 more
job_description: Description    ReversingLabs application security and threat intelligence solutions have become essential to advance cybersecurity around the globe. Funded by our recent Series B investment , we're on a journey to expand and grow by hiring top talent across the security industry.   Every application threatens businesses with new supply chain risks. ReversingLabs is the only company that can dissect any binary at unprecedented speed, scale, and explainability to protect the enterprise end-to-end.   Our mission is to help IT professionals secure their code from supply chain threats. If this sounds interesting and you wondered what the Log4j fuss in the news was all about, you can become a part of our solution that secures the software release process for publishers, and manage third party risk for software buyers. We are seeking extraordinary talent to help forge this transformational journey at ReversingLabs. Your future role as a Data Scientist is extremely important to the success of our solution - secure.software platform for software assurance. This is a game-changing opportunity.    About The Team    The machine learning team is a part of the Research group in ReversingLabs. The projects include data-driven approaches to file type identification, malware classification, detection of hidden payloads, and extraction of file properties related to security. These projects complement the more conventional static analysis techniques developed by threat analysts and reverse engineers in the group, and aim to be practical for threats present in real-world data distributions. For data, we leverage the existing ReversingLabs file reputation collections and feeds of novel samples received from security industry feeds, threat intelligence, and in-house harvesting. Other than straightforward product-oriented projects, we also engage in more research-oriented endeavors aimed at threat hunting, threat intelligence, and data quality in our file metadata collections. As a part of our team, you will also have the chance to work on large language model research projects. The biggest challenge of the machine learning team is working with complex data and a shifting data distribution. This often requires an investigative mindset and cooperation with threat analysts and reverse engineers to create finely tuned and reliable solutions.    Responsibilities    As a Data scientist, you would analyze data to define the scope of individual projects, create datasets, create and test predictive models, and monitor the performance of models on real-world data. The ideal set of skills would be data analysis, cybersecurity domain awareness, general machine learning and modeling, and experience with robust models deployed in production environments, but the position is also an opportunity to develop these skills. This means that we welcome various backgrounds that could grow into this position, such as data scientists with an interest in machine learning or cybersecurity practitioners with an interest in data-driven approaches.     For this position we are only considering candidates that are already based in Croatia!  We support all working models - on site, fully remote (if you are based in Croatia) and a hybrid model of remote work and coming to the office 😀      Requirements      Experience working with a Linux-based OS  Experience with machine learning tools, e.g. scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch  Experience with Python data science tools, e.g. pandas, matplotlib, scipy, numpy  Experience with SQL  2+ years of experience in data science or machine learning field      Desirable Skills      Experience with analytics platforms, e.g. Elasticsearch, Kibana  Experience with predictive models in production environments  Experience with managing data-driven projects  Interest in the cybersecurity domain      Benefits      Hybrid work options (paid accommodation & transportation to Zagreb during onboarding for remote employees)  Flexible working hours  Generous compensation and a bonus system based on annual performance  Hefty personal education budget and possibility to attend leading conferences and seminars in the field  Company library and possibility to order books of choice via Amazon  Permanent contract in a fast-growing global company with Fortune 500 & governmental agencies as clients  Challenging projects in a dynamic, collaborative team  Opportunity to work on innovative solutions in malware analysis & software assurance, crafted in our very own Croatian R&D center  Great career advancement opportunities - clear goals & internal promotions  Employee referral bonus program: EUR 1,060 net for junior position, EUR 2,123 net for mid to senior positions, and EUR 2,654 net for principal/managerial positions  Multisport card, annual health checkup, newborn child allowance, rent-cost, and 3rd pillar pension benefits  Wellness Weekends - quarterly, company-wide three day weekend, starting with a company paid Friday off for all employees  Fully covered car garage in Radnička for all employees

title: IT Data Analyst
skills: Skills: SharePoint, PowerPoint, +8 more
job_description: Per la nostra sede stiamo cercando una figura di  IT Data Analyst  da inserire all’interno del dipartimento IT   con riporto diretto al IT BI & DWH Manager, che verrà coinvolta attivamente nello sviluppo e nella gestione delle piattaforme di BI, reporting e analytics a servizio delle diverse funzioni aziendali e dei direttori di farmacia per il supporto alle decisioni operative e strategiche.     La figura si occuperà di sviluppare report e dashboard, condurre analisi ad hoc su richiesta delle funzioni di business ma potrà anche essere promotrice proattiva di nuove analisi e/o KPI di rilevante interesse. Il candidato si interfaccerà con i direttori interni (es: Finance, Retail Operations, Commerciale …) per raccoglierne le necessità e progettare le soluzioni di analisi più idonee. Si occuperà inoltre di mantenere aggiornata la documentazione di progetto e delle attività di formazione degli utenti sull’utilizzo degli strumenti e sulla comprensione degli indicatori aziendali. Il candidato si relazionerà anche con le società di consulenza che lavorano con il gruppo per la gestione di progetti ed iniziative nell’ambito del Datawarehousing e della Data Integration.      Tra le principali mansioni e responsabilità:       Raccogliere necessità di business relative all’analisi delle informazioni;  Stesura di requisiti tecnico/funzionali;  Sviluppare report, dashboard ed analisi con i principali tool e strumenti messi a disposizione;  Formare il personale delle altre funzioni nell’utilizzo degli strumenti di analisi;  Supportare il proprio referente nella selezione di nuove tecnologie e/o partner tecnologici;  Supportare il proprio referente nella gestione degli avanzamenti progettuali con i fornitori esterni;  Presidiare la qualità del dato anche sviluppando report di controllo e quadratura automatizzati;  Occuparsi della manutenzione evolutiva e/o correttiva degli strumenti sviluppati per garantire sempre coerenza e integrità dei dati esposti;  Mantenere aggiornata la documentazione relativa ai report e ai modelli dato.            Il/La Candidato/a ideale:       Possiede una laurea di primo o secondo livello in materie come ingegneria gestionale, ingegneria informatica, informatica, matematica, fisica o statistica oppure in ambiti formativi affini al mondo ICT;  ha un’esperienza di lavoro di 1-3 anni nella consulenza ICT o in ruolo simile all’interno di aziende preferibilmente del settore retail;  ha maturato una buona autonomia ne gestire le attività a lui assegnate;  ha utilizzato tool di project management e ticketing (e.g. Jira);  è in grado di realizzare analisi funzionali e tecniche, di redigere e tenere aggiornata la documentazione e i manuali operativi, nonché di produrre reportistica e dashboard di monitoraggio;  ha conoscenza dei principali strumenti Microsoft per produttività e collaboration (Office365: OneDrive, Excel, Power Point, Teams, Sharepoint);  ha una buona conoscenza di almeno uno dei principali strumenti di data analytics e visualization come Power BI, Qlick Sense, Tableau etc;  sarà considerata un plus un’esperienza anche minima in aziende del settore retail, GDO o farmaceutico/salute e benessere.       Soft skills :      Passione per innovazione e tecnologie;  Flessibilità e spirito di adattamento;  Capacità di gestire progetti differenti e attività contemporanee;  Orientamento ai risultati e attitudine al problem solving;  Capacità di lavorare in team di più persone di relazionarsi con le altre funzioni interne ed esterne alla società;         Sede di lavoro: Milano.  Tipo di impiego: Full Time.

job_description: ﻿Iper La grande i ,  azienda italiana leader del settore della GDO, presente in Italia con più di 20 ipermercati,  ricerca per la propria sede di  Milano  un/a  Posizione:   Data Scientist - MARKETING   Inserita all'interno della  Direzione Marketing , nel team della  Business Analysis  riportando direttamente al Responsabile di riferimento, la risorsa avrà l'opportunità di studiare modelli efficaci sulla base di tutti i dati transazionali disponibili in Iper proponendo  soluzioni innovative .  All'interno del team potrà occuparsi progressivamente con maggiore autonomia dello sviluppo di progetti: dalla  raccolta dei needs  alla  presentazione dell'output .  si occuperà di:   Analisi dati di vendita relativi alle performance economiche e di comportamento del cliente (dati carte fedeltà) con una logica orientata alla omnicanalità  Segmentazione cluster clienti   Analisi predittive  Interfaccia con la Direzione IT per la creazione e lo sviluppo di nuovi modelli di analisi     Requisiti:   Il candidat* ideale ha maturato un'esperienza pregressa in ruoli simili di almeno 2/3 anni.   Sono richiesti:   Esperienza pregressa preferibilmente in contesti Retail/Telco/Finance/Consulting  Laurea in discipline Statistiche/Data science - engineer  Conoscenza SQL, R, Python e Google Analytics   Attitudine al problem solving e orientamento al risultato  Capacità di lavorare in team    Altre informazioni:  Si offrono ambiente di lavoro dinamico, autonomia e formazione nel proprio ruolo.  La selezione è rivolta a candidati dell’uno e dell’altro sesso ai sensi del D. Lgs. 198/2006. Tutte le candidature devono essere accompagnate dalla autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati personali e saranno gestite ai sensi del Regolamento Europeo 2016/679 ( c.d. GDPR).  Per ulteriori informazioni circa le opportunità professionali ed il mondo di Iper, La grande i diventa follower della nostra pagina  Linkedin  (click su "Segui" al link  https://www.linkedin.com/company/finiper/ )

title: Business Intelligence Developer
skills: Skills: Визуализация данных, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Let’s Talk About You!   "Let’s make tomorrow different today" is our genuine dedication to all customers and employees on the way to a sustainable future.   A Snapshot of Your Day   Our  Business Intelligence Developer  will develop, deploy, and maintain various BI dashboards and reports to support decision making in manufacturing operations management.   How You'll Make An Impact     Build robust data models that enable automation using Alteryx. Extract, cleanse, combine, and wrangle large datasets from various sources, including Snowflake data lakes;  Transfer existing data models and BI solutions developed with e.g. Qlik Analytics and Microsoft Power BI to Tableau;  Generate various regular and impromptu reports;  Consistency and plausibility checks;  Document developed solutions in a structured and orderly fashion, enabling others to build and improve on what you have developed;  Support wide adoption of BI applications. Scale and multiply improvements;  Continuously develop own skills and knowledge in the BI domain. Help others to develop;  Help drive automation of various reporting processes. Identify opportunities to improve on existing processes and tools;  Act a responsible member of a larger team with a common purpose;  Professional handling of confidential and sensitive information.      What You Bring     Bachelor's Degree in Operations Management, Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field;  2-5+ years of combined professional experience working with BI application development;  Highly proficient with Tableau. Appropriate certifications beneficial;  Well-developed and proven data visualization skills;  Thorough knowledge of techniques for extraction, cleansing, and wrangling of large sets of data from various sources;  Experience with the safe and professional handling of sensitive, confidential information.  Positive “can-do” attitude;  Advanced English skills allowing you to express yourself with a high level of fluency and communicate effectively at a professional level;  Proven task and time management skills with a developed ability to prioritize;  Comfortable with remote work, collaborating with people from all over the world using various collaboration platforms.     In addition, experience with any of the below items is considered beneficial:    Alteryx or other data analytics & automation platforms;  Database systems such as Snowflake, utilizing SQL;  Forecasting and clustering techniques;  Scripting using R, Python, or VBA;  ERP systems, such as SAP;  Professional experience from a manufacturing industry;  Controlled solution deployment and version control with the help of platforms such as Github.      About The Team   Our  Gas Services  division offers Low-emission power generation through service and decarbonization. Zero or low emission power generation and all gas turbines under one roof, steam turbines and generators. Decarbonization opportunities through service offerings, modernization, and digitalization of the fleet.  Check out this video to learn more about our Gas Service business!   Who is Siemens Energy?   At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected.  With more than 92,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.  Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.   Our Commitment to Diversity   Lucky for us, we are not all the same.  Through diversity, we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character – no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability.  We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.   Rewards / Benefits     The opportunity to engage in an exciting environment on challenging projects.  Strong professional support and working with colleagues around the world.  Professional development opportunities within the company.  To be part of a growing function with a dynamic, informal and inspiring working environment in a position that entails a large responsibility.     Jobs & Careers

title: Sales Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, +8 more
job_description: We are looking for an analytical thinker who can determine how to extract accurate information from messy data sets.      As a  Sales Data Analyst , you will be responsible for transforming data to make it usable for analysis and preparing insightful reports. In this role, you will report to the CCO and work closely with the Commercial Team.      Who we are:     Global Message Services (GMS) is a global messaging company with over 16 years of expertise in the industry and extensive knowledge of messaging, traffic monetization, and customized software solutions. GMS is a one-stop shop for worldwide communications through high-quality turnkey solutions tailored to each client’s needs.      What you’ll do:    Collect and interpret large datasets.  Conduct statistical analysis of data and identify trends and patterns.  Develop reports and dashboards to visualize data insights.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for optimization.  Maintain databases and ensure data accuracy and integrity.  Provide recommendations to improve data quality and process efficiency.  Create predictive models to forecast future trends.  Stay up to date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques.       What we expect:    3+ years of experience in data analysis, sales analysis, or a related field.  University degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or a related field.  Proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint.  Knowledge of Salesforce CRM and BI tools, as well as other data analysis tools, will be a plus.   Experience with SQL or Python will be a plus.  Fluency in English (both verbal and written).  Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills.  Attention to detail and accuracy.  Ability to work independently and in a team environment.       What we offer:    Multicultural & dynamic environment in fast-growing worldwide business.  One-of-a-kind company culture — a mixture of an open mindset, high dedication, striving for success, and team spirit.  Professional team that is committed and stands for the highest standards of performance.  Our values – Commitment, Integrity, and Progress – are vivid in day-to-day company activities.  Customer-oriented culture with high respect for both internal and external customers.  Competitive salary and bonus system.       Choosing GMS, you choose progress!

title: Data Analyst - Flanders Digital
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Аналитика, +8 more
job_description: Cegeka blijft groeien! Binnen onze software afdeling Applications hebben we een nieuwe divisie opgericht voor een boeiend langdurig project bij de Vlaamse Overheid. Heb jij zin om mee te bouwen aan een digitaal Vlaanderen en heb je een passie voor data gedreven oplossingen? Dan ben jij misschien onze nieuwe Data Analyst! Je kan meewerken aan projecten die impact hebben op verschillende aspecten in je dagelijkse leven.   Aan de hand van je analytisch inzicht help je mee aan de transformatie van ruwe data tot inzichtelijke informatie.   Je analyseert de noden van de klant en vormt de brug tussen business users en data engineers.   Je voorziet de klant van nieuwe inzichten door eenvoudig te begrijpen data visualisaties uit te werken.   Je doet aanbevelingen op basis van de inzichten die je ontdekt en ondersteunt hiermee de strategische besluitvorming   Je zorgt ervoor dat relevante data structureel wordt vastgelegd om verdere analyse en rapportage te vergemakkelijken      Wat breng jij mee?    Je bent gepassioneerd door data gedreven oplossingen.   Je hebt een sterke kennis van statistische methoden en machine learning algoritmes.   Je bent bekend met zowel traditionele data (DWH) & big data omgevingen (Hadoop, Spark, Cloud).   Je hebt een grondige kennis van SQL en visualisatietools zoals Power BI   Je hebt ervaring met data analyse en data visualisatie in Python.   Je beschikt over een probleemoplossend vermogen.   Een flexibele, zelfstandige en collegiale instelling is vereist.      Wat hebben wij jou te bieden?    Je start bij een Top Employer!   Een marktconform loon aangevuld met extralegale voordelen. Een (elektrische) wagen met tankkaart/laadpas of een mobiliteitsbudget, maaltijdcheques, ecocheques, een interessante groeps- en hospitalisatieverzekering, een gsm-abonnement, een forfaitaire onkostenvergoeding, een krachtige laptop en de mogelijkheid om je salarispakket een eigen accent te geven dankzij ons Flex Reward Plan.   Flexibele werkuren én een mooie work/life balans.   Een top team: waarin nieuwe frisse ideeën en initiatieven steeds welkom zijn! Team-events, maandelijkse happy hours en een steeds legendarisch bedrijfsfeest horen daar ook bij.   Begeleiding op maat: doorheen jouw carrière word je begeleid door onze people managers. Zo heb je een aanspreekpunt, een persoonlijke coach én een sparring partner.   Continu bijleren: door innovation centers, leesgroepen, knowledge sharing meetings, hackatons, deelname aan conferenties en externe opleidingen zetten we kennisdeling en bijleren centraal.   Mogelijkheid tot groei: afhankelijk van je eigen interesses en initiatieven, biedt Cegeka verschillende horizontale en verticale carrièrepaden.   Hybride werken: je werkt vanuit een Cegeka kantoor in jouw buurt (Hasselt, Leuven, Antwerpen, Gent), maar ook vanuit de agentschappen van de Vlaamse Overheid (Gent of Brussel op wandelafstand van het station), gecombineerd met thuiswerk.   Wil jij instappen als freelancer? Geen probleem! Dan bieden wij jou een marktconform dagtarief en tal van voordelen aan.

job_description: Level up!   Nintendo aims to deliver unique, intuitive entertainment experiences for everyone, manufacturing and marketing video game devices such as the Nintendo Switch™ family of systems, developing and operating applications for smart devices, and collaborating with partners on a range of other entertainment initiatives like visual content and theme parks. title: Data & Analytics Consultant
skills: Skills: SAP BW, Бизнес-объекты, +8 more
job_description: Do you want to help us converting data into business insights?  The JI Business Intelligence team wants to expand, and is looking for your help as Data & Analytics consultant.      Main Objectives    You will design and develop reporting solutions within the SAP stack, considering the business and technical requirements  Your main job will consist of implementing pragmatic solutions for all companies in the Joris Ide Division  You will translate business requirements into data models, queries, views, reports, dashboards  You will be a promotor for business intelligence solutions, supporting us becoming a data-driven company       Skills and experience required    You have a strong analytical mentality and conceptual way of thinking  You want to take part of a team but like to take initiative, you can work independently and like to learn and explore new things  You have strong communication skills to understand your customer, the Joris Ide business looking for business insights  You like to work in an agile and pragmatic mode  You are result, customer and quality oriented  You want to be part of a fast moving company/team  You have a degree in IT or Business, understanding the business processes  You have a 3+ years experience in Business Intelligence, understanding data models, master data, etl flows  The SAP tool stack has no secrets for you: SAP BW, Business Objects, Hana/CDS views, Sap Analytics Cloud, S4 Analytics  You are fluent in English, but basic knowledge of Dutch/French is a plus  You will engage in close consultation with stakeholders from our departments / levels in the company      What can you expect?   A congestion-free job in the Bruges area.  A full-time job offer in a dynamic and international company.  An attractive salary package.( company car, laptop, phone,...)  Fringe benefits such as group and hospitalisation insurance.  Luncheon vouchers.  Possibility to lease a bicycle.  Ample room for initiative.  A flexible work environment.  flexible hours can be discussed  A good work-life balance.  Team building and corporate events.  Learning and advancement opportunities.  You work for an ecologically conscious company. Discover our Planet Passionate programme!

title: Junior Business Analyst (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: Business Analysis, Microsoft Excel, +7 more
job_description: AccorInvest in München      AccorInvest ist Eigentümer und Betreiber eines Immobilienportfolios von mehr als 767 Hotels, die sich in Besitz und Pacht in 27 Ländern Europas, Lateinamerikas und Asiens befinden. In Europa investiert der Konzern in den Ausbau seines Immobilienportfolios durch Hotelrenovierungen und neue Hotelentwicklungen in den Bereichen Economy & Midscale. Damit verfolgt AccorInvest ein zweifaches Ziel: Gästen den gewohnten Service in den Hotels zu garantieren und zugleich auf die aktuellen Umweltprobleme zu reagieren. Um die Ziele erfolgreich umzusetzen, setzt AccorInvest auf ein internationales Team aus mehr als 26.000 Mitarbeitenden.     Für unser Finance Team suchen wir Ihre Unterstützung!      Was Sie erwartet:   In dieser Position sind Sie verantwortlich für die übergreifende Zusammenstellung von Budgets, Prognosen und Analysen zur proaktiven Unterstützung des CFO, der Portfoliomanager (m/w/d) und der Assetmanager (m/w/d) sowie für die Optimierung der Performance des regionalen Hotelportfolios der DACH-Region (ca. 200 Hotels). Insbesondere übernehmen Sie folgende Aufgaben:      Mitwirkung bei der Bewertung und Vervollständigung der jährlichen Hotelbudgets im Rahmen des Finanzplanungsprozesses   Beteiligung an der monatlichen Berichterstattung und Analyse zur Unterstützung des CFO  Beratung und Unterstützung der Portfoliomanager (m/w/d) bei der Leistungsbeurteilung und -optimierung des Hotelportfolios  Unterstützung des Portfoliomanagements und des Assetmanagements bei der Beurteilung und Erstellung von Businessplänen, mit Fokus auf Hotelrenovierungen, Mietvertragsverhandlungen und Ankäufe       Qualifikationen und Voraussetzung:    Bachelor Abschluss in Finanzwesen, Rechnungswesen, Ökonometrie, Betriebswirtschaft, Hospitality Management oder in einem verwandten Bereich   Erfahrung in der Analyse, Finanz- und Vermögensverwaltung oder in einem verwandten (internationalen) Bereich vorteilhaft  Profundes Verständnis für GuV im Hotelgewerbe (USALI)  Analytischer, ergebnis- und kostenorientierterr Arbeitsstil sowie schriftliches und mündliches Kommunikationsvermögen in der Abstimmung mit vielfältigen Schnittstellen, auch auf Englisch  Interesse an unterschiedlichen Themen und an vielschichtigen Sachverhalten im Finanzbereich  Fortgeschrittene MS-Office-Kenntnisse, vor allem in Excel       Unsere Benefits:    Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, flexibel zu arbeiten – unterstützt wird dies u. a. durch unsere moderne IT-Ausstattung.  Sie erhalten monatlich jeweils einen Zuschuss zur Verpflegung und zum öffentlichen Nahverkehr.   Regelmäßige Weiterbildung ist bei uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit.       Jetzt ist es an Ihnen:   Begleiten Sie uns in eine vielversprechende Zukunft und bewerben Sie sich! Auf Ihre Unterlagen mit Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins ausschließlich per Mail (max. 6 MB) freuen wir uns: de.recruiting@accorinvest.com.     AccorInvest Germany GmbH, Hanns-Schwindt-Straße 2, 81829 München

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Python, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor’s limitless possibilities.  By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit  https://careers.accor.com/               Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo!    Job Description   Based in London or Warsaw, you will be part of the newly created Europe & North Africa Analytics team and quickly learn/adapt to new technologies, question processes and drive innovation.  Your role will be to set up and maintain the right data infrastructure to make our data easily usable for reporting and analysis.  Main Accountabilities  -You will build and maintain data pipelines to integrate a number of data sources into our cloud datawarehouse (Snowflake).  -You will prepare data models i.e. transform data into a format that is efficient for automated and scalable reporting & analysis.  -You will design and implement internal processes to monitor data quality and drive continuous improvement; conduct debugging/ troubleshooting.  -You will liaise with other BI team members to understand business needs and support them with complex data analysis.  -You will explore new ways of delivering business value through data and develop new advanced analytics capabilities.         Qualifications   Degree in a STEM discipline or computer science  Minimum 1-2 years of previous relevant experience  Analytical and curious mind ; self-starter willing to develop independently  Previous Python / SQL knowledge preferred  Understanding of data modelling, data structures, databases, and ETL processes  Stakeholder management skills; and ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences.            Our values: BeAllyouArewithallyourhearth   At Accor, we are committed to diversity. Each individual, each personality, and each experience has its place to grow and make us grow collectively. Everything we do, we do with heart. We are creators of emotions, professionals of the human experience, resolutely turned towards others and the world around us.  - Our culture is inclusive. We value the richness of the 120 nationalities, the different backgrounds, and all the stories that make us up. We encourage the diversity of our personalities.  - We take care of the world around us: our teams, our clients, our establishments, our environment are at the heart of our concerns. Our mission is human, essential: to bring cultures together, to open windows on the world, to provide unforgettable experiences, day after day.  - We like to reveal you. All our heartists are talents in the making, they are the future of our group and our hotels. Helping them grow professionally and develop personally according to their desires and ambitions is our priority.   - Together, we imagine your future. Our group is large, the field of possibilities is immense and the experiences are infinite. We encourage every project to evolve in our multi-brand network, in France, in Southern Europe and internationally.   - We dare to question the status quo. We take innovation to heart and challenge ourselves to always do better. We take risks, we dream the impossible and make it possible.   - Hospitality is a team effort and we are stronger together. We believe in caring, we respect our differences and value all voices. We work as a team, saying what we do and doing what we say. Live in ACCOR with yourself. With your talent, your passions, your teams, your desires Be All you Are with all your heart.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
