job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
skills: Skills: ETL, Решение задач, +8 more
job_description: We’re looking for an enthusiastic and passionate (Junior/ Mid) d ata analyst to join us here at GWI. Not just any d ata analyst though. Someone ambitious and genuine, who works best in the midst of a collaborative and forward-thinking team. That’s because as a GWIer you’ll be immersed in the fast-moving world of data tech. We  think big  to make an impact, we’re not afraid to  ask why  , and we always  show respect  . Those values are what got us where we are today, and they’re a big part of what we’re looking for in you.  About The Job  Our Data Science department at GWI is committed to maintaining the highest quality in our survey data and to helping our customers arrive at the insights they need to understand their audiences. We, the Data Team, are supporting the business at every level as data is at the very core of what we do. We are actively engaged throughout the entire data life cycle including data cleaning, data processing, data validation, designing and automating data workflows, automating data testing and investigating unexpected findings. We are at a very exciting junction where we are experimenting with cloud computing technologies as we want to shift towards full ownership of our own Data Platform. We are a diverse team with different backgrounds spread across two locations, Athens and London , and growing rapidly.  What you’ll be doing  The role will involve a range of different tasks from transforming and loading datasets to GWI platform, investigating and resolving data discrepancies, working with various stakeholders on the creation and automation of processes and reports, as well as expanding the capabilities of our internal tools. You’ll also be contributing to developing our Data Platform, which ingests and augments consumer survey data from around the world. You will be utilising key GCP components and functionalities, combined with dbt workflows, in order to build well-tested processing pipelines that transform our raw datasets into formats appropriate for our GWI products. You will report to one of the Team Leads of the Data Team and work closely with the Directors of Data, Engineering and Product on long-term initiatives.  Main responsibilities     Maintain and expand ETL/ELT pipelines for all our datasets    Collaborate with our Research, Engineering and Product Development teams to design and enhance our bespoke tools    Ability to work independently on projects by engaging with various internal teams, and meeting tight deadlines    Demonstrate a high level of attention to detail and design measures to ensure Data Quality    Actively participate in refactoring of our codebase and propose new ideas on task automation    General problem solving abilities, able to synthesise information and communicate it clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences     About you  First things first, as a disruptor in the global market research industry, we haven’t come this far without entrepreneurial spirit and a get-up-and-go attitude. So if you think we’ll see that in you, then you’re already halfway there. Here’s the rest of what we’d like you to bring to the table.  The essentials     Suitable educational qualifications in mathematical / computational / statistical sciences or equivalent    Demonstrable experience using Python and SQL in manipulating and transforming data    A passion for data quality, good documentation and attention to detail    Team mentality and a strong desire to collaborate and share ideas    A growth mindset and a thirst for learning    An aptitude to thrive in a diverse environment     Nice to have     Basic experience with automated ETL/ELT pipelines, shared script repos and version control    Basic experience with databases and data warehousing    Interest or beginner’s experience with GCP and dbt    Basic experience with linux os and working from the terminal    Basic experience with market research and survey analysis    Working knowledge of agile delivery tools such as Jira     Competencies     Gain a strong understanding of the business strategy and be able to apply it to your own projects    Escalate any problems with delivery to senior leaders in a timely fashion, in order to ensure all projects are appropriately resourced and managed    Enjoy working as part of a team, enjoy collaborating and spearhead open and honest communication    You really enjoy working with others to establish and maintain collaborative relationships, you value all feedback and you’re always eager to learn     Our benefits  Great benefits make a big difference. Not just to employees, but to the whole vibe of a business. That’s why when you work for us, you’ll enjoy a full spectrum of generous perks, rewards and office benefits.   Competitive salary and performance-based bonus  Generous training budget, including a fully paid international conference each year  25 days holiday and Christmas office closure days on top  Allocated shares according to GWI’s share scheme  A range of discounts and freebies  A genuine commitment to mental and physical health, with a range of content, tools and perks to help you look after your wellbeing  LinkedIn Learning and ongoing Learning and Development opportunities  Enhanced primary caregiver and co-caregiver’s benefits  Flexitime and a great work-life balance  Private health insurance plan  Referral bonus scheme  Mobile phone contract  Early finishes on Fridays  A well-stocked fridge and plenty of snacks (some healthy, some not so healthy)  Restaurant Ticket card option  Commit a working day to charity each year  Social activities and team outings    Who we are  GWI was founded with the knowledge that understanding your audience is really important for business. When you know who you’re speaking to and why, you can create content and campaigns that stand out to the people that matter. Through our global online survey, we gather data on the behaviour and perceptions of consumers across the world. This provides businesses with deep, actionable insights on their audience, revealed from data they trust. It’s been going well, too. Since launching in 2009, we’ve become one of the UK’s fastest growing target audience companies. We’re not about to stop growing any time soon. As a business, we’re on a mission to re-engineer data-driven marketing, and we’re on the lookout for talented people to join us.  Diversity & Inclusion  Imagine if our data came from just one kind of person. We’d get a very nuanced view of the world. And we definitely wouldn’t have got off the ground as a business. We’re so lucky to live in a society where differences are celebrated – so we’d expect nothing else from our teams. In fact, the GWI office is as diverse as our global data, and it’s really important to us that it stays that way. This is a place to feel at home, express yourself freely and make your mark.

job_description: Data Business Analyst     Willing to push the boundaries with us for a more sustainable world?  You have the ambition to grow in one of the most challenging data programs in Belgium? Do you like transversal interaction with co-workers from all businesses of our company? If so, you may be the Business Data Analyst we need.  At the  Data Governance Center of Excellence , within the  Enterprise Data Modelling squad , we offer you a job enabling the digital transformation of the banking sector. You will be able to take pride in the knowledge and experience that you have already acquired but also to develop yourself continuously and grow your skills.  We believe that our evolution is driven and inspired by our employees. In return, we aim to provide optimal working conditions that enable you to develop on both a professional and personal level. We offer a challenging and diverse working environment in which you will have an impact within our company.      Your future job       You will work closely with local stakeholders to understand the data needs within their initiatives  You will support squads throughout the organization to design and document their data models and API’s, in line with central modelling guidelines and tooling setup  Your main modelling tool will be SAP PowerDesigner; you will explore, configure and optimize its functionalities  You will develop and maintain data model guidelines for squads within the organization  You will onboard new data modellers across the organization  You will support IT architects and squads in making their data models and API’s EDM & GDPR compliant, and publishing their models throughout the bank  You will closely monitor the progress and quality of the data modelling practice  You will promote the culture of data modelling and data governance throughout the organization (importance of tooling, modelling, modelling guidelines, to both business and IT)       Highlight your strengths       Bachelor/Master ‘s degree in Business engineering or IT or equivalent by professional experience  Professional language competences: EN + NL or FR  A good understanding of the practice of data modelling  A good understanding of API’s  A good understanding of the broad landscape of data governance (metadata management, data quality, data lineage and traceability, GDPR, data dictionaries etc.)  Experience in SAP PowerDesigner is a plus  Quick self-starter, pro-active attitude, abilities to coordinate, excellent oral and written communication skills, Business mindset, Motivated, proactive, organized and precise, eager to learn, pragmatic       Your future workplace       By choosing us, you get    Excellent opportunities to develop, personally and professionally, and spread your wings.  A permanent contract and an attractive pay package.  A position in a responsible, socially engaged organisation where diversity and inclusion are the standard.      In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At BNP Paribas Fortis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them have their own experience and identity. Together, let's build the bank of tomorrow: innovative, responsible and sustainable. All of our full-time vacancies are also open to candidates wishing to work 80% or 90%.      Choose BNP Paribas Fortis now and apply here.      We will make our first selections on the basis of your CV and letter of motivation. Are you the candidate we’re looking for? Then you’re sure to hear from us. Good luck!

title: Data Analyst - Finance
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Scala, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights  Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge  Previous experience in the financial/banking industry     Nice to have    Advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming  Experience in Accounting    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: Within the newly created Demand and Supply planning function based in the HQ in Milan, the position is to follow and provide analytics supporting the function. The role will have the responsibility of maintaining tools, data flows and the data quality and provide the relevant and most reliable information to all related functions within the areas of Demand Planning and Inventory Planning. The role prepares and maintains relevant material to facilitate research and discussion between functional areas of interaction.  Finally, the role has the task of following and coordinating all the project activities that concern the area by acting as interlocutor towards the IT area and the team. title: Data Engineer

job_description: Company Description   BrandDelta empowers companies around the world to transform the way their Brands can learn and win. Our Brand Intelligence platform is built to enable our clients to understand how consumers perceive their brands faster, deeper and in a more actionable manner with measurable links.  We are helping our clients to transition from slow-moving, expensive and unactionable survey-based solutions into the 21 st  century with our solution.     BrandDelta has ambitious plans for growth, with Porto marked as the centre for advanced AI-led software, supported by a growing team, offering great career prospects to individuals. Founders have a history building globally awarded AI businesses (e.g. achieving a top-10 Gartner rating for AI-led insight in 2020 and 2021) and investing heavily into team and individual development.      Role Description   As a Data Engineer ,  you will be part of our Data & Innovation team. We are integrating a giant corpus of cross-channel online media, social, search, web, reviews and offline survey datasets to help our clients get a 360-degree view on the identity of their own & competitor brands (or product categories), design and implement efficient media, marketing, influencer & creative strategies and eventually solve some of the hardest problems of Consumer Brands around the world.     This role will involve cross-functional data & platform requirements gathering, ideation, synthesis of those requirements into solutions, and then deployment of those solutions throughout our firm and our network of partners, a constellation of vendors, and footprint of APIs, sites, brands, and lines of business.  We deliver growth to clients based on AI enabled insights, allowing our customers to remain relentlessly relevant, capture market share, create deeper connection with consumers.       Requirements    Bachelor’s degree in the quantitative research field, such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, social sciences, Biological/physical science, or Computer Science; Masters preferred  2+ years of experience working with data cleansing, transformation, and validation for data marts  2+ years of experience in designing and producing high-quality Python, SQL, PySpark, JavaScript, and code in other languages for ETL and ELT work  Expertise in designing and deploying data applications on cloud solutions, preferably using Azure Databricks  Integrating the end-to-end data pipeline - to take data from source systems to target data repositories ensuring the quality and consistency of data is maintained at all times  Contribute during design and architecture discussions, and decisions critical to curating growth of data assets and IP as we rapidly expand across clients/industries  Work cross-functionally with other teams to evaluate requirements, ideate on solutions, and deploy those solutions to production with an emphasis on adoption  Working with other members of the project team to support delivery of additional project components (such as API interfaces)  Skilled in writing unit tests, integration tests, end-to-end tests, and other QA code  Experience with relational and/or non-relational databases       Nice to have:  Experience working on an agile software engineering team and working directly with Product Management teams; Microsoft Azure certification, Azure AI Fundamentals, Azure Data Scientist Associate      Preferred Skills/Experience:    Demonstrates strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills  Ability to explain findings and recommendations to a broad business audience, both internal and external  Educated on a variety of analytical methods, shapes thinking and influences decisions  Experience in Consumer / Marketing Analytics with the ability to apply knowledge of and passion for digital, social, mobile media, and other new platforms to provide insight and evaluation that helps clients build stronger consumer connections.  Effectively handle client projects by balancing tasks to achieve both short- and long-term goals       What we offer:    Career Acceleration - Fast growth with many opportunities both in the AI-led software and business domains, with board-level clients.  Health Insurance & Benefits Policy  Flexible Work Hours - Adjust your schedule to your needs  Work Setup - Hybrid   Hardware and software for remote setup  Autonomy and Ownership Culture  Continuous feedback culture  Innovation Mindset       Benefits:    We will pay you competitive salary commensurate with what you're worth, as a high performer. We are fully committed to closing the gender pay gap, promoting diversity and inclusivity, and paying people what they deserve to be paid.  Enjoy the benefits of a flexible work schedule as part of a global team.  Experience ongoing training and growth opportunities. We will support you with your career endeavours. We are committed to internal progression and offering our team members the best opportunities for growth. We want to invest in you the same way you are going to invest in us!

title: Supply Planner F/H
skills: Skills: План продаж, Динамичность, чувствительность, +6 more
job_description: Le groupe URGO  est le spécialiste de la santé et du bien-être. Il regroupe les Laboratoires URGO, JUVA SANTE et SUPER DIET. Avec plus de 3100 collaborateurs en France et à l’international, URGO est en croissance constante et développe des marques à forte notoriété telles que : Juvamine, Urgo, Mercurochrome, Humex ou Ricqlès. Leader sur ses marchés européens et présent dans de nombreux pays à travers le monde, URGO accélère son développement international.  Pour atteindre leurs objectifs ambitieux les deux divisions s’appuient sur deux pôles d’excellence : Urgo Recherche et Urgo Industries.      URGO INDUSTRIES  est l’expert industriel du Groupe URGO. Plus de 900 collaborateurs dans le monde s’engagent chaque jour à produire et à livrer les produits de santé et de bien-être aux plus hauts standards qualité avec pour obsession la santé des patients et la satisfaction de nos clients ! Chez Urgo Industries, nous poursuivons une stratégie industrielle dynamique en France : nous aurons investi près de 100 M€ entre 2015 et 2025.  C’est grâce à nos équipes que nous poursuivons notre développement. Elles sont engagées, audacieuses, solidaires, toujours en quête de l’Excellence ! C’est dans ce pôle d’excellence que nous recrutons une/un :      SUPPLY PLANNER F/H       CDI à pourvoir dès que possible    Poste basé à DIJON (21)       Vos missions :      Rattaché à  Julie Soubeyrand , Responsable Sales & Operation Planning Urgo Global, vous avez la responsabilité principale d'assurer la disponibilité des produits de votre portefeuille en relation avec l'ensemble de vos clients de votre périmètre.      Dans le cadre de vos missions, vous :      • Assurez la coordination entre les demandes des marchés et les fournisseurs internes et externes (usines ou approvisionneurs externes) en animant le cycle S&OP et en élaborant le plan d’approvisionnement     • Pilotez les lancements de nouveaux produits en lien avec le Marketing En tant qu’expert(e) Supply chain, et suivez les évolutions de votre portefeuille produits. Votre expertise fait de vous un atout privilégié lors des phases de projet ou de change control.     • Elaborez le planning d'approvisionnement en fonction des prévisions de commandes, des ajustements émis par vos clients et des contraintes des sites de production / fournisseurs externes.     • Vous garantissez la disponibilité des produits en assurant un suivi des stocks efficace.     • Vous contribuez activement à l’amélioration des outils et process de distribution     Votre profil :      De formation supérieure type  bac +4/+5  de type Master, Ecole de Commerce ou Ecole d’ingénieur, dans  la prévision   ou la planification , vous avez acquis une première expérience dans un environnement industriel international.       Le contexte international du poste requiert une  parfaite maîtrise de l’anglais .       La connaissance de  SAP  est un prérequis indispensable et vous maitrisez dans son ensemble le processus  S&OP. En outre,  vous êtes à l’aise avec les  systèmes d’information  et la manipulation de données.       Vous faites preuve d’ assertivité , d’ adaptabilité  et de  réactivité , et vous êtes  force de proposition.  Aussi, Vous savez vous montrer agile et à l’écoute de vos interlocuteurs.       Votre  esprit entrepreneurial  et votre capacité d’ analyse  seront appréciés dans ce poste.             Si vous êtes passionné par la Supply Chain, que les missions vous intéressent et souhaitez faire valoir vos talents …           Alors pourquoi pas vous ? Rejoignez-nous !

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Scala, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Data Scientist   Decathlon Netherlands has grown significantly during the last 5 years, from 3 to 22 stores, a successful webshop, a nice head office and our own warehouse. The coming years we have the ambition to continue to grow. To facilitate this we are looking for someone that can help the business take data-driven decisions, provide clear insights and make Decathlon in general more data-driven in the role of data scientist.     Interested? Read on!     We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Data and Analytics team. You will be responsible for the design, development, programming methods and processes to consolidate and analyze structured and unstructured data sources to generate actionable insights and predictions for stakeholders across the business. In this role you will engage business partners to translate data into business opportunities through advanced analytics methods. You will identify opportunities and support the design of new tools in collaboration with the business stakeholders. Our Data Scientists’ develop software programs, algorithms, and automated processes that cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large data sets from multiple sources. They lead the development of predictive, preventive, and proactive data and analytics products.      Your team   The data-team is a multidisciplinary team that consists of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, BI Specialists, Digital Analysts and Business Analysts. Its main responsibility is to enable and lead data driven decision making. It provides products, insights and projects that make it possible for the business to make educated decisions. The work that the data-team does is incredibly diverse due to the fact that we work with all departments within the Decathlon business (pricing, logistics, HR, marketing, finance, online, etc.).      Responsibilities;    Data mining from internal and external sources  Contribute to empowering the organization to make data driven decisions  Proactively come up with findings and data insights  Application experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts  Monitor data quality and consistency  Developing and validating statistical and machine learning models  Contributing to translation of business problems into data insights and advanced analytics solutions  Developing and maintaining standards for Data Science  Creating and maintaining thorough documentation of infrastructure and related processes  Sharing knowledge and learnings with the team       What do we ask from you?    Experience in advanced statistical techniques and machine learning models  Experience with one or more programming/scripting languages such as Python, R, Scala, Julia, SQL is a must.  A broad knowledge of retail with experience about pricing solution is a plus  Experience with data visualization tools required; such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, Power BI, etc.  Ability to quickly grasp different technologies and use them to solve problems  Collaborative code development experience, including version control, code review and sharing  University Degree in Data Science/Big Data  Proactive with good communication and presentation skills  Good knowledge of ETL and experience working with cloud data warehouses, GCP/BigQuery experience is a plus  A passion for sports!      Do you have any questions about this role before you apply? Please get in touch with dylan.reichart@decathlon.com     We welcome feedback on our recruitment process, if you have any suggestions please feel free to let us know.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Data Program Manager
skills: Skills: CRM, Управление изменениями, +6 more
job_description: The Omnichannel department of the LVMH Group is accompanying Maisons on their omnichannel experience & selling capabilities acceleration. Part of this department the Data & A.I. Factory is focused on driving business value from data and advanced analytics by collaborating with the different Maisons of the Group. The Data Strategy Lead will report into the Global VP Data Value Office and play a key role in driving value from the usage of Data & Artificial Intelligence across the entire value chain (from Marketing & Sales to supply chain and merchandising etc).  You will be accountable for the business uplift generated by our data initiatives, by prioritizing high-value business use-cases & strategies that employ Data & A.I. and drive cross-functional teams (business domain experts, data scientists, data engineers etc) successfully towards delivery. You will be accountable for the business & data/tech needs identification and the strategic orientation and relationship with the Maisons. You will be exciting your partners and Maisons with a compelling and clear roadmap and drive towards business-oriented use-cases with measurable results. You will contribute to prioritizing high-value features for the technological infrastructure (data platform & algorithms). You will be exposed to all aspects of the discipline: difficult Big Data investigations, challenging UX processes, complex customer conversations etc.      Your main missions       Spearhead mutualized delivery teams with functional reporting to you dedicated to several Maisons with transversal functional management to ensure fast delivery of results according to objectives & timing/cost commitments  Drive a successful governance with Maisons, ensuring we co-create and drive towards the same goals. Communicate efficiently the results & progress in a clear and compelling way for stakeholders of various profiles and seniority up to CEO level and align them towards a common vision  Spearhead the selection and deployment of high-value use-cases employing Data & A.I across the entire value chain. Contribute to evolving the product & services catalogue of the Data Factory for Maisons based on Data & Artificial Intelligence use-cases, the business model and the process to support it from onboarding a new Maisons, to building use-cases, maintenance and innovation.  Demonstrate successful experience in artificial intelligence and machine learning applications in marketing & operations activations/optimizations and become a trusted advisor to decision makers. Provide customer and market feedback to the Architecture and Engineering teams.      You know how to:     ● Use your visionary approach and engage and convince C-Levels  ● Listen to your interlocutors with empathy   ● Explain complex things with simple words, without ever missing the big picture  ● Manage a team towards delivering concrete results and value  ● Communicate tough choices, and take the time to explain the “why” behind  ● You know how to create and nurture collaborative relationships with different stakeholders (Maisons, but also other teams in the Group - other Digital Business Solutions teams, IT, Marketing, Client Services and etc).      Your obsessions:     ● You think business & concrete value first, real use cases, for real people, in real conditions  ● You are the partner of Maison’s strategy pursuit while keeping in mind group strategy & goals  ● You are results oriented and driven towards concrete deliverables and impact  ● You make sure no one feels left behind after a big meeting, you never forget the little guy who stays in the corner  ● You’re here to help and protect, not to discipline and punish        Your background     ● PhD/ Master degree in Business or Computer Science in a top school, or equivalent working experience.   ● 5+ years of Experience working in the field of Data & Artificial Intelligence in a retail/apparel/beauty or consumer goods domain  ● You led a crucial part in driving business value from concrete applications of Data & A.I., with expertise in marketing activation, retail optimization & supply chain / operations.  ● You have experience with both structured and unstructured data, as well as online and offline data, you have good notions of Master Data Management operations & Data Platform principles  ● You have experience in navigating complex organizations, you put in place solid governance schemes and clear decisions processes  ● You spoke to both software engineers and business representative in your career

title: INGENIERO/A analista de datos Big Data
skills: Skills: Python, Spring Cloud, +8 more
job_description: Estamos buscando a un Ingeniero/a analísta de datos Big Data para que se una al equipo de Analísis de Datos e Inteligencia Artificial de IKERLAN. Las principales funciones a desarrollar dentro del equipo serán implementar soluciones innovadoras de Inteligencia Artificial en entornos Industriales que correrán en sistemas Big Data tanto en plataformas de nube pública como en nube privada.  Nuestro objetivo es crear soluciones útiles y de valor para nuestros clientes y la sociedad. Todo esto en las mejores infraestructuras y a partir del esfuerzo, la dedicación y la pasión por la tecnología.  Buscamos personas creativas, que sean capaces de solucionar problemas y estén locas por la tecnología y con ganas de trabajar en Inteligencia Artificial. Hacemos lo que las empresas corrientes no hacen, por eso necesitamos a los mejores.  RESPOSABILIDADES:  Diseñar y desarrollar soluciones de Inteligencia Artificial y análisis de datos en entornos industriales.  Capacidad en seleccionar la mejor técnica o combinación de técnicas a aplicar para la resolución de problemas del mundo industrial en donde la analítica avanzada (machine learning /estadística) forme parte de la solución.  Implementar componentes, librerías y frameworks reutilizables considerando un ciclo de vida de desarrollo orientado al testing y validación.  Planificar y ejecutar planes de integración y validación de componentes software.  Impulsar la innovación y la integración de nuevas tecnologías en los proyectos.  Colaborar y participar en grupos de proyectos multidisciplinares.  Desarrollar prototipos innovadores para demostrar las capacidades del equipo, integrando tecnologías y conocimientos adquiridos.  Gestionar proyectos con clientes, determinando sus necesidades y planteando soluciones concretas a sus problemas.  ¿Qué te aportaremos?   Un contrato indefinido de lunes a viernes, junto con un horario flexible y con un calendario muy top.  Posibilidad de teletrabajar hasta 2 días a la semana e incluso un tercer día en alguna de nuestras sedes más cercanas a tu domicilio como BILBAO o HERNANI.  Trabajar en un entorno joven y donde se respira y se palpa la tecnología del futuro.   Nuestra cultura Ikerlaniana:   El mundo no se nos ha dado para contemplarlos sino para transformarlo.  La tecnología, nuestra actitud.  Un Proyecto cooperativo vivo de todos y para todos.  Una filosofía de trabajo que apuesta por la excelencia, cercanía y autonomía.            Requisitos:     FORMACIÓN:  Ingeniería de Informática, Ingeniería de Telecomunicaciones o similar.  Conocimiento, formación específica en estadística y minería de datos. Máster relacionado con la materia. Doctorado en informática.  Buenas habilidades de comunicación en inglés.  EXPERIENCIA:  Conocimiento y habilidades importantes en programación con lenguajes /librería de análisis avanzado de datos y aprendizaje, por ejemplo, R, Python (SciKit).  Conocimientos de SQL orientado a analítica.  Conocimientos para el diseño y desarrollo de sistemas de procesamiento de datos (streaming, batch) en donde el volumen y la velocidad es una problemática a resolver (tecnologías tipo Kafka, Storm, Spark, etc.)  Conocimientos avanzados de lenguaje de programación Java así como conocimientos básicos de Scala.  Experiencia con entornos de trabajo sobre Linux (bash scripting, herramientas desarrollo, gestión de servicios, etc.).  Conocimientos en el uso de plataformas digitales PaaS como Kubernetes o Mesos en nubes públicas (Azure, Amazon).  Familiarizado con plataformas en la nube (AWS, Azure, Google).  Capacidad de escribir código de calidad (legible, estructurado y documentado) y aplicar patrones de diseño óptimos.  Experiencia con sistemas de control de versiones (CVS, SVN, TFS, GIT).  Se valorará experiencia en otros lenguajes de programación como Java/Python/Go.  Se valorará conocimiento de arquitecturas basadas en microservicios (Kubernetes, Spring Cloud).  Se valorará conocimiento de arquitecturas basadas en contenedores (Docker).  Se valorará experiencia en integración continua: automatización de builds y pruebas, definición de métricas, pruebas de aceptación, automatización de despliegue, etc.  Se valorará la experiencia en testing unitario, verificación y validación.  Se valorará la experiencia en metodologías ágiles de desarrollo (Scrum, Kanban, Agile)  APTITUDES:  Apasionado de la programación y de la tecnología en general  Compromiso con la calidad.  Capacidad de trabajar en equipo y desempeñar tareas de apoyo a la consecución de objetivos.  Gestión de proyectos multidisciplinares.  Capacidad de toma de decisiones y gestión de conflictos.  Capacidad de interlocución con clientes y gestión de los mismos.  Mente resolutiva y creativa.

title: Business Analyst
skills: Skills: Business Analysis, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: Are you motivated by the opportunity to delight your clients by providing them with innovative solutions to complex technical problems? If you have a pioneering spirit and thrive on innovative projects where you can influence the direction of technical strategy, now is the time to join this dynamic team.      Your future duties and responsibilities:   As a Business Analyst on our team, you will be working on several big initiatives within the business. This role will require communication and interaction with multiple internal and external clients to ensure each module interacts properly with each other.   Your responsibilities will include:  • Client Facing;  • Process Mapping.      Required qualifications to be successful in this role:    Essential Qualifications   • Prior Experience with Client Facing;  • Prior Experience with BackOffice Operations.      Professional Attributes   • Results-oriented with a strong track record of successful delivery;  • Participate and network externally in industry forums to share best practices and gain competitive intelligence.      Education and Certification   • Bachelor’s degree with a focus on Information Technology/Communications, or equivalent.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Python, +6 more
job_description: We are looking for a  Data Scientist with strong formalization skills able to convert stakeholders needs in verifiable hypothesis  to deliver even better clinical services.   Your main contribution  will be focused on developing models to answer clinical questions with evidence in a R&D setting using structured and unstructured data from the electronic health record. You will routinely interface with clinical stakeholders to evaluate KPIs, update the modeling strategy and course-correct unverified hypothesis. You will be developing libraries to share with your team and leverage already existing ones.   The main objective  of the research activity is to answer clinical questions with data driven methodologies with a special emphasis on evaluation, fairness and transparency so to produce translational research of quality.   You will be part of the Humanitas AI Center  reporting to the Chief Innovation Officer. The AI Center of Humanitas, a fast-paced research team at one among Italy’s best institutions working in the biomedical research field, is focused in research in the field of Artificial Intelligence applied in healthcare. Research and development areas include predictive and decision-support systems based on data-driven model (ML/DL models) to optimize clinical processes and ultimately improve the quality of patient care. We are a team of multidisciplinary scientists who work day by day on e-health and AI projects, by collaborating with clinical staff (doctors, nurses, researchers) and management staff.   Main activities :  ● retrieval and querying of data from distributed architecture databases,  ● exploratory data analysis on clinical data,  ● innovative algorithms design and data analysis to discover and assess significant dynamics and patterns from complex data,  ● explore, define and support the validation of statistical and machine learning models in order to obtain useful tools to be applied in the biomedical field,  ● create and iterate possibly scalable computational models, in order to make the theoretical findings applicable to real world data.  ● collaborate with international external partners on cross-academic research projects.      Candidate profile   We are looking for motivated candidates who appreciate challenging tasks, objectives and are strongly oriented to both scientific excellence, high performances computing and human relationships.      Mandatory Requirements:   ● master in a STEM related field.  ● +1 year of experience in a data science related role.  ● fluent in written and spoken English and Italian.      Hard Skills   ● strong scripting and programming skills in Python.   ● knowledge of SQL.  ● excellent statistical knowledge.  ● experience with data science frameworks (e.g. tensorflow, pytorch, scikit-learn, scipy, pandas, numpy) and visualization frameworks (e.g. plotly, seaborn, matplotlib),  ● strong experience with pre-processing and exploratory data analysis on clinical data, with effective results reporting,  ● excellent analytical and problem solving skills.      Strongly recommended:   ● story telling: communicate your results to stakeholders without your expertise with impact.  ● experience working with electronic health records.       Soft Skills:   ● excellent team-working capabilities even with colleagues from different research areas and backgrounds,  ● strong self-motivation and proactive approach,  ● able to meet deadlines and work autonomously,  ● curiosity and ability of stepping outside your comfort zone.      Why you should consider this opportunity   Humanitas Research Hospital is investing in data driven research and development of clinical support tools based on AI, you will contribute to the design and application of breakthrough technologies to be deployed in advanced clinical institutions. You will get access to an extraordinary group of talented and passionate people coming from fields ranging from clinical sciences and healthcare management to informatics, bioinformatics and systems biology, including our extended international research network.      Contract and duration   We can offer a fixed-term contract of at least two years, that could be converted into a permanent contract. Salary, as well as employment level, will be defined based on candidate's profile.

title: Data Steward
skills: Skills: Google Data Studio, Data Governance, +7 more
job_description: Intégré.e au département Digital Innovation et Services de la Région EUROPE de CHANEL, plus directement au sein de l’équipe Data, vous participerez au développement de la connaissance client digitale, e-business et CRM pour une meilleure compréhension et gestion des problématiques marketing/business.   Vous principales missions :   Pour les plateformes hébergeant les données de nos clients :      Veiller à la bonne application des règles de gestion et d’hygiène des données (fusions/défusions, nettoyage, anonymisation, …)  Veiller que la donnée collectée soit toujours qualifiée suivant les règles prédéfinies.  Veiller au respect de la politique des accès aux data et aux règles de visibilité.  En lien avec l’IT et la sécurité, veiller aux règles d'intégrité et de sécurité des données.  Alerter les équipes métier de l’évolution des KPI (qualité et quantité)  Définir, industrialiser et communiquer les procédures de collecte des données.  Veiller à la qualité des données des référentiels et de leurs mises à jour.  Vérifier la qualité des agrégats, de leur bonne et régulière exécution ainsi que de leur utilisation adéquate.  Participer aux mises au point des outils utilisés.  Effectuer au quotidien le manuel review des matches suivant les règles établies et effectue les fusions des matches confirmés ; Analyser et rapporter la qualité des données à la suite des opérations de Match & Merge  Effectuer au quotidien des actions demandées par l’équipe légale et/ou service client  Participer aux réunions Business / IT / Data      Vous serez amené(e) à travailler en relation étroite avec les équipes business, data, IT et nos partenaires.   De formation ingénieure, vous avez acquis de l'expérience dans l'univers de la data/ base de données.   Vous avez de l'appétence et une forte curiosité à la découverte et l'utilisation des outils de données (SQL/ Power BI) . Vous êtes orienté.e service, et avez de fortes capacités relationnelles pour évoluer dans un environnement collaboratif et matriciel. De fortes aptitudes analytiques et suffisamment curieux des évolutions dans l'univers de la data pour vous tenir au courant des nouvelles technologies en effectuant une veille permanente.   Vous avez de l'expérience idéalement acquise avec l'outil Reltio (MDM) et des connaissances en base de données SQL et outils de reporting (POwer BI, Google Data studio 360...).   Vous parlez anglais couramment puisque beaucoup de vos interfaces au sein de la région europe ne sont pas francophones.

title: Data Engineer (m/f/n)
skills: Skills: SQL, JavaScript, +8 more
job_description: Department:  Energy Business IT|  Location:  Esch-sur-Alzette|  Contract:  Permanent |  Job Requisition N° 18363         Your tasks      You will actively participate in our group wide energy data management initiative focusing on better understand our customer behaviours and needs, forecast the future energy demand, improve customer servicing, and innovate new business ideas in a fast-moving energy sector.      You manage the data integration pipelines of the Enovos IT ecosystem to the target data lakes/data marts   You work on test automation, environment anonymisation and refresh   You optimize the current data lakes/marts and conceptualize the future data analytics backbone   You investigate in the data structure required by business domains and setup these structure for further data analytics needs   You work in tight collaboration with application analyst and business partners to extract insights from our data - analyse, collect, organize, and store data with the necessary tool framework   You define, design and execute reports using off-the-shelf tools like Tableau   You assess business/market/customer needs and provide advise around data       For doing this, you will have the opportunity to use top notch technologies in our AWS Cloud:      Exasol as our current in memory analytics data warehouse   Apache Cassandra as our current NoSQL data lake   Apache Spark as our data processing and analytics engine   Apache Airflow for building, scheduling, and monitoring workflows   Elastic stack as our log monitoring system   Mule as our integration and API platform   Tableau for data visualization           Your profile       You hold a university degree in computer science/computer engineering, science, mathematics, or you have an equivalent working experience   You have demonstrated abilities for complex problem analysis and resolution and have a hands-on mentality   Experience with different data integrations techniques and data modelling is mandatory   You are proficient with one or more of the following programming languages: CQL, SQL, LUA; Scala, Python, Node.js   You have a very good understanding of database technologies (NoSQL, Column-based)   Experience with Cassandra is a strong asset   You are aware of the good practices in continuous deployment/integration of applications   Highly effective verbal and written communication skills in English. A good knowledge of German or French will be considered as an advantage           What we offer       The opportunity to join a Group that actively shapes the energy transition in Luxembourg and the Greater Region  A multicultural and international working environment that encourages diversity and inclusion  A competitive salary with many additional benefits  Continuous learning and development career path adapted to the needs of each employee  Hybrid working mode with the possibility to work from home         For external applications, a recent copy of the police record will be requested if you are invited for an interview.

job_description: Business Analytics and Intelligence (BAI) Analyst       Job Description:    We are seeking a highly motivated and organized BAI Analyst to join our team. The BAI Analyst will directly support our Managing Director and the BAI team, ensuring that global FENIX data analytics are running smoothly. This includes but is not limited to tracking project profitability, staff resourcing, project budgets, data analytics, and other key company operating metrics. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills, and a passion for process improvement.      Responsibilities:    Work closely with senior leaders in the organization and the business operations team to ensure the smooth running of all daily operations/data analytics and business reports  Assist Managing Director with key project initiatives management and coordination  Conduct research and analysis, run internal workshops, and conduct business-oriented discussions to identify areas for process improvement, and make recommendations  Help implement new processes and procedures to improve efficiency and productivity  Monitor and report on key company performance metrics  Maintain accurate records and documentation  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure effective communication and coordination  Provide administrative support as needed       Qualifications:    Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, or a related field such as accounting or finance)  1-2 years of experience in business operations or a related field  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Proficient in Microsoft Office with advanced skills in Excel  Detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills  Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks and projects  BONUS: Experience with project management tools and/or cash flow analysis such as Airtable or similar      If you are a highly motivated individual with a passion for process improvement and a desire to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.  ‪   QUALIFICATIONS:    • ‪Excellent oral and written communication skills in English are  REQUIRED  (level C1 or better)  • EU citizenship or ability to legally live/work in the EU without the need for sponsorship  REQUIRED   • ‪Demonstrated ability to work independently (good work ethic, maturity, and personal initiative), as well as ability to work as member of a team  • ‪Empathy, adaptability and excellent interpersonal skills  • ‪Close attention to detail and quality in all aspects of job performance  • ‪Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks, ensuring that no task (no matter how minor) is forgotten  • Flexibility and ability to adapt to changing project and company needs  • Proactivity – at FENIX, we don’t simply follow instructions; instead, we critically evaluate whether the instructions are complete or could be applied beyond their initial scope; in addition, providing new ideas on process improvements/efficiencies and methodologies is expected  • Resourcefulness – the ability to independently search for an answer and ask for help when needed      INTERNAL RESPONSIBILITIES:   • Timely and accurate submission of expense reports  • Timely and accurate submission of timesheets  • Open communication regarding project work, company concerns, and new ideas  • Growth mindset, with the ability to work collaboratively as well as autonomously  • Responsible use of company assets and credit card

job_description: CHI SIAMO: DUE PAROLE SU WIENERBERGER       Il Gruppo Wienerbeger   Wienerberger è una multinazionale austriaca di circa 18.000 dipendenti, presente in 28 Paesi con più di 200 stabilimenti worldwide.   Grazie ai suoi 200 anni di esperienza, Wienerberger è leader mondiale nella produzione e distribuzione di materiali da costruzione e soluzioni infrastrutturali. Dalla produzione di mattoni, ai sistemi di tubazioni e pavimentazioni di alta qualità alla costruzione di soluzioni infrastrutturali, l'esperienza di Wienerberger è visibile in tutti i settori della nostra vita.      Wienerberger Italia   Il Gruppo è presente in Italia con quattro stabilimenti: a Mordano (BO), a Feltre (BL), a Gattinara (VC) e a Terni (TR).   Wienerberger Italia focalizza il proprio core business sui laterizi ad elevata tecnologia, che le permette di realizzare di Edifici ad Energia quasi Zero (nZEB) e la colloca ai vertici del settore. Fornisce assistenza al cliente su tutto il territorio nazionale dalla fase di progettazione a quella di cantiere, grazie anche alla perfetta distribuzione degli stabilimenti, che permette di soddisfare qualsiasi esigenza costruttiva su tutto il territorio nazionale.                 IL RUOLO      In qualità di Process Engineer nel nostro stabilimento di Gattinara avrai l’opportunità di contribuire al miglioramento dei processi produttivi, supportando tutte le attività delle linee produttive in termini di affidabilità, consumi e performance.  In altre parole, sarai responsabile di:   Definire i parametri del processo produttivo, in collaborazione con le altre funzioni aziendali  Supervisionare e valutare i parametri di processo  Ottimizzare la produttività progettando, implementando e testando nuove procedure in accordo con il Plant Manager  Redigere report sugli andamenti degli impianti  Tracciare i principali parametri di processo al fine della valutazione del miglioramento degli stessi  Definire, in collaborazione con i Capi Impianto, i piani di controllo di produzione  Effettuare analisi basandosi su dati storici e KPI  Seguire le fasi di test di produzione, implementazione dei prodotti speciali e dei nuovi prodotti;  Coordinarti con il Plant Improvement Program (PIP+) Manager e il Plant Manager per le attività di miglioramento in stabilimento  Sostenere e promuovere una cultura del miglioramento continuo in linea con gli obiettivi del Plant Improvement Program (PIP+)                      CHI STIAMO CERCANDO        Per candidarti a questa posizione assicurati di soddisfare i seguenti criteri:   2-4 anni di esperienza nel ruolo  Laurea in Ingegneria Chimica o percorsi similari  Conoscenza dei principi di Project Management   Conoscenza dei programmi CAD (AutoCAD)  Conoscenza dei fondamenti dei concetti di Lean Production e di Miglioramento Continuo  Esperienza in contesti strutturati di carattere internazionale  Resilienza e flessibilità  Approccio open-minded  Problem Solving  Orientamento all’innovazione         Non perdere l'occasione di entrare nella nostra realtà e di essere direttamente coinvolto/a in un ambiente internazionale e in continua evoluzione! Diventa anche tu parte di  #WienerbergerPeople  !

title: Data Science & Analytics Specialist (f/m/x)
skills: Skills: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Автоматизация тестирования, +8 more
job_description: In deiner neuen Position gestaltest du den digitalen Auftritt der BMW Group für unsere Kunden. Gemeinsam mit dir stellen sicher, dass der Verkauf unserer Produkte in allen Kanälen genauso hochklassig wahrgenommen wird, wie unsere Produkte selbst.      Was erwartet dich?    In deiner neuen Rolle bist du verantwortlich für den Aufbau einer flexiblen Datenarchitektur u.a. in der AWS Cloud, um detaillierte Analysen für Europa zu ermöglichen.  Du definierst das Technologieset (Tech Stack) für die IT Landschaft in den europäischen Märkten, im Sinne einer Transition in den nächsten Jahren und einer Ziellandschaft 2025+. Dies erarbeitest Du im engen Zusammenspiel mit den lokalen Markt IT Organisationen und den zentralen Produktteams.  Du implementierst die BMW Datenstrategie durch Teilen standardisierter Datenbestände über das cloudbasierte Datenmanagementsystem (Data Hub) / Datenportal und stellst eine hohe Datenqualität und stabile Betriebsprozesse über ein Set von nicht-funktionalen Anforderungen sicher.  Unmittelbarer Austausch mit diversen Interessensgruppen aus verschiedensten BMW Abteilungen, um die technischen Möglichkeiten mit den wirtschaftlichen Anforderungen zu konsolidieren.  Du definierst Anforderungen z.B. im Rahmen von Workshops und managst diese mit den verschiedenen Stakeholdern (Unterschiedliche Fachabteilungen, Entwicklerteams, etc.).  Bei der Definition von Produktvisionen und Software Architekturen bis hin zu konkreten, technischen Lösungen berätst du und darüber hinaus bist du Sparring Partner für unsere Projekt Manager in der Projektdurchführung.  Die Beratung der beteiligten Fach- und IT-Stellen zum Einsatz neuer Technologien, die Validierung von Entscheidungen und das Aufzeigen von Möglichkeiten, die gemeinsam mit unseren unterschiedlichen Software Teams umgesetzt werden gehört zu deinen Aufgaben.  Die Vertretung der (IT) Perspektive der internationalen BMW Vertriebsgesellschaften in einem großen Projekt runden dein Tätigkeitsprofil ab.       Was bringst du mit?    Universitätsabschluss in Mathematik, Informatik bzw. Wirtschaftsinformatik, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen oder eine mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung mit Datenanalytik in einem ähnlichen Umfeld.  Mindestens 5 Jahre praktische Erfahrung mit ETL, Datenmodellierung und Datenarchitekturen.  Expertenerfahrung mit AWS Glue, S3, Athena sowie im schreiben und optimieren von SQL, Python, Spark.  Kenntnisse über Reporting-Lösungen wie AWS Quicksight, QlikSense etc. sind von Vorteil.  Kenntnisse über Technologien im Umfeld maschinelles Lernen, wie SageMaker, ist von Vorteil.  Kenntnisse über den Software-Entwicklungszyklus (CI/CD, Testautomatisierung, Konfigurationsmanagement) und sicherer Umgang mit gängigen CI/CD Tools (Terraform/CDK, Jenkins, Sonar etc.) sind von Vorteil.  Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.      Du bist mutig und motiviert, eigene Ideen einzubringen und neue technologische Wege zu gehen? Bewirb dich jetzt!      Hinweis:  Bitte bewirb dich ausschließlich online über unser Karriereportal. Bewerbungen auf anderen Kanälen (insb. auch Email) können nicht berücksichtigt werden.      Was bieten wir dir?    30 Urlaubstage.  Attraktive Vergütung.  BMW & MINI Angebote.  Flexible Arbeitszeitgestaltung.  Hohe Work-Life Balance.  Karriereentwicklung.  Mobilitätsangebote.  Und vieles mehr siehe  bmw.jobs/waswirbieten       Bei der BMW Group verstehen wir Diversität und Inklusion in all ihren Dimensionen als Stärke für unsere Teams. Chancengleichheit ist uns ein besonderes Anliegen, die Gleichbehandlung von Bewerber:innen sowie Mitarbeiter:innen ein grundlegendes Prinzip unserer Unternehmenspolitik. Daher basieren auch unsere Recruiting-Entscheidungen auf ihrer Persönlichkeit, ihren Erfahrungen und Fähigkeiten.  Mehr zu Diversity bei der BMW Group unter  bmwgroup.jobs/diversity      Startdatum: ab sofort  Anstellungsart: unbefristet  Arbeitszeit: Vollzeit     Ansprechpartner:  Annika Friedmann  BMW Group Recruiting Team  +49 89 382-17001

title: Business Analyst
skills: Skills: Microsoft Office, Английский язык, +8 more
job_description: BonelliErede, leader in Italia nei servizi legali e fiscali, che conta attualmente su una squadra di circa 800 persone con sedi in Europa, Africa e Medio Oriente, ricerca una figura di  Business Analyst  da inserire nella funzione  Finance & Controlling  per la propria sede di  Milano .           Il tuo profilo:          Hai appena conseguito una laurea in Economia o hai maturato un anno di esperienza, anche in stage, in area controllo di gestione o in società di revisione contabile e consulenza?  Conosci bene la lingua inglese e sai utilizzare con facilità Microsoft Office ed Excel in particolare?  Ritieni di essere una persona intraprendente e proattiva, desideri misurarti con un ambiente giovane e in crescita?           La persona giusta potresti essere tu!             Le responsabilità della figura:          Sales Control e supporto alla gestione e alla parcellazione delle commesse  Business Control: analisi vendite, produttività, per cliente e tipologia di attività, etc.  Creazione e aggiornamento di reportistiche gestionali  Analisi marginalità  Pricing  Elaborazione KPIs Partner dello Studio  Gestione relazioni con i Partner e il personale delle altre funzioni di Business Support dello Studio           Unisciti a noi e lasciati ispirare anche tu dal mondo BonelliErede!            Chi siamo e quali sono i valori che ci guidano           Selezionati dal Financial Times nel 2022 come  terza law firm più innovativa d’Europa nella categoria “People Management”  – unico studio legale italiano presente in classifica.       Ispirati dal   nostro purpose   “il coraggio e la forza di realizzare insieme grandi idee”, siamo alla ricerca di persone che sappiano integrarsi alla perfezione in un “insieme”, anagramma dei valori che ogni giorno ci guidano: Impegno, Noi, Solidarietà, Innovazione, Etica, Merito ed Eccellenza.       Con il progetto “ livebetter ” ci impegniamo a contribuire al wellbeing delle nostre persone aiutandole a coniugare impegni professionali e personali lanciando periodicamente iniziative dedicate. Scopri chi sono le BonelliErede People sul nostro sito nella sezione Unisciti a Noi nella quale Professionisti e Business Support si raccontano!  https://www.belex.com/experience/filippo-non-solo-numeri-il-mio-lavoro-e-anche-un-viaggio-intorno-al-mondo/        Attenti alle esigenze della società in cui viviamo in continua evoluzione, tutte le iniziative promosse dal nostro Comitato  CSR  si pongono al servizio della comunità, con un’attenzione particolare rivolta ai bambini, il nostro futuro. Negli ultimi anni si è aggiunta la sfida ambientale e anche in questo ambito ci impegniamo a fare la nostra parte.             Il nostro iter di selezione          Invio del CV cliccando sul pulsante “Invia la tua candidatura” sul sito web oppure direttamente sul nostro profilo Linkedin;  Primo screening da parte di HR, contatto telefonico o tramite e-mail;  Sessione di colloqui: un colloquio tecnico - conoscitivo  (durata 45 min, es. domande tecniche sulle attività seguite)  ed uno motivazionale  (durata 45 min)  oltre ad un test di inglese  (durata 90 min)  composto da una parte di grammar, speaking, writing e listening;  Eventuale offerta o riscontro in caso di esito negativo.          Lo Studio garantisce pari opportunità nel processo di selezione prevenendo e contrastando ogni forma di discriminazione per motivi legati alle convinzioni o condizioni personali, nonché al sesso, all’orientamento sessuale, all’origine etnica, allo stato di salute, alla nazionalità, alle opinioni politiche e sindacali, alle credenze religiose e a qualsiasi altra ragione.    Lo Studio promuove una cultura inclusiva, partecipativa e collaborativa, basata sull’etica, sul rispetto e sulla fiducia valorizzando le risorse umane di cui si avvale, garantendo loro lo sviluppo professionale e personale attraverso la coltivazione dei loro talenti.

title: BI Specialist
skills: Skills: Администрирование баз данных, Базы данных, +8 more
job_description: At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, the UK, China, and beyond.  To learn more about what we make possible,  meet some of our customers  or  take a look at some of our products .  We are looking for BI Specialist who will be part of the global Business Intelligence(BI) team looking after the Tobii Dynavox data Estate. The role is broad and includes maintaining and developing our data warehouse as well as understanding our source systems and gathering needs for development. Front end- reporting and data modelling is also part of the role.   Your days will be filled with:     Together with the team manage the daily operations of the BI Data Warehouse  Build and look after reports and dashboards in BI   Participate in project work to bring new information areas into the BI data estate  Working on different projects within the BI space  Perform various other duties as assigned      We are looking for someone with:      Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, engineering, or relevant field  Experience as a BI-Consultant/BI analyst or specialist in similar role  Experience with database management  Experience and interest in using business intelligence tools (Qlik, Tableau and Microsoft Power BI)   Experience and interest in programming languages such as SQL, DAX, M, additional programming language is a bonus  Strong skills in statistics and reporting  Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written  Ability to act with leadership seniority, professionalism and according to the Tobii Dynavox values    The Business Intelligence department at Tobii Dynavox is organized as a part of the finance organization but handles data for every discipline within the company. The department is serving internal customers across the world and is situated in Stockholm and in Pittsburgh.   Next Step!   Please address your questions to Shwetha Dsouza and submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through our website  (Please send your application in English).  We're looking forward to your application!  Tobii Dynavox values equality of opportunity, human dignity, and racial/ethnic and cultural diversity. Tobii Dynavox does not discriminate against individuals based on race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, disability, age, veteran status, ancestry, or national or ethnic origin.

skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Data Engineer, Business Intelligence
skills: Skills: Организация информационных хранилищ, Data Manipulation, +8 more
job_description: We are looking for a Data Engineer, Business Intelligence to help make the vast amount of data we produce organized and valuable so everyone in the company can make great decisions through insights. You will work on analytics tools, data quality, reporting solutions, data pipelines, data modeling and more.      About GetYourGuide     GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 80 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.    Team mission    The Data Platform team plays the central role in our data-driven strategy, designing and developing our data ecosystem, data process processes and analytics capabilities. We work on problems such as product events tracking, AB experiments framework and large-scale applied machine learning. The team is also responsible for making the vast amount of data accessible, reliable and efficient to query, so we are empowered to make the best data-driven decisions. We work with a wide variety of tools and technologies, from Spark to Looker, making this team a great place to learn new skills.     You Will       Work closely with different teams and business partners in the organization, build and foster strong relationships  Develop new data pipelines and work with data analysts, data scientists, engineers and product managers to add new data sources or new views in our data  Implement and maintain data models using analytics tools in order to allow our business users access the data directly and drive decisions  Design and implement metrics, dashboards and reports  Ensure data quality, accuracy and reliability  Empower and train our data users to use data more efficiently, by extending our self serve data services and documentation   Serve as a liaison between the product teams, analytics team and the data engineering team       Who You Are       Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English  2-4 years of relevant experience in a business intelligence role, including data warehousing and analytics tools, techniques and technologies  Experience in Data Warehousing solutions (Snowflake, PostgreSQL, Redshift, Big Query)  Expert knowledge with SQL & OLAP  Experience with Python or Scala  Advanced knowledge of data warehousing concepts and schema optimization based on usage patterns  Knowledge and direct experience in data visualization concepts using business intelligence reporting tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Jupyter notebooks)  Experience in developing cross-platform ETL processes, maintaining systems for tracking data quality and consistency and using databases in a business environment with large-scale, complex data sets       Nice To Have       Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Spark, Kafka, Hive, Hadoop)  Experience with data manipulation tools and libraries (e.g. PySpark, Pandas, R)  Prior experience in start-up environment       How We Set You Up For Success       Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget  Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget  Become a part of our success with virtual stock options  Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy  Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets  Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies     And more...   We look forward to hearing from you   Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.    We are an equal opportunity employer    Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

title: Data Engineer
