job_description: Generali Italia, primo Gruppo assicurativo italiano, posizionato tra i principali player mondiali di riferimento con un approccio innovativo e tecnologicamente all’avanguardia, opera su tutto il territorio nazionale fornendo un servizio ad oltre 6 milioni di clienti.     La figura di Data Engineer, inserita nel team di Data & Platform Governance della funzione del Country Data Officer, si occupa della definizione dei data model per i vari use case advanced analytics, considerando le varie fonti possibili dei dati e la predisposizione delle strutture dati per permettere la lavorazione ai Data Scientists (i.e., raccolta dati, catalogazione dati, pulizia dati, etc.).     La nuova figura sarà coinvolta principalmente nelle seguenti attività:   Collaborazione con i data scientists per comprendere i requisiti architetturali per il ciclo di vita dei modelli Advanced Analytics  Integrazione con la struttura IT di Generali, in modo da agganciare una moderna infrastruttura cloud con i sistemi gestiti da IT.  Collaborazione con i data scientists per costruire un data model che sia il più possibile pulito e completo  Costruzione di un’architettura scalabile, in alta affidabilità e 100% cloud based (GCP principalmente, ma anche Azure).  Sviluppo di una pipeline di continuous integration che sia verticale su tutto il lifecycle del modello di AI o ML. Dalla pull request fino al monitoraggio delle performance del modello già in produzione.  Automazione dei processi, usando sistemi di infrastructure as code come Terraform e Ansible.      Il/la candidato/a ideale è in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:   Laurea triennale o specialistica (preferibile) in discipline tecnico/scientifiche o di business o esperienza equivalente  Esperienza lavorativa nel data management e con sistemi avanzati di gestione dati e applicazioni (i.e. HDFS, Kafka, Cassandra, Kubernetes, etc.)  Esperienza nello sviluppo di applicazioni per la gestione di elevati volumi di dati in maniera scalabile  Conoscenza avanzata di SQL/NoSQL e stream processing.  Ottima conoscenza di almeno un linguaggio di programmazione, preferibilmente python o scala/java  Conoscenza base delle pipeline base di CI/CD  Comprensione dei diversi data domains (i.e. operations, dati cliente, etc.) ed esperienza nel Master Data Management (MDM)  Esperienza nella creazione e mantenimento di documentazione relativa alla gestione dati, alla strutture dati e al data modeling. Conoscenza di strumenti di collaborazione (es. Jira, Confluence), conoscenza avanzata di Git  Conoscenza di concetti come continuous integration, unit test, integration test, infrastructure as code  Saper sviluppare software containerizzato o serverless  Aver lavorato in un team agile avendo familiarità con le tematiche legate allo sviluppo prodotto e al business      Inoltre:   Ottime doti interpersonali e di comunicazione scritta e orale – capacità di sviluppare documenti e presentazioni strutturate  Capacità di lavoro in team, orientamento al risultato, flessibilità e dimostrabile esperienza di collaborazione con molteplici stakeholders      Sedi di lavoro: Milano, Trieste e Mogliano Veneto     Informazioni aggiuntive   Tipo di Contratto: Tempo Indeterminato

title: Junior CRM Analyst
skills: Skills: SPSS Clementine, Сегментация рынка, +8 more
job_description: We are the Nestlé Nespresso SA Company and are proud to be one of the fastest growing operating unit of Nestlé. Our passionate, entrepreneurial-minded team has transformed Nespresso into the reference in portioned coffee and one of the world’s most trusted brands. Our growth comes from our commitment to research and development in order to pioneer and be the reference in the portioned coffee sector to provide the very highest quality coffees that could be enjoyed in the comfort of consumers' own homes and also savored at out-of-home locations, such as restaurants, hotels, offices and luxury retail businesses. We guarantee quality by taking a careful, thoughtful approach in how we source our ingredients, produce and market our premium coffee products. With corporate headquarters in Lausanne, Switzerland, Nespresso is present in over 60 countries and counts over 12,000 employees worldwide. To learn more visit www.nespresso.com.   Position Summary    Do you have a passion for data, insights, and coffee? Do you want to work together with the teams towards the most performing plans for the Belux market? By joining our CX&I team, you will be working on customers insights, analytics and campaign segmentation. The role will also consist of updating & interpreting KPIs.    A day in the life of a CRM data analyst:   Marketing Activities B2C:   In charge of customer segmentation & profiling  Perform target selection & optimization of marketing activities  In charge of Adobe set-up for several campaigns and support on Nessoft set-up  Assessment reports (post analysis) for all major coffee and machine promotions  Perform analytical & statistical analysis (SQL CKLR, SPSS Modeler, ...) and Knime, Snowflake as from October 2023.   Key Performance Indicators:   Manage recurrent CRM reports for B2C   Track Marketing complaints level  Successful targeting for marketing campaigns  Qualitative post analysis delivery  Present status of Database KPI's at marketing meeting with highlights    Meet the team  The Nespresso Marketing team consists of 17 people operating in 4 distinct teams: Brand, Product, B2B and Customer experience & insights. You would be part of the later one which is a dynamic team of 5 persons. The CX&I team collaborates with all the departments (Channels, Demand & supply, B2C,..) to feed with data, insights and also our colleagues from marketing and be the guardians of net acquisition.  What will make you successful   Degree in mathematics/Statistics, or economic studies with large quantitative component  1-2 years experience in data analytics related activities.  Mastering Knime, Snowflake, Adobe is a plus  Analytical experience using software tools in a business-oriented environment.  Willingness to learn & proactivity     Benefits    A full-time position located in Brussels;   Hybrid working (2-3 days / week homeworking);  Excellent benefits, including an annual target bonus;  A variety of professional trainings and development programs;  Various career opportunities, both in Benelux and internationally;  Professional working environment, team spirit, company pride and passionate colleagues.  You will contribute to make Belux a better coffee place   Nestlé is the largest food and beverage company. We are 308,000 employees strong driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. Our values are rooted in respect: repect for ourselves, respect for others, respect for diversity and respect for our future. With more than CHF 91.4 billion sales in 2018, we have an expansive presence with 413 factories in more than 85 countries. We believe our people are our most important asset, so we'll offer you a dynamic inclusive international working environment with many opportunities across different businesses, functions and geopraphies, working with diverse teams and cultures. Want to learn more? Visit us at www.nestle.com.

job_description: Gruppo MESA , realtà di riferimento nell’ambito della  Digital Transformation  specializzata in  Tecnologie ,  Processi di Innovazione  e  Formazione , ricerca risorse neo laureate o con una minima esperienza da inserire in organico con il ruolo di  Junior Business Analyst , per potenziare i propri gruppi di progetto impegnati nell’implementazione della piattaforma tecnologica proprietaria MESA (www.mesacloud.tech).     Le risorse selezionate saranno impegnate in attività progettuali per le più grandi aziende italiane e multinazionali e riceveranno con un mix di formazione strutturata, mentoring e formazione on – the job, al fine di acquisire competenze sia funzionali sia tecnico - informatiche su:      analisi dei requisiti, disegno dei flussi utente, configurazione funzionale per i diversi gruppi di utenti e redazione dei casi d’uso per lo sviluppo delle funzionalità accessorie della piattaforma tecnologica MESA;  interrogazione database relazionali ed utilizzo del  linguaggio SQL  per la scrittura di query;  disegno e implementazione di report e dashboard tramite  Ms Power BI.       La risorsa che cerchiamo possiede:       Laurea triennale o magistrale  in una qualsiasi disciplina  STEM  oppure in  Economia/General Management  oppure Diploma di percorsi ITS con  curriculum tecnologico ;  Spiccata attitudine all’apprendimento e ad acquisire con completezza ed in velocità nuovi concetti e modalità di lavoro;  Buona conoscenza della  lingua inglese , idealmente almeno a livello B2 del quadro comune di riferimento europeo;  Almeno una fra le seguenti conoscenze tecniche:    Conoscenza anche di base del linguaggio SQL per la scrittura di query  Conoscenza di Microsoft Excel  Conoscenza base di Power BI      MESA offre:      Coinvolgimento in attività progettuali per le più grandi aziende italiane e multinazionali;  Sede aziendale all'interno del Campus Universitario di Savona in ambiente giovane, informale, collaborativo e dedito all'innovazione;  Programmi personalizzati di Formazione e Certificazione grazie ai servizi di OverNet Education, società del Gruppo MESA, Microsoft Certified Learning Partner & Exam Centre;  Orari flessibili e soluzioni ibride di smart working declinate sulle esigenze di ciascuna persona e di ciascun ruolo organizzativo;  Contratto a tempo indeterminato (oppure, in ragione del percorso pregresso della risorsa selezionata, apprendistato professionalizzante orientato all’inserimento a tempo indeterminato) con inquadramento e retribuzione commisurati all’effettiva esperienza maturata.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: BI Developer
skills: Skills: SSRS, SSIS, +8 more
job_description: About GroupM    GroupM is the world’s leading media investment company responsible for more than $63B in annual media investment through agencies Mindshare, MediaCom, Wavemaker, Essence and m/SIX, as well as the outcomes-driven programmatic audience company, Xaxis. GroupM’s portfolio includes Data & Technology, Investment and Services, all united in vision to shape the next era of media where advertising works better for people. By leveraging all the benefits of scale, the company innovates, differentiates and generates sustained value for our clients wherever they do business.    The team    Our BI Solutions team are responsible for delivering industry-leading insight and analysis to our ever-growing client portfolio. We use the SQL stack to build rich databases, transforming and moulding data from a variety of sources, such as Google Analytics, GMP and client data. We then build this data into graphically engaging BI solutions that provide meaningful and relevant insights to our clients and internal teams. Also, you will be supporting business operations in the development of management tools and solutions to advance efficiency of our optimization and media planning teams    The job    In this business-critical role as a BI Developer, you will form an integral part of the team that are the gatekeepers of our most precious asset. You will work closely with other BI Developers to strengthen and maintain our data platform, building out ETL processes using SSIS or Python. You will utilise your experience and knowledge to help us develop a new data model and architecture to future-proof our deliverables, working closely with peers and stakeholders alike   Solving complex problems is something you do for fun and you possess great attention to detail. You will have the determination to support the advancement of our BI and help us add even more value to our clients. You’ll support our internal and client teams where required and work closely with the rest of the BI Team to share ideas and best practice.   This is an exciting opportunity to become part of one of the most innovative and media agencies in the world. You’ll gain exposure to our tech, our amazing internal teams and our industry-leading clients and the chance to build your career & your future the way you want it.     Individual Responsibilities    Translate business needs to technical specifications  Capability to design, build and deploy full-stack BI solutions:   APIs setup  Automation of data ingestion streams  Manage databases/datawarehouses  Build exploration layer on top of data  Design and deploy reports/dashboards  Develop and execute database queries and conduct ad-hoc analyses  Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting  Evaluate and improve existing BI systems  Collaborate with other teams to integrate systems (e.g. JIRA)  Develop and update technical documentation  Support the implementation of a hybrid “Cloud + On-premises” approach to GroupM’s BI roadmap    Qualifications and technical skills      Minimum 3 years’ experience as a BI SQL Stack Developer  Essential experience in T-SQL, SSIS, Excel, SSRS  Knowledge of Azure  Exposure to C#, TFS, Data Warehousing, Data Lakes  Experience of managing the full reporting lifecycle, from requirements gathering to specification creation, implementation and maintenance  Familiarity with DevOps processes  Knowledge of Source Control  Knowledge or experience of BI Visualisation tools such as Tableau/Power BI and an interest in data visualization as a means to improve communication  An enthusiasm to support our people and our clients with innovative data solutions  Experience working with and mentoring junior team members  A love for data and passion for exceeding expectations  A well organised and proactive approach to projects & tasks  An appetite to evolve your skillset and embrace new technology to help drive the BI team forward  Have absolute attention to detail, be highly organized and thorough   Desired Knowledge, skills and abilities      Some experience in project management methodology would be a bonus  Understanding of AWS and GCP is valued  Knowledge of web analytics platforms such as Google Analytics is advantageous  Proactively seek feedback on your work to take it to the next level  Detail oriented, meticulous, responsive to deadlines and able to multitask  Ongoing interest in Digital marketing, industry trends, best practices and emerging technologies  Strive for excellence demonstrated by a commitment to continuous improvement, taking initiative and delivering results despite constraints

title: Data platform Product Owner
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Коммуникабельность, +4 more
job_description: About the job:   LVMH is the #1 Luxury group and is currently accelerating rapidly on digitalization. It is bringing technology and innovation in the core of the established 75+ Maisons by inventing unique and powerful products and services.  We are looking for a product owner to join our team and be part of this tech revolution of bringing the Group and its Maisons to the next level.  Our team proposes:   A data platform framework enabling all the LVMH Maisons to build a centralized trustworthy data platform and to leverage on data to deploy innovative AI use cases using, optimize operations and steer activities.  Platform for LVMH data scientists to allow them to craft and industrialize the most relevant algorithms  Services to create the best luxury intelligence   We are looking for a former data or software engineer seeking for a position of product owner to deliver our group data platform framework product.         Organization     Part of the Data Tech team in the LVMH group IT department, you’ll be part of a multidisciplinary team regrouping: software engineers in charge of crafting the best products, solution engineers in charge of the roll-out and deployment within the Maisons, customer success manager in charge of our customers satisfaction. We are all passionate about data and AI projects.  This team works closely with many experts from Maisons and the group Data scientists, data strategists, analytics lead, CRM, Supply experts and all the other IT departments.  The position reports to the Product Manager (in charge of the products and services detailed above) inside the data tech team.  Daily, you will work within a squad composed of software engineers managed by the Head of Engineering            Key responsibilities:      Backlog management and product team management     Lead the collection of user’s requirements through user-centric workshops enriched by your own former experience  Prioritize requirements to deliver value to the business, to unlock added value use cases.  Translate user’s requirements into ready-to-develop users stories prioritized within the backlog.  Lead the different agile ceremonies with the product team (daily, planning, refinement, retrospective,)     Delivery     Ensure incremental value deliveries aligned with the product’s vision and roadmap  Test the features delivered by the product team to ensure the qualitative delivery  Define and monitor KPI of success of your product (adoption, usage, value, satisfaction)     Communication & Promotion    · Communicate on the product release   · Lead committee presentations or workshop for the different audiences (business, tech teams, …)         Required experiences         You have previous experiences as data or software engineer and 5 years + in data  You are familiar, and worked with Google Cloud Platform and Terraform (or equivalent)  You know SQL and have used BigQuery for data management and analysis  You have at least one  previous experience in agile methodology (member of an agile squad using the SCRUM framework as developer or PO)  Skills of communication and collaborative management  You have strong verbal and written skills in English and French  You have a product and user centric approach, and you wish to evangelize it with your coworkers          If you believe Data and AI can enhance the retail luxury industry, from the day-to-day operational tasks to the long-term customer experience,    If you think that the Cloud technologies (we love Google Cloud) is a revolution for Data and AI products,    If you have good a clear and consistent communication, a collaborative team spirit and excellent interpersonal skills,    Apply now and join us!

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Data Engineering, Модели данных, +8 more
job_description: KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car, cruise, or vacation package. We’re also transforming the in-travel experience with our app and new accommodation software. For more information, visit www.KAYAK.com.  As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of metasearch brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined. Many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each others strengths and insights. Together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.  KAYAK is looking for a hardworking data engineer to join our Business Analytics team! This team is responsible for organizing KAYAK’s commercial performance data to drive data-driven decisions. Our team’s dashboards and reports are used globally across the company and are critical to the daily functioning of the business.  This position is based in Berlin and will report to the Manager of Engineering, who is based in the Zurich office.   Note: this is a hybrid role and will be required to be in office 2-3 days per week.    In this role, you will:      Build and maintain data pipelines (ETLs) using Python, SQL, Airflow, and Docker  Design performant data models and optimize SQL queries  Create dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to share insights into business performance  Investigate data issues to identify patterns and root causes  Automate repetitive tasks and build self-service tools to support data democratization  Work closely with cross-functional stakeholders to understand business needs, propose solutions, and communicate results     Please apply if you have:      2+ years of professional experience in the field of data engineering, analytics, or software engineering  Considerable experience with SQL using relational databases (e.g. Vertica, Snowflake, MySQL, Hive)  Experience in building and maintaining ETLs strongly preferred  Ability to write clean and concise code, Python experience preferred  Experience with Airflow & Looker is a plus  Experience with Django and/or web development is a plus  Fluent in English (both spoken and written)     Benefits And Perks     6 weeks paid vacation  Day off on your birthday  Work from (almost) anywhere policy  Free lunch catering 2 days per week and all the snacks you need  Generous retirement plans  Universal paid parental leave  Public transportation subsidies  Bike leasing possibility  German classes  Free massages  Regular team events and volunteering opportunities  Sport teams and in-house gym     Diversity and Inclusion   We aspire to have a workplace that reflects all of the diverse communities we serve. We know that when we have diverse teams we produce more creative ideas, products, and better outcomes for our team members. OpenTable/KAYAK is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome and encourage candidates from all backgrounds and experiences to apply for roles on our team. Whoever you are, just be you.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Scala, SQL, +8 more
job_description: We are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Data and Analytics team. You will be responsible for the design, development, programming methods and processes to consolidate and analyze structured and unstructured data sources to generate actionable insights and predictions for stakeholders across the business. In this role you will engage business partners to translate data into business opportunities through advanced analytics methods. You will identify opportunities and support the design of new tools in collaboration with the business stakeholders. Our Data Scientists’ develop software programs, algorithms, and automated processes that cleanse, integrate, and evaluate large data sets from multiple sources. They lead the development of predictive, preventive, and proactive data and analytics products.    Your team    The data-team is a multidisciplinary team that consists of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, BI Specialists, Digital Analysts and Business Analysts. Its main responsibility is to enable and lead data driven decision making. It provides products, insights and projects that make it possible for the business to make educated decisions. The work that the data-team does is incredibly diverse due to the fact that we work with all departments within the Decathlon business (pricing, logistics, HR, marketing, finance, online, etc.).    Responsibilities;      Data mining from internal and external sources  Contribute to empowering the organization to make data driven decisions  Proactively come up with findings and data insights  Application experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts  Monitor data quality and consistency  Developing and validating statistical and machine learning models  Contributing to translation of business problems into data insights and advanced analytics solutions  Developing and maintaining standards for Data Science  Creating and maintaining thorough documentation of infrastructure and related processes  Sharing knowledge and learnings with the team     What do we ask from you?     Experience in advanced statistical techniques and machine learning models  Experience with one or more programming/scripting languages such as Python, R, Scala, Julia, SQL is a must.  A broad knowledge of retail with experience about pricing solution is a plus  Experience with data visualization tools required; such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, Power BI, etc.  Ability to quickly grasp different technologies and use them to solve problems  Collaborative code development experience, including version control, code review and sharing  University Degree in Data Science/Big Data   Proactive with good communication and presentation skills  Good knowledge of ETL and experience working with cloud data warehouses, GCP/BigQuery experience is a plus  A passion for sports!       What Do We Offer       A great sports culture and a lot of sportive colleagues who want to sport with you  Holiday allowance  24 vacation days   20% discount on our own brands   Decathlon academy training sessions   Shareholder plan  Travel Allowance  Pension plan  Possible profit sharing     Decathlon Facts     Decathlon started in 1976 and is originally a French family business  Our mission at Decathlon is to make sport accessible, in a sustainable way, for as many people as possible. That's why we want you to be as passionate about sports as we are  Our four core values are: vitality, responsibility, generosity and authenticity  We are active in 60 countries worldwide with more than 100,000 employees and more than 1700 stores  In the Netherlands we have 22 stores, a head office (Amsterdam) and warehouse (Tilburg). We now have more than 1500 employees in the Netherlands     Decathlon is committed to inclusion and non-discrimination, and thus acts daily in favour of disabilities, seniors, social mixing and equality between men and women. Above all, we recruit personalities and diversity within our teams is a major challenge because it is a source of innovation and performance.   WHAT DOES THE APPLICATION PROCESS LOOK LIKE?     Application by means of your CV and motivation letter  Introduction by telephone (Room for your questions!)  First interview  Second interview  Contract proposal  Welcome to Decathlon!     Do you have any questions about this role before you apply? Please get in touch with dylan.reichart@decathlon.com   We welcome feedback on our recruitment process, if you have any suggestions please feel free to let us know.

title: Analyst - Marketing Effectiveness
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: About the role:      This entry level role sits within our Advanced Analytics department, who help advertisers get the best returns on their marketing and promotional spend. You’ll be responsible for delivering accurate and appropriate models, and interpret the analysis to create concise, insightful customer communications. Once you have settled in, you will be given a lot of autonomy and the opportunity to be client-facing. Here at Ebiquity we believe in empowering our people to take charge of their projects, give plenty of autonomy and opportunities to learn new things every day.      Key activities:       Deliver accurate and appropriate analytic models using the tools and processes as advised by team leaders  Interpret the analysis to create concise, insightful customer communications (presentations, documentation etc)  Continually develop marketing effectiveness knowledge and expertise  Contribute to team goals and profitability, by producing work to timetable       What will you bring to the role:       Ideally, you will have some experience in Big Data analysis, econometrics, and Marketing Mix Modelling. Alternatively, we are also considering recent graduates with a relevant degree and a genuine passion for data analysis, statistics, and econometrics.  Good knowledge of media, marketing, pricing and promotions, ideally with a consultancy, media agency or media owner  Numerate & analytical skills  Competent with Excel, PowerPoint and Word  Ideally you have had experience with Eviews, R or Sequel, any programming skills would be advantageous      Other Requirements :      Be able to communicate in a professional environment and be a team player.  Enthusiasm and ambition  Intellectually curious with an open mind, a self-starter, genuinely interested in data driven analysis  Team player, happy working in small groups  Applicants must be eligible/have a visa to work in Spain.           What we can offer:        We are a global forward-looking company which offers a range of opportunities for you to develop your skill set and career. In exchange for your contribution, we can offer you:       Competitive salary  Flexibility to work from home (required office present for training)  Training and Development Opportunities  Summer schedule July - Sept  6 hour work day on Fridays (9.00 – 15.00)  A company focus on wellbeing and work life balance including initiatives such as mental health support and regular health and wellbeing activities        About Ebiquity:       Ebiquity is the world leader in media investment analysis.  We harness the power of data to provide independent, fact-based advice, enabling brand owners to perfect media investment decisions and improve business outcomes.     We are a data-driven solutions company helping brand owners drive efficiency and effectiveness from their media spend, eliminating wastage and creating value. We provide analysis and solutions through five service lines:      Media Management  Media Performance  Marketing Effectiveness  Technology Advisory  Contract Compliance      More than 500 media specialists operate from our 18 offices across 16 countries, covering 80% of the global advertising market and that’s why we want the best talent available, regardless of race, religion, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, disability or age.     Our core values are:     “Collaboration” - The foundation on which we build our business and we put people first, whether they are clients or colleagues  “Creativity” - We are consistently looking for new ways of doing things and new ways of thinking  “Clarity”- We prioritize clarity for our clients and colleagues in the way we work, leading with transparency  “Courage” - We have an unshakeable belief in what we are capable of together as a team.     These values articulate the behaviours that will enable us to deliver on our vision, they reflect our personality and they unite us. These values also drive us to embrace the rich impact that multiple approaches and different ways of thinking can bring.      Ebiquity aims to create a workplace that is open and supportive, and free of discrimination and prejudice.    We want the best talent available, regardless of race, religion, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, disability or age.

title: Ingénieur Senior BI F/H
skills: Skills: Английский язык, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Spécialiste de la santé et du bien-être, URGO est un groupe international à capital familial, créé en France. Comptant 3500 collaborateurs, il est présent dans plus de 60 pays dans le monde et réalise un chiffre d’affaires de 660 millions d’euros. URGO a développé un solide portefeuille de marques à très forte notoriété comme JUVAMINE, ALVITYL, URGO, ou encore MERCUROCHROME.     URGO est reconnu pour sa forte capacité d’innovation et s’impose par exemple comme l’un des experts mondiaux de la cicatrisation avancée.     Afin de répondre à ses enjeux de croissance, le Groupe Urgo a lancé un ambitieux Programme de Transformation. Ce projet comprend notamment la refonte totale de la BI au sein du Groupe URGO. Dans ce contexte, nous renforçons notre équipe et recherchons notre futur  Ingénieur Senior BI (F/H).        Missions principales :       En tant que Responsable du Pôle BI, vous assurez la conduite du projet de refonte de la BI d’un point de vue architecture et fonctionnel, avec le support de l’Ingénieur BI qui vous est directement rattaché.     A ce titre, vous développez une vision transverse des processus, de l’organisation et des solutions. Vous êtes force de proposition auprès des décideurs et des opérationnels afin de construire l’architecture BI du Groupe, en :   Traduisant les besoins des différents services en spécifications techniques  Concevant, développant et déployant des solutions BI, notamment les cubes OLAP, les rapports et l’optimisation de l’entrepôt de données  Réalisant des tests unitaires et procédant au dépannage  Collaborant avec les équipes pour intégrer les systèmes  Créant des visualisations et des rapports pour les projets demandés  Développant et mettant à jour la documentation technique      En parallèle, vous formez à l’utilisation de l’outil BI (Key User, utilisateurs finaux) et apportez le support nécessaire aux équipes       Votre profil :       Vous avez au moins 5 ans d’expérience sur des problématiques BI et avez déjà piloté des projets d’implémentation d’outils BI en assurant le rôle d’interface avec le métier et les équipes techniques (en lead fonctionnel ou consultant technique).     Une expérience avec SQL / Power BI est nécessaire pour ce poste.     Votre organisation et votre rigueur vous permettent de gérer des projets complexes.     Enfin, Vous êtes reconnu pour votre communication vous permettant d’interagir efficacement tant avec des experts opérationnels, que des managers décisionnaires ou des interlocuteurs de la DSI.      La dimension internationale de notre environnement nécessite des interactions à l’oral et à l’écrit en anglais avec les filiales.        Modalités :        Type de contrat :  CDI   Date de démarrage :  Au plus tôt   Lieu :  Dijon

job_description: At allnex, you can go to work knowing you make a lasting impact on the world. Our work helps to protect and improve more than 1,000 products from interior coatings for airplanes, corrosion protection for cars, scratch-resistant coatings for smartphones to printing inks for glossy magazines at a newsstand.  Sustainability is a commitment to our stakeholders and a key part of our continued success. be ECOWISE™ is our promise and our proposition.  We are present in 4 regions, with more than 4,000 employees globally, and serve customers in over 100 countries, which makes allnex the world’s leading coatings resins company.  Please, come and see allnex insights –   Let’s make an impact together!    And here is a sneak peek, how life at allnex sites looks like -   allnex Operator Movie.      Position Overview    Are you passionate about  data management  and looking for a challenging role in a global company that values innovation and creativity? Look no further than allnex!  We are currently seeking a  Data Management Specialist  to join our dynamic Global Business Services (GBS) team. As a key member of our team, you will play a critical role in maintaining the integrity and accuracy of allnex's critical master data, helping to drive our business forward and enabling our customers to succeed.  In this role, you will collaborate with stakeholders across allnex's business functions to understand data requirements, design data models, and ensure data is entered and maintained correctly in our systems. You will also have the opportunity to leverage your expertise to recommend process improvements and work with other teams to implement these changes.  If you are a detail-oriented individual with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for driving data quality, we want to hear from you! At allnex, we offer a competitive salary, a comprehensive benefits package, and the opportunity to grow your career in a global organization.  Apply now to become part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world of data management!    Responsibilities     To advise Data Management Specialists on process or data setup issues  Ensure data stewardship – work with different teams within the organization to coordinate the complete set up of master data  Assistance to ERP-system users with master data-related issues, following the established issue management process  Take responsibility for data integrity and global consistency  Understand the business process and the relevant master data, ensure the validity of data definitions  Participate in projects and clean-up activities to ensure data integrity.     Required Skills And Experience     At least 1 year experience in Data Management or Master Data related role  Experience in ERP-supported environment, preferably SAP ERP  Familiarity with Material Master Data will be an advantage for this role  Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively and independently  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills  Advanced knowledge of MS Excel  At least intermediate (B2) English language skills.     Qualifications     University degree in IT or related field.    We offer    Monthly gross salary up to 1450 EUR, depending on skills and experience  Partially working from home option  Transportation allowance  Health, accident and critical illness insurance  Annual bonus program and special recognition awards  Excellent working conditions in modern environment  An international exposure in a cross-cultural community  Training, great opportunities to grow and develop your career nationally and internationally   Company’s social events    Equal Employment Opportunity   allnex is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an environment where all colleagues contribute for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our communities.  Find out how you can make an impact!  Check out our career page for available opportunities. We look forward to hearing from you.  www.allnex.com

job_description: Job summary    A global leading software company in the Capital Markets Technology (CapTech) industry. We’re looking to hire a Business Analyst with Supply Chain knowledge to join the team and help us shape the future of smart home.      Responsibilities    Automate and streamline demand and supply chain reporting  Implement a fully scoped demand planning process  Generate reporting to cross-functional team members and Executive S&OP review  Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and other analytical tools to monitor supply chain performance.  Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of organization  Solid ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities  Identify data quality issues and work with relevant teams to address them         Experience and Attribute    Bachelors degree required  Knowledge of Demand & Supply Chain functions a must  Self-starter, data driven individual, motivated to influence change and make improvements  Team player that takes ownership of actions and follows through on commitment  Demonstrates strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills  Comfortable working with large quantities of data across multiple systems  Presents ideas and information in a concise, well-organized manner  Advanced excel skills essential ( Pivot tables, Grouping, Data Validation, VLookup, Macros  Basic Tableau knowledge beneficial  Oracle and Anaplan knowledge a plus         Studies have shown that candidates from certain underrepresented communities may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every single one of the qualifications as described in a job description. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive company and we are most interested in finding the BEST candidate for the job. That candidate may be one who comes from a less traditional background, and that’s okay. We would strongly encourage you to apply, even if you don't believe you meet every one of the qualifications described. We may work with candidates, as appropriate, to ensure they develop additional skills as necessary to fulfill the essential functions of the job.    Arlo is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity and inclusion and are committed to a diverse, inclusive, and harassment-free workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment based on age, race, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, religion, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status in all hiring and employment. job_description: Canon is the world’s best imaging company – driven to enrich people’s lives and businesses with innovative products and smart digital solutions. We are a global brand, constantly challenging ourselves to find new ways of adding value through our growing portfolio of services and solutions.      Canon EMEA is looking for a  Data Management Consultant  to join our Master Data Management team. As a Data Management Consultant, you are responsible for defining and implementing the Data Management processes at Canon EMEA. Furthermore, you will play a key role in improvement projects, helping our stakeholders by creating more valuable insights from available data. At Canon EMEA, you will have the possibility to deepen your specialism further and create and share your vision as Subject Matter Expert. You will contribute to strengthening the foundation of our business with data-driven, fact-finding and translate into requirements.     Do you want to work in a multi-cultural and multi-disciplinary environment where we respect each other’s strength? Then you are the person we are looking for!     As a  Data Management Consultant , your key responsibilities are to:    Plan, coordinate and execute Data Management initiatives across the organization, such as Data Quality and Data Governance;   Support MDM system setup; analyze gaps in processes, systems or databases and make recommendations for further improvement, development, standardization or simplification, based on the business priorities;  Communicate business requirements effectively and transform into changes, and provide up-to-date Work Instructions;  Build or expand relationship with MDM user communities in Functions/BU’s, and ensure they are in alignment with the MDM objectives;  Demonstrate in-depth understanding of End-to-End business processes which use Master Data;   Understand business strategy, objectives and priorities , as well as high-level IT and Business architecture of the MDM concepts and solutions.       What we ask   The profile we have in mind for this role is someone with:   A bachelor’s or master's degree in a relevant field;  Hands-on experience in data analysis and improvement in preferably   Product Master   Data Management;  Proficient in MS Excel and in building automated report/dashboard via visualization tools such as MS Power BI, Sumatra;  Experience in Oracle ERP MDM Product Data Hub (PDH) or similar application is preferable;  Knowledge on Data Quality, Data Governance, and Data Stewardship;  Abilities to sell concept, communicate concisely verbally and in writing, and act independently in a cross-functional environment;  Demonstrated stakeholder management skills and influence others without authority.       You will need:   We are looking for a customer focused individual who can drive and manage change, take ownership and accountability, has great analytical skills, and can negotiate and influence.      What We Give   With Canon, you'll get the support and encouragement you need to grow, from people who share your ambition. We'll invest in your professional development to help you learn and progress in your role with us. You'll find leaders who give you the freedom to explore new things and a team where knowledge is shared openly.      Further Information   In addition to a competitive salary, you will be eligible for the following benefits in this role:   Performance-based bonus of 12,5%;  31 days holiday per year;  Pension plan;  Bicycle plan;  Full coverage of your public transport costs and partially car costs  Please not only candidates with a valid working permit for the EU will be considered for this role.      Canon champions hybrid working (3 days office & 2 days remote) with and a flexible working policy. You will be part of an energetic and innovative environment with more than 50 different nationalities! Lastly, you’ll find that Canon encourages continuous Learning and Development with a wide range of resources and support available on demand.     Does this seem like a great fit for your career expectations? We're excited to hear from you! Even if you don't meet all the qualifications we still encourage you to apply.     Job family Operations-Quality Assurance and Business Improvement  Grade12     Canon is enriching lives and businesses in incredible new ways. You can play a part in shaping the future of a company that’s visionary, innovative and bold. As the world's best imaging company, we're living and working together for the common good.

title: Data Analyst (Engineer)

job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Developing documentation and data governance  Owning the entire ETL process  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge     Nice to have    Advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: Exsolvæ is a data consultancy based in Brussels, Belgium. We are dedicated to fostering a culture of knowledge sharing among data professionals.  Our goal is not only to excel in one discipline, but also to gain a comprehensive understanding of the challenges spread across the four pillars of our expertise:      Data Foundations: Data Engineering to Design, develop, and maintain data architecture and infrastructure, build data pipelines, etc.  BI, Data Analytics & Visualization: Design and implement data visualization solutions that enable to gain insights from the data.  Data Science & Artificial Intelligence: Implement & Develop algorithms in Deep Learning, Machine Learning & Artificial Intelligence.  Data Governance & Strategy: Strategic consultancy for acquisition and valorization of Data. Responsibilities:       Design and develop interactive data visualizations that are intuitive, informative, and visually appealing using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or D3.js.       Collaborate with clients and data analysts to identify data visualization requirements and design solutions that meet their needs. title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Finance Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Моделирование данных, Visualization, +8 more
job_description: Description      Guardian Industries , a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian’s diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian’s vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.   Guardian is looking for a  Finance Data Analyst  based close to any Guardian location (hybrid work).   You will serve as a  data & analytics engagement partner  for your internal customers and bring an end-to-end perspective to make sure our data strategies create competitive advantage. We expect that you come along-side your customers to educate them on the value of effective analytics, prioritize work and help leaders ‘work backwards’ from the opportunity to capture the right data and design solutions that improve our responsiveness and decision making. The ability to realize this will be built on a  foundational  base of trusted data with BI and advanced analytics developed incrementally over time.   So, as a successful engagement leader you should be supporting customer teams on a journey where Guardian learns how to maximize the return on its investment in data by using information to make better, faster, and more profitable decisions.   What You Will Do In Your Role     Help prioritize activities based on value and be involved with decision makers through end-to-end process from creative ideation all the way through to delivery on BI, Advanced Analytics and other data related assets.   Continuous communication with the internal customers to understand their processes, value drivers, initiatives and priorities, problems they are trying to solve, etc. and make sure they get the data products or solutions they need to succeed. Validate backlog priorities with them and provide feedback on progress.  Lead the pod cross-functional team to work on the right priorities. Organize and understand the resources you will need to deliver the products. Manage and keep up to date your backlog (Azure DevOps as tool).  Collaborate with business partners to identify gaps and formulate sustainable solutions that align with current business priorities and vision.  Frame and document opportunities (demand), estimate value creation, key factors, and assign priority.  Develop frameworks, roadmaps, and actionable requirements and project decomposition for modeling & visualization, engineering, governance, and IT\Systems Dev. teams through execution of data needs.  Initial testing (fit for function).  Organizational change management and delivery of developed work products.  Ensure users education on the solution, monitor adoption and support on its effective usage.  Grow, through influence, a data enablement mindset across the organization and mentor others on how to think about data needs.  Reinforce data governance (Master data and enrichment) and ensure global compliance of framework.  Involvement in system implementations and/or decommissions in what refers to data related.     The Experience You Will Bring     Requirements       Bachelor’s Degree (Finance, Accounting or Mathematics preferred but not exclusive).  Work experience in finance (costing and reporting preferable).  Strong collaboration and communication skills and ability to work within cross functional teams.  Highly organized and able to manage the functional team’s work items. Problem solving oriented.  Knowledge of fundamental data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional) and understanding of SQL.  Knowledge of fundamental data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) and data analytics tools (e.g. Alteryx) a plus.  Ability to manage multiple priorities and assess and adjust quickly to changes or challenges.  Able to hold accountable, keep positive attitude, open minded and honest, able to embrace new challenges.  Strong economic thinking skills.  Effective oral and written communication skills in English. Other languages a plus.   Eagerness to learn new skills.

title: Business Analyst Specialist for Data Warehouse
skills: Skills: Спецификация требований, Бизнес-требования, +8 more
job_description: Division: Group Digital Capabilities (GDC)   The "Group Digital Capabilities" division ensures Euroclear’s competitiveness by delivering reliable and sustainable IT solutions for the financial securities markets.   In the Department “GDC-AIR-Analytics, Insights & Reporting”, we are looking for a new business analyst specialist who is curious about data behaviors and will be the link between the business and our team and who will reinforce the "Data warehouse squad" (around 15 persons).   Our department of almost 90 people is composed of several factories:      Data Warehouse factory (DWH) where designers/developers are specialized in DWH/Cognos reports development,    Advanced Analytical factory (AA) where data scientists/data engineers deliver new predictive products by extracting any data (structured or unstructured) and to turn them into valuable final products or reports.       Our main deliveries are:      Building and maintaining Data Warehouse(s) that, day after day, historize all critical business data by business domain,    Developing complex reports based on the information stored in the DWH either for regulatory purposes or for strategic purposes and    Risk reduction or revenue generation thanks to new Advanced Analytics services.       Our leitmotiv: turn data into added-value reports and insights.   All the department is working for both our internal and external clients.   You will play one key facilitator role in the delivery of the projects/business initiatives and in the satisfaction of our clients that are spread over the whole Euroclear Group.    Role:   Contribute to the smooth delivery of AIR initiatives whatever the domain of activity.   In that capacity, you will have to understand the challenge the client is facing, elaborate business requirements and follow up on the development and testing.    During the budgeting phase, you need to:      Meet the business requestors to understand their needs before formalizing them into a standard business document (HLBR)    Prepare a first budget assessment for new business initiatives.       During the requirements specification phase, you will be in charge to:      Create, review, and maintain the business documents (DBR, data catalogue, glossary, etc.)    Be the guardian of the scope of each business initiative (raise change request when needed)    Understand the data models created by the designers and validate their conformity to the business need.       After the requirement phase, you need to:      Help the designers/developers to validate the completeness and quality of the data they have collected and prepared    Support testing phase by defining the testing scope and strategy.    Provide ad-hoc support to the end-users (Operations) or developers during the User Acceptance Test (UAT)    Maintain the permanent documentation.        Qualifications:      You have strong analytical skills and a healthy critical mind set.    You can think in a structured way.    You are interested in data management technologies (BI, Big Data, and advanced analytics) and are not reluctant to deal with a certain degree of technicality.    You have good people skills: you can work in close collaboration with other parties involved in the project and build constructive relationships with all stakeholders (Product, Operations, Commercial, Network, IT, etc.).    You have already an experience in the BI area, or you're interested in the BI domain (training foreseen).    You have a good understanding of Euroclear as an organization and of its products and services. Your previous assignments have exposed you to a certain variety of domains.    You possess excellent communication skills: present information clearly and concisely (writing skills).    You keep people informed about projects status and issues - you are autonomous and organized.    You have played a role as business analyst in the Euroclear group.        Nice to haves:      Awareness and knowledge of Finance, Banking, Settlement or Asset Servicing domains, and a strong interest in both the financial world and the IT world, as being the intermediary between the two,    2 years as a business analyst experience whatever the area or 4 years in Euroclear bank operations    Some mathematical skills would be an asset to estimate numerical data.    Knowledge of: SQL (query language), Excel (Advanced), Cognos, Power BI.

title: Market Research Analyst (Remote - within Europe)
skills: Skills: Научно-исследовательская деятельность, Python, +8 more
job_description: SlashData is the leading market research company in the software developer economy: we help the world understand developers and developers understand the world. We survey 40,000+ developers annually - across mobile, IoT, desktop, cloud, AR/VR, web, games, data science, and machine learning - to help clients such as Microsoft, Meta, Google and Amazon understand who developers are, what tools they love or hate and where they are going next.     We’re now looking for a full-time Market Research Analyst to help our clients address their research needs and improve their business outcomes by designing research and unearthing insights from a wealth of data points related to developer activity. You’ll be working based in Europe, working remotely to support our distributed team.      Who we’re looking for   As a Market Research Analyst you will have 2-5 years of experience in the field of market research, data analysis, and research project delivery to clients, ideally in the tech industry. Your command of the English language will be second to none, and you will be fearless in data crunching and keen to uncover meaningful patterns, actionable insights and intriguing stories from the data.     You will have experience in working alongside clients, either internal to your company or external, to guide them from a vague brief to a research outcome that answers their business questions. You will also have a proven record of communicating your findings to non-technical audiences, eloquently narrating the story behind the numbers. You might not have worked in the software industry before, but you have a basic understanding of how it works.     If you’re that person, we’d love to talk.      What you'll be doing    Helping clients translate their business problems into research questions and projects.  Designing surveys to collect data that address clients’ research needs.  Performing data and statistical analysis to extract insights in the context of market research, behavioural analysis, population forecasting, segmentation and profiling.  Writing up your findings in short and long reports including visually appealing graphs and deep insights based on your analysis, answering the “why” behind the “what”.  Working closely with clients to provide insightful answers to tough business problems, and to support them in custom data insights projects.  Delivering briefings and webinars, and presenting our insights in conferences, meetups and events by communicating results and new ideas convincingly to others and selling the value.  Shaping our research agenda and global developer surveys, asking the right questions given our research objectives.  Tracking the latest trends in the software developer ecosystem.       The skills we are looking for    Background in statistics, engineering, business administration or other quantitative field.  Experience in working closely with stakeholders to understand their business objectives and define research projects that address their needs.  Excellent business writing skills (English), with the ability to effectively communicate complex findings to non-technical audiences.  Demonstrated experience in authoring insights reports, comprehensively and in an unbiased way, converting data to insightful information.  An ability to answer the ‘so what?’ question behind the observed numbers and patterns.  Ability to visualise data effectively, producing eye-catching and easy-to-understand graphs.  Very good presentation skills, preferably with experience in delivering client briefings.  Very good data analysis skills, preferably in Python (Pandas) and Excel.  At least a basic grasp of clustering and classification methodologies and models.  Comfortable working as part of a distributed team across four continents.       Bonus Points for    Past experience of working with complex survey data.  Past experience of consulting clients on market research projects, ideally in the tech industry.  Past experience with quantitative or qualitative research design, competitive market analysis or user research.  Following trends in the tech industry, either through past experience or as a hobby.  Advanced Python skills.  Advanced data modelling skills.  Having software development experience as a hobby or past work.       Key success metrics   You will be successful in the role if in the first 6 months you have:   Developed a basic understanding of how the developer-led landscape works.  Authored at least three research reports, carrying out all data analysis and background research as needed.  Actively participated in at least two client research projects.  Delivered at least two client briefings or webinars to our high standards.  Actively contributed in shaping the research agenda and designing parts of the questionnaire of our upcoming global developer survey.  Supported our developer outreach and sales teams, promptly responding to any requests relevant to your work.  Become a dependable team mate.       Benefits    Opportunity to make a difference as part of the leading research company in the developer economy  Competitive salary  Bonus based on performance and company profitability  Flexible working environment  Annual training budget to develop your skills and career  Monthly book allowance from Amazon, on any book you like  Spotify Premium subscription or Netflix  Annual co-working budget  Initial office set up budget to ensure you have the right equipment  Attendance at our annual team event  A fun and exciting work culture with regular opportunities to connect  Never work on your birthday  No dress code  Part of an entrepreneurial company that's raising the bar, and calling the trends of the developer economy      Salary  £40.000 - £60.000 depending on experience and location.

title: Senior Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Python, Kubernetes, +8 more
job_description: We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist     Who we are     Aplazame is a fintech company acquired by WiZink Bank that offers flexible payment methods that enable merchants to maximize their sales and conversion rates through instant financing options. Customers also benefit from the power of spreading the cost of their purchases. Aplazame features multiple products available for online and in-store purchases. We aim to build simple financing products, transparent and fair that enable our customers to purchase the things that make them happy through responsible lending, no hidden fees and an exceptional customer experience. In order to continue growing, we’d love to find a Senior Data Scientist for our Data Team.     What you’ll do      Investigation of improvements to existing models: hypothesis proposal, investigation and actionable conclusions  Development of new previously non-existent models for which interesting solutions must be proposed. For example, recommendation systems, marketing channel optimization, A / B testing measurement with multi-arms bandits or anomaly detection are some of the challenges that we have to solve.  Development with Python in AWS. We make Data Science and therefore we make (good) software.  Communication with the rest of the areas. We are a cross-functional team and we interact with all the areas and intend to convey.  Participating in the improvement of the strategic plan and adding ideas to the backlog is part of your responsibility. We have a complex and challenging product which requires witty solutions. We work a lot with Product teams in order to create a data-based product long-term vision.  Growth and development of analytical team  Interaction with other DS teams      Who you are  The essentials:      Very fluent handling of DS stack in Python. You’re eager to learn new technologies.  Statistical knowledge, especially in complex scenarios like estimations with censored data, non-random sampling or rare event sampling. We like to understand what’s happening under the framework.  Good Python: if you believe design and style is much more than aesthetics, this is your place  Teamwork and ability to communicate: we’re not rockstars, we work with a lot of people, we understand them and we make ourselves understood.  Intellectual curiosity oriented to solving complex problems and not completely defined.      Nice to have:      Experience with risk scoring and fraud, knowledge about the financial industry.  Experience with bayesian modelling, sequential decision making and reinforcement learning.  A/B testing for online products.  Knowledge of recommendation systems with various sources, especially historical (Collaborative Filtering) and descriptions ( NLP + Content-Based)      Other relevant aspects:      Knowledge of architecture and engineering, especially AWS and containers management using Kubernetes.  Knowledge of MLOps lifecycles using Kubeflow, MLFlow...  Experience developing web services.      What we offer      Competitive fixed salary plus 20% annual bonus based on individual and collective objectives.  Flexible working model.  Shorter working days on Fridays and summer (from June to September!).  1.000 € annual budget for training and books  Restaurant tickets upon your salary.  24 labour days paid annual leave.  Other benefits (life insurance, pension plan...).  You’ll work with a team full of stars to learn from and have fun as you grow professionally. We’re humble but ambitious. We’ll love to help you develop. You’ll decide where your limits are.  An environment full of confidence and open communication. We are very horizontal. Everyone is welcome to contribute with ideas or experiences in any area.  Culture of feedback and learning. We try not to make mistakes, but they are an excellent learning source      What else?  If you believe you’re the right person for this position, we’d love to hear from you. If your proposal sounds interesting, we’ll contact you to have an initial interview so we can get to know each other

title: Business Intelligence Engineer
skills: Skills: Панель управления, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Embark on a journey of data-driven innovation with Nordnet, as we endeavour to redefine the landscape of savings and investments. We are currently seeking a talented and passionate Business Intelligence Engineer to join our team.    In brief    We believe that our future success will be based on our ability to leverage the large amounts of data generated on our platform every day. We need the ability to gain fast insights from usage of our services to enable short cycles of product refinement and be able to create services based on all our data.   Since 2020 we have been progressively transitioning our backend services to the Google Cloud Platform (GCP). The move signifies the creation of our next-generation data and analytics environment, offering you an opportunity to exercise your data expertise to the fullest and contribute in shaping the future of financial services by helping the organisation leveraging our data.   The role is part of a team consisting of data engineering, business intelligence and data science competence responsible for the new environment, spanning from data pipelines to dashboards to machine learning models.   As a Business Intelligence Engineer your main focus will be to participate in designing and implementing data transformation pipelines as well as building and maintaining dashboards for stakeholders throughout the whole organisation.   The majority of the work will be done in Looker and DBT/Big Query as part of the GCP infrastructure but you will also initially be exposed to our old Qlikview platform that we are gradually moving away from.    This is you    You are passionate about data and learning new things, and you want to contribute with your experience and passion. In your work, you are organized, methodical and agile in a way that benefits the team’s working climate and ability to deliver high quality solutions.    As a Business Intelligence Engineer we believe that most of the following characteristics describes you:      Experience working with business intelligence development & dashboarding, preferably in Looker and QlikView  Great SQL skills, preferably from BigQuery  Experience with data transformation tools such as dbt and/or Dataform  Experience from working with version control software  Experience in finance is a plus  Are a problem solver – if you need an answer, you will find it  Hold a BA degree or equivalent in engineering, computational or technical subject       We offer    Nordnet started from a passionate belief that changing the hierarchical financial world was possible. We became part of redefining the industry when we gave the customers power over their own savings. You will become part of a journey that has only yet started towards the vision of making our customers the best investors they can be. To be leading in IT is pivotal for that journey and you will work with colleagues who have a great passion for that goal.   We are 800 employees in Stockholm, Oslo, Helsinki and Copenhagen. We cooperate, exchange ideas and use our core competencies in order to continuously improve the way we meet our customers. Open communication, creativity and engagement are important parts of our everyday life at the office.   Visit us on www.nordnetab.com,www.nordnet.se ,    www.nordnet.no ,  www.nordnet.dk  and  www.nordnet.fi.    Application    We will start interviewing immediately. Please note that we do only accept applications through our recruitment system, hence no email applications will be considered.   If you have questions, please contact Talent Acquisition Partner Joachim Öberg, joachim.oberg@nordnet.se.   We want to inform you that Nordnet conducts credit and background checks on the final candidate.   We look forward to receiving your application!
