title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Analyst
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Attention to Detail, +1 more
job_description: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.  As an Analyst within our Rapid Intelligence team, you will be responsible for utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.  A successful Analyst can distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends.    Duties And Responsibilities     Preparing daily and weekly news reports to send out to domestic and international clients   Writing and editing content for daily and weekly news reports   Summarising international media coverage into a digestible format   Researching international print and online media   Selecting relevant content for client-specific news reports      Essential Skills And Experience     An academic degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, Journalism, English, Business Administration, Social Sciences or similar; or equivalent industry experience [2+ years]   Proven editorial and research skills – as part of a university project or examples of workplace experience   Excellent written English with an in-depth understanding of grammar   Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis   Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams   Basic computer skills and knowledge of MS Office   Capable of working under time pressure   Able to adhere to tight and variable deadlines   Reliable and well-organized worker with attention to detail   A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business     What We Offer     25 vacation days  Health insurance + dental care  Sodexo vouchers  Option for an annual public transport card for the whole transport network  Option for a Multisport card (employee covers only half the price)  A variety of flexible benefits through Re:benefit platform using a monthly budget  Excellent hardware bundle  Informal, friendly, welcoming environment focused on people, learning & development    This position is open to REMOTE or HYBRID workers - Working hours - Monday to Friday    06.00    am to 15,00 pm.    If this sounds like you and you feel you have what it takes to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you!    Your application will be treated with strict confidentiality and in compliance with the legal requirements for personal data protection.   As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.  Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .  Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.  Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com  Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Data Scientist
company_name: Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air (CREA)
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Learning, +8 more
job_description: CREA ( Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air ) is seeking a Data Engineer / Data Scientist to support our  Russia Fossil Tracker  project and other related initiatives. The project led by CREA aims to shed light on energy exports from Russia and how they changed after the invasion of Ukraine. We achieve this by tracking ship movements and pipeline flows in as much detail as possible.     Join our dynamic team in a flexible, supportive environment and contribute to our mission of halting the Russian war campaign as soon as possible. This role reports to the Data Lead.    Responsibilities As part of our data team, you will:   Manage the entire Russia project data infrastructure, including Flask API, Postgres, Google Cloud Platform, and R  Cater to the Russia team's needs for datasets and visualisations  Assist data analysts with APIs and internal dashboards  Respond to data inquiries from journalists        Candidate Profile We are seeking a candidate with a passion for data science (e.g. modelling, insights extraction) and a solid foundation in data engineering (e.g. online infrastructure, databases, APIs).    Technical Requirements  Proficiency in deploying and maintaining applications and databases on cloud infrastructure, specifically Google Cloud  Advanced knowledge of Python, Postgres, and ideally R  Familiarity with Unix command line and git  Ability to generate high-quality data visualisation     Personal Attributes  A continuous learner with a strong desire to grow  Detail-oriented, organised, and takes pride in well-documented, clean code  Diligent in handling data and constantly striving for data validation  A team player who takes suggestions constructively  Strong alignment with our organisational and project mission and values   Please note that candidates are NOT required to possess experience in international trade or the fossil fuel industry.       What we can offer you  Employment contract or Services Agreement (i.e. company to company)  A remote & time-flexible working environment  Remuneration based on skills & experience, competitive with standard pay  A meaningful and potentially very impactful mission  Health insurance  Membership in a co-working space        Deadline Applications are checked  on a rolling basis , the role will remain open until a suitable applicant is found. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible. If you are interested in the position but aren't sure whether you're a good fit or not, you should apply nonetheless.       About CREA We are an independent research organisation focused on revealing the trends, causes, and health impacts, as well as the solutions to air pollution. We use scientific data, research and evidence to support the efforts of governments, companies and campaigning organisations worldwide in their efforts to move towards clean energy and clean air. We believe that effective research and communication are the keys to successful policies, investment decisions and advocacy efforts. Our data and insights are regularly picked up by major media outlets (e.g. Financial Times, The Economist, BBC) and used by policymakers and organisations in dozens of countries.     CREA is a fully remote organisation, with current team members based in Europe and Asia.

job_description: Early in your finance career and always wanted to work for iconic brands in a fast moving international environment? Keep reading!     We are looking for a Junior Finance Analyst reporting directly into the Supply Chain Finance Manager.       Main accountabilities     Month end Supply chain closing process     Prepare month-end journals (transport, interco margin eliminations, correct cost allocation to commercial markets etc.)  Provide reporting to Group Finance on Capex, SCM, PPV etc. on a monthly basis       Supply Chain Finance Planning Process    Support in budgeting and forecasting processes  Prepare & own the COBO intercompany & copacker files (OSF, SSE, LRS etc.)        Pricing and Costing process     Support & ensure each day on-time pricing and costing of SKUs for all flows as per SBFE transfer pricing rules  Be the owner of the K2 pricing tool to put the pricing in SAP (for interco / commercial markets)   Set up training to key end users on the key pricing processes       Supply Chain Business Partner on     Costing and pricing new products / countries launches  Capex reporting, RAM tracking, internal order management & follow up  Ad-hoc analysis to support on analyzing cost evolution (ingredients, manufacturing, packaging etc.)        Background and competences     Bachelor degree in Economics or Finance.  1-2 years experience in a Supply Chain/industrial Controlling or Accounting function.  Must need previous experience with an ERP system (SAP) / BI / HFM / K2  Excellent command of the English language (Spanish would be a plus)  Excellent communication skills. Ability to adjust communication style to different levels of management.  Able to learn quickly and to adapt to a changing environment.

Fluency in Italian and English Experience with SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Analytics Cloud, Qlik, Datawarehouse Experience in Digital Transformation Projects Capabilities of Project management Knowledge of Human Resources processes Ability to manage technical details together with business analysis Continuous improvement mindset with the agility to shift priorities as the needs of the business evolve Excellent organizational skills Problem solving, flexibility and proactivity Curiosity and ability to take any day by day opportunity as a challenge to bring your additional value Digital and Data Driven Mindset Communication and presentation abilities

title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (all genders)
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Цифровой маркетинг, +6 more
job_description: Who We Are   For 25 years, Native Instruments has been at the heart of musical innovation. We’ve created communities, pushed technological boundaries, and opened new creative horizons for amateurs and professionals alike. Guided by our mission to make music creation more inclusive and accessible, Native hardware, software, and digital services provide fully-integrated solutions for musicians, producers, and DJs of all genres and levels of experience.  Native Instruments is part of Soundwide , whose mission is to make music and audio creation a more joyful and inspiring experience for creators everywhere by helping them to find, and stay in, their creative flow. Soundwide’s collective vision is to inspire and empower creators to express themselves and reimagine the future of sound.        Our  Commercial Data Insights  team designs, builds and maintains data models, reports and dashboards for stakeholders throughout our organization. We manage, evaluate and mine vast volumes of web, sales, customer and usage data for information and insights to enable data-informed business choices. Our data team collaborates with all level contributors in  Marketing  and  Product Creation  on stimulating projects, transforming Soundwide into an insights driven organization where analysis, data and reasoning are embedded in all decisions - large and small.          What You'll Do       Evaluate user experience, engagement and purchasing data across our digital touchpoints to provide insights and actionable advice for marketing purposes;  Collaborating with our Digital Marketing Managers, you will develop insightful reports & dashboards to evaluate and optimize campaign performance;  Turn business questions into clear analysis problems and search for answers by assessing historical information, collecting new data and conducting experiments;  You will collaborate with data engineers, data scientists and digital marketing managers at different levels of seniority to implement a data strategy, expand our data-driven marketing campaigns and increase the data literacy throughout our organization;   Build relationships and connect with a range of internal stakeholders to create and refine the tools and processes needed to support the commercial growth of our e-commerce business.          What You'll Need       You bring previous experience within relevant Data Analytics roles, having worked with digital marketing stakeholders within your career;  Your demonstrated experience in leveraging analytics and systematic experimentation to improve e-commerce KPIs for customer acquisition and engagement;  A profound knowledge of SQL is a must, any additional knowledge of Python or R is a plus;  A solid understanding of descriptive statistics and exploratory data analysis;  A strong investigative mindset and your demonstrated ability to collaborate with stakeholders and translate requests into requirements;  Hands-on experience in data-driven performance optimisation in one or more of these areas: email and digital ad campaigns, attribution modeling, conversion rate optimization;  Experience with modern data analytics tools and platforms, especially the Google stack: Google Analytics / Tag Manager / Ads, BigQuery, Data Studio;  Your strong sense of ownership, and your ability to achieve high-quality results based on imperfect data;  You are fluent in English with strong verbal and visual communication skills in order to present your findings to diverse audience groups.          About Us    Native Instruments is a Soundwide company; together we embrace diversity and a respect for all people.  We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we believe the foundation of our dynamic and pioneering spirit starts with a fair and inclusive culture. At Soundwide we strive to embrace teamwork and passion, deliver inspiring experiences, continuously innovate and empower our communities, while also serving our planet.        All applicants will receive equal consideration for employment at Native Instruments and we encourage everyone to apply – regardless of gender identity, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.        Help us reach our goal in making the future of music diverse, inclusive and exciting! We encourage you to submit your application without the requirement for a photograph, identifying factors or personal status information.

title: Data Engineer

job_description: Data Engineer     Location: Zagreb      FOREO is developing a state of the art, end to end data platform to support business decision making for everyone, from interns to CEO. And is looking for an experienced Data engineer to bring on the expertise and eagerness to develop high end solutions for business.      What better environment to develop into a data engineering guru than a global, data centric company with highly engaged business users and a data team with great culture and people to learn from? Did we mention we don’t do boring meetings?     Love cutting edge technology? Modern data architecture, Python for ingestion code, Prefect for orchestration, dbt for data transformation, Redshift for processing, Tableau for analysis, you name it. What will become mainstream in a few years, we have now.     Join our expert Data Team at FOREO, a wildly innovative brand of 3000+ revolutionaries who opt for bold instead of boring every time.         REQUIREMENTS       1-3 years of experience in a similar role  Working knowledge of Python, SQL and Git  Passion for data and technology   Demonstrated ability to write clear code that is well-documented and stored in a version control system   Demonstrated ability to learn new techniques and troubleshoot code with minimum support  Data analytics background is an advantage  Well organized  Unquestionable dedication and hunger to learn and grow  Critical thinking   High level of English (speaking and writing)          KEY RESPONSIBILITIES       Create data ingestion and transformation pipelines  Implement data quality controls  Deliver top quality data products: rich, analysis ready data sources and highly interactive dashboards providing actionable insights  Maintain high level of software engineering practices  Stay up to date with new developments in data analytics  Support business users with data interpretation, analytical methods and tools  Work with data consumers to define, analyze, structure and document business requirements  Work with different sources of data, maintain API connections  Document all phases of work including prerequisites for data collection, database diagrams, target mapping sources, and other program technical specifications using current default design standards for new or revised solutions       WHY FOREO?    You will work for a global beauty and wellbeing brand that is the fastest growing in its industry  You will be encouraged to bring fresh ideas to the table and experiment daily  You will become part of a highly skilled and experienced international team  You will participate in global and local campaigns and be able to influence their success  You will profit from a creative, knowledge-sharing, and stimulating environment  You will have the possibility to grow and have the opportunity to take the most optimal roles and responsibilities in a fast-growing environment      If we raised your interest and you think you might be a perfect match for our company, send your CV in English. title: Business Analyst

job_description: Over deze functie   You will work at Brunel Global IT (GIT), which is responsible for all business-critical applications worldwide. This department consists of 4 agile teams that, based on Devops, design and develop the right functionality and applications for our international regions and manage them together with our partners.  Within these teams we work together with modern technology and IT partners, and we continue to innovate to provide our business with the best IT systems. You will report directly to the GIT applications manager.  As a Business Analyst at Brunel GIT means that you will be working in an international environment, employed by Brunel. And that has many advantages. At Brunel GIT, your career comes first.We offer you various training opportunities to accelerate your career.  Your tasks and responsibilities:    Inventory of customer’s needs, specifying requirements and translating into user stories;  Drawing up additional functional specifications that fit within the set of architectural frameworks;  Assessing functional and technical designs;  Making impact analysis of changes to business processes, related information systems and advising on this;  First point of contact for the Agile development teamsWorking together with the Product Owner having an opinion about the business value of changes.     Over jou     Bachelor's or master's degree in business administration, IT or similar;  Excellent Dutch and/or English communication and writing skills;  Demonstrable work experience in an agile/scrum, SAFe environment;  Experience in working with AzureDevops, Jira is a plus; Experience in keeping different stakeholders involved;  Demonstrable experience with process, business, information and/or system analysis;  Able to retrieve and describe requirements and translate them into user stories/use cases;  Knowledge and experience with modeling and techniques such as UML and BPMN;  Training/certifications in the field of business/information analysis and architecture (eg IREB, BABOK, UML, BPMN, TOGAF) are a plus.  You are an excellent communicator, and you are experienced in stake holder management; You can explain complex things easily. You are stress resistant and confident;  You are comfortable in dealing with a wide scope of tasks, can monitor overview and set priorities.  The salary depends on work experience and education and is between EUR 4000 and EUR 6250 (based on a 40-hour working week);  Profit-sharing scheme;  Ability to work 32 to 40 hours per week;  You can assume that you will receive a good pension scheme, group health insurance and travel expenses scheme. In addition, you get 26 vacation days and the option to buy up to 40 vacation days;  Good travel allowance scheme, smartphone and surface (which you can also use privately) that are suitable for the position;  Hybrid working policy with partly flexible hours so that you can, for example; exercise, travel less in traffic jams or being flexible for the children;  Brunel can provide a fully equipped home workplace. Various green employment conditions such as a lease bicycle and company fruit;  Through the Brunel Academy, you have every opportunity to continue to develop yourself, both professionally and personally;  Discount on gyms and cultural activities with an extensive vitality offer;  Because not everyone finds the same things important, you also benefit from a flexible employment conditions package, specifically aimed at your situation. For example, you can decide for yourself whether you want to purchase extra vacation days.     Over ons   In 1975, from a small office in The Netherlands, graduate engineer Jan Brand found a temporary job for a fellow engineer. This first placement was the beginning of an era and developed into a powerful global network, connecting the most talented and experienced specialists with both present-day and pioneering projects. With 120+ offices, in 40+ countries and more than 12,000 specialists around the world, we deliver people and workforce services that transform global projects in Life Sciences, Oil and Gas, Infrastructure, Future Mobility, Mining and Renewable Energy.>

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

title: Business Specialist
skills: Skills: SAP, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Vi udvikler den næste generation af IT-løsninger, der hver dag hjælper det offentlige Danmark. Kunderne griber de nye muligheder indenfor vagtplaner, sikkerhed og IT-infrastruktur, og det går hurtigere end forventet. Derfor har vi brug for flere hænder, der vil være med til at udvikle nye digitale løsninger til vores kunder – til gavn for borgerne og samfundsøkonomien. Er det dig vi leder efter?       Om jobbet    Vi synes, at vi har markedets bedste vagtplanløsning til det kommunale og regionale marked. Vi er stolte af at have styr på detaljerne, så vores brugere ikke behøver at have det. Derfor er din opgave at bygge bro mellem kundebehov, forretning og teknologi og på den måde sikre, at vi på bedst mulig måde understøtter krav og forventninger fra vores kunder. Du vil få mulighed for at sætte dit eget fingeraftryk på videreudviklingen af de eksisterende løsninger samt på udviklingen af helt nye produkter på området.     Åbenhed og ærlighed er nøgleord for den daglige kommunikation i det team, du bliver en del af. Vi gør hinanden bedre, og vi deler viden for at skabe de bedste løsninger i fællesskab. Du bliver en del af et skarpt hold, hvor faglighed og viljen til at lykkes er centralt. Desuden tror vi på, at man godt kan være ambitiøs og have en spændende karriere, samtidig med at man har en ordentlig work-life balance.     Du vil få mange gode kollegaer i form af andre forretningsspecialister, salgskonsulenter, produktarkitekter, produktmanagere, udviklere, implementeringskonsulenter, supportkonsulenter og product owners m.fl. Dine nære kollegaer er primært lokaliseret i Aalborg, men enkelte sidder også i Ballerup og Aarhus. Vi har herudover et fast udviklingshold i Polen, som området har et rigtigt godt og tæt samarbejde med.     Dit arbejde i teamet vil være præget af opgaver som:   Beslutte, hvordan ting skal løses på ved at omsætte behov og ønsker fra kunder og brugere til krav og løsningsbeskrivelser til udviklere  Deltagelse i kundemøder og på andre måder møde vores kunder og brugere og oparbejde en god forståelse af deres daglige arbejde og udfordringer  Løbende sparring med udviklingsteams ifm. både afklaringer, udvikling og test  Behandling af sager fra kunder - herunder fejlsøgning/analyse af løsningsmuligheder og beskrivelse til udvikling  Udarbejde og udføre test  Deltage i prioriteringen af opgaver og sager  Samarbejde med både polske og indiske udviklingsteams.       Om dig    Du er lige den vi leder efter, hvis du er typen der ikke lader dig begrænse, men ser muligheder, hvor andre ser problemer. Du har stærkt digitalt mindset og kan se gevinsten ved digitalisering og effektivisering. Du ved, at du har en stjernespiller i dig, men trives med at være en del af et team, hvor samarbejde med andre er en selvfølgelighed. Du forstår at alle har og tager ansvar for at bidrage til arbejdskulturen i både teamet og afdelingen, på lige fod med dit faglige bidrag.     For at få en succes i rollen, er det vigtigt at du:   Arbejder kunde- og brugerorienteret og evner at omsætte behov og komplekse problemstillinger til konkrete og håndterbare leverancer og værdiskabende løsninger. Vi er til for vores kunder, hvorfor fokus på kundetilfredshed og det at lytte til og forstå kundernes behov er naturligt for dig.  Har analytiske evner, mod på at sætte dig ind i et komplekst område og kan arbejde systematisk og grundigt med opgaverne.  Du kan fortolke komplekse data, træffe beslutninger og kommunikere din analyse klart på skrift og tale - både på dansk og engelsk.  Kan arbejde både selvstændigt og indgå i teamsamarbejde både lokalt og på distancen med polske/indiske udviklingsteams, og ved hvornår du skal søge hjælp.      Det vil være en fordel, hvis:   Du kender noget til enten løn, SAP eller vagtplanlægning  Har erfaringen indenfor fagområdet ’vagtplanlægning i det offentlige’  Har kendskab til overenskomster og arbejdstidsaftaler i det offentlige  Har erfaring med selv at undersøge data via SQL/har systemteknisk viden i din baggrund.      Vi kan tilbyde dig at blive en del af et team og et forretningsområde, hvor der er en uhøjtidelig omgangstone. Vi har gode sociale relationer og tillægger faglig sparring stor værdi. Vi hjælper og støtter hinanden, og vi prioriterer sjov og hygge i hverdagen.      Om KMD   KMD er den største danske it-virksomhed, der udvikler og leverer software- og serviceløsninger til kommune, stats- og erhvervssegmentet i Danmark samt udvalgte segmenter i Skandinavien. KMD har over 1.500 danske og internationale kunder. KMD-koncernen har en årlig omsætning på godt 4,8 mia. kr. og har cirka 2.600 ansatte. KMD er et datterselskab i den globale teknologikoncern NEC Corporation, der globalt beskæftiger mere end 100.000 medarbejdere.      Vil du vide mere?    Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at ringe eller skrive til Sine D. Gregersen, Development and Delivery Manager, sdg@kmd.dk, mobil: 20693749.  Vi afholder løbende samtaler med egnede kandidater, og derfor opfordres du til at sende din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.      KMD (an NEC company) is committed to provide equal opportunities. Hence, we invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. At KMD all aspects of employment and cooperation including the decision to hire /cooperate with will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or any other status protected under local anti-discrimination legislation.

title: Montblanc - Business Analyst H/Ft
skills: Skills: Business Reviews, Работа с ключевыми клиентами, +8 more
job_description: Description :     Montblanc, Maison fondée en 1906, a bâti sa réputation sur le marché de l’Instrument d’Ecriture de luxe dont il est le leader mondial. La Maison a diversifié son portefeuille d’activités dans les secteurs de la Maroquinerie, de la Haute Horlogerie et des Accessoires qui représentent aujourd’hui plus de la moitié de son chiffre d’affaire. Montblanc aspire à devenir le leader du marché « Luxury Business Lifestyle ».   Le marché Français est un marché clé pour la Maison tant du point de vue de l’image que du chiffre d’affaire.   Le Business Analyst qui reportera directement au Directeur Commercial aura la responsabilité de fournir les outils analytiques nécessaires au pilotage du chiffre d’affaires, du développement du réseau (Boutiques externes, Grands magasins, Revendeurs Multimarques) et des activités commerciales.   A ce titre le Business Analyste est un véritable pilier du département commercial Wholesale. Dans le cadre de vos missions vous aurez l’opportunité d’explorer de nombreux domaines d’activité de la marque (Commerciaux, Marketing, Logistiques etc..) qui vous permettront d’évoluer par la suite vers des positions stratégiques au sein de Montblanc ou d’une des Maisons du groupe Richemont à l’international.   Au-delà de l’expertise analytique demandée, le candidat doit faire preuve de curiosité, rigueur, initiative et d’esprit d’équipe.   Ci-dessous, le retour sur expérience de Louis, Business Analyste Montblanc durant 3 ans, aujourd’hui Responsable Strategic Planning pour Richemont : « En trois ans j’ai découvert : une équipe soudée et pédagogue, des missions variées et intéressantes, des challenges et de l’exposition. Mais surtout un manager qui a pris le temps de me former et me faire évoluer. Ce poste en filiale au contact de nos clients mais également du Dr. Commercial et Dr. Générale est une base solide qui me permet aujourd’hui de me projeter dans le Groupe Richemont . »     Périmètre de responsabilité :       Plan Stratégique et Revue Budgétaire : Réalisation des présentations stratégiques, budgétaires et des Business Review mensuelles en lien avec le Directeur Générale et le Directeur Wholesale. Construction du chiffre potentiel mensuellement, trimestriellement et annuellement.         Digitalisation des données de ventes et des process de prise de commande. Cela consiste en partie à collecter, analyser et transférer les données de Stock et Sell-out de nos principaux partenaires ainsi qu’à accompagner les équipes de ventes dans la digitalisation des process de commandes. A ce titre vous serez l’interlocuteur privilégier de la filiale vis-à-vis du siège sur ces problématiques.         Key Accounts Management : Préparations des éléments nécessaires aux négociations commerciales et réunions de suivi de la performance de la marque auprès des grands comptes. Le Key Account Manager pourra aussi participer ponctuellement à des réunions avec des clients.         Salons Commerciaux : Préparation des objectifs liés aux événements commerciaux annuels tels que Watch and Wonders, Brand Essential Moments (Showroom en janvier et juin) etc.. Définitions des objectifs et développement des analyses de ventes nécessaires au pilotage des achats.         Transformation : Implantation de JOOR 2.0 et accompagnement des clients et de l’équipe de ventes. Mise en place de Gemini et mise à plat complete des outils d’analyse de TIGER à Gemini.         Merchandising & Bon de commande : Suivi des références actives, des reliquats (commandes en attente de livraison). Définition d’assortiments pour les boutiques externes visant à améliorer la performance des points de ventes.    Analyses Ad-Hoc : En fonction du besoin, des analyses diverses et complémentaires vous seront demandées : analyse de marge, évolution du réseau, performance produit etc..         Profil Recherch    é :        Ecole d’ingénieur ou école de commerce.    Fort esprit analytique, d’initiative et autonomie.    Utilisation de Power Point et Excel très avancée (tableu croisées dynamique, macros…). Une première expérience avec SAP serait un plus.    Français et Anglais courant (écrit – parlé) exigés.

title: Online Data Analyst (m,f,d)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Data Analytics, +2 more
job_description: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions arbeitet mit einer vielfältigen und lebendigen Community zusammen, um unsere Kunden bei der Verbesserung ihrer KI- und maschinellen Lernmodelle zu unterstützen. Die Arbeit unserer KI-Community trägt zur Verbesserung der Technologie und der digitalen Erfahrungen vieler Menschen auf der ganzen Welt bei. Unsere KI-Community arbeitet in unserer proprietären KI-Trainingsplattform und verarbeitet alle Datentypen (Text, Bilder, Audio, Video und Geo) in über 500 Sprachen und Dialekten. Wir bieten flexible Arbeitsmöglichkeiten von zu Hause aus für Menschen mit einer Leidenschaft für Sprachen. Es handelt sich um Teilzeitjobs ohne festen Zeitplan. Wer auch immer Sie sind, wo auch immer Sie herkommen, werden Sie Teil unserer globalen KI-Gemeinschaft. www.telusinternational.com         Wir suchen freiberufliche deutschsprachige Online-Datenanalysten für ein Projekt zur Verbesserung des Inhalts und der Qualität digitaler Karten, die von Millionen von Nutzern weltweit verwendet werden. Die Stelle würde zu jemandem passen, der  detailorientiert  ist, gerne  recherchiert  und über gute Kenntnisse der nationalen und lokalen  Geografie  verfügt.        Es handelt sich um eine freiberufliche Stelle mit einem flexiblen Zeitplan - Sie können in Ihrer eigenen Zeit arbeiten, wann immer Arbeit verfügbar ist. Sie werden Recherche- und Bewertungsaufgaben in einer webbasierten Umgebung durchführen, z. B. Daten überprüfen und vergleichen, die Relevanz und Genauigkeit von Informationen bestimmen. Für jede Aufgabe erhalten Sie einen Leitfaden, den Sie befolgen müssen. Das Projekt bietet eine Vielzahl von Aufgaben, und die Arbeit wird pro Aufgabe bezahlt.         Anforderungen    Fließende Englisch- und  Deutschkenntnisse   Sie müssen seit mindestens2 aufeinander folgenden Jahren in  Deutschland  leben  Sie müssen in der Lage sein,  Richtlinien  zu befolgen und  Online-Recherchen  mit Hilfe von Suchmaschinen, Online-Karten und Website-Informationen durchzuführen  Sie müssen mit aktuellen und historischen Themen aus Wirtschaft, Medien, Sport, Nachrichten, sozialen Medien und Kultur in  Deutschland  vertraut sein  Offenheit für die Arbeit in verschiedenen Aufgabentypen (z. B. Karten, Nachrichten, Audioaufgaben, Relevanz)  Die Bewerber müssen 18 Jahre oder älter sein.          Die Mitarbeit an diesem Projekt setzt voraus, dass Sie das übliche Einstellungsverfahren durchlaufen (einschließlich des Bestehens eines Open-Book-Assessments). Es handelt sich um ein langfristiges Projekt, und Ihre Arbeit wird gelegentlich durchQualitätssicherungskontrollen überprüft.          Warum sollten Sie der TELUS International AI Community beitreten?     Verdienen Sie zusätzliches Einkommen  Zugang zu unserer Community-Wellness-Initiative   Remote & Standortunabhängigkeit  Seien Sie Ihr eigener Chef  Flexible Arbeitszeiten, die sich mit Ihrem Lebensstil vereinbaren lassen   Teil einer Online-Community sein         If you have any other queries, please contact our team at sourcingteam100@telusinternational.ai

title: Jr. Data Scientist
skills: Skills: SQL, C++, +6 more
job_description: DAIKIN is evolving from an air conditioning provider to a true total solution provider in the HVAC world with, in addition to the range of residential and commercial applications, industrial applications, retail and hotel solutions. As a result, the EMEA Electrics and Control department, located in Ghent- Technology Park, is one of the fastest growing departments and is part of the EMEA Development Center of Daikin. This department is responsible for development and improvement of controls (room, unit, app & cloud controls, electronics, software, cloud applications and controls with the subsequent generated data.     When you join Daikin, you are joining a team which is developing a new approach to how business generates value from data. You will be closely working with leading academics and industry specialist’s (PHD Engineer’s) where the focus is on developing new methodologies and tools to enable advanced modelling and statistical analysis against large and complex data sets.       In this role you -        Drive innovation using data science techniques   You are comfortable working with large-scale and complex data sets   Look for order and patterns in data, as well as spot trends that can help a business’s bottom line   You can extract knowledge and insights from structured & unstructured data and apply actionable insights from data across a broad range of application domains   You would be at ease performing a wide range of tasks – from data aggregation and summarization to building ML models to developing new techniques and algorithms  Staying on top of analytical techniques such as machine learning, deep learning and text analytics. With the help of Data Visualization tools, you can identify areas that needs attention or improvement   Spot new technical features and business opportunities that can benefit of the data (e.g. Predictive Maintenance, data monetarization, control algorithms, etc.) is a huge plus   Ability to work within a multidisciplinary team and understand the working principles of our devices and derive new services for the end users  Data Compliance: You have the experience with regulations and business processes in enterprises. (GDPR etc.)        Profile:     Master’s/PhD degree in computer science with a machine learning focus /post-Graduation in a quantitative field (applied mathematics, statistics, physics, operations research, or similar STEM fields)  Strong Programming skills: Demonstrated experience using Python, R or other statistical/ML software  Possess 1-3 years of relevant experience of statistical and machine learning methods, particularly in the areas of modelling and business analytics  Experience with statistical languages and packages, such as R, SAS, Mat-Lab, and/or Mahout  Experience with additional programming languages, such as Python, Java, and C/C++   Having a solid grasp of statistics, including statistical tests and distributions  Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI a plus        Personal Attributes:     Intellectual curiosity, critical thinking, a healthy scepticism, problem-solving abilities and creativity   Strong Data intuition: Talent to identify and visualize patterns   Strong communication skills: Effectively communicate his/her technical work in non-technical terms to management   Self-Starter      Daikin Europe is a subsidiary of Daikin Industries Ltd. and the leading provider of heating, cooling, ventilation, air purification, and refrigeration technology. The company designs, manufactures and brings to market a broad portfolio of equipment, as well as tailor-made solutions for residential, commercial, and industrial purposes in Europe, Middle East, and Africa (EMEA). To date, Daikin EMEA has over 12 000 employees across more than 59 consolidated subsidiaries. It has 12 major manufacturing facilities based in Belgium, the Czech Republic, Germany, Italy, Spain, Turkey, Austria, and the UK. Our aim is to drive sustainable and effective solutions, sparking a good climate for the generations to come. And all this can only be achieved because of our People.      We believe our employees are the beating heart of our company and that top-quality solutions are delivered by talented individuals in a good working environment. As a result, we live in a unique environment based on our people-centered approach, where we value each person's uniqueness and where we truly believe in people's unlimited potential.  We believe: Good climate starts with people.

title: Data Analyst - Milano
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Ключевые показатели деятельности, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?   Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo di diventare il guru dei nostri dati.   Per te abbiamo una posizione come Data Analyst in un settore, il field marketing, dove la tua competenza può davvero fare la differenza.  Potrai mettere in luce le tue capacità di analisi e interpretazione del dato al servizio di tanti brand diversi. Annoiarsi? Impossibile. Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Perché in CPM Italy siamo convinti che i tuoi risultati passino anche attraverso la qualità della tua vita.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?   Il tuo ruolo riguarda l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati riguardanti la vendita, il posizionamento e la valutazione di campagne promo e di comunicazione in store dei brand delle nostre aziende clienti. Come?   realizzando report su misura;  utilizzando indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  sviluppando e gestendo un avanzato sistema di business intelligence e dashboard online;  collaborando con i colleghi del team.   Sei tu la persona giusta?  Per entrare nel nostro reparto di Data Analyst è richiesta un’esperienza di almeno 1 anno in questo ruolo. Essere positivi, proattivi e precisi è un ottimo requisito ma i veri must sono la passione per i numeri e la voglia di partecipare sempre a nuove sfide.  In più è fantastico se…   ti piace trasformare dati in informazioni;  excel è il tuo pane quotidiano;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team;  sei flessibile sia come orari che di mentalità!   Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999 n.68, Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

job_description: Purpose of Position   The Business Insights Analyst combines analytical expertise and aptitude with adaptability, practicality, and a strong ability to communicate. The purpose is to deliver exceptional analytical insights and solutions to challenges throughout NetJets.  This role is responsible for gathering, managing and consolidating accurate information to provide to the business within the diverse areas that belong to the Business Insights & Analytics department, executing analysis measuring the business performance to provide actionable and value-add insights, support decision-making and business planning.  This role will help define solutions and support change adoption to improve forecasting performance, cross functional communication, and integrated planning.   Tasks And Responsibilities    Provide support to the Executive Leadership Team on strategic planning and decision-making processes of a wide range of topics contributing to the company’s profitability;  Develop and implement company dashboard reports, analytical modelling and visualizations to facilitate the monitoring of the business, allowing to quickly identify and act on issues and seize opportunities;  Assist to identify key business indicators to enhance the understanding of key business stakeholders of business needs by the distribution and creation of reporting, analysis, visualization, dashboards, whilst proposing solutions to business concerns;  Create timely, relevant, and accurate analyses of operational and business data and processes at the level of fidelity required for the diverse areas of the business;  Provide expertise in statistics, data visualization, machine learning, mathematical optimization, simulation, or another analytical specialty;  Learn new tools and techniques as needed to produce the best possible results;  Perform analysis of both strategic and tactical business and operational questions while working independently, pragmatically, and with reliance on creative analytical curiosity;  Collaborate with business partners to analytically explore business and operational problems;   Explore, gather, understand, and act to resolve operational issues through increasing business acumen;   Simplify complex analytical models/insights/solutions in presentations for Executive Leadership Team;  Author memos or presentations summarizing/explaining insights effectively and delivers work directly to the Executive Leadership Team;  Provide special analytical projects and prepares detailed, comprehensive presentations supporting corporate initiatives;  Collaborate with, mentors, develops, and supports other analysts;  Practice active listening and seeks feedback routinely to build business partner relationships and to foster trust in analytical insights and the recommendations of decision support tools and analyses.      Education   Bachelor's in Computer Science or Mathematics   Certifications and Licenses    Years Of Experience   2-4 years of experience   Core Competencies   Adaptability  Collaboration  Curiosity  Service-Oriented  Strives For Positive Results   Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Other (KSAOs)    University degree in Computer Science, Management, Mathematics, Statistics or similar;  Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar role or related work experience (preferential in aviation industry);  Ability to demonstrate high level of business acumen and commercial attitude;  Analytical skills with demonstrated experience in creating data architectures and datasets, machine learning and algorithms, prescriptive and predictive modelling techniques, advanced statistical techniques (regression, statistical tests etc) and their various applications;  High Proficiency in MS Office (VBA preferably) and experience in an analytical platform such as SAS, Python, AWS, SQL, R, or CRM solutions (SalesForce), and visualization platform such as Tableau, Qlik, Power BI;  Exceptional creative problem-solving abilities;  Detail oriented and proven ability to prioritize multiple objectives in a dynamic environment with constantly shifting priorities;  Initiative, confidence, and the drive to achieve results without explicit direction or detailed instruction;  Fluency in Business English (written and spoken).

title: Senior Reporting and Data Specialist
skills: None
job_description: About Ansell   Ansell is a world leader in providing superior health and safety protection solutions that enhance human well-being. The world’s need for better protection never stops, so Ansell is constantly researching, developing and investing to manufacture and distribute cutting edge product innovation and technology, marketed under well-known brands that customers trust. Operating in two main business segments, Industrial and Healthcare, Ansell is the market leader that continues to grow, employing 14,000 people worldwide.   For more information about our Company, our People and our Values, please follow the link https://www.ansell.com    Sr Reporting & Data Specialist   Ansell is looking for a passionate, employee-focused Sr Reporting and Data Specialist based in Krakow to join its HR organization.   As a member of the global HR process & systems improvement team, the Sr Reporting and Data Specialist will be responsible for generating insights, that help HR to better understand the employees, increase engagement and drive experience. Furthermore, it includes the roll-out of a data framework, including the set-up of data glossary and data controls. Educating our data administrators along the way. This is a great opportunity for a growing professional to shape the HR data landscape at Ansell and have a real impact on our HR analytics capabilities. Depending on personal capabilities and interest, there are multiple projects this role could be a part of, or even lead in the future, to further shape HR @ Ansell.  If you have a proven track record in reporting & analytics, storytelling, and data governance you might be the colleague we are looking for!    What will your role be?   Working in collaboration with our HR and IT departments, and reporting to the Director HR Process & Systems Improvement, the Sr Reporting & Data Specialist will have the below responsibilities and accountabilities:      Reporting Development and Delivery       Facilitate requirements gathering workshops and meetings, and document outcomes   Define requirements and visualization needs for HR and manager dashboards   Test and deploy reporting solutions and enable its automatic generation in co-operation with IT team   Analyze & optimize monthly reports and dashboards   Regularly examine dashboards, reports and data flows to locate and resolve any mistakes throughout   Create and maintain documentation of the reporting solutions in terms of calculations method and terminology definition   Ensure access to data is provided to each user filtered to the population they support   Train the HRBP community to ensure they know how to use the reporting tool and understand how to interpret the data   To develop our reporting capabilities and perform deep dive analysis on our population bring the findings to actionable insights for HR       Data Governance      Build & maintain HR Data Glossary   Ensure data quality checks are in place to detect data incompleteness and guarantee data integrity   Support the HR administrator community with their data & reporting related questions   Train HR data administrators on the required field entries as defined per HR processes   Partner with HR IT team on the functional analysis for future HR software transitions       Change Management/Coaching       Create actionable insights by deploying storytelling techniques and in doing so be a part of creating a great place to work for all our Ansell employees   Engage with business owners and users to understand how data-driven changes and new process requests can improve efficiencies and add value   Coach HR administrators and HR BP community on data governance & data interpretation   Communicate effectively with D & C-level management to ensure alignment       What will you bring to Ansell?      Demonstrated knowledge and experience in reporting analysis/business analysis and data governance   Knowledge and proven experience with Oracle, PowerBI, Powerquery, VBA as reporting tools.   Proven record of working with HR Data (attrition, performance, headcount, etc.)   Know-how on translating data into actionable insights and bringing data to the business (storytelling)   Awareness of Agile way of working (incremental, listen to voice of customer,…)   Excellent communication, interpersonal, organisational and consulting skills   Experience with stakeholder management   Languages: Fluent in English (written and spoken), any other languages are a plus   Nice to have programming languages skills such a R, Phython, SQL but not a requirement        Why join Ansell?      Work for a world leader in the health and safety protection solutions industry   A secure workplace with competitive remuneration and annual bonus based on own and company performance   We provide cafeteria system, my benefit, multisport card, medical insurance   Flexible schedule with a combination of home and office-based working   Inclusive, collaborative, and supportive work atmosphere    A diverse culture and international working environment   Targeted training courses and programs to develop professional and interpersonal skills   Opportunities to develop and strengthen your career        This is an exciting time to join Ansell. Apply now!    Equal Opportunity Statement   Ansell commits to securing an equal opportunity recruitment and selection process. All interested candidates are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, ethnic origin, religion, disability, genetic information, or any other factors that could be deemed discriminatory.   Follow us on Instagram, Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook

title: Information Technology Support Specialist
skills: Skills: Техническая поддержка, Информационные технологии, +8 more
job_description: IT SUPPORT SPECIALIST        Oslo International School seeks a dedicated and knowledgeable IT Support Specialist to join our technology department. As an IT Support Specialist, you will report to the Technology Director and play a crucial role in providing technical assistance and support to our staff and students. You will be responsible for troubleshooting hardware and software issues, managing user accounts, and ensuring smooth technology operations across the school.      Responsibilities    Provide prompt and effective technical support to students, teachers, and staff members.  Diagnose and resolve hardware and software issues.  Set up and configure computers, peripherals, and software applications according to the school's technology standards and guidelines.  Manage user accounts, including creating, modifying, and disabling accounts in alignment with school policies.  Install, upgrade, and maintain software applications on devices used by staff and students, following established procedures.  Troubleshoot network connectivity issues and work collaboratively with the Network Administrator to ensure devices can connect to the school's network.  Conduct routine maintenance tasks on computers, printers, and other technology equipment.  Assist in the procurement and inventory management of technology equipment and software, following the guidelines provided by the Technology Director.  Support the implementation of technology initiatives and projects as outlined by the Technology Director.  Collaborate with the Technology Director and other team members to identify areas for improvement and provide input on technology-related policies and procedures.  Document support requests, resolutions, and system configurations accurately, and contribute to the knowledge base for future reference.  Stay updated on emerging technologies and trends in the field of IT and education, sharing relevant information with the Technology Director and team.         Requirements    Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).  Proven experience in providing technical support and troubleshooting hardware and software issues.  Strong knowledge of computer systems, operating systems, and software applications.  Familiarity with network protocols, connectivity, and troubleshooting.  Experience working in an educational environment, preferably within a school setting, is viewed favorably.  Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a detail-oriented approach.  Effective communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical individuals.  Ability to work independently and in a team-oriented environment.  Customer service-oriented mindset with a patient and friendly approach.            To apply      If you are passionate about technology and providing excellent support to a diverse school community, please submit your CV and cover letter to jobs@oslois.no. Please include “IT Support Specialist” in the subject line.      Candidates are urged to apply no later than 7 June 2023. OIS reserves the right to move forward with interview and selection processes as suitable candidates apply.

We aspire to get Novartis medicines in the hands and homes of patients by delivering a Triple Win: A Win for Patients; A Win for Healthcare Systems, and A Win for Novartis.  Purpose of the Business Analytics Specialist role is to support lead and manager to enterprise-wide effort to leverage data and technology evolving IM Poland from dormant & descriptive to predictive & prescriptive analytics, providing quantitative support and business understanding as well as a strategic perspective throughout the organization.   Your key responsibilities:     The main task will be the care and management of the back end of the QlikSense analytical platform, taking care of the quality of the processed data   Translate the business needs into actionable analytic-focused initiatives to provide solutions and/or recommendations to enable the business excellence   Collaborate with cross-functional colleagues from Sales and Marketing to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis including data gathering, analysis and creating visual displays of quantitative information. Iteratively developing and proto-typing dashboards to provide insights at scale to deliver effective visualizations of findings.   Serve as data analytics subject matter expert throughout IM Poland, turning business questions into data analysis and delivering recommendations supported by meaningful insights. Providing data-driven recommendations on strategy & plans to amplify customer engagement and maximize Novartis access and sales.   Evangelize the benefits of the data-driven approach at key meetings (e.g. Monthly Perf Update, Business Review, Tactical Plans)   Develop and embed in daily business work the well-sourced insights generation and execution process, constantly strive for a better, smarter supply of actionable insights from data to business leaders   Monitor consistent KPI framework, that ties strategy to operations and facilitates the performance dialogue   Explore and evaluate new data sources to drive Insights and innovation and provide clear recommendations for the team based upon these Insights   Proactively propose analytical solutions to business questions and problems and come up with new data driven ideas that can enhance the business   Develop and implement data warehousing solution / NVS Formula 1, operable execution   Support developing marketing research and analytics programs and analyses providing strategic insights which support long term business goals with significant potential to impact company earnings. Responsibilities include gathering market and patient insights using both primary & secondary information, benchmarking, & opportunity evaluation   Identifying and integrating new data sources to address knowledge gaps. Recommending changes to data gathering to improve data quality and use. Implementing field force-friendly tools to optimize data collection and reporting.      Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:    Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams representative of the patients and communities we serve.     Minimum Requirements     What you’ll bring to the role:     1+ years of relevant experience, preferably in a complex corporate organization, pharma industry.   Master’s degree with emphasis on quantitative methods (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, Mathematics, Data Sciences).   Mandatory to know tools such as QlikSense, SQL.   Knowledge of Databricks, GitLab, Airflow, Confluence, Snowflake and Python will be an additional advantage.   Data & analytics domain knowledge - a thorough understanding of the benefits and limitations of the tools and approaches in the modern analytical toolbox.   Fluent Polish and middle advance English.   Problem-solving skills, technological surveillance and applied knowledge of statistics and evaluation.   Communication skills and teamwork during projects.      Why Novartis?   766 million lives were touched by Novartis medicines in 2021, and while we’re proud of this, we know there is so much more we could do to help improve and extend people’s lives.  We believe new insights, perspectives and ground-breaking solutions can be found at the intersection of medical science and digital innovation. That a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment inspires new ways of working.  We believe our potential can thrive and grow in an unbossed culture underpinned by integrity, curiosity and flexibility. And we can reinvent what's possible, when we collaborate with courage to aggressively and ambitiously tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges. Because the greatest risk in life, is the risk of never trying!  Imagine what you could do here at Novartis!  Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network   Division   Innovative Medicines International & Chief Commercial Office   Business Unit   Region Europe IMI   Country   Poland   Work Location   Warszawa    Company/Legal Entity    Novartis Poland Sp. Z o.o   Functional Area   Sales   Job Type   Full Time   Employment Type   Regular   Shift Work   No   Early Talent   No

Et c'est grâce à ces convictions, que nous sommes aujourd'hui référencés auprès de partenaires grands comptes dans les secteurs de la Banque, de l'Assurance ou encore de la Distribution.      ________________________________        >  En tant que  Business Analyst (H/F),  tu seras rattaché(e) au  Pôle Fonctionnel  de notre Agence nantaise . title: Client Data Analyst (Client Intelligence Specialist - Fully remote) )
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: For 75 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.   IMPORTANT:   In order to be considered for this position,  a resume/CV must be uploaded and submitted during the application process.   Please make sure work history and education are added correctly.  Charles River crée un poste d' analyste de données clients  -  H/F   Il s'agit d'un poste à distance mais en étroite  collaboration avec l'équipe européenne de développement commercial.    En charge des données sur les clients et les marchés, votre principale responsabilité est de rassembler et d'analyser ces informations afin de créer de nouvelles opportunités/ contacts en Europe.  Vous travaillerez au sein d'une équipe européenne orientée vers l'atteinte des objectifs de l'équipe grâce à votre contribution. Vous serez directement rattaché(e) au Scientific Service Support Manager.   Vos principales missions :     Analyse étendue du marché et collecte de détails auprès des principaux clients en Europe sur les changements de personnel, la stratégie, les nouveaux postes, les messages sur les médias sociaux, la communication sur le site web  Surveiller les concurrents de l'UE dans différents domaines de la gestion des risques. Nouveaux modèles, appels d'offres remportés, changements de personnel, communiqués de presse, tarification  Collaborer avec l'équipe chargée de l'engagement des clients pour rechercher et développer des opportunités ciblées avec précision pour les opportunités de vente et les contacts prospectés   Soutien à l'analyse approfondie des clients pour les comptes cibles (comment le client est-il financé, quels organes déterminent l'orientation de l'institution, qui siège au conseil d'administration, analyse des rapports annuels).   Acquérir des connaissances sur les besoins d'étude des clients et les applications des produits et services de Charles River tout en recueillant continuellement des informations sur les comptes et en recherchant des données sur les nouvelles perspectives de vente/leads.   Analyse des informations sur les concurrents  Rechercher et trouver de nouvelles initiatives scientifiques au niveau européen et national en suivant les appels d'offres de financement et les communiqués de presse des grandes institutions de financement  Recueillir des informations sur les appels d'offres soumis et des données sur les tendances du marché, les produits concurrents et les prix.      Profil :     Idéalement, vous avez une formation / un diplôme d'analyste de données ou une formation / un diplôme comparable  Idéalement vous avez un attrait pour les sciences de la vie et ce qui touche à la recherche.   Vous vous intéressez à l'analyse des données pour identifier les besoins individuels.   Vous avez à cœur d'apporter de l'aide et de garantir l'exactitude des données dans un environnement dynamique et bienveillant.   Vous maitrisez le Pack Office.   Vous avez une expérience antérieure démontrant votre capacité à saisir et à maîtriser rapidement des concepts hautement techniques et à bien les articuler avec d'autres personnes.   Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour vos qualités relationnelles.   Vous parlez couramment l'anglais (écrit et oral) = Niveau C1 Minimum.   Idéalement, vous avez une expérience de travail avec Salesforce, ou une base de données CRM similaire est un plus et vous êtes familier avec LinkedIn, LinkedIn Sales Navigator.      Autres :     Ce rôle ne nécessite pas de voyager et est entièrement à distance, ce qui nécessite une capacité à travailler dans ce cadre.   Du lundi au vendredi - 35 heures par semaine  Salaire et avantages en fonction du profil et du pays     IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position.  If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV.   About Research Models & Services   Fundamental to basic research and discovery is the use of in vivo models to help identify disease targets and determine potential biological pathways that regulate the condition. As the world’s leader in the production and distribution of the highest quality research animal, with 1 out of 2 animal models produced for preclinical research globally, we understand the importance of this step. With seven decades of experience, our expertise is unmatched, allowing us to provide you with the perfect model, including disease-specific and preconditioned options, for basic research and beyond.   About Charles River   Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.  With over 20,000 employees within 110 facilities in 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world.  At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of 86% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2021.   Equal Employment Opportunity   Charles River Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer - all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.  If you are interested in applying to Charles River Laboratories and need special assistance or an accommodation due to a disability to complete any forms or to otherwise participate in the resume submission process, please contact a member of our Human Resources team by sending an e-mail message to crrecruitment_US@crl.com. This contact is for accommodation requests for individuals with disabilities only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.  For more information, please visit www.criver.com.

title: Trading and Business Support Analyst
skills: Skills: Business Support, Futures, +8 more
job_description: About the job:       We get curious people invested in the world.       We believe access to global capital markets is not only for the privileged few. Our vision is to enable people to fulfill their financial aspirations to make an impact. That’s why we use the power of technology to deliver clients what they need, when they need it in a user-friendly and personalized experience.       We are looking for a driven, skilled and ambitious colleague to join our Trading and Business Support Team. The team consists of 10 dedicated and professional employees that have the overall responsibility for the day-to-day Business support, to ensure smooth operations of Saxo´s Applications in our headquarter, 5 days a week on shift rotation from 08:00-00:00.       About the role:       Provide business/ functional / technical issues support from users of Trading-based applications in Front / Middle and Back office operational areas   Fully responsible for handling major incident triage, troubleshooting, driving resolution and root-cause for critical and high-frequency applications and services   Troubleshoot & investigate moderate functional issues by way of using tools like Elastic, Dynatrace and querying application logs, server logs, from DB and/or resolving through application configuration   Participate and drive incident post-mortems, taskforces for P1 and P2 incidents        Your profile:        +3 years’ experience working within IT application & business support roles, preferably Financial Sector, Trading and Administration domains   Working knowledge of ITSM tool, preferably ServiceNow   Working knowledge of Financial Markets, Trading, and Instruments such as stocks, equities, bonds, derivatives (futures, options) is an advantage   Knowledge of monitoring tools, like Dynatrace/SCOM/SolarWinds is an advantage   Working knowledge of Log aggregation and visualization tools, preferably Elastic and Kibana is an advantage       We offer:      Online trading is evolving at a rapid pace. That’s why innovation and development are crucial parts of our culture. We have close to 850 IT employees across the globe who are constantly improving our award-winning trading platform.     At Saxo technology and the business are integrated into the same teams, ensuring end-to-end ownership.We organize ourselves based on what we want to do for our clients rather than on subject matter expertise, to make sure we make a positive impact on our clients.     We encourage new ideas and promote individual ownership of projects and tasks. In that way, every challenge and every achievement in your career belongs to you.     We aspire to be a non-hierarchical, purpose-driven organisation. At Saxo, it is not about entitlement; it is about impact – no matter where you sit in the organisation. A good idea is always taken seriously and you can truly make a difference.     When you work here, you become a Saxonian. Obviously you will get an attractive compensation package. But we also invest in your personal development and offer you large responsibility from day one. We encourage an open feedback culture and a supportive team environment. If you show a collaborative spirit, drive and passion, your learning curve will be steep and your (international) career opportunities with Saxo immense.     At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!
