job_description: TELUS International AI-Data Solutions s'associe à une communauté diversifiée et dynamique pour aider nos clients à améliorer leurs modèles d'Intelligence Artificielle et d'apprentissage automatique. Le travail de notre communauté Intelligence Artificielle contribue à améliorer la technologie et les expériences numériques de nombreuses personnes à travers le monde. Notre communauté Intelligence Artificielle travaille sur notre plate-forme de formation à l’Intelligence Artificielle qui gère tous les types de données (texte, images, audio, vidéo et géo) dans plus de 500 langues et dialectes. Nous offrons des opportunités flexibles de travail à domicile pour les passionnés de langues. Les emplois sont à temps partiel et il n'y a pas d'horaire fixe. Qui que vous soyez, d'où que vous veniez, rejoignez notre communauté mondiale d'IA. www.telusinternational.com     Nous recrutons un analyste francophone indépendant de données en ligne pour un projet visant à améliorer le contenu et la qualité des cartes numériques, qui sont utilisées par des millions d'utilisateurs dans le monde. Le poste convient à quelqu'un qui a le souci du détail, aime faire des recherches et possède une bonne connaissance de la géographie nationale et locale.  Il s'agit d'un poste indépendant avec des horaires flexibles. Vous pouvez travailler à votre rythme chaque fois que du travail est disponible. Vous effectuerez des tâches de recherche et d'évaluation dans un environnement Web, par exemple vérifier et comparer des données, déterminer la pertinence et l'exactitude des informations. Vous recevrez des directives pour chaque tâche, qui doivent être suivies. Le projet offre une variété de tâches et le travail est rémunéré à la tâche.      Conditions    Maîtrise professionnelle de l'anglais et du français  Vous devez vivre au France depuis les 2 dernières années sans interruptions.   Vous devez être capable de suivre des directives et d’effectuer des recherches en ligne à l'aide de moteurs de recherche, de cartes en ligne et d'informations sur des sites Web  Vous devez avoir une connaissance des affaires courantes et historiques, des médias, du sport, des nouvelles, des médias sociaux et des affaires culturelles au France.  Vous devez être prêt à travailler sur un ensemble diversifié de types de tâches (portant par exemple sur les actualités, des tâches audios ou sur la pertinence des éléments qui vous seront présentés).  Les candidats doivent être âgés de 18 ans ou plus.    Travailler sur ce projet vous obligera à suivre un processus de recrutement standard (y compris la réussite d'une évaluation). Il s'agit d'un projet à long terme et votre travail sera occasionnellement soumis à des contrôles d'assurance de qualité.         Pourquoi rejoindre la communauté IA internationale de TELUS ?    Gagnez un revenu supplémentaire  Accédez à notre initiative de bien-être communautaire  Travail à distance  Soyez votre propre patron      Tous les candidats doivent passer et réussir un examen de qualification en ligne. La clé pour réussir l'examen est de lire attentivement les directives et le matériel d'apprentissage en ligne qui vous sont fournis avec une attention particulière aux détails. Vous aurez la possibilité d'accéder à l'examen à votre convenance, cependant, vous devrez terminer l'examen dans un délai précis.     Si cette position vous intéresse, envoyez-nous votre application en bas.  Si vous avez des questions, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter à l'adresse email suivante: sourcingteam14@telusinternational.ai

title: Data Specialist
skills: Skills: Data Governance, Моделирование данных, +8 more
job_description: Siamo il più grande gruppo bancario privato ed indipendente italiano che fonda le sue radici in una storia imprenditoriale lunga 450 anni e caratterizzata da innovazione e apertura. Stiamo lavorando per costruire l’ecosistema finanziario sostenibile del futuro con l’obiettivo di contribuire alle sfide personali e imprenditoriali dei nostri clienti.  Nel gruppo, Banca Sella è la banca commerciale, riconosciuta nel settore per le sue eccellenze nell’innovazione dei sistemi di pagamento, nel commercio elettronico e nel private banking e che fa dell’affidabilità delle proprie soluzioni digitali il suo principale punto di forza.   Nel 2022    abbiamo creato un team che si occupa di dati a 360°     abbiamo rafforzato i nostri processi di Data Governance e li abbiamo diffusi in tutta la banca    abbiamo creato le basi per l'utilizzo dei dati a supporto delle strategie di business.    Nel 2023    vogliamo continuare a creare valore per noi e per i nostri clienti     vogliamo completare il team con professionalità specialistiche per diventare ancora di più un punto di riferimento in tema di dati    vogliamo realizzare la sfida di diventare un’azienda data driven.    Le persone che cerchiamo sono   appassionate di dati  (Big Data, Intelligenza Artificiale)  con due principali driver di competenze: interlocuzione con il business per la rilevazione/comprensione dei needs e data modeling per l’implementazione delle soluzioni più efficaci.    Più nello specifico, le vostre responsabilità principali sono:   Implementare i processi di Data Governance e Data Management nelle aree di business;  Raccogliere e analizzare le esigenze degli stakeholder in tema di dati;  Pianificare e coordinare il design, lo sviluppo e il rilascio di dashboard in coerenza con le esigenze di business;  Promuovere l’utilizzo dei dati nell’individuazione di opportunità di business e contribuire al miglioramento della Customer Journey e Customer Experience;  Garantire l’utilizzo del dato come asset per guidare le scelte di business;  Coordinare l'implementazione dei processi di alimentazione al sistema Datawarehouse (DWH);  Alimentare e mantenere costantemente aggiornati gli Asset di Data Governance (es. Glossario, Dizionario dei dati, Catalogo della qualità dei dati).      REQUISITI   Il vostro Background universitario è in ingegneria informatica/matematica/delle telecomunicazioni, informatica, statistica, economia o discipline affini;  Avete un’ esperienza di un paio d’anni  maturata in società di consulenza o del settore financial services in ruoli di Data Engineer, Data Scientist o Data Analyst; possedete una conoscenza tecnica e/o funzionale dei dati, della loro struttura e del loro potenziale come asset; vi siete già messi alla prova su attività di  business understanding  .   Avete competenze di project management, data modeling e/o data warehousing; conoscete metodi per acquisire, gestire e governare i dati in modo creativo e organizzato.   SKILL    costrutti SQL, ETL, Business Intelligence;  software di Data Modeling (Oracle Data Modeler, ERwin, …) e BI (PowerBI, Qlik, Tableau, ecc.)     Modalità e sede di lavoro:  ibrida con possibilità di smartworking e presenza fisica a Torino previa disponibilità a trasferte presso l’Head Quarter di Biella.   Il gruppo Sella promuove un ambiente di lavoro sostenibile, inclusivo e che abbraccia le diversità di genere, età, nazionalità, come occasione di continuo scambio culturale e fattore determinante per lo sviluppo stesso dell’ecosistema di Gruppo.   data-art

title: DevOps Engineer
company_name: NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)
skills: Skills: DevOps, Автоматизация тестирования, +6 more
job_description: Primary Location    Netherlands-The Hague    Other Locations    Belgium-Mons    NATO Body    NATO Communications and Information Agency (NCI Agency)    Schedule    Full-time    Application Deadline    31-May-2023, 11:59:00 PM    Salary (Pay Basis)    5,388.00    Grade    NATO Grade G12   NATO offers you more than a job. It gives you a mission: building peace and security for one billion people in Europe and North America. The NATO Communications & Information Agency (NCIA) is leading NATO’s Digital Transformation. Based in The Hague, Netherlands the DevOps Engineer plays a key role in supporting the maintenance, troubleshooting and automated deployment of Independent Verification, Validation and Quality (IVV&Q) reference environments.    Who we are:    NCIA acquire, deploy and defend communications systems for NATO's political decision-makers and Commands; the agency is on the frontlines against cyber-attacks, working closely with governments and industry to prevent future debilitating attacks. We are NATO’s technology and cyber leaders, helping NATO Nations to communicate and work together in smarter ways. Our work is challenging and meaningful, and you will develop and apply your expertise as part of a dynamic international team of civilian and military professionals.     The role:     We are looking for a talented DevOps Engineer who will be working within the Independent Verification, Validation and Quality (IVVQ) system administration team on DevOps activities related to maintenance, troubleshooting and automated deployment of the IVVQ reference environments. This is an ideal position for an engineer who has a passion for cloud based services, automation, scripting and coding.   The DevOps Engineer will be part of a team that develop and operate the NATO enterprise wide reference system in support Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V) and change activities. This includes the management of technical lab facilities, as well as providing Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) in private, hybrid and public cloud environments, applying leading orchestration, deployment and virtualization technologies. This new post will also:      Operate and maintain private, hybrid and public cloud environments used by IVVQ and its internal and external customers    Deploying and configuring these environments in preparation for test events    Ensuring that environments comply with NATO security requirements;    Achieving efficient operation of the environments by automating deployment of services and their configuration    Ensuring proper change and configuration management practices are put in place for these environments    Replicating production environments to ensure that test activities are conducted in a suitable environment    Act as alternate for operating, maintaining and custodial functions for crypto equipment    Providing monthly management reporting regarding the status and availability of the reference environments       About you:     You easily establish good relationship and are able to relate to people at all levels. You produce new ideas, approaches and insights to deliver innovate solutions to problems. Able to adapt to changing circumstances you can manage ambiguity, accept new ideas and change initiatives, further to this you have:      Experience provisioning and maintaining of Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) and Platform as a Service (PaaS) in private, public or hybrid cloud environments    Ideally experience in working with Infrastructure as Code and configuration management tools (e.g. Azure DevOps, Ansible, Terraform, CloudFormation etc.)    Windows or Linux/Unix systems administration experience and testing experience    Experience in working with physical and software defined networks    Working experience as DevOps engineer for at least 2 years    Knowledge of software/system/service life cycle management    Working-level knowledge of MS-Office, Project, Visio and SharePoint    Ideally have experience with cryptographic equipment    Ideally work experience as a tester or independent verification and validation engineer, during all phases of the project lifecycle       What do we offer?       Genuinely meaningful work as part of the most successful alliance in history    Initial three year contract with competitive monthly tax-free salary of 5,338 and household & children’s allowances    Privileges for expatriate staff including expatriation and education allowances (where appropriate) and additional home leave    Excellent private health insurance scheme    Generous annual leave of 30 days plus official holidays    Retirement Pension Plan      For a full list of duties, you can review the full job description here please note that internally to the Agency this role is titled “Principal Technician” to learn more about NCI Agency, our mission and goals take a few moments to visit our website .

title: Analyste Data -(H/F)
skills: Skills: Прикладная математика, Статистика, +8 more
job_description: 230007FD     Vos missions au quotidien    Vous savez « faire parler » les données pour créer de la valeur ? Vous souhaitez travailler en mode agile ? Rejoignez-nous.   Les données étant reconnues comme un actif stratégique de la Banque, elles constituent aujourd’hui un enjeu majeur pour le Groupe Société Générale. Un programme a été lancé pour développer - créer de la valeur autour de cet actif sur quatre réalités distinctes : sa qualité, sa protection, son utilisation et le développement des usages, sa gouvernance.     En tant que Data Analyst vous aller rejoindre la communauté Data de la Société Générale pour couvrir à la fois les enjeux business et technologiques liés à la donnée. Vous intégrez le Data Management Office (DMO) de la Direction Achat et rejoignez une équipe dynamique de six personnes, vous travaillez avec le département Digital de la Direction, et en étoite collaboration les équipes techniques.   Concevoir et assurer la maintenance des tableaux de bords (dataviz) sous PowerBI et des modèles de données (Data model), gérer et alimenter des bases de données et modèles  Prendre en charge le cadrage, le suivi, le planning, l’animation des projets « Analytics », et la communication auprès des clients internes, (rôle de product owner / chef(fe) de projet)  Assurer l’interface entre les différents acteurs des projets notamment les équipes techniques ainsi que la veille sur les sources de données internes et externes  Superviser les travaux de l'alternant / stagiaire du département  Accompagnement des équipes techniques sur la migration des données vers le Datalake du Groupe  Assurer et monitorer le bon fonctionnement de nos outils de Machine Learning  Identifier des cas d'usage en Data Science / Machine Learning  Conduite du changement : Contribuer à diffuser la « culture data » auprès des acheteurs, en s’appuyant sur le programme Data du Groupe Société Générale       Et si c’était vous ?      Vous avez une formation de niveau Bac+4/5 en Ecole d’Ingénieur, de Commerce ou Université avec une spécialisation en Statistique, Big Data, Informatique décisionnelle, Business Intelligence ou Data Science  Vous maîtrisez les langages de programmation communs et requête de bases de données : SQL, Dax (PowerBI) et Python  Vous avez un niveau confirmé sur Excel, et bénéficiez d'une expertise en statistiques et mathématiques appliquées : analyse prédictive à partir de différentes bases de données  Vous avez une bonne maîtrise de la gestion et coordination de projet data, et savez travailler en étroite collaboration avec :   vos clients internes, dans le cadre de la création de dashboards et de demande d'évolution (priorisation, étude de faisabilité, cadrage, aiguillage dans l'expression de besoins, suivi des travaux)   les équipes de développements (data engineers)  Des connaissances de base/conceptuelles en Machine Learning seraient un plus  You're fluent in English? Vous serez amené à travailler quotidiennement avec nos équipes de Data engineering anglophones  Vous êtes notre candidat(e) idéal(e)!       Plus qu’un poste, un tremplin    Le Groupe Société Générale offre de nombreuses opportunités d'évolution de carrière dans la Data. Fort d'un écosystème dynamique, vous pourrez évoluer vers de multiples fonctions : Chef de projet Data, Head of Data Management, Data Quality Manager etc.   Nous facilitons l’équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle en offrant la possibilité à nos collaborateurs de travailler sur un rythme alterné entre site et télétravail.     Pourquoi nous choisir ?    Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.   Aux 4 coins du monde, que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir. Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partie de notre ADN.   Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !    Vous hésitez encore ?    Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent s’engager quelques jours par an pour des actions de solidarité sur leur temps de travail : parrainer des personnes en difficulté dans leur orientation ou leur insertion professionnelle, participer à l’éducation financière de jeunes en apprentissage ou encore partager leurs compétences avec une association. Les formats d’engagement sont multiples.   Nous sommes un  employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances  et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à  promouvoir tous les talents , quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, parentalité, origine ethnique, nationalité, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

job_description: Wien Energie, größter regionaler Energieanbieter Österreichs, ist für die Versorgung mit Strom, Erdgas, Wärme und Kälte von rund zwei Millionen Menschen, 230.000 Gewerbe- und Industrieanlagen sowie 4.500 landwirtschaftlichen Betrieben verantwortlich.    Das erwartet Sie      Sicherstellung von Datenqualität und Konzeption von Datenmanagement-Systemen  Fachliche und organisatorische Unterstützung beim Aufbau und der Entwicklung von Datenmodellen und Use Cases  Durchführung von Datenanalysen und Austausch mit den Fachbereichen zum Thema Daten-Anforderungen  Ableitung von Maßnahmen aus umfassenden Analysen sowie Durchführung von Ad-Hoc-Reports    Das bringen Sie mit      Abgeschlossenes Ausbildung auf Maturaniveau (Studium von Vorteil)  Erfahrung als Data Engineer sowie umfassendes Know-how in der Umsetzung von DWH-Lösungen  Verständnis für Datenanalyse sowie grundlegende Kenntnisse im Gebrauch von Datenvisualisierungs-Tools (zB Power-BI)  Gutes analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen sowie eine proaktive und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise  Kommunikative Persönlichkeit mit hoher Eigenständigkeit und professionelles Auftreten im Umgang mit unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen  Den Wunsch, gemeinsam mit der Wiener Stadtwerke-Gruppe, Wien klimafit für die Zukunft zu machen       Kontakt    Wiener Stadtwerke GmbH   Konzernpersonalentwicklung | Recruiting   Isabella Groiß, MSc   wstw-raute Ein Unternehmen   der Wiener Stadtwerke    Das bieten wir Ihnen    Neben spannenden Aufgaben und der fachlichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung, bieten wir Ihnen zahlreiche attraktive Benefits. title: Junior Data Analytics Consultant
skills: Skills: Английский язык, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Hai la la passione per il mondo dei dati e per la  Business Intelligence ? SDG ha bisogno di te per rafforzare i suoi team.      Con chi lavorerai e di cosa ti occuperai?   In SDG hai l’opportunità di diventare un esperto di Analytics e e di entrare a far parte di una delle società più all’avanguardia d’Europa in questo ambito.  Avrai l’occasione di confrontarti quotidianamente con altri professionisti di diversa seniority, prendendo parte a progetti sfidanti e ambiziosi.  Partendo da un livello base, attraverso training, coaching, mentoring e un approccio never-stop-learning, avrai modo di diventare un esperto nella progettazione e sviluppo di practices con le quali far adottare ai nostri clienti un’ottica data driven.  In particolare, durante il percorso in SDG, avrai modo di costruire il tuo career path personalizzato sulle base delle tue passioni e delle tue attitudini, scegliendo tra diversi percorsi, che ti porteranno in breve tempo ad essere una figura di riferimento nel mondo della business analytics.      Your challenges    Acquisire una conoscenza del mondo analytics a 360°, scoprendo diverse modalità con cui possono essere trasformati e modellati i dati aziendali al fine di rappresentare i processi di business, permettendo ai clienti di massimizzare il valore ottenuto dagli strumenti analitici.  Apprendere tecniche ed abilità di rappresentazione ed analisi dei dati, con l’obiettivo di mettere a disposizione dei clienti strumenti e soluzioni che permettano loro di prendere decisioni rapide ed intraprendere azioni ad alto impatto sull’organizzazione  Sviluppare hard skills nell’utilizzo delle tecnologie di business intelligence e soft skills per relazionarsi con il cliente e il proprio team di lavoro;  Capacità di muoversi e interagire in un ambiente internazionale, rapido e dinamico assumendosi gradualmente maggiori responsabilità e autonomia nei tasks;       Requirements:    Technology attitude: tecnologie di Business Intelligence, Data Manipulation, Data Management sono solo il punto di partenza, ma non preoccuparti se la tua conoscenza è a un livello base: abbiamo un Learning Center per renderti velocemente un Data Cruncher.  Business attitude: l’utilizzo dei dati e delle tecnologie non è un esercizio fine a se stesso, ma uno strumento attraverso il quale migliorare il business dei clienti ad esempio ottimizzando il tempo degli utenti nell’operatività quotidiana, oppure prendendo decisioni basate su evidenze numeriche ed oggettive. Per farlo è necessario conoscere il mercato in cui si muovono i nostri clienti, che afferiscono a numerosi settori, tra cui: Fashion, Luxury & Retail, Financial Services & Insurance, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Consumer Products, Government, Telco & Utilities  Team player: un buon giocatore di squadra è una persona altruista, dinamica, entusiasta, resiliente e positiva. Sono elementi alla base dei Valori SDG, e lavoriamo per far crescere una cultura dei valori a tutti i livelli.  Conoscenza lingua inglese: B1/B2 (verrà testata in sede di colloquio)       Rock your future with SDG:    Academy interne e centri di eccellenza qualificati con possibilità di ottenere certificazioni per i tools più utilizzati nel campo dei big data & analytics: PowerBI, Looker, Qlik, Tableau, Microstrategy, SAP Analytics, AWS Redshift, Oracle DB, SQL Server, Azure Synapse Analytics, Google Bigquery, Snowflake etc.  Never stop learning: formazione continua per tutto l’arco della carriera con 80 ore di training iniziale e successiva attività di coaching e mentoring. Valutazioni semestrali del potenziale e della performance.  Ambiente internazionale e giovane: età media inferiore a 30 anni, possibilità di trasferte anche all’estero.  Smart & Remote working.       SDG Group:   Lavorare in SDG significa entrare a far parte di una delle società di management consulting in più rapida crescita nell’ambito dei Business Analytics, Corporate performance Management e Advanced Business Solutions. Con più di 2000 professionisti in tutto il mondo è stata riconosciuta da Gartner tra le 37 società più all’avanguardia nel settore dei Data & Analytics, l’unica italiana e seconda in Europa. SDG opera in Italia con 4 uffici (Milano, Firenze, Verona e Roma) e dislocamenti in Spagna, Portogallo, Francia, UK, USA e Middle East. Mettiamo la nostra esperienza nel settore degli Analytics a disposizione delle aziende per potenziare le loro strategie di business, facendole diventare organizzazioni data-driven di successo.

title: Technical Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: Reporting to the Senior AMOS & Technical Records Manager, the  Technical Data Analyst  is responsible for providing analytical support to a range of Engineering Teams such as  Reliability ,  Technical Services  and  Powerplant . These positions are instrumental in the review, analysis and interpretation of vital Airworthiness data such as Service Bulletins and Service letters, contributing to the safe and efficient operation of the   Jet2.com   fleet of aircraft.  You will act as the focal point for Engineering Airworthiness data, extracting relevant information and providing insight into the impact on the   Jet2.com   operational programme. The  Technical Data Analyst  will analyse the impact of repair work and modifications to overall aircraft availability and efficiency, making recommendations for improvements. You will also carry out continuous analysis of all relevant industry data relating to Airworthiness, highlighting key considerations and contributing to the maintenance of regulatory requirements and Company policies.   The successful candidate     Will have experience in data analysis within an Aviation or Engineering role, however candidates demonstrating strong data analytical backgrounds from other industries may also be considered.   You will have meticulous attention to detail and a structured approach to problem solving, as well as the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels.   The Technical Data Analyst will have excellent IT skills and the ability to work closely with very technical data.   What can we offer you?   We have been recognised as one of the  Top 50 Best Places to Work in the UK  on  Glassdoor  and offer our valued colleagues a range of benefits including: -   Competitive salary, with annual pay review  Contributory pension scheme  34 days holiday entitlement per annum (including Bank Holidays)  3 x salary life assurance  Generous Discretionary Profit Share Scheme  Colleague discounts on Jet2holidays and Jet2.com holidays and flights   Cycle to Work Scheme  Access to Mental Health First Aiders  Many retail discounts on – travel and leisure, health, and wellbeing, eating out, shopping and lifestyle    This is a great opportunity to be part of an exciting, forward-thinking business. We operate scheduled leisure flights to holiday destinations in the Mediterranean, the Canary Islands and to European Leisure Cities from our 10 UK bases.  Help us to send our all-important customers on holiday with   Jet2.com   and   Jet2holidays  !!

job_description: Referenz 16-152669   Für ein internationales Unternehmen der  Handelsbrache  in  Frankfurt am Main  suchen wir im Rahmen der  Direktvermittlung  zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Data Analyst (m/w/d).    Ihre Benefits     Attraktive Homeoffice-Möglichkeit  Flexible Arbeitszeiten  Spannendes und abwechslungsreiches Aufgabengebiet  Kostenfreie Parkplätze  Aufstiegsmöglichkeiten  Modernes Ambiente     Ihre Aufgaben     Analyse von Daten auf Datenqualität und Bewertung der Ergebnisse  Unterstützung bei der Optimierung der Geschäftsprozesse  Erstellung und Implementierung der Datasets auf Basis der fachlichen Anforderungen  Enge Zusammenarbeit mit den Fachabteilungen, dem BI Team und dem Bereich Datenmanagement  Mitwirkung bei der Entwicklung von analytischen Berichten     Ihr Profil     Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-) Informatik, Mathematik oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung  Nachweisbare Erfahrungen im Bereich Datenqualität, Data Mining und Datenanalyse  Gute Kenntnisse in Machine Learning, statistischen Methoden und Dateninfrastruktur  Praktische Erfahrungen mit MS PowerBI Services sowie der Nutzung von Cloud  Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Datenbanken (SQL & NoSQL), Datenmodellierung und Implementierung performanter Datenmodelle  Idealerweise Programmierkenntnisse in Python sowie Erfahrungen mit agilen Methoden  Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift   Die Amadeus FiRe Personalvermittlung & Interim Management GmbH bringt als spezialisierter Personaldienstleister jeden Tag Fach- und Führungskräfte aus dem kaufmännischen und IT-Bereich mit nationalen und internationalen Unternehmen zusammen. title: Junior Software Developer Engineer
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Тестирование модуля, +1 more
job_description: GTD is a high-tech company, committed to the design, integration, and operation of complex, mission-critical applications and systems throughout the world.  We carry out turnkey projects for our clients, developing state-of-the-art systems in Space, Aerospace, Energy, and Scientific facilities industries. Here you will find more information about GTD Group: https://vimeo.com/149636682      The role:   GTD Sistemas de Información is an engineering company specialized in rockets (Ariane family) and Ground Control & Command for different launchers and earth observation satellites (civil & military). We know how to create breath-taking, powerful software which is reliable and cost effective, whether it’s needed for space transportation, earth observation and science exploration missions.  We are looking for a Junior Software Developer Engineer to join our Space area in GTD Sistemas de Información, the company of GTD Group specialized in the design and development of large, complex and/or safety-critical applications. Here you will find more information about us: https://vimeo.com/451837856      Position activities:   Software development in a new project for Guiana Space Port. This new project i-CDO is in charge of a new infrastructure using virtualization, containers, distributed information and highly critical security software that aims to destroy the launcher if its path is not safe (risk of human or building loss).      Your profile    Graduates in Telecommunications Engineering or Computing Engineering  Linux   6 months of experience with C++   Python  JavaScript  Git  High level of English - B2        Nice to have    Windows  Kafka  Django  MongoDB  Nginx  Unit Testing  QT  Subversion  Basic French       What do we offer?    Full-time position with a permanent contract  To participate in highly advanced technological projects all around the world.  To be part of a young dynamic company  Flexible working hours.  Excellent location in our BCN HQ  Work from home’ policy  Ticket Restaurant  Free fruit at work on Wednesdays  Training plan  Flexible Compensation Plan according to your needs      We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, etc.

title: Senior BI Data Engineer
skills: None
job_description: We are  PHOENIX Pharma  – a leading integrated healthcare provider in Europe. Every day we reliably supply people with pharmaceuticals and medical products. Our approximately 39,000 employees make an important contribution to comprehensive healthcare in Europe. The vision of the PHOENIX group is to be the best-integrated healthcare provider – wherever it is active. In a total of 29 countries, we supply pharmacies, doctors, and medical institutions with pharmaceuticals and health products through 161 distribution centers. Millions of people across Europe can rely on our services every day.     Our international IT Hub in Sofia, Bulgaria is growing. You will be able to work with different teams within the PHOENIX Group in Europe, being involved in projects related to SAP, Security, Infrastructure, Cloud, Networks, OCC, Business Intelligence, ERP, and CRM Solutions. You will have the chance to participate in the development of projects and products that are diverse, visible, interesting, and for the public welfare and health. You will work in an international environment and culture with a constant exchange of onsite-/offsite knowledge.     We are looking for a  Senior BI Data Engineer  to join our PHOENIX Competence Centre IT & Digital in Sofia (Bulgaria).      Your Responsibilities:       You are an experienced senior responsible for the design and development of the central BI platform based on MS SQL Server and in future AZURE Cloud in an enterprise environment.  Together with our internal business partner you will design, develop and maintain critical mass data and data products.  You will collect, check, transform, and model data.  Partially you will work in 3rd-level support to ensure the proper and performant operation.       Your Profile:       University degree in business informatics or similar and verifiably some years of work experience in business intelligence.  Very good analytical skills to understand, solve and communicate complex technical and mathematical problems.  Very good skills for ETL processes in MS SQL Server procedures and functions, good skills in AZURE tools like Data Bricks, Python, and Spark.  You can work self-organized by taking over personal responsibility for your developments.  Good English in word and speech.       What We Offer:       26 days paid annual leave.  Health insurance.  Food vouchers.  Flexible working time and options to work from home.  Free parking.  Sports venue pass at a preferential price.  Learning and development.  Employee discounts for company products and services.  Others will be added in the course of establishing the hub.      Send us your recent resume if you recognize this role as a career opportunity for you. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.     All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

title: Business Intelligence Developer
skills: Skills: Базы данных, Аналитика, +8 more
job_description: A Snapshot of Your Day   You are supporting the organization with DataAnalytics and Visualization. Therefore, you are working closely together withour business to identify areas/use cases which have a potential for DataAnalytics. Structure the Data, manage the project, develop the Application whichis creating value add in our business and integrate it into our current ITlandscape.   How You’ll Make An Impact     Work closely with business to identify data-related business requirements and service standards (e.g., transaction processing speed, data mining and reporting capabilities, data security, scalability, etc.)   Support in the development of a high-level enterprise data model and conceptual views of related data sub-architectures (e.g., database, data integration, data warehouse/business intelligence, reporting, metadata, and content management architectures)   Develop new applications in Snowflake and BI tools (e.g., Qlik)  Continually work on enhancements of existing Dashboards and digital applications  Data provision and modeling for various business stakeholders  Work on functional data testing and performance optimization  Optimize overall data/information flow by reducing redundancy and enabling accessibility within security boundaries      What You Bring     Experienced in Qlik (Mandatory)  Strong self-learning and independent-working skills (Mandatory)  Understanding of Databases and Processes (Mandatory)  Experience in other BI Tools would be beneficial  Project Management Skills and good analytic thinking  Be a team player, experienced in working with international partners  Have the ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously, with time pressure  Energetic, creative, and proactive personality  Solid English language knowledge      About The Team   "Let’s make tomorrow different today"is our genuine commitment at Siemens Energy to all customers and employees onthe way to a sustainable future.  In our  Business Functions  we enable ourorganization to reach their targets by providing best-in class services andsolutions in the areas of IT, HR, Finance, Real Estate, Strategy &Technology and more.   Who is Siemens Energy?   At Siemens Energy, we are more than just anenergy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 92,000dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of theglobal community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect peopleand the environment.  Our global team is committed to makingsustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing theboundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation thatencourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization,new technologies, and energy transformation.   Our Office   Siemens Energy's location in One Cotroceni Parkis more than just an office space - it's a hub for a vibrant and thrivingcommunity. Nestled in the heart of Bucharest, this urban development is theperfect place to work, surrounded by green spaces, shopping destinations, andeverything the city center has to offer. And with the Academia Militara subwaystation just a 3-minute walk away, getting around the city has never been easier.   Our Commitment to Diversity    Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Throughdiversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creativeenergy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character– no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, ordisability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminatebased on our differences.   Rewards/Benefits     Your lunch with SE meal tickets   Keep your brain fit with our trainings   Special for books lovers - Bookster   Stay safe and healthy with our medical subscription   Think about your future too with Privat Pension Pilon III  Take care of yourself with our Wellbeing Initiatives     https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/jobs

title: Pricing Analyst
skills: Skills: Marketing Mix Modeling, Стратегии ценообразования, +7 more
job_description: Über die Stelle   Do you want to shape the future?   We are looking for an experienced and ambitious  Pricing Analyst, in our Business Unit E-Mobility,  to be an important part in paving the way for Vattenfall and its customers and partners towards a fossil free future!  In a international team, responsible for the sales and marketing services, you will be responsible for the governance and strategy concerning pricing. From a central staff position, you will work closely with local operations and sales teams, ensuring that the gross margin settings are market competitive and profitable. In your role as Pricing Analyst you will report to the Manager Marketing and Sales Services.   Your main responsibilities:    As the chairperson of an international pricing forum within the InCharge organization, you are responsible to drive decision-making on the pricing topics  Responsibility for overall pricing strategy for the products and services of InCharge  Develop the strategy and engage the stakeholders in the executing and understanding of the strategy  Conducting market research on the topic of pricing as well as inspiring and thriving the pricing strategy  Preparing the agenda, giving guidance when needed as well as cooperating with the stakeholders.      Location    Preferred work locations are Berlin or Amsterdam.  Ihr Profil   Your Profile as a Pricing Analyst:    An academic Master degree in Marketing and/or Econometrics  Several years working experience with defining prices and price complexity  Experience in B2B market, preferably in the EV mobility, energy (fuel) or telecom (roaming) industry  Experience in the combination of Marketing and Pricing is beneficial  Working closely with marketeers and proposition managers, you understand the importance of price in their marketing mix and how it can be influenced   You love data – you use data analyses to build your cases, talk to stakeholders and thrive decision making  Good communication and influencing skills  Strong analytical thinking skills  Fluent English language skills, written and spoken    Zusätzliche Informationen   Our offer   At Vattenfall we exist to help our customers power their lives in ever climate smarter ways and to become fossil free within one generation. E-Mobility is a big step towards our goal, help us achieve this by improving our pricing strategy and governance!   More Information    We welcome your application (including CV and motivation letter) in English, no later than, 31th of Mai. We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.  For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Maryana Halushko via phone: +49 40 790221053.  At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.   We look forward to receiving your application!   Über das Unternehmen  Vattenfall currently operates more than 30 000 charging points in Europe - and our network continues to grow. Our E-mobility business offers electric vehicle charging solutions for people’s homes, business locations and in large cities, with the aim to facilitate EV driving in Europe, in both rural and urban environments. Vattenfall is building the E-mobility business based on strong expertise in the energy and electricity business as well as with strong relationships with partners (e.g. cities, car manufacturers, leasing companies).

Maximizes account sales and inventory turns by forecasting consumer demand and developing optimal product assortments and replenishment inventory strategies  Manage both with the local and with the local suppliers the purchase orders for the finished goods.  Manage the local reworking activities for the promotional finished goods.  Assists with direction and prioritization of the entire Supply Chain, with consideration of supply chain constraints (Supplier, Equipment, Resources, Projects, Material Dating, and Quality Statuses).  Assists with implementing strategic decisions to support Planned (Life Cycle projects, New Product introduction, and Validation) and Unplanned (production deviation) events.  Document all the assumptions behind the sales forecast and potential changes;  Measure KPI’s like forecast accuracy, service level and inventory          Experience Required    University Degree in a relevant discipline  A minimum of 2 years work experience required  Strong analytical skills  Fluency in English and Italian is mandatory  Advanced Microsoft Office skills         We are seeking a diverse applicant pool to ensure the diversity of our team reflects the end consumers we serve through our self-care mission. title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Решение задач, +6 more
job_description: Job Description     NI is seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst in a team who are responsible for a high-quality information ecosystem that enables Supply Chain stakeholders to make better decisions more efficiently every day. This role supports a flexible work arrangement, including remote work (upto 4 days in a week and 1 day in office) and in-person work.     Core Job Responsibilities       Partner with other teams to outline business needs into data requirements.   Translate ambiguous business requirements into measurable insights with an emphasis on accuracy.   Work alongside our Supply Chain teams to recommend changes related to data setup and maintenance to improve process efficiencies.   Help solve strategic challenges facing NI through data using various technologies, languages, and analytical methods to provide actionable insights that support business decisions.   Envision & design an entire portfolio of dashboards to help leadership to lead the of Supply Chain.   Combine information with standards of design & performance to drive dashboard usability.   Provide subject matter expertise to determine appropriate data values when conflicts arise.  Balance statistical models and Machine Learning models to provide business-pertinent insights.   Integrate data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements.   Partner with other areas of Global Supply Chain to leverage data to drive key sales processes.   Develop standard procedures, user guides, and other training and job aid materials.  Lead and work on regional and global projects.       Requirements       Bachelor's Degree with an emphasis in business, economics, math, engineering or analytics (or relevant work experience). Advanced degree is a plus.   Minimum of 2 years of advanced reporting, and/ or programming experience in SQL   Minimum of 1 year of Tableau development experience. Experienced in Tableau features, Data Optimization, and a keen eye for design.   Proficiency with MS Excel, MS Word, and PowerPoint.   Technical mindset to understand system issues, data, and touchpoints   Solution driven with strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills   Capability to communicate clearly and with various types of audiences (team members, management, and senior leadership)   Needs to be comfortable piloting new technologies and determining if they would have a place within the larger team's tech stack.   Knowledge of Supply Chain business environment preferred.  Knowledge of KINAXIS Rapid Response Dashboard Authoring preferred.       About Us      Miért az NI?    Számos oka van annak, hogy fontolóra vedd a vállalatunkhoz való csatlakozást.   Kulcsfontosságú számunkra az emberek kapcsolata, az ötletek és a technológia. Az NI-nál hiszünk abban, hogy ezt a három tényezőt összekapcsolva megteremthetjük a siker felé vezető utat.   Az emberek: Kíváncsi és kreatív problémamegoldókat keresünk, akik értékelik a sokféleséget és a friss perspektívákat, merészek, kedvesek, valamint szívesen megragadják a lehetőségeket.   Az ötletek: Mi szerettél volna lenni felnőttként? Robotokat akartál programozni? Repülő autókat építeni? Jobbá tenni a világot? Az NI-nál az álmodozók nagy ötleteire építünk, hogy elképzeléseiket megvalósíthassák.   A technológia: Testreszabott, szoftver-központú megközelítésünkkel támogatjuk ügyfeleinket a termékfejlesztési ciklus minden szakaszában. Az 5G-től és az orvosi innovációktól kezdve az autonóm vezetésig és az űrutazás jövőjéig minden nap ambiciózusan, az Engineer Ambitiously mottó jegyében segítünk ügyfeleinknek.   Már hosszú ideje kiemelkedő munkaadóként ismernek el minket világszerte.   Kompenzációink és juttatásaink versenyképesek, csakúgy, mint a modern munkaterületeink, a karrierfejlesztési és mobilitási lehetőségeink, valamint a kultúra, amely elősegíti a hovatartozást és hangsúlyozza a közösség fontosságát.   Arra biztatjuk a csapattársainkat, hogy lépjenek ki az épp fennálló helyzetből és működjenek együtt másokkal, hogy innovatív megoldásokat hozzanak létre.   Függetlenül attól, hogy a karriered hol jár, mi érted, egymásért és a következő generáció innovátoraiért vagyunk, azokért, akik nagyobbat álmodnak, magasabb célokat tűznek ki és gyorsabban haladnak.   Készen állsz, hogy segíts az emberiség formázásában az elkövetkezendő 100 évben? Ha igen, álljunk is neki, és ne feledd: Engineer Ambitiously!

title: V.I.E Performance Management  Analyst
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Microsoft Excel, +8 more
job_description: Please attach your CV (PDF) in English when submitting your application       ArcelorMittal is the world’s largest steel producer. We use the most innovative technology to create the steels tomorrow’s world will be made of. Every day over 190,000 of our talented people, located in over 60 countries, push the boundaries of digitalization and use advanced technology to create a world that is stronger, faster and smarter. To help make this possible, they know they can depend on the support and training that a company of our scope and scale can provide.     Join us at the forefront of the steels industry and see your work help create renewable energy, impact major industries and boost economies. At ArcelorMittal we’ll help you make your world.     ArcelorMittal Luxembourg is looking for a:   V.I.E - Performance Management Analyst       Mission:    Group Accounting and Performance Management (GAPM) department reports to the Group CFO’s office and is responsible for consolidation and reporting of performance for all ArcelorMittal entities across the group. We are currently looking to fill an Analyst position in our Performance Management team. As member of the Performance Management team this position will be responsible for checking, validating, reviewing, analyzing and reporting the financial and non-financial key performance indicators (KPIs) of the Group.        Duties and Responsibilities:        He/she actively participates in tracking the Group's managerial KPI's, following prescribed guidelines and principles and ensures that uniform practices are adhered to by the key business units/segments.  Data checking and validation of the financial and non-financial information submitted by the assigned reporting units  Extraction and summarization of financial results of assigned segment / business unit from data reporting cubes  Analysis of financial and non-financial information of the assigned units / segment under the supervision of a performance management controller  Other ad-hoc reporting and analysis tasks / projects as may be assigned from time to time.       Profile:    Bachelor’s and master's degree in Finance or Economics  Past experience of working in a financial controlling, planning or analysis will be an advantage but is not mandatory  High level of proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, especially MS Excel is essential.  Familiarity with data cubes and other reporting tools / software is desirable.   High level of numeracy, an eye for detail, analytical ability and the ability to manage large sets of data is essential.  An interest and demonstrated aptitude and technical skills in managing and reporting data including experience with applications like Power BI, Excel VBA programming or similar skills in data analysis and reporting tools will be highly desirable  Fluent in English both in speaking and writing        Eligible for V.I.E. contract:      EU-country citizenship    Be aged under 29 (at the starting date of the contract)     Be willing to work abroad            Protection of Personal Data – Job Applicants     Personal Data at ArcelorMittal In Luxembourg is processed in compliance with applicable data protections laws including the European Union General Data Protection Regulation (“   GDPR   ”) and the ArcelorMittal Data Protection Policy and the ArcelorMittal Data Protection Procedure.    Personal Data contained within a candidate’s CV is processed by ArcelorMittal for the purposes of recruitment for positions advertised. Personal data will be disclosed only to persons involved in the recruitment and hiring process, including third party service providers in certain cases.    ArcelorMittal in Luxembourg retains Personal Data of shortlisted candidates contained in their CVs in its database for a maximum period of 12 months from the day the position for which they applied is filled.    This retained Personal Data of shortlisted candidates could be used (i) if the position for which they applied falls vacant during that 12-month period or (ii) another appropriate position becomes available.    In the event that the recruitment is for a position outside of the European Union (“   EU   ”) and ArcelorMittal in Luxembourg intends to send a candidate’s Personal Data collected in the EU by an ArcelorMittal EU subsidiary, outside of the EU, the candidate will be informed of (i) the recruiting legal entity (ii) the country of the recruiting company (iii) the fact that Personal Data is being transferred outside of the EU and (iv) the safeguards in place to protect their Personal Data – i.e the existence of binding corporate rules as prescribed by the GDPR.    Personal Data of candidates not shortlisted will not be retained by ArcelorMittal.    Candidates whose data is retained may exercise their rights of access, rectification, erasure and object to processing by sending an email to DataProtection@arcelorMittal.com.

job_description: THE COMPANY    KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics.       YOUR ROLE AT KIKO    We are looking for a  Demand Planning Analyst  to join KIKO MILANO’s Operations Team, reporting to the Demand Planning Manager.  Such talent will   ensure availability of products in KIKO central Warehouse, granting the product is in the right quantity, in the right place and at the right time without compromising the company goals on service level, inventory and obsolescence.     In particular, you will:   Define Demand Sales Forecasting and sales analysis of finished goods for stores, online/ e-commerce and franchising channels  Define central warehouse replenishment quantities for finished products and related raw materials  Grant the correct service level, optimizing inventory levels, in accordance with the commercial strategy for both baseline and promotions/events  Monitor and analyze KPIs and develop actions accordingly  Manage Stock analysis and stock mix optimization  Manage Slow moving analysis and shelf life management  Support the evolution of demand planning tool development        WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED     Degree in Engineering or Economics, with a strong focus on supply chain  2/3-year experience in a similar role in an international environment, having worked in the supply chain / demand&supply planning of a retail company is a plus  Strong analytical skills, ability to extrapolate and analyze data to drive problem solving, business recommendation and performance improvement  Fluent in English  Ms Office proficiency  Knowledge of SAP and Demand planning tools is plus        WE WOULD LOVE IF YOU HAD     Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams  Team player  Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organization  Ability to multi-task and be action oriented  Exercise independent judgement and decision-making  A solution-orientated mindset with the ability to work accurately at pace      KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99.  I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. title: Analytics Consultant - Marketing Effectiveness
skills: Skills: Английский язык, PowerPoint, +8 more
job_description: The Consultant is the "engine" of the Ebiquity Effectiveness practice.      Key activities:       Delivering accurate and appropriate analytic models using the tools and processes specified by team leaders (marketing mix model, price & promotion models etc.)  Processing and analysing media and sales data  Interpreting the analysis in order to create concise, insightful customer communications (presentations, documentation etc)  Continually accumulate and develop marketing effectiveness knowledge and expertise  Managing allocated tasks and avoid surprises by early identification/communication of potential problems and meeting deadlines  Demonstrating good team skills. Working enthusiastically to help colleagues.          Experience and Skills:       Have at least a Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Economics (with a strong focus on econometrics).  Strong numerate & analytical skills  Good knowledge of media & marketing and/or price & promotions  Competent with Excel, PowerPoint  Ideally has experience with databases  Programming in R would be advantageous  Be able to communicate in a professional environment  2-3 years’ experience, ideally in marketing mix modelling and consulting  Minimum level of English: C1 (being able to communicate and present in English)       Other Requirements:    Enthusiasm and ambition  Intellectually curious with an open mind, a self-starter, genuinely interested in data driven analysis  Team player, happy working in small groups  Applicants must be eligible/have a visa to work in Spain.        What we can offer:        We are a global forward-looking company which offers a range of opportunities for you to develop your skill set and career. In exchange for your contribution, we can offer you:         Competitive salary  Flexibility to work from home (required office present for training)  Training and Development Opportunities  Summer schedule July - Sept  6 hour work day on Fridays (9.00 – 15.00)  A company focus on wellbeing and work life balance including initiatives such as mental health support and regular health and wellbeing activities       About Ebiquity:      Ebiquity is the world leader in media investment analysis.  We harness the power of data to provide independent, fact-based advice, enabling brand owners to perfect media investment decisions and improve business outcomes.     We are a data-driven solutions company helping brand owners drive efficiency and effectiveness from their media spend, eliminating wastage and creating value. We provide analysis and solutions through five service lines:      Media Management  Media Performance  Marketing Effectiveness  Technology Advisory  Contract Compliance      More than 500 media specialists operate from our 18 offices across 16 countries, covering 80% of the global advertising market and that’s why we want the best talent available, regardless of race, religion, gender, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, disability or age.     Our core values are:     “Collaboration” - The foundation on which we build our business and we put people first, whether they are clients or colleagues  “Creativity” - We are consistently looking for new ways of doing things and new ways of thinking  “Clarity”- We prioritize clarity for our clients and colleagues in the way we work, leading with transparency  “Courage” - We have an unshakeable belief in what we are capable of together as a team.     These values articulate the behaviours that will enable us to deliver on our vision, they reflect our personality and they unite us. These values also drive us to embrace the rich impact that multiple approaches and different ways of thinking can bring.

job_description: Software in highly integrated electronic control units is the basis for inspiring customer experiences in the Digital Car. Feature development in the fields of e.g. autonomous driving and infotainment relies on BMW’s state-of-the-art and high-performance Software development platform. Within this central development platform, we collect, integrate and analyze data generated throughout the Software development process to identify potentials for improvement, monitor KPIs and develop data driven tools for developers as well as managers.      What awaits you?    Together with our process partners you develop and improve data assets for the analysis and optimization of our Software development processes. You direct the implementation of the data pipelines from the first PoC to production and accompany their operation and maintenance. You support our process partners with their analysis and visualization needs. University degree in computer science or a related technical field with a focus on data intensive applications.  Extended professional experience in architecting and implementing scalable data pipelines in cloud environments, preferably AWS (Amazon Web Services).  Experience with data analytics and modeling in relational as well as modern NoSQL and big data database systems.  Excellent programming skills in data related programming languages and frameworks, such as Python, Spark, SQL.  Familiarity with modern Software engineering concepts like DevOps, CI/CD and infrastructure as code and agile processes.  First experience with technical leadership is a plus  Know-how in advanced analytics and machine learning is a plus.  Business-fluent English. Applications via other channels (esp. e-mail) cannot be considered.      What we offer in Ulm?    Company car option.  English speaking teams in an intercultural setting.  Flexible organization of working times & mobile work arrangements.  High Work-Life Balance.  Career development & continuous personal qualification.  Relocation Services for our new employees.      At the BMW Group, we see diversity and inclusion in all its dimensions as a strength for our teams. Equal opportunities are a particular concern for us, and the equal treatment of applicants and employees is a fundamental principle of our corporate policy. Vous rejoindrez un collectif bienveillant qui s'inscrit dans une trajectoire de transformation ambitieuse qui repose sur la Data et la Data Science. Les équipes Data sont composées d’une quinzaine d’experts, et l’équipe Etudes et Data Science que vous rejoindrez est composée de 4 Data Scientist et 3 Data Analyst.     Vos missions :       Vous contribuez à la transformation digitale de l’entreprise (amélioration du tunnel de transformation des clients, optimisation des contenus et des contacts clients, accompagnement à la modernisation des processus internes)  Vous accompagnez l'équipe dans la montée en compétences sur les nouvelles technologies mises à disposition et des méthodes de développement associées (Gitlab, IDE type Pycharm ou Visual Studio, MLOPS, CI/CD)  Vous gérez de manière transverse un portefeuille de projets de Data Science de bout en bout (Cadrage, Réalisation de dossiers de décision, Collaboration avec les équipes IT/Métiers/Data Scientist/Analyst/Developer)   Vous élaborez des algorithmes de Data Science orientés résultats. Par exemple : Réalisation de cinématique de campagne marketing par l'IA (canal, contenus, fréquence, etc), Gérez et proposez les meilleurs contenus personnalisés en temps réel (Espace client, Offre tarifaire, etc), Priorisez le traitement commercial des dossiers, etc  Vous intervenez en tant que spécialiste auprès de cercles Data du Groupe Crédit Agricole, CA CF dans le cadre d’orientation stratégique de la Data.      Votre profil :       De formation Bac + 5 en Data Science/ML/Data engineer, vous êtes à l'aise avec les outils de développement d'algorithmes de Machine Learning. Vous avez pu mettre en œuvre ces compétences sur des projets transformant et à valeur (Interne dans une entreprise possédants ses outils ou en tant que consultant/Freelance)   Vous êtes en capacité à vous mettre au service du collectif, et êtes à l'aise avec la vulgarisation de votre savoir-faire  Force de proposition, vous capitalisez sur vos expériences pour identifier les risques et les opportunités de chaque projet  Vous avez une expérience de plus de 5 ans sur un poste similaire, une expérience en Marketing serait un plus  Vous maîtrisez les langages Python, SQL, êtes à l’aise avec Gitlab et un IDE (Pycharm, Visual Studio) et avec les méthodes de Devops (MLOPS)  Vous avez envie de rejoindre une équipe dynamique, bienveillante avec une trajectoire très ambitieuse sur les deux prochaines années  Management Projet/équipe possible à horizon court/moyen terme

title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
skills: Skills: SSIS, SQL, +8 more
job_description: WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN?   DocuWare stands for globally distributed, international teams and an open corporate culture that invites you to help shape it. Mobile Work and flexible working hours are part of our everyday life. Would you like to be part of an innovative company whose solutions are digitizing everyday work in a wide range of industries? In that case, we are happy to welcome you to the team.      YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES   As Data Engineer (m/f/d) you will be part of our Data Engineering team and implement and maintain ETL/ELT pipelines within our cloud-based Data Warehouse infrastructure in Azure.     Your responsibilities will include:       You implement and maintain ETL pipelines in Azure Data Factory.   Implementing data transformations using SSIS and Azure Data Factory is also part of your responsibilities.  You will work with a variety of data sources to ingest data into our data warehouse.  Stakeholder and consumer requirements are analyzed by you to design ideal data models for their reporting and data analysis needs.  You provide support to our users of the data warehouse via our internal helpdesk system.          WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED    You already have several years (5+) of professional experience in the field of data processing with a focus on data integration and data transformation and project delivery.  You bring very good knowledge of SQL (T-SQL), SSIS and Azure Data Factory with you.  You have already gained experience with the integration of third-party data sources via web APIs.  You are characterized by a willingness to work with unfamiliar data structures from a variety of business areas.  Furthermore, you are known for your ability to work in a team and willingness to teach the other team members about the data area.  You have a very good command of written and spoken English; German would be helpful.          WHAT WE CAN OFFER   There are many great reasons to join DocuWare - our company culture is only one of them.  As part of the DocuWare team, you will benefit from many advantages:    Globally distributed, international teams:  You will find our teams working in Germering, New York, Sofia or other worldwide locations.   Flexible work location and hours:  You can work on the road or in our modern office - and you have the flexibility to arrange your own working hours.   Individual support:  After an intensive induction, you will receive regular training tailored to your needs (e.g. conferences internal team building measures, Udemy courses).   Well-earned rest:  35 vacation days per year, sport offerings, massages, a foosball table and a relaxing lounge area.   Healthy food:  Together we enjoy Fairtrade coffee with organic milk or oat milk, snacks and fresh fruit - all free of charge - as well as subsidized lunch from the Foodji fridge.   Good accessibility:  Choose how you would like to come to the office with a leased e-bike, by train or via highways A96/A99 (you can charge your e-car on site for free).   Team spirit:  Regular employee and team events (virtual or on-site) ensure excellent collaboration with colleagues around the world.   Sustainability and social commitment:  DocuWare stands for paperless work and supports volunteer organizations and local sports clubs.   Your health matters:  DocuWare subsidizes your company pension plan!  Lastly, and most importantly, we offer a  stable job  with a well established and growing company.          Patricia Schaal   Recruiting Specialist & Employer Branding

SOGETI (Part of CAPGEMINI) ce sont de beaux projets dans tous les secteurs, un département recherche en interne, des expertises centers, la possibilité de suivre des formations certifiantes, d’évoluer au sein du groupe (via Pass Carrière), de profiter de mobilité, d’avoir un management de proximité (avec un Team Manager dédié), mais aussi de profiter d’un comité d'entreprise, de prime (vacances, cooptation, apport d'affaires), d’un PEG, d’une carte ticket restaurant, d’un pass navigo remboursé à 50% etc.        Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ce descriptif n'hésitez pas à postuler

job_description: Mediabrands est la division médias d’Interpublic Group (IPG), 4ème groupe de communication mondial.
