Mediabrands compte parmi ses clients certaines des marques les plus emblématiques dans un large éventail de secteurs. Le groupe emploie plus de 13 000 experts en marketing dans plus de 130 pays.   En France, Mediabrands compte 210 talents, a la plus forte croissance du marché français et a été récompensé 3 fois par le titre d’Agence Média de l’Année.   Pour accompagner nos équipes, nous recherchons un(e) assistant(e) Data Analyst en alternance (apprentissage ou de professionnalisation).     Key Responsibilities     Sous la responsabilité de la data analyst director, vous intégrerez le département Consumer Insight & Analytics en charge de l’alimentation de l’agence Initiative en études et outils, sur les problématiques d’analyse de données et d’efficacité media.    3 types de missions vous seront attribués en fonction des besoins de l’équipe.      Dans le cadre des sondages menés pour le compte de nos clients de manière régulière :  Prise de connaissance et compréhension des besoins de l’enquête  Proposition de plan de traitement  Importation des données, recodifications, fusions, redressements  Tris croisés  Import des résultats dans une base de données de benchmark.  Rédaction des présentations d’analyse.  Dans le cadre de l’analyse de données faite de manière ponctuelle :  Traitement des données  Analyses statistiques entre investissements media et impact sur les KPIs de marques ou de ventes.  Dans le cadre de la mise en place d’outils pour l’agence, mise en place d’un outil d’attribution de budget entre partenaires pour optimiser les retombées, projet long terme structurant pour l’agence.     Ainsi vous mettrez en application vos acquis techniques avec pour objectif une meilleure appréhension du fonctionnement de la publicité. La diversité des marchés étudiés et des problématiques traitées vous fera découvrir la richesse des études media.     Desired Skills & Experience     Diplômé au minimum d’une licence en statistique, traitements et analyse de la donnée.   De nature analytique, logique, méthodique et rigoureuse   Proactif, curieux, excellent relationnel, sens du service, flexible   Capacité d’anticipation et de gestion de plusieurs sujets en même temps   Connaissance des logiciels statistiques R Studio et SPSS.   Excellente maîtrise des outils bureautiques : PowerPoint, Word, Excel   La connaissance du VBA pour Excel serait un plus.   Alternance de 1 an    COMPETENCE INFORMATIQUE      Connaissance des logiciels statistiques R Studio et SPSS.  Excellente maîtrise des outils bureautiques : PowerPoint, Word, Excel  La connaissance du VBA pour Excel serait un plus.      LANGUES    Anglais B1 (intermédiaire supérieur)    AVANTAGES      Poste éligible au télétravail (50%)  Indemnités télétravail  Participation  Restauration d'entreprise      Rejoignez une agence labellisé Great Place To Work !    Plus d'informations :https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/ipg-mediabrands     About Us     Mediabrands c’est 13 000 experts dans 130 pays qui gèrent et investissent 37 milliards de $.   Un but : résoudre les challenges business de leurs clients et de mettre en place des stratégies de communication innovantes et efficaces, data-driven et créatives, dans un monde en pleine transformation digitale.

title: Data Scientist (f/m/d)
skills: Skills: Компьютерная наука, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: As part of our tech team, you will build software to help our customers combat one of the biggest contributors to global warming: food waste.  With this goal in mind, you will build and expand our predictive analytics platform which is already changing the way large food service providers manage their operations. You will work with a tightly knit team of talented developers in the fields of machine learning, backend and frontend development. We offer you a visionary, innovative environment and give you the support and tools you need to succeed. In our fast growing team there is plenty of room for personal development!  Are you ready to build Delicious Data with us and change the world for the better? We are looking forward to getting to know you!   Tasks   As a Data Scientist, you're part of the ML team that lies at the core of our value proposal: Across Germany, our forecasts are used for automating and optimizing purchasing in 100s of stores. Continuously improving our forecasting accuracy is critical to our mission success and your experience and ideas will enable us to expand our customer base quickly while continuously expanding our feature set.  At Delicious Data you will:   Enjoy working in a tightly knit team to build a data driven solution that positively impacts our planet's future.  You will make use of our large datasets to create valuable models that save tonnes of food from being wasted every day  Exchange code reviews with your team members.  Bring models into production, monitor them and iterate upon your observations to improve their performance.     Requirements    You have a masters degree in Computer Science or some related field.  You have passion for writing software with emphasis on quality, testability and automation.  You have solid experience working on timeseries data and forecasting problems  Tools like Pandas, scikit-learn, Pytorch are second nature to you  Preferred qualifications: Redis, GitLab CI, PostgreSQL  You are passionate about your work and love to collaborate with others  You can speak English at a C1 level.     Benefits    Room for creative solutions and personal initiative.  Experience ownership in our low hierarchy organization.  Work with the hardware of your choice.  We offer you a competitive compensation package (salary, benefits and virtual shares).  Use your annual development budget of 1,000 euros for attending conferences or courses, buying books, getting a coach etc.  We pay for your public transportation costs or an e-bike    We are looking forward to getting to know you!

title: Banking Operations Specialist
skills: Skills: Связи с поставщиками, Финансовые услуги, +2 more
job_description: Il nostro scopo?     Essere la fintech bank di riferimento per le PMI italiane, offrendo esperienze finanziarie digitali e innovative        Cosa abbiamo fatto fino ad ora?     Siamo una fintech che cresce velocissima! In soli due anni abbiamo ottenuto la licenza bancaria, siamo stati due volte tra LinkedIn Top Startups (al 1° e 2° posto), abbiamo lanciato 6 prodotti completamente digitali, superato i 6000 clienti e i 300 milioni € di finanziamenti erogati. In poco tempo abbiamo costruito un brand giovane e solido.    Siamo 80+ AideXer: motivati, sperimentatori e pronti ad innovare il modo di fare banca!      Come  Banking Operations Specialist  sarai inserit* nell’area Back Office Operations e parteciperai alla gestione dei processi di back office relativi ai prodotti transazionali e lending, gestirai il presidio di primo livello AML e i rapporti con i fornitori esterni.     Il team è formato da 5 persone ed è guidato da un Head of Operations che ti supporterà e guiderà nelle attività quotidiane e in occasione delle progettualità più complesse.       🚀Le tue attività     All’interno del team, ti occuperai di:    Supportare e contribuire all'esecuzione delle attività di finalizzazione del processo di acquisizione della clientela e dell'operatività transazionale lungo tutto il ciclo di vita del prodotto  Supportare e monitorare l'applicazione dei livelli di servizio e monitoraggio delle attività in carico alle terze parti  Collaborare nella corretta gestione del processo di adeguata verifica e dei controlli di primo livello in ambito antiriciclaggio        🧬Le tue caratteristiche      L’AideXer che fa per noi:     Ha esperienza nella gestione, analisi e revisione dei processi di back office – Ambito prodotti transazionali e strumenti di pagamento oppure lending, maturata in Banca o Istituti di Moneta Elettronica. (Must Have);  Mindset digital e orientato all‘innovazione per supportare il team nella costruzione di processi efficaci;  Ottima capacità di ragionamento e approccio analitico, per analizzare i processi con un approccio data driven, misurandone KPI e impatti;  Precisione e orientamento al cliente per guidare ogni decisione e miglioramento;  Capacità di lavorare in team, all'interno dell'area Operations e con altri dipartimenti (product, sales, compliance)        🏆Cosa ti offriamo     Contratto a tempo indeterminato;  Buoni pasto;  Assicurazione sanitaria integrativa per te e per la tua famiglia;  Previdenza complementare integrativa;   Approccio ibrido : Ci piace trascorrere dei momenti insieme in Casa X, il nostro ufficio nel 💚 di Milano, che sono l'occasione per fare finalmente una pausa caffè, partecipare a workshop e parlarsi senza essere in mute! Ci piace anche prenderci dei momenti in solitaria da remoto per quella presentazione piena di numeri che richiede un alto grado di concentrazione.   Flex days:  40 giorni l'anno in cui poter lavorare in qualsiasi parte del mondo, basta avere una buona connessione e un fuso orario allineato alle attività lavorative.  L’opportunità unica di partecipare attivamente al nostro sviluppo e alla nostra crescita partendo dalle fondamenta;  La possibilità di costruire la tua professionalità interfacciandoti con colleghi di grande esperienza nel panorama bancario e digitale italiano;  Un ambiente di lavoro altamente sfidante e davvero formativo, in cui il tuo contributo sarà fondamentale;  L’occasione di contribuire a rivoluzionare i servizi finanziari per chi fa impresa in Italia e contribuire così alla ripresa del nostro Paese.       Valutiamo con molta attenzione tutte le candidature ricevute e apprezziamo moltissimo l’interesse per il nostro progetto. Se questa opportunità sarà allineata al tuo profilo sarai presto ricontattat*. Altrimenti terremo presente il tuo profilo anche per future ricerche.

title: Finance Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Gigafactory Berlin
skills: Skills: Модели данных, Панель управления, +8 more
job_description: What To Expect  Gigafactory Berlin-Brandenburg marks a defining moment in Europe for Tesla’s mission of accelerating the world’s transition to sustainable energy. Tesla’s European Finance Team continues to grow with the business, currently focusing current energies on working effectively with operations to control costs, ensure sustainable growth, and embed efficient and robust processes; becoming a globally recognised finance team.  We are looking for a Financial Data Analyst who is a strong and enthusiastic addition to our exciting, dynamic and international team; capable of working independently and collectively in an environment that offers creative freedom   What You’ll Do    Perform rigorous data profiling on large, complex data sets and provide insights into data quality issues, and recommendations on corrective/preventive actions based on findings .  Create clean, reliable, and scalable “single-source-of-truth” data reports by partnering with IT and business teams to address data issues in upstream systems and document data lineage, business rationale, and KPI definitions.  Work cross functionally to build visualization reporting and analysis – improve efficiencies and presentation of data retrieved from internal systems.  Create automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance.  Keep it simple – ensure, where possible, improvements can be rolled out quickly with minimal effort for the business.  Provide basic training to team members; ensuring they can take ownership of data models and dashboards.  Support the wider Finance team, in achieving real time monthly closing without compromising accounting quality and accuracy.     What You’ll Bring    Experience in finance / IT industries  Academic degree in Data Analysis / Programming / Statistics or comparable experience  Advanced knowledge and experience in using Excel BI and VBA; languages including Power Query (M), PowerPivot (DAX)  Evidence of working with Microsoft BI stack: SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS Multidimensional (MDX), SSAS Tabular (DAX), PowerBI or similar tools  Knowledge of Python-based data visualization packages and tools  Working experience of MS-SQL and MySQL: relational and non-relational database  Excellent communication skills in English    You will be working in our state-of-the-art Gigafactory where you’ll solve the world's most interesting problems with the best and brightest people who share a passion to change the world. Tesla’s compensation package includes a competitive salary and Tesla shares or bonuses. Typical benefits that we provide are 30 vacation days, an occupational pension, employee life and disability insurances, free EV charging, product discounts and various transportation benefits.  #Finance

title: DATA ANALYST
skills: None
job_description: MIS & Reporting Analyst  Country: Spain   What You Will Be Doing    GETNET está buscando un/a  DATA ANALYST  para nuestras oficinas en Boadilla del Monte.    POR QUÉ DEBERÍAS CONSIDERAR ESTA OPORTUNIDAD    GETNET  es la entidad dedicada a la adquisición y emisión de medios de pago.  La compañía global que te ayudará a innovar en los pagos de tu negocio con una tecnología avanzada y la experiencia de Santander.  En Santander (www.santander.com) somos actores principales en la transformación del sector financiero. ¿Quieres unirte a nuestro equipo?  Santander se enorgullece de ser una organización donde hay igualdad de oportunidades, independientemente de raza, sexo, religión, edad, orientación sexual, estado civil discapacidad, nacionalidad o identidad de género.   QUÉ HARÁS EN TU TRABAJO   Como  Data Analyst , tu objetivo será el desarrollo y automatización de informes y cuadros de mando, asegurando la calidad de los datos y la extracción y análisis de la información de negocio a través de herramientas de BI y gestores de bbdd.  Necesitamos a alguien como tú para que nos ayude en distintos ámbitos:   Reporting     Actualizar, automatizar y auditar Cuadros de Mando e Informes con la finalidad de permitir realizar seguimiento de los distintos indicadores del negocio.    Gestión de la demanda de solicitudes puntuales de información de las diferentes áreas de la compañía, proporcionando conocimiento técnico y analizando y auditando los resultados proporcionados.    Creación de cuadros de mando y programación de los mismos en entornos de BI.      Análisis y control de información      Extracción y análisis de información.    Desarrollo e implantación de procesos de auditorías internas de todos los informes y aplicativos recurrentes.    Análisis puntuales sobre información comercial y de negocio.       EXPERIENCIA    1-2 años como analista de Información de Gestión / Programador / Gestión y explotación de BBDD / Desarrollo CdM en herramientas de BI    EDUCACIÓN     Licenciatura/Grado Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería.    HABILIDADES & CONOCIMIENTOS     Sistemas de gestión base de datos (SQL)  Herramientas BI (Power BI)  Conocimientos Visual Basic  Conocimientos altos de las aplicaciones de ofimática que ofrece la plataforma Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).  Nivel B2-C2 de INGLÉS    OTRA INFORMACIÓN     Si quieres conocer más sobre nosotros, síguenos en https://www.getneteurope.com/es.

job_description: Type de contrat   Stage     QUI SOMMES-NOUS     Avec 90 000 collaborateurs présents sur les cinq continents, SUEZ est un leader mondial dans la gestion intelligente et durable des ressources. Le Groupe fournit des solutions de gestion de l'eau et des déchets qui permettent aux villes et aux industries d’optimiser la gestion de leurs ressources et d’améliorer leurs performances environnementale et économique.     VOTRE MISSION       Contexte Du Stage     Ce stage s’inscrit dans le cadre de la restructuration de Suez, basé sur un nouveau système managérial ainsi que le développement de solutions de monitoring, à échelle internationale pour toutes les activités. Il vise à étudier, proposer et implémenter une nouvelle version de tableaux de bords de performance financière et/ou opérationnelle. title: Data Analyst (Product Data Analyst)
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Математика, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬 From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights  Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

title: Supply Chain Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Коммуникация, Решение задач, +6 more
job_description: Job Description     NI is seeking a Supply Chain Data Analyst in a team who are responsible for a high-quality information ecosystem that enables Supply Chain stakeholders to make better decisions more efficiently every day. This role supports a flexible work arrangement, including remote work (upto 4 days in a week and 1 day in office) and in-person work.     Core Job Responsibilities       Partner with other teams to outline business needs into data requirements.   Translate ambiguous business requirements into measurable insights with an emphasis on accuracy.   Work alongside our Supply Chain teams to recommend changes related to data setup and maintenance to improve process efficiencies.   Help solve strategic challenges facing NI through data using various technologies, languages, and analytical methods to provide actionable insights that support business decisions.   Envision & design an entire portfolio of dashboards to help leadership to lead the of Supply Chain.   Combine information with standards of design & performance to drive dashboard usability.   Provide subject matter expertise to determine appropriate data values when conflicts arise.  Balance statistical models and Machine Learning models to provide business-pertinent insights.   Integrate data from multiple sources to produce requested or required data elements.   Partner with other areas of Global Supply Chain to leverage data to drive key sales processes.   Develop standard procedures, user guides, and other training and job aid materials.  Lead and work on regional and global projects.       Requirements       Bachelor's Degree with an emphasis in business, economics, math, engineering or analytics (or relevant work experience). Advanced degree is a plus.   Minimum of 2 years of advanced reporting, and/ or programming experience in SQL   Minimum of 1 year of Tableau development experience. Experienced in Tableau features, Data Optimization, and a keen eye for design.   Proficiency with MS Excel, MS Word, and PowerPoint.   Technical mindset to understand system issues, data, and touchpoints   Solution driven with strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills   Capability to communicate clearly and with various types of audiences (team members, management, and senior leadership)   Needs to be comfortable piloting new technologies and determining if they would have a place within the larger team's tech stack.   Knowledge of Supply Chain business environment preferred.  Knowledge of KINAXIS Rapid Response Dashboard Authoring preferred.       About Us      Miért az NI?    Számos oka van annak, hogy fontolóra vedd a vállalatunkhoz való csatlakozást.   Kulcsfontosságú számunkra az emberek kapcsolata, az ötletek és a technológia. Az NI-nál hiszünk abban, hogy ezt a három tényezőt összekapcsolva megteremthetjük a siker felé vezető utat.   Az emberek: Kíváncsi és kreatív problémamegoldókat keresünk, akik értékelik a sokféleséget és a friss perspektívákat, merészek, kedvesek, valamint szívesen megragadják a lehetőségeket.   Az ötletek: Mi szerettél volna lenni felnőttként? Robotokat akartál programozni? Repülő autókat építeni? Jobbá tenni a világot? Az NI-nál az álmodozók nagy ötleteire építünk, hogy elképzeléseiket megvalósíthassák.   A technológia: Testreszabott, szoftver-központú megközelítésünkkel támogatjuk ügyfeleinket a termékfejlesztési ciklus minden szakaszában. Az 5G-től és az orvosi innovációktól kezdve az autonóm vezetésig és az űrutazás jövőjéig minden nap ambiciózusan, az Engineer Ambitiously mottó jegyében segítünk ügyfeleinknek.   Már hosszú ideje kiemelkedő munkaadóként ismernek el minket világszerte.   Kompenzációink és juttatásaink versenyképesek, csakúgy, mint a modern munkaterületeink, a karrierfejlesztési és mobilitási lehetőségeink, valamint a kultúra, amely elősegíti a hovatartozást és hangsúlyozza a közösség fontosságát.   Arra biztatjuk a csapattársainkat, hogy lépjenek ki az épp fennálló helyzetből és működjenek együtt másokkal, hogy innovatív megoldásokat hozzanak létre.   Függetlenül attól, hogy a karriered hol jár, mi érted, egymásért és a következő generáció innovátoraiért vagyunk, azokért, akik nagyobbat álmodnak, magasabb célokat tűznek ki és gyorsabban haladnak.   Készen állsz, hogy segíts az emberiség formázásában az elkövetkezendő 100 évben? Ha igen, álljunk is neki, és ne feledd: Engineer Ambitiously!

title: Traineeship data analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +6 more
job_description: Ben jij (bijna) klaar met je studie, heb jij een passie voor werken met data en ben je klaar voor een vliegende start van je carrière? Lees dan snel verder!  Als data analist ben jij bezig met het verzamelen, analyseren en controleren van data. Je hoeft hier nog geen ervaring in te hebben, want wij leiden jou, betaald, op tot data analist! Dit doen we door je een opleiding aan te bieden, maar ook een plek om te werken zodat je jouw geleerde kennis direct in de praktijk kan uitoefenen.  Je wordt vanaf dag 1 betaald!   Tijdens deze training word jij opgeleid tot volledig professional. Je behaalt erkende certificaten die goed staan op je cv. Binnen dit opleidingstraject zal je in ongeveer 1 maand klaargestoomd worden om aan de slag te gaan als data analist. Je krijgt de kans om als  young professional  gedetacheerd te worden bij verschillende internationale partijen.    Wat Breng Je Mee     Een (bijna) afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding  Een IT- of bèta-achtergrond is een pré  Een drive om in de IT-branche te werken  Je bent initiatiefrijk, communicatief vaardig, analytisch en flexibel ingesteld  Je hebt een ‘’hands-on’’ mentaliteit  Vloeiende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal     Wat Bieden Wij    Je komt terecht in een warme, hechte en gezellige organisatie. Er is veel ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en we zullen je blijven uitdagen om het beste uit jezelf te halen. Verder bieden wij jou:   Elke maand een gezellige borrel met alle data analisten die via Walters People werken   Vanaf dag 1 een salaris van 3000,- bruto per maand obv 40 uur  Betaalde opleiding  25 vakantiedagen  8% vakantiegeldtoeslag  Een goede pensioenregeling  Reiskostenvergoeding     Startdatum Traineeship    Je krijgt bij je start direct een contract, daarom starten de traineeships altijd de eerste van de maand. De volgende startdata's zijn nog mogelijk;   1 september 2023  1 november 2023    Hoe werkt de procedure?   Via de button op deze pagina kan je je aanmelden. Heb je jouw cv niet bij de hand, dan komt deze later wel! Na het aanmelden bellen we met je en nodigen wij je graag uit bij ons op kantoor.

title: Data Analyst für Customer Analytics (m/w/d)
skills: Skills: Панель управления, Salesforce.com, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                               Bei StepStone haben wir eine einfache, dennoch sehr wichtige Mission: Als eine der führenden Online-Jobplattformen helfen wir jedem, den richtigen Job zu finden. Dafür brauchen wir Dich!  Um unsere Mission zu erreichen, suchen wir aktuell weitere Unterstützung für unser Sales in der Rolle des  Data Analyst für Customer Analytics   (m/w/d)  in  Münster . Als Teil des Customer Analytics Teams erarbeitest Du ein tiefgründiges und ganzheitliches Kundenverständnis mithilfe verschiedener Parameter & Kennzahlen (Potentiale, Umsatz, Performance, Wettbewerb etc.), um die Erreichung der Unternehmensziele sicherzustellen sowie weiterhin auf Wachstumskurs zu bleiben.  Wir sind ein internationaler und globaler Arbeitgeber, daher ist Chancengleichheit für uns wichtig. Wir freuen uns auf Bewerbungen von Müttern, Vätern, Menschen mit Behinderung und Menschen aus der LGBTQIA+ Community. Bitte teile uns mit, wenn wir z.B. ein geschlechtsneutrales Pronomen verwenden sollen, Du einen barrierefreien Zugang zu unseren Büros benötigst oder wir mehr Zeit für den Bewerbungsprozess einplanen sollen.  Wir sind immer daran interessiert, mit großartigen Menschen zusammenzuarbeiten. Klicke einfach den „Ich bin interessiert“ Button – Wir freuen uns auf Dich!   Aufgaben    Du verantwortest die Aggregation & Verknüpfung verschiedener Daten und Datenquellen auf Kundenebene  Aus den mehrdimensionalen Daten entwickelst Du Zielbilder für unseren Vertrieb sowie wesentlichen Stakeholdern  Du identifizierst mithilfe der Daten neue Wachstumsfelder und machst StepStone noch erfolgreicher  Du erstellst Visualisierungen und beherrschst wesentliche Parameter zu verarbeiten und zeitgleich auf das Wesentliche zu reduzieren  Auf Basis Deiner Analysen schaffst Du einen tiefgründigen Wissenstransfer, in dem Du Sales, Service- und Kundenperspektive zusammenbringst  Du übernimmst die Verantwortung für Performance- und B2B-Marketing Dashboards  Dabei bist Du wichtiger Inputgeber und Sparringspartner für unsere vielfältigen Analyse- und BI-Teams    Profil    Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium Bereich Informatik, Statistik, Mathematik, Physik, Wirtschaftsinformatik bzw. eine vergleichbare Ausbildung wünschenswert, aber kein must-have  Mind. 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung mit Visualisierungsplattformen, Power BI und/oder Tableau von Vorteil  Tiefgründiges Datenverständnis mit dem absoluten Willen, das Unternehmen und Menschen erfolgreicher zu machen  Ausgeprägtes Wissen über Datenstrukturen und Datenbanken (MySQL)  Idealerweise verfügst Du über Wissen in Python, SQL & Sales Force  Fähigkeit, komplexe Ergebnisse & Insights in Businesssprache zu übersetzen    Wir bieten    Dein Start bei StepStone: Wir wollen, dass Du Dich von Anfang an wohl fühlst und Du direkt mit dem Netzwerken starten kannst. Deshalb geht's bei uns immer mit einer mehrtägigen Onboarding-Veranstaltung los, während der Du Deine neuen Kolleg*innen, unsere Produkte und unsere Kultur kennenlernst. Danach geht's in Deinem Fachbereich weiter – mit einer mehrwöchigen, individuellen Einarbeitung.   Deine Weiterentwicklung: Wir wachsen – und wollen natürlich, dass Du mit uns wächst. Dabei unterstützen wir Dich mit zielgerichteten Trainings, die Dich in Deiner persönlichen und fachlichen Entwicklung weiterbringen.   Big Player mit Start-up-Flair: Auch wenn wir ganz schön groß geworden sind, haben wir unsere Lockerheit aus den Anfangstagen nicht verloren. Das heißt konkret: Wir duzen uns, haben kurze Kommunikationswege, flache Hierarchien und super hilfsbereite Kolleg*innen.   Social Days: Reden ist Silber, Handeln ist Gold – genau deshalb haben bei uns alle Mitarbeiter*innen 2 Social Days im Jahr. Diese können flexibel für soziales und nachhaltiges Engagement eingesetzt werden. Und das Beste daran: Du musst dir dafür keinen Urlaub nehmen.   Urlaubstage: Wo wir gerade beim Thema Urlaub sind… Bei uns gibt's 30 Tage Urlaub im Jahr plus einen Brauchtumstag. Außerdem sind Weihnachten und Silvester bei uns immer frei.   Unser Standort? Am Medienhafen! Das heißt für Dich, wir sind gut erreichbar – ob mit dem Auto, der Bahn oder mit dem Fahrrad. Übrigens: Parkplatz oder Jobticket werden 50 % von uns gesponsert.   Jobbike: Und auch für alle Radler*innen haben wir gute News: Mit unserem Jobbike-Angebot unterstützen wir Dich, schnell und nachhaltig in unser Office zu kommen (nach einem Jahr Betriebszugehörigkeit).   Mobile Office: Auch das ist bei uns möglich! In der Regel bieten wir Dir zwei Tage mobiles Arbeiten pro Woche. Frag gerne direkt im Interview, wie die Regelung für Deine Rolle ist.   Du stehst auf Fitness? Prima! Ob in unserem eigenen Fitness-Studio, beim Beachvolleyball oder beim Lauftraining – mit unseren vielfältigen Sportangeboten hältst Du Dich fit.   Lust auf Kaffee? Dann schau mal bei unseren hauseigenen Baristas vorbei. Ob Caramello, Cortado oder Flat White laktosefrei – hier wird Dir alles kostenlos und frisch gebrüht. Apropos frisch, natürlich gibt's bei uns auch jeden Tag frisches Obst.   Unsere Hauspost: Schlange stehen ist nicht Dein Ding? Dann lass Dir Deine Pakete doch einfach ins Office liefern.   Noch mehr Benefits: Weihnachtsfeier, Sommerparty, Teamevents, Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge oder super Angebote zu Großkundenkonditionen (z. B. für Mobilfunkverträge, Sixt und Hotelbuchungen bei HRS) – unsere Liste ist lang. Da ist bestimmt auch für Dich etwas dabei!

Learn more                                We are now looking for an Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) to join our busy Marketing and Communications team based in the City of London, with hybrid working!    The Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) will be responsible for data interpretation and behavioural analysis across multiple channels, and identification of trends in the financial services sector, building a solid foundation on which to make suggestions for content.   This insight coupled with a strategic approach to digital data will help inform the Marketing and Communications team’s strategy.    Salary:  £14,000 - £20,000 depending on the hours you work and your skills and experience (£30,000 - £36,000 Full time equivalent).    Hours of Work:  Part-time, 16-20 hours per week (Tuesdays are office based and ideally Thursdays, with remaining hours completed remotely)     Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) Duties       Conduct research to provide insights into user sentiments on key trends and advise on future content creation.  Provide key insight from internal and external sources to inform content and business decisions  Use data tools and research to answer key business questions  Advocate for CISI members through content selection  Work collaboratively with colleagues across the Marketing and Communications team, IT, and other departments  Pull together multiple data sources to create a coherent story or outcome  Work with the UX team to present CISI content in a digestible and coherent way  Track content to provide management information       Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms)Requirements      You must be a self-starter with:      5 + years’ relevant experience  Experience ideally gained in the professional services sector  A proven track record of working successfully with corporate clients  A proven track record of delivering results against KPIs and deadlines  Have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  A passion for data and research  Energy, personal stature and interpersonal skills to represent the Institute and maintain relationships at all levels  Excellent organisational skills  Strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of Google Analytics, Excel, MS office packages and MS Power BI  The ability to interpret data in such a way as to enhance the CISI membership offering       Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) Benefits      We offer a competitive remuneration package, which includes:      7½% company pension contribution into a personal pension, in addition to your own contribution of 1½% via salary exchange  Life insurance and income protection insurance  A Wellness Allowance of up to £30 a month  26 days pro-rata for part-time and the institute closes for three days between Christmas and New Year.  A travel allowance after passing probation which has a minimum value of £2,500 per annum (pro rata for part-time)  After one year’s service, private medical insurance cover, and annual travel insurance  Cover (pro-rata for part-time)      If you think that you are suitable for this Data Analyst (Marketing & Comms) position, please apply now!    We value the contribution that employees with different views and experience bring to the Institute and are committed to promoting equity, inclusion and diversity. We hope to receive applications from a wide range of talented people irrespective of their race, religion or belief, gender, age, gender identity, neurodiversity, disability, sexual orientation, ethnic origin, political belief, social class, relationship status or caring responsibilities.   The Chartered Institute for Securities & Investment is the leading professional body for securities, investment, wealth and financial planning professionals. Formed in 1992 by London Stock Exchange practitioners, we have a global community, which aims to promote high standards of competence and integrity to more than 43,500 members in 116 countries. We are also the main examining body for the sector, offering our internationally recognised exams globally.   Our purpose is  “To champion lifelong learning and integrity, raising individual standards of knowledge, skills and behaviour globally to enhance public trust and confidence in financial services.”

job_description: Mediabrands est la division médias d’Interpublic Group (IPG), 4ème groupe de communication mondial. Mediabrands compte parmi ses clients certaines des marques les plus emblématiques dans un large éventail de secteurs. Le groupe emploie plus de 13 000 experts en marketing dans plus de 130 pays.   En France, Mediabrands compte 210 talents, a la plus forte croissance du marché français et a été récompensé 3 fois par le titre d’Agence Média de l’Année.   Pour accompagner nos équipes, nous recherchons un(e) assistant(e) Data Analyst en alternance (apprentissage ou de professionnalisation).     Key Responsibilities     Sous la responsabilité de la data analyst director, vous intégrerez le département Consumer Insight & Analytics en charge de l’alimentation de l’agence Initiative en études et outils, sur les problématiques d’analyse de données et d’efficacité media.    3 types de missions vous seront attribués en fonction des besoins de l’équipe.      Dans le cadre des sondages menés pour le compte de nos clients de manière régulière :  Prise de connaissance et compréhension des besoins de l’enquête  Proposition de plan de traitement  Importation des données, recodifications, fusions, redressements  Tris croisés  Import des résultats dans une base de données de benchmark.  Rédaction des présentations d’analyse.  Dans le cadre de l’analyse de données faite de manière ponctuelle :  Traitement des données  Analyses statistiques entre investissements media et impact sur les KPIs de marques ou de ventes.  Dans le cadre de la mise en place d’outils pour l’agence, mise en place d’un outil d’attribution de budget entre partenaires pour optimiser les retombées, projet long terme structurant pour l’agence.     Ainsi vous mettrez en application vos acquis techniques avec pour objectif une meilleure appréhension du fonctionnement de la publicité. La diversité des marchés étudiés et des problématiques traitées vous fera découvrir la richesse des études media.     Desired Skills & Experience     Diplômé au minimum d’une licence en statistique, traitements et analyse de la donnée.   De nature analytique, logique, méthodique et rigoureuse   Proactif, curieux, excellent relationnel, sens du service, flexible   Capacité d’anticipation et de gestion de plusieurs sujets en même temps   Connaissance des logiciels statistiques R Studio et SPSS.   Excellente maîtrise des outils bureautiques : PowerPoint, Word, Excel   La connaissance du VBA pour Excel serait un plus.   Alternance de 1 an    COMPETENCE INFORMATIQUE      Connaissance des logiciels statistiques R Studio et SPSS.  Excellente maîtrise des outils bureautiques : PowerPoint, Word, Excel  La connaissance du VBA pour Excel serait un plus.      LANGUES    Anglais B1 (intermédiaire supérieur)    AVANTAGES      Poste éligible au télétravail (50%)  Indemnités télétravail  Participation  Restauration d'entreprise      Rejoignez une agence labellisé Great Place To Work !    Plus d'informations :https://www.welcometothejungle.com/fr/companies/ipg-mediabrands     About Us     Mediabrands c’est 13 000 experts dans 130 pays qui gèrent et investissent 37 milliards de $. title: Data Analyst
skills: None
job_description: Job Title:   Data Analyst   Location:   Bristol, UK – Working from home options available   Compensation:   £39,408 - £44,044 + Benefits   Role Type:   Full time / Permanent   Role ID:   SF 46740   Creating Change Together   At Babcock we’re working to create a safe and secure world, together, and if you join us, you can play your part as a Data Analyst at our Bristol site.  As an international defence company, we support and enhance our customers’ defence and security capabilities and critical assets, meeting their requirements of value for money, increased availability, modernisation and flexibility.   Babcock International and Devonport    The Data Analyst role is based within our Devonport Royal Dockyard business area.  Comprising of 14 dry docks, four miles of waterfront and 25 tidal berths, Devonport is the base for numerous surface vessels as well as the base and refit centre for the Trafalgar-class nuclear-powered submarines. Devonport has also recently been selected as the base port for the Navy’s new Type 26 frigates and will become the maintenance centre for the future submarine programme.  For more than a century, Babcock, the Aerospace and Defence Company, has been trusted to deliver bespoke, highly-skilled engineering services. We help customers in the UK and around the world to improve the capability, reliability and availability of their most critical assets within the four market sectors of Marine, Land, Aviation, and Nuclear, underpinned by a deep understanding of technology integration, unique infrastructure and specialist training.   The Role    The difference our new Data Analyst will make:   As a Junior Data Analyst, you’ll have a role that’s out of the ordinary. An opportunity for you to work in a newly established team delivering modelling and analytic services in support of Babcock’s long-term submarine maintenance and disposal programme.  Day to day, you’ll be operating in a small team responsible for delivering modelling and analysis outputs in support of the strategic long-term planning of Babcock’s Devonport, Clyde, and Bristol operations.  At Babcock, we have a history of helping talent go far. With our track record of innovation, you’ll continually develop your knowledge and expertise.  We offer flexible working to give people more options to better integrate their work and personal life, whilst ensuring that business needs are met. This role requires regular travel to Bristol, on a weekly basis alongside home working arrangements.   Essential Experience     Relevant degree or strong relevant academic or vocational background.   Strong numeracy, logic and problem-solving skills.   Excellent team working and willing to proactively engage the wider business to support outputs.   Ideally, basic programming skills; Python is highly desirable.   Microsoft Power BI experience is desirable but, not essential.     What We Offer   Generous benefits including:    Generous holiday allowance of 25 days plus bank holidays   Reservist in the armed forces receive 10 days special paid leave   Matched contribution pension scheme up to 8% of salary, with life assurance   Employee share scheme – save tax and national insurance on shares, with 1 free share per 10 purchased   Employee shopping savings portal   Employment development allowance - £125 per year   Payment of Professional Fees   Reward and Recognition Scheme linked to Health and Safety   Working from home and flexible work patterns   Employee assistance programme supporting physical, mental and financial wellbeing   Flexible benefits, including cycle to work scheme, discounts and our Share Ownership Scheme   Autonomy. Trusted and empowered to be at your best     Babcock International    For over 130 years, we have helped to defend nations, protect communities and build a better world. To continue, we must adapt, advance and be a sustainable business with a shared goal. Change begins with our people and our shared Principles: be curious; be courageous; own and deliver; think: outcomes; collaborate; and be kind. These values not only guide the way we work, but also our efforts to reach net-zero carbon. Yes, our ambitions are big, but together, we can achieve them.   Armed Forces Covenant   We are proud to support the Armed Forces community by honouring the Armed Forces Covenant. If you are a reservist in the armed forces, we provide up to ten days special paid leave in support of your training commitments.   Application Guidance   All applications should be made online. If you have a disability or need any reasonable adjustments during the application and selection stages, please let us know. We’re committed to building an inclusive culture where everyone’s free to thrive. We are happy to talk about flexible working - please ask about alternative patterns of work at interview.

title: Product Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Статистическое моделирование, Моделирование данных, +8 more
job_description: At Storytel we believe that powerful stories add an extra dimension to life. We offer hundreds of thousands of audiobooks and ebooks to customers in more than 27+ markets, with several new markets launching in the coming year. Storytel is Northern Europe's largest audiobook streaming service and we’re now looking for a Product Data Analyst to join the team! Storytel’s vision is to make the world a more empathic and creative place with great stories to be shared and enjoyed anytime, anywhere by anyone.   About The Team   As a Product Data Analyst, you will belong to the Analytics team who is responsible for delivering insights to the entire Storytel organization. We combine technical and statistical skills with business acumen and tailored communication to drive change at Storytel, using data. Our stakeholders work in domains ranging from product development and content management to business strategy and marketing.  Our technology stack is built on top of Google Cloud Platform and includes but is not limited to BigQuery (SQL), Looker and Jupyter Notebooks/Python.   About The Role   As a Product Data Analyst at Storytel you will have the opportunity to provide the organization with actionable insights to facilitate decision-making and enable commercial opportunities. End-to-end responsibility ranges from problem articulation, preparing & structuring of underlying data assets, analysis & data visualization as well as communication of final recommendations to business stakeholders. You master the intersection of traits such as statistical understanding, programming, presentation and people skills. You will also have the opportunity to be an internal data ambassador and upskill business stakeholders in order to grow data literacy at Storytel.   Some Other Things You Will Do Is    Use data to enable Product Team decisions  Conduct quantitative research to uncover opportunities and insights relevant for a given product team  Setup, run and document experiments on features and ideas  Give concrete product recommendations in the relevant Product Team, based on insights from analyses and experiments  Manage working with different Product Teams, enabling their analyses while prioritising your work and effectively managing your time and their expectations   Ensure that the product team understands and have access to the metrics and insights from your analysis.  Ensure all stakeholders, including those outside of your immediate team are well informed about relevant insights and experiments     About You   To be successful in this role we believe that you have:   Experience working in SQL and Python (including pandas and data visualization packages)  Sound knowledge of conducting experiments (A/B testing) and implementing appropriate analyses (this includes an understanding of relevant statistics concepts)  Exposure to working with digital consumer-facing products, especially a streaming service is a plus  Experience with Looker is a plus  Analytical thinking and curiosity - we want you to feel comfortable exploring data and finding potential opportunities for improvement  Independent and self-driven - to be able to support multiple product teams we need you to be motivated and comfortable working independently     And for some bonus points if you have    Experience in the GCP tool stack (Looker, BigQuery, etc.)  Experience with data modelling and engineering procedures  Experience with statistical modelling  Experience in applying Machine Learning techniques to solve business problems  Experience with the modern data stack and ecosystem     What We Offer   At Storytel we trust our employees and believe in their autonomy. We offer flexible working hours, remote working possibilities when possible and flexible public holidays for people to celebrate what they truly believe in.  Storytel’s culture encourages self-leadership, innovation, collaboration – and our employees share a common passion for high-quality content and stories. There is a strong emphasis on continuous development, learning through experimentation and actively sharing feedback to constantly improve performance.  Storytel offers a friendly, entrepreneurial and fast-moving work environment where new ideas and creativity are welcomed. We like doing things in new ways and questioning old methods. The Storytel culture - characterized by being welcoming and helpful - is important to us. We don’t believe in hierarchy and micromanagement; we highly believe in giving responsibility and having people grow alongside it. And of course - you get unlimited listening to audio and ebooks from our service!  Does this sound like you? If you feel like Storytel is a place where you could thrive, please submit your application in English and we will contact you as soon as possible.

title: Finance Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Моделирование данных, Visualization, +8 more
job_description: Description      Guardian Industries , a global company headquartered in Auburn Hills, Michigan, employs more than 17,000 people and operates facilities throughout North America, Europe, South America, Africa, the Middle East and Asia. Guardian’s diverse group of companies are involved in the manufacture of high-performance float, coated and fabricated glass products and the manufacture of high-quality chrome-plated and painted plastic components for the automotive and commercial truck industries. Guardian’s vision is to create value for customers and society through constant innovation using fewer resources. Guardian is a wholly owned subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc.   Guardian is looking for a  Finance Data Analyst  based close to any Guardian location (hybrid work).   You will serve as a  data & analytics engagement partner  for your internal customers and bring an end-to-end perspective to make sure our data strategies create competitive advantage. We expect that you come along-side your customers to educate them on the value of effective analytics, prioritize work and help leaders ‘work backwards’ from the opportunity to capture the right data and design solutions that improve our responsiveness and decision making. The ability to realize this will be built on a  foundational  base of trusted data with BI and advanced analytics developed incrementally over time.   So, as a successful engagement leader you should be supporting customer teams on a journey where Guardian learns how to maximize the return on its investment in data by using information to make better, faster, and more profitable decisions.   What You Will Do In Your Role     Help prioritize activities based on value and be involved with decision makers through end-to-end process from creative ideation all the way through to delivery on BI, Advanced Analytics and other data related assets.   Continuous communication with the internal customers to understand their processes, value drivers, initiatives and priorities, problems they are trying to solve, etc. and make sure they get the data products or solutions they need to succeed. Validate backlog priorities with them and provide feedback on progress.  Lead the pod cross-functional team to work on the right priorities. Organize and understand the resources you will need to deliver the products. Manage and keep up to date your backlog (Azure DevOps as tool).  Collaborate with business partners to identify gaps and formulate sustainable solutions that align with current business priorities and vision.  Frame and document opportunities (demand), estimate value creation, key factors, and assign priority.  Develop frameworks, roadmaps, and actionable requirements and project decomposition for modeling & visualization, engineering, governance, and IT\Systems Dev. teams through execution of data needs.  Initial testing (fit for function).  Organizational change management and delivery of developed work products.  Ensure users education on the solution, monitor adoption and support on its effective usage.  Grow, through influence, a data enablement mindset across the organization and mentor others on how to think about data needs.  Reinforce data governance (Master data and enrichment) and ensure global compliance of framework.  Involvement in system implementations and/or decommissions in what refers to data related.     The Experience You Will Bring     Requirements       Bachelor’s Degree (Finance, Accounting or Mathematics preferred but not exclusive).  Work experience in finance (costing and reporting preferable).  Strong collaboration and communication skills and ability to work within cross functional teams.  Highly organized and able to manage the functional team’s work items. Problem solving oriented.  Knowledge of fundamental data modeling concepts (relational and dimensional) and understanding of SQL.  Knowledge of fundamental data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) and data analytics tools (e.g. Alteryx) a plus.  Ability to manage multiple priorities and assess and adjust quickly to changes or challenges.  Able to hold accountable, keep positive attitude, open minded and honest, able to embrace new challenges.  Strong economic thinking skills.  Effective oral and written communication skills in English. Other languages a plus.   Eagerness to learn new skills.

Unsere  schnell wachsende Unternehmensgruppe  ist immer auf der Suche nach  kreativen Köpfen  mit Ideen, die Lust darauf haben, die Themen von morgen zu denken, zu gestalten und zu erschaffen. Als Teil unserer  #Crew  bist Du ein wichtiger Baustein für die  Zukunft . Deine Aufgaben     Du bist für die Durchführung und Präsentation datengetriebener Analysen auf Basis unserer Kunden- und Profildatenbanken, z.B. im Rahmen von Attributions-, Segmentierungs- und Prognosemodellen zuständig   Du unterstützt bei der datengetriebenen Entwicklung von neuen Produkten und Angebotsmodellen in der Food- und Beauty-Industrie i.V.m. mit internen Käufer-, Produktbewertungs-, Verhaltens- und Profildaten sowie ergänzenden externen Datenquellen   Die Erstellung von Handlungsanweisungen zur Optimierung der bestehenden E-Commerce-, Abo-Commerce- und Community-Plattformen durch Data Analytics liegt in Deinem Aufgabenbereich   Unterstützung bei der Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von Business-Intelligence-Geschäftsmodellen   Du betreust und berätst interne und externe Stakeholder in der Daten-Analyse   Erstellung von Reports mit BI-Tools (u.a. AWS Quicksight) nach Anforderungen der Fachbereiche und die AdHoc-Auswertungen für aktuelle Anforderungen.   Konzeptionierung von Datenstrukturen für die Analyse der Bestell- und Umsatzdaten. Kein Problem! Überzeuge uns von anderen interessanten Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen, die Du mitbringst und die Du bei uns einbringen möchtest. job_description: Vous avez toujours rêvé d'évoluer au sein d'un groupe leader de son marché ? Vous souhaitez vous former sur un métier dans une entreprise reconnue en France comme à l'étranger ? Alors nous sommes l'entreprise qu'il vous faut !   Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?   Le Groupe Casino occupe en France une position de leader dans le secteur de la grande distribution grâce à la diversité de ses enseignes : Géant Casino, Monoprix, Supermarchés Casino, Franprix, Petit Casino, CDiscount, GreenYellow, Naturalia… et à une présence affirmée à l'international : Argentine, Brésil, Colombie, Uruguay...  La Diversité est aussi le cœur de notre politique de recrutement. Alors, intégrer un groupe responsable qui privilégie l'égalité des chances, ça vous tente ?   Toujours pas convaincu(e) ?   Casino accorde une grande importance à accompagner les jeunes dans leur premier emploi. Ainsi, chaque année, le groupe accueille des stagiaires et des alternants dans ses équipes. Votre tuteur(rice), s'engagera à vous accompagner tout au long de votre alternance, pour vous transmettre son savoir et son expertise et faire de vous un(e) véritable opérationnel(le) de terrain.   Quelles compétences allez-vous acquérir ?   Au sein du Pôle Data, voici vos missions principales :    Analyser la performance enseigne (Géant, Casino, Proxi), et mettre en place et produire des reportings   Mettre en place des segmentations et scores visant à l’amélioration de la connaissance client   Cibler et établir des bilans de performance des opérations clients   Réaliser des analyses ad ’hoc   Suivre les zones de distribution de prospectus    Ainsi le/la Chef de projets DATA :    Gère un réseau d’informations à partir de différentes sources et sélectionne les informations pertinentes   Extrait, analyse, interprète des données marketing et/ou des indicateurs statistiques à destination des équipes internes   Suit les évolutions   Apprécie des situations, effectue des diagnostics, dégage des tendances   Peut élaborer des prévisions ou des scénarios cohérents pour l’entreprise   Peut être amené à préconiser des choix ou à fournir des outils d’aide à la décision   Elabore des rapports, notes de synthèse, et présente les résultats    Poste à pourvoir en alternance en IDF dès la rentrée 2023.  La labellisation Happy Trainees récompense le travail des équipes RH et opérationnelles des Enseignes Casino auprès de nos alternants et stagiaires. Vous voulez faire partie de l'aventure ?  N'hésitez pas à nous rejoindre ! https://urlz.fr/krPz   Profil de candidat recherché :     Formation de type BAC+4/+5 spécialisation data   Maîtrise des logiciels d’analyse et de gestion des bases de données   Connaissance des logiciels SAS et PYTHON   Maîtrise des outils bureautiques et notamment SQL   Bonnes connaissances en marketing & datamining   Capacités de rédaction   Rigueur   Sens de l’analyse et de la synthèse   Anticipation et organisation     Si vous vous reconnaissez dans ce profil et que vous souhaitez que votre projet commence chez nous : rejoignez-nous !   La Diversité trouve toute son expression dans la politique de recrutement du Groupe Casino qui privilégie l'égalité des chances et la diversité des individus au sein de ses équipes. job_description: PERMANENT CONTRACT  The Global Analytics & Data Products Team is building a best-in-class analytics team in support of Stellantis' new  Software Group. As a member of a Product Intelligence team, your mission is to work alongside our data science,  product and software development partners to put science into decision making.  Responsibilities of the Role   Designing, developing and maintaining product and feature health metrics and monitoring visualizations  Working closely with software designers and engineering stakeholders to answer mission-critical questions  Make recommendations by translating data into insights through retrospective analysis of key metrics  Advise on data instrumentation needs and work with data engineering to ensure successful implementation  Deliver presentations on analysis results and recommendations to both technical and non-technical audiences  Build trusted relationships with the software, hardware and product teams acting as a conduit of knowledge   Top Performers will be able to demonstrate   Measurable consumer engagement impact through research, retrospective analysis or products built  Measurable revenue impact through research and retrospective analysis  Measurable consumer experience impact through research, retrospective analysis or products built  Measurable efficiencies in products, tools and agile development processes  Qualitative and quantitative deductions from experimentation that lead to product optimization   ONLY SEND CV IN ENGLISH    Profil     Qualifications    2+ years of experience in customer/ client facing analytics role  BA/BSc degree required with a technical focus - e.g. Computer Science, Data Science, Math, engineering  Strong technical skills with SQL, R/Python for data analysis and visualization tools such as PowerBI  Experience with deriving a narrative from data and communicating the results effectively  Familiarity working in a notebook-based workflow a plus (jupyter, zeppelin, etc.)  Work experience in cross-functional teams a plus  A passion for software development and the automotive industry a plus   Your Platform  A truly global company, we have headquarters in Amsterdam, Paris, Turin, and Auburn Hills. We also have technology  hubs on the east and west coast of the United States, in South America and India. These locations are the nerve center  of our company, where the best ideas combine with unrivalled rigor to create the biggest and best automotive  experiences in the world.  Our World  Great mobility solutions start with great people! This is an exciting time to join us!  Stellantis is a leading global mobility player guided by a clear mission: to provide freedom of movement for all through  distinctive, appealing, affordable and sustainable mobility solutions. Our Company's strength lies in the breadth of our  iconic brand portfolio, the diversity and passion of our 300,000 people, and our deep roots in the communities in which  we operate.  In this new era of mobility, our portfolio of brands is uniquely positioned to offer distinctive and sustainable solutions to  meet the evolving needs of customers, as they embrace electrification, connectivity, autonomous driving and shared  ownership. Founded by visionaries who infused them with passion and competitive spirit, these brands have made  automotive history for more than a century and continue to speak to customers and inspire our employees today.  The driving force behind us is the diverse and talented group of men and women around the world who bring their  passion and experience to their work every day. And while we are a truly global organization, we remain deeply rooted in the communities in which we operate and our people live and work.  At Stellantis, we assess candidates based on qualifications, merit and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, age, ethnicity, nationality, religion, sexual orientation and disability. Diverse teams, will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.  ONLY SEND CV IN ENGLISH

title: Data Analyst - Finance
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Scala, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analysts who do not believe there is a data task that can be too hard 🦬. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise insights  Promoting data literacy across the company, organising and holding workshops     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role, creating impactful solutions  Strong background / education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge  Previous experience in the financial/banking industry     Nice to have    Advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (such as: Java, Scala, C++…)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in: Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming  Experience in Accounting    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Bist Du also Motorsportfan, kannst Du dein Hobby in dein Berufsleben einfließen lassen!Das Team meines Mandanten sucht Unterstützung als  Customer Data Analyst (m/w/d) Motorsport.
