title: Technical Analyst for Databricks (all genders)
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Компьютерная наука, +8 more
job_description: With top notch technology, we drive the realization offers the Group’s vision: To provide human banking in digital times, and to build Financial Health for over 16 million customers in the CEE region. We aim to attract and develop the best talent and aspire to be an IT employer beyond compare.         What to do:      Erste Digital is working on a harmonized Data Science workbench- and collaboration platform across all entities of the group on the databricks cloud environment. We are running currently an implementation project that should cover Target Architecture, Platform implementation, Governance Model, Data Integration and Rollout & Training.  To support us in this challenging project we are looking for a databricks Technical Analyst.          In this position you will:       design an integrated solution in alignment with business requirements and architecture patterns, blueprints and guidelines  support the definition of technical requirements  participate in developing the right architecture for enabling data analytics within databricks on GCP cloud environment  participate in the operations of the solution to handle incidents and the active communication and collaboration with business users and vendors          You check these boxes:       Bachelor's/Master's degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)  Experience in the design, implementation and deployment of scalable and reliable solutions on analytical platforms in combination with cloud services (ideally GCP and/or databricks)  Capability to synthesize business requirements and construct technical requirements.  Good communication skills (also in English) and able to build good relations with business partners          Why you will like us:       Possibility to benefit and learn from our international, talented and passionate community at Erste  Great learning curve through ownership and creative freedom  Interest groups and clubs: Take part in discussions and get involved in projects. Numerous interest groups invite you to engage with a topic  Culinary delights – Healthy nutrition and good food are important for our quality of life. Whether lunch, breakfast or snacks – everything is within reach. As an employee, you receive a meal allowance per day.  Health Care – Taking care of your health is important. That’s why we contribute to your above standard medical examination and provide a helpline in case of hard lifetime situations. You also receive a salary compensation during sick leave  Work-Life-Balance – Sabbatical, paternity leave, contribution to marriage & childbirth, 4 days of extra holiday per year, contribution to the 3rd pillar and MultiSport card. This is how we promote a balance between work, leisure, and family  New way of work: With our flexible working hours model we want to make your life less complicated. Combing the best of both worlds, remote and office time  Employee Referral Program – Become a talent scout for career opportunities in IT. We are rewarding every successful referral for Erste Digital  Language courses for German & English – Learning a new language unites  Visa Sponsoring – We support our employees with all the formalities associated with a relocation to Slovakia and also advise them on choosing a suitable residential area  A competitive and performance-related salary dependent on your professional and personal qualifications is granted - we are obliged by law to quote the minimum wage of EUR 2 800 gross per month for this full time position. But this is just a formality, we are more than happy to discuss your actual expectations.          The way we are   Erste Group considers the diversity of its employees as key to innovation and success. As employer we are proud to offer everyone equal chances, irrespective of age, skin colour, religious belief, gender, sexual orientation or origin.

title: Data Analyste

job_description: illicado, N°1 français de la carte cadeau multi-enseignes, est la marque commerciale de la société SYNEDIS.  Créée il y a + de 15 ans, illicado a très tôt conquis les Comités Sociaux et Economiques (CSE) puis l’Incentive, les TPE-PME et les particuliers.  Nous souhaitons aujourd'hui faciliter le quotidien de nos clients avec des services « clé en main » et ces derniers nous le rendent bien avec une note de satisfaction de 8,6/10 !  Donner le sourire, c’est notre raison d’être !  illicado est une entreprise passionnée, innovante, engagée et indépendante, qui met ses clients au cœur de son organisation et de ses actions.  Afin d’accompagner ses grands enjeux de développement et sa transformation digitale, l'entreprise recherche ses futures pépites !      MISSIONS :   En cohérence avec la stratégie d’entreprise et la roadmap data, vous aurez pour principales missions de :  - Accompagner les équipes business pour identifier, cadrer, piloter des solutions analytiques (dashboarding, KPIs et analyses);  - Participer à la stratégie d’entreprise en analysant de nouveaux marchés;  - Maintenir et enrichir notre patrimoine data (1/2/3 party & open data);  - Vérifier la qualité des agrégats et KPIs, de leur bonne et régulière exécution ainsi que de leur utilisation adéquate;   - En lien avec l’IT et la sécurité, veiller aux règles d'intégrité et de sécurité des données;  - Gestion des outils analytiques;  - Participer aux missions de data gouvernance et d’acculturation data;  - Veille technologique.      LES OUTILS :   Plateforme data : Google Cloud Platform, Big Query, Python  Développement : Github/GitLab  Analytiques : Qlik  Outils gestion de projets: Jira, Confluence, Miro, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides      PROFIL RECHERCHE :   - Expérience en data/business analyse (idéalement 3+)   - A l’aise avec l’environnement Cloud et les outils analytiques  - Compréhension et challenge des enjeux business   - Communiquant, pédagogue et fortes capacités relationnelles   - Anglais écrit

title: Data Analyst - Global Marketing H/F
skills: Skills: A/B тестирование, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Company Details   SEPTODONT, leader mondial de la pharmacie dentaire spécialisé en médicaments et dispositifs médicaux, conçoit, produit et distribue une large gamme de produits destinés aux chirurgiens-dentistes. Le groupe SEPTODONT est présent dans plus de 150 pays et compte 1 800 collaborateurs dans le monde.   Job Summary   Dans un contexte de fort développement, le Groupe Septodont recherche son futur Data Analyst - Global Marketing H/F pour contribuer à optimiser la stratégie de croissance de l’entreprise, au sein de l’équipe marketing globale en étroite relation avec les équipes Marketing Produit et Marketing Digital.  Au cœur de la stratégie digitale de mise en place d’une relation directe avec nos clients et de lead management, vous agirez au cœur de la transformation de l’entreprise à la fois sur le process marketing digital, son implémentation avec les équipes locales et la stratégie downstream produit.   Responsibilities   Vos missions consisteront à :   Périmètre Marketing Digital    Consolider les données provenant de diverses sources (Meta (Ads centric), CRM (Hubspot & Salesforce), web analytics (GA4)…).  Concevoir et mettre en œuvre des tableaux de bord pour le suivi des performances.  Analyser la performance des campagnes d’A/B testing et l’approche systématique CRO.  Suggérer des recommandations afin d’améliorer la stratégie d'acquisition sur la base des data collectées.  Définir et suivre des indicateurs de performance mensuels, partager des recommandations stratégiques et tactiques.  Proposer des stratégies d’automation/machine learning visant à optimiser la conversion.     Périmètre Marketing Produit    Consolider et analyser les données de ventes provenant de sources internes (ventes internes consolidées) et externes (panels, industry reports,…).  Concevoir des tableaux de bord et des revues mensuelles de performance.  Soutenir les initiatives stratégiques (analyse de l'environnement et évaluations des marchés, veille concurrentielle...) et partager les informations avec l'équipe Marketing Produit.  Prendre en charge les analyses de rentabilité et les exercices de prévision en étroite collaboration avec les équipes Marketing Produit.  Mettre en place des tableaux de bord de lancement de produits et en assurer le suivi avec les équipes locales.     Qualifications   De formation Bac+ 4/5 type en Data Ingénierie, vous possédez une expérience de 4 ans minimum dans ce domaine, idéalement acquise dans un environnement international.  Vous aimez travailler en mode projets transversaux dans un cadre dynamique et multiculturel et maitrisez les outils d'analyse Web / Power BI / Programmation.  Anglais courant requis pour ce poste.   Contract type   Permanent

title: BI & data reporting Expert
skills: Skills: Высшее руководство, Имущественное страхование, +2 more
job_description: De Nederlandse tekst staat hieronder.      Au sein de la Direction Production P&C d'AXA Belgium, l'entité Performance Management est chargée de soutenir les équipes opérationnelles en termes de planification des capacités et de mise à disposition des ressources, de contrôle, de suivi périodique de la performance des activités de gestion, y compris le développement et la fourniture de rapports/données appropriés.  Notre rôle est de nous assurer que l'activité reste sous contrôle en termes de KPIs opérationnels et financiers, et de proposer des améliorations permettant d'atteindre les objectifs fixés et de réaliser la stratégie d'AXA.  En occupant le poste d'expert BI & Data reporting, vous aurez l'occasion de découvrir le monde passionnant de l'assurance d'un point de vue positif. Vous serez impliqué dans une variété d'activités impliquant des contacts fréquents et enrichissants au sein de la Direction Retail et au-delà.      Vos tâches :     Faciliter la définition de stratégies avec les managers de son département, et la définition de KPIs associés :  Prendre en compte la vision du management  Traduire la vision en indicateurs pertinents  Challenger le management sur les KPIs existants ou désirés  Traduire cette vision aux équipes, et définir avec les équipes de terrain le plan tactique d’implémentation de cette vision  Assurer le reporting day to day de la performance réelle par rapport à la vision du management et la tactique définie avec les équipes  Présenter ce reporting au management et aux équipes, challenger et mener les réflexions avec les équipes – si les objectifs n’ont pas été atteints : pourquoi ? S’ils l’ont été trop facilement : pourquoi ? En déduire des actions à prendre pour se réaligner avec la vision et ce qui est pertinent pour AXA.  Faire le suivi des actions déterminées avec le management et les équipes ainsi que le suivi du reporting associé.  Rechallenger les KPIs s’ils semblent avoir perdu en pertinence.  Capacité de développement de rapports pertinents en PowerBI et SSAS Tabular ; connaissances en SQL et modélisation de données.       Votre profil    Vous avez obtenu un Master ou équivalent acquis par l'expérience (2 années d'expérience)  Bonne connaissance de SSAS Tabular model, Visual Model, Dax Studio, Power BI, SQL  Une connaissance de Json et R est un atout  Excellent communicateur et vous parlez très bien le néerlandais ou le français et vous comprenez bien l’autre langue, avec une bonne connaissance de l’anglais  Vous avez une forte capacité d’analyse, vous êtes proactif, assertif et un bon team player  Vous avez des qualités de leadership et de motivation       Ce que nous vous offrons    Une bonne rémunération pour votre travail et dévouement   Un salaire brut attractif complété par des titres-repas et des écochèques.   Tous les avantages d’un assureur comme employeur   De l'assurance collective à l'assurance hospitalisation (également ouverte à un tarif avantageux aux autres personnes de votre ménage) et jusqu’à 30% de remise sur nos autres produits assurances.   Un emploi qui s'adapte à votre vie et à vos rêves   Avec 35 jours de congé par an pour pouvoir vous ressourcer après vos efforts enthousiastes, du travail à domicile, des équipements sportifs et des formations, nous prévoyons tout pour que vous restiez en pleine forme professionnellement, physiquement et mentalement!        De entiteit Performance Management staat binnen de directie Productie P&C van AXA Belgium in voor de ondersteuning van de operationele teams op het vlak van capaciteitsplanning en terbeschikkingstelling van middelen, monitoring, periodieke opvolging van de prestaties van de beheeractiviteiten, waaronder ook ontwikkeling en terbeschikkingstelling van passende reportings/gegevens. Onze taak bestaat erin te waarborgen dat de activiteit onder controle blijft wat betreft de operationele en financiële KPI's, en om verbeteringen voor te stellen die helpen om de vooropgestelde doelstellingen te behalen en de strategie van AXA te verwezenlijken.  Via de functie van 'BI & Data reporting expert’ krijg je de mogelijkheid om vanuit een ondersteunende hoek kennis te maken met de boeiende wereld van verzekeringen. Je houdt je bezig met uiteenlopende activiteiten die frequente verrijkende contacten binnen de directie Retail en daarbuiten inhoudt.      Je taken:    Helpen bij het bepalen van de strategieën in samenwerking met de managers van het departement en de daaraan verbonden KPI's:  Rekening houden met de visie van het management  De visie omzetten in relevante indicatoren  Het management challengen met betrekking tot bestaande of gewenste KPI's  Deze visie overbrengen naar de teams en samen met de teams op het terrein' het tactische plan uitwerken voor de tenuitvoerlegging van deze visie  Zorgen voor de day to day reporting van de reële performance ten opzichte van de visie van het management en de tactiek die met de teams is vastgelegd  Deze reporting voorleggen aan het management en de teams, challengen en hierrond denkoefeningen doen met de teams: als de doelstellingen niet zijn bereikt: waarom? Als ze te gemakkelijk zijn bereikt: waarom? Hieruit acties afleiden om terug in overeenstemming te zijn met de visie en wat relevant is voor AXA  De acties die zijn vastgelegd met het management en de teams + de reporting daarrond opvolgen  KPI's die aan relevantie hebben verloren opnieuw in vraag stellen  In staat zijn om relevante rapporten uit te werken in PowerBI en SSAS Tabular; kennis van SQL en gegevensmodellering       Je profiel    Je beschikt over een masterdiploma of bent gelijkwaardig door ervaring (twee jaar ervaring)   Goede kennis van SSAS tabular model, SSMS, Visual Studio, Dax Studio, POWER BI, SQL  Kennis van Json en R is een troef  Je beschikt over uitstekende communicatievaardigheden en spreekt heel goed Nederlands of Frans; je begrijpt goed de andere landstaal en hebt een goede kennis van het Engels  Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden, bent proactief, assertief en een goede teamspeler  Je beschikt over leiderschaps- en motivatievaardigheden       Een boeiende job    Een mooie beloning voor je harde werk   Een aantrekkelijk brutoloon, aangevuld met discretionaire persoonlijke en collectieve premies en natuurlijk ook maaltijd- en ecocheques.   Alle voordelen van werken bij een verzekeraar   Van groepsverzekering tot hospitalisatieverzekering (ook gezinsleden kunnen daarbij aansluiten aan een voordelig tarief) en met tot 30% korting op onze andere verzekeringsproducten.    Een job die zich aanpast aan je leven en dromen   Met tot 35 vrije dagen per jaar om uit te rusten van je enthousiaste inzet, thuiswerkmogelijkheden, sportvoorzieningen en opleidingen zorgen wij dat je mentaal, fysiek en professioneel in topvorm blijft!

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: SQL, Apache Kafka, +6 more
job_description: Mandatum on finanssialan asiantuntijakonserni, joka on asiakkailleen ja omistajilleen enemmän kuin osiensa summa. Mandatum yhdistää rahan ja hengen erikoisosaamisen ja tarjoaa asiakkailleen laajasti omaisuuden- ja varainhoidon, säästämisen ja sijoittamisen, palkitsemisen ja sitouttamisen, eläkeaikaan varautumisen sekä henkilövakuuttamisen palveluita.       Sinun roolisi      Tässä tehtävässä työskentelet Kehitys ja Palvelut -yksikössä Asiakastiedon kehittäminen ja hyödyntäminen -tiimissä. Tiimi vastaa kohderyhmätuotannosta, asiakasanalytiikasta ja toimii asiakasdatan hyödyntämisen linkkinä muun muassa markkinoinnin ja myyntijohdon suuntaan. Tiimin vastuulla on myös modernin asiakastietoalustan kehittäminen ja hyödyntäminen.     Sinun roolisi Data Engineerinä liittyy keskeisesti asiakasdatan hyödyntämiseen liittyvien ratkaisuiden kehittämiseen ja ylläpitoon. Tehtävässäsi      Rakennat ETL/ELT-pipelineja moderneilla työvälineillä,  Vastaat tietolatausten ylläpidosta ja tiedon laadun varmistuksesta  Kommunikoit datakehittämisen tarpeista myös liiketoiminnan kanssa      Teet tiivistä yhteistyötä sisäisten ja ulkoisten kumppanien kanssa. Tukenasi on noin 10 henkilön asiantuntijatiimi, jossa työkaveria autetaan aina.      Onnistumisen edellytykset      Odotamme sinulta kokemusta ainakin joistain seuraavista:      SQL-osaaminen ja kokemusta tietokannoista (esim. Snowflake, SQL Server tai Teradata)  ETL/ELT -putkien rakentaminen (esim. dbt, Kafka)  Pilvialustat (esim. AWS)  Tiedon mallintaminen (dimensional, datavault 2.0)  Ohjelmointitaidot (esim. Python)  Kokemus versionhallinnasta      Arvostamme soveltuvaa koulutusta (AMK- tai yliopisto). Voit olla työurasi alkuvaiheessa, mutta aiemmasta työkokemuksesta tai harrastuneisuudesta vastaavien tehtävien ja teknologioiden parissa on hyötyä. Tärkeintä kuitenkin on, että sinulla on intoa ja kykyä oppia uusia teknologioita ja halua ottaa vastuuta datakehittämisen kokonaisuuksista. Toivomme, että työskentelet sujuvasti niin suomeksi kuin englanniksikin.      Sinulle tarjoamme       positiivisen, motivoituneen ja ammattimaisen työyhteisön sekä kannustavat ja rennot tiimikaverit  monipuolisen ja vastuullisen tehtäväkentän, jonka kehittymiseen pystyt itse vaikuttamaan  tilaisuuden työskennellä vakavaraisessa finanssialan johtavassa yrityksessä, joka on valittu kahtena vuonna peräkkäin Suomen parhaaksi työpaikaksi (2020 ja 2021) Great Place to Work -tutkimuksen suurten organisaatioiden sarjassa. Vuonna 2022 Mandatum ansaitsi Siqni-henkilöstökyselyyn perustuvan Future Workplaces -sertifikaatin tutkitusti kovatasoisesta työntekijäkokemuksesta.  työtilat moderneissa tiloissa pääkonttorissamme Helsingin Bulevardilla sekä joustavan hybridityön mallin       Palkitsemisen kokonaisuus      Tasa-arvoinen ja oikeudenmukainen palkitseminen on osa Mandatumin ydinarvoja. Tarjoamme asiakkaillemme laadukkaita palkitsemispalveluita, ja samoja työkaluja hyödyntäen olemme rakentaneet myös Mandatumin omalle henkilöstölle laadukkaan ja monipuolisen palkitsemisen kokonaisuuden. Etukokonaisuutemme tavoitteena on kannustaa henkilöstöä yrityksen liiketoiminnan tavoitteiden mukaisiin hyviin suorituksiin sekä tukea työntekijöitä työn ja vapaa-ajan tasapainoisessa yhteensovittamisessa.     Peruspalkkaa täydennetään tulokseen perustuvalla palkkiojärjestelmällä, ryhmäeläkevakuutuksella ja palkkiorahastolla. Saat myös palkan päälle lounas-, liikunta-, hyvinvointi- ja kulttuuriedun Epassissa, pysäköintimahdollisuuden tai työsuhdematkalipun, laajennetun työterveyshuollon ja terveysvakuutuksen sekä mahdollisuuden hankkia työsuhdepyörän. Tarjoamme myös joogaa, kuntosalin ja hierontatuolin toimistolla, sekä henkilöstöhinnat konserniyhtiöiden omista tuotteista ja palveluista. Lisäksi saat tilata työvälineitä kotitoimistollesi.      Lisätietoja ja hakeminen      Työ on vakituinen ja paikka täytetään heti, kun sopiva henkilö on löytynyt.  Hae tehtävään viimeistään sunnuntaina 28.5.2023. Liitä hakemukseen CV ja palkkatoiveesi. Lisätietoja tehtävästä saat tiimin esihenkilöltä Juha Pajulta ke 17.5. klo 14-16 ja ti 23.5. klo 14-16 numerosta 040 702 6906.      Tutustu  tyypillisen rekrytointiprosessimme vaiheisiin urasivuillamme.      Lue lisää  yrityksestämme ja katso viimeisimmät kuulumisemme some-kanavissamme sekä osoitteessa www.mandatumlife.fi.

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Python, Java, +8 more
job_description: 🌟CHI SIAMO  Leroy Merlin fa parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo, la nostra missione è aiutare gli abitanti a dare forma ai loro progetti di casa e di vita, con soluzioni utili e ad impatto positivo e quotidianamente la nostra sfida è offrire al cliente la migliore esperienza di acquisto omnicanale.  Per noi le persone sono al centro: tutti insieme ci impegniamo a creare un ambiente di lavoro positivo ed inclusivo in cui condividere il valore delle relazioni autentiche, basate sulla fiducia reciproca e la spinta verso il miglioramento continuo delle nostre competenze e delle nostre performance.  🎁COSA OFFRIAMO  Sarai accolto, in un contesto dinamico e multinazionale, dove potrai accrescere competenze grazie ai nostri percorsi di sviluppo interni, alla formazione continua su pratiche e tecnologie innovative ed al confronto con altri Data Engineers e non solo, dato che all’interno del nostro team Data avrai la possibilità di lavorare a stretto contatto con il team di Data Science collaborando sinergicamente per nuove iniziative, in un clima informale e collaborazione reciproca. Partecipazione a eventi e conferenze. DevSummit annuale con tutta la comunità internazionale degli sviluppatori e tech talk interni.  Beneficerai del nostro sistema premiante che è orientato a valorizzare sia le performances individuali sia quelle di squadra.  Lavorerai in modalità agile, grazie alle politiche di smart working ibrido applicate in azienda.      🚀 Responsabilità:   Il Data Engineer avrà l'obiettivo di risolvere la sfida più grande che un’azienda Data Driven possa avere: lavorare allo sviluppo dell’ecosistema dati aziendale, totalmente su architettura cloud, contribuendo alla crescita della nuova Data Platform e lavorando attivamente su tutti i nuovi progetti in cantiere volti a trasformare l’azienda in una realtà totalmente guidata dai dati e che muove verso i concetti di Self BI e Data Mesh. Lavorerà sia individualmente che in team occupandosi dello sviluppo dell’intera pipeline di messa a terra di un progetto di data engineering, e collaborando con i Data Analyst per la definizione dei requisiti di business.  Cosa farai:   Progetterai e svilupperai data pipeline scalabili, ottimizzate per l’ingestion di grossi volumi di dati  Riscriverai o creerai ex novo processi di gestione dei dati per massimizzarne l’efficienza e ridurre i costi operativi  Implementerai e gestirai sistemi di data governance e observability per garantire la conformità, qualità ed integrità del dato  Lavorerai in un contesto internazionale contribuendo alla costruzione di una piattaforma dati solida e comune alle diverse BU di Adeo  Svilupperai soluzioni integrate nel Cloud (Google Cloud Platform), con focus su qualità, sicurezza, performance e robustezza delle soluzioni       ✅ Qualifiche e competenze:    Hai una laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Statistica, Matematica  Hai da 3 a 5 anni di esperienza pregressa nel ruolo  Ti piace programmare e hai esperienza con linguaggi come Python, Java, Scala e SQL  Hai padronanza ed esperienza su database relazionali e NoSQL, framework di elaborazione dati distribuiti, strumenti di data integration e ETL ( un plus è la conoscenza di stack moderni di ELT come Dataform o Data Build Tool)  Conosci i principi di controllo e accesso ai dati (IAM) e sviluppi con estrema sensibilità sulle tematiche legate alla sicurezza del dato  Ti muovi agilmente su almeno una delle principali piattaforme cloud in commercio (Azure, AWS, GCP)  Hai una passione autentica nell’applicare le tue conoscenze tecniche su problemi di natura aziendale, e hai curiosità per l’utilizzo di nuovi strumenti e tecnologie che possano continuamente migliorare ed innovare i processi data esistenti  Hai maturato esperienza su progetti di Data Viz con altri strumenti di BI equivalenti (PowerBI, Tableau, QuickSight, Looker), con preferenza su Looker e sulla costruzione del Semantic Layer in LookerML  Sei abituato a lavorare in team e credi che il lavoro di squadra sia un’opportunità di crescita per te e per gli altri  Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata      Vuoi raggiungere la squadra di Leroy Merlin? Inoltra la tua candidatura!

title: Senior Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Python, Машинное обучение, +3 more
job_description: Enabling What’s Next       Who We Are😎      Born in 2004 as Techedge, we have almost 20 years of expertise that enabled us to become what we are today: Avvale!  This path led us to be able to count on over 3,000 employees, present in 11 countries around the world.      What We Do🌱   We help public and private companies to re-design their business models through the development of innovative and sustainable solutions, which have a positive impact not only on our customers but also on the world we live in!      How we do 💡  Through circular economy models, made possible thanks to technological innovation.      Role and responsibilities        You will be part of the practice “Data Platform & AI”, an area that takes care of Advanced Analytics.     As a Data Scientist, you will work for customers and internal research departments on complex and innovative projects about NLP, demand forecasting, predictive maintenance, computer vision, and lots more, in various fields and sectors.  You will focus on solving complex problems: translating requirements into actionable rules and  deliverables.     You will be responsible for:  ● Analyzing business needs and suggest the most effective technical approach to meet them.  ● Performing EDA around a great amount of heterogeneous data and trigger and driving the discussion among DS team members.  ● Leveraging the application of advanced statistical methods, implementing the solution and delegating tasks to Junior DS team members maintaining the main responsibility on the final solution quality.  ● Validating statistical models focusing on their explainability and ability to generalize.  ● Preparing and presenting technical and non-technical reports to detail the final solution, being able to adapt the story telling based on interlocutors’ level.  ● Staying informed about updates in Data Science and related fields, proposing new ideas and participating in pre-sales activities.  ● Being a mentor for Junior Data Scientists.      Required Skills🛹   ● Have at least 3 years of relevant work experience  ● Have significant experience (2+ years) applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data and presenting final results; as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings  ● Have a Bachelor or Master’s Degree in quantitative fields such as Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, and Engineering with excellent grades  ● Be proficient in Python  ● Be fluent in Italian and proficient in English     It would be appreciated if you have:  ● Experience with Natural Language Processing  ● Experience with cloud services like Azure/AWS/GCP  ● Ability to communicate effectively to colleagues and customers      Come with us💪   We offer you the opportunity to grow in a young and dynamic team where you can take care of your work-life balance, thanks to our smart working policies and develop your professional career in a meritocratic context!  You will have the opportunity to work and get in touch with international players who will allow you to increase your know-how in view of future challenges!       We do not consider applications without CV.

title: Technical Business Analyst
skills: Skills: SAP ERP, Управление проектами, +8 more
job_description: Technical Business Analyst       Se vuoi lavorare all’interno di gruppo audace di talenti, composto da dirigenti e consulenti internazionali, CTO, fondatori di start-up e ingegneri, alla guida del successo delle aziende attraverso una nuova visione dell’Information Technology e del Cloud, sei nel posto giusto!     Hoverture, parte del gruppo Symphonie Prime, è un'azienda multinazionale al servizio della trasformazione digitale delle grandi e medie imprese. In particolare il team Cloud Native Development, in cui verrai inserito, realizza soluzioni tailor-made per i nostri Clienti seguendo i paradigmi e le best practices dello sviluppo di applicazioni Cloud native e metodologie agile e DevOps.      Cosa farai in quanto Technical Business Analyst:      Verrai inserito in un team multidisciplinare per lo sviluppo di soluzioni applicative per Clienti internazionali B2B e B2C su Google Cloud Platform.     In particolare:      Lavorerai in team, sarai il punto di riferimento e di raccordo tra i nostri Clienti, il nostro team tecnico, il nostro team di architetti, i nostri guru della sicurezza ed i nostri esperti di UX;  Disegno di funzionalità e della UX;  Disegno funzionale delle integrazioni e delle migrazioni del dato;  Lavorerai alla stesura delle User Story e all’esecuzione degli Acceptance Test;  Accrescerai e/o consoliderai le tue competenze in ambito metodologico (Agile e SAFe) e in ambito di project management.       L'esperienza e le abilità che ti rendono la persona giusta:       Esperienza da 2 a 4 anni su ruoli tecnico funzionali, di cui gli ultimi due anni impiegati in attività di stesura di specifiche e design;  Buona conoscenza della metodologia Scrum;  Ottima conoscenza professionale della lingua inglese;  Capacità di schematizzare e sintetizzare idee, concetti, bisogni, requisiti, processi e casi d’uso utilizzando formalismi e strumenti tipici delle metodologie Waterfall e Agile (es. Diagrammi E-R, diagrammi di flusso, Sequence Diagram, CRUD Matrix, requirement matrix, personas analysis, key features e requirement prioritization, Journey Maps, epic, user story);  Capacità di trasformare il contesto “As-Is” e le esigenze del Cliente in uno o più scenari “To-Be”, capacità di divulgare e promuovere gli scenari individuati (sia oralmente, sia attraverso la realizzazione di presentazioni, Mockup e Wireframe);  Capacità di disegnare, eseguire e monitorare campagne di test e test cases.       Le caratteristiche che ti fanno spiccare tra i candidati:       Competenze ed esperienze specifiche di Industry: Energy & Utilities;  Competenze ed esperienze specifiche di processo (es. CRM, Billing, gestione magazzino e logistica, ecc..);  Esperienza e certificazioni in ambito Agile e SAFe;  Esperienza e certificazioni in ambito Project Management.       Mindset.      Le persone che lavorano con noi non sono “dipendenti”,  sono talenti che contribuiscono , ciascuno nel proprio settore , alla creazione di un luogo senza confini spaziali e mentali, dove aspirazioni, obiettivi, entusiasmi e strategie si fondono in un percorso virtuoso di evoluzione condivisa , per crescere ed esprimere il massimo del proprio potenziale.      Sede:  Roma/Milano con lavoro in presenza e/o da remoto.      Il gruppo Symphonie ha creato un ambiente di lavoro in cui ogni persona ha la possibilità di esprimere e sviluppare le proprie potenzialità a pieno.       Promuoviamo l'indifferenza di genere, età, cultura, lingua, religione, idee politiche, orientamento sessuale, abilità psicofisiche, condizioni personali e sociali, mettendo in primo piano le persone, i loro meriti, le loro abilità e la loro passione.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
skills: Skills: Snowflake, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: iTech is a global digital marketing services company with a focus on digital media, online communities and comparison products. We create and develop flagship brands and optimise platforms to engage, inform and entertain global audiences across the most competitive comparison markets in the world: iGaming, Sports Betting and Personal Finance. We've brought to life over 150 products across 50+ countries and over 20+ languages, and the opportunities at iTech are unrivalled: you'll work with and learn from industry experts, deliver your best work and make a real impact.  We're a bootstrapped company, with 280+ awesome Arcs (our collective noun) today around the world. Our purpose is to Help People Make Smart Choices Online. We achieve our goals by building products that help people have fun, avoid the bad choices, and make the right play.   Why we need you:   You'll join our team that takes care of “last mile” of data, working on data modelling, documentation and assisting our users to help them make the best use of the data we have without needing extensive SQL knowledge. This is achieved through modelling data, automating data workflows, and working with analysts to resolve their data-related challenges.  What is more?  Work with the latest and greatest technologies, Airflow, Snowflake, Kafka and an opportunity to decide what else.  Learn from a variety of experts on data engineering, analytics and data science.  Shape the way in which data is used across the organisation.   What you’ll be doing:    Responsible for the “last mile”, enabling people to use of our data as easily as possible by maintaining and extending our data model in Snowflake.   Create and manage data sources in Tableau to be used by analysts.   Assisting analysts with SQL queries and advanced analytics.   Partner with the Experimentation and Analytics chapter to promote data literacy within the company.   Ensure that the data catalogue and user guides are up to date and easy to follow.      You’ll have:    Strong SQL skills, for example, comfortable building materialised views.   Experience in analytics and data visualisation.   Ability to communicate well with analysts and data engineers.  Skill in explaining technical data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.    Here at iTech Media we’re real believers in an interview being a two-way process, this is as much about you finding out everything you need to know about us as well as getting to know you. To help you understand what the process will involve:    Initial Conversation Talent Team – approx. 30 mins    1st Stage Interview with Engineering Manager and another member of the Chapter – 60 mins     2nd Stage Interview (Cease study discussion) with Data Engineers of the team – 60 mins    All the interview stages are held over Zoom. If you have a disability, a learning difficulty as dyslexia, a medical condition or other individual need for an adjustment to our process; and you believe this may affect your performance in selection, we’ll be happy to make reasonable adjustments to our processes for you. Please let us know in good time, so that we can support you to perform at your best.   What we can do for you:    Flexible working hours – “work your way”  26 days holiday, regardless of tenure, plus we close over end of year holiday period. You also get two days for your birthday and a life event, and two paid volunteering days a year.  Private healthcare including dental, wellbeing and talking therapy  Annual training budget, plus regular training days to support your growth and development  Eligibility for our discretionary bonus scheme  Company-wide share option scheme  Pension contribution matched up to 4%  Life insurance cover up to 300,000PLN    You can see more information about all of our awesome benefits here .   Diversity, equity and inclusion at iTech Media    iTech celebrates diversity in our teams, and we take inclusion seriously here. We’re creating an unrivalled opportunity for our teams to grow and belong, and as we scale, we know we need the most talented people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills. If you’re good at what you do, come and join us. The more inclusive we are, the more epic experiences we can create for our communities.  Please take a moment to read iTech Media's privacy policy

title: Data Scientist (Credit)
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Компьютерная наука, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else – with class, logical thinking, and lots of style 😎 Let’s break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers 🚀 If you’re thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don’t worry - that’s not how we do things. They’re some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions 🤘  We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate, and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.  We’re looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It’s a big task, but you won’t do it alone. 💪  You’ll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that’ll make our company move forward ⏩   What You’ll Be Doing    Building models for full Retail Credit lifecycle  Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept  Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions  Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products  Collaborating with product owners, engineers, and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems     What You'll Need    Experience working in a data science team of a credit institution  A Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)  Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools  A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals  A big-picture mindset to correctly diagnose problems, produce research, and discover solutions  Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

title: Front-end Developer
skills: Skills: Разработка клиентской стороны, Интернет вещей, +8 more
job_description: Job Title:    Front-end Developer   Job Ref:  AICOS_Jobs_2023_04   Job Type:  Full-time contract.   Job Salary:  Depending on the candidate's academic degree and professional experience.   Job Location:  Porto, Portugal.   Job Description and Responsibilities:   We seek a highly motivated and experienced front-end Developer to join our team in designing and developing user interfaces for IoT devices. You will be responsible for developing and implementing the user interface for IoT devices to provide our clients with a seamless user experience. You will perform research activities within the  Connected Things  (Cyber-physical systems) group, namely in edge & cloud computing and contribute to the innovation area of Cognitive Connected Solutions.  The candidate will work on the following tasks:  - Implementation of data visualisation tools using JS for gateways to monitor IoT devices;  - User management, authentication, and authorisation for IoT devices;  - Integration of data from IoT devices with cloud infrastructures.   Personal Skills:   Candidates with experience developing front-end using JS and REACT technologies are preferred. The candidate will work closely with IoT devices, so experience within this field will be highly valued. Previous working experience in relevant areas will be regarded. The candidate must be able to work autonomously and show excellent English communication skills.   Academic Qualifications:   Academic Master's degree or equivalent academic qualifications in Informatics Engineering, Computer Science, or similar.   Other Skills:   - 1+ years of experience in front-end development;  - Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery;  - Familiarity with front-end frameworks such as Angular, React, or Vue.js;  - Experience with responsive web design and mobile-first development;  - Experience with IoT devices and protocols is a plus;  - Excellent communication and teamwork skills;  - Proficiency in English, both spoken and written.   Professional Experience:   More than one year of professional experience or research experience in R&D projects and front-end development. If you are passionate about front-end development and interested in working with cutting-edge technology, please apply with your resume and portfolio.   What we offer:   - Excellent work conditions;  - Being part of the team of one of the most renowned applied R&D institutions in the world;  - Adequate salary (depending on the academic degree and professional experience);  - Private health insurance plan.   Application Process:   Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. A first "cut-off" to evaluate applications will occur on the 30 th  of May, 2023.  The selected candidate is expected to start working in June 2023.  Applications must be made to the email jobs@fraunhofer.pt and contain the following:   - CV – mandatory;  - Motivation Letter – optional;   - Recommendation Letters are optional but also welcome.           Observation:      The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of projects:    -  ATE – Aliança para a Transição Energética, with call N.º 01/C05-i01/2021;   -  AUGMANITY – Augmented Humanity (Mobilizer i4.0), with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046103;   -  CityCatalistMobilizador – City Catalist - Urban Platform as a catalyst for the development and sustainability of cities, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046119;   -  ConnectedHealth – Smart and End-to-end Healthcare Management Platform, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046858;   -  LoRa4UProbes – Long Range Communication for Underground Sensing Probes, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046943;   -  Microeletronica – Agenda Microeletrónica, with Call N.º 01/C05-i01/2021 (NextGenerationEU - PRR);   -  NewGenTSFAE – New Generation Test Systems for Future Automotive Electronics, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046990.   -  SmartHealth4All – Smart Health for All, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046115;   -  STVgoDigital – Mobilizador Indústria 4.0 Textil, with reference POCI-01-0247-FEDER-046086.              About Us:   Fraunhofer Portugal's mission to undertake applied research of direct utility to private and public enterprises and of wide benefit to society currently materialises itself through the Fraunhofer Portugal Research Center for Assistive Information and Communication Solutions (AICOS), located in Porto and born in 2009 following a partnership between the Fraunhofer Society (Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft), the Foundation for Science and Technology and the University of Porto.   With a team of over 80 hired researchers and a client portfolio from a broad range of areas, such as health, agriculture, retail or energy, AICOS has consolidated competence in:   · Human-Centred Design;  · Artificial Intelligence;  · Cyber-physical systems.  User analysis in different environments, computer vision, cognitive and decision support systems, and the internet of things are some of the fields of study in this research centre, which steers its activities towards applied research and its clients' success, with whom it establishes close cooperation for the development of innovative, intuitive, accessible and ubiquitous technological solutions. Currently, the innovation themes of interest to AICOS are the following:   · Cognitive connected solutions;  · Digital farming;  · Accountable artificial intelligence;  · Decentralised health technology;  · Living and ageing with data.  AICOS' track record in institutional and commercial collaborations has built a vast network of active partners. Since 2009, AICOS has been involved in 10 European projects and established partnerships with over 150 organisations in 31 countries.  To expand our team, AICOS is interested in applications from candidates feeling to contribute to the particular fields addressed by the centre. We are looking for team players capable of providing excellent qualifications and the skills described above.

Digital Turbine is looking for a Data Analyst (Fraud) to join our Offerwall Tech Operations team. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying suspicious behavior in our traffic and taking appropriate action.    Responsibilities of Fraud Analyst:      Extracting and analyzing data from various data sources  Automatize recurrent operations  Executes routine tasks according to department service level agreement   Thoroughly investigating fraud cases to identify the source of suspicious behavior and to research ways of reducing it  Supporting the team in global fraud and risk projects, identifying pain points and tackling them to drive performance and ensure best practices  Build high-level working relationships with Account Managers, and communicate with internal stakeholders on fraudulent activities  Helping to implement, optimize and follow fraud processes across our organization  Working with the product team on fraud-related investigations and implementation of anti-fraud solutions.   Introduce routine practices for looking for suspicious indicators/ transactions/ behaviors and trends.       Requirements of Fraud Analyst:      3+ years working in a role that involves querying, analyzing, and getting insights from very large amounts of data  3+ years in a position that requires communication with stakeholders   Proficient with SQL and comfortable working with different data tools (MySQL, Athena)  Proficient with Google Sheet (or equivalent spreadsheet technology) for analyzing data  Practical knowledge of at least a programming language for automatizing recurrent work (Python etc.)  Curiosity to find anomalies in the data that reveal fraudulent behavior  Ability in problem-solving  Previous experience in managing fraud and claims disputes; customer support or client services - an advantage  Familiarity with implementing reporting dashboards - an advantage  Excellent English, both written and spoken      About Digital Turbine:    Digital Turbine (NASDAQ: APPS) powers superior mobile consumer experiences and results for the world’s leading telcos, advertisers and publishers. Our end-to-end platform uniquely simplifies the ability to supercharge awareness, acquisition and monetization — connecting our partners to more consumers, in more ways, across more devices.   The company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, with global offices in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Singapore, Tel Aviv, and other cities serving top agency, app developer, and advertising markets. Listed on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for six consecutive years since 2015 and winner of Austin Chamber of Commerce’s Company Culture in 2020.   Digital Turbine is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We embed diversity in our mindset, products, and teams to empower an inclusive, equitable, and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators and partners, driving better outcomes.   To view our  Global Recruitment Privacy Notice , please click here .

title: Data Analyst - Customer Management Domain
skills: None
job_description: About Teya    Teya exists to make sure that every small and growing business in Europe has the opportunity to thrive. We want to become Europe’s go-to software solution for these businesses, simplifying their every day and helping them reconnect with the joy of running their business. Teya was born in 2019 and is home to over 2,000 employees in 15+ countries. We've built a fast-paced, energetic, and innovative environment that is dedicated to bringing the best solutions to customers.    Your Team    Your team is part of the Product Analytics Vertical aiming to provide data insights related to the Customer management domain within the company. The Data Domain facilitates everything from Data Engineering to Data Science and Data Analytics.    Your Mission    Your goal is simple: help us lead the rest of the business with data. Based on the data that we gather, we want you to apply your knowledge, alongside your critical judgement to build a stronger, more effective customer-centric product, capable of pushing our customers (as well as Teya) to the next level, because we can only grow as much as our customers do.   Based on innovative technology, you'll work closely with different teams, contributing to excellent insights and predictive models that will lead us to an improved customer experience. Your mission is to onboard on our growth journey, becoming one of the faces responsible for the revolution in the payments sector!   Your responsibilities will include:     Leading the company with data to drive business solutions.  Working on projects including but not limited to Product Analysis, Customer Activity and Churn, Customer Operations and more.  Analysing external customer and internal business data and working with teams across different countries to drive optimisation and improvement of our products.  Enable data-science products through powerful visualisations and communication of insights.  Building and promoting a data-driven culture across the business.  Effectively managing business stakeholders and driving initiatives to promote actionable insights.      Your Story    Must have:     Background in a Business or Quantitative field (Economics, Accounting, Business Management, Computer Science, Mathematics etc.).  3+ years of relevant working experience.  Someone who thrives in developing innovative, state-of-the-art products that can meet and surpass the latest advances in the field.  Proficiency in SQL, Tableau (or equivalent) and DBT.  Experience with Machine Learning and Python is beneficial.  Understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines and the ability to work closely with Data Engineers for product implementation.  Ability to communicate outcomes of Analysis to business stakeholders.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.  Ability to think creatively and insightfully about business problems.      The Perks      We trust you, so we offer flexible working hours, as long it suits both you and your team;  Competitive salary and enrollment in the Universal Stock Option Plan (USOP) from your first day. The USOP gives all employees the chance to be fellow company owners;  Physical and mental health support through our partnership with GymPass giving free access to over 1,500 gyms in the UK, 1-1 therapy, meditation sessions, digital fitness and nutrition apps;  Cycle-to-Work Scheme;  Health and Life Insurance;  Pension Scheme;  25 days of Annual Leave (+ Bank Holidays);  Possibility to travel to different offices around Europe;  Office snacks every day;  Friendly, comfortable and informal office environment in Central London.      Teya is for forward-thinkers and change-makers. We give greater priority to a growth mindset and the desire to learn over experience. We put our people first and focus on giving them the opportunities and challenges that foster personal growth. To build high-performing teams, we’re always looking for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join us.     All CVs and supporting documents must be submitted in English.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Статистическое моделирование, Анализ данных, +8 more
job_description: We Dream. We Do. We Deliver.      Merkle is a leading data-driven customer experience management (CXM) company that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices, such as one of the two leading Company in the last Forrester Wawe in CXM Area.   The company’s heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive hyper-personalized marketing strategies. Its combined strengths in performance media, customer experience, customer relationship management, loyalty, and enterprise marketing technology drive improved marketing results and competitive advantage. With 12,000 employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, with 50+ additional offices throughout the Americas, EMEA, and APAC.   Merkle is a dentsu company.      Job Description      Merkle's Data Science team is looking for  DATA   SCIENTIST  to join its workforce. The selected resource will be placed in a young, dynamic environment, with transversal skills and strongly based on teamwork, mutual collaboration and initiative of the individual.   Together with the other team members, he/she will manage and analyze large data from the web (digital marketing), customer CRMs, external data sources, developing machine learning algorithms and using various advanced analysis, information management and reporting tools.      Key responsibilities:       Understanding and analysis of business problems for resolution or optimization with analytical and statistical methods, with traditional and Big Data approaches   design and implementation of complex analyses, from the analysis of customer requirements to the collection and presentation of results   management and analysis of large amounts of data, with different tools and architectures (Google Cloud Platform, BigQuery, Google Cloud Storage, Jupyter notebooks)   development, release and maintenance of machine learning models of different types and purposes   Interaction with colleagues from other areas to identify problems that require solutions based on the use of data.        Requirements:          Master's degree in mathematics, statistics or related disciplines   At least  1 year of experience  in the field of data analysis and modeling   Knowledge of the principles of statistical modeling   Knowledge of at least one of the following data analysis languages: Python, R, Matlab   Familiar with SQL usage   Excellent communication and exposure skills of the activities carried out and the results obtained   Good knowledge of spoken and written English   Knowledge of media and attribution modelling is considered a plus;   The ability to work in a team is fundamental   Ability to work under strict deadline   Passion, creativity and enthusiasm   Desire to get involved and to learn   Flexibility           Additional Information      We work with highly motivated people, who support and enrich each other. We live the possibilities of the digital world through home office, meaning you can work anywhere with flexible (annual) working hours. We also value face-to-face exchanges - coffee or tea, biscuits or fruit are all welcomed on board and shared throughout our offices.  If you ever feel the need to take a break from the digital world, we love to get hands on together and use pens, paper, and whiteboards for brainstorming sessions. Need to clear your head? Hit the foosball table, PlayStation, massage bench or yoga mat. For networking and (brain) food, we offer regular exchange formats, like meetings, tech labs and more. Not enough? We are full believers in education and support training, whether it be internally or externally. We support you.     If you feel inspired by us, we’ll probably be inspired by you. Join us now and apply online to make sure we match each other’s expectations. We value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment. We welcome all qualified candidates - regardless of your gender or background, please indicate your salary expectations and possible entry date. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Data Analyst - Pilotage transformation Cloud-(H/F)
skills: Skills: Визуализация данных, Visualization, +8 more
job_description: 23000D7G     Vos missions au quotidien    Nous recherchons un/une stagiaire Data Analyste talentueux/se et motivé/e pour rejoindre notre équipe de pilotage de la transformation Cloud du portefeuille applicatif de la DSI des fonctions métiers transverses de la Société Générale.   Concrètement, vous serez amené(e) à :     Concevoir et développer des indicateurs afin de mesurer l’empreinte Cloud des applications transformées.  Ajuster et optimiser les modèles existants afin d'améliorer leur précision et leur performance.  Enrichir et généraliser les calculs de l'empreinte cloud à l'échelle de la DSI.       Et si c’était vous ?      Etudiant(e) Bac+4/5 en école d'informatique et/ou ingénieurs en analyse de données,  Maitrise des outils PowerBI, Excel & Powerpoint,  Appétence pour la Data visualisation,  Excellentes compétences en résolution de problèmes,  Excellentes compétences en communication écrite et verbale,  Curiosité et rigueur,  Connaissance des principales plateformes de cloud computing AWS & Azure,  You're fluent in english !       Plus qu’un poste, un tremplin    Dès votre arrivée, vous serez intégré(e) dans nos équipes et apprendrez chaque jour aux côtés de nos experts qui vous accompagneront dans vos missions. Progressivement, vous gagnerez en autonomie sur vos projets pour faire de cette expérience un vrai accélérateur de carrière. Vous découvrirez également toute la diversité de nos métiers, dans un secteur qui évolue et innove en permanence.   En tant que stagiaire, vous pourrez bénéficier de jours de télétravail selon le rythme de votre service, d’une prise en charge de 50% de votre titre de transport et de la billetterie à prix réduits de notre Comité d’Entreprise (concerts, cinéma, sport…). Lors de votre présence sur site, vous accéderez à une offre variée de restaurants d’entreprise et de caféterias à un tarif très compétitif.   A la fin de vos études, diverses opportunités pourront s’offrir à vous, en France et à l’international.     Pourquoi nous choisir ?    Chez Société Générale, nous sommes convaincus que les personnes sont moteurs du changement, et que le monde de demain sera fait de toutes leurs initiatives, des plus petites aux plus ambitieuses.   Que vous nous rejoigniez pour quelques mois, quelques années ou toute votre carrière, ensemble nous avons les moyens d’avoir un impact positif sur l’avenir.   Créer, oser, innover, entreprendre font partis de notre ADN. Si vous aussi vous souhaitez être dans l’action, évoluer dans un environnement stimulant et bienveillant, vous sentir utile au quotidien et développer ou renforcer votre expertise, nous sommes faits pour nous rencontrer !   Vous hésitez encore ?   Sachez que nos collaborateurs peuvent s’engager quelques jours par an pour des actions de solidarité sur leur temps de travail : parrainer des personnes en difficulté dans leur orientation ou leur insertion professionnelle, participer à l’éducation financière de jeunes en apprentissage ou encore partager leurs compétences avec une association. Les formats d’engagement sont multiples.   Nous sommes un  employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances  et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à  promouvoir tous les talents , quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, parentalité, origine ethnique, nationalité, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Process Engineer
skills: Skills: Машиностроение, Автоматизация производства, +3 more
job_description: The Process Engineer reports to the Plant Manager and has primary responsibility for driving productivity and process improvements in manufacturing in Mindelo. This is an important position, where innovative thinking and sound engineering principles must be applied to drive continuous improvement year over year. The Process Engineer will work closely and collaboratively with other functions in the facility and across the EIMEA region to deliver value to our customers through manufacturing excellence.         PRIMARY DUTIES    Drive productivity and process improvements in manufacturing in our Mindelo, Portugal facility.  Lead continuous improvement initiatives on site to deliver year over year improvements in productivity, yield and quality.  Apply innovative thinking, sound engineering principles, and continuous improvement tools and methodologies, including Lean and Six Sigma principles, to deliver step change results.  Promotes EHS and Quality and ensure that the quality and safety rules are followed consistently reflecting improvements, corrective actions and any other inputs on the SOPs related to Production.  Work collaboratively with other functions in manufacturing, EHS, supply chain, maintenance, R&D, sales, marketing and finance to develop manufacturing innovations and process improvements that will deliver value to our customers.  Lead new product introduction / scale-up and raw material acquisition, as well as product transfers from or to other sites.  Be the onsite contact and expert on all Industrial Control Systems and Automation processes used at the plant (Wonderware, Siemens,…);  Troubleshoot manufacturing problems, document and address issues with timely corrective actions.  Actively bring in new ideas and manufacturing concepts & processes by visiting customers, suppliers, attending trade shows, training, visiting other HBF sites, technical magazines, etc... to support a learning environment and culture.          Minimum Requirements     Bachelor of Science Degree in Chemical Engineering or Process Engineering and a minimum of 3 years work experience in process or applications engineering: or Master of Science in Chemical Engineering or Process Engineering and a minimum of 3 years work experience in process or applications engineering.  Demonstrated ability to evaluate and optimize manufacturing processes, including process design and development.  Project management experience, including the demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects at one time.  Proven record of high standards in EHS to ensure a safe working culture.  Experience in Lean and Six Sigma methodologies with special focus on problem solving and root cause analysis;  PHA or HAZOP analysis  Very good spoken & written English          PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS    Minimum 3 years work experience in the adhesives, specialty chemical or closely related industry.  Minimum 3 years’ experience working with Emulsion Polymers, Water Based Adhesives, Hot Melts and Solvent Based Adhesives.  Knowledge of adhesives manufacturing equipment.  Project management training or certification  Lean Six Sigma training or certification          At H.B. Fuller, we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to providing all applicants and employees with equal employment opportunity. We subscribe to the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) policy of employing and promoting individuals based on their merits, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, citizenship status, or any other protected classification.

job_description: Im Rahmen geldpolitischer Operationen des Eurosystems können Geschäftsbanken Kreditforderungen als Sicherheiten für die Refinanzierung bei der Deutschen Bundesbank einsetzen. Arbeit von besonderem Wert: Ihr Einsatz bei uns     Als Mitarbeiter*in im Referat Bonitätsanalyse und Wertpapiere werten Sie Jahresabschlüsse von Unternehmen des nichtfinanziellen Sektors aus.  Sie analysieren die Ergebnisse auf der Grundlage unserer internen Bonitätsbeurteilungsverfahren.  Auf Basis Ihrer Analyse schlagen Sie die Bonitätseinstufung der Unternehmen vor.  Dabei bereiten Sie die Gespräche mit Unternehmensvertretungen vor und nehmen an diesen Gesprächen teil. Alternativ: Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung mit langjähriger einschlägiger beruflichen Erfahrung im Bereich der Finanzierung oder Bankwesen.  Umfassende betriebswirtschaftliche Kenntnisse, insbesondere in den Gebieten Bilanzierung, Finanzierung und Gesellschaftsrecht.  Gute Kenntnisse der Finanzmathematik und Statistik.  Kenntnisse bezüglich Bonitätsanalyse/Ratingverfahren von Vorteil.  Grundlegende Kenntnisse zum geldpolitischen Instrumentarium des ESZB.  Kenntnisse der Konzernrechnungslegung und der IFRS wünschenswert.  Überdurchschnittliches Engagement, analytisches Denk- und sicheres Urteilsvermögen.  Ausgeprägte Eigenständigkeit, sicheres Auftreten, Belastbarkeit und Flexibilität.  Teamfähigkeit.  Sehr gutes mündliches und schriftliches Ausdrucksvermögen in deutscher Sprache. Bankzulage mit Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, unbefristetes Arbeitsverhältnis, grundsätzliche Verbeamtungsmöglichkeit   New Work   Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten, Arbeitszeit: 39 Stunden/Woche, 30 Tage Urlaub, flexible und planbare Arbeitszeiten, Förderung der Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie/Work-Life-Balance   Zusatzleistungen   betriebliches Gesundheitsmanagement , Betriebsrestaurant, kostenloses Jobticket, gute Verkehrsanbindung (Bus & Bahn), kostenloses Konto und Depot, Teilzeitbeschäftigung ist grundsätzlich möglich   Wollen Sie unser Team bereichern? job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

Then join our Global Sea Logistics team and become a part of Kuehne + Nagel. #SeaLogistics     Your Role     As Sea Analytics team, located in Hamburg, we enable our stakeholders and product owners from the business unit Sea Logistic to make best informed data-driven decisions for Kuehne+Nagel. Therefore, we tap into diverse datasets to identify areas for improvement areas in our service, challenge the status quo, and help decision processes by providing analyses and dashboards. This is done in close collaboration with IT. As toolset we use BI- and Analytics -software, such as Tableau and SAP Business Objects.    Your Responsibilities      Define product KPIs together with our product owners and stakeholders and subsequently implement those in our business reporting  Explain findings and implications of your analysis to diverse stakeholders  Automate recurring tasks from Sea Analytics portfolio  Definition of analysis requirements with respective business departments  Play a key role for business and technology efficiency by bridging the gap between IT and the business  Maintenance and support of existing Sea Analytics portfolio  Depending on the concerned application and project further development of our data warehouse in close cooperation with the IT department, or independent development of data structures by means of data replication and linking as well as data modeling and validation  Global user support and assistance in the optimal and smooth use of our reporting solutions      Your Skills And Experiences      Experience in a data role (e.g. as data scientist, data analyst or empirical researcher). You enjoy working with data and solving complex problems.  Proficient in data analytics technologies such as BusinessObjects, Tableau, SQL or similar  Strong communication skills, which include the ability to adapt to stakeholders, ask critical questions, and speak their language  Willingness to take over ownership. You have drive and like to focus on profitable solutions for the organization, which you deliver, maintain and improve continuously  Fluent oral and written English language skills. German is a plus  You know sea logistic? That would be beneficial but is no must       Good Reasons to Join     We want you to feel comfortable in your working surroundings. Therefore, we are offering you modern offices in Hamburg Hafencity directly adjacent to the Elbe, flexible working hours, a subsidized job ticket for the public transportations as well as a canteen with a broad range of menus. Kühne + Nagel is offering you a custom-made career – through individual planning and supervisors who support and advice you in every way. Personally, you get supported by a lot of work-life-balance offerings, a company pension and a supplementary health insurance.   Vielfalt und Chancengleichheit sind bei Kühne+Nagel fest in unserer Unternehmenskultur verankert. Unser Miteinander wird getragen von Respekt vor der Einzigartigkeit jedes einzelnen – unabhängig von Geschlecht und Geschlechtsidentität, den körperlichen und geistigen Eigenschaften, der Religion und Weltanschauung, der sexuellen Orientierung, der sozialen oder ethnischen Herkunft, Nationalität und Alter.
