title: Data Analyst H/F - Alternance 12 ou 24 mois
skills: Skills: Alteryx, MOE, +8 more
job_description: Data Analyste H/F - Alternance 12 ou 24 mois.   Ce poste basé à NANTERRE est à pourvoir à partir de 01/09/2023 pour une durée de 12 ou 24 mois.  #   Sur le terrain, ça donne quoi ?   Vous plongerez dans ces nouveaux challenges en :    Participant en tant que ressource MOA (maitrise d’ouvrage) à l’ensemble des projets Dataviz/Dataprep, de la conception générale à la mise en service des différents lots :   Contribution aux ateliers métiers de définition de la cible   Coordination entre l’équipe projet en interne et les interlocuteurs Groupe (MOA, MOE (maitrise d’œuvre), architectes fonctionnels et techniques)   Réalisation d’étude de besoin   Internalisant et capitalisant la compétence Tableau et Alteryx chez BNP Paribas Cardif   Appropriation des 2 solutions et de leur intégration technique   Réalisation de Dashboards sur Tableau   Réalisation de Workflows Alteryx   Accompagnement et formation des nouveaux utilisateurs     Les missions c’est important, l’équipe et l’environnement aussi !    Vous participez au bon fonctionnement opérationnel du service Reporting Systems, Business Intelligence & Innovation (RSB2I) et plus particulièrement du périmètre Expertise on Data Solutions.  Au sein de la direction Financière de BNP Paribas Cardif vous serez au cœur de la transformation du SI décisionnel (SID) de la Finance en prenant part aux projets ambitieux qui rythment l’activité.  Au contact de l’ensemble du périmètre Cardif, vous serez amené à évoluer tant humainement que professionnellement sur différentes problématiques fonctionnelles et techniques.  Vous occuperez un rôle d’intermédiaire technico-fonctionnel entre la MOE (Cardif/Groupe) et la MOA (Pilotage Financier/Actuariat).  Tableau, Power BI et Alteryx sont deux solutions de Dataviz/Dataprep récemment implantées, et sont actuellement au centre de nombreux enjeux stratégiques pour Cardif.  En parallèle, un projet d’envergure TOM DATAVIZ a été lancé en 2021 afin d’accompagner l’ensemble des entités de BNP Paribas Cardif à développer un pôle transverse sur les outils de Self-BI.  Ces sujets s’inscrivent dans trajectoire pluriannuelle à fin 2022, et s’accompagnent d’un élargissement et d’une ligne commune sur les outils de Self-BI à horizon 2024.   Et après...?   En plus de bénéficier du réseau BNP Paribas, vous pouvez vous épanouir dans une équipe qui vous apportera des compétences très recherchées sur le marché et qui a aussi à apprendre de vous !  Vos connaissances sont précieuses et écoutées au sein d’une équipe jeune et dynamique.  L’objectif : Gérer son propre sujet en solo de bout en bout à la fin de votre période d’apprentissage. Vous aurez toutes les clés pour y être prêt !  Plus qu’un tuteur, vous aurez une équipe qui compte sur vous autant que vous comptez sur elle.  Vous aimez les challenges ? Nous aussi !   Et la rémunération ?   Encadrée par la loi, elle sera abordée à l’issue de votre parcours de recrutement. Elle dépend du type de contrat, votre âge et de votre niveau d’études.   Pourquoi BNP Paribas ?    Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues.  Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable.  Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.  Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur www.bnpparibas.com   Etes-vous notre prochain Alternant Data Analyste H/F ?    Vous allez préparer l’année prochaine en école d’ingénieurs ou en université un BAC+4 /5, avec une spécialisation en DATA  Votre niveau en Français est Courant et Anglais, Avancé.  Vous avez des connaissances en Connaissance et culture digitale, Connaissances en matière de Data, Connaissances informatiques, Connaissances en matière d'assurance.  Vous êtes familiarisé avec la méthode agile.  Et vous maitrisez les outils Tableau, Power BI et Alteryx.  Votre adaptabilité, votre capacité à collaborer et analyser seront des atouts essentiels. Ajoutez à cela, une bonne capacité d'organisation et de communication qui finiront de nous convaincre.  Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes.  Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction :c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.  Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.  À tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d'identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiés.  N'oubliez pas d'indiquer sur votre CV la formation que vous souhaitez préparer dans le cadre de votre alternance.  #Rejoignez-nous !  ]]>

title: Associate Data Manager
skills: Skills: Приемочное испытание, Oracle RDC, +8 more
job_description: Description     Position at Premier Research   At  Premier Research , we help biotech and specialty pharma companies transform life-changing ideas into reality. What we do is profoundly connected to saving and improving lives, and we recognize our staff members are the most valuable asset in delivering success. Inspiring and nurturing staff to do their best work means a better, healthier future for all. We’re a community of 2,000 people in more than 20 countries delivering unmatched expertise, operational skills, and dedication to meet the most challenging needs facing clinical trials today.  We’re looking for an  Associate Data Manager   (UAT)  to join our team that is passionate about improving healthcare through innovative clinical research. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.   It can be a hybrid or remote opportunity depending on experience. The hours will be 11am-7pm local time.      What You'll Be Doing     Assist in preparing clean databases by performing a review of clinical trial data to ensure all captured data follows the rules outlined by the protocol and Data Management Plan  Provide input to and review of Data Management Plans in support of clinical study deliverables  Review responses to queries for appropriateness, resolve any discrepancies, and modify the database accordingly  Support data entry testing to ensure data can be input into the database as intended by the database design.  Support query testing (edit checks) to determine data entered to a clinical database outside of expected values or ranges are prompted for further review.  Assist in the user acceptance testing for study-specific data listings ensuring data output adheres with requirements  Prepare and maintain documentation related to CRF, edit check, and data listing testing including initial testing and follow-up testing to ensure that the changes have been made, as required   What we are searching for:     Bachelor degree, or international equivalent from an accredited institution, preferably in a technical, clinical, or health-related field], or equivalent combination of education, training and experience  Preferred 1 to 2 years of practical experience using commercial clinical data management systems and/or EDC products (eg - Oracle RDC / Inform, Medidata Rave, DataLabs, etc). Alternately, must have proven experience in all primary job functions.  Demonstrates excellent English verbal and written communication skills  Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment including proficiency in the Microsoft Office Suite of tools (eg - Outlook, Work, Excel, etc)  Proven ability to drive a successful customer experience through positive customer interactions, provision of quality and timely deliverables, and task ownership  Strong analytical and organization skills, able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities   Why choose Premier Research?    Premier Research is more than a company – it’s a community of people that truly care about one another, about our clients, and about our mission of furthering research to improve the lives of patients in critical need. Our cultural anchors – Caring & Empathy, Empowerment, Aspiration, One Team – mirror the flexibility and trust that our team embodies. As a Premier team member, you have the power to make an impact, regardless of job title and location. Our dedication to biotech and specialty pharma is unlike any other. We provide our staff with innovative technologies and continuous learning opportunities so that they have the tools they need to be successful.  At Premier Research, our mission is to improve healthcare by transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments that address the unmet needs of a diverse global population. Achieving this is impossible without creating a culture where our employees are given the power to think creatively, challenge ideas, and solve complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we strive to create a community of belongingness where our differences are welcomed and celebrated. It fuels our innovation and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.

title: Data Scientist (H/F)
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Искусственный интеллект
job_description: Votre environement       Renault Group se transforme depuis plusieurs années pour devenir une société technologique, mettant au cœur de sa stratégie les problématiques autour du Digital, de la Data et de l’Intelligence Artificielle. Sur la voie de la transformation digitale depuis 15 ans, la direction de la Qualité est à la pointe de l’innovation au sein du groupe sur les sujets de la Data, des Statistiques et de l’Intelligence Artificielle. Par exemple des techniques avancées se basant sur la théorie de l’analyse de survie ont été développées pour l’étude des défaillances de composants/systèmes et répondre à des besoins en incidentologie. Des techniques très récentes de traitement automatique du langage sont également implémentées et utilisées pour analyser et comprendre les retours clients. De façon plus générale, la direction de la Qualité, par sa nature très transverse avec toutes les directions métiers de l’entreprise, a pour vocation d’être un leader sur la Data Science et l’Intelligence Artificielle.  Le poste est basé à Guyancourt (France) en CDI. Vous bénéficiez de 2 à 3 jours de télétravail par semaine.      Vos missions      Dans ce contexte, le Data Scientist aura pour but de développer des méthodes pour mieux comprendre l’expérience de nos clients avec nos produits et services, faciliter la détection, l’analyse et la correction des problèmes sur nos produits et contribuer à notre démarche de  design to quality  pour assurer la qualité et la conformité de nos véhicules.  Cette mission consiste principalement à explorer de nouvelles sources de données; tester et mettre en production des modèles de data science pour identifier et prioriser les (in)satisfactions clients par croisement de multiples sources hétérogènes, et de proposer une manière de restituer ces résultats synthétiquement aux bons clients;  De manière complémentaire, la mission consiste à :   Réaliser des analyses statistiques/data science pour aider à mieux comprendre des problèmes « complexes » liés à la qualité et l’(in)satisfaction client.  Accompagner et valider la mise en production des méthodes testées et validées dans le cadre d’expérimentations  Assurer des formations et du coaching autour des données manipulées et des méthodes mises en place  Contribuer à l’animation du réseau « Data Science » transverse au Groupe Renault et développer le réseau de partenaires externes (laboratoires, universités, écoles) pour enrichir nos approches.       Votre profil      Vous possédez une formation supérieure en data science et avez 1 à 5 ans d'expérience professionnelle.  Vous avez un niveau d'anglais professionnel.  Vous avez acquis les compétences suivantes :   De solides connaissances théoriques en statistiques, probabilités et machine learning/deep learning (Ex : architectures Transformers)  Des compétences en programmation : Python (ex : framework sklearn, torch, transformers pour le TLN), SQL. R serait un plus.  Des capacités de communication et de vulgarisation sont indispensables  Rigueur, autonomie, prise d'initiative, curiosité sont des qualités appréciées   Une connaissance des services Data Science de GCP est un plus (exemple : Vertex AI pipeline/kubeflow)  De préférence, le Data Scientist aura une expertise dans un ou plusieurs de ces domaines :  Le traitement du langage naturel (TLN) permettant l’exploitation automatique de champs textuels (client, réparateur, call center).  Le développement de modèles explicatifs (statistiques ou par apprentissage) permettant de comprendre l’influence de différents facteurs dans l’apparition d’un phénomène (exemple : aide à la compréhension des causes racines d’un problème qualité).  Vous vous reconnaissez dans cette annonce ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous! Rejoignez-nous ! #CarMakerCareMakers

title: Credit - Data Analyst (Product)
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Математика, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  Data Analysts within the Product team develop innovative solutions to problems across all our global entities, helping our customers better manage their money.  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard - from digging into our complex databases looking for the root cause of a problem, to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them🦬 In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Automating solutions that help us provide the best support to our customers  Performing analysis across the entire suite of products to develop KPIs for our Product Teams (or maybe even building something novel completely from scratch!)  Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help build products for our customers  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise consumer insights     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role  A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Knowledge of version control, model deployment and developer environments  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge     Nice to have    An advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: You are eager to take new challenges ? You want to be part of a dynamic environment?    Come and join our team!      The job will be in the department of “ Digital transformation”  in charge of IT activities as well as the  strategy and deployment of the digital transformation  within ATR!   The Digital Transformation direction is based on 4 pillars: IS ARCHITECTURE, SUPPORT/SAP, DIGITAL PROJECTS, DATA ANALYTICS.     You will :    Design the technical architecture  necessary for the valorization of data.  Define and validate the architectural choices of the [Big] Data solutions to be adopted.  Provide the technological expertise necessary to develop the data solutions appropriate to the different data use cases emanating from ATR businesses divisions.  During data consolidation work, preparation of reporting that will support decision-making,  In charge of the Implementation of dashboards and performance indicators (KPI) using different technologies       You have 5 years' experience in  Data Engineering,   in an industrial environment.       As a referent, you will be in charge of checking and improving the development practices.   You have team spirit & need also autonom y. title: Planning & Control Analyst
location: Greater Palma de Mallorca Metropolitan Area
country: Greater Palma de Mallorca Metropolitan Area
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Коммуникация, +4 more
job_description: ¿Cuentas con formación en el área financiera? ¿Te gustaría trabajar en un entorno de proyección internaional? ¿Te consideras una persona analítica, organizada e inquieta? Si es así, esta puede ser tu gran oportunidad.     Como Planning & Control Analyst tu principal misión será analizar el control de gestión en todos los mercados y sociedades del área de negocio, incluyendo la preparación de informes y reportes de cada unidad, y colaborar con la transformación digital del área y el desarrollo del Centro de Excelencia (CoE). Tus principales funciones serán:     - Colaborar con el desarrollo y aplicación de la política de modelización (presupuesto, Profit & Loss, Forecast y cash Flow) de la compañía a nivel de grupo y las particularidades de cada mercado, unidad de negocio y sociedad.  - Preparar y analizar el soporte financiero y económico de las unidades de negocio y sociedades del grupo y con el Centro de Excelencia (CoE) de planificación y control.  - Revisar la implantación de la unificación de criterios de control de gestión, modelización (presupuesto, Profit & Loss, Forecast y cash Flow) y estandarización del grupo bajo una sola norma reconocida por mercados financieros (p.e. IFRS)  - Apoyar la preparación del presupuesto y forecast de su Area de Negocio con el seguimiento de los resultados económicos y el establecimiento de acciones correctivas en cuanto a desviaciones.   - Apoyar en la revisión financiera de las operaciones especiales en consideración del grupo, por cada unidad de negocio y sociedad con la perspectiva de las implicaciones planificación y control de gestión (análisis de inversión, compra o venta de activos, joint venture o UTE, fusión o integración, leasing, y nuevos modelos de negocio entre otras).  - Analizar el registro de las cuentas contables y del resultado de la operación para la aplicación de las dotaciones, amortización y otras políticas de planificación (presupuesto, Profit & Loss, Forecast y cash Flow) y gestión de control.   - Colaborar en la preparación en fechas y en calidad los cierres mensuales de control en colaboración e interdependencia de los demás equipos financieros así que el mapeo de cuentas para los informes de gestión (management report).  - Preparar los reportes de información de modelización (presupuesto, Profit & Loss, Forecast y cash Flow) y control según la periodicidad requerida (bajo demanda, mensual, trimestral, cuatrimestral, semestral y anual) y modelos específicos de otras instituciones u organismos (Banco de España, INE, entre otros) en colaboración con los equipos financieros de grupo, de cada unidad de negocio y sociedad para todos los destinos.  - Preparar los análisis de planificación y control de información financiera, mapa de riesgos, incidencias y penalizaciones para facilitar la toma de decisiones a nivel de grupo, por cada unidad de negocio y sociedad, en todos los destinos.   - Preparar los informes de gestión y KPI del Centro de Excelencia (CoE) según la periodicidad requerida (bajo demanda, mensual, trimestral, cuatrimestral, semestral y anual).

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Business Analyst - IT
skills: Skills: Разработка систем, Business Solution, +8 more
job_description: Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.       Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.       Who We Are…     When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the  storytellers  bringing our characters to life, the  creators  bringing them to your living rooms and the  dreamers  creating what’s next…   From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.    The Role     The IT Business Analyst is responsible for the planning and execution throughout the lifecycle of one or more software solutions within the business domain. This includes creating and prioritizing product and business requirements and working closely with business and technology teams to ensure business stakeholder and end user satisfaction goals are met. He or she will create and develop requirements and concepts for product enhancements in support of business and technology needs. This position provides a wide variety of services to our business users including business analysis and quality assurance, in support of strategic and tactical planning of systems features / functionality as well as day to day business operations.   The role also entails Project Management for software releases and managing of SOX processes and documentation.     Specific Responsibilities Include       Serve as primary contact to the business for the support and development of software solutions provided by the current vendors.   Manage business and functional requirements for one or more business solutions related to Ad Sales and Research operations.  Deliver support to end users in the organization about how to use various types of software programs efficiently and effectively in fulfilling business objectives. This includes troubleshooting systems and software for internal customers, such as operations, development, and business units.  Manage relationships with multiple business organizations, global technology groups and 3rd party software vendors including: facilitating requirement and design workshops, reviewing designs, test plans and test cases; reviewing vendor deliverables and schedules; managing quality or delivery issues with the vendor; coordinating end user testing and sign-off for in-house and vendor deliverables.  Prioritize enhancement requests with other change requests to improve system reliability and performance and reduce maintenance.  Ensure compliance with Discovery’s Software Development Lifecycle documentation and mandated compliance requirements for all application changes.  Assist in the design, delivery, and improvement of in-house training programs and related courseware.  Participate in assessment and feasibility studies of available technologies and recommend solutions.  Work independently under minimal supervision.       Basic Qualifications       Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or equivalent degree/work experience.  Experience supporting technology solutions in a Media industry organization.  Minimum of 3 years’ experience with mid to large-scale software development projects – understanding all phases of systems development.  Strong prioritization and organization skills.  Strong presentation and communication skills; excellent listening skills, ability to interface with business customers at all levels of the organization.  Strong project management skills.  Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.  Excellent people skills – negotiation, conflict resolution, providing direction and focus.  Ability to work on multiple projects at one time with minimal supervision and to ensure that overall priorities are being met.  Proven ability to successfully operate within, and contribute to, a high growth, entrepreneurial, fast paced business and matrix environment.  Must have the legal right to work in Italy.       Preferred Qualifications       Experience in Air-Time Sales and Research business areas and respective applications essential.  Formal Business Analysis Training desirable.       How We Get Things Done…     This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.    The Legal Bits…    Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.   If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Hypothesis Testing, +8 more
job_description: We are in the unique position to experience new and interesting situations that many companies have never seen before. We bake challenges by using  agile methodologies ,  top line tools  and of course always working with the  best of teams .   This is a chance to be part of a rapidly growing team in a company that is changing the online delivery landscape, and be able to influence, execute and see the impact of your work at the end of the day.   We are looking for a  Data Scientist  who is enthusiastic and wants to apply Machine Learning principles to help us serve efood's data vision.   We are a team of energetic, motivated and restless tech enthusiasts that take on the challenge of empowering our customers and internal users. We do that by providing them with the necessary intuitive technologies through creating a wide range of software solutions.   If you have strong technical background and "get-things-done" attitude, then challenge yourself by joining our #techteam and make an impact!     What You'll Do       Build machine learning models (training, validation, and testing) with appropriate solutions for data reduction, sampling, feature selection, and feature engineering.  Perform exploratory data analysis to understand ecosystems, behavioral trends, and long-term trends.  Design and evaluate experiments by creating key data sets (ranging from hypothesis testing to causal inference).  Review, scale, and enhance operationalized statistical models and algorithms.  Craft code that meets our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices. Maintain and advocate for these standards through code review.       What You'll Need       BSc and MSc/PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field.  2-4 years of experience in data science modeling, statistics, analytics, business intelligence, or data-driven business strategy.  Hands-on skills in Python/R and SQL to implement statistical models, machine learning, optimisation algorithms and analysis (prediction, classification, clustering, time series modeling, etc.).  Strong problem solving skills and critical thinking.  Comfort working in a highly agile, intensely iterative environment.  Excellent communication and collaboration skills (English is a must).       Nice To Have       Experience with Google Cloud Platform and Bigquery.  Experience with container technologies (Docker).       What We Offer       If you are happy, we are happy! That's why we offer an attractive remuneration package for what you bring in!  We share a passion for food, so you will certainly appreciate the ticket restaurant card 💳 to spend in restaurants and/or food supplies. We are efooders after all!  We take care of you with Private Medical & Life Insurance from day #1 to keep you healthy and happy!  We want you to grow with us 🚀 ! And to help you keep improving, we provide you access to our online training platform where you can study 📖 topics for your personal and professional growth!  Are you a cappuccino lover ☕? Do you desperately want a cookie? Our cafeteria got you covered!  If you want to stay in shape 🏋️ , our in-house gym awaits you fully equipped!       Life @efood:    At efood, no day is the same as the day before!   efooders know that working and having a good time aren't the opposite and that's why every day at efood is a new adventure!   We always aim higher and we thrive in finding solutions to push our limits further! We care about our customers, our employees, and our society.   We seize every opportunity to celebrate achievements and milestones, but we also celebrate small things (like Fridays!)   Every efooder is part of a fast-growing multinational company, with endless opportunities for professional growth and acquisition of new skills! We have an established, yet super creative and fun working environment, with talented and ambitious people whose ultimate goal is to maintain efood as the ideal workplace! [In 2021, we were honored with a 3rd place award from the Great Place to Work® Institute]   Hungry enough to join us?

title: Associate Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Data Engineering, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Job Description   Expect more. Connect more. Be more at Diebold Nixdorf. Our teams automate, digitize, and transform the way more than 75 million people around the globe bank and shop in this hyper-connected, consumer-centric world. Join us in connecting people to commerce in this vital, rewarding role.   Associate Data Engineer   Diebold Nixdorf is a strategic, collaborative, end-to-end provider of services, software, hardware and security. With our clients around the world, we’re driving connected commerce for the future of banking and retail. We want you to join us as a Data Engineer.   Position Overview   As Associate Data Engineer you will join a team of highly motivated and passionate team players. You will support business planning, execution and evaluation through the extraction, aggregation, labelling and transformation of customer, transaction, product and other relevant data. In this role you will perform a wide range of data engineering functions to support the data science and analytics team to derive meaning from large and complex data sets. You will work in partnership with key stakeholders such as IT, SW engineers and data scientist to turn insights into business-focused actions and long-term strategies. Also, you will ensure company data science applications incorporate state-of-the-art concepts, practices and methodologies.   Location : remote work from anywhere in Poland   Responsibilities    Collaborates with peers and colleagues to gather, extract, transform and label data sets within an assigned area of responsibility.   Designs and implements (cloud-based) data architectures, pipelines, and efficiently handle large amounts of data.  Drives data modelling, standardization of data, cleaning as well as centralized control of data and associated documentation.  Understands the data sources, architecture and platforms.  Consults the future data strategy from a data engineering perspective by raising and documenting requirements.  Consults and supports the implementation and extension of a central data platform.  Regularly aligns with IT, SW engineers, data scientist and domain experts to continuously improve and enhance the data infrastructure, availability and performance.  Consults business stakeholders when raising new data requirements and supports its implementation.     Required Qualifications   Education   BA/BS degree and 2-4 years’ relevant experience OR equivalent combination of education and experience.    Preferred Qualifications   Good communication skills  Fluent in English (spoken and written)  Critical Thinking  Initial experience of working in AGILE Projects   Team player in an international environment   ITIL Foundation Certificate recommended  Good skills in using MS Office products recommended   Experience in applied data analytics/science in the context of retail and/or banking industry and within the IT service delivery business recommended  Good understanding of technical support processes, customer technologies and applications recommended   Technical Skills (knowledge and hands-on experience in any of the below benefit the role)   Scripting languages: Python, Pyspark, SQL   Design principles: Data Engineering, Data Lake, Datawarehousing, ELT, Cloud Data Platform Migration, Metadata Modelling, Data Governance  Cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure (Databricks, Data Lake Store, Azure Data Factory, Azure Analytics and other main services)  Databases: Data Modelling, Azure Datalake Storage Gen1/2, SQL DB  ETL (Extract, Load, Transform) Tools: Informatica Power Center, SSIS  Data visualization: PowerBI       Offer    Great, supportive team  Flexi-time & remote working  Mentoring and free access to e-learning platforms  Private medical care with family option  Life and accident insurance  Multisport card  IT Events & conferences (hackathons: .NET Developer Days, etc.)  Multicultural work environment  International assignments and projects  Casual dress code and plenty of free parking spaces (when working from office)     Requisition Employer Description     Why should you join Diebold Nixdorf?      Brightest minds + technology and innovation + business transformation The people of Diebold Nixdorf are 23,000+ teammates of diverse talents and expertise in more than 130 countries, harnessing future technologies to deliver personalized, secure consumer experiences that connect people to commerce. Our culture is fueled by our values of collaboration, decisiveness, urgency, willingness to change, and accountability.      –Diebold Nixdorf is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.      To all recruitment agencies: Diebold Nixdorf does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Diebold Nixdorf employees or any other organization location. Diebold Nixdorf is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes**       We are a global Company operating in multiple Locations and Entities. As we are keen to find the best solution for our candidates several legal entities might be applicable for a Job offer. A List of our operating entities can be found    here -    https://www.dieboldnixdorf.com/en-us/about-us/global-locations

title: BI/Reports Developer
skills: Skills: Report Development, Technical Specs, +8 more
job_description: The Purpose of the BI/SQL Developer is to review business processes in order to gain a complete understanding of current procedures, identify improvements, document those processes, and connect business people to information technology groups in an organization, as well as to provide operational SQL development support to the organization.    Essential Responsibilities    Principal Accountabilities:      Designing and optimizing MS reporting and Analysis reports ensuring their stability, reliability, and performance.   Prepare documentations and specifications   Handle common database procedures such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc.   Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders     Contacts   Routine contact is required with IT managers at all organizational levels and with technology vendors. Within the business, periodic contact is required with executives in charge of the key business units using IT services.   Experience in the following topics will be considered a very strong asset      Strong experience in Database Administration in SQL Server (2014 & later versions)    Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, replication issues, log shipping issues, connectivity issues, security issues, etc.    Experience in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization, using Performance Monitor, SQL Profiler and other related monitoring and troubleshooting tools.    SQL Development – ability to write and troubleshoot SQL Code and design (stored procedures, functions, tables, views, triggers, indexes, constraints)    Experience in BI Tools including (QlikView, QlikSense, etc.)       Position Requirements       Bachelor’s Degree in computer science preferred      Experience:     Has 3+ years of experience in database development and support in MS SQL Server environments    3+ years of experience working as a Functional, Data or Business Analyst    3+ years of experience as an Applications Systems Analyst      Skills/Knowledge:    Solid experience in report Development using tools such as MS Reporting services (2012 & later versions), MS Analysis services (2012 & later versions) and Cube handling, and/or Qlik View/Sense since this will be a major part of the day-to-day work   The ability to develop requirements and create functional and technical specs is an essential requirement

title: Digital Analyst
skills: Skills: Adobe Analytics, Tableau, +8 more
job_description: NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 140.000 profesionales, tan diverso como diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad:       Telecomunicaciones, Sector Financiero (Banca y Seguros), Industria, Utilities, Sector Público y Sanidad.       ¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.       Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.       #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.       ¿Qué buscamos?       Queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo Experience Optimizacion (ExO).  En plena era digital es imprescindible conocer el comportamiento de nuestros clientes de una forma omnicanal y aquí es donde entramos nosotros: Somos los responsables de analizar y optimizar los canales digitales de nuestros clientes.      ¿Cómo lo hacemos?  A través de la definición, recolección y análisis de datos en todos sus canales, buscando la forma optimizar su comunicación con los usuarios de forma constante. Para ello, trabajamos con tecnologías en diferentes niveles y con distintos sectores.      Buscamos por esto a un Digital Analyst que disponga de experiencia senior en herramientas de analítica y de reporting (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.).       Trabajarás en proyectos y servicios donde desarrollarás las siguientes tareas para los diferentes canales digitales (web, apps, chatbots):       Definición de objetivos de negocio y de KPIs  Aseguramiento de la calidad del dato  Configuración de reportes avanzados en las diferentes herramientas de visualización (con unificación de diferentes fuentes de datos)  Análisis avanzado para la extracción de insights  Análisis proactivos gracias al seguimiento diario de la calidad del dato  Generación y mantenimiento de sistemas de alertado que nos permitan ser proactivos ante un cambio de tendencia en un KPI  Reporting y presentación de resultados, propuestas de mejora e impacto  Cuantificación del impacto de nuestros insights  Presentaciones a equipos ejecutivos y multidisciplinares de funcionamiento de los canales y próximos pasos      Valoraremos tu expertise en estas tareas y herramientas, así como será un plus tu conocimiento en herramientas de analítica y Tag Manager desde un punto de vista más técnico; así como tus conocimientos en CRO y en herramientas de Testing y Personalización.     Si te sientes cómodo con este tipo de funciones y llevas unos años trabajando con ellas ¡este es tu sitio!      ¿Qué ofrecemos?       Contarás con un path formativo según tu perfil, área de expertise y nivel experiencia, tanto en soft skills como en programas de certificación en soluciones de Adobe y Google.       Retribución salarial competitiva y acorde con la experiencia aportada.       Programa de teletrabajo.       Plan de carrera individualizado y tutorizado a nivel personal y profesional.       Beneficios sociales: tickets comida, seguro médico y seguro de vida.       Dinamismo de los proyectos en base a las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.       Trabajar en un buen ambiente de equipo donde podrás aprender de los demás y ellos de ti.       Libertad para decidir cómo quieres que evolucione tu carrera dentro de la compañía, gracias a la flexibilidad de nuestro Modelo de Carreras.       Formación ajustada tanto a tus necesidades como a las del mercado actual. Desde nuestra Universidad Corporativa podrás realizar certificaciones, cursos de idiomas, de habilidades de gestión, técnicas y mucho más.       Horario y vestimenta flexible.          En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.       Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.       #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

job_description: Description      Clarity AI’s mission is to  bring social impact to the market . Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.  We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!     We are looking for an  Associate - Data Research  that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies’ ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies’ sustainability performance is measured.      LOCATION:   Madrid or remote      KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:   Working as an  Associate - Data Research  you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:   Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python  Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)  Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks  Perform ad hoc team projects as needed          Requirements:    Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)  At least a Bachelor’s degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study  2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)  Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL  Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)  Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage  Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets  Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact      *Only CVs in English will be taken into account

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Наука о данных, Data Analytics, +8 more
job_description: Location : Barcelona   City : Barcelona   State : Barcelona (ES-B)   Country : Spain (ES)   Requisition Number : 25555   Bunge has an exciting opportunity available for a Data Scientist. In this role you will be part of a global team working on challenging, meaningful projects impacting core business activities.   Since 1818, Bunge has been connecting farmers to consumers to deliver essential food, feed, and fuel to the world. Looking to the future, our ambition is to continuously reinvent ourselves, leveraging data to be at the forefront of analytics, technology and talent to accomplish our purpose in a better, faster and simpler way. Bunge is committed to operating and thriving in the digital world – creating world class agile teams where teammates are empowered and encouraged to collaborate and test and learn to succeed.   At Bunge, people don’t just come here to work, they come here to grow – solving challenges that directly impact the world with a diverse team of thinkers and doers. Bunge offers a strong compensation and benefits package, generous paid time off program, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity to progress. Our hybrid work environment provides a balance of in office and remote work.   Most importantly, in all we do we live our values:      Act as One Team by fostering inclusion, collaboration, and respect    Drive for Excellence by being agile, innovative and efficient    Do What's Right by acting safely, ethically, and sustainably       Overview:    The Data Scientist applies strong expertise in machine learning, data mining, and information retrieval to design, prototype, and build next generation advanced analytics engine and services. The data scientist collaborates with translators to define technical problem statement and hypothesis to test; develops efficient and accurate analytical models that mimic business decisions    Responsibilities:       Design, create, test and implement complex models and algorithms that drive analytical solutions throughout the organization    Conduct advanced statistical and other analysis to provide actionable insights, identify trends, and measure performance.    Collaborate with translators and understands business problems to implement scalable and sustainable solutions    Coordinate with MIS, Digital Specialists, and Data Engineers to deliver holistic analytical solutions    Support translators in communicating the design, functioning and output of the analytical models/solutions developed    Ensure timely analysis and testing for regular maintenance of solutions over time       Qualifications/Requirements:       MS/PhD(Computer Science or Electronics), or MS in Computer Applications, Economics, Statistics or Mathematics or related technical discipline    2-3 years’ experience in a statistical and/or data science / business intelligence role    Should have experience in machine learning, statistics, optimization or related fields; deeper experience in working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization or distributed computing tools is a plus    Experience with programming is required; specific experience in R or Python is a plus    Experience of working with large data sets, simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools (Map/Reduce, Hadoop,    Hive, Spark, etc.) is a plus    Strong analytical and problem-solving skills    Strong understanding of Agile methodologies    Openness to working in Agile environments with multiple stakeholders    Professional attitude and service orientation; team player    Good verbal and written communication skills    Quick learner to business needs and translate them into potential analytics solutions    Strong work ethic; ability to work at an abstract level and gain consensus    Able to build a sense of trust and rapport that creates a comfortable and effective workplace Attitude to thrive in a fast-paced environment    Open minded to new approaches of learning      Bunge (NYSE: BG) is a world leader in sourcing, processing and supplying oilseed and grain products and ingredients. Founded in 1818, Bunge’s expansive network feeds and fuels a growing world, creating sustainable products and opportunities for more than 70,000 farmers and the consumers they serve across the globe. The company is headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri and has 25,000 employees worldwide who stand behind more than 350 port terminals, oilseed processing plants, grain facilities, and food and ingredient production and packaging facilities around the world.   Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship, age, disability or military or veteran status, or any other legally protected status. Bunge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled

job_description: Maximize your impact    About the Challenge    All money has impact. You either invest for a positive future, or against it. At Triodos Investment Management, it is our mission to make money work for positive social, environmental and cultural change. Our investing strategies focus on renewable energy, financial inclusion and sustainable food & agriculture.    Our Size And Way Of Working Offer You a Diverse Range Of Tasks    As a Junior Business Analyst, you’ll be part of the Business Analysis team who focuses on improving processes and information systems that are used to manage direct investments and to operate impact funds.     Improving direct investment process flows  Change management for our IM applications  Translating user stories and requirements into instructions for development  Optimising the way of working  Implementing upgraded versions of FrontInvest  Managing data structures to safeguard data integrity and overall quality      Your Skills      Strong personal connection to the values and mission of Triodos IM  Minimum of 2 years’ experience in a comparable role (Support Engineer, Business Intelligence Analyst, …)  Relevant college degree (Finance, Business Administration, IT, …)  Knowledge of and experience in the investment/asset management sector  Knowledge of FrontInvest and experience with investment management applications  Knowledge of and experience with data querying languages such as SQL  Fluency in English, which is the formal language at Triodos IM     We encourage you to apply, even if you don’t meet all the requirements. The most important thing is that you’re interested in investment management and willing to learn quickly.    Our offer     Here’s What You Can Expect From Us    Exellys isn’t your typical recruiting or consulting agency, we’re a different breed. We are a tech talent incubator, which is every bit as cool as it sounds.     You’ll join an awesome community and enter one of our Smart Programs, based on where you are in your career and where you want to go. Did we mention you’ll get a personal coach as well?  Next to a generous monthly salary, you'll receive a company car or a flexible mobility budget and tons of other benefits (pension, daily compensations, etc.)  You’ll spend most of the time at (y)our client’s, except for regular Exellys trainings, fun events, tribe meet-ups, after works, knowledge sharing sessions, etc.  After two years of coaching and upskilling from Exellys, you’ll get the opportunity to join (y)our client’s organization as an internal employee. Or if you prefer to stay with us, you could explore our follow-up Smart Programs as well.

B. job_description: Who are we:   Antolin is a leading global automotive supplier, we are experts in designing, manufacturing, and supplying innovative solutions for vehicles around the world. Our product portfolio includes trim, headliners, and acoustic systems, as well as lighting and other interior systems. We offer comprehensive solutions with a focus on quality, safety, and sustainability. Our products are used in many of the world’s leading car brands. In fact, three out of four cars nowadays, have interiors made by Antolin.     With over 140 plants in 26 countries, Antolin has achieved this strong industry presence through over seventy years of working with our customers in order to develop a complete cycle of component manufacturing, from their conception and design, through the development and validation stages, to their industrialisation and sequenced delivery.     We are working hard on spearheading the transformation that the automotive industry is currently experiencing with regard to vehicle interiors by collaborating with our customers. We do so in order to develop more sustainable and technologically advanced vehicles that are also adapted to the new needs and requirements of their passengers.     As part of this transformation, Antolin is committed to a sustainable business model that focuses on and creates value for all its stakeholders, including its customers, employees, investors, suppliers, and society as a whole.      Mission:   The aim of this position is to support the development of data models for industrial processes, work with several sources of data and create advanced monitoring views for different kind of users.      Responsibilities:    Grafana Programming by SQL, Deployment and Maintenance.  Node-Red HMI Development, Deployment and Maintenance.  NR Data Flows Programming, connecting several data sources, such as PLCs / DDBB / Sockets / MQTT / OPCUA Servers / Vnode / Kepware /, etc.  Data Modelling (Company Standard).  Data Quality Reliability.  Generate documentation from the executed projects.  Industrial Process Digitalization.       What we are looking for:    Engineer in Computer Sciences, Telecommunications or similar.  English and Spanish (High level).  Experience in the role (2 years).  Knowledge in SQL programming, Java Script /Type Script programming and Python Programming.  Knowledge in relational databases (PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server).  Non-relational data bases (Mongo, Cassandra, etc.).  Versatility and adaptability skills.  Frequent trips to Burgos HQ.       What can we offer you:    You will be part of a highly engaged multinational with international career opportunities.  We offer you a learning journey adapted to your professional experience.  You will work on international projects for world- renowned companies in Automotive sector.  You can find an Open Environment to learn new technologies.  We can offer you a competitive salary, benefits and valuable OEM discounts.      Here at Antolin, we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our workplace. job_description: Qualifications     Master's degree required in engineering, science or another technical or related field; advanced degrees advantageous   Several years work experience in a blue-chip or start up environment within pharma, financial services, high tech, engineering, aerospace, media, telecommunications, FMCG or the public sector   Previous experience in a technology/IT strategy related role combined with expertise in areas such as digital strategy/ transformation, IT infrastructure & architecture, IoT, e-commerce, AI/machine learning, robotics, cloud, big data and analytics, cyber security   Combination of strategic and analytical insights with a passion for technology   Excellent track record of academic and managerial or professional achievement Proven experience of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities   Fluency in English and local languages  Willingness to travel      What You'll Do    You will work with C-suite executives and senior managers, problem-solve on key issues as well as provide actionable recommendations leveraging your technological know-how and business sense.  You will play an active role in all aspects of a client project, typically working in teams of 3-5 consultants alongside experts and colleagues of all tenures, including developers, designers, data engineers, agile coaches and others. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses, and developing and communicating recommendations for client presentations. You’ll also have the opportunity to present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members. Our consultants receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on their teams. This support includes a partner from your local office or practice assigned to you to help guide your career as well as up to five weeks of formal training in your first two years as an Associate. Additionally, you'll receive guidance and support from your local office or practice in the selection of client projects, helping you to develop your skills and build your network.    Who You'll Work With    You'll work as part of our Digital McKinsey team in one of our offices in Central Europe.  Digital McKinsey helps enterprises think strategically about how to leverage technology to create fundamental business change – from formulating tech-driven growth strategies to enabling more efficient operations through the use of technology. In a world where digital is the new standard, executives are increasingly looking for sharp advice on technology. With a team of 2,100 experts and consultants across 60 countries, Digital McKinsey works on key technology topics including big data, agile, cloud, cybersecurity, analytics and digital transformation. We serve a range of companies, including start-ups, the public sector and global Fortune 100 firms. When you join McKinsey, you are joining a firm whose culture is distinctive and inclusive. We will accelerate your development as a leader to create positive, enduring change in the world.

title: BI Specialist
skills: Skills: Базы данных, Аналитические навыки, +4 more
job_description: Already an employee? You must apply through our internal portal: click here    BI Specialist    Date: May 12, 2023  Location:  Sofia, 22, BG   Requisition ID:  26686    Каменица АД е една от водещите пивоварни компании в България, част от Molson Coors - един от най-големите пивовари в света. Компанията е пионер в бирената индустрия в страната със 142 годишен опит, история и традиции. Хората са сърцето на компанията и тяхната страст е тази, която превръща ечемичното зърно във възхитителна кехлибарена течност. Нашата амбиция е да бъдем избор номер едно за нашите служители, клиенти и потребители.      Специалист „Търговски анализи“ (по заместване)      Докладва на : Мениджър „Бизнес анализи“      Пряко подчинени: Не      За Нашия Екип „Ценообразуване, Приходи и Бизнес Анализи“ Търсим    Специалист „Търговски анализи“  Целта на позицията е да работи върху опростяването на процесите и отчетите за търговските отдели. Подпомага бизнеса чрез непрекъснато планиране, анализ и мониторинг на действителното представяне и отклонение на търговските резултати. Осигурява високо качество и навременно предоставяне на обработените отчети за целите на вземането на бизнес решения, свързани с търговското планиране и изпълнение.  Отговорности:    Изгражда и развива Power BI анализи с цел опосредстване на бързи и базирани на факти бизнес решения.    Подпомага бизнеса в събирането, съхранението и анализирането на данни с цел улесняване на стратегически и оперативни решения от страна на заинтересованите страни (Ръководен екип на страната, Регионални Търговски мениджъри, Отдел Развитие на отношенията с Клиенти, Маркетинг) и предоставя прозрачна пазарна информация за организацията.    Подпомага опростяването на сложни процеси в цялата организация чрез програмиране на по-добри решения за спестяване на време и избягване на грешки в трудните процеси.    Подкрепя вземането на по-добри решения с изчерпателни анализи и репорти.    Поддържа и надгражда на съществуващите репортинг модели.    Създава и координира на дневни, седмични, месечни репорти и разработва на нови при нужда.    Подпомага процеса на целеполагане на търговската функция с изчисляване и разпределяне на различните цели и пера. Проследява актуалното представяне спрямо поставените цели и прави препоръки за опростяване и подобряване на процеса.      Ще Се Справиш Успешно с Ролята , Ако Притежаваш      Висше образование.    3 години опит в областта на отчитането на резултати.    Опит със статистически и финансови инструменти е предимство.    Отлични к омпютърни умения – Excel, Word, PPT, Outlook, Internet и/или други инструменти за обработка и анализ на данни.    Силни организационни и координационни умения.    Внимание към детайла.    Добро ниво на Английски език- разговорен и писмен .    Нашето предложение:    Приобщаваща култура и екип, който цени разнообразните гледни точки и перспективи, които ни помагат да сме иновативни .    Автентично наследство и възможност за кариера с индивидуален план в компания с история в производството на бира .    Предизвикателни проекти, които ще подобрят и развият уменията ти .    Пакет от възнаграждения и социални придобивки .    Ако оценяваш всичко това като страхотна възможност за развитие, не се колебай и натисни бутона „Кандидатствай“. Ще се свържем само с одобрените кандидати.   Job Posting Grade: 9    At Molson Coors we seek diversity. Differing perspectives lead to challenging the expected, which keeps new ideas bubbling up. We’re an equal opportunity employer and invite applications from candidates from all backgrounds, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic. We take pride in celebrating our unique brew.

title: Data Analyst and Business Development Specialist
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Аналитика, +8 more
job_description: Description      Xylem |ˈzīləm|     The tissue in plants that brings water upward from the roots;   a leading global water technology company.    Xylem, a leading global water technology company dedicated to solving the world’s most challenging water issues. Xylem is the leading global provider of efficient, innovative and sustainable water technologies improving the way water is used, managed, conserved and re-used. Our international team is unified in a common purpose: creating advanced technology and other trusted solutions to solve the world’s water challenges. We are committed to creating an organization of inclusion and diversity, where everyone feels involved, respected, valued and connected, and where everyone is free to bring their authentic selves and ideas.    If you are excited and passionate about helping us #letssolvewater, we want to hear from you! For more information, please visit us at    www.xylem.com    .    Data Analyst and Business Development Specialist   We are seeking a Data Analyst for our Digital Enabled Services department.  You will be part of a team that creates the next-generation digital customer journey. Our goal is to provide world-class support to our customers and to our business.  As a Data Analyst at Xylem, you will work side-by-side with stakeholders, developing the necessary tools and analyses that will convert static and dynamic data into actionable insights used to maximize customer value from services.  You will work with R&D-teams and Commercial Teams in facilitating the implementation of functions and associated processes, testing and evaluating them, and feeding back results in order to achieve maximized customer value.  If you join us as our new Data Analyst, you will be one of the first players in a growing Data and Analytics team.  We offer a role in a fast-paced, collaborative, and friendly environment.    Responsibilities      Oversee development of functions, dashboards, and methods that will convert data from connected assets into actionable insights    Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure that the business deploy methods and processes and get support to drive growth    Lead interactions with Digital Experts from local and central functions.   Participate in the daily work to generate and deliver insights to the business   Analyze and assess improvement needs and recommend strategies and roadmaps to enable local adoption and growth of the Digitally enabled Services Offering.   Contribute to the development of enabling structures and operational processes in the form of support organizations, data analytics, and follow-up processes.   Co-work with the Digital Development teams across Xylem to develop methods and roadmaps as needed for the EU Wide development and support of new methods.   Monitor project progress and report periodic progress      Qualifications      Academic degree in engineering, preferably with a special focus on data analysis/ML/AI.   Preferably experience in digitization of Services in Business to Business   Project management experience    Experience working in an international context with business transformation    Characteristics     Analytical skills   Continuous improvement mindset   Cross functional collaboration   Customer focus   Project planning skills     Why Work at Xylem!   We offer you a creative and international environment where you get the opportunity to focus on your personal and professional development together with committed and helpful colleagues. Engage as a volunteer through Xylem´s business program for community initiatives Xylem Watermark: www.xylemwatermark.com.   Everyone's equal value   We want people, regardless of skin color, age, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity, to feel at home, not just at Xylem, but everywhere in the world. For us, diversity, equality, and inclusion mean more than just a policy or a set of methods. Diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental parts of our corporate culture and a key to long-term growth.  Feel free to visit us at https://www.xylem.com/sv-se/   Application   We look forward to receiving your application in English. Please note that we will be interviewing continuously, which means that we may close the application process if we find the right candidate.  If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Recruiter Leila Sayyad, [email protected].  We only accept applicants through https://www.xylem.com/sv-se/karriar/xylem-career-opportunities/?currentpageid=49039&page=1&pagesize=24 .

title: (Junior) Project Coordinator

job_description: The deugro group is a globally active company serving the project logistics industry. Counting 1,200 employees worldwide in more than 40 countries, we are a true global network of logistics experts—for road and rail, ocean and air freight. We set the courses of tomorrow—today.     deugro is the first company of the deugro group. Since 1924, it has been the main business of the international project logistics company, founded in Frankfurt am Main, Germany. Every day, we face all the challenges of the logistics industry. Here is where employees like to keep on eye on really big objects while keeping a cool head—enabling us to come up with alternatives when the conventional path from A to B does not work.     Become a part of our international Operations team at one of our locations in Rotterdam, The Netherlands . For the next possible date we are looking for you in fulltime as (Junior) Project Coordinator      Your tasks and responsibilities:    Providing timely and accurate quotations to our overseas branches and external clients for all modes of transportation  Supporting the determination of transport solutions for each type of involved cargo and route  Coordinating autonomously the execution of international transport and logistic projects as per the company’s procedures in direct coordination with the client and suppliers  Taking close economic control of the operations assigned, looking for profit optimization  Traveling for coordination of operations in the field when necessary either locally or abroad  Employing company tools such as CRM or TMS to gain maximum advantage from them  Collaborating in teamwork with branch colleagues in any supportive task such as the preparation of documents, submitting them through Web platforms, sharing enquiries among suppliers  Supporting business development activities by gathering relevant information, preparing presentations  Participating in the activities of reciprocal collaboration with other deugro companies and corporate functions, as required by management          What you can contribute:    Successfully completed training in the field of freight forwarding  At least two years’ experience in the operations departments of freight forwarding–related companies (import/export, FCL, LCL, air freight, etc.)  Basic knowledge of industrial international logistics concepts and main transport modalities  The ability to work under the pressure of tight deadlines  Familiarization with current software packages such as Microsoft Word and Excel  Good organizational skills, customer-focused with attention to detail  Excellent communications skills (cross-functional and cross-cultural)  Fluent English skills, both written and verbal  The willingness to travel on national and international business trips (10 – 25%)       What we offer you:   A family-owned and run company, deugro group has been active in the project logistics industry for nearly 100 years. With our sights continuously on the future, we are a prosperous company offering you a long-term perspective for your professional career. What’s more, you benefit from an attractive salary and a modern workplace, with the option to work remotely—ensuring flexible working hours and individual development opportunities. We want to work with people who not only bring the right résumé/CV, but who also pursue their ideas with passion and put them into action with commitment.      Contact:   Do you value a motivating, international environment with opportunities for development and freedom? Send your application including your salary expectations and a possible start date.      deugro (Netherlands) B.V.   Marco Miraglia  Nijmegenstraat 27, Rotterdam, ZH 3087 CD NLD      www.deugro.com
