job_description: Billennium jest polską firmą IT, która od 20 lat rozwija innowacyjne usługi i produkty oraz dostarcza najlepszych specjalistów w ramach outsourcingu.  Realizujemy projekty i usługi IT w Polsce, na terenie Unii Europejskiej, a także w Kanadzie.  Obecnie zatrudniamy ponad 1800 specjalistów z zakresu najnowocześniejszych rozwiązań wspierających biznes.     Aktualnie poszukujemy specjalisty na stanowisko  Analityka IT  dla naszego klienta z branży bankowej.      wynagrodzenie do 900 zł netto dziennie B2B  angielski średniozaawansowany   wymagane doświadczenie w branży bankowości minimum 2 lata        Opis:  Wsparcie zespołów produktowych odpowiedzialnych za ofertę dla Klienta Indywidualnego oraz Mikroprzedsiębiorstw w zarządzaniu ofertą i obsłudze sprzedażowej/posprzedażowej rachunków bieżących, we wdrażaniu ofert promocyjnych dla rachunków bieżących i depozytowych oraz stosowaniu procedury „Poznaj swojego klienta" (Know Your Customer), w digitalizacji procesów kredytowych/depozytowych sprzedażowych i posprzedażowych, w rozwoju oferty produktów dodatkowych (cross selling, up selling).      Zadania:    Współpraca z właścicielami biznesowymi systemów informatycznych oraz innymi członkami zespołów rozwojowych i utrzymaniowych przy opracowywaniu rozwiązań zgodnych z celami biznesowymi;  Analiza i przekładanie wymagań biznesowych na koncepcję rozwiązania w systemie;  Przygotowywanie specyfikacji technicznych i funkcjonalnych dla opracowywanych rozwiązań;  Ścisła współpraca z programistami, dostawcami i przedstawicielami biznesu w celu zrozumienia wymagań, wypracowania rozwiązania, przeprowadzenia testów oraz wdrożeń produkcyjnych;  Tworzenie scenariuszy testowych oraz wykonywanie testów FAT;  Uczestnictwo w procesie utrzymania środowisk produkcyjnych poprzez wspieranie rozwiązywania awarii i incydentów;   Udział w wycenach projektów (założenia biznesowe, architektura, budżet i harmonogram);  Praca w zwinnym środowisku.       Wymagania:    Dobrze rozwinięte umiejętności miękkie w zakresie komunikacji, nawiązywania kontaktów oraz współpracy w nowym środowisku z różnymi jednostkami w banku;  Umiejętność kreatywnego podejścia do rozwiązywania problemów projektowych;  Umiejętność przygotowania argumentacji za i przeciw oraz zdolność identyfikowania i eliminowania sprzecznych /błędnych/nielogicznych wymagań;  Samodzielność i zorientowanie na cele;  Wykształcenie wyższe;  Minimum 3-letnie doświadczenie w roli analityka systemowego w sektorze finansowym (mile widziana znajomość rynku usług dodanych dla mikroprzedsiębiorców);  Znajomość metodyk pozyskiwania, modelowania i specyfikowania oraz praktyczna znajomość notacji UML;   Praktyczna znajomość języka SQL i relacyjnych baz danych;  Znajomość metodyk projektowych z naciskiem na metody zwinne;  Umiejętność analitycznego myślenia, precyzyjnego formułowania myśli oraz dokładność.         Narzędzia:  Jira, Confluence, SQL.

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

job_description: In Poland we are located in: Katowice, Szczecin, Gdynia, Warszawa      Sapiens International Corporation (NASDAQ and TASE: SPNS) empowers the financial sector, with a focus on insurance, to transform and become digital, innovative and agile. Backed by 40 years of industry expertise, Sapiens offers a complete insurance platform, with pre-integrated, low-code solutions and a cloud-first approach that accelerates customers’ digital transformation. Serving more than 600 customers in 30 countries, Sapiens offers insurers across Property & Casualty, Workers’ Compensation and Life markets the most comprehensive set of solutions, from core to complementary, including Reinsurance, Financial & Compliance, Data & Analytics, Digital, and Decision Management. Sapiens’ team of more than 5,000 employees operates through our offices in North America, the UK, EMEA and Asia Pacific.         Roles and Responsibilities:   • Work as part of the global DevOps team  • Maintain DB servers  • Develop and maintain DBA scripts and procedures  • Support development work   o schema and data changes   o assist developers   o prepare release pack for client delivery  • Support client installation and operations issues         Desired Skills and Experience   • Extensive knowledge in SQL Server performance tuning  • Excellent knowledge of the SQL language  • Programming experience in scripting languages   o T-SQL – must   o Windows Powershell, Linux shell, python – preferred  • Operating system skills - preferred   o Windows    o Linux    o Cloud    o Kubernetes   • Knowledge of other databases preferred (primarily PostgreSQL)  • English language knowledge – high level (reading, writing, speaking)            We offer   • Opportunity to design and develop complex integration solutions  • Stable employment – permanent job contract  • Flexible working hours to help you keep the work-life balance and find time for your hobbies  • Partnership approach & communication respecting individual needs and employee development plan ideas  • Possibility to gain professional experience and learn from global industry experts  • Stable project & diversified working environment  • Periodical events and contests for employees  • Private medical healthcare & Multisport card  • IT-specific, friendly dress code that you will become a fan of  • Attractive employee referral program and bonuses   Sapiens is an E-Verified & Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, M/F/D/V.       Join us and become part of our common success! Please send your resume in English.

title: Technical Business Analyst
skills: Skills: Истории пользователей, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: JR0114434   Technical Business Analyst   – Vilnius, Lithuania   Have you got what it takes to help us realize our vision of being one of the world's largest FinTech organizations? How about offering up your skills in a global business that is committed to moving money for better? Are you interested in joining a globally diverse organization where our unique contributions are recognized and celebrated, allowing each of us to thrive? Then it’s time to join Western Union as a Technical Business Analyst.   Western Union powers your pursuit.   We are seeking a technical business analyst with strong hands-on experience in delivering data driven controls and governance.  In this position you will be responsible for developing large scale data solutions that fits multiple lines of business, this includes building requirements for API integrations and data model sets that can be deployed across the Care Apps portfolios to unlock expanded self-service capabilities and enhance the overall customer experience.  You will be liaising closely with the engineering and technical teams that form the front line of systems for customer support and ensure implementation is accomplished in alignment with requirements.  In your technical role, you will leverage your expertise of Western Union’s intricate web of host systems, CARE tools & technology and other integration services – to build business requirements, design process maps, and integration documentation, while serving as the knowledge expert and UAT coach & mentor. You will work closely with the technology and engineering leads, vendors, intent analysts, business analysts, product owners, and other SME’s & Stakeholders to ensure that a flawless solution is delivered.    Role Responsibilities     Ability to understand and connect the data flows of information between web host, API and communication channel services (IVR, IVA and Chat).  Assist in leading data clean up efforts to provide accurate information to customers.  Work with cross regional / and functional working groups to implement strategic data capabilities and requirements gathering.  Develop data flows, ownership matrixes and data lineage.  Apply in-depth understanding of the business impact of technical and data contributions.  Gather and synthesize existing data governance principles, policies, practices and standards.  Ability to write User Stories and technical mapping and design flows that can be used by partners and internal teams to implement integration points.  Create test data, test cases, and related business process flows.  Develop process improvement initiatives, introduce new ideas to improve integration efficiencies, using or consuming new data elements or find ways to integrate with new data sources.  Must be a problem solver, be comfortable troubleshooting problems and working with the technical and engineering teams to find solutions.  NOTE: this is not an engineering role and the focus is on writing documentation that follows Western Unions strategy for API integration and technology evolution.     Role Requirements     Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.  Experience working with diverse, global teams across multiple time zones.  Strong MS Office tools knowledge. Any data management tools would be an advantage.  Fluency in written and spoken English language.  Relevant experience of care channel or customer related systems.  Ability to translate business needs to technical teams.  Exceptionally organized and detail oriented with the ability to achieve goals amid limited supervision.  Ability to thrive in a dynamic and demanding work environment.  Enjoy collaborating with co-workers to develop solutions and establish a sense of trust and respect.  Deep understanding of web host and API integration.  Knowledge of Western Union front line applications, Interactive conversational technologies and calls management is an advantage.  This role requires the ability to work a flexible schedule as needed, coordination with teams across the globe, in multiple time zones and ability to support deployments during the standard WU change windows of 8pm ET to 6am ET will be required.    We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what’s next.   Western Union is positioned to become the world’s most accessible financial services company —transforming lives and communities. We’re a diverse and passionate customer-centric team of over 8,000 employees serving 200 countries and territories, reaching customers and receivers around the globe. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.  Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You’ll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you’re ready to help drive the future of financial services, it’s time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/.   Salary   The monthly gross base salary range is 2175 – 3291 EUR. This range represents the anticipated low and high end of the salary for this position. This role is also eligible to receive an annual bonus that align with individual and company performance. Actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate’s qualifications, skills, and competencies.    Benefits    You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few  (https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.    Your Lithuania Specific Benefits Include     Hybrid work environment with opportunity to work from abroad (up to 2 months a year)  Extra days off  Volunteering activities  Discount and special offers  Referral program    We are passionate about diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. The company will provide accommodation to applicants, including those with disabilities, during the recruitment process, following applicable laws.

title: Analyst (Strategy, Policy and Innovation)
skills: Skills: Написание политики, Законодательные отношения, +8 more
job_description: About You      The MFSA is looking for a promising individual with solid academic background in Banking/ Economics/ Accountancy/ Law/ any other qualification related to innovative areas of finance.   Candidates possessing either experience and/ or knowledge of ESG-related EU legislation (notably, Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation, Taxonomy Regulation, Non-Financial Reporting Directive/ Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive) and/ or ESG certifications and/ or professional training relevant to this role, would be preferred. Also, knowledge and/or experience in a selected sector regulated by the MFSA and relevant framework, would be considered an asset.  The role calls for an academic qualification in a relevant field of study at National Qualification Framework Level 6 or better, duly certified by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC), or a widely recognised professional qualification at a comparable level.  You will also possess a minimum of three (3) years working in the area of financial services. Candidates with longer working experience relevant to the role will be preferred. If you do not have the necessary academic or professional qualifications but you have at least seven (7) years’ experience in a similar related role, we would still be interested in speaking with you.   The chosen candidate is expected to be a confident individual who is flexible, proactive and having a critical and analytical mind-set. The following skills and attributes are important for this position:   Keen interest in financial services regulatory and legislative development;  Excellent attention to detail;  Sound time management skills and ability to adapt to changing priorities, as may be necessary;  Ability to maintain good working relationships with other team players, including with external stakeholders in general;  Good research and excellent oral, written and presentation skills.   The selected candidate will be given opportunities to learn and be trained for the role, through various mechanisms which the Authority holds, such as, the Financial Supervisors Academy and also on the job training.      About Department      The Strategy, Policy and Innovation function is responsible for providing advice, analyses and reviews on current and prospective strategies and policies related to key priority areas in respect to the various financial services sectors. The function also proposes new areas which could potentially be delved into by the MFSA and provides insight on how related frameworks may be developed.  In formulating and proposing policies, the function seeks to ensure that the Authority is proactive in the face of new opportunities, perceived risks and changing international standards which may impact the financial services sector, whilst fostering innovation and enhancing access to financial products. The function hence contributes towards strengthening Malta’s framework for the regulation of the sector, whilst promoting and coordinating strategic thinking across all functions within the MFSA.   As part of its remit, the function is also responsible for participating in selected local, EU and international fora, including committees of the European Supervisory Authorities, which may impinge on the Authority’s strategies and policies.       About Role        The successful candidate will join an analytical and multidisciplinary team of policy experts and will have the opportunity to participate in the shaping and implementation of key regulatory policy initiatives, falling within the various sectors regulated by the MFSA, with a particular focus, amongst others, on Sustainable Finance.   The role requires individuals who can interpret law and related regulatory frameworks and be able to understand market needs and trends, as part of the policy formulation process. The selected candidate will be responsible for:   Contributing and supporting the implementation of key policy initiatives in relation to sustainable finance undertaken by the Authority, as well as, developing expertise in relation to ESG factors to strengthen the MFSA’s work in this area;  Participating in the formulation, implementation and evaluation of other cross-sectoral strategy and policy projects and related ongoing policy work;  Liaising with other directorates within the Authority, as well as other governmental bodies and external stakeholders in the implementation of such policy work and act as a contact point, as required, to facilitate communication channels;  Participating in selected local, EU and international fora, including the relevant committees of the European Supervisory Authorities, which may impinge on the Authority’s strategies and policies;  Liaising and cooperating with foreign regulators, as required;  Undertaking other tasks as directed by line management, depending on the Authority’s exigencies.       How to Apply      Candidates are to forward a copy of their Curriculum Vitae (C.V.) and an accompanying covering letter providing the motivation for the application to vacancies@mfsa.mt.      Other Info      The MFSA is an Equal Opportunities Employer as certified by the NCPE (National Commission for the Protection of Equality) and is committed to a policy of equal opportunity in all aspects of employment and will take care to avoid any form of discrimination in its recruitment procedures. The MFSA reserves the right to withdraw this call at any time and not to select any of the Candidates.  It is the responsibility of applicants in possession of qualifications awarded by Universities and other similar institutions outside Malta to produce a recognition statement on comparability of qualifications issued by the Malta Qualifications Recognition Information Centre (MQRIC). Applicants should do so preferably at application stage or otherwise at the preliminary interview should an applicant be selected for such interview. Details can be obtained by accessing the National Commission for Further and Higher Education website on www.ncfhe.gov.mt under MQRIC heading.  The MFSA shall ensure that any processing of personal data is in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation), the Data Protection Act (Chapter 586 of the Laws of Malta) and any other relevant European Union and national law. For further details, you may refer to the Data Protection Policy on the MFSA webpage www.mfsa.mt.  Candidates are to note that the submission of any false statement/s or omission, even if unintended, may lead to the cancellation of their application and may render the candidate's appointment liable to termination.  Furthermore, please note that candidates may be asked to submit any documentation in support of the information provided, including but not limited to, proof of qualifications and Police Conduct Certificates.     Public Call No: 683/2022

title: Junior Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Python, SQL, +8 more
job_description: Alfa Group  è una realtà italiana operante anche livello internazionale. Nel corso di oltre 20 anni di attività abbiamo sviluppato tecnologie, competenze e alleanze strategiche in ambiti di gestione e automazione dei processi (Business Process Management), Cyber Security, Antifrode e ERP, con l’obiettivo di accompagnare le aziende nel processo di Digital Transformation e di supportarne la resilienza attraverso l'efficace governance del rischio cyber e attraverso la prevenzione e il contrasto di minacce informatiche e frodi.     Attualmente il Gruppo conta 4 uffici sul territorio italiano (Roma, Milano, Bologna e Porto San Giorgio) e due sul territorio Europeo (Eindhoven e Londra), all’interno dei quali opera un team di oltre 160 professionisti tra Dipendenti e Collaboratori, con oltre 400 Clienti attivi.     Nell’ambito del potenziamento della nostra Unit di "Analytics" cerchiamo  Junior   Data Scientist.           Mission    Creare valore attraverso l’analisi approfondita dei dati e l’utilizzo delle tecnologie più adatte a trasformare i requisiti funzionali e di business in implementazioni integrate in grado di supportare le esigenze analitiche e decisionali dei nostri clienti.          Responsabilità/Attività:    I nostri Data Analyst/Scientist saranno introdotti in contesti progettuali e si occuperanno di:  · Supportare la comprensione delle esigenze e i requisiti del Cliente;  · supportare l’analisi della base dati del Cliente;  · supportare il lavoro di preparazione dei dati;  · supportare lo sviluppo ed implementazione di reportistica e dashboard.          Requisiti:    · laurea in Data Science, Ingegneria Informatica, Ingegneria Matematica, Informatica, Fisica, Economia, Statistica o discipline affini (STEM);  · forte approccio quantitativo e brillanti doti analitiche;  · competenza in ambito data exploration, analisi dati e creazione di modelli;  · conoscenza approfondita del pacchetto MS Office;  · conoscenza di database relazionali (MySQL/Oracle) e di linguaggio SQL;  · conoscenza scripting con uno o più dei seguenti linguaggi: Python, R;  · conoscenza preferenziale di tecnologia e linguaggio di programmazione SAS;  · conoscenza preferenziale di strumenti di data visualization e Business Intelligence (Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense).          Soft Skills:    · Dinamismo, proattività, spirito d’iniziativa;  · Senso di responsabilità, organizzazione, qualità del lavoro;  · Flessibilità e autonomia nei task operativi;  · Ottime doti relazionali e comunicative;  · Orientamento al cliente e al raggiungimento degli obiettivi;  · Buona attitudine a lavorare in team;  · Precisione e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze;  · Disponibilità per trasferte in Italia e all’estero.           Sede di lavoro:  Roma, Milano           Sono possibili brevi trasferte presso i Clienti o presso le altre sedi italiane ed estere (EMEA) del Gruppo.               Per candidarsi inviare il CV con autorizzazione al trattamento dei dati a curriculum@alfagroup.it indicando nell’oggetto “Junior Data Scientist”.         I dati personali saranno trattati in conformità al Regolamento UE 2016/679 e successive integrazioni; gli interessati possono consultare l’Informativa sul trattamento dei dati personali sul sito www.alfagroup.it

title: Developer

job_description: De Nora is an Italian multinational company, listed on the Euronext Milan stock exchange, a global provider of innovative technologies and solutions, and is recognized as a partner of choice for significant industrial electrochemical processes. Since its foundation in 1923, De Nora has been driven by the philosophy of continual improvement. Today, it is the world’s largest supplier of high-performing catalytic coatings and insoluble electrodes for electrochemical and industrial applications. It is also a leading supplier of equipment, systems, and processes for water disinfection and filtration. De Nora is committed to developing unconventional solutions to achieve the energy transition to decarbonization, the green hydrogen economy, and clean water for everyone.   For our ICT department, we are looking for a  developer  who will:      Execute clearly defined tasks, closely reviewed for accuracy and soundness, without acting independently.   Collect data, maintain accurate and complete records, organize information   Interacting with colleague, guided by more experienced engineer/developer/functional analysts, occasionally interface with other functions' colleagues   Collect information related to the ICT contracts and maintain the database of the same. Integrate budget and actual in the database and prepare the reporting for the ICT Directors.   Interact with backoffice to prepare and manage the purchase requisitions related to ICT contracts, supporting ICT line managers in the criteria definition.   Maintain SAP user-id and role / profiles under the supervision of the senior manager. Beyond the technical skills he/she will learn the main concepts of Segregation of Duties and their application in the industrial processes.      Education And Professional Experience       Diploma or bachelor in Computer Science.   Basic knowledge of programming languages ((Microsoft based, SAP based..)   SAP ABAP knowledge is a plus   Experience on Microsoft tools like Excel and Power Point.   English level: minimum B2 Upper Intermediate     We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride of our diverse and inclusive environment. We aim to attract and recruit individuals with diverse backgrounds, skills, and abilities, who will enhance the quality of our products and services and contribute to the Group’s success. We are committed to prioritize talent, make people feel respected, appreciated, and free to fully express their potential.

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

job_description: The promise that ArcelorMittal Europe makes to employees and prospective employees is 'make your world'. It describes not only the essential role of steel in modern life, such that our people really are physically making the world around them, but as well, the significant opportunity that ArcelorMittal gives to employees who are willing to step out of their comfort zone, take charge of their own development and realize their full potential.        ArcelorMittal is the leading automotive steel maker with a worldwide presence, delivering a large scale of products, solutions and services to automotive customers with the same high quality focus in all regions.        Today, the automotive industry faces two major challenges : CO2 reduction and improvement of safety standards. Reducing vehicle weight by using lighter solutions and optimizing steel utilization are obvious ways to cut emissions, and steel offers unbeatable crash protection. ArcelorMittal Tailored Blanks answers both these demands with innovative and sustainable solutions, also being able to leverage ArcelorMittal offer of decarbonized steels.        Our mission is to make cars lighter and safer, while creating sustainable mobility solutions.        Join AMTB if you have the ambition to be an actor of the transformation to a sustainable world ! job_description: Groupe familial indépendant depuis 1959, le Groupe Roullier est un acteur international engagé pour relever les défis nutritionnels de demain.  Spécialiste de la nutrition des plantes, du sol et des animaux, TIMAC AGRO, sa filiale historique, conçoit, fabrique et commercialise des solutions agronomiques à haute valeur ajoutée dans 40 pays. Toutes nos actions gravitent autour d’un modèle unique qui allie la proximité avec nos clients, la création de produits spécifiques, l’innovation constante et la performance industrielle.  Poussés par notre volonté de développement et nos objectifs de croissance nous recherchons aujourd’hui, au sein de notre siège social basé à Saint Malo (35) et en CDI, un       Chef.fe de Projet Data et BI F/H        Vos missions    Rattaché à la Responsable Data & BI, vous prendrez en charge la gestion applicative et la mise en œuvre de solutions Data & Business Intelligence de Timac Agro International. Pour cela vos missions principales se regroupent en trois grands pôles :     1) Vous assurez la maintenance et l’évolution des outils existants :  · Intégration de données dans un Data Warehouse (SQL, Talend)  · Gestion des applications Business Intelligence (Power BI)     2) Vous animerez la communauté d’utilisateurs BI et Data à l’international :  · Formalisation des besoins et création de spécifications fonctionnelles  · Accompagnement fonctionnel et technique des partenaires internationaux dans leurs utilisation de la BI     3) Vous aidez à la mise en place de la nouvelle architecture :  · Création de nouveaux flux ETL  · Conception de l’architecture du Data Warehouse  · Partage des datasets pour les partenaires       Votre profil    Issu d'une formation Bac+5 en Systèmes d’Information (universitaire ou ingénieur), vous justifiez idéalement de minimum 4 ans d’expérience sur des fonctions similaires.     Vous disposez d’une réelle aptitude au traitement des données ainsi qu’un intérêt pour la BI, les problématiques de gouvernance de la donnée et parlez anglais couramment.     Ce poste est au contact de nombreux interlocuteurs métiers ayant des niveaux techniques très variés et vos qualités humaines (autonomie, rigueur, bonne humeur, persévérance ...) sont tout aussi importantes que vos compétences techniques.

title: BUSINESS ANALYST (h/f/x) CDI
skills: None
job_description: Vous recherchez un impact sociétal direct et concret dans votre engagement professionnel ?    Alors rejoignez la coopérative Smart qui œuvre dans ce sens depuis près de 25 ans.    Qui est Smart ? Quelle est son action au quotidien ?      Smart permet à des porteur·euses de projets issus de métiers très variés de développer leurs activités professionnelles en accédant à un ensemble d’outils émanant de l’entreprise qu’ils et elles partagent : juridiques, financiers, administratifs, formations, accompagnement économique, espaces de travail.      Quelques chiffres :      Smart, c’est un réseau de partenaires présents dans 8 pays en Europe.  Smart Belgique, c’est 9 bureaux situés à Bruxelles, Wallonie et Flandres  Smart Belgique, c’est 19 000 travailleur·euses qui ont utilisé ses services en 2021      Présentation détaillée de Smart :   https://smartbe.be/fr/a-propos/      Dans la continuité de son développement et pour renforcer son pôle produit, Smart recrute :        1 Business analyst dynamique et motivé.e        Au sein de l’organisation Smart, la Direction des Systèmes d’Informations garante du développement, de l’évolution et de la maintenance technologique de notre coopérative, est dotée d’un pôle produit dont la mission est de maintenir au plus haut niveau possible la valeur du produit informatique de Smart en développant une connaissance approfondie de ses fonctionnalités, de son usage et des ambitions stratégiques qu’il doit servir.       Quelles sont les missions et activités principales ?    Sous la responsabilité de la directrice des systèmes d’informations, vous aurez pour principales missions et activités de/d’:       Missions principales        Comprendre, analyser et décrire le besoin justifiant une évolution ou une exploitation du système IT   Comprendre, analyser et décrire les concepts et les processus métiers   Identifier et modéliser les évolutions de ces processus et leurs impacts        Activités principales        Sur l’aspect collaboratif et organisationnel   Organiser des ateliers avec les parties prenantes pour clarifier la demande et le besoin,   Comprendre la demande métier et identifier son impact sur les concepts et les processus existants   Aligner le business et l’IT sur la compréhension du besoin   Collaborer avec le/les PO pour découper la demande en incréments de produits   Collaborer avec les PO, les tech lead et les analystes fonctionnels pour sélectionner la solution à mettre en œuvre et en assurer la compréhension business        Sur l’aspect technique et de contenu :   Identifier toutes les parties prenantes impliquées par une demande   Décrire et clarifier les règles métier à appliquer dans la mise en œuvre de la solution   Documenter le besoin, les processus, les systèmes   Définir les fonctionnalités attendues pour chaque intervenant   Challenger, avec le PO les solutions proposées pour maximiser la valeur business de la réponse apportée à un problème   Veiller avec le PO à la cohérence métier de chaque incrément        Votre profil        Vous disposez de connaissances en gestion d’entreprise, en gestion des ressources humaines, statistiques, marketing et finances   Vous disposez d’une expérience comparable au sein d’une entreprise de même taille en tant que business analyst et vous maitrisez le concept d’agilité   Vous pouvez motiver les parties prenantes d’un projet   Vous pouvez démontrer une expérience en animation d’ateliers   Vous maîtrisez les outils bureautiques et de travail collaboratif, y compris les applications et logiciels de la suite Office 365 ;   Vous maîtrisez les outils informatiques : système de ticketing, de base de données, les outils de stockage et d’extraction d’informations, de programmation et de développement   Vous faites preuve d’une bonne communication orale et écrite ;   Vous êtes à l’écoute, vous avez le sens de contact et le sens de la négociation ainsi que de la diplomatie   Vous avez le sens de l’organisation, la rigueur et l’autonomie   Vous faites preuve de créativité, de curiosité et d’ouverture d’esprit   Vous aimez travailler en équipe et apprenez de manière autodidacte   Vous avez une bonne capacité d’analyse et un esprit de synthèse   Vous êtes résistant au stress        Alors n’hésitez pas à postuler :        Nous offrons :     Un contrat à durée indéterminée à temps plein ;   Lieu de travail principal : Siège de la coopérative, à Bruxelles ;   Un environnement de travail agréable au sein d’une coopérative en pleine croissance ;   La possibilité de choisir un télétravail partiel, organisé en accord avec votre hiérarchie   Un package salarial attractif : prime de fin d’année, chèques-repas, écochèques (250€/an), assurance-groupe, remboursement des déplacements domicile/lieu de travail à 100% sur base d’un abonnement de transport en commun, abonnement GSM.        Intéressé.e ?       Merci de nous faire parvenir votre lettre de motivation accompagnée d’un CV détaillé au plus tard le vendredi 12/05/2023 par mail à Smart : jobs@smart.coop  en indiquant dans l’objet de votre mail la référence suivante : 2304107-BA-Bruxelles-DSI       Ce poste est à pourvoir immédiatement.          Smart agit en faveur de la diversité et encourage toutes les personnes ayant les compétences requises à transmettre leur candidature, et ce quels que soient leur origine, couleur de peau, sexe, âge, orientation sexuelle, conviction philosophique, handicap, …        Si vous avez besoin d’un aménagement, quel que soit votre handicap, et ce pour la phase de sélection à cette fonction ou après celle-ci, n’hésitez pas à nous contacter.

title: Business Analyst - Manufacturing & Supply Chain
skills: Skills: Английский язык, Ведение переговоров, +8 more
job_description: What we expect.   As a Manufacturing and Supply Chain Expert (25%) , you will be involved in several internal and external missions, working in a challenging environment, helping our customers and partners to take the best advantage of our Manufacturing suite of apps. You will participate in the product evolution by providing feedback to the product owner. You will be a point of reference for the team of business analysts, providing support on complex project implementations and creating relevant product documentation.         As a Business Analyst (75%) , you will implement Odoo. You'll be in direct contact with the clients to help them with the good use of Odoo Software (eCommerce, Marketing, Finance...). Therefore, you will analyse their needs and deliver personal training sessions. Basically, you'll be responsible to deliver the best management solution to your customers!      As a Business Analyst , you will also  support the growth of our partner network . You will help & coach our partners, from all around the world, to implement their customers projects and to become Odoo Experts.     You'll work on various different projects at the same time. In the very first weeks, you will quickly get involved in your first projects receiving the support of more experienced colleagues. You will progressively increase your level of autonomy but never forget that two heads are better than one! You won't have time to get bored as each project is different (industry, scope, etc.).        RESPONSIBILITIES    Project Management (80%)   Gain the trust of your customers  Analyse the customer needs and suggest solutions  Implement the agreed solutions (configuration & development)  Make your customer/partner an Odoo Champion (training)  Follow the project and communicate about its status and the ongoing tasks  Organise and follow up Odoo implementations   Internal improvement (20%)   Feedback to the Product Owners  Coaching & Training  Feedback for department improvement             MUST HAVE    1-8 years of experience in ERP implementation in a MRP/Supply Chain domain OR Bachelor/Master in Supply Chain related   Valid work permit for Belgium   Fluent in English    Learn fast  Multitasking  Good communication/negotiation skills  Autonomous, Assertive & Proactive  Affinity with the IT world

title: Supply Officer & Data Analyst - Systems & Equipment (d/f/m)
skills: Skills: Управление логистикой, Recovery Plans, +8 more
job_description: Job Description     Airbus Commercial Aircraft  is looking for a  Supply Officer & Data Analyst - Systems & Equipment (d/f/m)  located in  Hamburg  with a possible start date of  August 2023  or later.  In this position you will be a member of the Supply Management Upgrades & Retrofit Team.  The Supply Management for Upgrades & Retrofit is an international team based in Hamburg and Toulouse, closely interacting with international suppliers and our internal customers. We are responsible for the on-time and on-quality delivery of parts for the Aftersales Upgrades & Retrofit business supporting the in-service fleet of airlines and lessors.  Our multicultural team is managing a wide range of suppliers across Europe and all over the world. We are looking for a motivated and open minded colleague as a boost for our Team. We are working in a flexible environment with high team-spirit.  The Supply Officer is reflecting the center pillar of the triangle between Ordering (that's us), Contracts (Commercial Procurement buyers) and the Supply Chain Quality Manager. As the job holder you manage purchase orders for on-time and on-quality delivery of the ordered parts.  You will start in the position supported by a buddy helping you to navigate in the Airbus environment and get to know the business. If you are a fresh graduate without any experience and a fast-learner, feel free to apply to change the aeronautics world together with us.  Our location  You will be working at the largest production site for civil aircraft situated in Hamburg. Its location on the southern banks of the river Elbe includes the option to commute by ferry. Experience the special flair of Hamburg in your spare time where vibrant cosmopolitan culture meets nautic legacy.  Your benefits    Attractive salary and special payments  30 days holidays and extra days-off for special occasions  Excellent upskilling opportunities and great development prospects  Special benefits: employer-funded pension, employee stock options, discounted car leasing, special conditions for insurances, transportation subsidy, employee benefits at cooperating companies  On-site-facilities: Kindergarten close to the site, medical officer for check-ups and other health-related services, canteen and cafeteria    At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.  Your tasks and responsibilities    Supply Management      In this position you actively manage the flow of materials to Airbus as well as to our external customers and find solutions to fulfill customer demands for Aircraft Systems & Equipment parts  You communicate demands to suppliers, take care of placing and following-up orders, are responsible for anticipating production disturbances and managing recovery plans  You monitor the supply chain performance, identify areas for supplier development and establish close relationships to supporting functions to implement such improvements  You play an active role in defining and negotiating logistics processes   You support our digital transformation journey by actively contributing to automatization developments and business intelligence      Data Analysis      You transform data into actionable insights for business intelligence as well as operational performance diagnostics   You perform data fusion, data manipulation and enrichment, data cleaning and data extraction      Desired Skills And Qualifications      Educated to a Bachelor’s degree (Business Administration, Supply Chain Management, Engineering etc.)   Or a completed technical or commercial apprenticeship (e.g. in aviation sector/supply chain)   You have first experience in basic coding / data analytics and in supply chain / logistics  You have knowledge and ideally experience in data analytics tools (Skywise, Celonis, SAP Analytics etc.) and SAP/R3 (materials management)   Experience with suppliers and project management is a plus  Google workspace (GSuite) is something you ideally have already worked with    Desired soft skills    You enjoy working on short term demands in a reactive and proactive approach and think out-of-the-box to propose solutions  You enjoy working in an international environment with different cultures  You have a positive and open mindset, are eager to learn and adopt new technologies  You are a team player and cooperation is very important to you  You have very good communication skills (technical as well as non-technical) and intuition for customer needs   Your working method is very structured and you have the ability to think analytically and understand complex situations  As a self motivated person, you are able to work autonomously    Desired language skills    English at negotiation level  All other languages are a plus    Business travels    The position might involve irregular business trips (1 - 2 times per year) in Europe.    Take your career to a new level and apply  online  by providing your CV including your salary expectation and notice period.  Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.  You have a question regarding this job offer? Please do not hesitate to get in touch by writing to  questions@airbus.com .  This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.    Company    Airbus Operations GmbH    Contract Type    Permanent    Experience Level    Entry Level    Job Family    Supplier Management  By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.  Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.  Airbus is, and always has been, committed to equal opportunities for all. As such, we will never ask for any type of monetary exchange in the frame of a recruitment process. Any impersonation of Airbus to do so should be reported to emsom@airbus.com.  At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly. Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

title: Junior Business Analyst - back office team
skills: None
job_description: We are looking for bright and energetic young potentials that are passionate about IT consultancy and Business Analysis in particular in order to strengthen our back -office team at one of our clients in the energy sector .      Your day-to-day activities      Validation and Confirmation of transactions across a wide range of commodity markets and with trading counterparties (internal and external) for all UK trading activities. This includes trades executed on exchanges and Over the Counter (OTC) directly with counterparties under various contract structures. Maintain a system for tracking outstanding confirmations and liaise with counterparties to ensure all outstanding confirmations are received.     Invoicing: Accurate preparation and validation of commodity invoices, associated fees (including broker fees, gas shipping and transportation charges) and some ancillary services.     Daily cash margining process: agree daily cash margin (also referred to as cash collateral) exposures with trading counterparties. The process includes running MtM/exposure reports, calculating and agreeing payments due to/due from the counterparty, and forwarding the relevant paperwork to the finance team for payment in a timely manner. This is a time sensitive process that involves daily payments by set deadlines and being proactive in following up if there are late responses and/or mismatches.     Query Resolution: Have a thorough understanding of commodities and contract structures traded to successfully resolve queries from internal and external counterparties.     Compliance control: Review deals from a compliance and control point of view and flag up for corrective action (e.g. errors and breaches by traders).     Financial Control: Liaise with colleagues in the wider business to ensure cash settlement occurs and follow up late payments with counterparties where necessary.     Internal Control, Best Practice and Audit: Develop and maintain clear and logical administrative processes with efficient audit trails. Assist with audit queries as and when they arise. Strive to develop the Back Office as an area of “Best Practice”.     Financial and Trading Reporting: Ensure all required information is provided under agreed deadlines to various users including:  o Finance teams - for cash forecasting, gross margin reporting and month end reporting o Risk Management- for trading reports     o Wider areas of the business for ad-hoc analysis     Compliance with Contractual Terms: Ensure all Back Office processes are carried out in accordance with contractual obligations.     Regulatory reporting: support Back Office team with regulatory reporting (REMIT, EMIR etc)  Various Ad-Hoc Tasks, including:  o provide knowledge and support during Trade System improvement projects.     o propose and participate in improving processes and tools (e.g., automate manual tasks, update and improve existing tools etc.).     Back up cover for the team – provide cover for the Back Office team when colleagues are out of the office (e.g., holiday/sick leave cover).         What you need to be successful in this role   • Bachelor or Master degree  • You have good presentation and communication skills;  • You are fluent in Dutch and you have a good knowledge of English;  • You facilitate workshops that lead to results;  • You are a good team player but you’re also able to work autonomously;  • You are a good listener and communicate clearly with people from different departments;  • You effectively extract relevant information available in the organization;      Our offer   We offer you a full-time contract .      Are you ready to be part of our story?   Apply now! We will contact you as soon as possible. Questions about the position? Ask them to Bart Jansen mailto:bart.jansen@cgi.com.  For other questions about the application procedure contact recruiter Fabienne Philips mailto:fabienne.philips@cgi.com.     We do not cooperate with external Recruitment parties.  Acquisition due to our vacancies is therefore not appreciated.      Insights you can act on    While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success     When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees “members” because they are CGI shareholders and owners, and, as owners, we enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today—one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.  At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where everyone belongs, and we collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal opportunity employer, we empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know.  We will be happy to assist.  Ready to become part of our success story? Join CGI—where your ideas and actions make a difference.

title: Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Machine Learning Algorithms, Deep Learning, +8 more
job_description: The role of Data Scientist is responsible for analysing data and implementing machine learning algorithms and statistical models. These activities require the integration of strong analytical skills, statistics, business acumen and programming to create advanced and innovative solutions of data analysis and business intelligence. The role also includes participation in activities of new business ideation and business know-how in the following industries: finance, banking, insurance, energy, retail distribution, telecommunication, manufacturing.  The role requires strong understanding of the following methodologies: Machine Learning, Bayesian Networks, very thorough knowledge of applied statistics in general.      The position is open for our  Milan  office.      Requirements       PhD in a quantitative field (Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, etc.)   5+ years of experience  in similar positions  Theoretical understanding of statistical modeling and machine-learning algorithms  Advanced knowledge of Python  Knowledge of relational and non-relational databases  Fluency in English and Italian       Responsibilities       Analyse and interpret raw data: assessing quality, cleansing and structuring for downstream processing  Support senior data scientists in designing accurate and scalable prediction algorithms  Support engineering team to bring analytical prototypes to production       Nice to have       Knowledge of other languages (e.g. Scala, R)  Experience in implementing and applying Machine Learning and Deep Learning algorithms in university assignments or industry use cases  Knowledge of the main cloud platform (AWS, GCP, ...)       What we offer       Opportunity of flexible working  Opportunity to grow professionally and personally working hand to hand with senior data scientists from top-tier international universities (Sissa, University of Cambridge, KTH, University of Warwick, IDIDS)  Exposure to cutting-edge technologies (e.g. Big Data Hadoop-based applications, Deep Neural Networks, Reinforcement Learning) and very innovative projects that leverage on machine learning techniques to generate value  Occasion to build end-to-end applications that embed all stages of the data-value chain (ingestion, transformation, analytics and frontends), with exposure to data engineering, data science and data viz challenges  Direct interaction with clients and use cases in many different fields: Energy, Telecommunication, Banking, Finance, Insurance, Retail, Logistics, etc...

job_description: Jakala  è la prima società  martech  italiana che offre ai propri clienti supporto in ambito strategico, analytics, digital e technology. title: Global Manager Data Analytics
skills: Skills: Mobile Switching Centre Server (MSS), Statistical Analysis, +8 more
job_description: About Abbott     Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 113,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.   Abbott serves the Irish market with a diverse range of healthcare products including diagnostics, medical devices and nutritionals products. In Ireland, Abbott employs over 5,000 people across nine sites. We have six manufacturing facilities located in Clonmel, Cootehill, Donegal, Longford and Sligo and a third-party manufacturing management operation in Sligo. Abbott has commercial, support operations and shared services in Dublin and Galway. We have been operating in Ireland since 1946.     Background/Opportunity     As a Medical Safety & Surveillance (MSS) Manager, Data Engineering/Analytics within the Research and Development organization, the candidate will use his/her technical expertise and in-depth understanding of data engineering and advanced analytics to drive the Medical Safety Analytics program.     What You’ll Work On       Developing a deep understanding of business needs (short term and long term goals) and driving the adoption of analytic solutions deployed that contain actional information  Working with IT to execute data ETL (extract, transform, load) from source systems into the Datamart and MSS business owned area within MS Azure  Evaluating application and implementing advanced techniques/methodologies in the area of data analytics (i.e., machine learning, predictive algorithms, automation, etc.) to medical safety related data  Assessing and implementing use of advanced statistical analysis to determine trends and significant data relationships  Assisting with the cleansing of new data for future data analytics activities  Validating datasets, models, analytical techniques, etc. used for medical safety related analyses  Working with stakeholders to define business questions, requirements, timelines, objectives and success criteria  Clearly communicating data limitations, restrictions; elevating data concerns with proposed solutions to identified issues  Ensuring integrity & security of data is maintained and processes related to data analytics are in compliance with internal procedures and external regulatory/legal requirements  Establishing and maintaining important relationships with key cross-functional business stakeholders  Building, nurturing and supporting a strong data culture within MSS and the entire Research and Development organization, where high quality data and analytics are key in driving decisions  Developing and implementing MSS overall strategy for Data Analytics       Required      EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE, YOU’LL BRING      Education       Bachelor’s degree (master’s preferred) in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Statistics (or any other related field)   7+ years of experience in a data analyst/engineer position. Higher education may compensate for some years of experience       Preferred       Advanced experience with programming scripts such as SQL, R (as well as Excel)  Advanced experience with visualization tools, such as PowerBI  Experience in working with data warehousing and cloud-based computing services, notably Microsoft Azure  Knowledge of mathematical programming, statistics, advanced analytics methods (e.g., machine learning, etc.)  Excellent written, verbal and listening communication skills as well as project management skills      Abbott Ireland is an equal opportunities employer

job_description: STMicroelectronics is a leading semiconductor company, a world key player thanks to our more than 50,000 employees including 8,300 working in R&D.    ST's products are found everywhere today. And together with our customers, we are enabling smarter driving, homes, factories, and cities, along with the next generation of mobile and Internet of Things devices. Everywhere microelectronics makes a positive contribution to people lives, ST is there.     WHY JOINING US :   At ST, we are more than 50,000 men and women designers and manufacturers of microelectronic technologies. We collaborate with 200,000 customers and thousands of partners. With them, we design and create products, solutions and ecosystems that address their challenges and opportunities and the need to contribute to a more sustainable world. Our advanced technologies enable smarter mobility, more efficient energy and power management, and large-scale deployment of the Internet of Things (IoT) and 5G. ST is certified Top Employers France 2023. This certification recognizes our commitment to integration and professional insertion, equal opportunities, employability and quality of life at work.      OUR FUTURE COLLABORATION :  You will join the Manufacturing and Data Analytics group in order to provide advanced solution at ST level. More specifically you will be part of a team dedicated to use case exploration based on data sciences technics. This will offer you the opportunity to foster your skill in deep learning, statistics, NLP, etc.. You will be working in an innovative environment with high development standards. You will be in direct relationship with business owners, data engineers, data analysts, architects from data exploration to first production steps and you will be a key actor to define the solution. Inside Data solution group your primary focus will be on Statitistics and NLP. You will be able to have an end-to-end view of projects.    With an Ingineer Degree in Computer Science/Mathematics/ Statistics or equivalent ( Masters or PhD preferred), ability to manipulate data and having experience on AI & ML using Python/R, understanding of business needs and be a proposal actor for solution. Fluent in English. Technical skills : NLP, Statisitics Machine Learning, Deep Learning Computer vision, time series Python, R Tools : Databricks, Dataiku, Spotfire  Soft skills : Strong communication skills Team player, Innovative mindset and proposal force

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Research Analyst
skills: Skills: Factiva, Финансовый анализ, +8 more
job_description: Insight Centre Research Analyst (m/w/d) - German Speaker      Alvarez & Marsal is a leading independent global professional services firm, specializing in providing turnaround management, performance improvement and corporate advisory services. With more than 7,500 professionals globally, our firm excels in problem solving and value creation. Drawing on a strong operational heritage and hands-on-approach, our professionals work closely with organizations and stakeholders to help tackle complex business issues and maximize value.     Our  Insight Centre  is the rapidly growing research and benchmarking arm of A&M and it's mission is to provide our professionals with highly relevant, industry specific, actionable, fact-based insights derived through our proprietary benchmark and research studies on a global basis. The group was founded to adhere to one of A&M’s founding principles, “No shooting from the hip”. It supports client work and business development projects with an ever-growing toolbox of products, including custom benchmarking and research studies and targeted subscriptions and resources. The team considers research both a science and an art, and as such is committed to developing high-quality, unique and insightful deliverables to support stakeholders.      The Role   A&M’s Insight Centre is recruiting a  Research Analyst  into our  Munich  office to support our German, Swiss, French and Spanish practices. The Research Analyst will be an integral part of the Insight Centre, working alongside one other Research Analyst in Munich, but reporting to the European Senior Manager and Senior Director who is based in London. This role will help our existing team member in Germany drive uptake of Insight Centre’s services by European practitioners. The role involves working directly with practitioners to deliver a wide range of secondary desk-based research services which support thought leadership, business development and client work. This role requires the keen ability to multi-task in order to deliver a range of research requests. The role does provide a lot of training and course attendance opportunities as part of your professional development.     There may be some travel required throughout A&M’s European offices, particularly London, as well as potentially occasional travel to the US.      The Responsibilities   You will fulfill a wide range of varied research requests by interacting directly with A&M stakeholders from all divisions and across all levels - from Analysts to Managing Directors. You will engage in the full life-cycle of the request from the scoping phase to delivering the final output.  These requests will include, but are not limited to the following examples:   Identifying and obtaining reports from industry, financial, IT and news subscriptions and resources  Assisting in Selling, General & Administrative (SG&A) functional and process benchmarking  Conducting financial analysis on a range of companies to understand their financial health  Creating market overviews to track industry trends      In addition, you will:   Help to manage the research request pipeline through Salesforce.com  Collaborate with the US-based team to prioritise, coordinate and manage any research requests sent to our third-party research partners  Promote the Insight Centre and provide education to the European professionals on how to leverage and engage with the Insight Centre  Increase awareness and management of local research tools  Train end-users on research best practices  Evaluate new research tools and service offerings  Work collaboratively with counterparts in the US as part of the global Insight Centre team to drive a “one-firm” approach to research       Who You Are   You’re a self-starter and problem solver that loves variety at work. You enjoy collaborating with team members from other USA and European offices. When faced with challenges to solve, you dive in and think creatively to find great solutions to research-based questions, therefore you have a good understanding of financial metrics and are comfortable with numbers, but importantly you have a flair for customer service.      What you bring    Fluent German, English (and preferably either French or Spanish) speaker  Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a related field (Relevant Information degree preferred)  Relevant work experience in a similar role  Excellent analytical skills and research experience using a research database such as Factiva, Capital IQ, APQC  Strong knowledge and understanding of fundamental financial research, financial analysis, and financial markets/trends  Exceptional written and verbal communication skills  Advanced knowledge of MS Office (Excel)       Your general qualities    Motivated by constant learning and desire to build something meaningful  Entrepreneurial  Ability to deliver high quality results, often in a time-constrained environment  Flexible/adaptable and creative thinker  Results-oriented mindset  Team Player  Positive and “Let’s Get it Done” attitude; willing to pitch in where needed

job_description: Job Description     DXC Technology (NYSE: DXC)  is the world’s leading independent, end-to-end IT services company, helping clients harness the power of innovation to thrive on change. Created by the merger of CSC and the Enterprise Services business of Hewlett Packard Enterprise, DXC Technology serves nearly 6,000 private and public sector clients across 70 countries. The company’s technology independence, global talent and extensive partner alliance combine to deliver powerful next-generation IT services and solutions. In Poland, we are located in Warsaw and Wrocław   Analytics Global Delivery Poland , a large, growing delivery center located in Warsaw, offers high-quality Applications/Platforms Development and Management Services to DXC customers all over the world. The Center’s portfolio covers the full software lifecycle, including Business and Systems Analysis, Development, Quality Assurance, Project Management, Testing and Support.
