title: Junior Data Scientist
skills: Skills: Обработка естественного языка, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: Experis, brand di ManpowerGroup presente in 54 paesi, grazie ai servizi integrati di Consulenza IT&Technology, Resourcing di professionisti specializzati, sviluppo di Career & Skills con Experis Academy, è il technical partner ideale per ogni azienda che necessita di realizzare progetti in ambito Cyber Security, Business Transformation, Cloud & Infrastructure, Enterprise Applications e Digital Workspace.     Il nostro cliente è una primaria realtà multinazionale Oil&Gas e ci ha incaricato di ricercare una figura di  Data Scientist  con una prima esperienza nel ruolo.     La persona opererà nel Team AI e Machine Learning, all’interno del dipartimento di Digital Transformation, per definire, ideare, preparare dati e implementare algoritmi e progetti. Nello specifico le mansioni sono:      Supporto al Data Science & Machine Learning Manager nell'identificare come sfruttare i dati aziendali per generare valore in termini di business;  Sviluppo di modelli di Machine Learning e algoritmi ad-hoc per creare soluzioni di Forecasting, Natural Language Processing, Computer, Vision;  Attività di Data Analytics & Insights al fine di estrarre informazioni utili al miglioramento continuo dei processi aziendali;  Sviluppo di processi e strumenti per monitorare e analizzare le prestazioni e l'accuratezza dei modelli e delle soluzioni implementate.       Requisiti richiesti:       Laurea in Informatica, Matematica, Statistica, Ingegneria;  Indicativamente 2-3 anni di esperienza come Data Scientist;  Esperienza nell’implementazione di modelli di Advanced Analytics (ambito industriale o universitario/accademico);  Esperienza in almeno una delle seguenti aree: Forecasting e Optimization, Natural Language Processing, Computer Vision;  Solida conoscenza di SAS o Python ed SQL;  Competenze in ambito Data Mining e Data Exploration;  Buona comprensione dei fondamenti del Machine Learning e degli algoritmi principali: clustering, decision tree learning, deep learning;  Buona conoscenza di tecniche statistiche quali classification, regression, statistic tests;  Inglese fluente (almeno un reale B2 parlato e scritto).       Costituiscono requisito preferenziale:       Certificazioni Azure Machine Learning e/o SAS;  Partecipazione a competizioni quali Kaggle, Hackathon;  Conoscenza del linguaggio R.       Completano il profilo:       Approccio analitico e attitudine al problem-solving;  Attitudine al lavoro in team;  Autonomia nell’organizzazione del proprio lavoro;  Buone doti comunicative per relazionarsi con colleghi e i vari attori coinvolti.       Sede di assunzione:  Milano      Tipologia contrattuale:  Assunzione Diretta con contratto a tempo indeterminato con CCNL Petrolio ed Energia.     L’offerta prevede lavoro ibrido, venerdì di 5 ore lavorative, accesso alla mensa aziendale quando si è in sede e buoni pasto se da remoto, assicurazione sanitaria integrativa.

title: Inventory Analytics Manager
skills: Skills: Аналитические навыки, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: FARFETCH exists for the love of fashion. Our mission is to be the global platform for luxury fashion, connecting creators, curators and consumers.  We're a positive platform for good, bringing together an incredible creative community made up by our people, our partners and our customers. This community is at the heart of our business success. We welcome differences, empower individuality and celebrate diverse skills and perspectives, creating an inclusive environment for everyone. We are FARFETCH for All.     OPERATIONS     We're passionate about operational excellence, acting with our customers and partners always in our heart. Covering the entire order journey, we create our online content, secure payments and fraud process compliance, ensure order fulfilment and delivery, while providing customer and partner care. In a nutshell, we love to create seamless and memorable luxury experiences for our customers all around the world.     PORTO     Our Porto office is located in Portugal's vibrant second city, known for its history and its creative yet cosy environment. You can have an informal meeting in the treehouse or play the piano during your lunch break!     THE ROLE     Stock visibility and analytics are central to our goal to always deliver the best service to our Customers. In order to lead our efforts to deliver relevant and actionable insights to the Business, we are seeking an experienced and business-savvy Inventory Analytics Manager to join our team. Reporting to our Head of Logistics Planning, you will lead a team of analysts responsible for utilizing data analysis and business acumen to identify opportunities and lead initiatives that optimize cost, maximize service and improve sustainability of our operation through inventory management.      WHAT YOU'LL DO       Support the development and implementation of our Stock Planning Tool. Operate as a subject matter expert in matters related to forecasting and management of stock.  Review, critique and modify stock management processes within our network from global inventory deployment to pick face replenishment in our DCs.  Own the data sharing routines with the DC teams. Be accountable for implementation of our insights and for measurement and improvement of the DC stock processes.  Continuously search and identify opportunities for improving inventory management. Use advanced analytics and business sense to support iterative improvements.  Stay up-to-date on industry trends and best practices in inventory management. Adapt, adopt and create industry leading ideas in this discipline.  Communicate effectively with all areas of the Business, from senior management to DC teams. Collaborate with internal teams, including procurement, tech and ops becoming the go-to person for relevant and insightful inventory knowledge.       WHO YOU ARE       Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Economics, or related field.  Minimum of 5 years of experience in inventory management and analysis with a commercial bias in all decisions.  Strong analytical skills, with experience utilizing data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker and Excel.  Not afraid to get your hands dirty on building analysis and insight.  Strong leadership and team management skills. Experience developing and nurturing highly analytical teams.  Excellent communication and presentation skills.  Proven experience in leading projects and delivering results.       BENEFITS & PERKS       Health insurance for the whole family, flexible working environment and well-being support and tools  Extra days off, sabbatical program and days for you to give back for the community  Training opportunities and free access to Udemy  Flexible benefits program  FARFETCH Equity plan       EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES STATEMENT       FARFETCH is an equal opportunities employer ensuring that all applicants are treated equally and fairly throughout our recruitment process. We are determined that no applicant experiences discrimination on the basis of sex, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, disability, age, gender identity, ancestry, sexual orientation, veteran status, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, or any other basis prohibited by applicable law. We continue to build our consciously inclusive culture as part of our Positively FARFETCH strategy throughout our business, partnerships and communities.         Reporting to our Head of Logistics Planning, you will lead a team of analysts responsible for utilizing data analysis and business acumen to identify opportunities and lead initiatives that optimize cost, maximize service and improve sustainability of our operation through inventory management

title: Data Analyst Professional Programme
skills: None
job_description: Hybrid – Expectation of once or twice a week in Ansty, Coventry      £29,000    Are you interested in pursuing a career in data analysis? We are currently seeking individuals who have a strong analytical mindset, excellent problem-solving skills, and a keen attention to detail to join our Data Analyst professional programme to join our comprehensive Data Analyst Professional programme.   Cadent Gas is dedicated to investing in our employees' growth and development, offering opportunities for career advancement. Our training programme delivers comprehensive instruction in gathering, analysing, and interpreting complex data sets to inform business decisions. As part of the Data Management team, you will collaborate with experienced professionals and receive extensive training in data analysis methods, data visualization, and data modelling techniques.   Our 24-month programme is structured to offer hands-on experience with industry-leading tools and technologies, including SQL, Python, and MS Power BI. You will also have the chance to work on real-world projects, gaining practical skills that will help you acquire a wide range of knowledge and expertise. This unique opportunity will enable you to become a Future Professional in your area of specialisation by providing practical knowledge and experience.   In addition to high-quality training that's paid for you’ll be supported every step of the way by a dedicated programme manager, business mentor and line manager. Our community of trainees also provide the perfect support network, pulling from their personal experience they’ll provide guidance and assistance, and you’ll inspire each other from the very start.   We believe in developing and investing in talent, and we know that by supporting our future talent to gain the very best skills, behaviours and experience, we’ll continue to have a bright, successful future and you will too.   If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding career in data analysis, we encourage you to apply for our training programme today!    What You Will Bring    We’re looking for people who act with pride, purpose, and ownership to join our Professional Programme, along with:      A passion for analysing and interpreting data   Ability to identity risk and approach complex problems in a methodical and logical manner   A strong attention to detail   A willingness to learn with lots of drive and motivation   Someone organised and structured and can prioritise activities   A team player who can communicate, collaborate and enjoy working with different people.   Able to clearly communicate to senior management and effective engagement with our stakeholders   Ability to approach complex problems in a methodical and logical manner   Ability to challenge and improve processes   Good knowledge of using Microsoft Office to analyse and present information      What’s In It For You    Here at Cadent, we are committed to supporting our employees to get the best out of themselves. For this role we can offer:      Funding and support towards your professional accreditation   Ample opportunity for progression within the business   Mentoring and guidance opportunities      Benefits     We offer a host of benefits to suit your lifestyle and support your well-being. These include:       Pension Scheme double matched up to a total of 18% of salary (i.e., employee contributions of up to 6%, double matched by a Cadent contribution of up to 12%)   25 days holiday, plus statutory days, and an option to buy more   Fantastic career development prospects with funded learning options, including support with exams, and internal and external learning and development   Strong focus on supporting you as an individual including:   hybrid working   flexible working   strong commitments to ED&I   generous family provision policies   Flexible benefits including cycle to work scheme, salary sacrifice car scheme, insurance, and healthcare packages, plus much more   My Offers membership card – offering discounts and savings from hundreds of retailers   2 paid volunteering days per year   Free gym access at the Ansty office, as well as a ‘Gympass’ scheme providing free or heavily subsidised local gym memberships     We want our employees to achieve a healthy work-life balance and are happy to discuss flexible working options with you if the role can accommodate it. Let us know about your flexibility requirements, whether that be reduced hours, remote working, flexible start/finish times, or compressed hours, and we will be more than happy to explore what’s possible for the role.          About Us    At Cadent we’re excited to be part of the future of UK energy! We’ve got a clear roadmap that will drive our performance to the forefront of our industry and support the UK government in achieving its net zero targets by 2050.   We’re making a difference through innovation and new ways of working. Together we’re shaping a cleaner, greener future for our 11 million customers whom we put at the heart of everything we do.    Diversity and Inclusion    Don’t meet every single requirement listed?   Understanding, learning, and celebrating what makes us different, as well as what we have in common, is good for us as individuals and enables us to work better together as one team. Cadent is committed to being an equitable and diverse employer that fosters an inclusive culture for all our employees, therefore, all our employment decisions are assessed based on qualifications, merit, and business need. So, if you’re excited about this opportunity but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification mentioned, we would still love for you to submit your application – You may just be the right person for this role or other opportunities at Cadent.   As a recognised Disability Confident Employer, we are proud to champion inclusion in the workplace and ensure to provide an environment that is accessible to all and supports individuals throughout their journey with Cadent. Please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments during the application process.   We place great importance on equity, diversity and inclusion, and we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Our employee communities Women in Cadent, Pride at Work (LGBTQ+), Embrace (ethnicity and religion), Thrive! (disability) and the Cadent Military Community can’t wait to welcome you!    Circle Back Initiative    As an active and proud member of The Circle Back Initiative, we aim to ensure that all candidates receive a response to their application, regardless of the outcome.   We will be receiving applications until the specified date above, though Cadent retains the right to close this vacancy early without prior notification, so it is advisable to complete your application at your earliest convenience.    Be part of something big. Help shape the future of gas for generations to come. title: Credit - Data Analyst (Product)
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Математика, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  Data Analysts within the Product team develop innovative solutions to problems across all our global entities, helping our customers better manage their money.  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard - from digging into our complex databases looking for the root cause of a problem, to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them🦬 In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Automating solutions that help us provide the best support to our customers  Performing analysis across the entire suite of products to develop KPIs for our Product Teams (or maybe even building something novel completely from scratch!)  Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help build products for our customers  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise consumer insights     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role  A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Knowledge of version control, model deployment and developer environments  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge     Nice to have    An advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

job_description: Si vous avez le goût d’entreprendre, aimez travailler en équipe et voulez participer au développement des énergies renouvelables, alors rejoignez-nous !     Qui sommes-nous ?     Le groupe VALOREM est un des producteurs majeurs en France dans le domaine des énergies renouvelables. Groupe indépendant, il garantit à ses clients une offre complète sur l’ensemble de la chaîne de valeur des projets ENR et dans plusieurs activités : prospection, développement de projets, construction, exploitation et maintenance de sites, mais aussi hydrogène, offshore, stockage …     Le groupe VALOREM en quelques chiffres : + de 400 collaborateurs, 101 millions d’euros de chiffres d’affaires en 2021, présent dans 5 pays, pionnier de l’éolien en France, une filiale construction VALREA et une filiale maintenance et exploitation des parcs EnR VALEMO.     VALEMO c'est aujourd'hui plus de 120 collaborateurs, répartis sur 9 bases en France.     Nous recherchons :   DATA ENGINEER F/H (ref : EMO23-02)       Votre mission :   En interaction avec l'équipe Exploitation et au sein du département Ingénierie de Valemo, vous êtes garant du développement d'outils de gestion de données.      Vos principales responsabilités :    Récupérer et centraliser les données issues de l’ensemble des centrales EnR  Traiter et consolider les données pour permettre le calcul des indicateurs de performance  Définir des architectures data  Concevoir et développer des pipelines de données  En lien étroit avec le service IT, garantir l'intégrité des données  Retranscrire les besoins métiers en solution technique (pour l'Exploitation)        Formation(s) et expérience(s) requises :    Bac+5 - École d’ingénieur généraliste/informatique  Vous maitrisez une ou plusieurs technologies suivantes : Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks et pour le stockage: Azure Datalake, SQL Server  Vous maîtrisez au moins l’un des langages suivants : Scala, SQL, Python  Vous avez une sensibilité au cloud (gestion des coûts, scalabilité)       Valeurs et culture d’entreprise :   Ancienne PME devenue un groupe de plus de 400 salariés aujourd’hui, l’entreprise reste très attachée à ses valeurs fondatrices et sa politique RSE dorénavant inscrite dans ses statuts : la convivialité, l’esprit d’initiative, le partage, la collégialité, l’esprit d’équipe.     En témoignent les nombreuses activités organisées tout au long de l’année : séminaire annuel, réunions thématiques interservices pour des projets transverses, midis de la découverte avec l’appui de conférenciers externes, partenariat avec des AMAP locales, compétitions sportives, clubs divers, etc…      Avantages sociaux   Voici quelques exemples d’avantages sociaux proposés par le groupe :  Accord télétravail, prime intéressement et participation, tickets resto, mutuelle familiale, AMAP, droits de berceau dans des crèches partenaires, prime vélo.      Conditions :   Type de contrat :   Contrat à Durée Indéterminée   Date début activité :   Dès que possible   Lieu de travail  : Bordeaux (Bègles )  Statut :  CADRE       Rémunération  : à négocier selon expérience

title: Software Engineer
skills: Skills: Angular, Модемы, +6 more
job_description: The team Technology Development, within Gridspertise is looking for a Software Engineer.   Gridspertise is a new, fast-paced global organization with a unique expertise and technological know-how in distribution grids on a global scale set-up in 2021 as a carve-out of Enel’s twenty-year-long experience in grid digitalization.   Every day we strive to create a greener and more electric future for generations to come by offering cutting edge sustainable solutions to Distribution System Operators worldwide and deliver a new era of sustainable and reliable smart grids.    We are company made of people who aspire to achieve results that enable our teams, our customers, and ultimately the world to prosper. We are looking for highly-motivated, talented, visionary and curious people that are willing to accelerate electric future with us.   Would you like to get involved in a customer oriented, innovative and dynamic context? Join us!   What you will do:   As Software engineer, you will be responsible for all activities related to:  * Design/maintenance of supervision/control Software  * Design/maintenance of microcontroller Firmware testing Software  * Drafting of technical documentation  * Design versions management   Who you are:   Bachelor’s/Master’s Degree in Electronic or Computer Engineering with:   * At least 5 years’ experience in the proven experience/ability fields  * Design, development and testing of Object Oriented Solutions with C# (knowledge of the WPF gui platform is considered a plus)  * Knowledge of programming languages such as Python and TypeScript  * Basic knowledge of the Angular framework  * Systemic Knowledge of Windows and Linux environments  * Knowledge of modem communication standard, AT commands in serial communication.   * Analysis and testing of serial communication protocols  * Basic use of laboratory instruments such as Oscilloscopes, Wave form generators, Multimeters, Spectrum Analyzers, Power Sources, Isolation Transformers and Variacs.  * Good knowledge of English   What we search in you:  * Proactivity  * Team working  * Communication skills  * Problem solving  * Ability to build consensus and network with other processes/areas within the company  * Organization and autonomy in own job and relation skill to coordinate other specialists in an international environment   What we offer:  * Personal growth and programs of empowerment   * Extensive flexible and remote work options in accordance with organizational needs   * Corporate welfare including supplemental health care, wellness programs, family and parental caring, benefits, conventions and more   * Permanent contract in Milan   Who we are:   Gridspertise offers grid intelligent devices, end-to-end cloud-edge platform solutions, and services to accelerate the digital transformation of electricity distribution grids across three main areas: metering and grid edge digitalization, network infrastructure digitalization, field operation digitalization.    The Company’s portfolio is designed as an open ecosystem, easy to integrate with Distribution System Operators' existing infrastructure, combining intelligent and automated grid devices with ready-to-use modular applications, running at central level as well as on the edge.    The company was set-up in 2021 as a carve-out of Enel’s twenty-year-long experience in developing, testing, and scaling up digital technologies to transform legacy distribution networks into smart grids. Gridspertise is today jointly controlled by the Enel Group and the leading global alternative investment manager CVC Capital Partners.    The Company has inherited a significant intellectual property portfolio of over 430 patents and combines its expertise in grid digitalization with cutting-edge solutions from leading technology partners to tackle the evolving digitalization needs of the energy market.    In 2022, Gridspertise has delivered over 5 million intelligent devices, working with more than 50 Distribution System Operators of different sizes and across different geographies.    The Company is headquartered in Italy with subsidiaries in Spain, Brazil, India and the United States.    Current target markets include Europe, Latin America and North America, expanding towards Asia-Pacific and Africa, where investments in power grids will drive infrastructure upgrade projects in the near future.   We are looking for candidates of both sexes - L.903/77 e D. Lgs n. 98/2006, art 27

title: Sviluppatore front-end
skills: Skills: JavaScript, CSS, +8 more
job_description: CHI SIAMO      Fides è una tech company che da vent’anni si contraddistingue sul mercato per una doppia offerta di servizi: partnership consulenziali con i più importanti system integrator internazionali e sviluppo di progetti IT custom.  Grazie a 20 anni di esperienza e oltre 300 risorse dislocate tra le sedi (Milano, Napoli e Roma), Fides si posiziona tra le principali aziende italiane Hi-tech.  Le competenze e i progetti Fides si estendono dal Banking & Finance, al Digital Retail, alle tecnologie per il Monitoraggio Ambientale, ai Servizi e Soluzioni ICT per l’Industry 4.0, per l’e-commerce e la logistica.      OPPORTUNITÀ      Se vuoi far parte di una tech company giovane, dinamica e in forte crescita è il momento giusto per entrare in Fides.  Siamo alla ricerca di un  Front-end Developer , da inserire all’interno dei nostri team di sviluppo.     Sei la persona giusta se:   Sei un vero appassionato dello sviluppo software;  Sei autonomo nella scelta ed uso di strumenti nel contesto in cui ti trovi;  Sei proattivo nell’affrontare casi dapprima sconosciuti;  Sei attivo nell'ascoltare i consigli ed i suggerimenti dei tuoi colleghi e del tuo responsabile di team.      E hai queste competenze tecnologiche:   Ottima conoscenza di React.js e React native e dei suoi principi fondamentali (component lifecycle, JSX, Virtual DOM, ecc);  Ottima conoscenza di Typescript, HTML, JS e CSS;  Buona conoscenza del framework Angular;  Utilizzo di GIT;  Ottima conoscenza dei concetti fondamentali di SEO e delle best practice di sviluppo in conformità agli standard W3C (per le tipologie di progetti che lo richiedono);  Familiarità con le librerie js più popolari (GSAP, RequireJS, jQuery…);  Familiarità con le API RESTful.       NICE TO HAVE       Conscenza di standard sviluppo Android;  Conoscenza di Next JS;  Conoscenza della metodologia Agile (Scrum, Kanban);  Ottima conoscenza del linguaggio di programmazione Typescript  Progettazione e realizzazione di layout responsive;  Conoscenza dei concetti fondamentali di SEO e delle best practice di sviluppo in conformità agli standard W3C (per le tipologie di progetti che lo richiedono).       PERCHÉ FIDES?       Ambiente di lavoro giovane e informale  Interazioni continue con colleghi da aree diverse dell’azienda  Feedback continuo orientato alla tua crescita  Organizzazione orizzontale  PC aziendale  Ambiente di lavoro giovane e stimolante  Dress code casual  Work life balance: proponiamo modalità ibrida tra presenza in sede e lavoro da remoto      Il nostro Human-Centric Model ci permette di valorizzare la persona e la sua crescita professionale grazie a career path personalizzati, formazione continua sugli ultimi trend tecnologici e certificazione delle competenze acquisite. Saremo felici di aiutarti a crescere attraverso il confronto continuo con i migliori talenti che condividono la tua stessa passione per il mondo IT.      Crediamo nei valori della diversità e dell’inclusione di genere e cultura prestando inoltre attenzione e sensibilità ai/alle candidati/e appartenenti alle categorie protette, ai sensi degli articoli 1 e 18 della legge 68 del ‘99.I dati personali saranno trattati in conformità alle disposizioni contenute nel regolamento UE 2016/679.

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Digital Analyst
skills: Skills: Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, +8 more
job_description: NTT Data somos todas las personas que la formamos. Un equipo de más de 140.000 profesionales, tan diverso como diversos son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes y los diferentes sectores en los que desarrollamos nuestra actividad:       Telecomunicaciones, Sector Financiero (Banca y Seguros), Industria, Utilities, Sector Público y Sanidad.       ¿Nuestra misión? Ofrecer soluciones tecnológicas, de negocio, estrategia, desarrollo y mantenimiento de aplicaciones, siendo un referente en consultoría. Todo gracias a la colaboración entre equipos, la calidad humana de nuestra gente y a que no nos conformamos con lo establecido, buscamos siempre la innovación que nos acerca al futuro.       Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología, a romper paradigmas y a brindar las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.       #Greattech, needs #GreatPeople, like you.       ¿Qué buscamos?       Queremos que formes parte de nuestro equipo Experience Optimizacion (ExO).  En plena era digital es imprescindible conocer el comportamiento de nuestros clientes de una forma omnicanal y aquí es donde entramos nosotros: Somos los responsables de analizar y optimizar los canales digitales de nuestros clientes.      ¿Cómo lo hacemos?  A través de la definición, recolección y análisis de datos en todos sus canales, buscando la forma optimizar su comunicación con los usuarios de forma constante. Para ello, trabajamos con tecnologías en diferentes niveles y con distintos sectores.      Buscamos por esto a un Digital Analyst que disponga de experiencia senior en herramientas de analítica y de reporting (Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, Google Data Studio, PowerBI, Tableau, etc.).       Trabajarás en proyectos y servicios donde desarrollarás las siguientes tareas para los diferentes canales digitales (web, apps, chatbots):       Definición de objetivos de negocio y de KPIs  Aseguramiento de la calidad del dato  Configuración de reportes avanzados en las diferentes herramientas de visualización (con unificación de diferentes fuentes de datos)  Análisis avanzado para la extracción de insights  Análisis proactivos gracias al seguimiento diario de la calidad del dato  Generación y mantenimiento de sistemas de alertado que nos permitan ser proactivos ante un cambio de tendencia en un KPI  Reporting y presentación de resultados, propuestas de mejora e impacto  Cuantificación del impacto de nuestros insights  Presentaciones a equipos ejecutivos y multidisciplinares de funcionamiento de los canales y próximos pasos      Valoraremos tu expertise en estas tareas y herramientas, así como será un plus tu conocimiento en herramientas de analítica y Tag Manager desde un punto de vista más técnico; así como tus conocimientos en CRO y en herramientas de Testing y Personalización.     Si te sientes cómodo con este tipo de funciones y llevas unos años trabajando con ellas ¡este es tu sitio!      ¿Qué ofrecemos?       Contarás con un path formativo según tu perfil, área de expertise y nivel experiencia, tanto en soft skills como en programas de certificación en soluciones de Adobe y Google.       Retribución salarial competitiva y acorde con la experiencia aportada.       Programa de teletrabajo.       Plan de carrera individualizado y tutorizado a nivel personal y profesional.       Beneficios sociales: tickets comida, seguro médico y seguro de vida.       Dinamismo de los proyectos en base a las últimas tendencias tecnológicas.       Trabajar en un buen ambiente de equipo donde podrás aprender de los demás y ellos de ti.       Libertad para decidir cómo quieres que evolucione tu carrera dentro de la compañía, gracias a la flexibilidad de nuestro Modelo de Carreras.       Formación ajustada tanto a tus necesidades como a las del mercado actual. Desde nuestra Universidad Corporativa podrás realizar certificaciones, cursos de idiomas, de habilidades de gestión, técnicas y mucho más.       Horario y vestimenta flexible.          En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad.       Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.       #WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

title: Data Reporting Engineer
skills: Skills: SAP, Аналитические навыки, +5 more
job_description: Are you ready for the next step in your career? Would you like to work in an international, culturally-diverse and forward-thinking organization that actively works towards sustainable circular solutions for its customers around the world? We might be looking for you!      For our HQ in Waddinxveen, we are looking for a Data Reporting Engineer       About your new job    Measuring the company's social, environmental and economic performance, allows the management team to make strategic decisions toward a more sustainable and profitable business model. As our Data and Reporting Engineer you are the linking pin between:   Providing usable software features and data-models needed for reporting and exchanging data by the LC Business lines.  The market developments regarding handling and exchanging data within the boundaries of IT security and policies.   You will be part of our Business Operations team and operate on behalf of the CFO and the Sustainability Manager to whom you also report.      As our Data and Reporting Engineer you will:    Create and maintain BO Policies and Guidelines for secure data-exchange and be able to explain them to others;  Ensure that new Reporting- and EDI solutions are being developed and maintained within the boundaries of the LC Workplace Service;  Maintain BO-Services needed for the ‘Data and Reporting Analyst’ role to provide reporting, data-exchange and ad-hoc information requests;  Support the tooling needed for the development of an ‘Enterprise Data-model’.       What we can do for you:   We offer you a challenging and varied role within our rapidly expanding family business with offices and production facilities around the world. Including:   A workspace in our brand-new HQ in Waddinxveen, rated as a top 1% sustainable building (BREEAM Outstanding). We also belong to the 1% most sustainable companies in the world (Ecovadis Platinum)!;  A fast-paced, stimulating and international environment with family values and room to develop your own projects;  Competitive salary and benefits like an online learning environment, a bicycle plan and personal training facilities to help you stay fit. We also offer you a solid pension plan, an attractive bonus structure and great Friday After Work Drinks.       You are probably great at a lot of things, such as:    Using your analytical skills, you can provide substantiated advice and assist your colleagues in making informed decisions;  You are interested in ‘the story’ behind data and understand the organisational value and technical aspects;  You are a team player with strong communication skills.       As Data and Reporting Engineer, you:    Hold a bachelor's and/or master's degree in (business) information technology, information services, or information management;  At least 3 years of experience in a similar position;  Knowledge of both the organisational and technical aspects of the position;  Knowledge of and experience with the Microsoft365, MS Power platform especially BI, SAP(Fiori), MS Dynamics, ETL procedures, SQL, Scripting for data-matching and cleaning. Security and connectivity standards, Data classification models etc…;  Very good command of spoken and written English and Dutch.  You live in the triangle Gouda – The Hague – Rotterdam and you have your own transport.       Apply!   Will you make our amazing team even greater? Don’t hold back and send us your CV and motivation letter, to the attention of Sara Jans, Senior Corporate Recruiter.  An online assessment test can be part of the recruitment process.  For more information and to apply visit: www.lcpackaging.com/career

Sa mission : contribuer durablement à un monde plus sûr, où le transport aérien devient toujours plus respectueux de l'environnement, plus confortable et plus accessible. Implanté sur tous les continents, le Groupe emploie 83 000 collaborateurs pour un chiffre d'affaires de 19,0 milliards d'euros en 2022, et occupe, seul ou en partenariat, des positions de premier plan mondial ou européen sur ses marchés. Safran s'engage dans des programmes de recherche et développement qui préservent les priorités environnementales de sa feuille de route d'innovation technologique.  Safran est dans le top 30 des meilleurs employeurs mondiaux 2022 selon le magazine Forbes.   Safran Electronics & Defense est une société de 10 000 salariés fondée sur la maîtrise de technologies clé au service de la souveraineté. Conjuguant intelligences humaine et artificielle, elle développe des produits et services permettant d'observer, de décider et de guider pour les marchés de l'aéronautique, de la défense et de l'espace. La société met également son expertise électronique au service des autres sociétés de Safran. title: Analyst - FRENCH speaking -
skills: Skills: Attention to Detail, Профессиональные навыки работы с компьютером, +8 more
job_description: Cision employs the brightest, most passionate people in the tech industry. We’d love for you to join our growing team! We invest in our people through training and professional development while supporting you along the way—all so you can meet your career goals. To us, the most important measure of our success is yours.   As an Analyst within our Rapid Intelligence team, you will be responsible for utilizing complex proprietary software, to scour tens of thousands of sources – mostly news, but also white papers, financial analyst reports, market research, business opportunities, etc. – and distill their core findings into quick-read briefing. Each briefing service is created specifically for each client, focused on (if govt) its unique mission and (if corporate) its company, competitors and industry.     A successful Analyst can distinguish between critical, important and non-essential information and must be able to provide insightful briefings that allow senior business executives to begin their day fully prepared. You will be part of a top team using cutting-edge technology in order to research and analyze changing events and information trends.     Duties And Responsibilities     Preparing daily and weekly news reports to send out to domestic and international clients   Writing and editing content for daily and weekly news reports   Summarising international media coverage into a digestible format   Researching international print and online media   Selecting relevant content for client-specific news reports      Essential Skills And Experience     An academic degree in Marketing, Communications, Media, Journalism, English, Business Administration, Social Sciences or similar; or equivalent industry experience [2+ years]   Proven editorial and research skills – as part of a university project or examples of workplace experience   Excellent written English with an in-depth understanding of grammar   Strong skills in competitive-intelligence analysis   Understanding the information needs of chief executives and their teams   Basic computer skills and knowledge of MS Office   Capable of working under time pressure   Able to adhere to tight and variable deadlines   Reliable and well-organized worker with attention to detail   A plus: fluency in any non-English language often used in business     What We Offer     25 vacation days  Health insurance + dental care  Sodexo vouchers  Option for an annual public transport card for the whole transport network  Option for a Multisport card (employee covers only half the price)  A variety of flexible benefits through Re:benefit platform using a monthly budget  Excellent hardware bundle  Informal, friendly, welcoming environment focused on people, learning & development    This position is open to REMOTE or HYBRID workers - Working hours - Monday to Friday    06.00 am to 15,00 pm.    If this sounds like you and you feel you have what it takes to succeed in this role, we want to hear from you!    Your application will be treated with strict confidentiality and in compliance with the legal requirements for personal data protection.   As a global leader in PR, marketing and social media management technology and intelligence, Cision helps brands and organizations to identify, connect and engage with customers and stakeholders to drive business results. PR Newswire , a network of over 1.1 billion influencers, in-depth monitoring, analytics and its Brandwatch and Falcon.io social media platforms headline a premier suite of solutions. Cision has offices in 24 countries throughout the Americas, EMEA and APAC. For more information about Cision's award-winning solutions, including its next-gen Cision Communications Cloud®, visit www.cision.com and follow @Cision on Twitter.  Cision is committed to fostering an inclusive environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and perform at their best. We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion is vital to driving our culture, sparking innovation and achieving long-term success. Cision is proud to have joined more than 600 companies in signing the CEO Action for Diversity & Inclusion™ pledge and named a “Top Diversity Employer” for 2021 by DiversityJobs.com .  Cision is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, seeking to create a welcoming and diverse environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other protected statuses.  Cision is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Cision will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact hr.support@cision.com  Please review our Global Candidate Data Privacy Statement to learn about Cision’s commitment to protecting personal data collected during the hiring process.

title: Credit - Data Analyst (Product)
skills: Skills: Основные показатели, Математика, +8 more
job_description: About Revolut   People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, more freedom. And since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. With an arsenal of awesome products that span spending, saving, travel, transfers, investing, exchanging and more, our super app has helped 28+ million customers get more from their money. And we're not done yet.  As we continue our lightning-fast growth, we believe that two things are essential to continuing our success: our people and our culture. So far, we have 6000+ people working around the world, from our great offices or remotely, on our mission. And we're looking for more. We want brilliant people that love building great products, love redefining success, and love turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.   About The Role   We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions 🤘  Data Analysts within the Product team develop innovative solutions to problems across all our global entities, helping our customers better manage their money.  We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard - from digging into our complex databases looking for the root cause of a problem, to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them🦬 In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨  Up for the challenge? Get in touch 👇   What You’ll Be Doing    Automating solutions that help us provide the best support to our customers  Performing analysis across the entire suite of products to develop KPIs for our Product Teams (or maybe even building something novel completely from scratch!)  Understanding our business and its processes through our data  Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help build products for our customers  Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business  Maintaining and creating new dashboards to track metrics and visualise consumer insights     What You'll Need    Previous experience in an analytical role  A strong background/education in a quantitative discipline  Great skills with Python, SQL or other programming languages  Knowledge of version control, model deployment and developer environments  Evidence of strong mathematical & statistics knowledge     Nice to have    An advanced degree in a core STEM subject  Strong experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)  School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics or Programming    Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.  Refer to our Data Privacy Statement for Candidates: https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Data Scientist/Data Engineer, Matching
skills: Skills: Apache Spark Streaming, Apache Kafka, +8 more
job_description: Vinted is Europe’s biggest pre-loved fashion marketplace, with 75+ million registered members in 18 countries. We want to make second-hand the first choice worldwide.  A team of 1,200+ people from Vinted’s offices in Vilnius, Berlin, Prague, and Amsterdam develop and support our platform. We share a unique work culture that’s based on aiming high, taking ownership, co-creating, caring, and growth.  Vinted is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, colour, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion/beliefs, disability or age. We truly believe when we can be fully ourselves, we work better.  You’ll become a part of the Matching domain - a cross-functional product department responsible for search, personalization, discovery, and categorization of listings for our users. This role is based in the  Item Retrieval and Ranking subdomain  which is responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving recommendation, ranking, and item retrieval algorithms and services that enable customers to more easily find relevant items in various Vinted product areas (e.g. homepage, catalog, and search). The team focuses a lot on making data-driven decisions by employing ML algorithms to make customer journeys more personalized.  As Data Scientist/Data Engineer in this team you would be mostly responsible for maintaining and improving existing data and ML pipelines both for ML model development (offline) and deployment to production (online) and also (to a limited extent) contribute to ML model improvement itself. You will report to the Manager of Data Science and Analytics within the Item Retrieval and Ranking subdomain and work closely with other data scientists in your team and other subdomains in Matching. You will also work closely with Backend Engineers in the area of model deployment and Data Engineers/Analytics Engineers in the area of data-related pipelines.   In this position, you’ll:    Together with data engineers, migrate on-premises data warehouse jobs from Spark to BigQuery and DBT  Maintain, improve and create data pipelines for ML model training and inference for data scientists  Collaborate with the team to design and implement scalable data processing solutions  Ensure the quality and reliability of data pipelines and infrastructure  Continuously improve and optimize data processing systems and techniques  Together with backend engineers, ensure high performance and scalability of our deployed models  Improve the monitoring quality of our ML models and Feature Store in production  Write and own clean and understandable code, make sure it is re-usable where relevant  Mentor and support colleagues, share knowledge in the Science and Analytics Guild  Contribute to a culture of curiosity and experimentation     About you:    Bachelor's or higher degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field  Experience with database data modeling and the development of ETL/ELT processes in a cloud data platforms, preferably on GCP or AWS  Experience with developing, training and deploying machine learning models in production  Knowledge of feature stores and their applications in machine learning systems  A proven track record of machine learning project development and deployment in production  Advanced knowledge of Python programming language  Able to effortlessly communicate complex technical and statistical information to business stakeholders  Demonstrated ability to work with cross-functional teams, such as data scientists, machine learning engineers, and product managers, to define requirements, troubleshoot issues, and develop robust, scalable, and efficient data solutions that meet business objectives  Bonus:   Experience with recommendation and ranking systems  Proficiency in streaming-based data processing tools, such as Apache Flink, Kafka, or Spark Streaming  Familiarity with BigQuery and DBT  Familiarity with containerization and orchestration technologies, such as Docker and Kubernetes, to streamline deployment and scaling of data processing and machine learning workloads    Work perks:   Opportunity to join our share options programme  Learning budget (10% from net yearly salary)   30 working days of holiday   Mental and emotional health support from Mindletic  Frequent team-building events  A personal budget for shopping on Vinted  A daily allowance for ordering lunch  Work anywhere in the EU for 90 days out of the year  Dog-friendly office  Home office support (IT workstation equipment provided and a personal budget for home workplace furniture)    We want people to work from where they’re most comfortable, which is why we’re using a hybrid workplace model at Vinted for the foreseeable future.  Hybrid means that we encourage working from the office on Tuesdays and Wednesdays and the remainder of your time from either home or the office, but it’s not required. You’re welcome to work from either location all or some of the time, depending on what you think is best and safest for you, and how the Covid-19 situation is developing where you are.  The salary range for this position is  51,000 - 81,000   €  (gross) per month.  If this sounds interesting – you may well be just who we need!

title: ANALISTA (H/M) FINANCIERO / FP&A REPORTING
skills: Skills: Экономика, Корпоративные финансы, +8 more
job_description: Si te gustan los animales... ¡Únete al grupo líder de las mascotas!     El grupo Iskaypet lo formamos más de 2000 profesionales de diferentes áreas que compartimos la pasión por las mascotas y por nuestro trabajo.     En fuerte crecimiento, actualmente operamos en España y Portugal desde dos oficinas corporativas en Madrid y Málaga; desde más de 200 tiendas Tiendanimal y Kiwoko, y desde más de 80 clínicas y consultorios veterinarios Clinicanimal y Kivet.     Desde todas las áreas de la empresa compartimos el mismo objetivo: mejorar la vida de nuestras mascotas y sus familias.     Estamos buscando un/a Analista Financiero para las oficinas centrales de Madrid o Málaga (según preferencia de candidato/a) dentro del Departamento de Finanzas.     Estas son las tareas y responsabilidades:     -Elaboración de todo tipo de planes de negocio: planes de viabilidad para empresas en dificultades, planes estratégicos para grupos en crecimiento, proyecciones financieras para compañías en fase de arranque y desarrollo, valoración de todo tipo de iniciativas empresariales, etc.     -Elaboración de proyecciones financieras (cuentas de resultados, balances y flujos de caja); así como de las valoraciones que resulten de dichas proyecciones.     -Realizar análisis de información cuantitativa y cualitativa, de la elaboración de presentaciones a clientes, de cuadernos de venta de empresas y de la redacción de informes.     -Colaboración con el equipo contabilidad en los cierres mensuales para revisión de cuentas contables     -Control y análisis de KPIS financieros     -Revisión mensual de las desviaciones presupuestarias.         REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:      ¿Cómo será el/la candidata/a ideal?     - Formación: Grado o Licenciatura en Economía/Empresariales o Ingeniería     - 2 años de experiencia en las funciones descritas     - Sólidos conocimientos técnicos de contabilidad financiera     - Ser una persona habituada a concluir proyectos en ajustados plazos de entrega     - Disponibilidad para viajes puntuales     - Manejo de SAP S4     Valorable:     - Máster o posgrados en finanzas     - Experiencia previa en Consultoría de negocio, auditoría y/o Finanzas Corporativas     - Nivel de inglés alto     Y además gracias a nuestro programa #happyiskaylife encontrarás:     - Horario flexible de entrada y salida.     - Entorno Petfriendly: ¡Tráete tu mascota a la oficina!     - Sistema de trabajo híbrido: teletrabaja el 50% de la jornada.     - Jornada intensiva cada viernes y los meses de julio y agosto.     - Posibilidad de retribución flexible (ticket restaurante, guardería y transporte)     - Seguro de salud para ti y tu familia a precios competitivos.     - Programa Erasmus a través del cual tendrás la oportunidad de vivir la experiencia de trasladarte temporalmente o de manera indefinida a cualquiera de nuestras oficinas: Málaga, Madrid y Oporto.     - Programa de ayuda al empleado/a con el que podrás recibir atención psicológica sobre temas profesionales y personales.     IskayPet S.L. (Tiendanimal, Kiwoko, Clinicanimal, Kivet) se compromete con la igualdad y oportunidad entre todas las candidaturas que participen en los procesos de selección, comprometiéndose además con la integración de personas con discapacidad, prestando especial atención a aquellas candidaturas en posesión de certificado de discapacidad.

title: Business Data Analyst Evolutions (2300046Z)
skills: Skills: Анализ данных, Python, +8 more
job_description: Notre objectif chez  AXA Investment Managers  consiste à agir pour le progrès humain en investissant dans ce qui compte, cet objectif est au centre de chaque action que nous entreprenons. En tant que gestionnaire d'actifs responsable, nous investissons activement pour aider nos clients, nos collaborateurs et le monde à aller de l’avant.     Votre rôle de  Business Data Analyst – Evolutions  sera rattaché au  Head Of Data Referentials Evolutions  et vous ferez partie du département  AXAIM Data & Analytics Management.      Le titulaire intègre l’équipe Data Referentials Evolutions, le centre d’expertise interne relativement à l’administration, à la qualité et à la gouvernance des données et des analytics. L’équipe est en charge de l’ensemble des évolutions apportées aux référentiels de données centraux d’AXA IM : le Security Master File, dédié à la création d’instruments ; le référentiel des portefeuilles et produits d’AXA IM ; le référentiel dédié aux définitions de benchmarks et à la collecte des niveaux et des constituants d’indices ; ainsi que le référentiel des entités tiers.      DECOUVREZ votre opportunité      Au-delà de sa contribution à la définition et à l’implémentation des nouveaux besoins portant sur les référentiels de données, le titulaire sera amené à participer aux efforts de gouvernance vis-à-vis de nos partenaires internes et externes, notamment auprès de State Street et de nos fournisseurs de données externes.      Vos rôle et responsabilités :    Evolutions apportées aux référentiels de données    Comprendre et analyser les nouveaux besoins métier  Définir et implémenter, avec l’aide du département Technology, les nouveaux champs et nouveaux processus d’acquisition de données requis  Valider les tests fonctionnels avant passage en production  Mettre en place des contrôles et produire des tableaux de bord afin de suivre les éventuels problèmes de qualité de données  Analyser les processus d’acquisition et de production existants, et proposer proactivement des évolutions afin d’augmenter l’efficacité des équipes du département       Gouvernance    Prendre part aux interactions et à la gouvernance entre l’équipe et certains partenaires externes (par ex. State Street ou Rimes)  Collaborer avec les membres de l’équipe Data Referentials Operations pour permettre une mise en production fluide des évolutions apportées (bonne livraison des évolutions, puis formation)  Participer aux comités de gouvernance avec nos clients data internes lorsque cela est pertinent       PARTAGEZ votre expertise unique      Nous accueillons différentes combinaisons de compétences et d'expériences.      Vos connaissances et compétences :    Connaissances générales en finance, et plus spécifiquement relatives aux concepts de gestion d’actifs : portefeuilles, instruments financiers, …  Attrait marqué pour la modélisation et la gouvernance des données et des analytics  Familiarité avec les outils de gestion et d’administration de données  La capacité à coder en Python pour l’automatisation et l’analyse et la visualisation de données est un plus  Très bonnes capacités de communication et d’interaction  Capacité à interagir avec des profils divers, tels que : gestionnaires des données, fournisseurs de données, développeurs, responsables middle office, analystes de performance, gérants de portefeuilles, …  Capacité à organiser les priorités et à gérer de multiples sujets de front  Attention portée aux détails  Français et Anglais courants (lu, écrit et parlé) indispensable       Nous aimerions en savoir plus sur vous ! Envoyez-nous votre CV.       Votre Environnement De Travail   Grâce à notre approche de conviction, nous sélectionnons les investissements en actions, obligations, alternatifs et dans les stratégies multi-actifs qui recèlent selon nous des meilleures opportunités à l’échelle internationale. Nous gérons à ce jour plus de 887 milliards d’euros d’actifs.    https://www.axa-im.fr       AXA IM est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et nous encourageons les candidats présentant un handicap ou toute autre caractéristique protégée à postuler. Nous nous engageons à fournir des aménagements raisonnables si nécessaires aux candidats qualifiés et aux employés handicapés pendant le processus de recrutement et dans l’exercice de leurs fonctions professionnelles essentielles.    https://www.axa-im.com        Pourquoi Nous Rejoindre ?   Nous nous engageons à vous offrir un environnement où vous pourrez :   Développez votre potentiel : Intégrer une entreprise engagée sur le développement de ses collaborateurs via une mobilité interne dynamique et une large offre de parcours de formation personnalisés.  Personnalisez votre manière de travailler : Travailler pour une entreprise qui s'engage à garantir flexibilité et équilibre à ses employés, en vous offrant une large gamme d'avantages (intéressement, télétravail, avantages sociaux compétitifs, etc.).  Epanouissez-vous par la diversité de notre communauté : Jouer un rôle au sein d'une entreprise inclusive qui reconnaît et valorise activement les différences individuelles dans un environnement de travail diversifié et inclusif.  Faites avancer le monde : Rejoindre un employeur responsable qui agit en faveur des causes sociétales et environnementales en tant qu'investisseur, assureur et entreprise, notamment au travers de l'association AXA Atout Cœur. Dans le cadre de notre engagement en faveur de la durabilité et de la responsabilité environnemental, nous célèbrerons votre arrivée en plantant un arbre.

title: CDI - Chef de Projet Data/Analytique F/H
skills: Skills: Coordinating Skills, Координация, +8 more
job_description: Description de la mission   En tant que Chef de projet, vos responsabilités seront les suivantes :    Instruire les demandes des différents métiers      Animer la relation client autour des demandes de reporting et d’analyse d’activité (BUILD et RUN)  Valoriser les demandes métier par le cadrage de cas d’usage      Construire et suivre son planning d’exécution      Être le garant du bon déroulement des projets et de la satisfaction du client  Travailler avec une équipe pluridisciplinaire composée de profils juniors et expérimentés  Gérer les tâches de développements en utilisant les outils de notre environnement technique (description plus bas)  Développer, Faire développer les briques applicatives d’alimentation et d’intégration de données d’une part, et de restitution et de Data visualisaton d’autre part  Assurer la validation de chaque étape de réalisation des demandes,  Répartir la charge de travail, en volume et en calendrier, en fonction des prévisions d’évolutions du reste à faire sur ces projets      Enrichir le cadre méthodologique BI / Analytique      Accompagner l'équipe BI sur les aspects méthodologiques  Promouvoir les valeurs agiles  Conduire la démarche Qualité ; participer au développement des procédures et outils de gestion  Structurer les actions de maintenances     Environnement Technique :     ETL : Matillion (Cloud)  Restitution : SAP Business Objects, QlikSense,  Base de données : Oracle 11g, Snowflake  Language : SQL , Python  Méthodologie Traditionnel et Agile     Profil     Diplôme d’ingénieur/de commerce ou équivalent, avec au minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans la gestion de projets BI.  Maîtrise opérationnelle de l’anglais   Une expérience en développement d’application Data (Alimentation et/ou Restitution) et Qliksense et/ou SAP BO serait appréciée  Doté(e) d’une véritable culture du service, vous avez le souci constant de l’utilisateur et de la qualité de la réponse à lui apporter  Pédagogue et très bon communiquant vous savez échanger avec tous les corps de métiers représentés dans un projet BI (des couches techniques jusqu'aux représentations fonctionnelles)  La coordination est votre maitre mot : vous savez piloter et gérer des projets BI / Analytique (dont conduite de changement)  Vous ête autonome, aimez synthétiser et échanger sur vos bonnes pratiques et prise de décision  Le travail en équipe vous définit : vous aimez animer et accompagner une équipe     Informations   Localisation : Paris 16ème   Date : Dès que possible   Notre offre   La Direction des Systèmes d'Information du groupe Lacoste cherche un Chef de projet Data / Analytique. Le poste est rattaché au responsable du Data Lab. Véritable coordinateur votre rôle sera polyvalent et transverse :      Instruire le cycle de demande de projets : de la qualification à la mise en service en passant par l'animation d'atelier et le suivi des développements   Participer et construire un service et une démarche de valorisation des données pour répondre aux enjeux du métier   Soutenir la démarche data de la DSI comme levier de performance et de transformation du métier   Participer avec l'équipe à la gestion des demandes de support et d'évolution des métiers pour les applications BI existantes (Maintien en conditions opérationnels)

Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Market Analyst- European Power Market
skills: Skills: Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, +8 more
job_description: We are looking for a Market Analyst- European Power Market to join our Trading and Energy Solutions team in Amsterdam.      Let’s get to know each other   Enerjisa Commodities is an energy trading company, based in Amsterdam and İstanbul. The mother company Enerjisa Üretim has an installed capacity of 3727 MW in Türkiye, from 5 different technologies with a growing share of renewables. Enerjisa Üretim’s trading arm has very strong trading acumen, track record and risk management capability and is Türkiye’s leading energy trading company. It is active in the SEE countries Hungary, Bulgaria, Greece and Serbia via an entity called Enerjisa Europe.  We are now unifying our domestic and international trading and energy solution activities under the brand Enerjisa Commodities. We aim to expand our reach in power and gas markets in Europe, trade environmental commodities globally and become a climate solution partner for corporations. In this journey, our amazing team is our biggest strength and we are looking for new colleagues to  Wonder. Explore. Evolve. Impact.  with us!      Culture at Enerjisa Commodities:        We are committed to our values,  Ethics is at the highest rank; compliance is the overarching value,  Each of our colleagues is unique, the energy we create is common,  We keep the competition friendly and the cooperation as the priority,  Vivid, exciting, and friendly atmosphere,  Work is more fun when you celebrate successes together,  Challenge the status quo, think out of the box,  We don’t only trade energy we also trade ideas and experiences,  Constructive feedback culture,  We are transparent, we are open-minded, we are straightforward.       Key Responsibilities:    Analyzing fundamentals and forecasting power prices in European power markets  Identifying trends and price drivers and responding quickly to the market events to produce data-driven analysis  Developing tools to monitor political and regulatory developments for power markets and efficiently use information within the business  Working closely with our modeling team, structuring data into quantifiable analyses and deriving insights from the model results  Strong coordination with front offices  Designing and publishing regular market view reports       Who are we looking for?       Bachelor’s degree  0-2 years of experience  Analytical thinker, good with numbers, know-how in statistics  Intellectually curious with the ability to identify problems and coming up with various solutions  Clear and effective communication and presentation skills  Ability to work in a multi-cultural environment  Willingness to accept responsibility and self-driven  Very good interpersonal skills and able to work in a team environment  Proficiency in English is a must  Proficiency in MS Office applications, especially at Excel and Power Point  Know-how in SQL and/or Python is a plus
