title: Solution Owner, Enterprise Solutions, IKEA Industry AB
skills: None
job_description: IKEA Industry, part of the Inter IKEA Group, is the world's largest producer of wooden furniture and is an integrated part of the IKEA value chain. IKEA Industry has over 30 production units in 7 countries, with about 15,000 co-workers. Every year, IKEA Industry produces more than 100 million pieces of furniture for IKEA customers.      We are a diverse group of people working together, sharing the humanistic IKEA values. The values are the foundation of our work. By living them, we form the unique IKEA culture where team spirit and togetherness are key. In a constantly growing IKEA, every individual is taken care of, respected, acknowledged and included. People are themselves and respecting the uniqueness of every individual makes IKEA better.       Job Description    Do you want to create the solutions of the future at IKEA Industry? Do you like efficient supply chain, modern digital solutions, and are you an early adopter of new technologies? Do you also have experience from our ERP system M3 and Infor OS - then this might be your next step!      Digital Arena’s mission at IKEA Industry is to support and improve the business by providing a robust and efficient information supply to the organization. We operate strategically, tactically and operationally with all aspects of the IT and OT delivery; from demand capture to realization, implementation and operational support in a global manufacturing environment.      In this position it will be your responsibility to secure that our solutions fulfil the needs across the organization; now and in the future. You will work closely with our process development teams, site representatives and peer Solution Owners to develop, implement and support solutions based on our standard platforms.       A DAY IN YOUR LIFE WITH US     Exciting challenge for You who wants to...    Act as a Solution Owner for various supply chain software solutions, all which are integrated with M3.       Provide strategic direction, roadmap and standards together with business strategies and IT architecture   Manage key stakeholder expectations through strong relationships both within IKEA and with external service partners and suppliers   Collaborate with process and business functions, IT Architects, super users, software suppliers, service operations, information security and other relevant functions   Manage solution/service cost and budget including coordinate license, maintenance, support and service contract   Stay updated on new solutions and technologies, be innovative and bring future ideas to our business        WHO YOU ARE    We are looking for those of you who are interested in enabling an efficient supply chain by leveraging technology and modern digital solutions. You are a high-energy, entrepreneurial mind who has the ability to create trust and build relationships in a multicultural environment.       We think you will be motivated by this position if You...     Are down-to-earth with willpower and the ability to create togetherness and enthusiasm around you   Are passionate about continuous development   Combine an analytical and structural mind with drive, curiosity and integrity   Have an academic background in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration or equal working experience   Have at least five years working experience from an international or manufacturing organization   Have experience from implementation/realization of ERP, IT products and services, including project management and life cycle management   Are service minded and meet every person with a positive attitude   Have good communication skills in English, both verbal and written   Have good coaching and leadership capabilities and communicate with ease on all levels of the organization       The IKEA culture and values are very much a part of our business and day to day work life. For you to thrive and grow with IKEA it’s important for us that you share our values! You can read more regarding our values and life at IKEA on our website https://about.ikea.com/en.       Additional Information   This role is located in our office Klipphult, at Hyllie in Malmö, Sweden. Klipphult is a place to work, meet, act, grow and create together. It is an activity-based, flexible and inspiring workplace.  The position requires global travelling.      QUESTIONS AND SUPPORT? LET'S CONNECT!   Do you feel challenged and inspired by what you have seen in this job ad? If “yes!” we appreciate your application, no later than May 31st.     For job specific questions please contact Carin Sjöqvist, Manager Enterprise Solutions, carin.sjoqvist@inter.ikea.com. For questions about the recruitment process, please contact Recruitment Partner Jamila Harmal on jamila.harmal2@inter.ikea.com.

title: QE Manager
skills: Skills: ООП, Автоматизация тестирования, +8 more
job_description: Paramount  is a leading global media and entertainment company that creates premium content and experiences for audiences worldwide. Driven by iconic consumer brands, its portfolio includes CBS, Showtime Networks, Paramount Pictures, Nickelodeon, MTV, Comedy Central, BET, Paramount+, Pluto TV and Simon & Schuster, among others. The company delivers the largest share of the U.S. television audience and boasts one of the industry's most important and extensive libraries of TV and film titles. In addition to offering innovative streaming services and digital video products,  Paramount  provides powerful capabilities in production, distribution and advertising solutions for partners on five continents.      What will you do?   You will take a role of Manager as a part of Quality Engineering Chapter.  As a hands-on manager you will lead and mentor team of tests automation engineers in all testing activities and build new and/or enhance existing tools to be used in validating functionality, usability, performance, scalability, security, etc., as well as take care of their well-being and assist in their path of personal and business development.  By working closely with development teams and other managers in the Chapter, you will be responsible for reviewing, maintaining and improving testing processes, standards and policies aligned with products development, and maintain key technical decisions. As a technical representative, you will clearly communicate the team’s path to your business partners, as well as assist with the recruitment process as a key voice on hiring decisions. In conjunction with Director, you will translate business requirements into technical ones, execute a vision and suggested principles with the team, build observability for better data-driven decision making process.      Your profile:    Master’s degree or greater in Computer Science, Engineering, Business or a related discipline  5+ years of test engineering experience (designing and working with test automation frameworks and developing automated test scripts) in at least one of following areas: backend, web, mobile, connected tv & emerging technologies  Strong knowledge of software quality practices and ability to learn & adopt emerging concepts  High coding skills (i.e. writing of clean, reusable, extensible, standards-compliant code) in at least one OOP language  Good understanding of TDD, BDD, DDD software development/testing methodologies  Experience managing and mentoring a quality engineering team  Ability to build relationships, collaborate with and influence cross-functional teams within your area of responsibility  Great communication skills, both with technical and non-technical team members  Experience interacting with senior leadership and being the voice of change for improved strategic direction  Hands-on experience with analytics, observability and reporting tools and/or platforms  Experience with Agile Development       What will be your additional plus?    Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment techniques  Experience working with cloud based architectures and tools (AWS, Google)  Experience with testing streaming video related products       We offer:    Employment contract,  Hybrid/Remote (home office if applicable),  Multisport card + private medical care,  Access to e-learning and self-development platforms and office library,  English and Polish language lessons,  We participate in and speak at conferences, also join/ run public meet-ups (e.g. Google IO, WWDC, Confitura),  In-house activities: tech talks, hackathons,  You can use 10% of your working time to pursue your personal development, and side projects,  Active global inclusion and CSR groups,  Well located, modern office with lots of amenities – adjustable desks, electronics toolkit, 3D printer ready for you to use, pool table, console, table tennis, massage chair.       We kindly inform you that we will contact only selected candidates.   To find out more about Paramount visit:   https://www.paramount.com/       Please, include in your documents the following personal data:  name and surname, date of birth, your contact details you wish us to use during the recruitment process, education, professional qualifications, professional experience (i.e. employment history). Providing us with this data is obligatory (article 22¹ §1 of the Polish Labor Code).      If you wish to provide us with further information regarding yourself, then please provide us with the following consent:    “I hereby agree VIMN Poland sp. z o.o. with a registered office in Warsaw („VIMN”) to process my personal data included in my job application (CV/ Cover Letter) for the purposes of the recruitment process conducted by VIMN. This consent relates to my personal data which scope exceeds the scope of personal data required on the basis of the Article 22 ¹  §1 of the Polish Labor Code.”   Providing us with personal data other than those referred to in article 22¹ §1 of the Polish Labor Code, without the above declaration, shall mean that you agree to their processing.  You have a right to withdraw your consent any time what will not affect the lawfulness of processing made on the basis of the consent prior to its withdrawal. Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Software Engineer
skills: Skills: JavaScript, Java, +8 more
job_description: Intesa Sanpaolo è un gruppo bancario internazionale, leader in Italia e fra i primi 5 gruppi dell'area euro con oltre 20 milioni di clienti in Italia e all’estero. Estremamente innovativo è anche motore di crescita sostenibile e inclusiva, con impatto concreto sulla società e con un forte impegno per l’ambiente.     Scopo e attività     Stiamo cercando un Analista Tecnico / Software Engineer in ambito Information and Comunication Technology nel settore Bancario, che abbia partecipato alla gestione di progetti ad alta complessità in ambito Non Perfoming Loans.  E' da considerarsi come requisito necessario la conoscenza approfondita e la capacità a condurre analisi tecniche e individuazione soluzione applicativa su tecnologie dipartimentali, a container/microservizi, progettazione di servizi esposti in API rest, e gestione di team di sviluppo e unit test. Requisito primario è la conoscenza del credito in generale e dei processi NPLs (in particolare disegno e sviluppo di processi di gestione, provisioning e recupero crediti proattivi e deteriorati e nelle applicazioni di gestione dei portafogli oggetto di cartolarizzazione e normativi di bilancio) e avere esperienza di gestione e sviluppo dei relativi applicativi e la provenienza da società di Software Engineering o da strutture equivalenti.  Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza della Google Cloud Platform e di tecnologie quali Kubernetes, JSON, PostgresSQL o equivalenti.  Integra il profilo l'avere esperienza o l'attitudine di pianificazione e monitoraggio dei progetti, la capacità di gestire relazioni ed integrare fornitori terzi, la conoscenza generale delle tecnologie di riferimento nel settore  La risorsa verrà inserita all'interno di un team che seguirà progetti complessi di trasformazione applicativa della piattaforma per la gestione dei crediti / finanziamenti e NPLs integrando innovazioni di prodotto e nuove tecnologie     Tra le principali attività:     • Analizzerai con gli utenti della Banca i requisiti e le necessità di Business al fine di dettagliare le specifiche e valutare gli impatti sul software  • Ti occuperai della predisposizione delle stime, gestirai le analisi funzionali e tecniche e l'interazione con i team di sviluppo per la realizzazione del software seguendo le diverse fasi progettuali, comprensive di test (includendo anche la definizione dei test tecnici e di performance necessari) , rilascio in produzione e follow-up  • Svolgerai in ruolo di referente applicativo nell' ambito dei Finanziamenti  • Potrai integrare la tua esperienza su Devops e nuove tecnologie (Cloud, API, Microservizi, ecc..)  • Parteciperai al disegno di una soluzione in un ambiente complesso ad alta interazione e con le tecnologie più innovative     Esperienza Richiesta     1-3 anni di esperienza in progetti IT a medio/alta complessità preferibilmente nel contesto digitale bancario, finanziario o settore creditizio.     Qualifiche Richieste, Skills e Competenze      Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria Informatica, Matematica, Statistica o Fisica o esperienza equivalente  Esperienza di progettazione architetturale e sviluppo software a microservizi e/o su applicazioni containerizzate su Customer Journey di vendita di prodotti bancari  Conoscenza di alcuni tra i più recenti linguaggi di programmazione e dei DB relazionali e non  Conoscenza professionale della lingua inglese  Conoscenza delle tecnologie cloud e della Google Cloud Platform  Conoscenza delle tecnologie Kubernetes, JSON, PostgresSQL, e/o equivalenti      Come Developer Java Backend/Frontend:      Conoscenza linguaggi programmazione ad oggetti Java (preferibilmente versione JDK 8) e Javascript  Conoscenza di framwork: SpringBoot (o SpringBatch), Angular (versine >= 2), Hibernate, Jpa  Conoscenze DB: ORACLE, Postgres, Mongo DB (opzionale)  Sviluppo unit test (Junit)  Strumenti di versioning: GIT  Strumenti di build: Maven  Conoscenza base: Gestione processi asincroni(es: Code Kafka), concetti di contanier  Esperienza di sviluppo di API  Conoscenza di OpenShift (opzionale)       Entra a far parte di una realtà internazionale e innovativa. Il futuro non si aspetta, si sceglie!     #sharingfuture

title: Salesforce Business Analyst
skills: Skills: Salesforce.com, Администрирование SalesForce.com, +6 more
job_description: ENGIE mette al centro delle sue attività (elettricità, gas naturale, efficientamento energetico e servizi) lo sviluppo sostenibile, per far fronte alle sfide della transizione energetica verso una low carbon economy: accesso ad un'economia sostenibile, mitigazione e adattamento al cambiamento climatico e ottimizzazione delle risorse.     La  Funzione IT & Digital  per supportare la crescita della Global Business Unit Supply, ricerca un  Salesforce Business Analyst  che seguirà l'area  Work Force Management  responsabile dello sviluppo delle soluzioni digitali a supporto dei nostri tecnici che intervengono sul campo per erogare servizi ai nostri clienti.  La schedulazione, la gestione delle attività del personale operativo, la rendicontazione degli interventi di manutenzione sono oggetto di continuous improvement volto a digitalizzare, migliorare e ottimizzare i processi e i deliverables.  La missione del ruolo sarà partecipare in maniera attiva e rilevante all'evoluzione della piattaforma, basata su tecnologia  Salesforce , guidandone la roadmap, i progetti e le operation.     Il ruolo richiede una comprovata esperienza nella gestione di progetti complessi e articolati, una spiccata attitudine al lavoro di squadra e alla comprensione del cliente (interno ed esterno), una forte passione per le tecnologie e una naturale inclinazione ai processi di trasformazione e di cambiamento.         Principali Attività:    Comprendere a fondo le esigenze del business, per partecipare in modo attivo al processo di trasformazione della piattaforma, raccolta esigenze e studio della fattibilità sia operativa che di costi.  Promuovere e valorizzare le opportunità digitali a supporto delle attività di business ( es. Remote Assistant per permettere sopralluoghi o interventi digitali)  Gestione di progetti complessi, trovando il giusto equilibrio tra tempi, costi e soddisfazione utenti esterni ed interni  Collaborare con team interfunzionali che coprono diverse aree dell’IT per allineare i piani dei singoli fornitori funzionali agli obiettivi di business tenendo in considerazione le esigenze degli utenti  Conoscenza delle metodologie ITIL di gestione dell'esercizio IT, livelli di servizio e KPI/SLA con penali, costi e planning di progetto  Capacità ed esperienza nella gestione dei servizi in outsourcing          Requisiti:    Laurea in materie scientifiche (Ingegneria informatica magistrale, Informatica o percorso equivalente)  Esperienza lavorativa; 4-6 anni in ambienti  Salesforce   Conoscenza del settore Energy\Utility (preferenziale)  Competenze di gestione del progetto;  Conoscenza piattaforma Salesforce Field Services (preferenziale)  Conoscenza moduli SAP PM/MM (preferenziale)  Gestione degli stakeholders e attitudine alla costruzione di relazioni solide e alla negoziazione;  Capacità di riordinare e organizzare tempi e priorità in contesti complessi, gestendo nel corso del progetto variabili endogene;  Spiccato approccio user-centric e forte capacità comunicativa;  Disponibilità e flessibilità nell’affrontare aree fuori dalla propria comfort zone  Atteggiamento orientato alla risoluzione dei problemi;  Lingua inglese: full business proficiency (C1 - preferenziale)       Sede di lavoro: Milano      Se possiedi tali requisiti, allora sei la risorsa che stiamo cercando. Non perdere tempo!  Candidati allegando il tuo CV aggiornato, in formato PDF, indipendentemente dal genere di appartenenza.      Facendo parte di un gruppo multinazionale, lavorare con ENGIE significa avere un'ampia varietà di possibilità di carriera in oltre 30 paesi.    Ma significa anche mettere l'utilità per gli altri al centro della tua vita professionale e contribuire a un vero cambiamento nel corso di una carriera stimolante.    ENGIE si impegna a combattere tutte le forme di discriminazione in materia di occupazione, accesso alla formazione, promozione e più in generale in tutte le componenti dell'azienda.    Pertanto, l'integrazione e il sostegno di giovani e anziani e persone con disabilità sono priorità fondamentali della politica delle risorse umane.    Il Diversity Label, che il Gruppo detiene dal 2012, dimostra questo impegno

job_description: Description and Requirements       What does the role involve?       In this role you will be reviewing online search results in order to improve their content and quality. You will be required to provide feedback and analysis on content found in search engine results and provide ratings on their relevance to the search terms used. Another aspect of this role will involve reviewing the language used in the search results by examining grammar, tone and cultural relevance.       Through this work you will be making a valuable contribution by expressing your opinion on the quality and content of what is currently out there on the web. You will play a part in improving the quality of one of the largest search engines in the world using both your PC and required Smartphone device.       Who is suitable for this role?       We are currently seeking dynamic and creative people who have a strong interest in social media, specifically those who are an active daily user of their Gmail account. We also require suitable candidates to own & use a smartphone – Android or iPhone – and have a familiarity with other forms of social media and Google products. You should also be flexible, reliable and have the ability to interpret and follow established guidelines.    You will have the    flexibility and freedom to work from your own home,  working your own hours . Hours are up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability. You must have full    professional proficiency in written and verbal English and Slovak     You    must be living in Slovakia for the last 5 consecutive years     You must own and use a Smartphone (Android V4.2 or higher or iPhone running iOS version 13.0 or higher) to complete tasks    The majority of the task types will require both a desktop/laptop and a Smartphone    Gmail must be your primary email account    Active daily user of Gmail and other forms of social media.    You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Slovakia    Access to and use of a broadband internet connection and associated computer and software to perform the work, all provided at your own expense    Experience in use of web browsers to navigate and interact with a variety of content        Additional Job Description       We help companies test and improve machine learning models via our global AI Community of 1 million+ annotators and linguists. Our proprietary AI training platform handles all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. job_description: Billennium jest polską firmą IT, która od 20 lat rozwija innowacyjne usługi i produkty oraz dostarcza najlepszych specjalistów w ramach outsourcingu.  Realizujemy projekty i usługi IT w Polsce, na terenie Unii Europejskiej, a także w Kanadzie.  Obecnie zatrudniamy ponad 1800 specjalistów z zakresu najnowocześniejszych rozwiązań wspierających biznes.     Aktualnie poszukujemy specjalisty na stanowisko  Analityka  dla naszego klienta z branży bankowej.      wynagrodzenie do 120 zł/h netto b2b w zależności od doświadczenia  angielski średniozaawansowany   wymagane doświadczenie w branży bankowości        Opis:  Rozwój bankowości mobilnej - zespół rozwija frontend i backend. Aplikacja jest jedną z najlepszych mobilnych aplikacji bankowych na polskim rynku. Do aplikacji obecnej w sklepach Google Play oraz App Store każdego dnia loguje się ponad 700 tysięcy klientów. Aplikacja umożliwia Klientom szybkie sprawdzanie stanu konta, realizację przelewów i płatności BLIK, płatności Google Pay i Apple Pay, założenie konta oraz wnioskowanie o nowe produkty. Działanie aplikacji wspierane jest zestawem mikroserwisów projektowanych i rozwijanych w ramach zespołu. Jako zespół pracujemy w metodyce zwinnej, dbając o ciągły rozwój i poprawę jakości naszej aplikacji.  Wierzymy w siłę podejścia „inspect & adapt” i korzystamy z niej na co dzień.     Wymagane doświadczenie w rozwoju bankowości mobilnej albo internetowej.  Praca w roli analityka systemowego, czyli opisywanie integracji pomiędzy systemami - API, kolejki, itd.        Zadania:   • Przeprowadzanie analizy systemowej pod kątem realizacji wymagań biznesowych,  • Przygotowywanie dokumentacji projektowej/analitycznej jako wkładu dla prac developerskich,  • Współpraca z Product Owner-ami (PO) przy doprecyzowywaniu wymagań biznesowych,  • Współpraca z developerami,  • Udział w spotkaniach projektowych oraz zespołu developerskiego,  • Wsparcie merytoryczne PO w odbiorze prac developerskich.      Profil kandydata:   • Minimum 3 letnie doświadczenie na podobnym stanowisku,  • Znajomość notacji BPMN i UML,  • Znajomość języka angielskiego w stopniu przynajmniej komunikatywnym,  • Umiejętność samoorganizacji,  • Duża komunikatywność,  • Znajomość procesów wytwarzania oprogramowania.      Mile widziane:   • Doświadczenie w obszarze aplikacji mobilnych,  • Doświadczenia w pracy w metodyce AGILE,  • Znajomość Confluence i Jira.        Narzędzia:   · Confluence,  · Jira,  · BPMN,  · UML.

title: Business Intelligence Specialist
skills: Skills: ETL, Аналитические навыки, +8 more
job_description: Feyenoord en Stadion Feijenoord zijn de laatste jaren verregaand gedigitaliseerd en wij blijven ons ontwikkelen om een ondernemende, innovatieve en data gedreven onderneming te zijn. IT is een belangrijke strategische pijler binnen onze organisatie. IT, data en innovatie moeten zorgen voor een optimale bedrijfsvoering, onderscheidend vermogen en groei.   Wij zijn per direct op zoek naar een ervaren  Business Intelligence Specialist (fulltime) .       Wat ga je doen?    Als Business Intelligence Specialist ben je primair verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, visualiseren, interpreteren, analyseren en presenteren van data uit in- en externe bronnen. Je draagt bij aan data gedreven werken, stelt dataverwerkingsprocessen op en bewaakt de kwaliteit. Je inspireert en adviseert de organisatie over de toepassing van data om tot onderbouwde besluitvorming te komen. Je bent expert van de diverse databronnen en hoe deze zich tot elkaar verhouden. Je bent in staat om scherpe analyses te maken die de (operationele) afdelingen ondersteunen in het maken van bepaalde keuzes. Hierbij werk je nauw samen met een team van applicatiespecialisten, data scientists en analisten.      Daarnaast als Business Intelligence Specialist:    Extraheer, transformeer en laad je data in (ETL);  Ontwerp, implementeer en beheer je rapportage oplossingen voor de KPI’s;  Creëer je commerciële inzichten en kansen op basis van data;  Voer je analyses uit en maak je deze inzichtelijk voor gebruikers;  Ontwerp, implementeer en beheer je de dashboards, visualisaties en rapportages;  Stel je de kwaliteitseisen van de data op en bewaak en verbeter je deze waar nodig.       Wie ben jij?     Je hebt minimaal hbo werk- en denkniveau en bij voorkeur 3-5 jaar werkervaring in een gelijksoortige functie;  Je bent zelfstandig en hebt een groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel;  Je werkt gestructureerd en bent in staat overzicht te bewaren;  Je bent bekend met Agile en SCRUM werken en kan dit tevens ondersteunen;  Je hebt ruime kennis en ervaring met MS SQL;  Kennis en ervaring met Azure Data Factory en PowerBI is een pré;  Kennis en ervaring met het uitlezen van API’s is een pré;  Je bent innovatief, creëert makkelijk draagvlak en toont initiatief;  Je kunt goed communiceren en presenteren.       Wat krijg je er voor terug?     Een unieke en dynamische werkomgeving in één van Rotterdams grootste iconen;  Een salaris tussen de €3.900 en €4.400 afhankelijk van ervaring;  25 vakantiedagen, 8% vakantietoeslag en een vergoeding van €0,21 per km of openbaar vervoer (tot een maximum van €335,-);  Pensioen op basis van een beschikbare premieregeling met een zeer lage eigen bijdrage van 1% in de premie;  Een 12 maanden contract dat bij goed functioneren wordt omgezet in een vast contract;  Eén seizoenkaart gratis en een tweede tegen fiscale bijtelling;  Kortingen bij onze partner en tours in De Kuip;  Onbeperkt toegang tot GoodHabitz om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen.       Klaar voor de transfer?    Ben of ken jij deze Business Intelligence Specialist? Zorg dan dat jij/hij/zij reageert op deze vacature via de link.

title: Junior Analyst - Data Process
skills: Skills: Документация, Коммуникация, +8 more
job_description: Location: Hungary, Budapest   The Sony Belgium branch of Sony Europe hosts a variety of support divisions, one of which is the Service, Quality and Environmental (SQE) division. This division drives the direction of Sony Europe end-customer support & service, striving for a very good customer satisfaction experience under a well-balanced cost for Sony. Within SQE, a team of business and functional analysts is responsible for constantly re-thinking and improving business process flows, growing a better customer experience or decreasing the cost for Sony. Within this team, Sony is looking for an extra person to function as a data process junior analyst.    You will:      Maintaining & updating internal databases  Transferring data from one system to another  Preparing data readiness to support service operations and indirectly our end-customers  Handling critical issues related to incorrect data/set-up of internal IT systems  Thinking along with the IT dept on the feasibility of automating data processing activities  Documenting this into a set of functional change requests for all impacted applications  Liaise between SQE business, Sony internal & external IS teams for IT follow-up/release mgmt.  Supervise data accuracy  Set up follow updata dashboards to follow-up on contract sales     On a day-to-day basis you will work with below SQE domains;    Model Master set-up & escalation handling    Any new SONY product sold on the market needs to be set up accurately inside our internal SONY applications. As such the model is known for its accurate properties for     Online interactions through our Support Website  Contact Centre handling through our CRM system  Service Centre operations through various internal & external service systems  Reporting transparency comparing sales vs failures & showing overall service cost      Default Warranty set-up & escalation handling      A standard warranty period needs to be set up for all EU countries & all products  In-warranty service scheme needs to be set up in case of quality issues      Extended Warranty/Contract set-up & escalation handling      Applicable to both consumers as professional end-customers  SONY sells contracts with extra guarantee periods or special services  Through various sales channels; online/e-commerce as via dealer shops  Which requires a lot of system & data set-up in various internal SONY IT systems      You bring:      University “Master” degree or equivalent by experience  1-2 years of experience in a similar role  Used to work on a day-to-day basis with data processing tools MS Access & MS XLS  Reading/writing SQL and development of XLS macros  Working with SAP BW data extract  Proficient in English (+ other European languages are an asset)   A phenomenal teammate and a good communicator who can establish excellent working relationships  Has an analytical mind and a structured way of working along with an excellent eye for details  Has the ability to handle several tasks and projects at the same time  Ability to work under stress and keen to reach deadlines optimally      Your new office in   Budapest    Based at the Budapest office, you will enjoy a modern, vibrant and diverse working environment with lots of social and charity events to be part of and enjoy a sense of belonging. We have an onsite canteen with a wide range of healthy options, a café, and free coffee/tea in the office kitchens. The office is easily reachable by public transportation. You can enjoy your lunchbreak outside in the garden or have a walk by the Danube. If you like to ride, we have bike storage in the building with a changing room and we also have a MOL BUBI bike docking station in front of the office building.    Life at Sony    We ensure  competitive salaries  and benefits by using established benchmarking. We encourage healthy  work-life balance  supported by hybrid and  flexible  working policies. We are a positive  community  who dream big together, respect each other, and enjoy a collaborative culture.   We like to celebrate our colleagues who make a real difference using our  recognition  platform. We also provide access to numerous services and platforms for all aspects of  wellbeing . We  listen  to our people through conversations and surveys,  respect  their suggestions, then act on them. We also provide allowances for  volunteering days  so that our staff can support the causes they are most passionate about.   You can build your career around you with our fantastic range of  learning & personal development  programs to enhance your skills. We also encourage our staff to try exciting new roles, in a wide range of countries, with a supportive  mobility  team to support you if you take that leap!    Bring your uniqueness to Sony    We are passionate about creating a culture that promotes equity and cultivates inclusion, diversity, and belonging. We want employees with diverse backgrounds and perspectives that will stimulate innovation and have a direct impact on our creation of social value to fulfil Sony’s purpose – ‘to fill the world with emotion, through the power of creativity and technology’. We want you to bring your unique self to work and help shape our culture.    We are Sony Europe.    Our people collaborate in an environment of respect, integrity, and open-mindedness. Diverse teams from all over Europe are the driving force for our business, and we embrace the differences that make each of us original and unique.   With offices in 28 European countries, Sony Europe caters to consumer, professional, semiconductor and healthcare markets with innovative electronics products and solutions. Our European laboratories research and develop new technologies and capabilities that contributes to the Sony Group and important issues on a planetary scale.   Bring your passion, creativity and ambitions to Sony Europe.   Apply now (in English please) and let’s create the future together.

FUNCIONES A DESEMPEÑAR:       Diseño de modelos de datos vinculados al planteamiento, definición y diseño de soluciones tecnológicas y sostenibles en el ámbito de la logística, la movilidad y el transporte.  Participación en la ejecución de proyectos con empresas y ciudades y administraciones públicas para la digitalización y automatización de las operativas y servicios de transporte (pasajeros y mercancías)  Desarrollo de un modelo basado en BIG DATA e Inteligencia Artificial para el soporte a iniciativas de digitalización en Smart cities.  Creación de gemelos digitales mediante herramientas de simulación.  Creación de un concepto de explotación de datos provenientes de vehículos en movimiento, condiciones del tráfico y otros factores externos. Se requiere experiencia o conocimientos en el manejo de:      Herramientas de visualización de datos (PowerBI, Tableau, etc.)  Programación de algoritmos para el análisis de datos y creación de modelos predictivos (Python, R, Matlab, etc.)  Conocimientos de estadística  Conocimiento del manual de buenas prácticas DAMA BoK 2   Valorable conocimientos en bases de datos norelacionales.     Inglés B2/C1 (se realizará prueba de nivel).     Disponibilidad para viajar con carácter puntual, a nivel nacional e internacional.

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

job_description: Line of Service  Internal Firm Services     Industry/Sector  Not Applicable     Specialism  IFS - Internal Firm Services - Other     Management Level  Associate     Job Description & Summary  A career in the Chief Data Office within Internal Firm Services will provide you with the opportunity to support our business by delivering excellent data management services. Key responsibilities include:      Develop process maps and data flows   Develop, maintain and socialise data policies and processes to a high standard   Coordinate with business stakeholders to and escalate problems as appropriate using initiative and discretion   Ability to develop business relationships internally and externally    Demonstrates a commitment to quality and integrity title: Oracle Developer (2 posts)
skills: Skills: Моделирование данных, Oracle Developer Suite, +8 more
job_description: Primary Location    Belgium-Brussels    NATO Body    NATO International Staff (NATO IS)    Schedule    Full-time    Application Deadline    11-Jun-2023, 11:59:00 PM    Salary (Pay Basis)    4,384.94    Grade    NATO Grade G10-G12   With this campaign, we are looking for a G10/12 Oracle Developer (Pensions) and a G10/12 Oracle Developer (Payroll).   We have also launched a separate campaign to recruit an Assistant, HR Data Analytics (G10/12) in support of the same team.      SUMMARY     Within the Executive Management Division (EM), NATO’s International Staff (IS) Human Resources (HR) Directorate is comprised of four pillars: Talent Management and HR Integration (TMHRI); Staff Services (pay and benefits, pensions, personnel support); HR Policy and Strategy Coordination (IS and NATO-wide HR policy); and the Medical Service.   The NW-PMIS provides personnel management ICT support for NATO civilian staff and pensioners. It is an in-house developed Oracle application used by HR centres of around 20 NATO Bodies spread across NATO member countries for the primary purpose of salary and pension calculation. The post incumbent will support the payroll aspects of this system from an Information Technology standpoint.   The Developer is assigned tasks prioritised by the NW-PMIS Management Board which relate to the system analysis, design, development and maintenance of the NW-PMIS. The Developer will also ensure the integration of the NW-PMIS with other commercial off the shelf (COTS) tools, products, and applications.   Under the supervision of the Head of Section, the incumbent will provide ICT development support (Oracle) to the Pensions Service and act as the main point of contact for the NATO-Wide Personnel Management Information System (NW-PMIS) support team, for those aspects of NW-PMIS relating to the administration of payroll.   The incumbent will ensure the application conforms to IT security policies on an ongoing basis and will assist in maintaining business continuity of the application.   Examples of significant functional areas with which the incumbent will be involved are:      Calculation of payroll allowances and deductions    Salary adjustment processes    Bank file processing and interfacing to financial systems    DCPS Redemptions (Release of funds to retiring DCPS members)    Defined Contributions Pension Scheme (DCPS) pension contribution processing    Medical Insurance contributions processing    QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE      Essential    The incumbent must:      possess a good general education at least to higher secondary level complemented by a training in Information technology applications development;    have a minimum of 6 years’ experience in developing and maintaining software or systems developed in Oracle PL/SQL environment;    have a minimum of 3 years’ experience with a combination of systems technical analysis and design, using Software Development Life Cycle methodologies;    have experience with formal development and test procedures, including check-in, check-out, software versioning, integration testing, change management, release management, and user acceptance testing;    have understanding of structured project management methodologies;    have some understanding of hardware platforms, networking technologies, and operational requirements;    possess the following minimum levels of NATO’s official languages (English/French): V (“Advanced”) in one; III (“Intermediate”) in the other.       DESIRABLE    The following would be considered an advantage:      experience in development with Oracle Forms;    experience in data modelling, diagramming, and application module design;    knowledge of Prince2 project management methodology;    experience in user training;    experience in HTML, Java, SQL and help authoring tools (e.g. Robohelp);    experience in developing and supporting Payroll and Personnel Management systems in the governmental and public sector organisations;    experience with development work in Oracle reporting tools;    MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES      Expertise Development:    Providing the analysis, design, development, testing and document software and hardware solutions to meet user requirements using Software Development Life Cycle methodologies. Use programming experience, COTS tools and development environments to develop solutions to meet defined business and technical requirements, implementing proper check-in, check-out, version control and release management standards. Follow internal testing guidelines to ensure quality of all developed solutions, including developing and executing testing plans for unit/module testing, integrating testing and other types as appropriate. Develop, execute user acceptance testing and modify systems and applications based on test results. Conduct life-cycle application support activities to include assisting in troubleshooting and identifying code-related issues and bug fixes and providing second and third level production support toward issue resolution. Organise and perform user training sessions.    Knowledge Management:    Produce all required documentation for each solution/system developed or integrated, to include application specifications, administrative guides, troubleshooting guides and end user documentation. Coordinate distribution and retention of documents.    Information Management:    Produce all required documentation for each solution/system developed or integrated to include application specifications, administrative guides, troubleshooting and support guides, and end user documentation.    Stakeholder Management:    Interface with customers/users located in NATO Bodies in different geographical areas. Consult with technical analysts and application development/package integration members of other teams to analyse requirements and outline the proposed technical solution. Liaise with relevant external customers/clients such financial institutions, HR Administration, payroll and pension providers.    Project Management:    Monitor, and support the review of the projects that provide new or upgraded applications to ensure early and appropriate planning of all application support issues; ensure that all deliverables required for application support are made available; plan and execute production installation, final application acceptance testing and Post Implementation Reviews. Take part in project activities related to the application aspects of implementing and testing Business Continuity.   Perform any other related duty as necessary.      INTERRELATIONSHIPS     The incumbent works under the direction of the Head, Data Analytics. S/he works closely with the Head of the Pensions Unit. Moreover, s/he will coordinate - as appropriate - with other staff members within the Human Resources (HR) units of the NATO bodies.   Direct reports: N/a   Indirect reports: N/a.      COMPETENCIES     The incumbent must demonstrate:      Achievement: Works to meet standards;    Analytical Thinking: Sees basic relationships;    Clarity and Accuracy: Checks own work;    Conceptual Thinking: Sees patterns based on life/work experience;    Customer Service Orientation: Takes personal responsibility for correcting problems;    Empathy: Reads non-verbal cues and understands meanings;    Impact and Influence: Takes multiple actions to persuade;    Initiative: Is decisive in a time-sensitive situation;    Teamwork: Co-operates.    CONTRACT      Contract to be offered to the successful applicant (if non-seconded): Definite duration contract of three years’ duration; possibility of an indefinite duration contract thereafter .   Contract clause applicable:   In accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Regulations, the successful candidate will receive a definite duration contract of three years, which may be followed by an indefinite duration contract.   If the successful applicant is seconded from the national administration of one of NATO’s member States, a 3-year definite duration contract will be offered, which may be renewed for a further period of up to 3 years subject to the agreement of the national authority concerned. The maximum period of service in the post as a seconded staff member is six years.   Serving staff will be offered a contract in accordance with the NATO Civilian Personnel Régulations.   NOTE: Irrespective of previous qualifications and experience, candidates for twin-graded posts will be appointed at the lower grade. Advancement to the higher grade is not automatic, and will not normally take place during the first three years of service in the post.   Under specific circumstances, serving staff members may be appointed directly to the higher grade, and a period of three years might be reduced by up to twenty four months for external candidates. These circumstances are described in the IS directive on twin-graded posts.      RECRUITMENT PROCESS     Please note that we can only accept applications from nationals of NATO member countries. Applications must be submitted using e-recruitment system, as applicable:      For NATO civilian staff members only: please apply via the internal recruitment portal ( link );    For all other applications: www.nato.int/recruitment      Please note that at the time of the interviews, candidates will be asked to provide evidence of their education and professional experience as relevant for this vacancy.   Appointment will be subject to receipt of a security clearance (provided by the national Authorities of the selected candidate) and approval of the candidate’s medical file by the NATO Medical Adviser.   More information about the recruitment process and conditions of employment, can be found at our website (http://www.nato.int/cps/en/natolive/recruit-hq-e.htm).      ADDITIONAL INFORMATION     NATO is committed to diversity and inclusion, and strives to provide equal access to employment, advancement and retention, independent of gender, age, nationality, ethnic origin, religion or belief, cultural background, sexual orientation, and disability. NATO welcomes applications of nationals from all member Nations, and strongly encourages women to apply.   Building Integrity is a key element of NATO’s core tasks. As an employer, NATO values commitment to the principles of integrity, transparency and accountability in accordance with international norms and practices established for the defence and related security sector. Selected candidates are expected to be role models of integrity, and to promote good governance through ongoing efforts in their work.   Due to the broad interest in NATO and the large number of potential candidates, telephone or e-mail enquiries cannot be dealt with.   Applicants who are not successful in this competition may be offered an appointment to another post of a similar nature, albeit at the same or a lower grade, provided they meet the necessary requirements.   The nature of this position may require the staff member at times to be called upon to travel for work and/or to work outside normal office hours.   The organization offers several work-life policies including Teleworking and Flexible Working arrangements (Flexitime) subject to business requirements.   Please note that the International Staff at NATO Headquarters in Brussels, Belgium is a non-smoking environment.   For information about the NATO Single Salary Scale (Grading, Allowances, etc.) please visit our website . Detailed data is available under the Salary and Benefits tab.

title: Digital Analyst
skills: Skills: Статистика по компании, Cross-Channel Marketing, +8 more
job_description: About Us:    The payments market is the most exciting technology market in the world today for good reason. McKinsey values it globally at over $2 trillion and it’s growing between 13-15% year-on-year. Some of the largest most dynamic brands are investing in this sector; Apple has ApplePay, Google has GooglePay, Amazon has AmazonPay, and it’s not just the Silicon Valley brands. Tencent owns WeChatPay, Alibaba owns Alipay and digital disruptors like Square, Stripe and Adyen all invest millions to grow the payments market.   Planet are a technology company that’s transforming payments by putting the customer experience first. We help our customers deliver a better experience for guests, shoppers, and consumers everywhere. We operate in a market that continues to evolve and expand, partnering with the world’s most prestigious brands across Retail and Hospitality, and with a network of Financial Services partners worldwide.   To meet consumer demands, payments must be simple, safe, and invisible. The only way to do this is to fully embed payments in the software that runs business. By combining software and payment technology, Planet’s creating a world of connected commerce, that makes payments feel good.   We’re growing organically, and with strong Private Equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we’ve the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisition.    Growth    The Growth team is responsible for defining and driving the execution of Planet’s Growth and Go-To-Market (GTM) strategies. Within our team we combine Go-To-Market strategy, Marketing, Inside Sales, Pre-Sales Consulting and Revenue Operations to grow Planet’s business and expand into new markets and customer segments. From top level strategy to operational excellence and execution. We design end-to-end customer acquisition journeys and drive high impact Go-To-Market motions at scale. We are natural team players, partnering closely with the Hospitality, Retail and Partner teams, Product, Operations and many others. We play to win and always put the customer first.    Role Overview:    The Digital Analyst will be responsible for the development, management, and oversight of the digital reporting and data visualization, providing data-driven and actionable insights and measurement of company performance against targets. The Digital Analyst will develop a detailed understanding of the key data sources, websites and channels. They will identify, build, and maintain the key business metrics for the demand generation team. The successful candidate must have excellent analytical skills, be detail-oriented and tenacious in their ability to track down data to drive meaningful insights across channels and data streams, website behaviour, full B2B funnel analysis, and work well within a team.   The Digital Analyst must have experience building a cohesive, cross-channel measurement and reporting strategy, exhibit excellent analytical skills, be detail and solution-oriented, and be tenacious in their ability to track down data to drive meaningful insights, and work well across business partners.   What you will do:     Analyse the results of digital marketing and ecommerce initiatives across several channels, including website, media, social, mobile, email and video  Contribute to digital campaign and web measurement strategies   Create dashboards, reports and presentations that clearly synthesize learnings and actionable insights/recommendations  Monitor team performance against targets and perform required deep dives when needed  Maintaining knowledge and documentation on key systems and data sources  Provide analysis of impact and performance of program changes/optimizations; provide recommendations  Communicate and present findings to colleagues and senior leaders by telling stories from data and turning data into insights that help improve results to optimize KPIs  Integrate advanced analytics techniques and methodologies into our day-to-day insight and analytics approach.   Monitor the performance of our products (dashboards and sales monitoring KPIs), forecast performance through predictive analytics, and recommend remedial actions through prescriptive analytics.   You will use data to drive decisions to result in higher performance.   Full funnel approach: understand business needs and objectives, from channel acquisition to customer advocacy.   Collaborate with all teams building dashboards, reports, etc.   Develop strategies for effective data analysis and reporting, defining measurement requirements.   Oversee all analytics operations to correct discrepancies and ensure quality.   Lead testing & optimization efforts to optimize Website and channel conversion (AB tests, landing pages, etc).      Who You Are:     5+ years of relevant experience in related roles. title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Data Vault, Data Engineering, +8 more
job_description: The insurance space is changing rapidly. New ways of creating value from data are evolving at a fast pace. Therefore, within Allianz Benelux, we are looking for a strong Data engineer. You want to build the foundations of the data warehouse to enable high impact projects ? You want to manipulate data from different data sources, organize them and get them accessible for the business users?        As a data engineer you will acquire a strong sense of methodology and ability to translate business concepts in ontology design and E-R schemas that will be the foundation of data-driven applications and decisions. It also requires flexibility and decisiveness in arbitraging different possible methodological choices and the ability to anticipate downstream impacts. Finally, It requires an Agile mindset of incremental added value and continuous improvement towards architecture vision, while servicing business needs and continuity of existing assets.         What do you get in return?    As a Data engineer, we offer you a full-time challenging role in an international landscape based in Brussels or Rotterdam (traveling to the other country one day every two weeks if allowed)  Working in a dynamic environment at Allianz, world leader in assistance and insurance  A pleasant working atmosphere  An experienced and enthusiastic team  A fascinating, versatile and multilingual job  Development opportunities and a nice salary package supplemented with fringe benefits including meal vouchers, eco vouchers, sports and culture vouchers, group and hospitalization insurance  Since January 2021 - Allianz is giving the flexibility to the employees in choosing for a full flex-regime where homeworking will remain the norm even after COVID-19          Let’s do the match:   You have relevant experience in a similar role? Check! You have experience with Data Modelling, Data Warehouse projects and Wherescape3D or similar tools? Check! Hands-on knowledge in different modelling methodologies (3NF, Dimensional, Data Vault)? Check! Experience in EDW implementation with good understanding of data engineering and BI analytics? Check! Working experience on cloud platforms and/or experience in a insurance-related data modelling project are considered a plus. You have strong communication skills and good requirement analysis skills? Check!        As Data engineer, we count on you for the following tasks:    Leading implementations through detailed planning, analysis, and support, including go-live preparedness and post-live course corrections and improvements.  Ensures harmonized application of a consistent methodology (i.e. Data Vault 2.0) modelling and implementations.  Evaluating and documenting current-state processes through discovery and analysis. Presenting recommendations for improvements based on industry experience and best-practices (including Allianz group guidelines).  Mentoring colleagues on project activities and deliverables and collaborating with others.          Have we peaked your interest? Join us and #LetsCareForTomorrow    Apply now via the apply button, give a call to our recruiter or send us an email to learn more!    If you’re interested in joining us in The Netherlands, please contact Milou Waters   recruitment@allianz.nl.  +316 42 55 27 69        If you’re interested in joining us in Belgium, please contact Noé Falletta  recruitment@allianz.be

ability to take initiative and be proactive.  Ability to effectively handle multiple priorities, organize workload, and meet deadlines  Positivity, enthusiasm and a passion towards the mission of Tesla.  Confident in learning and adapting to multiple technologies.   Able to communicate, read, and write effectively in the Portuguese and English language on all levels  Have the required language skills if required by our local markets  Good knowledge of MS Office     Requisitos  Experiência administrativa preferencialmente no setor automóvel  Capacidade de progredir num ambiente de equipa e alcançar objetivos comuns  Excelente competência na resolução de problemas e forte capacidade de iniciativa e proatividade  Capacidade de lidar com várias prioridades com eficácia, organizar a carga de trabalho e cumprir prazos  Positivismo, entusiasmo e paixão para com a missão da Tesla  Confiança na aprendizagem e adaptação a múltiplas tecnologias   Capacidade de comunicar, ler e escrever eficazmente na língua inglesa a todos os níveis  Ter os conhecimentos linguísticos necessários, se exigido pelos nossos mercados locais  Bons conhecimentos de MS Office   #Sales&CustomerSupport

Analytics,…)  PowerShell  Veille technologique orientée Data       Votre profil :       Vous aimez les problématiques liées aux données et les technologies Microsoft  Vous possédez une formation title: Junior Innovation Analyst
skills: Skills: Microsoft Office, Microsoft Excel, +8 more
job_description: Tech startups can sprout up anywhere, but their growth potential is tied to the richness of their home turf. Without access to the right insights, knowledge, and funding, even promising startups run out of steam. Thriving tech ecosystems are a cornerstone for innovation, job creation and economic growth. Data transparency has the power to accelerate entrepreneurship. While Dealroom is best known for sharing startup data and discovering industry trends – e.g., to help venture capital firms spot the next Spotify tree in the startup forest – helping foster tech ecosystems is also part of our mission.      Dealroom.co is looking for a curious and ambitious innovation analyst to join our Intelligence Unit (IU).  As Dealroom’s research unit, the IU is on a mission to derive original insights out of Dealroom data. In recent years, Dealroom has become a well-recognised company in the startup ecosystem globally, with a reputation for high-quality content & data for Venture Capital firms, Corporates, and Governments. Insights and content you will help put together are frequently featured in The Economist, Financial Times, The New York Times, and other leading titles.      What can you expect from this opportunity?   On a daily basis, you can expect to work on diverse projects pertaining to startups, Venture Capital, and the broader ecosystem including their enablers (governments, universities and service providers).  There is no typical day at Dealroom but here are some of the tasks and activities you can expect:   Leverage Dealroom data to create compelling insights on trends within startup and venture capital ecosystems, and emerging innovation sectors;  Analyze, discover and showcase emerging trends for the creation of meaningful, influential industry reports, guides and digital content;  Lead research projects end to end - from ideation and client management, to data analysis and storytellin -, to enable investors and corporates to make better data-driven decisions;  Innovate and improve, work across departments and come up with new ideas to delight our customers.   In this role, you will become an integral part of our Intelligence Unit. Working with and learning from our senior analysts and team leads, you can expect careful and personalized mentoring from industry experts. As an innovation analyst we expect you to grow rapidly into a key and valued member of the team, leading your own projects and supporting on team wide initiatives, taking active part in cross-functional projects, and expanding your network with partners externally. You will also work closely with our Sales, Data, Marketing and Product teams in-person in Amsterdam, and further with our teams in Lisbon and our remote colleagues.      There are many reasons why Dealroom is a great place to work, but here are some:     In the right spot, at the right time.  Startups have become the most important driver of innovation and economic growth. This is a great opportunity and role to be active and visible in a highly dynamic market, right in the middle of the tech ecosystem.   You’re at the center of the ecosystem.  You will engage directly with the world’s key players in the ecosystem while being at the very forefront of innovation.   30+ Nationalities, and counting.  We’re a team of 80 people across 30 different nationalities! As part of the IU, you will interact with many parts of the company, from business development and marketing to data science and AI.       Who is this role ideal for?    1-3 years of work experience in delivering research and/or experience related to the venture capital ecosystem. A broad interest plus passion for innovation, technology trends, startups, venture capital markets and impact;  EU/EEA nationals, with the right to work in the Netherlands. Sponsorship is not offered for this position.  You are currently based in the Netherlands, preferably in or close to Amsterdam, or you are planning to (independently) relocate to the Netherlands. Relocation support is not offered for this position.  You should demonstrate genuine interest in technology, innovation, startups, and venture capital markets. This includes getting to know the Dealroom database inside-out and staying up-to-date on industry news and trends to truly understand the potential of our Data, in order to turn it into valuable insights for our users, partners and prospects.  You should be eager to learn in a great team and rapidly growing business, but you also thrive when working independently.       What you will need to succeed    Ambition: you are or want to become a (highly) numerate storyteller. You are ready to join a fast-paced startup environment, with the prospect of helping Dealroom become the .  Agility and willingness to learn: you are a keen and fast learner. You are joining us with a baggage of skills but most importantly, to expand your knowledge. You are not afraid to ask for guidance and know how to integrate feedback into your work.  An analytical (and critical) mind: you are organized and logical with a genuine interest for crunching numbers and playing with data to discover interesting trends and angles.  A strong attention to details: identifying patterns and solving puzzles are your strength  A broad interest: you are generally curious, especially for all-things innovation, technology trends, startups, venture capital markets and impact. While prior research on and/or experience related to the venture capital ecosystem, startups and innovation is preferred; we value experience in tech in general, especially around data and software products.       And…    Proficiency in English is a must.  Proficiency in additional languages is a plus.  Proficiency with Google Suite & Microsoft Office, with a strong emphasis on Google Sheets, Google Slides and Excel;  Exposure to an in-office work environment, such as internship(s), and/or relevant work experience.  Comfortable with, or ready to adapt to a hybrid work format and asynchronous teams.  You are open to and ready to join a multicultural and fast-growing scaleup work environment.  Readiness to improve every aspect of Dealroom and yourself.  We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds. You do not need to hold a degree in any particular field. You should be willing to learn alongside our analysts, and to commit to this role on a full-time basis (0.8 - 1 FTE).       What we can offer you    A suitable salary + shares and vesting opportunities  A scale-up environment in which the right dose of insight and initiative can turn your ideas into reality fast  Positive, empathic and outward-focused colleagues, and customers working at the forefront of innovation and technology.  A team of mentors including industry and research experts, data wizards and marketing magicians to learn from and grow alongside of.  Perks designed to set you up for success in a new reality:  Apple or Windows laptop  Flexible working hours  Hybrid work setup: you can work from our office as much as you like, with a minimum of two days per week. Though we would require at least four days a week for the first eight weeks for learning and onboarding. We will also provide support for home office setup.  Team days, Friday drinks and social activities (sports, …).
