title: Data Analyst / Risques de Crédit - Boursorama-(H/F)
skills: Skills: Управление данными, Наука о данных, +8 more
job_description: 22000SJP     Vos missions au quotidien    Au sein de la Direction des Risques et de la Conformité, et en ligne avec les missions générales du pôle Risque de Crédit, ligne de défense 2, vous participerez au respect de l’appétit pour le risque de crédit de Boursorama et du risque de marché. Vous participerez à la définition, au suivi et au pilotage du risque de crédit ainsi qu’au reporting en lien avec ces activités. Vous proposerez les adaptations nécessaires à la politique d’octroi et veille à l’application de la règlementation (Bale III, IRBA, IFRS9,…). Vous serez en du risque de contrepartie et du risque lié à l’activité de brokerage et du risque de marché.   Vous aurez pour missions principales de :     développer et maintenir le datamart Risques ;  développer et maintenir les requêtes périodiques conçues pour les besoins de reporting et de suivi du risque de crédit;  être le point de contact naturel au sein du département avec les équipes de datamarketing, BI et Data de Boursorama pour les projets de transformation ;   mesurer les risques de crédit notamment par la mise en place d’outils d’évaluation et la réalisation d’analyse ;  réaliser des analyses de données ponctuelles sur les sujets impactant le risque de crédit (identification de poches de risques via des analyses statistiques, identification de profils de clients à risque au titre de la fraude, etc.) ;   maintenir au sein de la direction des risques de BRS la connaissance des modèles internes de risques de crédit en lien avec les équipes de modélisation du Groupe et l’utiliser pour le développement de cas d’usages opérationnels ;  être force de proposition pour la conception et le développement de modèles ad hoc permettant de mieux encadrer le risque de crédit de l’activité ;  veiller à la qualité des données utilisées pour ses analyses.     En complément, vous devrez :     apporter votre expertise sur les projets réglementaires et piloter la mise en œuvre des évolutions nécessaires (Bale III, méthode IRBA, IFRS 9, …) ;  participer de manière générale à l’implémentation puis au suivi des nouvelles règlementations ou instructions des autorités de tutelle ou de Société Générale sur les risques de crédit ;  contribuer à l’analyse des modèles d’octroi de crédit ;  apporter votre expertise pour le suivi du risque de modèles pour le compte de Boursorama (MRM).  contribuer aux prévisions et stress tests.        Et si c’était vous ?    De formation BAC +5, vous justifiez au minimum d’une expérience de 3 à 5 ans au sein d’une Direction des Risques (Crédit) ou d’une Direction Financière dans un poste orienté autour du data management, data engineering ou en modélisation.   Vous êtes doté de compétences éprouvées en termes de réglementation, de suivi statistique du risque et des modèles de risques et d’approche bancaire du risque produit.   Votre expérience vous a permis d’acquérir les compétences métiers suivantes :     Très bonne connaissance des outils de data management/ data mining et de modélisation (SAS, R, Python) ;  Maitrise des méthodes d’analyse et de suivi du risque de crédit et du provisionnement (octroi, défaut, recouvrement) ;  Très bonne connaissance de la réglementation bancaire (Bale, IRBA, IFRS9...) ;  Très bonne connaissance des techniques de modélisation et de scoring, capacité à les challenger ;   bonne connaissance des opérations de crédits réalisées par une clientèle constituée de particuliers et de professionnels (CAV, Crédits à la consommation, Prêts immobiliers,…) et des risques associés ;  Bonne maitrise des outils bureautiques ;     Vous êtes organisé, autonome avec un bon esprit d’analyse et de synthèse. Vous disposez de bonnes qualités rédactionnelles et d’une aisance relationnelle.   Anglais professionnel nécessaire sur ce poste.    Contexte particulier :      Le poste de data analyst - Risques de Crédit nécessite la certification AMF (validation pouvant être obtenue en interne dans le cadre d’une formation dédiée).       Pourquoi nous choisir ?    Avec son double positionnement unique de banque-média,  Boursorama  est leader, en France, sur trois métiers : la banque en ligne, le courtage en ligne, et l’information économique et financière sur Internet avec le portail Boursorama.com.   Nous comptons 4,5 millions de clients à la fin de l'année 2022 et ce avec 18 mois d'avance sur l'objectif de conquête initialement fixé à fin 2023.   L’entreprise, filiale à 100 % de Société Générale, compte plus de 800 collaborateurs. En devenant l’un d’eux, vous prendrez part à une aventure professionnelle enrichissante, placée sous le signe de la croissance !   Boursorama assure également une politique de travail en remote dynamique, le télétravail fait ainsi partie intégrante de son organisation du temps de travail !   Vous rejoignez notre Direction Risques et Conformité et plus particulièrement le périmètre Risques et Contrôle Permanent composée d’experts de la gestion du risque.   Ses principales missions ? Identifier, piloter et maîtriser les risques liés à notre activité bancaire.   Son organisation ? Basé à Boulogne-Billancourt (92), vous travaillez de chez vous 2 jours par semaine.   En bref, les Risques et Contrôle Permanent de Boursorama, c’est de la règlementation bancaire et une culture du risque forte au sein d’une organisation flexible.   Nous sommes un  employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances  et nous sommes fiers de faire de la diversité une force pour notre entreprise. Le groupe s’engage à reconnaître et à  promouvoir tous les talents , quels que soient leurs croyances, âge, handicap, parentalité, origine ethnique, nationalité, identité de genre, orientation sexuelle, appartenance à une organisation politique, religieuse, syndicale ou à une minorité, ou toute autre caractéristique qui pourrait faire l’objet d’une discrimination.

title: Process Performance Engineer
skills: Skills: Управление проектами, Непрерывное совершенствование, +8 more
job_description: At Tony’s Chocolonely our mission is to make all chocolate 100% slave free. Not just our chocolate, all chocolate worldwide. We are an impact company that makes chocolate, and we are changing the industry from within. Our five sourcing principles have been proven to increase living income and dramatically decrease child labor rates in West African cocoa farms, where 1.5 million children are involved in child labor. Plus, our Tony's Open Chain initiative is bringing more and more allies on board, including the iconic Ben and Jerry's.  But that's not all - we're also one of the fastest-growing chocolate brands in the world. We're leading the way in ethical chocolate production, and consumers can't get enough of our delicious bars. We're on a mission to create awareness of the inequalities in the chocolate supply chain, lead by example with our best-practice approach to chocolate-making, and inspire others to join us in changing the industry for the better.  And the coolest part? We're not just in it for profit. We're a B Corp committed to making a positive impact on the world, from reducing our environmental footprint to creating a supportive and fulfilling work environment for our employees. With a turnover of around €150 million and annual growth of over 25%, we're expanding rapidly and have big plans for the future. So if you're looking to join a company that's making a real difference, come join us at Tony's Chocolonely!      Your role at Tony's   We are looking for a process performance engineer to join our team based in Amsterdam! Your #1 goal will be to support the production of the best chocolate in the world. As our new process performance engineer, you will have the opportunity to develop and optimize the manufacturing process and capabilities for all our chocolate products, allowing us to increase production and meet the demands of our growing fanbase.  At Tony's Chocolonely, we are looking for someone with experience supporting a production site, who can help us ensure we have the right technology in place to deliver the desired amount of chocolate products. You will work closely with our Product team to understand their ideas and lead the process of industrializing those kitchen samples. You will also stay up to date with the latest market trends and technologies, identifying opportunities to improve our manufacturing process and drive capacity improvements on the existing production lines.     What you will do:   lead production facilities in engineering projects and help manage the project until implementation and ensure its documentation.  stay up-to-date with the latest market trends and technologies, identifying opportunities to improve our manufacturing process and drive capacity improvements on the existing production lines.  provide subject matter expertise to the site team by offering technical guidance and insight for new process optimisation.  identify, select, and deploy the best techniques for chocolate product production.  work closely with our Product team to understand their ideas and lead the process of industrializing those kitchen samples.          The ideal candidate    Experience developing and optimising manufacturing process and capabilities for a production site, preferably a food manufacturing environment.  Professional training or experience in project management and continuous improvement, where you have proven to have the ability to lead multidisciplinary groups in a project setting.  Successful problem-solver and confident handling multifaceted aspects of a project  Raise the bar. Challenge yourself and team Tony’s to increase our ambition and to accomplish our mission. Make mistakes along the way and learn from them.  Wholehearted belief in Tony’s mission. You live our core values: outspoken, wilful, entrepreneurial and makes you smile.  Last but not least, you can deal smoothly with the challenges that come with a growing company, and positively contribute to team Tony's performance.          Sounds like you?   Are you passionate about making a difference in the world? Look no further! If you're ready to take the chocolate industry to new heights with us, we'd love to hear from you! Please send your direct application, no agencies. We can't wait to hear from you!        Everybody is welcome to apply. From classics to limited editions, we know that different flavours make life more inspiring. And not just in our chocolate assortment. At Tony’s, we welcome everyone with equal enthusiasm – regardless of race, colour, age, gender, sexual orientation, nationality, disability or veteran status. Crazy about chocolate, serious about people.

title: Business Analyst
skills: Skills: Business Analysis, Product Service, +8 more
job_description: join the retail tech revolution!   HEMA heeft honderden internationale vestigingen – groot of wat kleiner, zelf geëxploiteerd of door enthousiaste franchisenemers – en een (gezellig!) groeiende kantoorpopulatie. Dat maakt ons tot een applicatie-intensieve organisatie. ‘De truc’ is niet om deze applicaties live te krijgen, maar om ze voor onze collega’s blijvend te laten werken. Dat vraagt om meer dan tech expertise, want het gaat om het ondersteunen van de business processen en te begrijpen waar daar de uitdagingen en kansen liggen. Eens? Welkom bij Digital!      Maak onalledaags veel impact!   Als Business Analist onboarden we je binnen het Digital HR team, onderdeel van de bredere CTO organisatie. De sfeer? Gezellig en ontspannen maar tegelijkertijd gedreven. De uitdagingen? Elke dag anders, maar het oppakken en uitwerken van business verzoeken, en het uitvoeren van scenario analyses zijn in ieder geval onderdeel van de rol van Business Analist. Samen met de product owners, solution architecten, HR management en nog andere collega’s vanuit HR en IT draag je bij aan de digitale transformatie van HEMA. Dit is een rol met onalledaags veel impact, want er liggen nog veel verbeterpunten om onze collega’s in de winkels, op de distributiecentra en het hoofdkantoor optimaal te ondersteunen om de klant op één te kunnen zetten. De inzet is dus hoog. Net als de uiteindelijke opbrengst.     Je bent als Business Analist succesvol als je in staat bent om duidelijk in kaart te brengen waar de huidige uitdagingen liggen én wat mogelijke oplossingen zijn. Je doet dit in samenwerking met de Product Owners en DevOps engineers in het team en de stakeholders van de business.  De setting van HEMA is complexer dan in de meeste corporate omgevingen, omdat alles binnen HEMA ‘fast-moving’ is en trekjes van een tech scale-up (na 17 energiedrankjes) vertoont. Niets is in steen gebeiteld, en sommige structuren en processen ontbreken nog. Zo’n werkomgeving vraagt om eigenaarschap, het bepalen van de juiste prioriteiten en het lef om andere meningen mee te wegen.     Het komende jaar staat in het teken van een aantal grote projecten, zoals de implementatie van een nieuw workforce management systeem en het herdefiniëren van de rollen en processen van de HR selfservice en payroll applicaties. Als Business Analist speel je hierin een cruciale rol, door de huidige situatie in kaart te brengen en de uitdagingen in deze situatie gecombineerd met de business behoeften te vertalen in oplossingen en scenario’s.  Jij bedenkt dus voor een groot deel hoe HEMA de komende jaren gaat werken.      De ‘snel even langs HEMA’ versie    Je brengt zaken duidelijk, overzichtelijk en zo simpel mogelijk in kaart: van de functionaliteiten van de applicaties tot de huidige pijnpunten en uitdagingen  Je bent een goede sparringpartner voor de stakeholders: je helpt hen te definiëren wat ze nodig hebben en vertaalt dit naar mogelijke oplossingen  Je bijt je graag vast in complexe ‘puzzels’, maar houdt zaken zelf het liefst eenvoudig  Jij bedenkt hoe we de HR processen het beste kunnen ondersteunen met bestaande en nieuwe applicaties  Je signaleert bottlenecks en draagt actief verbeteringen aan  Je kan kennis goed overbrengen binnen een team van gelijkgezinden maar ook naar eindgebruikers       Dit haal je bij HEMA    Een bruto salaris tussen 3700 en 5500 euro  Reis- en onkostenvergoeding, een vaste (!) bonus van 4%, een variabele bonus van max 14%, pensioenregeling en een royale korting op alles wat HEMA (on)alledaags goed maakt  Bewegingsvrijheid: HEMA keurslijft je niet  Ontwikkeltempo: je leert van je collega’s en hebt de optie trainingen te volgen  Een unieke setting met een organisatie met vele gezichten: online tech scale-up, gepokt en gemazelde retailer, productontwikkelaar/producent en een grote internationale speler  Flexibiliteit: waar jij je beste werk doet, mag je (in overleg) werken  Fijn hoofdkantoor: Op de NDSM werf. Boven een levendige HEMA.  De kans om het alledaagse leven van miljoenen mensen onalledaags leuker te maken       Dit neem je naar HEMA mee    WO denkniveau en minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring, bij voorkeur bij een (IT) consultancy of binnen de IT afdeling van een middelgroot of groot bedrijf  Sterk analytisch denkvermogen: je hebt snel door hoe zaken in elkaar zitten en kan dit ook aan anderen uitleggen  Je haalt er energie uit om orde te scheppen in chaos  Je heb affiniteit met techniek, maar snapt dat het gaat om het creëren van waarde  Je voelt je thuis in een dynamische omgeving waar zaken snel (kunnen) veranderen

title: Data Engineer
skills: Skills: Data Pipelines, Data Engineering, +8 more
job_description: Are you a data engineering virtuoso? Do you thrive in working with databases and tools for collecting, querying, and storing information?      Are you passionate about devising and implementing best practices in data collection and analytical experimentation? Are you eager to take the lead in constructing top-of-the-line data infrastructure and pipelines? If you answered yes to these questions, then we want you on our team at Radiobotics!           Who we are   At Radiobotics, our mission is to revolutionize radiology by developing ML/DL-based products that enhance radiologists' workflow, improve diagnostic quality, and reduce waiting times. We develop algorithms for the automatic analysis and description of routine medical X-ray images at hospitals, specializing in musculoskeletal radiology. Our beautiful central Copenhagen office is where we work, swim in the harbor during the summer, and enjoy each other's company.         Who you are   We are seeking a pragmatic individual who values iterations and utilizes the most appropriate tools for the task at hand. As an accomplished Python developer with experience in constructing data pipelines, you will excel in the role of our Data Engineer. In this capacity, you will spearhead the development of Radiobotics' data infrastructure and pipelines, collaborating closely with our data science team to gather and analyze data, thereby facilitating data-driven decision-making.  If you are eager to embrace this opportunity, we invite you to join our team and contribute to the creation of something remarkable!  Your educational background likely encompasses computer science, software engineering, or a related field. However, your technical prowess, coupled with your ability to learn rapidly, work autonomously, and collaborate effectively, are the attributes we truly value. As a small, close-knit team with an informal atmosphere, we prioritize finding a new member who can seamlessly integrate within our group dynamic.  At Radiobotics, your primary responsibility will be to lead our Data Engineering initiatives, contribute to the enhancement of our existing ML/DL processes, and support the development of algorithms for our cutting-edge products.  As a compact organization, we wear many hats, and we anticipate that you will leverage your expertise in software development to refine and introduce a novel outlook to our product offerings' software components.         Data that you will be working with   Unstructured data consisting of medical image data (especially x-ray images) across multiple countries. Furthermore, you will be working with medical text reports and records.  Semi-structured data including annotations for the training of deep learning algorithms (objects like segmentation masks, bounding boxes, etc.) and metadata of medical DICOM images.  You will be working in our tech stack which consists of  Python -powered pipelines running in  Prefect  for onboarding of data into  Azure Data Lake  for cloud storage. We use  dbt  to build our  PostgreSQL  databases.  Our data infrastructure runs in  Azure  and is provisioned and managed using  Terraform,  and our BI visualizations are done using  Metabase.          What we expect from you    You have minimum of 3+ years of industry experience from a Data Engineer or similar role  You have strong skills in Python and good general experience in software development, writing maintainable code, and implementing patterns where applicable  You have experience working with technologies like Prefect, Luigi, dbt, PostgreSQL, Azure Data Lake, Docker, or equivalent  You have experience designing and working with analytics databases and are fluent in SQL  You have experience working with unstructured and semi-structured data  You are skilled in explaining and presenting analyses and concepts to a broad technical audience  You have ownership and responsibility of the parts of the project you implement/lead  You’re positive and driven, and a fast learner        Other relevant experience    BI experience - creating dashboards and automating reporting  Exposure to annotation platforms such as V7, LabelBox, ScaleAI or SuperAnnotate  Knowledge of Machine Learning and Deep Learning algorithm development      Please attach a short motivated application and a resume.  We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.

title: Analytics & Reporting - Associate – Warsaw

job_description: Job Description    The Risk Division identifies, anticipates, measures and mitigates – whenever appropriate - the diverse array of risks that the firm faces in serving clients and operating its global businesses.  Risk professionals focus on giving the firm clarity on the risk profile of our activities and devise strategies to protect the firm’s ability to serve our clients as a leader in global financial markets. Teams play a critical function for the firm, driving how the firm takes and manages risk. Risk professionals execute critical day-to-day risk management activities, lead projects and contribute to the ongoing advancement of a robust risk management program. Effective coordination with executive management, business units, control departments and technology is critical for success. The division is ideal for collaborative individuals who have strong ethics and attention to detail.  We are at the forefront of the most recent engineering solutions, including data and analytical solutions to efficiently produce timely and insightful risk analysis.  Within the Risk division, the Risk Engineering (RE) department’s mandate is to provide robust metrics, data-driven insights, and effective technologies for best-in-class risk management. Analytics & Reporting (A&R) is a multidiscipline RE team with primary responsibility for such data-driven insights; the team is at the cutting edge of our businesses, with strong traditions of risk management, engineering excellence, client service and career development opportunities for our people.  A&R professionals answer real-world questions through a variety of quantitative and qualitative methods as part of the core value proposition of the Risk division which balances our key functional responsibility of control with that of being commercial. The team is staffed globally with offices including Dallas, New Jersey, New York, Salt Lake City, London, Warsaw, Frankfurt, Bengaluru, and Tokyo.  As a member of the A&R team, you will work closely with colleagues around the globe to:   Apply advanced quantitative techniques and programming languages to analyze large datasets  Design and develop cutting edge analytics, using best-in-class analytical tools to visualize risk and inform business decisions  Deliver risk insights through verbal, written and interactive digital content to key stakeholders both internal and external to the firm  Play a key role in the risk management function at Goldman Sachs by providing understanding of and insight into existing and emerging risks, highlighting important and topical risk features, facilitating and informing risk management decisions     Key Responsibilities     Identify, design and implement the best means of delivering risk information through compelling narratives, tools and visualizations to increase understanding and awareness of risk  Innovate and design new analytics and visuals, leveraging internal and external programming languages and software  Use finance, economics, mathematics, programming and logical thinking to find solutions to a broad range of problems, in a dynamic, fast-paced environment  Analyze, visualize and manage sets of data used in our risk management and control functions  Quantitative application to storytelling leveraging Risk Engineering processes to maximize significance, quality, efficiency, speed, and reliability while ensuring clear accountability and attribution  Perform anomaly detections in large data sets, investigating the cause and recommending corrective actions  Engage with colleagues around the global, across divisions and with external stakeholders of the firm, such as regulators and rating agencies  Work in close collaboration with bankers, traders and portfolio managers as well as risk modelers and technology across the firm     Basic Qualifications     Bachelor’s Degree     Preferred Qualifications     Interest in financial markets and risk management, motivated by learning and continuous improvement  Interest in learning programming and database management languages  Ability to learn quickly, work independently, form own judgment/opinions, provide insights and drive change  Proactive with strong analytical, interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal) and ability to work effectively with colleagues in other regional offices  Desire to work in an apprenticeship culture and to be challenged in an environment of fast-paced change  Strong academic background, preferably in quantitative fields such as finance, economics, computer science, engineering or statistics     Benefits     Goldman Sachs is committed to providing our people with valuable and competitive benefits and wellness offerings, as it is a core part of providing a strong overall employee experience. A summary of these offerings, which are generally available to active, non-temporary, full-time and part-time US employees who work at least 20 hours per week, can be found    here   .     About Goldman Sachs    At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.  We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.  We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html  © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2023. All rights reserved.  Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: PTP Analyst
skills: Skills: SAP SRM, Коммуникация, +2 more
job_description: Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.       Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.       Who We Are…     When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the  storytellers  bringing our characters to life, the  creators  bringing them to your living rooms and the  dreamers  creating what’s next…   From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.   Warner Bros. has been entertaining audiences for more than 90 years through the world’s most-loved characters and franchises. Warner Bros. employs people all over the world in a wide variety of disciplines. We're always on the lookout for energetic, creative people to join our team.    The Job    Have you heard that there is no business like showbusiness? We have the perfect opportunity for you to get to know our exciting multimedia industry from finance perspective as we are looking for an Accounts Payable Analyst. This position exists to support the Procure to Pay (PTP) workstream of Warner Bros. Discovery and you will have overall responsibility for performing PTP functions involved in maintaining PTP processes, ensuring SOX compliance, maintaining a robust controls environment providing updates / reporting of overall Procure to Pay Operations.    The Daily      Deliver world class / proactive customer service to internal and external stakeholders while adhering to company policies and procedures  Support PTP processes to ensure operational success (i.e. vendor creation is timely, invoices match to PO’s correctly, invoices route to the appropriate coders, etc.)  Review PCard statement submissions for compliance  Monitor and reconcile aging PTP activity, including interfacing applications  Support integration and onboarding of new acquisitions into Warner Bros. Discovery processes and systems  Support PTP system changes, improvements and new company codes created with testing as required and support new business projects, acquisitions and integrations where needed  Serve as a subject matter expert in PTP processes & technologies (SAP SRM, Ariba, PeopleSoft, Oracle, OpenText VIM, SAP ECC) for non-content spend.       The Essentials       You have a complete understanding of the PTP processes  Ability to work independently, creatively and efficiently  Proven track record in meeting deadlines      Nice to Haves      Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance or related field is preferred  Experience in Peoplesoft Financials and SAP is preferred       How We Get Things Done…     This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.    The Legal Bits…    Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law.   If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

job_description: Description     Position at Premier Research   Bring your Passion to Remarque! Remarque Systems is a software company that is passionate about improving drug development using cutting edge software. Founded in 2015 Remarque Systems is focused on Clinical Trial Software to support Risk Based Monitoring and Quality by Design.  We’re looking for a  Customer Data Integration Specialist  to join our  Clinical Technologies  department. As a member of the Premier Research team, you’ll help create tangible solutions for patients in need while building cross-functional partnerships that enable your growth and success.  The Customer Data Integration Specialist (CDIS) is responsible for identifying client data sources, mapping client data to Remarque Systems data ingest engines, and determining critical data points, data thresholds, event triggers, and other events for special handling and reporting by the Remarque System Platform (RSP).    What You'll Be Doing     The CDIS will be responsible for supporting customers in the setup of the Remarque System  Responsible for working with product specialists to identifying client data and data sources for intake into the RSP  Assist with recognizing study risks and helps evaluate risk profiles with customer  Actively work to support our customer base for all integration needs  Carry out client engagement, study setup, system design, and development as required by the company  Assist Product Support in monitoring and handling support requests  Provides feedback to the development team on the RSP, especially the data ingest toolsets  Provides interaction with customer in a manner that supports the company’s culture, mission and values.     What We Are Searching For     Bachelor’s in Computer Science, Math, Engineering or similar field  5+ years’ experience working with clinical data information technology and trial execution, including but not limited to experience with clinical trial protocol development, study risk analysis, data management, and trial monitoring  Understanding of SQL required to enable building of custom metrics where needed  Ability to communicate well with customers and Remarque colleagues  Demonstrated technical aptitude and the ability to learn new technology quickly, proficiency with general computer hardware and software  Demonstration of technical, quantitative, analytical skills  Experience in a role exhibiting excellent written and oral communications and has effective interpersonal skills  A disciplined self-starter an excellent team player, collaborative and able to encourage effectiveness and efficiency  Ability to multitask and work effectively in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities  Strong verbal and written communication skills across all levels of the organization  Excellent organizational and time-management skills, able to prioritize work to meet deadlines  Accountable, dependable and strong commitment  Is customer service focused in approach to work both internally and externally   High standard for quality, execution and customer relationship management  Excellent independent judgement and problem-solving skills  Results and goal oriented  Proficiency in Microsoft Excel  Up to 10% travel is involved.   Because we are transforming life-changing ideas into new medical treatments for a diverse population, we require the perspectives of a diverse staff thinking creatively, challenging ideas, and solving complex problems fearlessly. Through a commitment to diversity, equity, inclusion, and empowerment, we create a community of belonging that welcomes differences, fuels innovation, and better connects us to the patients, physicians, and customers we serve.  We hire people that add to our culture, then invest in developing skills and abilities. If you are excited about this role, but your past experiences do not perfectly align with the position as described, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be exactly the right candidate for this role or others.   Premier Research is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that is compliant with all federal guidelines. All qualified applicants will receive equitable consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

job_description: Sobre nosotros   habitissimo es la plataforma digital que conecta a las personas que precisan mejorar su hogar con los profesionales adecuados para realizar cada trabajo.     La presencia de habitissimo en el Sur de Europa ha permitido crear una red de más de 240.000 profesionales de la construcción. Desde su fundación en 2009, más de 14 millones de hogares han confiado en la plataforma para elevar su calidad de vida.     Desde 2017, la compañía forma parte de la multinacional británica HomeServe, empresa líder internacional en cuidado y mantenimiento del hogar, con más de 25 años de experiencia.     Los grandes productos se crean a partir de experiencias extraordinarias, y las mejores experiencias de usuario las crean las personas y los equipos que trabajan con una visión compartida hacia el resultado final. En habitissimo somos un equipo dinámico, formado por personas creativas e innovadoras que trabajan codo a codo con el fin de enamorar a nuestros clientes y buscamos nuevo/a  CRO / Digital Analyst  quién, integrado en el equipo de CRO (Producto), nos ayude a liderar la evolución de la experiencia de usuario (Particulares) para incrementar el ratio de conversión y la generación de oportunidades de trabajo para nuestros profesionales.      Tus funciones y responsabilidades serán:       Liderar estudios cualitativos y cuantitativos de comportamiento de usuarios.  Modelizar la “customer experience” de cada uno de los segmentos de clientes.  Identificar las oportunidades de mejora del marketplace basadas en los estudios y en el dato.  Definición de los diferentes planes de medición, orientados a extraer la información necesaria del comportamiento de nuestros usuarios  Gestionar las herramientas de análisis cualitativo y cuantitativo (Analítica, Test A/B & MVT, mapas de calor, encuestas online, ….).  Liderar el plan de taggeo del e-commerce y participar en su implementación.  Colaborar con los equipos de UX, captación, CRM, comercial, diseño y IT para poner en marcha los proyectos validados en el plan.  Participar en la definición de las campañas de la herramienta de personalización e integrar los resultados de la personalización dentro del plan CRO.  Medir los resultados obtenidos y presentar los resultados y análisis para facilitar la toma de decisiones, proponer acciones de mejora continua en base a resultados.  Aportar un soporte a los equipos de captación, CRM y UX en la medición de su performance de habitissimo necesita.  Auto-motivado, con iniciativa y sin aversión a riesgo.       Por eso buscamos a alguien como tú:       Con al menos 2 años de experiencia en CRO.  Alto conocimiento de gestión e implementación de herramientas de analítica WEB GA-UA, GA4.  Valorables conocimientos de Amplitude y Tableau.  Alto conocimiento de herramientas de gestión de tags: GTM.  Alto conocimiento de la gestión e implementación de herramientas de analítica cualitativa (Hotjar, Content Square…).  Experiencia mínima de dos años en la implementación y gestión de herramientas CRO / Experimentación, como por ejemplo: Google Optimize, VWO, Dynamic Yield, AB Tasty…  Orientación al negocio y con la capacidad de hacer que las cosas pasen.  Altas habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas, sin miedo a probar cosas nuevas y plantear escenarios innovadores.  Data-driven, capaz de diseñar nuevos análisis y ayudar a la toma de decisiones a nivel de negocio y de optimización de campañas.  Proactivo/a, responsable, con atención al detalle y, sobre todo, con preferencia por el trabajo en equipo.  Será un plus contar con experiencia en E-Commerces o Marketplaces de alto volumen de tráfico.       ¿Qué ofrecemos?     Contrato indefinido (6 meses de periodo de prueba)  Salario competitivo  Base en Palma de Mallorca o Madrid  Al año tendrás 24 días laborables de vacaciones + el día de tu cumpleaños libre + 24 y 31 de diciembre libres  Gozar de una jornada intensiva con entrada flexible de 8.00h a 9.00h y salida entre las 16.30h y las 17.30h de lunes a jueves y entre las 14.00 hs y las 15.00 hs los viernes  Seguro médico incluido para ti. Descuento para hijos/as y cónyuges/convivientes.  Oportunidades de formación y desarrollo continuo  Y gozarás de un buen ambiente de trabajo en una empresa certificada como Best Place to Work 2021 que apuesta por el talento diverso

job_description: Qué esperamos...   Como Customer Support Analyst colaborarás con varios equipos para hacer felices a nuestros clientes actuales y potenciales así como a nuestros compañeros, encontrando de forma estratégica las mejores soluciones a sus incidencias.      Tu misión consistirá en ayudar a los usuarios de nuestro software investigando para darles la respuesta perfecta a sus preguntas. Cuando llegue una solicitud de un cliente, a través de tickets, livechat y llamadas telefónicas, tendrás que entender la incidencia e investigarla. En caso necesario, redirigirás a los clientes a otros departamentos, en función del tipo de solicitud, por lo que mantendrás una relación abierta y constante con otras áreas.        RESPONSABILIDADES   Ayudar a los clientes en el uso de Odoo Business Apps.  Resolver incidencias funcionales.   Interactuar con nuestros visitantes y clientes potenciales (Livechat).  Asegurar la satisfacción de los clientes.   Mejorar la experiencia de los clientes.  Contribuir a la mejora de nuestro producto y toda la documentación.      REQUISITOS   Grado enfocado a administración, negocios o ciencia, tecnología, ingeniería y matemáticas.   Nivel de inglés: C1, C2 (Indispensable)   Pensamiento creativo y capacidad para resolver problemas de manera estratégica.  Habilidad para comunicar conceptos técnicos de forma clara y eficaz, tanto por escrito como verbalmente.  Orientación al cliente  Autónomo y de rápido aprendizaje      Deseable   1-3 años de experiencia profesional  Experiencia profesional en un ERP.  Sociable y extrovertido  Disposición a aprender de forma constante y a trabajar de forma proactiva  Conocimientos técnicos (XML, Python, JS).

title: Emerton Data: Data Scientist & Strategy Consultant
skills: Skills: Python, Решение задач, +8 more
job_description: Visit:  emerton-data.com/join-emerton-data/          Emerton Data   Emerton Data is the entity of Emerton dedicated to digital and advanced data analytics activities, led by experienced partners in both data science & AI and management consulting.     We support companies in their environmental and digital transitions.     Emerton Data provides above standards data science and AI services, and helps companies use data to drive decisions, to create impact, and to transform businesses. We empower organizations to become more data-driven by providing first class skills, advisory solutions and make-it-happen support.     We develop innovative approaches and tailored solutions to complex problems, which generate impact. We also help corporations designing their data strategies to develop competitive edge and to transform their businesses from top-line to bottom-line.     Emerton Data offers both the environment of a fast-changing tech culture, together with the challenging and international work environment of Emerton, a high-standard strategy consulting firm, with offices in Paris, Munich, New-York and Tokyo.  Emerton is listed among the best 20 consulting firms in Europe to work for by Vault ranking.     Our clients are mainly large international corporations in the energy, consumer good, food services, industry, TMT, and insurance sectors.     In the context of our fast-paced development we are looking for talented young professionals to join our team in Paris.      Your Role      This position offers a double track as Strategy Consultant and Data Scientist. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a variety of projects:   Strategy projects (e.g., strategic due diligence, market opportunity, full potential strategic plan, etc.) that can be linked to data & AI topics or not,  Data & AI strategy projects (e.g., data roadmap connected to business strategy, Responsible AI governance),  Data use case delivery projects (industrialized products), that often includes the following tasks: data science modeling, machine learning and advanced data processing and visualizations,  and advanced data analytics projects (e.g., in-depth analysis of complex data such as order book data on energy markets),      After an onboarding period and under the guidance of partners and experienced consultants, you will join a project team and contribute to solving the client's toughest problems, for instance:  • Structure, analyze and solve problems  • Conduct interviews, market analysis  • Analyze facts and translate them into meaningful insights and recos  • Identify, scope, and prioritize use cases  • Collect and process data, using scraping technologies  • Prepare data, both structured and non-structured  • Find the adequate model to solve the problem  • Implement machine learning algorithms and relevant optimizations  • Find insights and communicate  • Program code at best standards to ensure proper industrialization  • Create meaningful and useful data products and visualizations     Permanent position. Competitive package.      Requirements      • MSc in the field of General Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics  • Programming experience in Python, SQL  • Experience in finding data science solutions to business problems  • Sharp problem-solving capabilities, strong business acumen  • Experience in statistical modeling and machine learning techniques  • Knowledge of the data techno ecosystem is a plus: NoSQL, Container technologies (Docker), cloud (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure), Gitlab.  • Excellent oral and written communication skills; in particular, flawless command of oral and written English and French

title: Stage | Data Analyst
skills: Skills: Data Analytics, Визуализация данных, +8 more
job_description: This job is sourced from a job board.       Learn more                                Vuoi un mini spoiler su CPM?    Ci prendiamo cura dei maggiori brand mondiali da oltre 80 anni attraverso diverse attività, dal merchandising alle vendite, dalla consumer activation al supporto clienti fino alla formazione sul prodotto. Questa è CPM, una realtà internazionale forte e dinamica, come le persone che ne fanno parte. Per te, rappresenta la grande opportunità di entrare a far parte di una solida multinazionale dove formarti e sviluppare la tua carriera in un settore in crescita e in un ambiente giovane, innovativo e super stimolante. Un’esperienza che ti metterà a contatto con i brand e le aziende più importanti in Italia.  Candidati e… magari ci vediamo a bordo!   Ti offriamo un’esperienza in linea con la tua passione: i numeri.    Per te abbiamo uno stage come Data Analyst all’interno del nostro team dedicato ad uno dei nostri clienti. Potrai formarti in un ambito molto richiesto dal mercato del lavoro e sperimentare il tuo interesse per i dati, i brand e il field marketing.  Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage è retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilità di proroga o eventuale assunzione.   Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?      In Particolare Ti Insegneremo a    La tua attività riguarda la redazione della reportistica utile per l’analisi e la presentazione dei dati a un nostro cliente di livello internazionale.   verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser;  analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri;  valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI);  preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.   Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.   Sei tu la persona giusta?    Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst può essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma l’unico vero must è la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.  In più è fantastico se…   hai la passione per i numeri;  te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici;  mastichi bene l’inglese;  ti entusiasma lavorare in team.   Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiosità, integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.  Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.  La ricerca è altresì rivolta ad entrambi i sessi.
